pairs.source: Itihleh sibungas Gah deꞌ paguh tentang Yesus Kristus, Onak Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: The beginning of the Good News of Jesus Christ, the Son of God.

pairs.source: Gah deꞌ Paguh inoh mulai kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nulis nabi Yesaya daang buk-e noꞌuh-e, “In Topaꞌ, ‘Ningaꞌ mey! Okuꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ pait Kuꞌ dioꞌ soꞌ Muꞌu, saꞌ-e sidia olan saꞌan Muꞌu.’
pairs.target: As it is written in the prophets, “Behold, I send my messenger before your face, who will prepare your way before you:

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ luꞌow-luꞌow-e sina deꞌ padang pasil, in-e, ‘Sidia olan saꞌan Topaꞌ, nongon olan saꞌan-E.’ ”
pairs.target: the voice of one crying in the wilderness, ‘Make ready the way of the Lord! Make his paths straight!’”

pairs.source: Samah kodaꞌ deꞌ obuah nulis inoh, wat noh leh Yohanes Pembaptis nog deꞌ padang pasil tanon tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ, “Togan olan deꞌ jaꞌat nyeꞌ moꞌ baptis saꞌ Topaꞌ ngapun dosa muꞌ!” In Yohanes.
pairs.target: John came baptizing in the wilderness and preaching the baptism of repentance for forgiveness of sins.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa soꞌ propinsi Yudea duoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ loꞌo deꞌ kota Yerusalem odi ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ tanon Yohanes, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngakuꞌ suaꞌ dosa-e.  Yohanes moꞌ baptis odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ sungi Yordan.
pairs.target: All the country of Judea and all those of Jerusalem went out to him. They were baptized by him in the Jordan river, confessing their sins.

pairs.source: Yohanes pakai jubah bulun unta duoh soot kupuang kulit, yohmoꞌ pinguman-e kadis duoh piꞌin bonyih.
pairs.target: John was clothed with camel’s hair and a leather belt around his waist. He ate locusts and wild honey.

pairs.source: Yohanes moꞌ magah tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ gah deꞌ in-e, “Ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ lobih ayuh-E soꞌ okuꞌ, yaꞌ nog mokuaꞌ okuꞌ.  Nyuduk bukaꞌ tolin kasut-E tuang doiꞌ geh nyam kuꞌ patut.
pairs.target: He preached, saying, “After me comes he who is mightier than I, the thong of whose sandals I am not worthy to stoop down and loosen.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ baptis ingan pakai piꞌin, pak-e Iyoh yaꞌ baptis ingan pakai Iyang Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: I baptized you in water, but he will baptize you in the Holy Spirit.”

pairs.source: Takal inoh Yesus nog soꞌ kota Nazaret deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ propinsi Galilea, Yohanes moꞌ baptis Iyoh daang Sungi Yordan.
pairs.target: In those days, Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee, and was baptized by John in the Jordan.

pairs.source: Takal Yesus moꞌ maꞌad soꞌ piꞌin keꞌ doyoh, Iyoh moꞌ ningaꞌ longit tibukaꞌ, Iyang Topaꞌ moꞌ muun map deꞌ tun Yesus mun manuk asang mun-e.
pairs.target: Immediately coming up from the water, he saw the heavens parting, and the Spirit descending on him like a dove.

pairs.source: Yohmoꞌ ogiꞌ sina soꞌ longit deꞌ in-e, “Muꞌu leh Onak deꞌ ngibalaꞌ Kuꞌ, deꞌ odaꞌ kila Kuꞌ munuas.”
pairs.target: A voice came out of the sky, “You are my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.”

pairs.source: Takal moꞌ mokuaꞌ baptis, Iyang Topaꞌ moꞌ toban Yesus deꞌ padang pasil.
pairs.target: Immediately the Spirit drove him out into the wilderness.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ loꞌo danoꞌ pat puluꞌ onu, Laja Muat munua moꞌ suba-E.  Topat Yoh loꞌo inoh bogoꞌ binatang deꞌ ogiꞌ bisa-e duoh deꞌ gaus loꞌo danoꞌ, malaikat-malaikat moꞌ nog tulung-E.
pairs.target: He was there in the wilderness forty days tempted by Satan. He was with the wild animals; and the angels were serving him.

pairs.source: Takal Yohanes Pembaptis moꞌ obuah takap, Yesus moꞌ odi keꞌ propinsi Galilea magah Gah deꞌ Paguh soꞌ Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: Now after John was taken into custody, Jesus came into Galilee, preaching the Good News of God’s Kingdom,

pairs.source: Iyoh moꞌ in-e, “Moꞌ nog takal Topaꞌ moꞌ yaꞌ mulai militah jadin Laja.  Togan leh olan deꞌ jaꞌat nyeꞌ moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Gah deꞌ paguh soꞌ Topaꞌ!”
pairs.target: and saying, “The time is fulfilled, and God’s Kingdom is at hand! Repent, and believe in the Good News.”

pairs.source: Takal Yesus ponu nunaꞌ bingon donu Galilea, Iyoh moꞌ ningaꞌ Simon duoh madih-e Andreas ngijaling ikian, dop-e inoh leh kiloja odop-e deꞌ duwoh.
pairs.target: Passing along by the sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and Andrew the brother of Simon casting a net into the sea, for they were fishermen.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Jaꞌ nunaꞌ Okuꞌ! Deꞌ dioꞌ ingan kiloja kalik ikian, pak-e adin Okuꞌ ngajal odaꞌ ingan kalik manusia saꞌ-a nunaꞌ Okuꞌ.”
pairs.target: Jesus said to them, “Come after me, and I will make you into fishers for men.”

pairs.source: Simon duoh Andreas lasuꞌ togan jaling-e yohmoꞌ odi nunaꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: Immediately they left their nets, and followed him.

pairs.source: Iyoh moꞌ lanyut pimonu-e, Iyoh moꞌ ningaꞌ Yakobus duoh Yohanes.  Odop-e deꞌ duwoh onak Zebedeus.  Odop-e deꞌ duwoh kiloja nopung jaling-e daang olud.
pairs.target: Going on a little further from there, he saw James the son of Zebedee, and John, his brother, who were also in the boat mending the nets.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ mogan odop-e deꞌ duwoh, odop-e deꞌ duwoh lasuꞌ togan samaꞌ-a duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ kiloja saꞌan-e daang olud, yohmoꞌ lasuꞌ nunaꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: Immediately he called them, and they left their father, Zebedee, in the boat with the hired servants, and went after him.

pairs.source: Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E nog kota Kapernaum.  Takal-e moꞌ nog onu simayang ulang Yahudi deꞌ nang nyaꞌa onu Sabat, Yesus molot kaang topat simayang agama Yahudi yohmoꞌ mulai ngajal.
pairs.target: They went into Capernaum, and immediately on the Sabbath day he entered into the synagogue and taught.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa ilan ningaꞌ wat Iyoh ngajal, dop-e oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal-E tok diꞌ nyaꞌa ponai yaꞌ nyakal-e, idoh diꞌ-e kodaꞌ pingajal gulu-gulu agama Yahudi.
pairs.target: They were astonished at his teaching, for he taught them as having authority, and not as the scribes.

pairs.source: Takal inoh ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah bikalui muat munua, molot kaang boli simayang agama ulang Yahudi, yohmoꞌ nang bogan-e,
pairs.target: Immediately there was in their synagogue a man with an unclean spirit, and he cried out,

pairs.source: “Oi Yesus ulang Nazaret, oni nai Ingan kaso koꞌih? Podo Ingan yaꞌ katuab koꞌih? Puꞌan kuꞌ osi Ingan, Ingan leh deꞌ kakuꞌ Topaꞌ, deꞌ pait Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: saying, “Ha! What do we have to do with you, Jesus, you Nazarene? Have you come to destroy us? I know you who you are: the Holy One of God!”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nang muat munua inoh, “Maꞌ bidaluag! Buu luah soꞌ nyaꞌa itih!”
pairs.target: Jesus rebuked him, saying, “Be quiet, and come out of him!”

pairs.source: Muat munua inoh moꞌ ulih-ulih guyang gusuak gonan nyaꞌa inoh, muat munua nang bogan-e daang-e buu luah.
pairs.target: The unclean spirit, convulsing him and crying with a loud voice, came out of him.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa danoꞌ obuaꞌ ilan-e, yohmoꞌ bisikian duoh dingan-e deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ, in-e, “Oni deꞌ wat itih? Nyaꞌa itih ngajal pakai punuaꞌ kuasa.  Iyoh sina tuduꞌ muat munua odaꞌ buu luah, muat munua moꞌ lasuꞌ luah!”
pairs.target: They were all amazed, so that they questioned among themselves, saying, “What is this? A new teaching? For with authority he commands even the unclean spirits, and they obey him!”

pairs.source: Gah inoh moꞌ popah katiꞌ-kanih keꞌ suaꞌ propinsi Galilea.
pairs.target: The report of him went out immediately everywhere into all the region of Galilee and its surrounding area.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E buu soꞌ topat simayang agama Yahudi inoh, yohmoꞌ odi keꞌ boli Simon duoh Andreas.  Yakobus duoh Yohanes suwaꞌ odi duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: Immediately, when they had come out of the synagogue, they came into the house of Simon and Andrew, with James and John.

pairs.source: Takal-e molot kaang boli, ogiꞌ nyaꞌa tanon tuduꞌ Yesus nang tua Simon deꞌ dayung monam modud, yoh guling deꞌ topat boꞌos-e.
pairs.target: Now Simon’s wife’s mother lay sick with a fever, and immediately they told him about her.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ odi sinok tua Simon inoh yohmoꞌ kagong tongan-e tulung odaꞌ mokat, onam-e moꞌ lasuꞌ mokuaꞌ, iyoh moꞌ mokat, yohmoꞌ nguliaꞌ pinguman saꞌan ayua odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: He came and took her by the hand, and raised her up. The fever left her, and she served them.

pairs.source: Takal onu moꞌ yaꞌ ngalom, bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ toban ulang-ulang deꞌ monam duoh deꞌ obuah bikalui muat munua nog tuduꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: At evening, when the sun had set, they brought to him all who were sick, and those who were possessed by demons.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ moꞌ nog tikuluk deꞌ bolot tiban-e.
pairs.target: All the city was gathered together at the door.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ deꞌ bipasia-pasia onam tiboꞌi-e mokuaꞌ duoh kasig muat munua soꞌ gonan nyaꞌa, pak-e Yesus diꞌ-e odaꞌ muat munua sina, dop-e muat munua puꞌan osi Yesus inoh.
pairs.target: He healed many who were sick with various diseases, and cast out many demons. He didn’t allow the demons to speak, because they knew him.

pairs.source: Onu tiaꞌ pagi-e takal onu aluaꞌ bosow, Yesus moꞌ mokat boꞌos yohmoꞌ odi keꞌ sopaꞌ kota deꞌ doiꞌ nyaꞌa daꞌ-e.  Danoꞌ Yesus bidoa.
pairs.target: Early in the morning, while it was still dark, he rose up and went out, and departed into a deserted place, and prayed there.

pairs.source: Simon duoh ayua dingan-e moꞌ odi kalik Yesus.
pairs.target: Simon and those who were with him followed after him;

pairs.source: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ tapod Yesus, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e, “Suaꞌ nyaꞌa bolipotak kalik Ingan.”
pairs.target: and they found him, and told him, “Everyone is looking for you.”

pairs.source: Pak-e Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Jaꞌ otoꞌ odi keꞌ topat deꞌ bokon deꞌ sinok-sinok soꞌ katiꞌ, saꞌ Okuꞌ tanon geh Gah deꞌ paguh soꞌ Topaꞌ danoꞌ.  Dop-e inoh leh ngan Okuꞌ nog.”
pairs.target: He said to them, “Let’s go elsewhere into the next towns, that I may preach there also, because I came out for this reason.”

pairs.source: Yesus ponu kodak suaꞌ propinsi Galilea, Yoh ngajal nyaꞌa Gah deꞌ Paguh deꞌ topat-topat simayang agama Yahudi duoh kasig muat munua soꞌ nyaꞌa.
pairs.target: He went into their synagogues throughout all Galilee, preaching and casting out demons.

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah onam kulit deꞌ bijakit nog tuduꞌ Yesus, yohmoꞌ bikunyug deꞌ sulung jowin Yesus.  Mokuaꞌ inoh yoh mitiaꞌ masiꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus, yohmoꞌ in-e, “Simoꞌ Ingan laꞌan, Ingan tapod odaꞌ okuꞌ mokuaꞌ.”
pairs.target: A leper came to him, begging him, kneeling down to him, and saying to him, “If you want to, you can make me clean.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ tok-tok masiꞌ tuduꞌ-e.  Iyoh moꞌ tomaꞌ gonan nyaꞌa inoh daang-e in-e, “Laꞌan Kuꞌ, mokuaꞌ leh!”
pairs.target: Being moved with compassion, he stretched out his hand, and touched him, and said to him, “I want to. Be made clean.”

pairs.source: Takal inoh geh onam kulit-e deꞌ bijakit lasuꞌ musuap yohmoꞌ mokuaꞌ.
pairs.target: When he had said this, immediately the leprosy departed from him, and he was made clean.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ odaꞌ iyoh buu duoh ulih-ulih jaman-e, in-E,
pairs.target: He strictly warned him, and immediately sent him out,

pairs.source: “Maꞌ muꞌu tanon tuduꞌ osi sijaꞌ-a, pak-e odi leh tuduꞌ pimipin agama Yahudi saꞌ-a pilisa muꞌu, tok mokuaꞌ ke doh keh muꞌu.  Mokuaꞌ inoh nyeꞌ simoliah binatang saꞌan Topaꞌ kodaꞌ deꞌ tanon Musa, deꞌ jadin bukti tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ dop-e muꞌu moꞌ bonal-bonal mokuaꞌ.”
pairs.target: and said to him, “See you say nothing to anybody, but go show yourself to the priest, and offer for your cleansing the things which Moses commanded, for a testimony to them.”

pairs.source: Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ mokuaꞌ monam inoh odi katiꞌ kanih diꞌ-e mokuaꞌ-mokuaꞌ silita tanon wat Yesus odaꞌ iyoh mokuaꞌ soꞌ onam kulit-e.  Yesus moꞌ diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ ponai molot bitanga odop-e daang kota.  Iyoh moꞌ jok-e loꞌo deꞌ sopaꞌ kota deꞌ doiꞌ nyaꞌa loꞌo daꞌ-a, pak-e nyaꞌa diꞌ-e obuaꞌ-obuaꞌ nog soꞌ niꞌ-soꞌ niꞌ tuduꞌ-E.
pairs.target: But he went out, and began to proclaim it much, and to spread about the matter, so that Jesus could no more openly enter into a city, but was outside in desert places: and they came to him from everywhere.

pairs.source: Kudu-kudu onu mokuaꞌ inoh, Yesus odi lagiꞌ keꞌ Kapernaum.  Nyaꞌa moꞌ ngojit gah nang Iyoh ogiꞌ deꞌ boli.
pairs.target: When he entered again into Capernaum after some days, it was heard that he was in the house.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ moꞌ nog ngubun-E, mulai soꞌ bolot tiban nog aang boli punuaꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa.  Yesus moꞌ tanon Gah soꞌ Topaꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ inoh.
pairs.target: Immediately many were gathered together, so that there was no more room, not even around the door; and he spoke the word to them.

pairs.source: Takal-E aluaꞌ sina, nog pat naꞌan nyaꞌa tawiak niꞌ naꞌan dali deꞌ kobos gonan-e, yoh toban tuduꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: Four people came, carrying a paralytic to him.

pairs.source: Saai nyaꞌa sikiya bogoꞌ, odop-e deꞌ pat inoh diꞌ-e tapod molot bitapod duoh Yesus.  Yoh moꞌ toban maꞌad keꞌ bungan boli, yoh moꞌ nglibuang bungan totok Yesus mujuag.  Yoh moꞌ pimuun nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos gonan-e inoh deꞌ sulung jowin Yesus baya topat guling-e.
pairs.target: When they could not come near to him for the crowd, they removed the roof where he was. When they had broken it up, they let down the mat that the paralytic was lying on.

pairs.source: Takal Yesus ningaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ sukup-sukup bisayaꞌ, Iyoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos gonan-e inoh, in-e, “Dosa-dosa muꞌ moꞌ obuah ngapun.”
pairs.target: Jesus, seeing their faith, said to the paralytic, “Son, your sins are forgiven you.”

pairs.source: Pak-e ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan gulu agama ulang Yahudi deꞌ guluꞌ danoꞌ moꞌ in-e daang otin-e,
pairs.target: But there were some of the scribes sitting there, and reasoning in their hearts,

pairs.source: “Puus manah Yoh nyamah odop-E duoh Topaꞌ! Jok-e Topaꞌ deꞌ tapod ngapun dosa nyaꞌa neh.”
pairs.target: “Why does this man speak blasphemies like that? Who can forgive sins but God alone?”

pairs.source: Takal inoh geh Yesus lasuꞌ puꞌan daang otin-E, oni deꞌ pikil odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, Yoh moꞌ in-e, “Oni nai ingan bipikil deꞌ in inoh daang otin ingan?
pairs.target: Immediately Jesus, perceiving in his spirit that they so reasoned within themselves, said to them, “Why do you reason these things in your hearts?

pairs.source: Ki deꞌ sonang dooꞌ, tanon tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos gonan-e inoh nang, ‘Dosamuꞌ moꞌ obuah ngapun’ keh, ‘Mokat, nyeꞌ moꞌ toban topat guling muꞌ nyeꞌ moꞌ ponu’?
pairs.target: Which is easier, to tell the paralytic, ‘Your sins are forgiven;’ or to say, ‘Arise, and take up your bed, and walk?’

pairs.source: Pak-e saꞌ ingan puꞌan-e, daang dunia itih Onak Manusia ogiꞌ kuasa-E ngapun dosa manusia.” Yoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos gonan-e inoh,
pairs.target: But that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins”—he said to the paralytic—

pairs.source: “Mokat nyeꞌ moꞌ toban topat guling muꞌ, nyeꞌ moꞌ buu motas!”
pairs.target: “I tell you, arise, take up your mat, and go to your house.”

pairs.source: Yoh moꞌ mokat daang-e lasuꞌ mit topat guling-e.  Yohmoꞌ buu luah, takal inoh geh nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ ningaꞌ iyoh.  Yoh ngan-e suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ ilan-e, yohmoꞌ mudi Topaꞌ daang-e in-e, “Mulan toꞌ ningaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ wat itih!”
pairs.target: He arose, and immediately took up the mat, and went out in front of them all; so that they were all amazed, and glorified God, saying, “We never saw anything like this!”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus paliꞌ odi lagiꞌ keꞌ pang donu Galilea.  Bogoꞌ nyaꞌa nog tuduꞌ-E, Yoh moꞌ ngajal-e.
pairs.target: He went out again by the seaside. All the multitude came to him, and he taught them.

pairs.source: Takal Yesus aluaꞌ ponu danoꞌ, Yoh ningaꞌ ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ tukang nagih suke deꞌ adon Lewi onak Alfeus, guluꞌ deꞌ topat nyaꞌa bayal suke saꞌan kerajaan Romawi.  Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, “Jaꞌ nunaꞌ Okuꞌ!” Lewi moꞌ mokat mujuag yoh moꞌ lasuꞌ nunaꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: As he passed by, he saw Levi, the son of Alphaeus, sitting at the tax office, and he said to him, “Follow me.” And he arose and followed him.

pairs.source: Takal Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E man deꞌ boli Lewi, bogoꞌ ulang-ulang deꞌ tukang nagih suke duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ nang nyaꞌa ulang bidosa suwaꞌ man samah-samah duoh ayua odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, dop-e bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nunaꞌ Yesus .
pairs.target: He was reclining at the table in his house, and many tax collectors and sinners sat down with Jesus and his disciples, for there were many, and they followed him.

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa Yahudi soꞌ uluk ulang Farisi ningaꞌ Yesus suwaꞌ man duoh ulang-ulang pinagih suke duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ sobot nyaꞌa nang ulang deꞌ bidosa inoh.  Yoh moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus, “Oni nai gulu muꞌ suwaꞌ man duoh tukang pinagih suke duoh ulang deꞌ bidosa inoh?”
pairs.target: The scribes and the Pharisees, when they saw that he was eating with the sinners and tax collectors, said to his disciples, “Why is it that he eats and drinks with tax collectors and sinners?”

pairs.source: Takal Yesus ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ nang odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, Yoh moꞌ nyawot-e, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ sehat diꞌ-e pilelu doktol, jok-e nyaꞌa deꞌ monam.  Idoh diꞌ kuꞌ nog mogan nyaꞌa deꞌ bonal, pak-e okuꞌ nog mogan nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa.”
pairs.target: When Jesus heard it, he said to them, “Those who are healthy have no need for a physician, but those who are sick. I came not to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.”

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ onu-e takal pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yohanes Pembaptis duoh gulu-gulu agama ulang Yahudi puasa.  Ogiꞌ nyaꞌa nog tuduꞌ Yesus yohmo bisikian, “Oni nai pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yohanes Pembaptis duoh gulu-gulu agama ulang Yahudi puasa, pak-e pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Ingan diꞌ-e puasa?”
pairs.target: John’s disciples and the Pharisees were fasting, and they came and asked him, “Why do John’s disciples and the disciples of the Pharisees fast, but your disciples don’t fast?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e pakai nang silita, “Moꞌ nyaꞌa biluman kawin, podo tamu-tamu-e diꞌ-e man? Takal nyaꞌa deꞌ kawin aluaꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ, totu nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ aluaꞌ man.
pairs.target: Jesus said to them, “Can the groomsmen fast while the bridegroom is with them? As long as they have the bridegroom with them, they can’t fast.

pairs.source: Pak-e ogiꞌ takal-e nyaꞌa toban nyaꞌa deꞌ kawin inoh toban buu.  Takal inoh leh diꞌ nyaꞌa tiyaꞌ man-nuak.
pairs.target: But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them, and then will they fast in that day.

pairs.source: Doiꞌ-e ogiꞌ nyaꞌa nopung bojuh deꞌ oma pakai kain deꞌ baꞌuh.  Dop-e moꞌ-e kain topung deꞌ baꞌuh inoh bikinyot yoh moꞌ notak bojuh deꞌ moꞌ oma, totak-e moꞌ bitamah ayuh.
pairs.target: No one sews a piece of unshrunk cloth on an old garment, or else the patch shrinks and the new tears away from the old, and a worse hole is made.

pairs.source: Watnoh geh doiꞌ nyaꞌa ngisiꞌ piꞌin anggul deꞌ baꞌuh daang topat deꞌ moꞌ oma, dop-e piꞌin anggul deꞌ baꞌuh muab, topat-e deꞌ oma inoh moꞌ totak.  Luban-e soꞌ duwoh-e tibuang.  Totu leh piꞌin anggul deꞌ baꞌuh, nyaꞌa naꞌ daang topat deꞌ baꞌuh geh!” In Yesus.
pairs.target: No one puts new wine into old wineskins, or else the new wine will burst the skins, and the wine pours out, and the skins will be destroyed; but they put new wine into fresh wineskins.”

pairs.source: Takal Onu Sabat, Yesus ponu duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E ngilusuꞌ umoh gandum.  Pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ pilai, yohmoꞌ tuk kiluang gandum yoh moꞌ man-e.
pairs.target: He was going on the Sabbath day through the grain fields, and his disciples began, as they went, to pluck the ears of grain.

pairs.source: Ulang Yahudi soꞌ uluk ulang Farisi moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Yesus, “Ningaꞌ, oni nai pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Ingan nai oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ nyaꞌa soꞌon nai-e daang Onu Sabat?”
pairs.target: The Pharisees said to him, “Behold, why do they do that which is not lawful on the Sabbath day?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Aluaꞌ doiꞌ keh ingan basa daang Kitab? Oni deꞌ nai Daud noꞌuh-e? Takal iyoh duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-e pilai doiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ man-e.
pairs.target: He said to them, “Did you never read what David did, when he had need, and was hungry—he, and those who were with him?

pairs.source: Takal Abyatar deꞌ jadin pimipin deꞌ paling ayuh-e, Daud molot kaang topat nyaꞌa nyomah Topaꞌ.  Yoh duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-e moꞌ man kueh deꞌ ngin nyaꞌa tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, nunaꞌ atulan agama otoꞌ jok-e pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ soꞌon man kueh inoh.”
pairs.target: How he entered into God’s house at the time of Abiathar the high priest, and ate the show bread, which is not lawful to eat except for the priests, and gave also to those who were with him?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ, “Topaꞌ nai Onu Sabat saꞌan manusia, idoh diꞌ-e manusia saꞌan onu Sabat.
pairs.target: He said to them, “The Sabbath was made for man, not man for the Sabbath.

pairs.source: Onak Manusia leh deꞌ notu oni deꞌ soꞌon duoh oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ-e soꞌon nyaꞌa nai-e daang Onu Sabat.”
pairs.target: Therefore the Son of Man is lord even of the Sabbath.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ paliꞌ odi lagiꞌ keꞌ topat simayang agama Yahudi.  Danoꞌ ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ tongan-e kobos niꞌ kawa.
pairs.target: He entered again into the synagogue, and there was a man there who had his hand withered.

pairs.source: Danoꞌ ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan ulang Yahudi deꞌ ningaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai Yesus, simoꞌ Yesus odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tongan-e kobos niꞌ kawa inoh mokuaꞌ daang Onu Sabat, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tapod yaꞌ nyalah-E.
pairs.target: They watched him, whether he would heal him on the Sabbath day, that they might accuse him.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tongan-e kobos niꞌ kawa inoh, “Got mokat mujuag katiꞌ, keꞌ sulung jowin koꞌih!”
pairs.target: He said to the man who had his hand withered, “Stand up.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ, “Moꞌ-e nunaꞌ atulan agama otoꞌ, oni deꞌ patut otoꞌ nai daang Onu Sabat? Nai oniꞌ deꞌ paguh keh, nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat? Tulung nyaꞌa odaꞌ idip keh nyeꞌ ngabos-e?” Pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ loꞌo jaꞌ-e.
pairs.target: He said to them, “Is it lawful on the Sabbath day to do good, or to do harm? To save a life, or to kill?” But they were silent.

pairs.source: Yesus ningaꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ daang-e tiwas, duoh kila-E susah, dop-e nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ obuaꞌ kolas otin-e.  Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tongan-e kobos niꞌ kawa inoh, “Suual tongan muꞌ.” Nyaꞌa inoh moꞌ suual tongan-e, yohmoꞌ lasuꞌ mokuaꞌ.
pairs.target: When he had looked around at them with anger, being grieved at the hardening of their hearts, he said to the man, “Stretch out your hand.”  He stretched it out, and his hand was restored as healthy as the other.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh ulang Yahudi soꞌ uluk ulang Farisi buu soꞌ topat simayang inoh, yoh moꞌ biloneng duoh ulang Yahudi deꞌ nuaꞌ Laja Herodes ngan-e yaꞌ ngabos Yesus.
pairs.target: The Pharisees went out, and immediately conspired with the Herodians against him, how they might destroy him.

pairs.source: Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ buu keꞌ pang Donu Galilea.  Yohmoꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa soꞌ propinsi Galilea duoh soꞌ propinsi Yudea bitunaꞌ duoh-E.
pairs.target: Jesus withdrew to the sea with his disciples, and a great multitude followed him from Galilee, from Judea,

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ geh deꞌ soꞌ kota Yerusalem, soꞌ Idumea soꞌ polad Sungi Yordan, soꞌ kota Tirus, duoh kota Sidon.  Suaꞌ ayua deꞌ munoꞌ nog dop-e yoh moꞌ ngojit suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nai Yesus.
pairs.target: from Jerusalem, from Idumaea, beyond the Jordan, and those from around Tyre and Sidon. A great multitude, hearing what great things he did, came to him.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ odaꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E sidia olud saꞌan odop-E, dop-e nyaꞌa sikiya bogoꞌ, saꞌ Yoh diꞌ-e pisiat odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bitodod-todod duoh Yoh.
pairs.target: He spoke to his disciples that a little boat should stay near him because of the crowd, so that they wouldn’t press on him.

pairs.source: Bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ mokuaꞌ odaꞌ-E, yoh ngan suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ monam bitodod-todod ngan-e yaꞌ odi sinok Yesus, saꞌ-e tapod tomaꞌ-E.
pairs.target: For he had healed many, so that as many as had diseases pressed on him that they might touch him.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ molot muat munua daang gonan-e, takal-e ningaꞌ Yesus yoh moꞌ nyuduk bikunyug deꞌ sulung jowin Yesus daang-e nang bogan-e, “Ingan Onak Topaꞌ!”
pairs.target: The unclean spirits, whenever they saw him, fell down before him, and cried, “You are the Son of God!”

pairs.source: Pak-e Yesus isin-isin jaman muat munua inoh tanon nang Iyoh Onak Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: He sternly warned them that they should not make him known.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus maꞌad keꞌ tun punguꞌ.  Yesus moꞌ ngijaꞌ ulang-ulang deꞌ yaꞌ pilih-E, saꞌ-a odi tuduꞌ odop-E danoꞌ.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ odi tuduꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: He went up into the mountain, and called to himself those whom he wanted, and they went to him.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ pilih simoong duwoh naꞌan soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.  Iyoh moꞌ sobot nang rasul-rasul-E.  Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Okuꞌ pilih ingan, sa' ingan suwaꞌ duoh Okuꞌ, saꞌ Kuꞌ pait ingan odaꞌ magah Gah deꞌ Paguh soꞌ Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: He appointed twelve, that they might be with him, and that he might send them out to preach,

pairs.source: Okuꞌ yaꞌ ngin kuasa tuduꞌ ingan odaꞌ ponai kasig pibuu muat munua.”
pairs.target: and to have authority to heal sicknesses and to cast out demons:

pairs.source: Deꞌ mutiꞌ leh adon-adon nyaꞌa deꞌ pilih-E: Simon deꞌ sobot Yesus geh nang Petrus,
pairs.target: Simon (to whom he gave the name Peter);

pairs.source: Yakobus duoh Yohanes, odop-e deꞌ duwoh itih onak Zebedeus.  Odop-e deꞌ duwoh itih, Yesus biladon nang Boanerges loti-e “Nyaꞌa deꞌ kodaꞌ Dudu.”
pairs.target: James the son of Zebedee; and John, the brother of James, (whom he called Boanerges, which means, Sons of Thunder);

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ geh Andreas, Filipus, Bartolomeus, Matius, Tomas, Yakobus onak Alfeus, Tadeus, Simon soꞌ uluk ulang Yahudi deꞌ bijuang odaꞌ Israel bebas soꞌ kerajaan Romawi,
pairs.target: Andrew; Philip; Bartholomew; Matthew; Thomas; James, the son of Alphaeus; Thaddaeus; Simon the Zealot;

pairs.source: duoh Yudas Iskariot, nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ jua Yesus tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ buꞌui daꞌ-E.
pairs.target: and Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed him. Then he came into a house.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus paliꞌ ke boli.  Pak-e nyaꞌa bogoꞌ nog tikuluk lagiꞌ ngubun Iyoh, yoh ngan Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E diꞌ supot man.
pairs.target: The multitude came together again, so that they could not so much as eat bread.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ moꞌ in-e, “Iyoh itih moꞌ bakoꞌ!” Takal madih ayua-e moꞌ ngojit gah inoh, yoh moꞌ odi mit-E.
pairs.target: When his friends heard it, they went out to seize him: for they said, “He is insane.”

pairs.source: Gulu-gulu agama Yahudi deꞌ nog soꞌ Yerusalem moꞌ in-e, “Iyoh itih obuah nguasa odaꞌ Beelzebul! Laja suaꞌ muat munua inoh leh deꞌ ngin kuasa daꞌ-E, ngan-e kasig muat munua.”
pairs.target: The scribes who came down from Jerusalem said, “He has Beelzebul,” and, “By the prince of the demons he casts out the demons.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ mogan nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ inoh, yohmoꞌ in-e, “Wat ki Laja Muat munua ponai yaꞌ kasig Laja Muat munua?”
pairs.target: He summoned them, and said to them in parables, “How can Satan cast out Satan?

pairs.source: Yesus lanyut sina-E pakai nang silita, in-E, “Simoꞌ-e ogiꞌ negeli deꞌ diꞌ layat-e tilukum daang-e silalu bikaꞌi si odop-e idoh diꞌ-e taan tuui.
pairs.target: If a kingdom is divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand.

pairs.source: Lawang boꞌon deꞌ silalu bikiing bilawan tipan odop-e idoh diꞌ-e taan tuui.
pairs.target: If a house is divided against itself, that house cannot stand.

pairs.source: Simoꞌ Laja Muat munua bilawan si odop-e wat ki wat-e yaꞌ taan tuui? Iyoh pasti obuaꞌ mutuab.
pairs.target: If Satan has risen up against himself, and is divided, he can’t stand, but has an end.

pairs.source: Niꞌ naꞌan tuang doiꞌ geh deꞌ taan molot kaang boli nyaꞌa deꞌ dolas duoh mit halta-e, simoꞌ-e diꞌ-e pasung dioꞌ.  Takal-e moꞌ mokuaꞌ pasung-e ke yoh tapod mit halta-e.
pairs.target: But no one can enter into the house of the strong man to plunder, unless he first binds the strong man; and then he will plunder his house.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Suaꞌ dosa deꞌ nai nyaꞌa duoh sina deꞌ jaꞌat aluaꞌ tapod obuah ngapun.
pairs.target: Most certainly I tell you, all sins of the descendants of man will be forgiven, including their blasphemies with which they may blaspheme;

pairs.source: Pak-e sina deꞌ jaꞌat deꞌ pijaꞌat Iyang Topaꞌ, idoh diꞌ Topaꞌ tapod ngapun-e.  Dosa inoh moꞌ lokat nah-nah.”
pairs.target: but whoever may blaspheme against the Holy Spirit never has forgiveness, but is subject to eternal condemnation.”

pairs.source: Yesus tanon deꞌ in inoh, dop-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nang Yesus obuah nguasa Laja Muat munua.
pairs.target: —because they said, “He has an unclean spirit.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh, sinoꞌ duoh madih Yesus nog yaꞌ bitapod duoh-E.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ kajon deꞌ sopaꞌ, yoh moꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa mogan Yesus.
pairs.target: His mother and his brothers came, and standing outside, they sent to him, calling him.

pairs.source: Takal inoh, bogoꞌ nyaꞌa nog guluꞌ sinok Yesus.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e, “Ogiꞌ sinoꞌ duoh madih Ingan kajon deꞌ sopaꞌ.  Yoh yaꞌ bitapod duoh Ingan.”
pairs.target: A multitude was sitting around him, and they told him, “Behold, your mother, your brothers, and your sisters are outside looking for you.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Osi sinoꞌ Kuꞌ? Osi madih Kuꞌ?”
pairs.target: He answered them, “Who are my mother and my brothers?”

pairs.source: Yoh moꞌ ningaꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ gulu' sinok odop-E, yohmoꞌ in-e, “Deꞌ mutiꞌ leh sinoꞌ duoh madih Kuꞌ!
pairs.target: Looking around at those who sat around him, he said, “Behold, my mother and my brothers!

pairs.source: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nai oni' deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ, deꞌ munoꞌ leh sinoꞌ duoh madih Kuꞌ.”
pairs.target: For whoever does the will of God, the same is my brother, and my sister, and mother.”

pairs.source: Yesus paliꞌ ngajal lagiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bingon Donu Galilea.  Nyaꞌa moꞌ bogoꞌ nog ngubun-E.  Iyoh odi guluꞌ kaang olud deꞌ ogiꞌ daang donu.  Pak-e nyaꞌa bogoꞌ mujuag deꞌ doyoh bingon donu.
pairs.target: Again he began to teach by the seaside. A great multitude was gathered to him, so that he entered into a boat in the sea, and sat down. All the multitude were on the land by the sea.

pairs.source: Bogoꞌ oni' deꞌ ngajal Yesus pakai nang silita, Iyoh moꞌ silita in-E,
pairs.target: He taught them many things in parables, and told them in his teaching,

pairs.source: “Ngojit dioꞌ! Ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ odi dabul biniaꞌ.
pairs.target: “Listen! Behold, the farmer went out to sow,

pairs.source: Takal-e dabul biniaꞌ-e, ogiꞌ deꞌ labuꞌ deꞌ olan, yohmoꞌ nog manuk lasuꞌ man kabuaꞌ-e.
pairs.target: and as he sowed, some seed fell by the road, and the birds came and devoured it.

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ geh deꞌ labuꞌ deꞌ tun tanaꞌ deꞌ bibatuh, yoh moꞌ lasuꞌ tumuꞌ dop-e tanaꞌ-e lidiaꞌ.
pairs.target: Others fell on the rocky ground, where it had little soil, and immediately it sprang up, because it had no depth of soil.

pairs.source: Pak-e takal onu moꞌ putiak, tumuꞌ pimuluah inoh moꞌ pisok yoh moꞌ kobos layuꞌ, dop-e aat-e diꞌ-e tuluap kaang tanaꞌ.
pairs.target: When the sun had risen, it was scorched; and because it had no root, it withered away.

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ geh deꞌ labuꞌ deꞌ siak duh deꞌ bilojaꞌ.  Takal-e tumuꞌ, duh deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ molut-e yoh moꞌ diꞌ-e ponai mokat tumuꞌ duoh bibuaꞌ.
pairs.target: Others fell among the thorns, and the thorns grew up, and choked it, and it yielded no fruit.

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ geh deꞌ labuꞌ deꞌ tanaꞌ deꞌ paguh.  Yoh moꞌ tumuꞌ yoh moꞌ bibuaꞌ, ogiꞌ deꞌ taluh puluꞌ sidoh bogoꞌ, ogiꞌ geh deꞌ nuam puluꞌ sidoh bogoꞌ, ogiꞌ geh deꞌ silatus sidoh bogoꞌ.”
pairs.target: Others fell into the good ground, and yielded fruit, growing up and increasing. Some produced thirty times, some sixty times, and some one hundred times as much.”

pairs.source: Takal Yesus moꞌ mokuaꞌ nang silita inoh, Yoh moꞌ in-e, “Osi deꞌ ogiꞌ kojit-e saꞌ-e ngojit-e!”
pairs.target: He said, “Whoever has ears to hear, let him hear.”

pairs.source: Takal nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ moꞌ buu duam Yesus sadiꞌ-e, pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E baya simoong duwoh naꞌan rasul-E moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Yesus, oni loti silita deꞌ nang-E inoh.
pairs.target: When he was alone, those who were around him with the twelve asked him about the parables.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot in-E, “Tuduꞌ ingan Topaꞌ moꞌ tanon tentang oni wat Iyoh militah jadin Laja.  Pak-e tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon Okuꞌ tanon pakai nang silita.
pairs.target: He said to them, “To you is given the mystery of God’s Kingdom, but to those who are outside, all things are done in parables,

pairs.source: Okuꞌ nai wat inoh saꞌ-e jadi kodaꞌ daang Kitab, deꞌ in-e, ‘Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ telus ningaꞌ, pak-e diꞌ-e ngiloti oni-oni-e.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ telus ngojit, pak-e diꞌ-e ngiloti oni-oni-e.  Simoꞌ-e ngiloti-e, yoh togan olan deꞌ jaꞌat, yohmoꞌ paliꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, Okuꞌ yaꞌ ngapun dosa-e.’ ”
pairs.target: that ‘seeing they may see, and not perceive; and hearing they may hear, and not understand; lest perhaps they should turn again, and their sins should be forgiven them.’”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Simoꞌ ingan diꞌ ingan ngiloti silita deꞌ nang Kuꞌ tiꞌ-e, silita deꞌ bokon tuang idoh geh diꞌ ingan ngiloti-e.
pairs.target: He said to them, “Don’t you understand this parable? How will you understand all of the parables?

pairs.source: Okuꞌ yaꞌ tanon loti silita deꞌ nang Kuꞌ tiꞌ-e: Nyaꞌa deꞌ dabul biniaꞌ, iyoh leh deꞌ kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tukang magah Pingunang Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: The farmer sows the word.

pairs.source: Biniaꞌ deꞌ labuꞌ deꞌ olan iyoh leh deꞌ kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit Pingunang Topaꞌ, pak-e Laja Muat munua lasuꞌ mit Pingunang Topaꞌ deꞌ tuang-e ngojit-e .
pairs.target: The ones by the road are the ones where the word is sown; and when they have heard, immediately Satan comes, and takes away the word which has been sown in them.

pairs.source: Biniaꞌ deꞌ labuꞌ deꞌ topat deꞌ bibatuh, samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit Pingunang Topaꞌ yohmoꞌ lasuꞌ tilimaꞌ daang otin deꞌ doon.
pairs.target: These in the same way are those who are sown on the rocky places, who, when they have heard the word, immediately receive it with joy.

pairs.source: Pak-e Pingunang Topaꞌ inoh diꞌ-e tumuꞌ daang otin osuap-e, yoh moꞌ diꞌ-e taan tuui, takal idip-e susah jolaꞌ iyoh moꞌ lasuꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ.
pairs.target: They have no root in themselves, but are short-lived. When oppression or persecution arises because of the word, immediately they stumble.

pairs.source: Biniaꞌ deꞌ labuꞌ deꞌ totaꞌ lojaꞌ, samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit Pingunang Topaꞌ,
pairs.target: Others are those who are sown among the thorns. These are those who have heard the word,

pairs.source: pak-e yoh bigaduh natong pingidip-e, suka yaꞌ kaya, ngilipuang suaꞌ-suaꞌ oni' daang dunia.  Pingunang Topaꞌ inoh moꞌ obuah molut, yohmoꞌ diꞌ-e ponai bibuaꞌ.
pairs.target: and the cares of this age, and the deceitfulness of riches, and the lusts of other things entering in choke the word, and it becomes unfruitful.

pairs.source: Biniaꞌ deꞌ labuꞌ deꞌ tanaꞌ deꞌ paguh, samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit Pingunang Topaꞌ, yohmoꞌ tumuꞌ daang otin osuap-e, yoh moꞌ bibuaꞌ.  Ogiꞌ deꞌ bibuaꞌ taluh puluꞌ sidoh bogoꞌ, ogiꞌ deꞌ nuam puluꞌ sidoh bogoꞌ, ogiꞌ geh deꞌ silatus sidoh bogoꞌ.”
pairs.target: Those which were sown on the good ground are those who hear the word, and accept it, and bear fruit, some thirty times, some sixty times, and some one hundred times.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ lanyut silita-E lagi', “Doiꞌ-e ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tung lapu yohmoꞌ ngilokuab-e pakai bona yoh moꞌ suan deꞌ libuaꞌ topat boꞌos-e.  Pasti nyaꞌa tung lapu, yohmoꞌ kajuag deꞌ topat deꞌ bigatung, saꞌ-e odaꞌ tana' jawaꞌ.
pairs.target: He said to them, “Is the lamp brought to be put under a basket  or under a bed? Isn’t it put on a stand?

pairs.source: Oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ nyaꞌa ponai kilin-e adin, tiaꞌ tuang ponai geh nyaꞌa kilin-e.  Oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ nyaꞌa puꞌan-e adin, tiaꞌ tuang ponai geh nyaꞌa puꞌan-e.
pairs.target: For there is nothing hidden, except that it should be made known; neither was anything made secret, but that it should come to light.

pairs.source: Osi deꞌ ogiꞌ kojit-e, saꞌ-e ngojit bonal-bonal.”
pairs.target: If any man has ears to hear, let him hear.”

pairs.source: Yoh moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ, “Ngojit bonal-bonal-e, pingajal deꞌ tanon Kuꞌ tuduꞌ ingan! Oni wat oniꞌ deꞌ nai nyeꞌ duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon, wat inoh leh wat Topaꞌ duoh odop nyeꞌ, makin lobih soꞌ inoh.
pairs.target: He said to them, “Take heed what you hear. With whatever measure you measure, it will be measured to you, and more will be given to you who hear.

pairs.source: Dop-e osi deꞌ moꞌ ogiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ-e, yoh yaꞌ soꞌon lobih bogoꞌ lagiꞌ, pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ doiꞌ oniꞌ, sit oniꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ-e, yaꞌ obuah mit geh.”
pairs.target: For whoever has, to him will more be given, and he who doesn’t have, even that which he has will be taken away from him.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ ngajal lagiꞌ pakai silita ngan-e tanon oni wat Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja.  Yoh moꞌ in-e, “Ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ dabul biniaꞌ-e deꞌ umoh-e.
pairs.target: He said, “God’s Kingdom is as if a man should cast seed on the earth,

pairs.source: Takal onu ngalom iyoh boꞌos, onu jawaꞌ yoh moꞌ mokat bo'os, yoh moꞌ ningaꞌ biniaꞌ-e moꞌ tumuꞌ luah suk-e bitamah bigatung, pak-e diꞌ-e puꞌan oni wat tumuꞌ-e inoh bitamah ayuh.
pairs.target: and should sleep and rise night and day, and the seed should spring up and grow, though he doesn’t know how.

pairs.source: Tanaꞌ umoh inoh leh deꞌ odaꞌ biniaꞌ inoh tumuꞌ nog-e bibuaꞌ, sibungas-e bisuat, yoh moꞌ bisalaꞌ yoh moꞌ jadin buaꞌ-e.
pairs.target: For the earth bears fruit: first the blade, then the ear, then the full grain in the ear.

pairs.source: Simoꞌ gandum inoh moꞌ masak, nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ umoh inoh moꞌ ngutuam-e, dop-e moꞌ nog onu-e yaꞌ ngutuam.”
pairs.target: But when the fruit is ripe, immediately he puts in the sickle, because the harvest has come.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ, “Samah kodaꞌ oni otoꞌ yaꞌ baning Topaꞌ deꞌ militah jadin Laja? Silita oni ngan toꞌ tanon-e?
pairs.target: He said, “How will we liken God’s Kingdom? Or with what parable will we illustrate it?

pairs.source: Takal Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja, inoh samah kodaꞌ silita itih: Luang sabih deꞌ sukup alus kiluang-e soꞌ luang pimuluah deꞌ ogiꞌ daang dunia.
pairs.target: It’s like a grain of mustard seed, which, when it is sown in the earth, though it is less than all the seeds that are on the earth,

pairs.source: Pak-e takal-e tumuꞌ, yoh moꞌ jadin koyuh deꞌ ayuh soꞌ pimuluah kuduas deꞌ bokon.  Yoh moꞌ bidaꞌan ayuh, bogoꞌ manuk deꞌ bisolin daꞌ-a.”
pairs.target: yet when it is sown, grows up, and becomes greater than all the herbs, and puts out great branches, so that the birds of the sky can lodge under its shadow.”

pairs.source: Wat inoh leh Yesus ngajal nyaꞌa pakai bogoꞌ silita kodaꞌ inoh, deꞌ tapod nyaꞌa ngiloti-e.
pairs.target: With many such parables he spoke the word to them, as they were able to hear it.

pairs.source: Yesus silalu ngajal nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ pakai nang silita.  Pak-e takal-E jok-e duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, Yoh tanon susuaꞌ loti pingunang-E tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: Without a parable he didn’t speak to them; but privately to his own disciples he explained everything.

pairs.source: Takal ngumi inoh geh, Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, “Jaꞌ otoꞌ motas keꞌ polad donu.”
pairs.target: On that day, when evening had come, he said to them, “Let’s go over to the other side.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ muun kaang olud, pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ suwaꞌ muat duoh-E niꞌ olud.  Yoh moꞌ togan nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ, pak-e ogiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ nunaꞌ pakai olud deꞌ bokon.
pairs.target: Leaving the multitude, they took him with them, even as he was, in the boat. Other small boats were also with him.

pairs.source: Aluaꞌ diꞌ-e tuui bilakat, sobak libut moꞌ nog.  Piꞌin gilumang moꞌ molot kaang olud-e, olud-e moꞌ tadoꞌ-e yaꞌ kuuam.
pairs.target: A big wind storm arose, and the waves beat into the boat, so much that the boat was already filled.

pairs.source: Takal inoh Yesus boꞌos deꞌ tun tilam deꞌ butut olud.  Yohmoꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E guyang odaꞌ mokat.  Yoh moꞌ in-e, “Gulu! Doh diꞌ Ingan tolu nang otoꞌ yaꞌ kobos kuuam?”
pairs.target: He himself was in the stern, asleep on the cushion, and they woke him up, and told him, “Teacher, don’t you care that we are dying?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ mokat, Yoh moꞌ nang sobak libut duoh sina tuduꞌ donu inoh in-E, “Loꞌo! Maꞌ tiyaꞌ bilayaꞌ!” Sobak duoh gilumang moꞌ lasuꞌ loꞌo.
pairs.target: He awoke, and rebuked the wind, and said to the sea, “Peace! Be still!” The wind ceased, and there was a great calm.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Oni nai ingan tolu? Oni nai ingan diꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ?”
pairs.target: He said to them, “Why are you so afraid? How is it that you have no faith?”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sukup tolu-e, yoh moꞌ in-e tipan odop-e, “Osi sibonal-e Yoh itih, sape sobak libut, gilumang tuang tunuak geh tuduꞌ sina-E?”
pairs.target: They were greatly afraid, and said to one another, “Who then is this, that even the wind and the sea obey him?”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E nog keꞌ polad Donu Galilea, topat ulang Gerasa loꞌo.
pairs.target: They came to the other side of the sea, into the country of the Gadarenes.

pairs.source: Takal Yesus maꞌad soꞌ aang olud, ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan dali deꞌ obuah bikalui muat munua deꞌ loꞌo deꞌ totaꞌ kubul odi tuduꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: When he had come out of the boat, immediately a man with an unclean spirit met him out of the tombs.

pairs.source: Dali inoh doiꞌ nyaꞌa tapod yaꞌ mokos-e bial-e pakai late.
pairs.target: He lived in the tombs. Nobody could bind him any more, not even with chains,

pairs.source: Moꞌ paliꞌ-paliꞌ nyaꞌa pasung tongan poꞌon-e, pak-e late ngan nyaꞌa pasung-e obuaꞌ motod-e, bosi deꞌ poꞌon-e tuang mugat-e geh.  Dali inoh sikiya dolas doiꞌ tiyaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ taan yaꞌ pasung-e.
pairs.target: because he had been often bound with fetters and chains, and the chains had been torn apart by him, and the fetters broken in pieces. Nobody had the strength to tame him.

pairs.source: Iyoh singonu singalom motak moliꞌ deꞌ totaꞌ kubul, deꞌ punguꞌ-punguꞌ simadi-e nang bogan-e daang-e mupuꞌ gonan-e pakai batuh.
pairs.target: Always, night and day, in the tombs and in the mountains, he was crying out, and cutting himself with stones.

pairs.source: Soꞌ juuaꞌ geh iyoh ningaꞌ takal Yesus nog, yoh moꞌ bikoduh tuduꞌ Yesus, yohmoꞌ nyomah Yesus nog jowin-e sium tanaꞌ.
pairs.target: When he saw Jesus from afar, he ran and bowed down to him,

pairs.source: Daang-e nang bogan-e, “Yesus Onak Topaꞌ deꞌ sukup ayuh kuasa-E, oni wat Muꞌu yaꞌ duoh okuꞌ? Daang adon Topaꞌ, okuꞌ bonal-bonal mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ Ingan maꞌ yaꞌ kanam okuꞌ!”
pairs.target: and crying out with a loud voice, he said, “What have I to do with you, Jesus, you Son of the Most High God? I adjure you by God, don’t torment me.”

pairs.source: Yoh ngan-e in inoh, dop-e Yesus sina tuduꞌ muat munua, “Luah leh soꞌ nyaꞌa itih!”
pairs.target: For he said to him, “Come out of the man, you unclean spirit!”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ-e, “Osi adon muꞌu?” Muat munua daang gonan nyaꞌa inoh moꞌ nyawot-E, “Adon kuꞌ Legion, dop-e koꞌih bogoꞌ.”
pairs.target: He asked him, “What is your name?” He said to him, “My name is Legion, for we are many.”

pairs.source: Paliꞌ-paliꞌ iyoh mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus, saꞌ-E diꞌ-e kasig muat munua luah soꞌ topat inoh.
pairs.target: He begged him much that he would not send them away out of the country.

pairs.source: Diꞌ-e juuaꞌ soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, bogoꞌ oyuaꞌ deꞌ kalik man-e deꞌ tilipang punguꞌ.
pairs.target: Now on the mountainside there was a great herd of pigs feeding.

pairs.source: Muat munua moꞌ mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus, “Odaꞌ leh koꞌih molot kaang gonan oyuaꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ.”
pairs.target: All the demons begged him, saying, “Send us into the pigs, that we may enter into them.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ odaꞌ muat munua deꞌ munoꞌ luah soꞌ gonan dali inoh yohmoꞌ molot daang gonan kaban oyuaꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ.  Suaꞌ oyuaꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bitabum soꞌ tilipang punguꞌ, kaang donu yohmoꞌ kobos longod.  Oyuaꞌ deꞌ kobos inoh kulang lobih ogiꞌ duwoh libu polong.
pairs.target: At once Jesus gave them permission. The unclean spirits came out and entered into the pigs. The herd of about two thousand rushed down the steep bank into the sea, and they were drowned in the sea.

pairs.source: Ayua deꞌ jaga oyuaꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bikoduh buu keꞌ kota, keꞌ kupuaꞌ-kupuaꞌ deꞌ sinok ngan-e tanon gah inoh.  Nyaꞌa moꞌ nog ningaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ magah-a inoh.
pairs.target: Those who fed them fled, and told it in the city and in the country. The people came to see what it was that had happened.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ odi tuduꞌ Yesus yohmoꞌ ningaꞌ dali deꞌ obuah bikalui muat munua inoh guluꞌ, yoh moꞌ pakai pimakai-e daang-e diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ bakoꞌ.  Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nog deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ tolu.
pairs.target: They came to Jesus, and saw him who had been possessed by demons sitting, clothed, and in his right mind, even him who had the legion; and they were afraid.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ningaꞌ dali inoh duoh kaban oyuaꞌ inoh, moꞌ silita oni deꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ-a.
pairs.target: Those who saw it declared to them what happened to him who was possessed by demons, and about the pigs.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ loꞌo deꞌ Gerasa inoh moꞌ ulih-ulih mitiaꞌ odaꞌ Yesus buu soꞌ topat inoh.
pairs.target: They began to beg him to depart from their region.

pairs.source: Takal Yesus moꞌ muat kaang olud, dali deꞌ mokuaꞌ obuah bikalui muat munua inoh mitiaꞌ odop-e yaꞌ suwaꞌ nunaꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: As he was entering into the boat, he who had been possessed by demons begged him that he might be with him.

pairs.source: Pak-e Yesus jaman-e, yohmoꞌ in-e, “Paliꞌ negeh, tanon tuduꞌ madih ayua muꞌ, oni deꞌ moꞌ nai Topaꞌ tuduꞌ muꞌu duoh tanon nang Topaꞌ masiꞌ tuduꞌ muꞌu.”
pairs.target: He didn’t allow him, but said to him, “Go to your house, to your friends, and tell them what great things the Lord has done for you, and how he had mercy on you.”

pairs.source: Dali inoh moꞌ buu, yohmoꞌ odi magah keꞌ topat deꞌ sobot nyaꞌa nang, “Simoong Kota”.  Danoꞌ iyoh moꞌ silita oni deꞌ moꞌ nai Yesus tuduꞌ odop-e.  Suaꞌ nyaꞌa ilan ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ silita-e.
pairs.target: He went his way, and began to proclaim in Decapolis how Jesus had done great things for him, and everyone marveled.

pairs.source: Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E paliꞌ motas Donu Galilea pakai olud.  Takal Yesus moꞌ nog polad donu, nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ moꞌ bitodod-todod odi ngumaꞌ Iyoh.
pairs.target: When Jesus had crossed back over in the boat to the other side, a great multitude was gathered to him; and he was by the sea.

pairs.source: Pimipin topat simayang agama Yahudi deꞌ adon Yairus nog tuduꞌ Yesus.  Takal yoh moꞌ ningaꞌ Yesus, yohmoꞌ guluꞌ bikunyug deꞌ sulung jowin-E.
pairs.target: Behold, one of the rulers of the synagogue, Jairus by name, came; and seeing him, he fell at his feet,

pairs.source: Daang-e in-e, “Tok-tok kuꞌ mitiaꞌ tulung tuduꞌ Ingan, odi keꞌ boli kuꞌ dioꞌ, tomaꞌ gonan onak dayung kuꞌ deꞌ bonaꞌ, saꞌ-e mokuaꞌ, duoh diꞌ-e kobos.”
pairs.target: and begged him much, saying, “My little daughter is at the point of death. Please come and lay your hands on her, that she may be made healthy, and live.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ lasuꞌ odi duoh Yairus.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ moꞌ odi siuah-siuah-e bitunaꞌ duoh Yesus daang-e bitodod-todod, soꞌ boit soꞌ toꞌuh-E.
pairs.target: He went with him, and a great multitude followed him, and they pressed upon him on all sides.

pairs.source: Daang uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ, ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan dayung deꞌ obuah onam bubuꞌ, onam nog koꞌis-e deꞌ lika yoh noman-e, moꞌ simoong duwoh sowaꞌ tuui-e.
pairs.target: A certain woman, who had an issue of blood for twelve years,

pairs.source: Moꞌ puas yoh ngubat-e sape nog obuaꞌ halta benda-e, pak-e aluaꞌ geh diꞌ-e mokuaꞌ.  Makin onu makin bitamah bonaꞌ.
pairs.target: and had suffered many things by many physicians, and had spent all that she had, and was no better, but rather grew worse,

pairs.source: Dayung inoh moꞌ ngojit oni' deꞌ moꞌ nai Yesus soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ, yoh moꞌ odi sinok Yesus soꞌ dug-E.
pairs.target: having heard the things concerning Jesus, came up behind him in the crowd, and touched his clothes.

pairs.source: Yohmoꞌ in-e daang otin-e, “Simoꞌ kuꞌ tapod tomaꞌ jubah-E, okuꞌ pasti mokuaꞌ.”
pairs.target: For she said, “If I just touch his clothes, I will be made well.”

pairs.source: Takal inoh geh yoh tomaꞌ jubah Yesus, onam koꞌis-e lasuꞌ mokuaꞌ.
pairs.target: Immediately the flow of her blood was dried up, and she felt in her body that she was healed of her affliction.

pairs.source: Takal inoh geh Yesus ngoon ogiꞌ kuasa deꞌ luah soꞌ odop-E.  Yesus moꞌ kumiat tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ Yoh moꞌ sikian in-E, “Osi deꞌ tomaꞌ jubah Kuꞌ?”
pairs.target: Immediately Jesus, perceiving in himself that the power had gone out from him, turned around in the crowd, and asked, “Who touched my clothes?”

pairs.source: Pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ in-e, “Idoh keh Ingan ningaꞌ nyaꞌa bogoꞌ deꞌ bitodod-todod? Oni nai Ingan sikian osi deꞌ tomaꞌ odop Ingan.”
pairs.target: His disciples said to him, “You see the multitude pressing against you, and you say, ‘Who touched me?’”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ ningaꞌ katiꞌ-kanih osi deꞌ tomaꞌ odop-E.
pairs.target: He looked around to see her who had done this thing.

pairs.source: Dayung inoh moꞌ kimotol tolu takal-e moꞌ puꞌan nang odop-e moꞌ mokuaꞌ, yoh moꞌ guluꞌ bikunyug daang jowin-e sium tanaꞌ deꞌ sulung jowin Yesus, yoh moꞌ ngakuꞌ nang odop-e deꞌ tomaꞌ jubah Yesus.
pairs.target: But the woman, fearing and trembling, knowing what had been done to her, came and fell down before him, and told him all the truth.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ dayung inoh, “Luban muꞌu bisayaꞌ punuaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ muꞌu moꞌ mokuaꞌ, paliꞌ leh daang otin deꞌ bidanah.  Muꞌu moꞌ tok-tok mokuaꞌ.”
pairs.target: He said to her, “Daughter, your faith has made you well. Go in peace, and be cured of your disease.”

pairs.source: Takal Yesus aluaꞌ sina, kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa soꞌ boli Yairus moꞌ nog tanon in-e, “Onak dayung ingan moꞌ kobos, dusah tiyaꞌ nyeꞌ nyusah Gulu neh!”
pairs.target: While he was still speaking, people came from the synagogue ruler’s house saying, “Your daughter is dead. Why bother the Teacher any more?”

pairs.source: Pak-e Yesus diꞌ-e piduli oniꞌ deꞌ nang odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Yairus, “Maꞌ tolu, bisayaꞌ negeh!”
pairs.target: But Jesus, when he heard the message spoken, immediately said to the ruler of the synagogue, “Don’t be afraid, only believe.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ lasuꞌ ponu, Yoh jaman nyaꞌa niꞌ naꞌan tuang diꞌ soꞌon geh nunaꞌ Odop-E, jok-e odaꞌ Petrus, Yakobus duoh madih-e Yohanes.
pairs.target: He allowed no one to follow him, except Peter, James, and John the brother of James.

pairs.source: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nog boli Yairus, yoh moꞌ ningaꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ siꞌian nang puas bogan-e.
pairs.target: He came to the synagogue ruler’s house, and he saw an uproar, weeping, and great wailing.

pairs.source: Yesus molot, Yoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Oni nai ingan kiak kaung siꞌian deꞌ in inoh neh? Onak opot itih idoh diꞌ-e kobos, iyoh jok-e boꞌos.”
pairs.target: When he had entered in, he said to them, “Why do you make an uproar and weep? The child is not dead, but is asleep.”

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ towoh Yesus.  Yoh moꞌ odaꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ luah.  Yesus moꞌ toban sinoꞌ samaꞌ onak opot inoh duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E molot kaang bilit-e.
pairs.target: They ridiculed him. But he, having put them all out, took the father of the child, her mother, and those who were with him, and went in where the child was lying.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ kagong tongan onak dayung Yairus inoh, Yoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, “Talita kum,” loti-e “Oi onak dayung, Okuꞌ odaꞌ muꞌu mokat!”
pairs.target: Taking the child by the hand, he said to her, “Talitha cumi!”  which means, being interpreted, “Girl, I tell you, get up!”

pairs.source: Takal inoh geh onak dayung inoh moꞌ lasuꞌ mokat mujuag, yoh moꞌ ponu.  Takal inoh umul-e simoong duwoh sowaꞌ.  Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ moꞌ sukup doon-e daang-e ilan-e.
pairs.target: Immediately the girl rose up and walked, for she was twelve years old. They were amazed with great amazement.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ isin-isin jaman odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tanon tuduꞌ osi sijaꞌ-e.  Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Ngin odaꞌ onak opot inoh man.”
pairs.target: He strictly ordered them that no one should know this, and commanded that something should be given to her to eat.

pairs.source: Soꞌ boli Yairus, Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E paliꞌ keꞌ kupuaꞌ-E Nazaret, kupuaꞌ asal-E.
pairs.target: He went out from there. He came into his own country, and his disciples followed him.

pairs.source: Takal Onu Sabat, Iyoh moꞌ mulai ngajal nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ deꞌ boli topat simayang agama Yahudi.  Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal-E moꞌ sukup ilan-e.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e, “Soꞌ ki soꞌ-E soꞌon ilmu deꞌ masam-masam? Kuasa deꞌ oni wat-e deꞌ ogiꞌ daꞌ-A? Oni wat-e ngan-E ponai nai oniꞌ deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa?
pairs.target: When the Sabbath had come, he began to teach in the synagogue, and many hearing him were astonished, saying, “Where did this man get these things?” and, “What is the wisdom that is given to this man, that such mighty works come about by his hands?

pairs.source: Deꞌ puꞌan otoꞌ, Yoh itih onak tukang koyuh.  Sinoꞌ-E Maria, duoh kudu-kudu sudiꞌ-E deꞌ dali, Yakobus, Yoses, Yudas duoh Simon.  Sudiꞌ-E deꞌ dayung tuang ogiꞌ geh datiꞌ.” Noh leh ngan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ doliaꞌ-e tilimaꞌ Iyoh danoꞌ.
pairs.target: Isn’t this the carpenter, the son of Mary, and brother of James, Joses, Judah, and Simon? Aren’t his sisters here with us?” They were offended at him.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Daki-daki sijaꞌ-e nyaꞌa pimodo tuduꞌ nabi, pak-e jok-e nyaꞌa deꞌ kupuaꞌ-e duoh madih ayua duoh sikiaꞌ sudiꞌ-e deꞌ diꞌ-e pimodo tuduꞌ-e.”
pairs.target: Jesus said to them, “A prophet is not without honor, except in his own country, and among his own relatives, and in his own house.”

pairs.source: Danoꞌ, Iyoh diꞌ-e dapod nai oniꞌ deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa, jok-e kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ tomaꞌ-E deꞌ odaꞌ-E mokuaꞌ soꞌ onam-e.
pairs.target: He could do no mighty work there, except that he laid his hands on a few sick people, and healed them.

pairs.source: Yesus sukup ilan-e, oni nai nyaꞌa deꞌ kupuaꞌ-E diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ odop-E.  Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ ponu ngajal nyaꞌa keꞌ kupuaꞌ-kupuaꞌ deꞌ bokon.
pairs.target: He marveled because of their unbelief. He went around the villages teaching.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ mogan simoong duwoh naꞌan rasul-E.  Iyoh moꞌ ngin kuasa tuduꞌ-e saꞌ-e ponai kasig muat munua, yohmoꞌ odaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ odi ngaꞌ duwoh-duwoh.
pairs.target: He called to himself the twelve, and began to send them out two by two; and he gave them authority over the unclean spirits.

pairs.source: Iyoh sibaya tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ jaman toban balang-balang deꞌ yaꞌ pakai-e kodaꞌ onyad, duit, duoh bek.  Jok nyeꞌ soꞌon toban sikuud.
pairs.target: He commanded them that they should take nothing for their journey, except a staff only: no bread, no wallet, no money in their purse,

pairs.source: Jok nyeꞌ pakai silipal duoh bojuh deꞌ polong nyeꞌ sijaꞌ-e.
pairs.target: but to wear sandals, and not put on two tunics.

pairs.source: Iyoh moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ, “Simoꞌ ingan nog deꞌ kota, ogiꞌ nyaꞌa tilimaꞌ ingan loꞌo deꞌ boli-e, nyeꞌ moꞌ ngilumon danoꞌ nog ingan buu paliꞌ soꞌ kota inoh.
pairs.target: He said to them, “Wherever you enter into a house, stay there until you depart from there.

pairs.source: Simoꞌ-e ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ topat soꞌ ingan odi, diꞌ-e tilimaꞌ ingan duoh doliaꞌ-e ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ nang ingan, nyeꞌ moꞌ buu daang nyeꞌ nguguah lopu tana' soꞌ lupaꞌ poꞌon ingan, saꞌ-e jadin tanda Topaꞌ yaꞌ ngukum odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.”
pairs.target: Whoever will not receive you nor hear you, as you depart from there, shake off the dust that is under your feet for a testimony against them. Assuredly, I tell you, it will be more tolerable for Sodom and Gomorrah in the day of judgment than for that city!”

pairs.source: Takal-e mokuaꞌ ngojit sibaya Yesus, keꞌ simoong duwoh naꞌan rasul-E moꞌ bilakat ponu, tanon tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tapod-e, odaꞌ togan olan deꞌ jaꞌat duoh paliꞌ keꞌ olan Topaꞌ, nyeꞌ moꞌ nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nang-E.
pairs.target: They went out and preached that people should repent.

pairs.source: Bogoꞌ basa muat munua deꞌ kasig rasul-rasul Yesus, yoh gasak inyuaꞌ zaitun deꞌ gonan nyaꞌa deꞌ monam odaꞌ mokuaꞌ.
pairs.target: They cast out many demons, and anointed many with oil who were sick, and healed them.

pairs.source: Laja Herodes moꞌ ngojit gah tentang Yesus, dop-e adon-E moꞌ timogah katiꞌ-kanih.  Ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nang, “Yohanes Pembaptis paliꞌ idip baꞌuh, iyoh ngan-e ogiꞌ kuasa-e nai oniꞌ deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa.”
pairs.target: King Herod heard this, for his name had become known, and he said, “John the Baptizer has risen from the dead, and therefore these powers are at work in him.”

pairs.source: Pak-e ogiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ nang, “Iyoh itih nabi Elia deꞌ noꞌuh-e!” Ogiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ nang “Iyoh itih nabi deꞌ samah kodaꞌ nabi-nabi soꞌ joman deꞌ noꞌuh-e.”
pairs.target: But others said, “He is Elijah.” Others said, “He is a prophet, or like one of the prophets.”

pairs.source: Takal Laja Herodes moꞌ ngojit gah inoh iyoh moꞌ in-e, “Iyoh pasti Yohanes Pembaptis deꞌ noꞌuh-e, deꞌ moꞌ mokuaꞌ kuꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa notok tunguaꞌ-e deꞌ moꞌ paliꞌ idip baꞌuh.”
pairs.target: But Herod, when he heard this, said, “This is John, whom I beheaded. He has risen from the dead.”

pairs.source: Dop-e deꞌ dioꞌ soꞌ kanoꞌ Laja Herodes itih leh deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa takap duoh pasung-e yohmoꞌ naꞌ kaang jel.  Herodes nai wat inoh, dop-e Yohanes Pembaptis ngalah nang Herodes mit Herodias odaꞌ jadin sowon-e.  Deꞌ dioꞌ, Herodias itih iyohleh sowon Filipus, Filipus itih madih odop Herodes.
pairs.target: For Herod himself had sent out and arrested John, and bound him in prison for the sake of Herodias, his brother Philip’s wife, for he had married her.

pairs.source: Yohanes moꞌ silalu ngalah Herodes nang polih nyeꞌ mit sowon madih nyeꞌ odaꞌ jadin sowon nyeꞌ.
pairs.target: For John said to Herod, “It is not lawful for you to have your brother’s wife.”

pairs.source: Iyoh ngan Herodias buꞌui tuduꞌ Yohanes, yoh moꞌ yaꞌ ngabos-e.  Pak-e yoh diꞌ-e ponai nai wat inoh,
pairs.target: Herodias set herself against him, and desired to kill him, but she couldn’t,

pairs.source: dop-e Herodes pimodo tuduꞌ Yohanes.  Iyoh puꞌan-e geh nang Yohanes Pembaptis ulang deꞌ bonal, doiꞌ salah-e.  Yoh ngan-e odaꞌ nyaꞌa jaga Yohanes saꞌ nyaꞌa diꞌ-e ngabos-e.  Pak-e bilang-e ngojit pingunang Yohanes, yoh moꞌ jadin bigaduh kila-e, pak-e yoh sonang geh ngojit-e.
pairs.target: for Herod feared John, knowing that he was a righteous and holy man, and kept him safe. When he heard him, he did many things, and he heard him gladly.

pairs.source: Nyuang-nyuang-e Herodias moꞌ soꞌon olan ngan-e yaꞌ ngabos Yohanes Pembaptis.  Takal onu Herodes biluman onu limokah-e, yoh moꞌ ngunang suaꞌ piayuh-piayuh, pimipin-pimipin sidadu, duoh ulang-ulang deꞌ timogah deꞌ propinsi Galilea.
pairs.target: Then a convenient day came, that Herod on his birthday made a supper for his nobles, the high officers, and the chief men of Galilee.

pairs.source: Takal-e biluman inoh, onak dayung Herodias bitanaꞌ.  Herodes duoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ daang lami inoh sukup doon-e ningaꞌ iyoh bitanaꞌ.  Yoh ngan Herodes in-e, “Oni deꞌ yaꞌ mitiaꞌ muꞌ tuduꞌ okuꞌ, tanon negeh tiaꞌ kuꞌ ngin daꞌ nyeꞌ.”
pairs.target: When the daughter of Herodias herself came in and danced, she pleased Herod and those sitting with him. The king said to the young lady, “Ask me whatever you want, and I will give it to you.”

pairs.source: Herodes moꞌ bisupah tuduꞌ onak Herodias yoh moꞌ in-e, “Oni sijaꞌ-e deꞌ mitiaꞌ muꞌ kuꞌ ngin daꞌ nyeꞌ, bial-e sitengah soꞌ negeli deꞌ kagong kuꞌ.”
pairs.target: He swore to her, “Whatever you shall ask of me, I will give you, up to half of my kingdom.”

pairs.source: Onak dayung inoh moꞌ odi sikian tuduꞌ sinoꞌ-e “Oni deꞌ patut okuꞌ mitiaꞌ-e?” In-e.  Sinoꞌ-e moꞌ nyawot-e, “Mitiaꞌ bak Yohanes Pembaptis.”
pairs.target: She went out, and said to her mother, “What shall I ask?” She said, “The head of John the Baptizer.”

pairs.source: Onak dayung inoh moꞌ paliꞌ ngaduap Herodes yohmoꞌ in-e, “Okuꞌ mitiaꞌ bak Yohanes Pembaptis tuduꞌ ingan, katod tuduꞌ okuꞌ naꞌ daang talam!”
pairs.target: She came in immediately with haste to the king, and asked, “I want you to give me right now the head of John the Baptizer on a platter.”

pairs.source: Takal Herodes ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ mitiaꞌ-e inoh bak Yohanes Pembaptis, otin Herodes moꞌ sukup ngilobuꞌ, pak-e yoh moꞌ diꞌ-e ponai nalik sina-e, dop-e moꞌ tilanyul bisupah deꞌ jowin nyaꞌa deꞌ ngunang-e.
pairs.target: The king was exceedingly sorry, but for the sake of his oaths, and of his dinner guests, he didn’t wish to refuse her.

pairs.source: Iyoh moꞌ lasuꞌ odaꞌ sidadu-e notok tunguaꞌ Yohanes Pembaptis toban tuduꞌ odop-e.  Sidadu-e moꞌ lasuꞌ odi keꞌ jel yoh moꞌ notok tunguaꞌ Yohanes.
pairs.target: Immediately the king sent out a soldier of his guard, and commanded to bring John’s head, and he went and beheaded him in the prison,

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh yoh moꞌ toban bak Yohanes deꞌ naꞌ-e daang talam, yohmoꞌ ngin tuduꞌ onak dayung Herodias.  Onak dayung inoh moꞌ ngin tuduꞌ sinoꞌ-e lagiꞌ.
pairs.target: and brought his head on a platter, and gave it to the young lady; and the young lady gave it to her mother.

pairs.source: Takal pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yohanes moꞌ ngojit nang Yohanes moꞌ obuah ngabos, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ odi mit todang-e yohmoꞌ ngubul-e.
pairs.target: When his disciples heard this, they came and took up his corpse, and laid it in a tomb.

pairs.source: Keꞌ simoong duwoh naꞌan rasul Yesus deꞌ pait-e inoh paliꞌ tikuluk duoh Yesus.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ tanon suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nai-e duoh oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal-e.
pairs.target: The apostles gathered themselves together to Jesus, and they told him all things, whatever they had done, and whatever they had taught.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ rasul-rasul-E deꞌ munoꞌ, “Jaꞌ otoꞌ odi keꞌ topat deꞌ motug, deꞌ doiꞌ nyaꞌa daꞌ-e saꞌ otoꞌ tapod nosaꞌ loꞌo niꞌ tiliaꞌ.” Yesus in inoh, saai nyaꞌa sikiya bogoꞌ deꞌ nog, deꞌ buu.  Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E diꞌ-e supot man.
pairs.target: He said to them, “You come apart into a deserted place, and rest awhile.” For there were many coming and going, and they had no leisure so much as to eat.

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ buu pakai olud, ngan-e odi keꞌ topat deꞌ doiꞌ nyaꞌa daꞌ-e.
pairs.target: They went away in the boat to a deserted place by themselves.

pairs.source: Pak-e bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kilin odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ buu, duoh puꞌan kaki soꞌ-e yaꞌ odi.  Nyaꞌa moꞌ obuaꞌ bikoduh soꞌ kota-kota odi keꞌ topat deꞌ soꞌ Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E odi.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ dioꞌ nog.
pairs.target: They saw them going, and many recognized him and ran there on foot from all the cities. They arrived before them and came together to him.

pairs.source: Takal Yesus moꞌ maꞌad soꞌ olud keꞌ doyoh, Yoh moꞌ ningaꞌ nyaꞌa moꞌ bogoꞌ.  Iyoh masiꞌ tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, dop-e Yoh ningaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ samah kodaꞌ domba deꞌ doiꞌ nyaꞌa piala-e.  Noh leh ngan Yesus moꞌ mulai tanon bogoꞌ pingajal tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: Jesus came out, saw a great multitude, and he had compassion on them, because they were like sheep without a shepherd, and he began to teach them many things.

pairs.source: Takal onu moꞌ ngumi, pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ Yesus, “Onu moꞌ yaꞌ ngalom, topat itih juuaꞌ soꞌ nyaꞌa.
pairs.target: When it was late in the day, his disciples came to him, and said, “This place is deserted, and it is late in the day.

pairs.source: Lobih paguh Ingan odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ mutiꞌ buu soꞌ topat itih, saꞌ-a tapod milih pinguman-e deꞌ kupuaꞌ-kupuaꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ sinok itih.”
pairs.target: Send them away, that they may go into the surrounding country and villages, and buy themselves bread, for they have nothing to eat.”

pairs.source: Pak-e Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Ingan negeh deꞌ ngin man tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ mutiꞌ!” In odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nyawot-e, “Doiꞌ koꞌih taan milih pinguman deꞌ loga-e duwoh latus kiping duit pilak, ngan koꞌih yaꞌ maꞌan odop-e deꞌ kiang-kiang itih?”
pairs.target: But he answered them, “You give them something to eat.” They asked him, “Shall we go and buy two hundred denarii worth of bread, and give them something to eat?”

pairs.source: Pak-e Yesus moꞌ bisikian tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Suba ningaꞌ dioꞌ, duam kudu kueh ingan deꞌ ogiꞌ!”   Takal-e mokuaꞌ ningaꞌ-e yoh moꞌ in-e, “Ogiꞌ limoh kueh, ogiꞌ duwoh polong ikian.”
pairs.target: He said to them, “How many loaves do you have? Go see.” When they knew, they said, “Five, and two fish.”

pairs.source: Iyoh moꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ guluꞌ bikuluk deꞌ tun duh.
pairs.target: He commanded them that everyone should sit down in groups on the green grass.

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ guluꞌ bikuluk ogiꞌ deꞌ ngaꞌ silatus, ogiꞌ deꞌ ngaꞌ limoh puluꞌ daang niꞌ uluk.
pairs.target: They sat down in ranks, by hundreds and by fifties.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ mit limoh kueh baya duwoh polong ikian inoh, Iyoh moꞌ bigalong keꞌ longit, yohmoꞌ bisukul tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.  Mokuaꞌ inoh Iyoh moꞌ nyipiak-nyipiak kueh-e, yohmoꞌ ngin tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E saꞌ-e kutung tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa.  Watnoh geh wat-e duoh ikian deꞌ duwoh polong inoh, Iyoh bikutung tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa.
pairs.target: He took the five loaves and the two fish, and looking up to heaven, he blessed and broke the loaves, and he gave to his disciples to set before them, and he divided the two fish among them all.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ man nog busuah-e.
pairs.target: They all ate, and were filled.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh, nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nguluk kuban-e.  Takal-e moꞌ tikuluk, aluaꞌ ogiꞌ simoong duwoh bakul.
pairs.target: They took up twelve baskets full of broken pieces and also of the fish.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ suwaꞌ man inoh ogiꞌ kila-kila limoh libu naꞌan dali.
pairs.target: Those who ate the loaves were five thousand men.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus lasuꞌ odaꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E muat deꞌ olud dioꞌ odi keꞌ kota Betsaida deꞌ polad Donu Galilea.  Iyoh moꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ buu paliꞌ.
pairs.target: Immediately he made his disciples get into the boat, and to go ahead to the other side, to Bethsaida, while he himself sent the multitude away.

pairs.source: Takal nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ buu, Yesus moꞌ maꞌad keꞌ tun punguꞌ, ngan-e yaꞌ bidoa.
pairs.target: After he had taken leave of them, he went up the mountain to pray.

pairs.source: Takal onu moꞌ ngalom, olud deꞌ pakai pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E inoh moꞌ nog uun donu, pak-e Yesus aluaꞌ deꞌ doyoh.
pairs.target: When evening had come, the boat was in the middle of the sea, and he was alone on the land.

pairs.source: Yesus ningaꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E lolah posah bikayuh olud-e dop-e sobak nog soꞌ jowin olud-e.  Takal onu aluaꞌ bosow, Yesus odi tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, simadi-E ponu tun piꞌin.  Iyoh ponu mun deꞌ yaꞌ kawan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ jaꞌ-a.
pairs.target: Seeing them distressed in rowing, for the wind was contrary to them, about the fourth watch of the night he came to them, walking on the sea,  and he would have passed by them,

pairs.source: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ningaꞌ Iyoh ponu deꞌ tun piꞌin, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sakaꞌ nang inoh munua.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nang bogan-e.
pairs.target: but they, when they saw him walking on the sea, supposed that it was a ghost, and cried out;

pairs.source: Suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ gogoh duoh tolu takal-e ningaꞌ nang inoh Yesus.  Pak-e Yesus lasuꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Maꞌ tolu! Okuꞌ itih Yesus.”
pairs.target: for they all saw him, and were troubled. But he immediately spoke with them, and said to them, “Cheer up! It is I! Don’t be afraid.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ maꞌad kaang olud duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, sobak moꞌ lasuꞌ loꞌo, pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ sukup ilan-e.
pairs.target: He got into the boat with them; and the wind ceased, and they were very amazed among themselves, and marveled;

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ aluaꞌ geh diꞌ-e ngiloti-e, takal-e ningaꞌ Yesus maꞌan nyaꞌa limoh libu naꞌan pakai limoh kiping kueh, duoh pakai duwoh polong ikian, sobab otin odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ madod.
pairs.target: for they hadn’t understood about the loaves, but their hearts were hardened.

pairs.source: Takal Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ nog polad donu, Iyoh moꞌ maꞌad keꞌ doyoh keꞌ topat deꞌ adon Genesaret.
pairs.target: When they had crossed over, they came to land at Gennesaret, and moored to the shore.

pairs.source: Takal Yesus moꞌ maꞌad soꞌ aang olud, nyaꞌa moꞌ lasuꞌ piluh nang Yoh Yesus.
pairs.target: When they had come out of the boat, immediately the people recognized him,

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bikoduh keꞌ boli-boli nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ topat inoh.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bitawiak toban nyaꞌa deꞌ monam deꞌ tun tilam yohmoꞌ toban tuduꞌ Yesus.  Daki sijaꞌ-e soꞌ Yesus odi takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ puꞌan-e, yoh lasuꞌ toban nyaꞌa deꞌ monam tuduꞌ-E.
pairs.target: and ran around that whole region, and began to bring those who were sick, on their mats, to where they heard he was.

pairs.source: Daki sijaꞌ-e Yesus odi, bait deꞌ kota, deꞌ kupuaꞌ-kupuaꞌ deꞌ ayuh, duoh kupuaꞌ-kupuaꞌ deꞌ isit.  Nyaꞌa silalu toban ulang deꞌ monam piguling deꞌ topat nyaꞌa bijua, mitiaꞌ masiꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus kadu-e tomaꞌ tubon jubah-E sijaꞌ-e.  Yohmoꞌ suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ monam deꞌ tomaꞌ tubon jubah Yesus mokuaꞌ.
pairs.target: Wherever he entered, into villages, or into cities, or into the country, they laid the sick in the marketplaces, and begged him that they might just touch the fringe of his garment; and as many as touched him were made well.

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ onu, takal kudu-kudu naꞌan ulang Yahudi soꞌ uluk ulang Farisi duoh kudu-kudu naꞌan gulu agama Yahudi soꞌ Yerusalem odi bitapod duoh Yesus.
pairs.target: Then the Pharisees and some of the scribes gathered together to him, having come from Jerusalem.

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus man pakai tongan-e deꞌ koꞌis, diꞌ-e mamiaꞌ-e.
pairs.target: Now when they saw some of his disciples eating bread with defiled, that is unwashed, hands, they found fault.

pairs.source: Dop-e suaꞌ ulang Yahudi yaꞌ diꞌ-e man, moꞌ-e diꞌ-e mamiaꞌ tongan-e nunaꞌ adat sumuk babai-e.  Amot-e ulang Yahudi soꞌ uluk ulang Farisi.
pairs.target: (For the Pharisees and all the Jews, don’t eat unless they wash their hands and forearms, holding to the tradition of the elders.

pairs.source: Yoh diꞌ-e soꞌon man oniꞌ deꞌ milih-e soꞌ pasal, moꞌ-e aluaꞌ diꞌ-e mamuh.  Bogoꞌ lagiꞌ adat sumuk babai-e deꞌ halus yoh nunaꞌ-e, kodaꞌ mamiaꞌ sakil makup duoh balang-balang deꞌ soꞌ tibaga.
pairs.target: They don’t eat when they come from the marketplace unless they bathe themselves, and there are many other things, which they have received to hold to: washings of cups, pitchers, bronze vessels, and couches.)

pairs.source: Noh leh ngan uluk ulang Farisi duoh gulu-gulu agama Yahudi sikian tuduꞌ Yesus, “Oni nai pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Muꞌ man diꞌ-e mamiaꞌ tongan-e? Oni nai-e diꞌ-e nunaꞌ atulan adat sumuk babai otoꞌ?”
pairs.target: The Pharisees and the scribes asked him, “Why don’t your disciples walk according to the tradition of the elders, but eat their bread with unwashed hands?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Oi ulang deꞌ suka pulaꞌ-pulaꞌ! Tutuas kodaꞌ deꞌ nang Topaꞌ pakai nabi Yesaya noꞌuh-e deꞌ in-e, ‘Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ jok-e nyomah Okuꞌ deꞌ bobaꞌ-e, pak-e daang otin-e idoh.
pairs.target: He answered them, “Well did Isaiah prophesy of you hypocrites, as it is written, ‘This people honors me with their lips, but their heart is far from me.

pairs.source: Doiꞌ guna-e yoh nyomah Okuꞌ, dop-e yoh jok-e ngajal atulan adat deꞌ nai manusia.’ Inoh leh deꞌ moꞌ tanon-e.
pairs.target: But they worship me in vain, teaching as doctrines the commandments of men.’

pairs.source: Pilitah-pilitah deꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ ingan togan-e, ingan moꞌ ulih-ulih nunaꞌ atulan adat deꞌ nai manusia.”
pairs.target: “For you set aside the commandment of God, and hold tightly to the tradition of men—the washing of pitchers and cups, and you do many other such things.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Ponai manah geh ingan nulak pilitah Topaꞌ, ngan ingan yaꞌ nunaꞌ atulan adat deꞌ nai manusia.
pairs.target: He said to them, “Full well do you reject the commandment of God, that you may keep your tradition.

pairs.source: Nabi Musa moꞌ ngin atulan wat tih, ‘Pimodo leh tuduꞌ samaꞌ sinoꞌ muꞌ,’ duoh ‘Osi deꞌ diꞌ-e pimodo duoh samaꞌ sinoꞌ-e, halus obuah ukum ngabos.’
pairs.target: For Moses said, ‘Honor your father and your mother;’ and, ‘He who speaks evil of father or mother, let him be put to death.’

pairs.source: Pak-e ingan ngajal nang doiꞌ salah-e moꞌ ingan sina tuduꞌ pingoma ingan, ‘Doiꞌ kuꞌ tapod tulung ingan, dop-e suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ ngin kuꞌ tuduꞌ ingan moꞌ ngin kuꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.’
pairs.target: But you say, ‘If a man tells his father or his mother, “Whatever profit you might have received from me is Corban,  that is to say, given to God”;’

pairs.source: Oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal ingan inoh moꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa diꞌ-e piduli pingoma-e.
pairs.target: then you no longer allow him to do anything for his father or his mother,

pairs.source: Jadin ingan nang pilitah Topaꞌ diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ toga, pak-e ingan moꞌ nunaꞌ atulan adat deꞌ nai manusia.  Aluaꞌ bogoꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ kodaꞌ itih deꞌ nai ingan.”
pairs.target: making void the word of God by your tradition, which you have handed down. You do many things like this.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ mogan nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ, Iyoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, “Ngojit dioꞌ saꞌ ingan ngiloti-e!
pairs.target: He called all the multitude to himself, and said to them, “Hear me, all of you, and understand.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ molot kaang polong nyaꞌa, doiꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa koꞌis, pak-e suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ luah soꞌ polong nyaꞌa inoh leh deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa koꞌis.
pairs.target: There is nothing from outside of the man, that going into him can defile him; but the things which proceed out of the man are those that defile the man.

pairs.source: Osi deꞌ ogiꞌ kojit-e, iyoh ngojit-e!”
pairs.target: If anyone has ears to hear, let him hear!”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ buu togan nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ yohmoꞌ molot kaang boli, pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ sikian oni loti silita inoh.
pairs.target: When he had entered into a house away from the multitude, his disciples asked him about the parable.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ sina in-e tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, “Idoh keh diꞌ ingan puꞌan-e, suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ molot kaang polong nyaꞌa, doiꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa koꞌis?
pairs.target: He said to them, “Are you also without understanding? Don’t you perceive that whatever goes into the man from outside can’t defile him,

pairs.source: Dop-e oniꞌ deꞌ man nyaꞌa diꞌ-e molot kaang otin nyaꞌa, pak-e molot kaang toꞌin nyaꞌa, mokuaꞌ inoh nyaꞌa odi saꞌat keꞌ jaman.” Yesus in inoh ngan-e tanon nang suaꞌ pinguman bisig, doiꞌ deꞌ polih nyeꞌ man-e.
pairs.target: because it doesn’t go into his heart, but into his stomach, then into the latrine, thus purifying all foods?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ, “Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ luah soꞌ polong nyaꞌa inoh leh deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa koꞌis.
pairs.target: He said, “That which proceeds out of the man, that defiles the man.

pairs.source: Dop-e soꞌ aang otin nyaꞌa timul pikil deꞌ jaꞌat, idip kodaꞌ sowon duoh bonon pak-e aluaꞌ diꞌ-e kawin, noku, ngabos,
pairs.target: For from within, out of the hearts of men, proceed evil thoughts, adulteries, sexual sins, murders, thefts,

pairs.source: biamai, suaꞌ oniꞌ yoh yaꞌ kakuꞌ-e, suka nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat, nipu, idip nunaꞌ kila odop-e deꞌ jaꞌat, siniaꞌ, suka pijaꞌat nyaꞌa, samuh, liꞌiang bak-e.
pairs.target: covetings, wickedness, deceit, lustful desires, an evil eye, blasphemy, pride, and foolishness.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat inoh luah soꞌ aang otin nyaꞌa duoh kaꞌis odop-e.”
pairs.target: All these evil things come from within, and defile the man.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ buu soꞌ topat inoh yohmoꞌ odi keꞌ topat deꞌ sinok kota Tirus.  Iyoh molot kaang boli saꞌ-e doiꞌ nyaꞌa puꞌan-E.  Pak-e Yoh diꞌ-e ponai yaꞌ suan odop-E.
pairs.target: From there he arose, and went away into the borders of Tyre and Sidon. He entered into a house, and didn’t want anyone to know it, but he couldn’t escape notice.

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ sinoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ onak dayung-e obuah bikalui muat munua.  Takal yoh moꞌ ngojit tentang Yesus, yoh moꞌ lasuꞌ nog tuduꞌ-E yoh moꞌ bonal-bonal mitiaꞌ masiꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: For a woman, whose little daughter had an unclean spirit, having heard of him, came and fell down at his feet.

pairs.source: Iyoh mitiaꞌ tulung tuduꞌ Yesus odaꞌ kasig muat munua soꞌ gonan onak-e.  Dayung inoh diꞌ-e ulang Yahudi.  Iyoh soꞌ Fenisia deꞌ propinsi Siria.
pairs.target: Now the woman was a Greek, a Syrophoenician by race. She begged him that he would cast the demon out of her daughter.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Onak opot leh deꞌ dioꞌ nyeꞌ maꞌan-e, dop-e diꞌ-e patut pinguman deꞌ yaꞌ ngin nyeꞌ tuduꞌ onak opot, nyeꞌ ngin deꞌ kosuang.”
pairs.target: But Jesus said to her, “Let the children be filled first, for it is not appropriate to take the children’s bread and throw it to the dogs.”

pairs.source: Pak-e dayung inoh moꞌ nyawot-E, “Tok bonal oniꞌ deꞌ nang Ingan, pak-e kosuang man-e geh puluh pinguman deꞌ luluh soꞌ tun mija.”
pairs.target: But she answered him, “Yes, Lord. Yet even the dogs under the table eat the children’s crumbs.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot dayung inoh, “Dop-e muꞌu moꞌ nyawot in inoh, paliꞌ negeh.  Onak muꞌ moh moꞌ buu muat munua soꞌ gonan-e.”
pairs.target: He said to her, “For this saying, go your way. The demon has gone out of your daughter.”

pairs.source: Dayung inoh moꞌ buu.  Nog boli-e, yoh moꞌ ningaꞌ onak-e guling deꞌ topat boꞌos, dop-e muat munua moꞌ buu soꞌ gonan-e.
pairs.target: She went away to her house, and found the child having been laid on the bed, with the demon gone out.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ buu soꞌ topat deꞌ sinok kota Tirus, odi keꞌ donu Galilea ngilusuꞌ kota Sidon.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ponu keꞌ topat deꞌ nang nyaꞌa geh Simoong Kota.
pairs.target: Again he departed from the borders of Tyre and Sidon, and came to the sea of Galilee, through the middle of the region of Decapolis.

pairs.source: Takal-e danoꞌ, kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa toban tuduꞌ Yesus niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ bongam daang-e bebeꞌ.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bonal-bonal mitiaꞌ odaꞌ Yesus tomaꞌ-e saꞌ iyoh mokuaꞌ.
pairs.target: They brought to him one who was deaf and had an impediment in his speech. They begged him to lay his hand on him.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ toban nyaꞌa inoh buu soꞌ uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ, duam odop-e duwoh jaꞌ-e.  Yesus moꞌ tiluak pakai tilinyuꞌ-E soꞌ duwoh lubang kojit nyaꞌa inoh.  Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ ngujaꞌ deꞌ lupaꞌ tongan odop-E duoh gasak loyang-E deꞌ jolaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bebeꞌ inoh.
pairs.target: He took him aside from the multitude, privately, and put his fingers into his ears, and he spat, and touched his tongue.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ bigalong keꞌ longit daang-e nalik asong-E, yohmoꞌ sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa inoh, “Efata,” loti-e, “Tibukaꞌ mey!”
pairs.target: Looking up to heaven, he sighed, and said to him, “Ephphatha!”  that is, “Be opened!”

pairs.source: Takal inoh geh yoh moꞌ lasuꞌ ponai ngojit, jolaꞌ-e moꞌ lasuꞌ dodot yoh moꞌ lasuꞌ ponai sina.
pairs.target: Immediately his ears were opened, and the impediment of his tongue was released, and he spoke clearly.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ sibaya tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ jaman kilakal tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon.  Pak-e makin Yesus jaman-e, makin nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ silita katiꞌ kanih.
