pairs.target: He commanded them that they should tell no one, but the more he commanded them, so much the more widely they proclaimed it.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit gah inoh moꞌ ilan-e.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e, “Paguh manah suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai-E.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ bongam ponai ngojit, duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bebeꞌ ponai sina.”
pairs.target: They were astonished beyond measure, saying, “He has done all things well. He makes even the deaf hear, and the mute speak!”

pairs.source: Kudu-kudu onu mokuaꞌ inoh, ogiꞌ bilibu nyaꞌa nog baꞌuh tuduꞌ Yesus.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ doiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ man-e.  Yesus moꞌ mogan pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E yohmoꞌ in-e,
pairs.target: In those days, when there was a very great multitude, and they had nothing to eat, Jesus called his disciples to himself, and said to them,

pairs.source: “Masiꞌ nyam Kuꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ itih neh.  Moꞌ taluh onu yoh bitunaꞌ duoh Okuꞌ, moꞌ doiꞌ oni-oni deꞌ yaꞌ man-e tiyaꞌ.
pairs.target: “I have compassion on the multitude, because they have stayed with me now three days, and have nothing to eat.

pairs.source: Simoꞌ Kuꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ mutiꞌ paliꞌ toban toꞌin-e deꞌ pilai, jak-e ogiꞌ deꞌ pisan deꞌ olan, dop-e ogiꞌ odop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ deꞌ nog soꞌ juuaꞌ.”
pairs.target: If I send them away fasting to their home, they will faint on the way, for some of them have come a long way.”

pairs.source: Pak-e pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-e moꞌ nyawot-e, “Daki soꞌ toꞌ yaꞌ kalik pinguman deꞌ sukup saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ kiang-kiang itih? Topat itih juuaꞌ soꞌ kupuaꞌ soꞌ nyeꞌ yaꞌ milih pinguman.”
pairs.target: His disciples answered him, “From where could one satisfy these people with bread here in a deserted place?”

pairs.source: In Yesus sikian tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Oni kiang kueh deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ ingan?” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-e, “Ogiꞌ juꞌ kiping kueh.”
pairs.target: He asked them, “How many loaves do you have?” They said, “Seven.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ odaꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ guluꞌ deꞌ tanaꞌ.  Yesus moꞌ mit kueh deꞌ juꞌ kiping inoh, yohmoꞌ bisukul tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.  Yoh moꞌ nyipiak-nyipiak kueh inoh, yohmoꞌ ngin tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E odaꞌ bikutung tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa.
pairs.target: He commanded the multitude to sit down on the ground, and he took the seven loaves. Having given thanks, he broke them, and gave them to his disciples to serve, and they served the multitude.

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ geh kudu-kudu polong ikian deꞌ toban odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.  Yesus moꞌ mit ikian yohmoꞌ bisukul tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, Yoh moꞌ ngin tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E odaꞌ bikutung tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa.
pairs.target: They had a few small fish. Having blessed them, he said to serve these also.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa man nog busuah-e.  Mokuaꞌ inoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ nguluk kuban nyaꞌa man-e, aluaꞌ ogiꞌ duam juꞌ bakul.
pairs.target: They ate, and were filled. They took up seven baskets of broken pieces that were left over.

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ man inoh ogiꞌ kulang lobih pat libu naꞌan.  Mokuaꞌ man, Yesus moꞌ odaꞌ buu paliꞌ.
pairs.target: Those who had eaten were about four thousand. Then he sent them away.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E lasuꞌ muat daang olud, yohmoꞌ odi keꞌ Dalmanuta.
pairs.target: Immediately he entered into the boat with his disciples, and came into the region of Dalmanutha.

pairs.source: Kudu-kudu ulang Yahudi soꞌ uluk ulang Farisi nog bikalah duoh Yesus, odaꞌ Yesus bitanga kuasa-E nai oniꞌ deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa, deꞌ jadin tanda nang Iyoh tok obuah pait soꞌ Topaꞌ, saꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ dapod kalik wat olan ngan-e nyalah Yesus.
pairs.target: The Pharisees came out and began to question him, seeking from him a sign from heaven, and testing him.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nalik asong-E omu-omu-e daang in-e, “Aah, oni nai nyaꞌa joman deꞌ adin bigaꞌan mitiaꞌ tanda? Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Idoh diꞌ Kuꞌ bitanga kuasa nai oniꞌ deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa tuduꞌ ingan neh!”
pairs.target: He sighed deeply in his spirit, and said, “Why does this generation  seek a sign? Most certainly I tell you, no sign will be given to this generation.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ buu togan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ odi keꞌ polad donu inoh.
pairs.target: He left them, and again entering into the boat, departed to the other side.

pairs.source: Pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus komut toban kueh, jok-e ogiꞌ niꞌ kiping kueh daang olud.
pairs.target: They forgot to take bread; and they didn’t have more than one loaf in the boat with them.

pairs.source: Takal-e daang olud, Yesus sibaya tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, in-E, “Maꞌ tauꞌ-tauꞌ duoh ragi ulang Yahudi soꞌ uluk ulang Farisi duoh ragi Laja Herodes.”
pairs.target: He warned them, saying, “Take heed: beware of the yeast of the Pharisees and the yeast of Herod.”

pairs.source: Pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus moꞌ bolipotak si odop-e in-e, “Yoh sina in inoh saai otoꞌ diꞌ toꞌ toban kueh, yoh ngan-e in inoh.”
pairs.target: They reasoned with one another, saying, “It’s because we have no bread.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ puꞌan oniꞌ deꞌ sobot odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, Iyoh moꞌ in-e, “Maꞌ bigaduh nang doiꞌ kueh deꞌ toban toꞌ! Idoh diꞌ-e wat inoh wat-e oniꞌ deꞌ nang Kuꞌ! Madod manah pikil ingan ngan diꞌ ingan dapod ngiloti!
pairs.target: Jesus, perceiving it, said to them, “Why do you reason that it’s because you have no bread? Don’t you perceive yet, neither understand? Is your heart still hardened?

pairs.source: Boton ingan ogiꞌ, pak-e ingan kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ.  Kojit ingan ogiꞌ geh, pak-e ingan kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bongam.  Podo idoh diꞌ ingan natong-e,
pairs.target: Having eyes, don’t you see? Having ears, don’t you hear? Don’t you remember?

pairs.source: takal Okuꞌ nyipiak limoh kiping kueh saꞌan limoh libu naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ man, duam kudu kuban-e?” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nyawot-e, “Duam simoong duwoh bakul.”
pairs.target: When I broke the five loaves among the five thousand, how many baskets full of broken pieces did you take up?” They told him, “Twelve.”

pairs.source: “Takal juꞌ kiping kueh saꞌan pat libu naꞌan nyaꞌa, duam kudu kuban-e?” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-e, “Duam juꞌ bakul punuaꞌ.”
pairs.target: “When the seven loaves fed the four thousand, how many baskets full of broken pieces did you take up?” They told him, “Seven.”

pairs.source: Yoh moꞌ in-e lagi tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Podo aluaꞌ geh diꞌ ingan ngiloti-e?”
pairs.target: He asked them, “Don’t you understand yet?”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E nog keꞌ kota Betsaida, kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa toban ulang deꞌ butaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus.  Yohmoꞌ mitiaꞌ masiꞌ odaꞌ Yesus tomaꞌ ulang deꞌ butaꞌ inoh saꞌ-e tapod ningaꞌ.
pairs.target: He came to Bethsaida. They brought a blind man to him, and begged him to touch him.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ kagong tongan-e, yohmoꞌ kayak toban luah soꞌ kota inoh.  Yesus moꞌ ngujaꞌ duoh tomaꞌ soꞌ duwoh boton nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ inoh.  Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ-e, “Podo muꞌu moꞌ ponai kilin oniꞌ?”
pairs.target: He took hold of the blind man by the hand, and brought him out of the village. When he had spat on his eyes, and laid his hands on him, he asked him if he saw anything.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ inoh moꞌ ningaꞌ keꞌ jowin, yohmoꞌ in-e, “Okuꞌ moꞌ ponai ningaꞌ nyaꞌa ponu, pak-e mun sibamia tongon koyuh mun-e.”
pairs.target: He looked up, and said, “I see men; for I see them like trees walking.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ tomaꞌ baꞌuh boton nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ inoh.  Mokuaꞌ inoh ke yoh moꞌ tapod ningaꞌ sukup telang-e, dop-e boton-e moꞌ paguh.
pairs.target: Then again he laid his hands on his eyes. He looked intently, and was restored, and saw everyone clearly.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ odaꞌ iyoh paliꞌ keꞌ boli-e, Iyoh moꞌ in-e, “Maꞌ yaꞌ nosaꞌ keꞌ kota Betsaida.”
pairs.target: He sent him away to his house, saying, “Don’t enter into the village, nor tell anyone in the village.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E odi keꞌ kupuaꞌ-kupuaꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ sinok kota Kaisarea Filipi.  Takal-e aluaꞌ daang pimonu-e Yesus sikian tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, in-E, “Moꞌ-e nunaꞌ deꞌ sobot nyaꞌa, osi Okuꞌ tih?”
pairs.target: Jesus went out, with his disciples, into the villages of Caesarea Philippi. On the way he asked his disciples, “Who do men say that I am?”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-e, “Ogiꞌ nyaꞌa nang Yohanes Pembaptis, ogiꞌ geh nyaꞌa nang nabi Elia, ogiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ nang Ingan nabi deꞌ bokon.”
pairs.target: They told him, “John the Baptizer, and others say Elijah, but others: one of the prophets.”

pairs.source: Pak-e Yesus sikian tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ lagiꞌ, “Moꞌ-e nunaꞌ pikil ingan osi odop-e Okuꞌ itih?” Petrus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Ingan leh Laja Pinyilamat deꞌ pait Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: He said to them, “But who do you say that I am?” Peter answered, “You are the Christ.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ sibaya tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E jaman tanon tuduꞌ osi sijaꞌ-e, nang odop-E inoh leh Laja Pinyilamat.
pairs.target: He commanded them that they should tell no one about him.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ tanon tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E nang odop-E Onak Manusia deꞌ halus idip susah jolaꞌ.  Iyoh obuah netang odaꞌ pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi, pimipin-pimipin agama deꞌ ayuh, duoh gulu-gulu agama.  Odop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ leh deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa ngabos Onak Manusia inoh, pak-e takal mokuaꞌ taluh onu Onak manusia paliꞌ mokat idip.
pairs.target: He began to teach them that the Son of Man must suffer many things, and be rejected by the elders, the chief priests, and the scribes, and be killed, and after three days rise again.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ telang-telang tanon suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ obuah odop-E.  Pak-e Petrus moꞌ toban Yesus keꞌ tuak tanaꞌ yoh moꞌ jaman nang sina deꞌ in inoh.
pairs.target: He spoke to them openly. Peter took him, and began to rebuke him.

pairs.source: Pak-e Yesus moꞌ kos odop-e ningaꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E deꞌ bokon.  Iyoh moꞌ ngalah Petrus daang-e in-e, “Buu muꞌu Laja Muat munua! Muꞌu diꞌ muꞌ piduli oniꞌ deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ, muꞌu jok muꞌ piduli oniꞌ deꞌ laꞌan manusia.”
pairs.target: But he, turning around, and seeing his disciples, rebuked Peter, and said, “Get behind me, Satan! For you have in mind not the things of God, but the things of men.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ mogan pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ.  Yoh moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ yaꞌ nunaꞌ Okuꞌ, iyoh halus lawan kila-e, siap idip jolaꞌ kodaꞌ Okuꞌ, yohmoꞌ nah-nah nunaꞌ Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: He called the multitude to himself with his disciples, and said to them, “Whoever wants to come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross, and follow me.

pairs.source: Dop-e osi deꞌ ngibalaꞌ asong-e iyoh diꞌ-e soꞌon idip soꞌ Topaꞌ.  Pak-e osi deꞌ tumut asong-e ngan-e nunaꞌ Okuꞌ duoh magah Gah deꞌ Paguh, iyoh deꞌ soꞌon idip deꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: For whoever wants to save his life will lose it; and whoever will lose his life for my sake and the sake of the Good News will save it.

pairs.source: Nai oni ingan kakuꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ daang dunia, pak-e diꞌ ingan soꞌon idip deꞌ baꞌuh duoh Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: For what does it profit a man, to gain the whole world, and forfeit his life?

pairs.source: Dop-e doiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ dunia itih deꞌ tapod ngan ingan yaꞌ milih idip deꞌ baꞌuh duoh Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: For what will a man give in exchange for his life?

pairs.source: Dop-e osi deꞌ dasaꞌ ngakuꞌ Okuꞌ duoh oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal kuꞌ deꞌ uun manusia deꞌ suka nai dosa duoh diꞌ-e taat tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, Okuꞌ, Onak Manusia tuang dasaꞌ geh ngakuꞌ iyoh, takal Kuꞌ nog daang kuasa Samaꞌ Kuꞌ baya ayua malaikat soꞌ Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: For whoever will be ashamed of me and of my words in this adulterous and sinful generation, the Son of Man also will be ashamed of him, when he comes in his Father’s glory, with the holy angels.”

pairs.source: Yesus tanon lagiꞌ tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Ogiꞌ soꞌ ingan deꞌ mutiꞌ deꞌ aluaꞌ totap idip nog Topaꞌ bitanga odop-E jadin Laja deꞌ punuaꞌ kuasa-E.”
pairs.target: He said to them, “Most certainly I tell you, there are some standing here who will in no way taste death until they see God’s Kingdom come with power.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ nuam onu, Yesus toban Petrus, Yakobus duoh Yohanes maꞌad keꞌ tun dolod deꞌ bigatung saꞌ-e juuaꞌ soꞌ nyaꞌa.  Takal-e moꞌ deꞌ tun dolod Yesus moꞌ bilubah jawaꞌ jowin-E.
pairs.target: After six days Jesus took with him Peter, James, and John, and brought them up onto a high mountain privately by themselves, and he was changed into another form in front of them.

pairs.source: Pimakai-E moꞌ jadin mopuꞌ bikilap.  Doiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ daang dunia itih deꞌ tapod mamiaꞌ pimakai-e odaꞌ mopuꞌ mun inoh.
pairs.target: His clothing became glistening, exceedingly white, like snow, such as no launderer on earth can whiten them.

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ taluh moꞌ ningaꞌ nabi Elia duoh nabi Musa sina duoh Yesus.
pairs.target: Elijah and Moses appeared to them, and they were talking with Jesus.

pairs.source: Petrus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Yesus, “Gulu, tok-tok nyam doon-e koꞌih deꞌ topat itih neh.  Oni wat-e moꞌ koꞌih nai taluh galang, niꞌ saꞌan Ingan, niꞌ saꞌan Musa, niꞌ saꞌan Elia.”
pairs.target: Peter answered Jesus, “Rabbi, it is good for us to be here. Let’s make three tents: one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.”

pairs.source: Petrus nang sina deꞌ in inoh, iyoh diꞌ-e puꞌan oni deꞌ yaꞌ nang-e, dop-e yoh sukup tolu-e.
pairs.target: For he didn’t know what to say, for they were very afraid.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh abun moꞌ muun deꞌ tun odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.  Yoh moꞌ ngojit sina soꞌ aang abun inoh deꞌ in-e, “Itihleh Onak Kuꞌ deꞌ sukup Kuꞌ ngibalaꞌ, ngojit leh oniꞌ deꞌ tanon-E.”
pairs.target: A cloud came, overshadowing them, and a voice came out of the cloud, “This is my beloved Son. Listen to him.”

pairs.source: Tang-tang takal odop-e deꞌ taluh kumiat katiꞌ kanih, doiꞌ-e nak ogiꞌ osi-osi danoꞌ, jok-e ogiꞌ Yesus sijaꞌ-e.
pairs.target: Suddenly looking around, they saw no one with them any more, except Jesus only.

pairs.source: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ muun soꞌ tun dolod, Yesus sibaya tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ saꞌ-e diꞌ-e silita duoh osi-osi-e oniꞌ deꞌ ningaꞌ-e, nog Onak Manusia paliꞌ idip lagiꞌ.
pairs.target: As they were coming down from the mountain, he commanded them that they should tell no one what things they had seen, until after the Son of Man had risen from the dead.

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ taluh inoh moꞌ nyikon sibaya inoh daang otin-e, pak-e odop-e deꞌ taluh mulai kilakal oni loti oniꞌ deꞌ nang-E, “Paliꞌ idip lagiꞌ.”
pairs.target: They kept this saying to themselves, questioning what the “rising from the dead” meant.

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Yesus, “Oni nai gulu-gulu agama Yahudi nang Elia yaꞌ dioꞌ nog?”
pairs.target: They asked him, saying, “Why do the scribes say that Elijah must come first?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Elia tok dioꞌ nog, nai suaꞌ oniꞌ odaꞌ paliꞌ paguh.  Pak-e oni nai-e ogiꞌ sina daang Kitab deꞌ nang Onak Manusia yaꞌ susah jolaꞌ duoh obuah nulak?
pairs.target: He said to them, “Elijah indeed comes first, and restores all things. How is it written about the Son of Man, that he should suffer many things and be despised?

pairs.source: Pak-e Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Elia moꞌ bilasa nog, nyaꞌa moꞌ adoh-adoh wat-e duoh-e samah kodaꞌ daang Kitab.”
pairs.target: But I tell you that Elijah has come, and they have also done to him whatever they wanted to, even as it is written about him.”

pairs.source: Takal Yesus, Petrus, Yakobus duoh Yohanes muun soꞌ dolod, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa ngubun pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus deꞌ bokon.  Ogiꞌ geh kudu-kudu naꞌan gulu agama Yahudi deꞌ bikalah duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: Coming to the disciples, he saw a great multitude around them, and scribes questioning them.

pairs.source: Takal nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ inoh ningaꞌ Yesus yoh moꞌ sukup nyam-e ilan-e, yoh moꞌ bikoduh odi ngumaꞌ-E.
pairs.target: Immediately all the multitude, when they saw him, were greatly amazed, and running to him, greeted him.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ bisikian tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Oni deꞌ bikalah ingan duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ?”
pairs.target: He asked the scribes, “What are you asking them?”

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ uluk odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-E, “Gulu, okuꞌ toban onak kuꞌ tuduꞌ Ingan.  Iyoh obuah nguasa muat munua deꞌ odaꞌ yoh bebeꞌ.
pairs.target: One of the multitude answered, “Teacher, I brought to you my son, who has a mute spirit;

pairs.source: Asal muat munua nyelang gonan-e, yoh moꞌ paan-paan gonan-e keꞌ tanaꞌ, loyang-e bijulak luah soꞌ bobaꞌ-e, daang jipon-e obuaꞌ bitatuak, gonan-e moꞌ nisuk.  Okuꞌ mitiaꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Ingan odaꞌ kasig muat munua inoh, pak-e diꞌ-e taan kasig-e.”
pairs.target: and wherever it seizes him, it throws him down, and he foams at the mouth, and grinds his teeth, and wastes away. I asked your disciples to cast it out, and they weren’t able.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Ingan deꞌ mutiꞌ tok-tok diꞌ ingan bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ! Oni tian Kuꞌ yaꞌ loꞌo duoh sabal tuduꞌ ingan? Toban onak dali inoh katiꞌ!”
pairs.target: He answered him, “Unbelieving generation, how long shall I be with you? How long shall I bear with you? Bring him to me.”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ toban onak dali inoh tuduꞌ Yesus.  Takal muat munua inoh moꞌ ningaꞌ Yesus, yoh moꞌ lasuꞌ odaꞌ gonan onak dali inoh nisuk.  Onak dali inoh moꞌ lasuꞌ tumang bigulai-gulai deꞌ tanaꞌ daang loyang-e bijulak luah soꞌ bobaꞌ-e.
pairs.target: They brought him to him, and when he saw him, immediately the spirit convulsed him, and he fell on the ground, wallowing and foaming at the mouth.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ samaꞌ onak dali inoh, “Moꞌ oni tian-e yoh obuah oniꞌ deꞌ wat itih?” Samaꞌ-e moꞌ nyawot-e, “Soꞌ isoꞌ-e geh.
pairs.target: He asked his father, “How long has it been since this has come to him?” He said, “From childhood.

pairs.source: Moꞌ bogoꞌ sidoh-e muat munua yaꞌ ngabos-e, odaꞌ tolan odop-e kaang opui, duoh odaꞌ tolan odop-e kaang piꞌin.  Simoꞌ Ingan tapod odaꞌ onak dali itih mokuaꞌ, Ingan masiꞌ leh, duoh Ingan tulung leh koꞌih.”
pairs.target: Often it has cast him both into the fire and into the water, to destroy him. But if you can do anything, have compassion on us, and help us.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ-e, “Oni nai muꞌ sina: ‘Simoꞌ Ingan tapod?’ Doiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ-e tapod saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ.”
pairs.target: Jesus said to him, “If you can believe, all things are possible to him who believes.”

pairs.source: Samaꞌ onak dali inoh moꞌ lasuꞌ nang sina-e dolas-dolas, “Okuꞌ bisayaꞌ! Pak-e aluaꞌ kulang.  Tulung leh odaꞌ okuꞌ bisayaꞌ lobih lagiꞌ!”
pairs.target: Immediately the father of the child cried out with tears, “I believe. Help my unbelief!”

pairs.source: Takal Yesus ningaꞌ makin bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nog bikubun, Yesus moꞌ nyingak muat munua inoh daang-E sina duoh-e, “Buu! Muat deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa itih bongam duoh bebeꞌ! Okuꞌ odaꞌ muꞌu luah soꞌ onak dali itih duoh maꞌ tiyaꞌ paliꞌ nguasa onak dali itih!”
pairs.target: When Jesus saw that a multitude came running together, he rebuked the unclean spirit, saying to him, “You mute and deaf spirit, I command you, come out of him, and never enter him again!”

pairs.source: Muat munua inoh moꞌ nang bogan-e, yoh moꞌ odaꞌ suaꞌ gonan onak dali inoh nisuk.  Mokuaꞌ inoh muat munua moꞌ lasuꞌ buu luah soꞌ gonan onak dali inoh.  Onak dali inoh moꞌ mun nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ kobos mun-e, iyoh leh ngan nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ moꞌ in-e, “Iyoh moꞌ kobos.”
pairs.target: After crying out and convulsing him greatly, it came out of him. The boy became like one dead; so much that most of them said, “He is dead.”

pairs.source: Pak-e Yesus moꞌ kagian tongan-e, Yoh moꞌ tulung odaꞌ mokat.  Onak dali inoh moꞌ lasuꞌ mokat.
pairs.target: But Jesus took him by the hand, and raised him up; and he arose.

pairs.source: Takal Yesus moꞌ daang boli, duam Yoh duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sikian, in-e, “Oni nai koꞌih diꞌ taan odaꞌ muat munua inoh buu soꞌ onak dali inoh?”
pairs.target: When he had come into the house, his disciples asked him privately, “Why couldn’t we cast it out?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Muat munua deꞌ basa inoh jok toꞌ tapod kasig pakai bidoa.”
pairs.target: He said to them, “This kind can come out by nothing, except by prayer and fasting.”

pairs.source: Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ buu togan topat inoh ngilusuꞌ Galilea.  Yoh doliaꞌ-e odaꞌ nyaꞌa puꞌan soꞌ-e loꞌo,
pairs.target: They went out from there, and passed through Galilee. He didn’t want anyone to know it.

pairs.source: dop-e Yoh yaꞌ ngajal pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E jaꞌ-e.  Yoh moꞌ in-e, “Onak Manusia yaꞌ obuah nyelah tuduꞌ ulang-ulang deꞌ jaꞌat, yoh moꞌ ngabos-e, pak-e mokuaꞌ taluh onu Yoh paliꞌ mokat idip.”
pairs.target: For he was teaching his disciples, and said to them, “The Son of Man is being handed over to the hands of men, and they will kill him; and when he is killed, on the third day he will rise again.”

pairs.source: Pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E diꞌ-e ngiloti oni loti sina deꞌ nang Yesus inoh, pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tolu yaꞌ sikian-e.
pairs.target: But they didn’t understand the saying, and were afraid to ask him.

pairs.source: Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ nog keꞌ Kapernaum.  Takal-e moꞌ nog kaang boli, Yesus moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, “Oni deꞌ kilakal ingan daang olan tiꞌ-e?”
pairs.target: He came to Capernaum, and when he was in the house he asked them, “What were you arguing among yourselves on the way?”

pairs.source: Pak-e suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ doiꞌ deꞌ nyawot, dop-e daang olan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bikalah osi deꞌ paling ayuh soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: But they were silent, for they had disputed one with another on the way about who was the greatest.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ guluꞌ, yohmoꞌ mogan soꞌ simoong duwoh pinunaꞌ-E deꞌ sobot-E nang rasul.  Yoh moꞌ in-e, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ laꞌan jadin nomol niꞌ, yoh mesti jadin deꞌ paling piobuaꞌ-e duoh jadin kuli nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ.”
pairs.target: He sat down, and called the twelve; and he said to them, “If any man wants to be first, he shall be last of all, and servant of all.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ mit onak opot deꞌ aluaꞌ isoꞌ, yohmoꞌ posan deꞌ uun odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, simadi-e pakuaꞌ onak opot inoh Yesus moꞌ in-e,
pairs.target: He took a little child, and set him in the middle of them. Taking him in his arms, he said to them,

pairs.source: “Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ nyamut onak opot kodaꞌ itih, ngan yoh bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, samah geh iyoh tilimaꞌ Okuꞌ.  Osi deꞌ tilimaꞌ Okuꞌ, yoh tilimaꞌ geh Topaꞌ deꞌ pait Okuꞌ.”
pairs.target: “Whoever receives one such little child in my name, receives me, and whoever receives me, doesn’t receive me, but him who sent me.”

pairs.source: Yohanes moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ Yesus, “Gulu, koꞌih ningaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e nunaꞌ otoꞌ kasig muat munua pakai adon Ingan.  Koꞌih moꞌ jaman-e, dop-e yoh diꞌ-e nunaꞌ otoꞌ.”
pairs.target: John said to him, “Teacher, we saw someone who doesn’t follow us casting out demons in your name; and we forbade him, because he doesn’t follow us.”

pairs.source: Pak-e Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Maꞌ yaꞌ jaman-e, dop-e niꞌ naꞌan tuang doiꞌ geh deꞌ tapod nai oniꞌ deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa pakai adon Okuꞌ, mokuaꞌ inoh yoh lasuꞌ pijaꞌat adon Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: But Jesus said, “Don’t forbid him, for there is no one who will do a mighty work in my name, and be able quickly to speak evil of me.

pairs.source: Osi deꞌ diꞌ-e netang otoꞌ, iyoh nuaꞌ otoꞌ.
pairs.target: For whoever is not against us is on our side.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ ngin nuak niꞌ sakil piꞌin tuduꞌ ingan, ngan ingan jadin pinunaꞌ Laja Pinyilamat, yoh totap soꞌon upah-e.”
pairs.target: For whoever will give you a cup of water to drink in my name, because you are Christ’s, most certainly I tell you, he will in no way lose his reward.

pairs.source: Yesus lanyut sina-e, “Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ odaꞌ niꞌ naꞌan onak opot diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, lobih paguh nyeꞌ gutan batuh deꞌ ayuh deꞌ baat deꞌ tunguaꞌ-e, nyeꞌ moꞌ tolan kaang laut.
pairs.target: Whoever will cause one of these little ones who believe in me to stumble, it would be better for him if he were thrown into the sea with a millstone hung around his neck.

pairs.source: Simoꞌ tongan muꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ muꞌu nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat, lobih paguh muꞌ kopog-e! Dop-e lobih paguh doiꞌ tongan muꞌ niꞌ kawa, pak-e idip deꞌ baꞌuh duoh Topaꞌ deꞌ siluga.  Nai oni ogiꞌ soꞌ duwoh tongan muꞌ, pak-e obuah tolan kaang neraka deꞌ opui-e diꞌ-e ponai pulaꞌ?
pairs.target: If your hand causes you to stumble, cut it off. It is better for you to enter into life maimed, rather than having your two hands to go into Gehenna,  into the unquenchable fire,

pairs.source: Deꞌ neraka olod-e diꞌ-e ponai kobos, opui-e diꞌ-e ponai pulaꞌ.
pairs.target: ‘where their worm doesn’t die, and the fire is not quenched.’

pairs.source: Simoꞌ poꞌon muꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ muꞌu nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat, lobih paguh muꞌ kopog-e, dop-e lobih paguh muꞌ bojang pak-e idip deꞌ baꞌuh duoh Topaꞌ.  Nai oni ogiꞌ soꞌ duwoh poꞌon muꞌ pak-e obuah tolan kaang neraka?
pairs.target: If your foot causes you to stumble, cut it off. It is better for you to enter into life lame, rather than having your two feet to be cast into Gehenna,  into the fire that will never be quenched—

pairs.source: Deꞌ neraka olod-e diꞌ-e ponai kobos, opui-e diꞌ-e ponai pulaꞌ.
pairs.target: ‘where their worm doesn’t die, and the fire is not quenched.’

pairs.source: Simoꞌ boton muꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ muꞌu nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat, tukiat kadi-e.  Lobih paguh muꞌu molot keꞌ siluga pakai boton niꞌ.  Nai oni ogiꞌ soꞌ duwoh boton muꞌ, pak-e obuah tolan kaang neraka?
pairs.target: If your eye causes you to stumble, cast it out. It is better for you to enter into God’s Kingdom with one eye, rather than having two eyes to be cast into the Gehenna of fire,

pairs.source: Deꞌ neraka olod-e diꞌ-e ponai kobos, opui-e diꞌ-e ponai pulaꞌ.
pairs.target: ‘where their worm doesn’t die, and the fire is not quenched.’

pairs.source: Dop-e suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nunaꞌ Topaꞌ yaꞌ obuah nguji pakai idip deꞌ susah jolaꞌ, samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa ngoon bongoh opui, samah geh kodaꞌ dagin deꞌ modiaꞌ nyaꞌa pakai galuaꞌ.
pairs.target: For everyone will be salted with fire, and every sacrifice will be seasoned with salt.

pairs.source: Galuaꞌ inoh paguh, pak-e simoꞌ-e doiꞌ sap pidiaꞌ-e, oni wat nyeꞌ odaꞌ pidiaꞌ baꞌuh? Odaꞌ leh idip ingan biguna saꞌan nyaꞌa, duoh silalu idip bidamai duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon.”
pairs.target: Salt is good, but if the salt has lost its saltiness, with what will you season it? Have salt in yourselves, and be at peace with one another.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ buu soꞌ kota Kapernaum, Iyoh moꞌ odi keꞌ propinsi Yudea duoh motas polad sungi Yordan.  Nyaꞌa moꞌ siuah-siuah nog tuduꞌ-E.  Iyoh moꞌ ngajal nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ kodaꞌ deꞌ silalu Iyoh nai-e.
pairs.target: He arose from there and came into the borders of Judea and beyond the Jordan. Multitudes came together to him again. As he usually did, he was again teaching them.

pairs.source: Kudu-kudu naꞌan ulang Yahudi soꞌ uluk ulang Farisi nog yaꞌ suba Yesus.  Yoh moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Yesus in-e, “Soꞌon yeh dali deꞌ moꞌ kawin posan sowon-e?”
pairs.target: Pharisees came to him testing him, and asked him, “Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife?”

pairs.source: Pak-e Yesus moꞌ nyawot odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Oni in sibaya nabi Musa noꞌuh-e tuduꞌ ingan?”
pairs.target: He answered, “What did Moses command you?”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-e, “Musa nang soꞌon nyaꞌa biposan, asal-e nai sulat biposan-e tuduꞌ sowon-e.”
pairs.target: They said, “Moses allowed a certificate of divorce to be written, and to divorce her.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Musa nai sibaya deꞌ in inoh dop-e ingan sikiya kolas yaꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ laꞌan odop ingan.
pairs.target: But Jesus said to them, “For your hardness of heart, he wrote you this commandment.

pairs.source: Pak-e sibungas-e Topaꞌ nai dunia itih, ‘Iyoh moꞌ nai niꞌ dali duoh niꞌ dayung.’
pairs.target: But from the beginning of the creation, God made them male and female.

pairs.source: ‘Iyoh leh ngan-e dali deꞌ kawin togan samaꞌ sinoꞌ-e, iyoh moꞌ tikuluk duoh sowon-e,
pairs.target: For this cause a man will leave his father and mother, and will join to his wife,

pairs.source: odop-e deꞌ duwoh moꞌ jadin niꞌ.’ Jadin, yoh diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ duwoh, pak-e niꞌ.
pairs.target: and the two will become one flesh, so that they are no longer two, but one flesh.

pairs.source: Iyoh leh ngan-e nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ nguluk Topaꞌ, diꞌ soꞌon yaꞌ biposan.”
pairs.target: What therefore God has joined together, let no man separate.”

pairs.source: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ daang boli, pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E paliꞌ sikian tentang nyaꞌa deꞌ biposan.
pairs.target: In the house, his disciples asked him again about the same matter.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ posan sowon-e, yohmoꞌ kawin baꞌuh duoh dayung deꞌ bokon, iyoh biamai.
pairs.target: He said to them, “Whoever divorces his wife, and marries another, commits adultery against her.

pairs.source: Wat noh geh dayung deꞌ posan bonon-e, iyoh moꞌ kawin duoh dali deꞌ bokon, iyoh tuang biamai geh.” Yesus duoh onak opot
pairs.target: If a woman herself divorces her husband, and marries another, she commits adultery.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa toban onak opot-e tuduꞌ Yesus, saꞌ Yesus tomaꞌ-e duoh blokat-e, pak-e pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus moꞌ malah tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: They were bringing to him little children, that he should touch them, but the disciples rebuked those who were bringing them.

pairs.source: Takal Yesus ningaꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E malah tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ, Yesus moꞌ malah tuduꞌ-e.  Iyoh moꞌ in-e, “Tanah saꞌ onak opot deꞌ munoꞌ odi tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.  Dop-e nyaꞌa deꞌ kodaꞌ onak opot deꞌ mutiꞌ leh deꞌ tilimaꞌ Topaꞌ militah daang idip-e.
pairs.target: But when Jesus saw it, he was moved with indignation, and said to them, “Allow the little children to come to me! Don’t forbid them, for God’s Kingdom belongs to such as these.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ diꞌ-e tilimaꞌ pilitah Topaꞌ kodaꞌ onak opot, iyoh diꞌ-e tapod jadin ayua umat Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: Most certainly I tell you, whoever will not receive God’s Kingdom like a little child, he will in no way enter into it.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ sina in inoh, Yesus moꞌ pakuaꞌ onak opot deꞌ munoꞌ yohmoꞌ tomaꞌ bak-e, daang-e blokat-e.
pairs.target: He took them in his arms, and blessed them, laying his hands on them.

pairs.source: Takal Yesus lanyut pimonu-E, ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan dali odi tuduꞌ Yesus.  Iyoh guluꞌ bikunyug yohmoꞌ in-e sikian tuduꞌ Yesus, “Gulu deꞌ paguh, oni deꞌ halus kuꞌ nai-e saꞌ kuꞌ soꞌon idip deꞌ baꞌuh duoh Topaꞌ takal kuꞌ moꞌ kobos?”
pairs.target: As he was going out into the way, one ran to him, knelt before him, and asked him, “Good Teacher, what shall I do that I may inherit eternal life?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Oni nai muꞌ nang Okuꞌ deꞌ paguh? Doiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ paguh, jok-e Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: Jesus said to him, “Why do you call me good? No one is good except one—God.

pairs.source: Muꞌu moꞌ puꞌan pilitah-pilitah Topaꞌ: Maꞌ ngabos nyaꞌa, maꞌ biamai, maꞌ noku, maꞌ jadin tukang tanon deꞌ pibulaꞌ, maꞌ ngakal-nipu nyaꞌa, pimodo leh duoh samaꞌ sinoꞌ muꞌ.”
pairs.target: You know the commandments: ‘Do not murder,’ ‘Do not commit adultery,’ ‘Do not steal,’ ‘Do not give false testimony,’ ‘Do not defraud,’ ‘Honor your father and mother.’”

pairs.source: Dali inoh moꞌ in-e, “Gulu, suaꞌ pilitah deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nai kuꞌ soꞌ isoꞌ kuꞌ geh.”
pairs.target: He said to him, “Teacher, I have observed all these things from my youth.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ ningaꞌ nyaꞌa inoh daang kila-E masiꞌ yohmoꞌ in-e, “Duam niꞌ deꞌ kulang deꞌ aluaꞌ diꞌ muꞌ nai-e.  Odi jua suaꞌ halta muꞌ nyeꞌ moꞌ bikutung duit-e duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ botak.  Mokuaꞌ inoh muꞌu moꞌ yaꞌ soꞌon halta deꞌ siluga.  Mokuaꞌ inoh paliꞌ katiꞌ nunaꞌ Okuꞌ.”
pairs.target: Jesus looking at him loved him, and said to him, “One thing you lack. Go, sell whatever you have, and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven; and come, follow me, taking up the cross.”

pairs.source: Takal-e ngojit sina Yesus deꞌ in inoh, yoh moꞌ nesal-e yohmoꞌ buu, dop-e iyoh bogoꞌ halta-e.
pairs.target: But his face fell at that saying, and he went away sorrowful, for he was one who had great possessions.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ ningaꞌ tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, Iyoh moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ-e, “Susah manah nyaꞌa deꞌ kaya yaꞌ jadin ayua umat Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: Jesus looked around, and said to his disciples, “How difficult it is for those who have riches to enter into God’s Kingdom!”

pairs.source: Pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E ilan ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ nang-E.  Pak-e Yesus moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ, “Onak-onak Kuꞌ, sukup susah-e nyaꞌa yaꞌ jadin ayua umat Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: The disciples were amazed at his words. But Jesus answered again, “Children, how hard is it for those who trust in riches to enter into God’s Kingdom!

pairs.source: Sonang dooꞌ unta molot kaang lubang tuas soꞌ ulang deꞌ kaya yaꞌ jadin ayua umat Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: It is easier for a camel to go through a needle’s eye than for a rich man to enter into God’s Kingdom.”

pairs.source: Pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E makin ilan-e, daang-e bisikian si odop-e, “Simoꞌ-e wat inoh osi deꞌ tapod silamat?”
pairs.target: They were exceedingly astonished, saying to him, “Then who can be saved?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ ningaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ daang-e in-e, “Manusia diꞌ-e tapod nyilamat odop-e, pak-e Topaꞌ tapod nyilamat manusia.  Doiꞌ deꞌ diꞌ Topaꞌ tapod nai-e.”
pairs.target: Jesus, looking at them, said, “With men it is impossible, but not with God, for all things are possible with God.”

pairs.source: Petrus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ Yesus, “Koꞌih moꞌ togan suaꞌ oniꞌ ngan koꞌih nunaꞌ Ingan.”
pairs.target: Peter began to tell him, “Behold, we have left all, and have followed you.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ muꞌu: Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ togan boli-e, atou madih ayua-e, atou pingoma-e, atou onak-e, atou umoh-e ngan-e nunaꞌ okuꞌ duoh magah Gah deꞌ Paguh,
pairs.target: Jesus said, “Most certainly I tell you, there is no one who has left house, or brothers, or sisters, or father, or mother, or wife, or children, or land, for my sake, and for the sake of the Good News,

pairs.source: daang idip-e deꞌ dunia itih geh yoh yaꞌ soꞌon silatus sidoh bogoꞌ boli-e, madih ayua-e, pingoma-e, onak-e duoh umoh-e, duoh susah jolaꞌ tuang ogiꞌ geh.  Pak-e tiaꞌ ijoꞌ deꞌ Dunia deꞌ Baꞌuh, iyoh yaꞌ soꞌon idip deꞌ baꞌuh duoh Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: but he will receive one hundred times more now in this time, houses, brothers, sisters, mothers, children, and land, with persecutions; and in the age to come eternal life.

pairs.source: Pak-e bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ dioꞌ adin yaꞌ ponai sunih, nyaꞌa deꞌ sunih adin yaꞌ ponai dioꞌ.”
pairs.target: But many who are first will be last; and the last first.”

pairs.source: Daang pimonu Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E nuju Yerusalem, Yesus ponu dioꞌ nuaꞌ jowin.  Suaꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E bigaduh duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon deꞌ suwaꞌ deꞌ nunaꞌ dug-e tuang tolu geh.  Mokuaꞌ inoh, Yesus ngijaꞌ lagiꞌ soꞌ simoong duwoh naꞌan pinunaꞌ-E odaꞌ odi okon soꞌ-o, saꞌ-e diꞌ-e sinok nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon.  Yesus moꞌ tanon tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ oni wat nyaꞌa yaꞌ duoh odop-E.
pairs.target: They were on the way, going up to Jerusalem; and Jesus was going in front of them, and they were amazed; and those who followed were afraid. He again took the twelve, and began to tell them the things that were going to happen to him.

pairs.source: Yoh moꞌ in-e, “Otoꞌ yaꞌ odi keꞌ Yerusalem, danih nyaꞌa yaꞌ nyelah Okuꞌ Onak Manusia tuduꞌ pimipin-pimipin agama deꞌ ayuh duoh gulu-gulu agama Yahudi.  Yoh moꞌ yaꞌ ngukum ngabos Okuꞌ.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ ngin tuduꞌ ulang deꞌ diꞌ-e ulang Yahudi.
pairs.target: “Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem. The Son of Man will be delivered to the chief priests and the scribes. They will condemn him to death, and will deliver him to the Gentiles.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ ngine Okuꞌ, yoh yaꞌ ngujaꞌ, pijolaꞌ, duoh ngabos Okuꞌ.  Pak-e mokuaꞌ taluh onu Okuꞌ yaꞌ paliꞌ idip.”
pairs.target: They will mock him, spit on him, scourge him, and kill him. On the third day he will rise again.”

pairs.source: Yakobus duoh Yohanes, onak-onak Zebedeus moꞌ odi sinok Yesus.  Yoh moꞌ in-e, “Gulu, ogiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ mitiaꞌ koꞌih tuduꞌ Ingan, odaꞌ Ingan nai-e.”
pairs.target: James and John, the sons of Zebedee, came near to him, saying, “Teacher, we want you to do for us whatever we will ask.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Oni deꞌ mitiaꞌ ingan odaꞌ Okuꞌ nai-e?”
pairs.target: He said to them, “What do you want me to do for you?”

pairs.source: Yoh moꞌ nyawot-e, “Takal Ingan militah jadin Laja deꞌ ayuh odaꞌ leh koꞌih guluꞌ, niꞌ naꞌan nuaꞌ toꞌuh, niꞌ naꞌan nuaꞌ boit Ingan.”
pairs.target: They said to him, “Grant to us that we may sit, one at your right hand, and one at your left hand, in your glory.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Ingan diꞌ ingan ngiloti oniꞌ deꞌ mitiaꞌ ingan.  Podo ingan moꞌ siap tilimaꞌ susah jolaꞌ kodaꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ obuah Okuꞌ? Podo ingan taan yaꞌ obuah pijolaꞌ kodaꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ obuah Okuꞌ?”
pairs.target: But Jesus said to them, “You don’t know what you are asking. Are you able to drink the cup that I drink, and to be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ duwoh moꞌ nyawot lagiꞌ, “Koꞌih taan.” Yesus moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ, “Tok ingan yaꞌ kiꞌan susah jolaꞌ duoh obuah pijolaꞌ samah kodaꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ obuah Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: They said to him, “We are able.” Jesus said to them, “You shall indeed drink the cup that I drink, and you shall be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with;

pairs.source: Pak-e Okuꞌ doiꞌ hak Kuꞌ, yaꞌ notap osi deꞌ guluꞌ nuaꞌ toꞌuh duoh osi deꞌ nuaꞌ boit Kuꞌ.  Inoh Topaꞌ sidia saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ nyok-E.”
pairs.target: but to sit at my right hand and at my left hand is not mine to give, but for whom it has been prepared.”

pairs.source: Takal simoong pinunaꞌ-E deꞌ bokon ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ mitiaꞌ odop-e deꞌ duwoh, yoh moꞌ malah tuduꞌ-e.
pairs.target: When the ten heard it, they began to be indignant towards James and John.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ mogan suaꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E yohmoꞌ in-e, “Pimipin-pimipin dunia militah layat-e pakai paksa duoh pijolaꞌ.
pairs.target: Jesus summoned them, and said to them, “You know that they who are recognized as rulers over the nations lord it over them, and their great ones exercise authority over them.

pairs.source: Pak-e ingan diꞌ soꞌon wat inoh! Osi deꞌ yaꞌ jadin pimipin deꞌ soꞌ ingan, iyoh halus jadin pilayan.
pairs.target: But it shall not be so among you, but whoever wants to become great among you shall be your servant.

pairs.source: Duoh osi deꞌ yaꞌ jadin ulang timogah, iyoh sidia jadin kuli saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon.
pairs.target: Whoever of you wants to become first among you, shall be bondservant of all.

pairs.source: Dop-e Onak Manusia nog idoh diꞌ-e odaꞌ nyaꞌa layan odop-E, pak-e Yoh yaꞌ layan duoh ngin asong-E ngan-e nyilamat nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ.”
pairs.target: For the Son of Man also came not to be served, but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.”

pairs.source: Yesus duoh suaꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ nog keꞌ Kota Yerikho.  Takal Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E buu luah soꞌ Kota inoh, nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ moꞌ siuah-siuah nunaꞌ-E.  Ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ deꞌ tukang mitiaꞌ-mitiaꞌ deꞌ guluꞌ deꞌ bingon olan deꞌ adon Bartimeus onak Timeus.
pairs.target: They came to Jericho. As he went out from Jericho, with his disciples and a great multitude, the son of Timaeus, Bartimaeus, a blind beggar, was sitting by the road.

pairs.source: Takal Bartimeus moꞌ ngojit nang Yesus deꞌ soꞌ Nazaret ponu ngilusuꞌ odop-e, iyoh moꞌ nang bogan-e mitiaꞌ masiꞌ, “Yesus onak sukun Laja Daud! Masiꞌ leh tuduꞌ okuꞌ!”
pairs.target: When he heard that it was Jesus the Nazarene, he began to cry out, and say, “Jesus, you son of David, have mercy on me!”

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ moꞌ malah daꞌ-a daang-e odaꞌ yoh loꞌo, pak-e yoh makin dolas nang bogan-e, “Yesus onak sukun Laja Daud! Masiꞌ leh tuduꞌ okuꞌ!”
pairs.target: Many rebuked him, that he should be quiet, but he cried out much more, “You son of David, have mercy on me!”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ loꞌo daang-e sina, “Mogan odaꞌ iyoh odi katiꞌ!” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ mogan nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ inoh simadi-e sina tuduꞌ-e, “Notod negeh kila muꞌ, mokat likas-e, Yesus mogan muꞌu!”
pairs.target: Jesus stood still, and said, “Call him.” They called the blind man, saying to him, “Cheer up! Get up. He is calling you!”

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ inoh moꞌ lasuꞌ bukaꞌ jubah-e, iyoh moꞌ lasuꞌ mujuag, iyoh moꞌ odi tuduꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: He, casting away his cloak, sprang up, and came to Jesus.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ-e, “Oni deꞌ mitiaꞌ ingan odaꞌ Okuꞌ nai-e?” Nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ inoh moꞌ nyawot-e, “Gulu, okuꞌ mitiaꞌ odaꞌ boton kuꞌ ponai ningaꞌ!”
pairs.target: Jesus asked him, “What do you want me to do for you?” The blind man said to him, “Rabboni, that I may see again.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, “Dop-e muꞌu bisayaꞌ, muꞌu mokuaꞌ.Paliꞌ leh.” Takal inoh geh yoh lasuꞌ ponai ningaꞌ.  Yoh moꞌ nunaꞌ Yesus daang pimonuꞌ-E.
pairs.target: Jesus said to him, “Go your way. Your faith has made you well.”  Immediately he received his sight, and followed Jesus on the way.

pairs.source: Takal Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ yaꞌ nog Yerusalem, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nog keꞌ kupuaꞌ Betfage duoh kupuaꞌ Betania.  Soꞌ duoh kupuaꞌ inoh ogiꞌ deꞌ tilipang Punguꞌ Zaitun.  Takal-e danoꞌ, Yesus odaꞌ duwoh naꞌan pinunaꞌ-E ponu dioꞌ.
pairs.target: When they came near to Jerusalem, to Bethsphage and Bethany, at the Mount of Olives, he sent two of his disciples,

pairs.source: Yoh moꞌ sibaya tuduꞌ-e in-E, “Odi leh keꞌ kupuaꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ nuaꞌ jowin toꞌ inoh.  Takal muꞌ molot kanoꞌ, muꞌu ningaꞌ ogiꞌ niꞌ polong keledai deꞌ aluaꞌ mudaꞌ deꞌ obuah mokos, deꞌ aluaꞌ doiꞌ nyaꞌa muat daꞌ-e.  Nyeꞌ moꞌ nukas-e, nyeꞌ moꞌ toban katiꞌ.
pairs.target: and said to them, “Go your way into the village that is opposite you. Immediately as you enter into it, you will find a young donkey tied, on which no one has sat. Untie him, and bring him.

pairs.source: Simoꞌ-e ogiꞌ nyaꞌa sikian-e, oni nai muꞌ mit keledai inoh? Nyeꞌ tanon tuduꞌ-e, ‘Gulu pilelu keledai itih, mokuaꞌ inoh Iyoh yaꞌ lasuꞌ paliꞌ-e.’ ”
pairs.target: If anyone asks you, ‘Why are you doing this?’ say, ‘The Lord needs him;’ and immediately he will send him back here.”

pairs.source: Soꞌ duwoh pinunaꞌ-e moꞌ odi.  Yoh moꞌ tapod ogiꞌ niꞌ polong onak keledai deꞌ mokos nyaꞌa deꞌ jowin boli-e sinok olan.  Odop-e deꞌ duwoh moꞌ nukas tolin-e.
pairs.target: They went away, and found a young donkey tied at the door outside in the open street, and they untied him.

pairs.source: Kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ mujuag sinok topat inoh moꞌ sikian-e, “Oni nai ingan nukas keledai inoh neh?”
pairs.target: Some of those who stood there asked them, “What are you doing, untying the young donkey?”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ duwoh moꞌ nyawot nunaꞌ deꞌ tanon Yesus tuduꞌ-e, yohmoꞌ nyaꞌa danoꞌ moꞌ tanah odaꞌ iyoh toban-e.
pairs.target: They said to them just as Jesus had said, and they let them go.

pairs.source: Iyoh moꞌ toban keledai inoh tuduꞌ Yesus.  Iyoh moꞌ nopas tun dug keledai inoh pakai jubah-e.  Yesus moꞌ nyikoh guluꞌ deꞌ tun-e.
pairs.target: They brought the young donkey to Jesus, and threw their garments on it, and Jesus sat on it.

pairs.source: Bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nopas olan deꞌ yaꞌ ngilusuꞌ Yesus pakai jubah-e.  Ogiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ nopas olan pakai dowon-dowon koyuh deꞌ mit-e soꞌ kobon-e.
pairs.target: Many spread their garments on the way, and others were cutting down branches from the trees, and spreading them on the road.

pairs.source: Ayua deꞌ nunaꞌ Yesus deꞌ nuaꞌ jowin duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ nunaꞌ nuaꞌ dug-e moꞌ nang bobaꞌ-e, “Mudi Topaꞌ deꞌ siluga! Obuah bilokat Iyoh deꞌ nog daang adon Topaꞌ!
pairs.target: Those who went in front, and those who followed, cried out, “Hosanna!  Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord!

pairs.source: Obuah bilokat leh Onak sukun Laja Daud itih, deꞌ yaꞌ militah otoꞌ odaꞌ paguh! Mudi leh Topaꞌ otoꞌ deꞌ siluga!”
pairs.target: Blessed is the kingdom of our father David that is coming in the name of the Lord! Hosanna in the highest!”

pairs.source: Takal Yesus nog keꞌ Yerusalem, Iyoh moꞌ molot keꞌ awah Boli Topaꞌ.  Iyoh ningaꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ awah Boli Topaꞌ inoh, dop-e onu moꞌ yaꞌ ngalom Iyoh duoh pinunaꞌ-E deꞌ simoong duwoh naꞌan moꞌ odi keꞌ kupuaꞌ Betania.
pairs.target: Jesus entered into the temple in Jerusalem. When he had looked around at everything, it being now evening, he went out to Bethany with the twelve.

pairs.source: Onu tiaꞌ pagi-e, takal Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E buu soꞌ Betania odi keꞌ Yerusalem, Yesus noman toꞌin-e pilai.
pairs.target: The next day, when they had come out from Bethany, he was hungry.

pairs.source: Soꞌ juuaꞌ Iyoh moꞌ ningaꞌ tongon ara deꞌ bidonom dowon-e.  Iyoh moꞌ odi keꞌ puꞌun-e, podo-podo-e ogiꞌ buaꞌ-e.  Pak-e takal Yesus moꞌ nog libuaꞌ-e Iyoh moꞌ ningaꞌ jok-e ogiꞌ dowon-e sijaꞌ-e, dop-e aluaꞌ diꞌ-e musim tongon ara inoh bibuaꞌ.
pairs.target: Seeing a fig tree afar off having leaves, he came to see if perhaps he might find anything on it. When he came to it, he found nothing but leaves, for it was not the season for figs.

pairs.source: Pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ ngojit Yesus sina in-e tuduꞌ tongon ara inoh, “Mulai soꞌ adin doiꞌ tiyaꞌ nyaꞌa yaꞌ man buaꞌ soꞌ tongon muꞌ!”
pairs.target: Jesus told it, “May no one ever eat fruit from you again!”  and his disciples heard it.

pairs.source: Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ nog keꞌ Yerusalem.  Iyoh moꞌ molot keꞌ awah Boli Topaꞌ, Iyoh moꞌ kasig nyaꞌa deꞌ bijua danoꞌ.  Yesus moꞌ ngibolui mija topat nyaꞌa nukal duit duoh mija topat nyaꞌa jua manuk asang.
pairs.target: They came to Jerusalem, and Jesus entered into the temple, and began to throw out those who sold and those who bought in the temple, and overthrew the money changers’ tables, and the seats of those who sold the doves.

pairs.source: Yoh moꞌ jaman osi sijaꞌ-e diꞌ soꞌon toban balang deꞌ yaꞌ jua-e ngilusuꞌ awah boli Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: He would not allow anyone to carry a container through the temple.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ ngajal nyaꞌa danoꞌ in-e, “Ogiꞌ deꞌ obuah nulis daang Kitab deꞌ in-e, ‘Boli kuꞌ nyaꞌa sobot nang   boli topat bidoa saꞌan suaꞌ bangsa.’ Pak-e ingan odaꞌ jadin topat pinoku bisukan.”
pairs.target: He taught, saying to them, “Isn’t it written, ‘My house will be called a house of prayer for all the nations?’ But you have made it a den of robbers!”

pairs.source: Ayua pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh duoh gulu-gulu agama Yahudi moꞌ ngojit sina Yesus inoh, yoh moꞌ kalik olan ngan-e yaꞌ ngabos Yesus.  Pak-e yoh tolu tuduꞌ Yesus dop-e bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ sonang duoh oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal Yesus.
pairs.target: The chief priests and the scribes heard it, and sought how they might destroy him. For they feared him, because all the multitude was astonished at his teaching.

pairs.source: Takal onu moꞌ yaꞌ ngalom Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E buu soꞌ kota inoh.
pairs.target: When evening came, he went out of the city.

pairs.source: Tiaꞌ pagi-e takal Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E ponu ngilusuꞌ tongon ara inoh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ tongon ara inoh moꞌ kobos pisok nog aat-e.
pairs.target: As they passed by in the morning, they saw the fig tree withered away from the roots.

pairs.source: Petrus moꞌ natong oniꞌ deꞌ nai Yesus sumia-e yoh moꞌ in-e, “Gulu, ningaꞌ mey tongon ara deꞌ obuah nyupah Ingan sumia-e moꞌ pisok.”
pairs.target: Peter, remembering, said to him, “Rabbi, look! The fig tree which you cursed has withered away.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Bisayaꞌ negeh tuduꞌ Topaꞌ!
pairs.target: Jesus answered them, “Have faith in God.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ sina tuduꞌ dolod itih, ‘Bilalih leh duoh obuah tolan kaang laut,’ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nang ingan inoh yaꞌ jadi, asal ingan diꞌ ingan bigaduh duoh totap bisayaꞌ nang oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ bonal-bonal jadi.
pairs.target: For most certainly I tell you, whoever may tell this mountain, ‘Be taken up and cast into the sea,’ and doesn’t doubt in his heart, but believes that what he says is happening; he shall have whatever he says.

pairs.source: Yoh ngan Kuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Oni sijaꞌ-e deꞌ mitiaꞌ muꞌ daang doa muꞌ, bisayaꞌ negeh nang muꞌu moꞌ soꞌon-e, muꞌu pasti yaꞌ soꞌon-e.
pairs.target: Therefore I tell you, all things whatever you pray and ask for, believe that you have received them, and you shall have them.

pairs.source: Siniaꞌ sijaꞌ-e takal muꞌu bidoa, simoꞌ muꞌ natong muꞌu ogiꞌ monam otin tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon, muꞌu halus ngapun dioꞌ salah-e, saꞌ Samaꞌ muꞌ deꞌ siluga ngapun-E geh muꞌu.
pairs.target: Whenever you stand praying, forgive, if you have anything against anyone; so that your Father, who is in heaven, may also forgive you your transgressions.

pairs.source: Pak-e simoꞌ muꞌ diꞌ ngapun salah nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon, Samaꞌ muꞌ deꞌ siluga tuang doliaꞌ-e geh ngapun dosa muꞌ.”
pairs.target: But if you do not forgive, neither will your Father in heaven forgive your transgressions.”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ odi lagiꞌ keꞌ Yerusalem.  Takal Yesus ponu-ponu deꞌ limang Boli Topaꞌ, pimipin-pimipin agama duoh gulu-gulu agama ulang Yahudi duoh pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi deꞌ bokon bitapod duoh Yesus.
pairs.target: They came again to Jerusalem, and as he was walking in the temple, the chief priests, and the scribes, and the elders came to him,

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Yesus, “Osi deꞌ odaꞌ Muꞌu nai oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ? Osi deꞌ ngin tugas tuduꞌ Muꞌu nai suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ?”
pairs.target: and they began saying to him, “By what authority do you do these things? Or who gave you this authority to do these things?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Okuꞌ tuang yaꞌ sikian geh tuduꞌ ingan.  Simoꞌ ingan tapod nyawot, Okuꞌ tuang tanon Kuꞌ geh osi deꞌ odaꞌ Okuꞌ nai suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ.
pairs.target: Jesus said to them, “I will ask you one question. Answer me, and I will tell you by what authority I do these things.

pairs.source: Osi deꞌ odaꞌ Yohanes Pembaptis baptis nyaꞌa? Manusia keh Topaꞌ?”
pairs.target: The baptism of John—was it from heaven, or from men? Answer me.”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ biloneng si odop-e, “Moꞌ toꞌ nang ‘Topaꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ’, Iyoh pasti nang ‘Oni nai diꞌ muꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yohanes?’
pairs.target: They reasoned with themselves, saying, “If we should say, ‘From heaven;’ he will say, ‘Why then did you not believe him?’

pairs.source: Pak-e idoh geh diꞌ otoꞌ ponai nang ‘Manusia deꞌ odaꞌ.’ ” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nang in inoh saai yoh tolu deꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ yaꞌ malah tuduꞌ odop-e, dop-e suaꞌ nyaꞌa bisayaꞌ nang Yohanes inoh nabi.
pairs.target: If we should say, ‘From men’”—they feared the people, for all held John to really be a prophet.

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-E, “Koꞌih diꞌ koꞌih puꞌan-e.” Yesus moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Okuꞌ tuang idoh geh diꞌ kuꞌ tanon osi Nyaꞌa deꞌ odaꞌ Okuꞌ nai suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ.”
pairs.target: They answered Jesus, “We don’t know.” Jesus said to them, “Neither do I tell you by what authority I do these things.”

pairs.source: Yesus mulai sina tuduꞌ pimipin-pimipin agama deꞌ ayuh, gulu-gulu agama, duoh pimipin-pimipin Yahudi deꞌ bokon pakai nang silita, in-e, “Ogiꞌ nyaꞌa nai kobon anggul, yoh moꞌ ngijuam-e, mokuaꞌ inoh yoh moꞌ nai lubang topat nyaꞌa misiat piꞌin buaꞌ anggul.  Mokuaꞌ inoh yoh moꞌ nai pangal topat nyaꞌa jaga kobon, yoh moꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa nyewa kobon-e, odop-e moꞌ buu keꞌ negeli deꞌ bokon.
pairs.target: He began to speak to them in parables. “A man planted a vineyard, put a hedge around it, dug a pit for the wine press, built a tower, rented it out to a farmer, and went into another country.

pairs.source: Takal-e nog musim ngutuam buaꞌ anggul, nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ kobon inoh moꞌ pait kuli-e odaꞌ odi mit duman soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nyewa kobon-e.
pairs.target: When it was time, he sent a servant to the farmer to get from the farmer his share of the fruit of the vineyard.

pairs.source: Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ nyewa kobon inoh moꞌ takap kuli deꞌ pait nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ kobon.  Yoh moꞌ bipupuꞌ duoh-e, yohmoꞌ odaꞌ paliꞌ boloh.
pairs.target: They took him, beat him, and sent him away empty.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ kobon inoh moꞌ pait kuli-e deꞌ bokon, pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ mupuꞌ bak-e yohmoꞌ kasig odaꞌ buu, daang-e makiꞌ-mutaꞌ-e.
pairs.target: Again, he sent another servant to them; and they threw stones at him, wounded him in the head, and sent him away shamefully treated.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ kobon inoh moꞌ pait kuli-e deꞌ bokon, pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngabos-e.  Watnoh geh yoh duoh kuli-e deꞌ bogoꞌ deꞌ pait-e deꞌ bokon.  Ogiꞌ deꞌ mupuꞌ-e, ogiꞌ geh deꞌ ngabos-e.
pairs.target: Again he sent another; and they killed him; and many others, beating some, and killing some.

pairs.source: Adin moꞌ doiꞌ tiyaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon deꞌ yaꞌ pait nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ kobon inoh, duam onak odop-e deꞌ ngibalaꞌ-e jaꞌ-e.  Yoh moꞌ in-e daang pikil-e, ‘Paguh okuꞌ odaꞌ onak odop kuꞌ deꞌ odi, saꞌ-e pimodo daꞌ-e.’
pairs.target: Therefore still having one, his beloved son, he sent him last to them, saying, ‘They will respect my son.’

pairs.source: Pak-e takal nyaꞌa deꞌ nyewa kobon ningaꞌ onak nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ kobon inoh nog, yoh moꞌ sina tipan odop-e, in-e, ‘Ningaꞌ onak nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ kobon itih! Iyoh leh deꞌ yaꞌ kakuꞌ suaꞌ kobon itih, takal samaꞌ-e kobos.  Jaꞌ toꞌ ngabos-e saꞌ otoꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ kobon itih.’
pairs.target: But those farmers said among themselves, ‘This is the heir. Come, let’s kill him, and the inheritance will be ours.’

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ takap duoh ngabos onak nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ kobon inoh, yoh moꞌ tolan todang-e keꞌ sopaꞌ kobon.”
pairs.target: They took him, killed him, and cast him out of the vineyard.

pairs.source: Yesus mokuaꞌ silita, yohmoꞌ sikian tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ, “Oni wat oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nai nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ kobon inoh? Pasti odop-e sadiꞌ-e deꞌ yaꞌ nog ngabos nyaꞌa deꞌ nyewa kobon-e inoh.  Mokuaꞌ inoh yoh moꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon deꞌ nyewa.
pairs.target: What therefore will the lord of the vineyard do? He will come and destroy the farmers, and will give the vineyard to others.

pairs.source: Pasti moꞌ ogiꞌ ingan basa daang Kitab deꞌ in-e, ‘Batuh deꞌ tolan tukang boli, moꞌ jadin batuh deꞌ sukup biguna-e.
pairs.target: Haven’t you even read this Scripture: ‘The stone which the builders rejected, the same was made the head of the corner.

pairs.source: Itih leh oniꞌ deꞌ nai Topaꞌ, deꞌ sukup otoꞌ ilan-e.’ ”
pairs.target: This was from the Lord, it is marvelous in our eyes’?”

pairs.source: Ayua pimipin Yahudi deꞌ ngojit silita inoh moꞌ kagaꞌ odop-e yaꞌ takap Yesus, dop-e silita deꞌ nang Yesus inoh nados odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.  Pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tolu tuduꞌ nyaꞌa' deꞌ bogoꞌ, inoh leh ngan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ buu togan Yesus.
pairs.target: They tried to seize him, but they feared the multitude; for they perceived that he spoke the parable against them. They left him, and went away.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh ayua pimipin Yahudi moꞌ odaꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan soꞌ uluk ulang Farisi duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ nuaꞌ Laja Herodes odi tuduꞌ Yesus ngan-e odaꞌ Yesus yaꞌ nang sina deꞌ diꞌ-e bonal, saꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ dapod nyalah Yesus.
pairs.target: They sent some of the Pharisees and the Herodians to him, that they might trap him with words.

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nog tuduꞌ Yesus, yohmoꞌ in-e, “Gulu, koꞌih puꞌan nang Ingan tanon oniꞌ deꞌ bonal duoh diꞌ Ingan piduli oni in sina nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon.  Ingan diꞌ Ingan tolu, bait tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ timogah, bait tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e timogah, pak-e Ingan suang-suang in Ingan ngajal wat ki wat manusia idip nunaꞌ deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ.  Adin, suba tanon tuduꞌ koꞌih, moꞌ-e nunaꞌ atulan agama otoꞌ, soꞌon kedoh keh otoꞌ bayal suke tuduꞌ Laja Roma deꞌ paling ayuh? Halus keh idoh otoꞌ bayal-e?”
pairs.target: When they had come, they asked him, “Teacher, we know that you are honest, and don’t defer to anyone; for you aren’t partial to anyone, but truly teach the way of God. Is it lawful to pay taxes to Caesar, or not?

pairs.source: Yesus puꞌan nang odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ pulaꞌ-pulaꞌ paguh.  Iyoh moꞌ nyawot-e, “Oni nai ingan siaji ingan odaꞌ Okuꞌ yaꞌ nang sina deꞌ diꞌ-e bonal? Suba bitanga tuduꞌ Okuꞌ niꞌ kiping duit pilak!”
pairs.target: Shall we give, or shall we not give?” But he, knowing their hypocrisy, said to them, “Why do you test me? Bring me a denarius, that I may see it.”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngin tuduꞌ-E.  Yesus moꞌ sikian in-E, “Gamal duoh adon osi deꞌ ogiꞌ datiꞌ?” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-e, “Gamal duoh adon Laja Roma deꞌ paling ayuh.”
pairs.target: They brought it. He said to them, “Whose is this image and inscription?” They said to him, “Caesar’s.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Moꞌ-e wat inoh, oni deꞌ kakuꞌ laja, ngin tuduꞌ laja.  Oni deꞌ kakuꞌ Topaꞌ, ngin tuduꞌ Topaꞌ!” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sukup ilan-e.
pairs.target: Jesus answered them, “Render to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.” They marveled greatly at him.

pairs.source: Uluk ulang Saduki iyoh leh uluk ulang deꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ nang nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos tapod paliꞌ idip.  Ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ nog tuduꞌ Yesus.Yoh bisikian tuduꞌ Yesus, in-e,
pairs.target: There came to him Sadducees, who say that there is no resurrection. They asked him, saying,

pairs.source: “Gulu, Musa nulis atulan itih saꞌan otoꞌ: ‘Simoꞌ-e ogiꞌ dali deꞌ moꞌ kawin, yoh moꞌ kobos, pak-e yoh doiꞌ onak-e, yohmoꞌ madih-e deꞌ dali deꞌ bokon mit bokas sowon-e, odaꞌ jadin sowon odop-e, saꞌ-e ogiꞌ onak saꞌan bonon-e deꞌ moꞌ kobos.’
pairs.target: “Teacher, Moses wrote to us, ‘If a man’s brother dies, and leaves a wife behind him, and leaves no children, that his brother should take his wife, and raise up offspring for his brother.’

pairs.source: Deꞌ dioꞌ, ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ sikiaꞌ-sudiꞌ juꞌ madih odop-e deꞌ dali.  Madih-e deꞌ pinuan kawin, yoh moꞌ dioꞌ kobos ngan-e aluaꞌ doiꞌ onak-e.
pairs.target: There were seven brothers. The first took a wife, and dying left no offspring.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh madih-e deꞌ keꞌ duwoh-e mit bokas sowon-e inoh odaꞌ jadin sowon-e, yoh tuang dioꞌ kobos geh ngan-e aluaꞌ doiꞌ onak-e.  Wat noh geh, madih-e deꞌ keꞌ taluh-e,
pairs.target: The second took her, and died, leaving no children behind him. The third likewise;

pairs.source: telus nog madih-e deꞌ ke' juꞌ-e, wat inoh geh yoh kobos ngan-e aluaꞌ doiꞌ onak-e.  Mokuaꞌ inoh dayung inoh tuang kobos geh.
pairs.target: and the seven took her and left no children. Last of all the woman also died.

pairs.source: Takal suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ kobos paliꞌ idip, dayung inoh jadin sowon osi? Dop-e soꞌ juꞌ madih odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ kawin duoh-e.”
pairs.target: In the resurrection, when they rise, whose wife will she be of them? For the seven had her as a wife.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ in-e, “Pikil ingan moꞌ salah.  Ingan diꞌ ingan puꞌan Kitab duoh kuasa Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: Jesus answered them, “Isn’t this because you are mistaken, not knowing the Scriptures, nor the power of God?

pairs.source: Dop-e takal nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ kobos mokat paliꞌ idip, doiꞌ tiyaꞌ nyaꞌa yaꞌ kawin, suaꞌ nyaꞌa idip kodaꞌ malaikat deꞌ siluga.
pairs.target: For when they will rise from the dead, they neither marry, nor are given in marriage, but are like angels in heaven.

pairs.source: Tentang nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ kobos mokat paliꞌ idip, podo doiꞌ sidoh ingan basa daang buk deꞌ nulis nabi Musa, takal Topaꞌ bitanga odop-E tuduꞌ Musa soꞌ totaꞌ lojaꞌ deꞌ biduduꞌ opui daꞌ-e? Topaꞌ in-e, ‘Okuꞌ leh Topaꞌ deꞌ obuah nyomah odaꞌ Abraham, Ishak duoh Yakub,’
pairs.target: But about the dead, that they are raised; haven’t you read in the book of Moses, about the Bush, how God spoke to him, saying, ‘I am the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’?

pairs.source: Iyoh idoh diꞌ-e Topaꞌ deꞌ obuah nyomah odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos, pak-e Iyoh Topaꞌ deꞌ obuah nyomah odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ idip.  Ingan diꞌ ingan ngiloti-e!”
pairs.target: He is not the God of the dead, but of the living. You are therefore badly mistaken.”

pairs.source: Takal Yesus aluaꞌ bikalah duoh uluk ulang Saduki, ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan gulu agama Yahudi suwaꞌ ngojit-e.  Yoh ningaꞌ Yesus nyawot oni deꞌ sikian odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ sukup bonal-e.  Gulu agama Yahudi inoh moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Yesus in-e, “Ki pilitah deꞌ paling penting soꞌ susuaꞌ pilitah soꞌ Topaꞌ?”
pairs.target: One of the scribes came, and heard them questioning together. Knowing that he had answered them well, asked him, “Which commandment is the greatest of all?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Pilitah deꞌ paling penting keꞌ niꞌ-e iyoh leh: ‘Ngojit leh ingan oi ulang Israel! Topaꞌ otoꞌ jok-e niꞌ.
pairs.target: Jesus answered, “The greatest is, ‘Hear, Israel, the Lord our God, the Lord is one:

pairs.source: Ngibalaꞌ leh Topaꞌ daang suaꞌ otin muꞌ, suaꞌ asong muꞌ, suaꞌ pikil-kila muꞌ, duoh suaꞌ tenaga muꞌ.’
pairs.target: you shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, and with all your soul, and with all your mind, and with all your strength.’ This is the first commandment.

pairs.source: Pilitah deꞌ keꞌ duwoh-e iyoh leh: ‘Ngibalaꞌ leh siodop muꞌ manusia, samah kodaꞌ muꞌu ngibalaꞌ odop muꞌ.  Doiꞌ pilitah deꞌ bokon deꞌ paling penting soꞌ pilitah deꞌ duwoh itih.’ ”
pairs.target: The second is like this, ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’ There is no other commandment greater than these.”

pairs.source: Gulu agama Yahudi inoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Yesus, “Bonal manah oniꞌ deꞌ nang Ingan, pak Gulu-e! Iyoh jok-e niꞌ, doiꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ bokon.
pairs.target: The scribe said to him, “Truly, teacher, you have said well that he is one, and there is none other but he,

pairs.source: Manusia halus ngibalaꞌ Topaꞌ daang suaꞌ otin-e, pakai suaꞌ pikil kila-e, duoh suaꞌ tenaga-e, duoh halus ngibalaꞌ si odop-e manusia, samah kodaꞌ iyoh ngibalaꞌ odop-e sadiꞌ-e.  Itih lobih paguh soꞌ binatang deꞌ ngabos nyeꞌ ngan nyeꞌ nyomah Topaꞌ, duoh deꞌ bokon-bokon-e deꞌ ngin nyeꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: and to love him with all the heart, and with all the understanding, with all the soul, and with all the strength, and to love his neighbor as himself, is more important than all whole burnt offerings and sacrifices.”

pairs.source: Yesus ningaꞌ gulu agama ulang Yahudi inoh sikiya ponai nyawot sina-E, Yesus moꞌ sina lagiꞌ tuduꞌ-e, “Muꞌu moꞌ siap yaꞌ tilimaꞌ Topaꞌ militah daang idip muꞌ.” Mokuaꞌ inoh suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ puus sikian oni-oni-e tuduꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: When Jesus saw that he answered wisely, he said to him, “You are not far from God’s Kingdom.” No one dared ask him any question after that.

pairs.source: Takal Yesus aluaꞌ ngajal deꞌ awah Boli Topaꞌ, Yesus moꞌ in-E, “Oni wat gulu-gulu agama ulang Yahudi tapod tanon nang Laja Pinyilamat soꞌ onak sukun Laja Daud?
pairs.target: Jesus responded, as he taught in the temple, “How is it that the scribes say that the Christ is the son of David?

pairs.source: Noꞌuh-e Laja Daud sibonal-e obuah nutuan Iyang Topaꞌ yohmoꞌ in-e, ‘Topaꞌ sina tuduꞌ Tuan kuꞌ: guluꞌ nuaꞌ toꞌuh Kuꞌ saꞌ Muꞌ militah jadin Laja, nog kuꞌ odaꞌ musuh-musuh Muꞌ tunuak tuduꞌ Muꞌu.’
pairs.target: For David himself said in the Holy Spirit, ‘The Lord said to my Lord, “Sit at my right hand, until I make your enemies the footstool of your feet.”’

pairs.source: Simoꞌ-e Daud sobot nang Laja Pinyilamat inoh Tuan-e, jadin Iyoh nak-e jok-e onak sukun Daud, Iyoh pasti lobih ayuh kuasa-E soꞌ Daud.” Nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ danoꞌ sukup sonang-e ngojit pingajal Yesus.
pairs.target: Therefore David himself calls him Lord, so how can he be his son?”  The common people heard him gladly.

pairs.source: Yesus tanon geh tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Maꞌ tauꞌ-tauꞌ yaꞌ nunaꞌ gaya gulu-gulu agama deꞌ munoꞌ.  Iyoh suka ponu pakai jubah deꞌ omu, yoh magah nang odop-e ulang timogah, duoh suka odaꞌ nyaꞌa mudi odop-e deꞌ pasal.
pairs.target: In his teaching he said to them, “Beware of the scribes, who like to walk in long robes, and to get greetings in the marketplaces,

pairs.source: Iyoh suka guluꞌ deꞌ topat-topat nuaꞌ jowin daang topat simayang agama Yahudi, duoh deꞌ topat-topat nyaꞌa man ayuh.
pairs.target: and the best seats in the synagogues, and the best places at feasts:

pairs.source: Iyoh suka nipu sinoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ janda duoh mit lomin boli-e.  Iyoh suka bidoa tuui-tuui deꞌ jowin nyaꞌa ngan-e magah nang odop-e paguh .  Tiaꞌ ijoꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ lobih baat ukum deꞌ yaꞌ tilimaꞌ-e.”
pairs.target: those who devour widows’ houses, and for a pretense make long prayers. These will receive greater condemnation.”

pairs.source: Takal Yesus guluꞌ ngaduap topat nyaꞌa ngin duit tuduꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ Boli Topaꞌ, Yesus ningaꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kibalot duit-e daang kutak inoh.  Bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kaya kibalot duit-e lobih bogoꞌ.
pairs.target: Jesus sat down opposite the treasury, and saw how the multitude cast money into the treasury. Many who were rich cast in much.

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ geh sinoꞌ janda deꞌ botak suwaꞌ odi, iyoh kibalot duwoh kiping duit tibaga deꞌ mulah loga-e.
pairs.target: A poor widow came, and she cast in two small brass coins, which equal a quadrans coin.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ mogan pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, Iyoh moꞌ sina, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Duit deꞌ kibalot sinoꞌ janda inoh lobih ayuh loga-e soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon.
pairs.target: He called his disciples to himself, and said to them, “Most certainly I tell you, this poor widow gave more than all those who are giving into the treasury,

pairs.source: Dop-e nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon ngin soꞌ lobih-e.  Pak-e sinoꞌ janda inoh bial yoh botak, iyoh ngin suaꞌ duit-e deꞌ ogiꞌ.  Dop-e duam inoh jaꞌ-e duit-e deꞌ ogiꞌ.”
pairs.target: for they all gave out of their abundance, but she, out of her poverty, gave all that she had to live on.”

pairs.source: Takal Yesus luah soꞌ awah Boli Topaꞌ, ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E sina tuduꞌ Yesus, “Gulu, suba ningaꞌ! Batuh-batuh Boli Topaꞌ inoh sangon manah! Wat inoh geh duoh sinung-sinung-e!”
pairs.target: As he went out of the temple, one of his disciples said to him, “Teacher, see what kind of stones and what kind of buildings!”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Suba ingan ningaꞌ batuh-batuh duoh sinung-sinung deꞌ sangon inoh.  Ogiꞌ onu takal-e suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ningaꞌ ingan itih yaꞌ asul.  Niꞌ tuang doiꞌ geh deꞌ soꞌ suaꞌ Boli Topaꞌ inoh deꞌ yaꞌ wat-wat-e geh, suaꞌ-e yaꞌ obuah pilubuh.”
pairs.target: Jesus said to him, “Do you see these great buildings? There will not be left here one stone on another, which will not be thrown down.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ odi keꞌ Punguꞌ Zaitun, Yoh moꞌ guluꞌ deꞌ topat deꞌ ngaduap Boli Topaꞌ.  Petrus, Yakobus, Yohanes duoh Andreas moꞌ nog tuduꞌ Yesus, ngan-e yaꞌ sikian sadiꞌ-e tuduꞌ-E.
pairs.target: As he sat on the Mount of Olives opposite the temple, Peter, James, John, and Andrew asked him privately,

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ sikian in-e, “Tanon tuduꞌ koꞌih siniaꞌ soꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ jadi? Oni tanda-tanda suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ yaꞌ jadi, saꞌ koꞌih puꞌan-e?”
pairs.target: “Tell us, when will these things be? What is the sign that these things are all about to be fulfilled?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Silalu jaga-jaga, maꞌ sape ingan obuah nipu odaꞌ nyaꞌa pakai pingajal deꞌ salah!
pairs.target: Jesus, answering, began to tell them, “Be careful that no one leads you astray.

pairs.source: Yoh moꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ nog pakai adon Okuꞌ yohmoꞌ sina nang, ‘Okuꞌ leh Laja Pinyilamat’, yoh moꞌ nipu nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ.
pairs.target: For many will come in my name, saying, ‘I am he!’ and will lead many astray.

pairs.source: Simoꞌ ingan ngojit sowoꞌ polang duoh gah-gah polang, maꞌ yaꞌ tolu.  Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ jadi.  Pak-e aluaꞌ diꞌ-e kiamat.
pairs.target: “When you hear of wars and rumors of wars, don’t be troubled. For those must happen, but the end is not yet.

pairs.source: Bangsa deꞌ niꞌ yaꞌ nyelang bangsa deꞌ bokon.  Negli deꞌ niꞌ yaꞌ lawan negli deꞌ bokon.  Daki-daki-e yaꞌ ogiꞌ topat deꞌ tiguyang tigusuak, suaꞌ nyaꞌa yaꞌ sibolok.  Pak-e suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ jadin puꞌun nyaꞌa yaꞌ mulai jolaꞌ soꞌ suaꞌ-e deꞌ yaꞌ jadi.  Samah kodaꞌ dayung bitiiaꞌ deꞌ mulai noman toꞌin-e monam yaꞌ milaꞌ.
pairs.target: For nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. There will be earthquakes in various places. There will be famines and troubles. These things are the beginning of birth pains.

pairs.source: Pak-e ingan masim-masim ati-ati! Nyaꞌa yaꞌ takap ingan duoh toban keꞌ Pengadilan Agama Yahudi.  Yoh yaꞌ pijolaꞌ ingan deꞌ topat-topat simayang agama Yahudi.  Yoh toban ingan ngaduap piayuh-piayuh duoh laja-laja.  Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ obuah ingan, dop-e ingan pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Okuꞌ.  Inoh leh onu-e saꞌ ingan tapod magah Gah deꞌ Paguh tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: But watch yourselves, for they will deliver you up to councils. You will be beaten in synagogues. You will stand before rulers and kings for my sake, for a testimony to them.

pairs.source: Gah deꞌ Paguh inoh halus lobih dioꞌ nyeꞌ magah-e tuduꞌ suaꞌ bangsa takal onu kiamat aluaꞌ diꞌ-e nog.
pairs.target: The Good News must first be preached to all the nations.

pairs.source: Simoꞌ ingan obuah takap duoh obuah toban keꞌ topat nyaꞌa bilituang, maꞌ bigaduh oni in sina deꞌ yaꞌ nang ingan.  Pak-e tanon negeh oni in deꞌ tanon Iyang Topaꞌ tuduꞌ ingan takal inoh.  Sibonal-e idoh diꞌ-e soꞌ odop ingan deꞌ tanon in inoh, Iyang Topaꞌ leh deꞌ odaꞌ ingan tanon-e.
pairs.target: When they lead you away and deliver you up, don’t be anxious beforehand, or premeditate what you will say, but say whatever will be given you in that hour. For it is not you who speak, but the Holy Spirit.

pairs.source: Takal inoh yaꞌ ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngin madih-e odaꞌ nyaꞌa ngabos-e.  Samaꞌ ngin onak-e deꞌ nyaꞌa odaꞌ ngabos-e.  Wat noh geh onak-e ngin pingoma-e, odaꞌ nyaꞌa ngabos-e.
pairs.target: “Brother will deliver up brother to death, and the father his child. Children will rise up against parents, and cause them to be put to death.

pairs.source: Bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ buꞌui tuduꞌ ingan dop-e ingan jadin pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Okuꞌ.  Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ taan naan nog piobuaꞌ idip-e yoh leh deꞌ yaꞌ silamat.”
pairs.target: You will be hated by all men for my name’s sake, but he who endures to the end, the same will be saved.

pairs.source: “Ingan yaꞌ ningaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ sisiꞌ nyaꞌa daꞌ-a duoh oniꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa kobos tulah deꞌ yaꞌ mujuag daang Boli Topaꞌ ngan-e yaꞌ kaꞌis-e, topat deꞌ diꞌ-e soꞌon yoh molot daang-e.  (Nyaꞌa deꞌ basa itih halus bonal-bonal ngiloti hal itih.) Takal inoh ulang-ulang deꞌ loꞌo deꞌ propinsi Yudea halus bikoduh buu keꞌ dolod-dolod.
pairs.target: But when you see the abomination of desolation, spoken of by Daniel the prophet, standing where it ought not (let the reader understand), then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains,

pairs.source: Ayua deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ tun bungan boli-e, maꞌ tiyaꞌ yaꞌ muun kalik oniꞌ kaang boli, lasuꞌ negeh bikoduh buu.
pairs.target: and let him who is on the housetop not go down, nor enter in, to take anything out of his house.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ aluaꞌ kiloja deꞌ umoh-e, maꞌ tiyaꞌ yaꞌ moliꞌ mit pimakai-e.
pairs.target: Let him who is in the field not return back to take his cloak.

pairs.source: Takal onu inoh, todah mun sinoꞌ-sinoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ balut duoh deꞌ aluaꞌ siduaꞌ onak-e.
pairs.target: But woe to those who are with child and to those who nurse babies in those days!

pairs.source: Bidoa leh tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, saꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e nog takal musim modud.
pairs.target: Pray that your flight won’t be in the winter.

pairs.source: Dop-e takal inoh nyaꞌa yaꞌ sukup jolaꞌ-e, deꞌ doiꞌ onu nyaꞌa obuah-e, mulai soꞌ sibungas Topaꞌ nai dunia nog adin.  Susah jolaꞌ inoh diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ yaꞌ obuah dunia.
pairs.target: For in those days there will be oppression, such as there has not been the like from the beginning of the creation which God created until now, and never will be.

pairs.source: Simoꞌ Topaꞌ diꞌ-e sagot onu jolaꞌ inoh, doiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ taan bitaan idip.  Pak-e Topaꞌ masiꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ pilih-E odaꞌ nunaꞌ odop-E, yoh ngan-e sagot onu-e.
pairs.target: Unless the Lord had shortened the days, no flesh would have been saved; but for the sake of the chosen ones, whom he picked out, he shortened the days.

pairs.source: Takal inoh, simoꞌ ogiꞌ nyaꞌa nang, ‘Ningaꞌ Laja Pinyilamat ogiꞌ datiꞌ, ogiꞌ danih,’ maꞌ yaꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ-e.
pairs.target: Then if anyone tells you, ‘Look, here is the Christ!’ or, ‘Look, there!’ don’t believe it.

pairs.source: Dop-e nyaꞌa deꞌ ngakuꞌ odop-e Laja Pinyilamat duoh nabi-nabi pibulaꞌ yaꞌ nog.  Iyoh bogoꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa ngan-e yaꞌ nipu nyaꞌa, nog nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ pilih-E, tadoꞌ-tadoꞌ-e yaꞌ obuah nipu geh.
pairs.target: For there will arise false christs and false prophets, and will show signs and wonders, that they may lead astray, if possible, even the chosen ones.

pairs.source: Jadin maꞌ tauꞌ-tauꞌ bisayaꞌ, suaꞌ-e moꞌ dioꞌ Kuꞌ tanon-e tuduꞌ ingan takal-e aluaꞌ diꞌ-e jadi.”
pairs.target: But you watch. “Behold, I have told you all things beforehand.

pairs.source: “Pak-e takal-e moꞌ mokuaꞌ onu-onu nyaꞌa jolaꞌ inoh, boton onu yaꞌ mopung, bulan diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ jawaꞌ.
pairs.target: But in those days, after that oppression, the sun will be darkened, the moon will not give its light,

pairs.source: Bitang-bitang obuaꞌ luluh duoh kuasa-kuasa deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ longit obuaꞌ tiguyang.
pairs.target: the stars will be falling from the sky, and the powers that are in the heavens will be shaken.

pairs.source: Takal inoh nyaꞌa yaꞌ ningaꞌ Onak Manusia nog deꞌ abun pakai kuasa-e deꞌ ayuh duoh jawaꞌ-e deꞌ telang.
pairs.target: Then they will see the Son of Man coming in clouds with great power and glory.

pairs.source: Yoh moꞌ odaꞌ malaikat-malaikat odi nguluk nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ pilih-e odaꞌ nunaꞌ odop-e, deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ suaꞌ tun dunia itih, soꞌ nyuang bumi nog tubon longit.
pairs.target: Then he will send out his angels, and will gather together his chosen ones from the four winds, from the ends of the earth to the ends of the sky.

pairs.source: Bilajal leh soꞌ silita tongon ara.  Takal daꞌan-daꞌan-e moꞌ dodot duoh mulai ngilotad, onu moꞌ yaꞌ logaꞌ.
pairs.target: “Now from the fig tree, learn this parable. When the branch has now become tender, and produces its leaves, you know that the summer is near;

pairs.source: Wat inoh geh moꞌ ingan ningaꞌ moꞌ ogiꞌ tanda-tanda deꞌ tanon Kuꞌ tiꞌ-e, inoh loti-e moꞌ sinok onu-e.  Duam-e yaꞌ nog.
pairs.target: even so you also, when you see these things coming to pass, know that it is near, at the doors.

pairs.source: Ngojit bonal-bonal-e! Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ yaꞌ jadi takal nyaꞌa deꞌ idip adin aluaꞌ diꞌ-e suaꞌ-e kobos.
pairs.target: Most certainly I say to you, this generation will not pass away until all these things happen.

pairs.source: Longit duoh tanaꞌ yaꞌ musuap, pak-e pingunang Kuꞌ totap ogiꞌ silamaꞌ-lamaꞌ-e.”
pairs.target: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will not pass away.

pairs.source: “Pak-e siniaꞌ onu-e duoh siniaꞌ takal-e yaꞌ jadi doiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ puꞌan, malaikat deꞌ siluga tuang doh geh diꞌ-e puꞌan-e.  Pak-e jok-e Samaꞌ deꞌ siluga deꞌ puꞌan.  Onak-E tuang idoh geh diꞌ-e puꞌan-e.
pairs.target: But of that day or that hour no one knows, not even the angels in heaven, nor the Son, but only the Father.

pairs.source: Maꞌ tauꞌ-tauꞌ duoh silalu jaga-jaga! Dop-e ingan diꞌ ingan puꞌan siniaꞌ takal-e.
pairs.target: Watch, keep alert, and pray; for you don’t know when the time is.

pairs.source: Onak Manusia yaꞌ nog samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ buu togan boli-e.  Takal-e aluaꞌ diꞌ-e buu, yoh moꞌ bikutung kiloja tuduꞌ kuli-kuli-e odaꞌ ngatul boli-e.  Yoh sibaya tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tukang jaga tiban-e, maꞌ sape yoh yaꞌ komut kiloja-e nog nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ boli paliꞌ.  Mokuaꞌ inoh ke yoh moꞌ odi keꞌ topat deꞌ juuaꞌ.
pairs.target: “It is like a man, traveling to another country, having left his house, and given authority to his servants, and to each one his work, and also commanded the doorkeeper to keep watch.

pairs.source: Inoh leh ngan nyeꞌ silalu jaga singonu singalom, dop-e diꞌ ingan puꞌan siniaꞌ takal-e nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ boli inoh yaꞌ nog.  An onu ngumi, an tuluap ngalom, an suam-suam pagi, an takal boton onu moꞌ tumuꞌ.
pairs.target: Watch therefore, for you don’t know when the lord of the house is coming, whether at evening, or at midnight, or when the rooster crows, or in the morning;

pairs.source: Saꞌ-e simoꞌ iyoh tang-tang nog, maꞌ sape iyoh nog ningaꞌ ingan aluaꞌ boꞌos.
pairs.target: lest coming suddenly he might find you sleeping.

pairs.source: Oni deꞌ tanon Kuꞌ tuduꞌ ingan, Kuꞌ tanon geh tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa: Maꞌ tauꞌ-tauꞌ duoh silalu jaga-jaga!”
pairs.target: What I tell you, I tell all: Watch.”

pairs.source: Duwoh onu lagiꞌ ulang Yahudi yaꞌ nyamut Onu Ayuh Paskah duoh nyamut Onu Ayuh Kueh deꞌ doiꞌ Ragi-e.  Pimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh duoh gulu-gulu agama Yahudi yaꞌ takap duoh yaꞌ ngabos Yesus.  Pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ doliaꞌ-e odaꞌ nyaꞌa puꞌan oni deꞌ yaꞌ nai-e.
pairs.target: It was now two days before the feast of the Passover and the unleavened bread, and the chief priests and the scribes sought how they might seize him by deception, and kill him.

pairs.source: Yoh moꞌ bipokat diꞌ-e takap Yesus daang onu ayuh, in odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Maꞌ sape oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nai otoꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ nang liuak daluag-e.”
pairs.target: For they said, “Not during the feast, because there might be a riot among the people.”

pairs.source: Yesus aluaꞌ loꞌo deꞌ kupuaꞌ Betania, iyoh moꞌ odi boli Simon, nyaꞌa deꞌ dioꞌ soꞌ kanoꞌ obuah onam kulit deꞌ bijakit.  Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ julah-e man, ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan dayung nog toban niꞌ jobul inyuaꞌ wangi deꞌ maal loga-e, duoh jobul-e tuang maal geh.  Yoh moꞌ mugat tunguaꞌ jobul inoh yohmoꞌ duwan inyuaꞌ inoh deꞌ tun bak Yesus.
pairs.target: While he was at Bethany, in the house of Simon the leper, as he sat at the table, a woman came having an alabaster jar of ointment of pure nard—very costly. She broke the jar, and poured it over his head.

pairs.source: Pak-e ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ moꞌ malah, daang-e sina tipan odop-e, “Nai oni saꞌat inyuaꞌ deꞌ maal wat inoh?
pairs.target: But there were some who were indignant among themselves, saying, “Why has this ointment been wasted?

pairs.source: Lobih paguh nyeꞌ jua negeh inyuaꞌ wangi inoh! Loga-e samah duoh gaji nyaꞌa kiloja deꞌ niꞌ sowaꞌ.  Duit-e tapod nyeꞌ bikutung tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ sotok!” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ malah tuduꞌ dayung inoh.
pairs.target: For this might have been sold for more than three hundred denarii,  and given to the poor.” They grumbled against her.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Tanah negeh! Doiꞌ nyeꞌ jolaꞌ malah tuduꞌ-e.  Iyoh nai oniꞌ deꞌ paling paguh-e saꞌan Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: But Jesus said, “Leave her alone. Why do you trouble her? She has done a good work for me.

pairs.source: Dop-e nyaꞌa deꞌ sotok, silalu ogiꞌ sinok ingan, siniaꞌ sijaꞌ-e ingan tapod tulung-e.  Pak-e Okuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ silamaꞌ-lamaꞌ-e yaꞌ duoh ingan.
pairs.target: For you always have the poor with you, and whenever you want to, you can do them good; but you will not always have me.

pairs.source: Dayung itih moꞌ nai oni deꞌ tapod yoh nai-e tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, iyoh moꞌ dioꞌ ngiyuaꞌ gonan-Kuꞌ takal Kuꞌ aluaꞌ idip.  Inoh samah geh iyoh ngiyuaꞌ todang Kuꞌ takal Kuꞌ kobos.
pairs.target: She has done what she could. She has anointed my body beforehand for the burying.

pairs.source: Natong bonal-bonal-e! Daki sijaꞌ-e nyaꞌa magah Gah deꞌ Paguh tentang Okuꞌ deꞌ tun dunia itih, wat inoh geh nyaꞌa silita oni deꞌ moꞌ nai dayung itih.  Saꞌ nyaꞌa silalu natong oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nai-e tuduꞌ Okuꞌ adin.”
pairs.target: Most certainly I tell you, wherever this Good News may be preached throughout the whole world, that which this woman has done will also be spoken of for a memorial of her.”

pairs.source: Yudas Iskariot, niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ simoong duwoh pinunaꞌ Yesus inoh, moꞌ odi tuduꞌ pimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh ngan-e yaꞌ nyelah Yesus tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: Judas Iscariot, who was one of the twelve, went away to the chief priests, that he might deliver him to them.
