pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sukup doon-e ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ tanon-e, yoh moꞌ bipokat yaꞌ ngin duit tuduꞌ Yudas.  Yudas moꞌ kalik wat olan ngan-e yaꞌ nyelah Yesus tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: They, when they heard it, were glad, and promised to give him money. He sought how he might conveniently deliver him.

pairs.source: Takal onu keꞌ niꞌ-e nyaꞌa nyamut Onu Ayuh Kueh deꞌ doiꞌ Ragi-e, daang onu inoh nyaꞌa mulai simoliah domba ngan-e yaꞌ nyamut Onu Ayuh Paskah.  Pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ bisikian tuduꞌ Yesus, “Gulu, daki topat soꞌ otoꞌ yaꞌ man nyamut Onu Ayuh Paskah? Saꞌ koꞌih sidia pinguman deꞌ topat inoh.”
pairs.target: On the first day of unleavened bread, when they sacrificed the Passover, his disciples asked him, “Where do you want us to go and prepare that you may eat the Passover?”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ pait duwoh naꞌan pinunaꞌ-e yohmoꞌ sibaya tuduꞌ-e, “Odi kaang kota.  Danih ingan yaꞌ bitapod duoh niꞌ naꞌan dali deꞌ toban kobuk deꞌ punuaꞌ odaꞌ piꞌin, nyeꞌ moꞌ ponu bitunaꞌ duoh-e.
pairs.target: He sent two of his disciples, and said to them, “Go into the city, and there you will meet a man carrying a pitcher of water. Follow him,

pairs.source: Takal iyoh molot kaang boli, nyeꞌ moꞌ tanon tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ boli, ‘Gulu sikian daki aluang boli topat Iyoh duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E yaꞌ man nyamut Onu Ayuh Paskah?’
pairs.target: and wherever he enters in, tell the master of the house, ‘The Teacher says, “Where is the guest room, where I may eat the Passover with my disciples?”’

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ boli inoh moꞌ yaꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan, ogiꞌ niꞌ aluang deꞌ longah deꞌ ayuh, deꞌ moꞌ suaꞌ-e siap oniꞌ daang-e.  Danoꞌ leh ingan sidia pinguman ngan toꞌ nyamut Paskah.”
pairs.target: He will himself show you a large upper room furnished and ready. Get ready for us there.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ odop-e deꞌ duwoh ngojit sibaya Yesus, yoh moꞌ odi molot kaang kota.  Danoꞌ yoh bitapod duoh nyaꞌa, bonal-bonal samah kodaꞌ deꞌ tanon Yesus.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sidia pinguman ngan-e nyamut Onu ayuh Paskah danoꞌ.
pairs.target: His disciples went out, and came into the city, and found things as he had said to them, and they prepared the Passover.

pairs.source: Takal onu moꞌ ngalom, Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-E deꞌ simoong duwoh naꞌan moꞌ odi keꞌ boli inoh.
pairs.target: When it was evening he came with the twelve.

pairs.source: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ julah-e man, Yesus moꞌ sina, “Natong bonal-bonal-e! Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ ingan deꞌ mutiꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nyelah Okuꞌ tuduꞌ musuh-musuh Kuꞌ.  Odop-e ogiꞌ man samah-samah duoh Okuꞌ.”
pairs.target: As they sat and were eating, Jesus said, “Most certainly I tell you, one of you will betray me—he who eats with me.”

pairs.source: Takal-e ngojit sina Yesus inoh, pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ susah kila-e.  Yoh moꞌ masim-masim sina nang, “Okuꞌ keh idoh, Gulu?”
pairs.target: They began to be sorrowful, and to ask him one by one, “Surely not I?” And another said, “Surely not I?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Ogiꞌ odop-e datiꞌ, soꞌ simoong duwoh naꞌan pinunaꞌ Kuꞌ itih, deꞌ man niꞌ pingian samah-samah duoh Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: He answered them, “It is one of the twelve, he who dips with me in the dish.

pairs.source: Onak Manusia tok yaꞌ kobos, nunaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ obuah nulis daang Kitab, pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ nyelah Iyoh yaꞌ tulah idip-e.  Lobih paguh moꞌ-e yoh diꞌ-e obuah milaꞌ daang dunia itih.”
pairs.target: For the Son of Man goes, even as it is written about him, but woe to that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed! It would be better for that man if he had not been born.”

pairs.source: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ aluaꞌ man, Yesus moꞌ mit kueh, yohmoꞌ bisukul tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.  Iyoh moꞌ nyipiak kutung tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-E daang-e in-e, “Mit nyeꞌ moꞌ man-e, itih gonan Kuꞌ.”
pairs.target: As they were eating, Jesus took bread, and when he had blessed, he broke it, and gave to them, and said, “Take, eat. This is my body.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh yoh moꞌ mit sakil deꞌ ogiꞌ piꞌin anggul daang-e, yoh moꞌ bisukul tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.  Mokuaꞌ inoh Iyoh moꞌ ngin tuduꞌ suaꞌ pinunaꞌ-E nuak soꞌ sakil inoh.
pairs.target: He took the cup, and when he had given thanks, he gave to them. They all drank of it.

pairs.source: Yoh moꞌ sina lagi, “Itih doyaꞌ Kuꞌ, doyaꞌ deꞌ nogap janyi Topaꞌ duoh manusia, doyaꞌ deꞌ soyang saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ.
pairs.target: He said to them, “This is my blood of the new covenant, which is poured out for many.

pairs.source: Natong bonal-bonal-e! Tok idoh diꞌ Kuꞌ tiyaꞌ nuak piꞌin soꞌ buaꞌ anggul nog onu Okuꞌ nuak soꞌ buaꞌ anggul deꞌ baꞌuh takal Topaꞌ nog militah jadin Laja.”
pairs.target: Most certainly I tell you, I will no more drink of the fruit of the vine, until that day when I drink it anew in God’s Kingdom.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ngilagu mudi Topaꞌ yohmoꞌ odi keꞌ Punguꞌ Zaitun.
pairs.target: When they had sung a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.

pairs.source: Takal-e aluaꞌ daang olan, Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, “Suaꞌ ingan yaꞌ buu togan Okuꞌ, dop-e ogiꞌ deꞌ nulis daang Kitab, ‘Topaꞌ yaꞌ ngabos nyaꞌa deꞌ tukang jaga koming domba-e, yoh moꞌ koming domba-e yaꞌ buu katiꞌ kanih.’
pairs.target: Jesus said to them, “All of you will be made to stumble because of me tonight, for it is written, ‘I will strike the shepherd, and the sheep will be scattered.’

pairs.source: Pak-e takal Okuꞌ yaꞌ paliꞌ idip, Okuꞌ yaꞌ dioꞌ kajon ingan deꞌ Galilea.”
pairs.target: However, after I am raised up, I will go before you into Galilee.”

pairs.source: Petrus moꞌ in-e nyawot Yesus, “Okuꞌ idoh! Simoꞌ nyaꞌa buu togan Ingan, okuꞌ totap idoh!”
pairs.target: But Peter said to him, “Although all will be offended, yet I will not.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot Petrus, in-E, “Natong bonal-bonal-e! Ngalom itih geh takal babang siuak aluaꞌ diꞌ-e bitadu duwoh sidoh, muꞌu moꞌ taluh sidoh sukan nang odop muꞌ diꞌ muꞌ piluh Okuꞌ.”
pairs.target: Jesus said to him, “Most certainly I tell you, that you today, even this night, before the rooster crows twice, you will deny me three times.”

pairs.source: Pak-e Petrus isin-isin in-e, “Simoꞌ okuꞌ tipaksa suwaꞌ kobos duoh Ingan, idoh geh diꞌ kuꞌ sukan nang odop kuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ piluh Ingan.” Pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus deꞌ bokon tuang inoh geh in-e.
pairs.target: But he spoke all the more, “If I must die with you, I will not deny you.” They all said the same thing.

pairs.source: Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E nog keꞌ topat deꞌ adon Getsemani.  Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, “Guluꞌ datiꞌ dioꞌ, Okuꞌ yaꞌ odi bidoa.”
pairs.target: They came to a place which was named Gethsemane. He said to his disciples, “Sit here, while I pray.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ ngijaꞌ Petrus, Yakobus duoh Yohanes odi duoh odop-E.  Yesus sikiya nyam kila-E tolu, otin-e ulih-ulih susah.
pairs.target: He took with him Peter, James, and John, and began to be greatly troubled and distressed.

pairs.source: Iyoh moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ taluh inoh, “Ulih-ulih nyam susah otin Kuꞌ sape yaꞌ kobos nyam Kuꞌ odaꞌ-e.  Loꞌo kajon datiꞌ maꞌ yaꞌ boꞌos!”
pairs.target: He said to them, “My soul is exceedingly sorrowful, even to death. Stay here, and watch.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ ponu muaꞌ juꞌan-e soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.  Yoh moꞌ guluꞌ bikunyug nog jowin-E obuah tanaꞌ, ngan-e bidoa.  Daang doa-E, Iyoh mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, moꞌ-e tapod saꞌ susah jolaꞌ diꞌ-e obuah odop-E.
pairs.target: He went forward a little, and fell on the ground, and prayed that, if it were possible, the hour might pass away from him.

pairs.source: Iyoh bidoa in-e, “Oi Samaꞌ Kuꞌ! Suaꞌ oniꞌ tapod Ingan nai-e.  Okuꞌ mitiaꞌ saꞌ Ingan odaꞌ Okuꞌ lopas soꞌ susah jolaꞌ itih.  Pak-e nai negeh kodaꞌ deꞌ laꞌan Ingan, idoh diꞌ-e kodaꞌ deꞌ laꞌan Okuꞌ.”
pairs.target: He said, “Abba, Father, all things are possible to you. Please remove this cup from me. However, not what I desire, but what you desire.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ bidoa Yesus moꞌ paliꞌ tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-E deꞌ taluh naꞌan inoh.  Iyoh moꞌ ningaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ boꞌos, yohmoꞌ in-e tuduꞌ Simon Petrus, “Simon, boꞌos yeh muꞌu neh? Idoh diꞌ muꞌ taan nijon boton muꞌ niꞌ jam negeh?”
pairs.target: He came and found them sleeping, and said to Peter, “Simon, are you sleeping? Couldn’t you watch one hour?

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, in-e, “Silalu jaga-jaga duoh bidoa, saꞌ diꞌ ingan nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat.  Otin kila ingan laꞌan-e yaꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ bonal, pak-e gonan ingan deꞌ diꞌ-e taan.”
pairs.target: Watch and pray, that you may not enter into temptation. The spirit indeed is willing, but the flesh is weak.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ odi lagiꞌ muaꞌ juꞌan-e soꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, yohmoꞌ bidoa samah kodaꞌ in deꞌ tiꞌ-e.
pairs.target: Again he went away, and prayed, saying the same words.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ bidoa, Yesus paliꞌ lagiꞌ tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ obuaꞌ boꞌos, dop-e diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ taan nijon boton-e.  Takal Yesus guyang odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yohmoꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ puꞌan oni in-e yaꞌ nyawot Yesus.
pairs.target: Again he returned, and found them sleeping, for their eyes were very heavy, and they didn’t know what to answer him.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ paliꞌ keꞌ taluh sidoh-e.  Iyoh moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Aluaꞌ boꞌos keh ingan? Moh tiyaꞌ! Ningaꞌ Onak Manusia obuah nyelah tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa.
pairs.target: He came the third time, and said to them, “Sleep on now, and take your rest. It is enough. The hour has come. Behold, the Son of Man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.

pairs.source: Mokat tiyaꞌ, jaꞌ toꞌ buu.  Ningaꞌ! Nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ nyelah Okuꞌ moꞌ nog!”
pairs.target: Arise, let us be going. Behold, he who betrays me is at hand.”

pairs.source: Takal Yesus aluaꞌ sina, tang-tang mun Yudas nog.  Yudas itih niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ simoong duwoh pinunaꞌ Yesus.  Yudas nog samah-samah duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ deꞌ toban podang duoh pakung.  Ayua pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh, gulu-gulu agama duoh pimipin ulang Yahudi deꞌ bokon deꞌ pait odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ odaꞌ odi saꞌ-e takap Yesus.
pairs.target: Immediately, while he was still speaking, Judas, one of the twelve, came—and with him a multitude with swords and clubs, from the chief priests, the scribes, and the elders.

pairs.source: Yudas, nyaꞌa deꞌ nyelah Yesus, moꞌ dioꞌ tanon tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ in-e, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ sium kuꞌ tiaꞌ inoh leh odop-E.  Takap Iyoh nyeꞌ moꞌ ngawal toban buu.”
pairs.target: Now he who betrayed him had given them a sign, saying, “Whomever I will kiss, that is he. Seize him, and lead him away safely.”

pairs.source: Takal Yudas nog yoh moꞌ lasuꞌ odi tuduꞌ Yesus yoh moꞌ in-e “Gulu!” Yoh moꞌ sium Yesus.
pairs.target: When he had come, immediately he came to him, and said, “Rabbi! Rabbi!” and kissed him.

pairs.source: Ayua deꞌ munoꞌ lasuꞌ takap-E yohmoꞌ bikagong duoh-E.
pairs.target: They laid their hands on him, and seized him.

pairs.source: Niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ ayua deꞌ nunaꞌ Yesus nyitak podang-e, yoh moꞌ lasuꞌ kawiang podang-e nyopaꞌ kuli pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ paling ayuh.  Kojit-e moꞌ lasuꞌ sopial.
pairs.target: But a certain one of those who stood by drew his sword, and struck the servant of the high priest, and cut off his ear.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ ayua deꞌ nog takap odop-E, “Baꞌ ingan nang Okuꞌ pinyamun? Ingan nog sape toban podang, toban pakung ngan ingan takap Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: Jesus answered them, “Have you come out, as against a robber, with swords and clubs to seize me?

pairs.source: Tibilang konu Okuꞌ samah-samah ngajal deꞌ awah Boli Topaꞌ deꞌ jowin ingan, pak-e doiꞌ nak ingan takap Okuꞌ danoꞌ.  Pak-e adin takap leh Okuꞌ, saꞌ-e bonal-bonal samah kodaꞌ deꞌ obuah nulis daang Kitab.”
pairs.target: I was daily with you in the temple teaching, and you didn’t arrest me. But this is so that the Scriptures might be fulfilled.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh suaꞌ pinunaꞌ-E bikoduh buu togan Iyoh.
pairs.target: They all left him, and fled.

pairs.source: Takal inoh, ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan onak mudaꞌ deꞌ jok-e bisabuak kain ngan-e nutu gonan-e bitunaꞌ duoh Yesus.  Ayua deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ nyonguam takap-e.
pairs.target: A certain young man followed him, having a linen cloth thrown around himself over his naked body. The young men grabbed him,

pairs.source: Kain deꞌ gonan-e moꞌ lusut yoh moꞌ bikoduh buu sitagual.
pairs.target: but he left the linen cloth, and fled from them naked.

pairs.source: – 55 Mokuaꞌ inoh ayua deꞌ munoꞌ toban Yesus odi keꞌ boli pimipin agama deꞌ paling ayuh.  Yohmoꞌ suaꞌ pimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh, pimipin-pimipin Yahudi deꞌ bokon duoh gulu-gulu agama tikuluk danoꞌ.  Pak-e Petrus nunaꞌ Yesus soꞌ juuaꞌ nog keꞌ limang boli pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ paling ayuh.  Iyoh moꞌ guluꞌ ngosah nyaꞌa deꞌ jaga simadi-e ngunuh sinok opui.  Pimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh duoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ daang pengadilan agama kalik bukti ngan-e yaꞌ nyalah Yesus saꞌ-e tapod ngukum Yesus odaꞌ kobos, pak-e doiꞌ-e nak tapod salah Yesus.
pairs.target: -55 They led Jesus away to the high priest. All the chief priests, the elders, and the scribes came together with him.   Peter had followed him from a distance, until he came into the court of the high priest. He was sitting with the officers, and warming himself in the light of the fire.   Now the chief priests and the whole council sought witnesses against Jesus to put him to death, and found none.

pairs.source: Bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ mokat nang sina pibulaꞌ-e ngan-e nyalah Yesus, pak-e oniꞌ deꞌ nang odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e niꞌ in.
pairs.target: For many gave false testimony against him, and their testimony didn’t agree with each other.

pairs.source: Yohmoꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ mujuag nang sina pibulaꞌ napo Yesus in-e,
pairs.target: Some stood up, and gave false testimony against him, saying,

pairs.source: “Koꞌih moꞌ ngojit Yoh itih sina, ‘Okuꞌ yaꞌ pilubuh Boli Topaꞌ itih deꞌ obuah nai tongan manusia.  Daang taluh onu Okuꞌ yaꞌ kajuag deꞌ baꞌuh deꞌ diꞌ-e tongan manusia deꞌ nai.’ ”
pairs.target: “We heard him say, ‘I will destroy this temple that is made with hands, and in three days I will build another made without hands.’”

pairs.source: Pak-e oniꞌ deꞌ nang nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ tuang idoh geh diꞌ-e niꞌ in.
pairs.target: Even so, their testimony did not agree.

pairs.source: Pimipin agama deꞌ paling ayuh mokat mujuag deꞌ uun odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.  Iyoh moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Yesus in-e, “Idoh diꞌ muꞌ yaꞌ nyawot sina nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ napo Muꞌu neh?”
pairs.target: The high priest stood up in the middle, and asked Jesus, “Have you no answer? What is it which these testify against you?”

pairs.source: Pak-e Yesus loꞌo jaꞌ-e, diꞌ-e nyawot-e.  Pimipin agama deꞌ paling ayuh sikian niꞌ sidoh lagiꞌ in-e, “Podo Muꞌu yeh Laja Pinyilamat Onak Topaꞌ deꞌ nyomah toꞌ?”
pairs.target: But he stayed quiet, and answered nothing. Again the high priest asked him, “Are you the Christ, the Son of the Blessed?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Bonal, Okuꞌ leh Odop-E.  Suaꞌ ingan yaꞌ ningaꞌ Onak Manusia guluꞌ nuaꞌ toꞌuh Topaꞌ deꞌ Ayuh Kuasa-E.  Yohmoꞌ ingan yaꞌ ningaꞌ Iyoh yaꞌ nog daang abun!”
pairs.target: Jesus said, “I am. You will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of Power, and coming with the clouds of the sky.”

pairs.source: Pimipin agama deꞌ paling ayuh inoh moꞌ notak pimakai-e, yoh in-e, “Dusah tiyaꞌ toꞌ sikian tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon neh!
pairs.target: The high priest tore his clothes, and said, “What further need have we of witnesses?

pairs.source: Ingan moꞌ ngojit sina-E deꞌ nguyat Topaꞌ.  Oni wat otoꞌ yaꞌ duoh Iyoh itih?” Yohmoꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ situju Yesus halus obuah ukum ngabos.
pairs.target: You have heard the blasphemy! What do you think?” They all condemned him to be worthy of death.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa mulai ngujaꞌ-E.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ kuab jowin Yesus yoh moꞌ bibokut duoh-E daang-e in-e tuduꞌ-E, “Suba sobot, osi deꞌ bokut Muꞌu tih?” Nyaꞌa deꞌ jaga danoꞌ suwaꞌ bitapal duoh-E.
pairs.target: Some began to spit on him, and to cover his face, and to beat him with fists, and to tell him, “Prophesy!” The officers struck him with the palms of their hands.

pairs.source: Takal Petrus aluaꞌ ogiꞌ guluꞌ deꞌ limang boli pimipin agama deꞌ paling ayuh, ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan kuli-e deꞌ dayung nog kanoꞌ.
pairs.target: As Peter was in the courtyard below, one of the maids of the high priest came,

pairs.source: Takal-e ningaꞌ Petrus guluꞌ ngunuh kibangoh gonan-e sinok opui, yoh moꞌ bonal-bonal ngibotoh jowin Petrus.  Iyoh moꞌ in-e, “Bah idoh diꞌ-e ingan itih deꞌ silalu nunaꞌ Yesus ulang Nazaret inoh neh?”
pairs.target: and seeing Peter warming himself, she looked at him, and said, “You were also with the Nazarene, Jesus!”

pairs.source: Pak-e yoh moꞌ sukan-e.  Iyoh moꞌ in-e, “Okuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ puꞌan oni deꞌ nang muꞌ inoh.” Mokuaꞌ inoh Petrus moꞌ buu keꞌ limang deꞌ sinok tiban pagal boli pimipin agama deꞌ paling ayuh.  Takal inoh geh babang siuak bitadu.
pairs.target: But he denied it, saying, “I neither know, nor understand what you are saying.” He went out on the porch, and the rooster crowed.

pairs.source: Takal kuli deꞌ dayung inoh ningaꞌ Petrus lagiꞌ, yoh moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ, “Iyoh itih ulang deꞌ silalu bitunaꞌ duoh Yesus.”
pairs.target: The maid saw him, and began again to tell those who stood by, “This is one of them.”

pairs.source: Pak-e Petrus aluaꞌ geh sukan-e.  Aluaꞌ diꞌ-e tuui mokuaꞌ inoh, nyaꞌa danoꞌ in-e lagiꞌ tuduꞌ Petrus, “Diꞌ muꞌ tiyaꞌ ponai sukan-e.  Muꞌu pasti soꞌ ayua deꞌ munoꞌ dop-e muꞌu ulang Galilea.”
pairs.target: But he again denied it. After a little while again those who stood by said to Peter, “You truly are one of them, for you are a Galilean, and your speech shows it.”

pairs.source: Petrus moꞌ sina bisupah in-e, “Doiꞌ kuꞌ piluh osi deꞌ nang ingan inoh neh! Asal kuꞌ pibulaꞌ, tanah saꞌ Topaꞌ ngukum okuꞌ!”
pairs.target: But he began to curse, and to swear, “I don’t know this man of whom you speak!”

pairs.source: Takal inoh geh babang siuak bitadu keꞌ duwoh sidoh-e.  Petrus moꞌ gos nyam-e natong sina Yesus deꞌ dioꞌ, deꞌ in-E, “Aluaꞌ diꞌ babang siuak bitadu duwoh sidoh, muꞌu moꞌ taluh sidoh sukan nang odop muꞌ diꞌ muꞌ piluh Okuꞌ.” Mokuaꞌ inoh kila Petrus moꞌ ngilobuꞌ yohmoꞌ siꞌian.
pairs.target: The rooster crowed the second time. Peter remembered the word, how that Jesus said to him, “Before the rooster crows twice, you will deny me three times.” When he thought about that, he wept.

pairs.source: Suam-suam pagi ayua pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh duoh ayua pimipin ulang Yahudi deꞌ bokon baya gulu-gulu agama Yahudi, suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ moꞌ sipakat.  Yoh moꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa mokos Yesus, mokuaꞌ inoh yoh moꞌ matak Yesus toban tuduꞌ gubelnul deꞌ propinsi Yudea deꞌ adon Pilatus.
pairs.target: Immediately in the morning the chief priests, with the elders and scribes, and the whole council, held a consultation, and bound Jesus, and carried him away, and delivered him up to Pilate.

pairs.source: Gubelnul Pilatus moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Yesus in-e, “Podo tok Muꞌu laja ulang Yahudi?” Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Muꞌu deꞌ sobot nang inoh.”
pairs.target: Pilate asked him, “Are you the King of the Jews?” He answered, “So you say.”

pairs.source: Ayua pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh moꞌ nuduh nang Yoh bogoꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat.
pairs.target: The chief priests accused him of many things.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Pilatus sikian lagiꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus, “Ngojit, bogoꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nuduh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tuduꞌ Muꞌu.  Oni nai diꞌ muꞌ nyawot-e?”
pairs.target: Pilate again asked him, “Have you no answer? See how many things they testify against you!”

pairs.source: Pak-e niꞌ doiꞌ geh sina-e deꞌ nyawot Yesus, yoh ngan Pilatus ilan-e.
pairs.target: But Jesus made no further answer, so that Pilate marveled.

pairs.source: Moꞌ adat-e bilang Onu Ayuh Paskah, Pilatus pilopas niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah jel nunaꞌ deꞌ pilih nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ.
pairs.target: Now at the feast he used to release to them one prisoner, whom they asked of him.

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ adon Barabas.  Iyoh obuah jel samah-samah duoh ayua nyaꞌa deꞌ lawan kerajaan Romawi, dop-e ayua deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngabos nyaꞌa takal nyaꞌa nai liuak daluag-e.
pairs.target: There was one called Barabbas, bound with his fellow insurgents, men who in the insurrection had committed murder.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ deꞌ tikuluk danoꞌ moꞌ mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ Pilatus odaꞌ pilopas niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ jel, nunaꞌ adat-e.
pairs.target: The multitude, crying aloud, began to ask him to do as he always did for them.

pairs.source: Pilatus moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ, “Podo ingan mitiaꞌ odaꞌ okuꞌ pilopas laja ulang Yahudi inoh saꞌan ingan?”
pairs.target: Pilate answered them, saying, “Do you want me to release to you the King of the Jews?”

pairs.source: Dop-e Pilatus moꞌ puꞌan pimipin-pimipin agama ulang Yahudi deꞌ ayuh deꞌ munoꞌ nyelah Yesus tuduꞌ odop-e, dop-e yoh siniaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: For he perceived that for envy the chief priests had delivered him up.

pairs.source: Pak-e ayua pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh moꞌ kibangoh kila nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ odaꞌ pilopas Barabas saꞌan odop-e.
pairs.target: But the chief priests stirred up the multitude, that he should release Barabbas to them instead.

pairs.source: Pilatus moꞌ sikian lagiꞌ keꞌ duwoh sidoh-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Moꞌ-e wat inoh, oni wat kuꞌ yaꞌ duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ nang ingan laja ulang Yahudi inoh?”
pairs.target: Pilate again asked them, “What then should I do to him whom you call the King of the Jews?”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sina daang-e nang bogan-e, “Masak Iyoh tun salip!”
pairs.target: They cried out again, “Crucify him!”

pairs.source: Pilatus sikian lagiꞌ tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Pak-e oni wat oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat deꞌ nai-E?” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ makin dolas nang bogan-e, “Masak Iyoh tun salip!”
pairs.target: Pilate said to them, “Why, what evil has he done?” But they cried out exceedingly, “Crucify him!”

pairs.source: Pilatus moꞌ pilopas Barabas, saꞌ diꞌ nyaꞌa tiyaꞌ nang liuak daluag-e.  Mokuaꞌ inoh yoh moꞌ odaꞌ sidadu-sidadu-e pijolaꞌ Yesus duoh masak tun salip.
pairs.target: Pilate, wishing to please the multitude, released Barabbas to them, and handed over Jesus, when he had flogged him, to be crucified.

pairs.source: Sidadu-sidadu Roma moꞌ toban Yesus kaang boli topat gubelnul militah.  Yoh moꞌ mogan suaꞌ sidadu deꞌ bokon odaꞌ tikuluk danoꞌ.
pairs.target: The soldiers led him away within the court, which is the Praetorium; and they called together the whole cohort.

pairs.source: Ayua sidadu deꞌ munoꞌ pasang jubah walna ungu tuduꞌ Yesus, duoh naꞌ mahkota deꞌ nai-e pakai daꞌan koyuh deꞌ bilojaꞌ deꞌ bak Yesus.
pairs.target: They clothed him with purple, and weaving a crown of thorns, they put it on him.

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ pulaꞌ-pulaꞌ mudi Yesus, daang-e in-e, “Idip laja ulang Yahudi!”
pairs.target: They began to salute him, “Hail, King of the Jews!”

pairs.source: Ayua sidadu deꞌ munoꞌ makung bak Yesus pakai sikuud, ogiꞌ geh odop-e deꞌ ngujaꞌ Yesus.  Mokuaꞌ inoh yoh moꞌ guluꞌ bikunyug deꞌ sulung jowin Yesus pulaꞌ-pulaꞌ pimodo tuduꞌ-E.
pairs.target: They struck his head with a reed, and spat on him, and bowing their knees, did homage to him.

pairs.source: Takal-e mokuaꞌ adoh-adoh wat-e duoh Yesus, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bukaꞌ jubah-E deꞌ walna ungu inoh, yoh moꞌ paliꞌ pasang bojuh odop Yesus.  Mokuaꞌ inoh yoh moꞌ toban buu ngan-e yaꞌ nyalip-E.
pairs.target: When they had mocked him, they took the purple off him, and put his own garments on him. They led him out to crucify him.

pairs.source: Takal-e deꞌ lopot olan, sidadu deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ paksa niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ adon Simon odaꞌ golong salip Yesus.  Simon itih tuang-e nog soꞌ kupuaꞌ yaꞌ molot keꞌ kota.  Iyoh nyaꞌa soꞌ Kirene, samaꞌ Aleksander duoh Rufus.
pairs.target: They compelled one passing by, coming from the country, Simon of Cyrene, the father of Alexander and Rufus, to go with them, that he might bear his cross.

pairs.source: Sidadu-sidadu deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ toban Yesus keꞌ topat deꞌ adon Golgota, loti-e, “Topat Tikuluak.”
pairs.target: They brought him to the place called Golgotha, which is, being interpreted, “The place of a skull.”

pairs.source: Deꞌ danoꞌ, ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ ngin piꞌin anggul deꞌ sapul-e duoh potok koyuh deꞌ sobot-e nang Mur, deꞌ tapod odaꞌ nyaꞌa diꞌ-e sikiya noman gonan-e monam, pak-e Yesus doliaꞌ-e nuak-e.
pairs.target: They offered him wine mixed with myrrh to drink, but he didn’t take it.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ mabak pasak deꞌ tongan poꞌon Yesus deꞌ tun koyuh salip.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bikutung pimakai Yesus pakai ngundi, saꞌ-e puꞌan osi deꞌ soꞌon bojuh-E duoh osi deꞌ soꞌon jubah-E.
pairs.target: Crucifying him, they parted his garments among them, casting lots on them, what each should take.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa nyalip Yesus inoh takal pukul piliꞌi pagi.
pairs.target: It was the third hour,  and they crucified him.

pairs.source: Deꞌ tun salip-E ogiꞌ tulis deꞌ nopia nyaꞌa, ngan-e sobot luban nyaꞌa nyalip Yesus deꞌ in-e, “Laja ulang Yahudi.”
pairs.target: The superscription of his accusation was written over him, “THE KING OF THE JEWS.”

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ duwoh naꞌan pinyamun deꞌ obuah nyalip bibaya-baya duoh Yesus.  Niꞌ naꞌan nuaꞌ toꞌuh-E, niꞌ naꞌan nuaꞌ boit-E.
pairs.target: With him they crucified two robbers; one on his right hand, and one on his left.

pairs.source: Oniꞌ deꞌ obuah Yesus inoh, moꞌ bonal-bonal jadi samah duoh deꞌ moꞌ obuah nulis daang Kitab, deꞌ in-e, “Nyaꞌa moꞌ nang Iyoh samah duoh ulang jaꞌat.”
pairs.target: The Scripture was fulfilled, which says, “He was counted with transgressors.”

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ ngilusuꞌ topat inoh moꞌ adoh-adoh in-e duoh Yesus, daang-e kuting bak-e, yohmoꞌ in-e, “No mey-e, patut Muꞌu nang odop Muꞌ yaꞌ pilubuh Boli Topaꞌ, duoh yaꞌ paliꞌ kajuag baꞌuh daang taluh onu
pairs.target: Those who passed by blasphemed him, wagging their heads, and saying, “Ha! You who destroy the temple, and build it in three days,

pairs.source: Suba muun soꞌ tun salip, nyilamat odop Muꞌ!”
pairs.target: save yourself, and come down from the cross!”

pairs.source: Watnoh geh pimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh duoh gulu-gulu agama Yahudi suwaꞌ geh adoh-adoh in-e duoh Yesus.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sina tipan odop-e, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon Iyoh nyilamat-e, pak-e Iyoh diꞌ-e taan nyilamat Odop-E sadiꞌ-e!
pairs.target: Likewise, also the chief priests mocking among themselves with the scribes said, “He saved others. He can’t save himself.

pairs.source: Simoꞌ Iyoh tok-tok Laja Pinyilamat ulang Israel, tanah saꞌ-e muun soꞌ salip, saꞌ otoꞌ ningaꞌ-E, otoꞌ moꞌ bisayaꞌ.” Wat inoh geh pinyamun deꞌ suwaꞌ obuah nyalip samah-samah duoh Yesus, suwaꞌ geh adoh-adoh in-e duoh Yesus.
pairs.target: Let the Christ, the King of Israel, now come down from the cross, that we may see and believe him.”  Those who were crucified with him also insulted him.

pairs.source: Takal uun onu pukul simoong duwoh, suaꞌ pulou moꞌ mopung, nog pukul taluh ngumi.
pairs.target: When the sixth hour  had come, there was darkness over the whole land until the ninth hour.

pairs.source: Takal pukul taluh ngumi inoh Yesus moꞌ nang bogan-e, in-E, “Eloi, Eloi, lema sabakhtani?” Deꞌ loti-e, “Topaꞌ Kuꞌ, Topaꞌ Kuꞌ, oni nai Ingan togan Okuꞌ?”
pairs.target: At the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice, saying, “Eloi, Eloi, lama sabachthani?” which is, being interpreted, “My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?”

pairs.source: Takal nyaꞌa danoꞌ ngojit Yesus nang bogan-e, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e, “Ngojit, Iyoh mogan adon nabi Elia!”
pairs.target: Some of those who stood by, when they heard it, said, “Behold, he is calling Elijah.”

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ odi mit lumut deꞌ nyolap piꞌin, yoh moꞌ suad daang piꞌin anggul deꞌ masuam, yoh moꞌ naꞌ deꞌ tubon tisuk koyuh ngan-e nyog deꞌ bobaꞌ Yesus, daang-e sina, “Jaꞌ toꞌ kajon-e! Toꞌ ningaꞌ-e podo nabi Elia nog pimuun Iyoh soꞌ tun salip.”
pairs.target: One ran, and filling a sponge full of vinegar, put it on a reed, and gave it to him to drink, saying, “Let him be. Let’s see whether Elijah comes to take him down.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nang bogan-e lagiꞌ, mokuaꞌ inoh asong-e moꞌ doiꞌ.
pairs.target: Jesus cried out with a loud voice, and gave up the spirit.

pairs.source: Takal inoh geh tabial daang Boli Topaꞌ moꞌ totak jadin duwoh amal soꞌ somu nog douꞌ.
pairs.target: The veil of the temple was torn in two from the top to the bottom.

pairs.source: Takal piayuh sidadu Roma deꞌ mujuag deꞌ jowin salip Yesus moꞌ ningaꞌ pingobos-E deꞌ wat inoh, yoh moꞌ in-e, “Tok bonal Nyaꞌa itih Onak Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: When the centurion, who stood by opposite him, saw that he cried out like this and breathed his last, he said, “Truly this man was the Son of God!”

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ geh bala dayung deꞌ suwaꞌ ningaꞌ nyaꞌa nyalip Yesus soꞌ juuaꞌ.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ Maria Magdalena, Salome, baya Maria sinoꞌ Yakobus deꞌ mudaꞌ duoh Yoses.
pairs.target: There were also women watching from afar, among whom were both Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James the less and of Joses, and Salome;

pairs.source: Dayung-dayung deꞌ mutiꞌ leh deꞌ bitunaꞌ duoh Yesus takal-e deꞌ Galilea ngan-e tulung-E.  Bogoꞌ geh dayung-dayung deꞌ bokon deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ deꞌ suwaꞌ nog keꞌ Yerusalem samah-samah duoh Yesus.
pairs.target: who, when he was in Galilee, followed him, and served him; and many other women who came up with him to Jerusalem.
When evening had now come, because it was the Preparation Day, that is, the day before the Sabbath,

pairs.source: Takal onu moꞌ yaꞌ ngalom Yusuf soꞌ kupuaꞌ Arimatea nog.Yusuf itih suwaꞌ jadin ayua soꞌ Pengadilan Agama Yahudi deꞌ pimodo nyaꞌa daꞌ-e.  Yoh itih tuang suwaꞌ geh kajon Topaꞌ yaꞌ nog militah jadin Laja.  Onu inoh, nyaꞌa moꞌ siap-siap yaꞌ nyamut Onu Sabat.  Inoh leh ngan-e yoh maksa-e jaꞌ-e odop-e odi ngaduap Pilatus, yohmoꞌ mitiaꞌ todang Yesus ngan-e yaꞌ ngubul-e.
pairs.target: Joseph of Arimathaea, a prominent council member who also himself was looking for God’s Kingdom, came. He boldly went in to Pilate, and asked for Jesus’ body.

pairs.source: Pilatus moꞌ ilan-e takal-e ngojit Yesus moꞌ kobos.  Iyoh moꞌ mogan piayuh sidadu ngan-e yaꞌ sikian podo Yesus moꞌ bonal-bonal kobos.
pairs.target: Pilate marveled if he were already dead; and summoning the centurion, he asked him whether he had been dead long.

pairs.source: Takal-e moꞌ ngojit soꞌ piayuh sidadu inoh nang Yesus moꞌ kobos, yoh moꞌ odaꞌ Yusuf mit todang Yesus.
pairs.target: When he found out from the centurion, he granted the body to Joseph.

pairs.source: Yusuf moꞌ milih kain mopuꞌ ngan-e yaꞌ molut todang.  Mokuaꞌ inoh yoh moꞌ pimuun todang Yesus, yoh moꞌ molut-e, yoh moꞌ naꞌ daang kubul gua.  Mokuaꞌ inoh yoh pigulai batuh deꞌ ayuh ngan-e kuab kubul gua inoh.
pairs.target: He bought a linen cloth, and taking him down, wound him in the linen cloth, and laid him in a tomb which had been cut out of a rock. He rolled a stone against the door of the tomb.

pairs.source: Takal inoh ogiꞌ Maria Magdalena duoh Maria sinoꞌ Yoses suwaꞌ ningaꞌ topat nyaꞌa piguling todang Yesus.
pairs.target: Mary Magdalene and Mary, the mother of Joses, saw where he was laid.

pairs.source: Takal mokuaꞌ onu Sabat, Maria Magdalena, Salome, duoh Maria sinoꞌ Yakobus odi milih inyuaꞌ wangi deꞌ yaꞌ toban-e keꞌ kubul gua, ngan-e yaꞌ nginyuaꞌ todang Yesus.
pairs.target: When the Sabbath was past, Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James, and Salome, bought spices, that they might come and anoint him.

pairs.source: Daang puꞌun minggu inoh, suam-suam pagi takal boton onu moꞌ tumuꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ odi keꞌ kubul gua.
pairs.target: Very early on the first day of the week, they came to the tomb when the sun had risen.

pairs.source: Deꞌ lopot olan yoh moꞌ bisikian si odop-e, “Osi deꞌ taan gulai batuh deꞌ kuab kubul gua saꞌan otoꞌ?”
pairs.target: They were saying among themselves, “Who will roll away the stone from the door of the tomb for us?”

pairs.source: Pak-e takal-e moꞌ sinok kubul gua inoh, yoh moꞌ ningaꞌ batuh deꞌ sukup ayuh inoh moꞌ tigulai.
pairs.target: for it was very big. Looking up, they saw that the stone was rolled back.

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ molot kaang kubul gua inoh, yoh moꞌ gogoh takal-e ningaꞌ ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan onak mudaꞌ deꞌ pakai bojuh mopuꞌ guluꞌ nuaꞌ toꞌuh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: Entering into the tomb, they saw a young man sitting on the right side, dressed in a white robe, and they were amazed.

pairs.source: Onak mudaꞌ inoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Maꞌ tolu! Okuꞌ puꞌan nang ingan kalik Yesus ulang Nazaret deꞌ moꞌ obuah nyalib inoh.  Iyoh moꞌ doiꞌ datiꞌ! Iyoh moꞌ paliꞌ idip! Ningaꞌ itih topat nyaꞌa posan todang-E.
pairs.target: He said to them, “Don’t be amazed. You seek Jesus, the Nazarene, who has been crucified. He has risen. He is not here. Behold, the place where they laid him!

pairs.source: Buu paliꞌ adin, tanon gah itih tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E baya Petrus.  In nyeꞌ tanon tuduꞌ-e, ‘Yesus dioꞌ odi kajon ingan deꞌ Galilea.  Danih leh ingan yaꞌ bitapod duoh Iyoh kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ dioꞌ-e tanon-E.’ ”
pairs.target: But go, tell his disciples and Peter, ‘He goes before you into Galilee. There you will see him, as he said to you.’”

pairs.source: Daang kila deꞌ gogoh duoh sukup tolu-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bikoduh luah togan kubul gua inoh.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e tanon oni-oni-e tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tapod-e deꞌ olan dop-e yoh tolu.  Yesus bitanga Odop-E tuduꞌ Maria Magdalena
pairs.target: They went out, and fled from the tomb, for trembling and astonishment had come on them. They said nothing to anyone; for they were afraid.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ Yesus moꞌ paliꞌ idip, suam-suam pagi deꞌ puꞌun minggu inoh, Iyoh moꞌ bitanga odop-E, sibungas-e tuduꞌ Maria Magdalena.  Iyoh itih leh deꞌ ogiꞌ onu Yesus kasig juꞌ muat munua soꞌ gonan-e.
pairs.target: Now when he had risen early on the first day of the week, he appeared first to Mary Magdalene, from whom he had cast out seven demons.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Maria Magdalena moꞌ odi tanon tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus deꞌ aluaꞌ siꞌian, dop-e yoh aluaꞌ susah otin-e.
pairs.target: She went and told those who had been with him, as they mourned and wept.

pairs.source: Pak-e takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ngojit soꞌ Maria Magdalena nang yoh kilin Yesus paliꞌ mokat idip, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ.
pairs.target: When they heard that he was alive, and had been seen by her, they disbelieved.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ bitanga Odop-E tuduꞌ duwoh naꞌan pinunaꞌ-E, pak-e okon mun jowin-E, takal odop-e deꞌ duwoh daang pimonu-e soꞌ Yerusalem odi keꞌ kupuaꞌ deꞌ bokon.
pairs.target: After these things he was revealed in another form to two of them, as they walked, on their way into the country.

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ duwoh moꞌ paliꞌ tuduꞌ dingan-dingan-e yohmoꞌ tanon suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ kilin-e.  Pak-e ayua dingan-e tuang idoh geh diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ.
pairs.target: They went away and told it to the rest. They didn’t believe them, either.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus sadiꞌ-e lasuꞌ bitapod duoh simoong niꞌ naꞌan pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ aluaꞌ julah-e man.  Yesus moꞌ ngalah odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, dop-e suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ liꞌiang bak-e duoh doliaꞌ-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tanon nang odop-e moꞌ ningaꞌ Yesus takal-e paliꞌ idip.
pairs.target: Afterward he was revealed to the eleven themselves as they sat at the table, and he rebuked them for their unbelief and hardness of heart, because they didn’t believe those who had seen him after he had risen.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, in-E, “Kodak leh nog tubon longit nyeꞌ moꞌ magah Gah deꞌ Paguh soꞌ Topaꞌ tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa.
pairs.target: He said to them, “Go into all the world, and preach the Good News to the whole creation.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ duoh obuah baptis iyoh yaꞌ silamat.  Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ yaꞌ obuah ngukum.
pairs.target: He who believes and is baptized will be saved; but he who disbelieves will be condemned.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, Okuꞌ ngin kuasa tuduꞌ-e odaꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa.  Ingan tapod kasig muat munua daang adon Okuꞌ, ponai nang sina deꞌ aluaꞌ doiꞌ sidoh ingan bilajal-e.
pairs.target: These signs will accompany those who believe: in my name they will cast out demons; they will speak with new languages;

pairs.source: Moꞌ nyam ingan kagian dipoh duoh nuak lasun doiꞌ geh oni-oni wat ingan odaꞌ-e.  Moꞌ nyam ingan tomaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ monam, iyoh tapod mokuaꞌ.”
pairs.target: they will take up serpents; and if they drink any deadly thing, it will in no way hurt them; they will lay hands on the sick, and they will recover.”

pairs.source: Takal-e mokuaꞌ sina duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, Topaꞌ Yesus moꞌ tipa'ad keꞌ siluga.  Danih Iyoh moꞌ militah samah-samah duoh Topaꞌ Samaꞌ deꞌ siluga.
pairs.target: So then the Lord, after he had spoken to them, was received up into heaven, and sat down at the right hand of God.

pairs.source: Pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ odi niꞌ pulou-pulou tanon Gah deꞌ Paguh soꞌ Topaꞌ.  Odop Topaꞌ tuang suwaꞌ geh kiloja samah-samah duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.  Iyoh ngin-e geh kuasa tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ saꞌ-e nai bogoꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa, saꞌ-e jadin tanda nang gah deꞌ tanon-e inoh bonal-bonal soꞌ Topaꞌ.     GAH DEꞌ PAGUH DEꞌ TANON LUKAS
pairs.target: They went out, and preached everywhere, the Lord working with them, and confirming the word by the signs that followed. Amen.

pairs.source: Pinajoh Tuduꞌ ingan Teofilius, Noꞌuh-e bogoꞌ nyaꞌa yaꞌ suba nulis silita pingidip Yesus, nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ jadi daang uluk otoꞌ.
pairs.target: Since many have undertaken to set in order a narrative concerning those matters which have been fulfilled among us,

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nulis silita inoh samah kodaꞌ oni deꞌ tanon nyaꞌa deꞌ tok-tok ogiꞌ kilin duoh magah oni deꞌ soꞌ sibungas-e oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ jadi.
pairs.target: even as those who from the beginning were eyewitnesses and servants of the word delivered them to us,

pairs.source: Sobab inoh okuꞌ moꞌ tiluti silita inoh tiꞌ-e soꞌ sibungas-e, okuꞌ kila paguh okuꞌ nulis buk-e saꞌan ingan.
pairs.target: it seemed good to me also, having traced the course of all things accurately from the first, to write to you in order, most excellent Theophilus;

pairs.source: Saꞌ ingan puꞌan, oni sijaꞌ-e deꞌ obuah tanon duoh deꞌ obuah ngajal suaꞌ-e inoh tok-tok bonal jadi.
pairs.target: that you might know the certainty concerning the things in which you were instructed.

pairs.source: Takal Herodes jadi laja deꞌ propinsi Yudea, ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ adon-e Zakharia soꞌ uluk Abia.  Sowon-e onak-sukun Harun deꞌ adon-e Elisabet.
pairs.target: There was in the days of Herod, the king of Judea, a certain priest named Zacharias, of the priestly division of Abijah. He had a wife of the daughters of Aaron, and her name was Elizabeth.

pairs.source: Idip Zakharia duwoh sowon-e nyonang otin Topaꞌ, sobab odop-e deꞌ duwoh silalu idip nunaꞌ plitah Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: They were both righteous before God, walking blamelessly in all the commandments and ordinances of the Lord.

pairs.source: Pak-e odop-e deꞌ duwoh noh aluaꞌ doiꞌ onak-e sobab Elisabet manang yomoꞌ soꞌ duwoh odop-e moꞌ sikiya nyoma.
pairs.target: But they had no child, because Elizabeth was barren, and they both were well advanced in years.

pairs.source: Takal nog onu-e uluk Abia soꞌon tugas, watinoh geh Zakharia nai kiloja-e daang Boli Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: Now while he executed the priest’s office before God in the order of his division,

pairs.source: Yomoꞌ takal-e nguni kodaꞌ deꞌ biasa pimipin agama Yahudi nai-e Zakharia deꞌ soꞌon, yoh deꞌ nyouh kinamai daang Boli Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: according to the custom of the priest’s office, his lot was to enter into the temple of the Lord and burn incense.

pairs.source: Takal-e nyouh kinamai, nyaꞌa bogoꞌ bidoa deꞌ sopaꞌ.
pairs.target: The whole multitude of the people were praying outside at the hour of incense.

pairs.source: Takal inoh ogiꞌ malaikat Topaꞌ bitanga odop-e tuduꞌ Zakharia.  Iyoh mujuag deꞌ nuwaꞌ toꞌuh mija soꞌ topat-e nyouh kinamai.
pairs.target: An angel of the Lord appeared to him, standing on the right side of the altar of incense.

pairs.source: Takal Zakharia ningaꞌ malaikat inoh, iyoh moꞌ gogoh simadi-e tolu.
pairs.target: Zacharias was troubled when he saw him, and fear fell upon him.

pairs.source: Pak-e malaikat inoh moꞌ sina in-e, “Maꞌ tolu, Zakharia! Sobab Topaꞌ moꞌ ngojit doamuꞌ, sowonmuꞌ Elisabet yaꞌ milaꞌ onak dali, yomoꞌ muꞌu halus biladon onak inoh Yohanes.
pairs.target: But the angel said to him, “Don’t be afraid, Zacharias, because your request has been heard, and your wife, Elizabeth, will bear you a son, and you shall call his name John.

pairs.source: Muꞌu baya suaꞌ nyaꞌa suwaꞌ doon takal onak inoh limokah tieꞌ sodiꞌ neh.
pairs.target: You will have joy and gladness; and many will rejoice at his birth.

pairs.source: Iyoh timogah deꞌ boton Topaꞌ, iyoh idoh diꞌ-e nuak pingunuak deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa mabuk, soꞌ daang toꞌin sinoꞌ-e geh iyoh moꞌ punuaꞌ odaꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: For he will be great in the sight of the Lord, and he will drink no wine nor strong drink. He will be filled with the Holy Spirit, even from his mother’s womb.

pairs.source: Yoh yaꞌ toban bogoꞌ ulang Israel paliꞌ saꞌan nunaꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ militah idip-e.
pairs.target: He will turn many of the children of Israel to the Lord, their God.

pairs.source: Iyoh yaꞌ nyidia nyaꞌa saꞌan tilimaꞌ Topaꞌ duoh Topaꞌ yaꞌ ngin kuasa tuduꞌ-e saꞌ-a ponai kiloja kodaꞌ nabi Elia, deꞌ ponai nai samaꞌ duoh onak bidamai, yomoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e taat iyoh toban paliꞌ keꞌ olan Topaꞌ.  Watinoh wat-e iyoh sidia umat kaꞌan Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: He will go before him in the spirit and power of Elijah, ‘to turn the hearts of the fathers to the children,’ and the disobedient to the wisdom of the just; to prepare a people prepared for the Lord.”

pairs.source: Yomoꞌ in Zakharia tuduꞌ malaikat inoh, “Oniwat kuꞌ yaꞌ puꞌan oni deꞌ nang ingan inoh yaꞌ bonal jadi? Oni tanda-e? Sobab okuꞌ duoh sowonkuꞌ moꞌ nyoma.”
pairs.target: Zacharias said to the angel, “How can I be sure of this? For I am an old man, and my wife is well advanced in years.”

pairs.source: Malaikat inoh moꞌ nyawot-e, “Okuꞌ itih Gabriel.  Okuꞌ itih utusan Topaꞌ kaꞌan tanon gah deꞌ paguh itih tuduꞌ muꞌu.
pairs.target: The angel answered him, “I am Gabriel, who stands in the presence of God. I was sent to speak to you, and to bring you this good news.

pairs.source: Oniꞌ deꞌ nang kuꞌ itih totap jadi takal onu-e, pak-e sobab muꞌu diꞌ muꞌ bisayaꞌ, muꞌu bebeꞌ nog suaꞌ-suaꞌ sinakuꞌ itih tok-tok jadi.”
pairs.target: Behold, you will be silent and not able to speak, until the day that these things will happen, because you didn’t believe my words, which will be fulfilled in their proper time.”

pairs.source: Takal inoh nyaꞌa bogoꞌ kajon Zakharia, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ilan oni ngan Zakharia tian oni daang Boli Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: The people were waiting for Zacharias, and they marveled that he delayed in the temple.

pairs.source: Takal-e luah, iyoh diꞌ-e ponai sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, yomoꞌ tanon tanda pakai tongan-e.  Takal inoh nyaꞌa bogoꞌ puꞌan nang iyoh ogiꞌ kilin tanda soꞌ Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: When he came out, he could not speak to them, and they perceived that he had seen a vision in the temple. He continued making signs to them, and remained mute.

pairs.source: Takal onu kiloja-e moꞌ obuaꞌ, iyoh moꞌ paliꞌ keꞌ boli-e.
pairs.target: When the days of his service were fulfilled, he departed to his house.

pairs.source: Diꞌ-e tui soꞌ inoh, Elisabet moꞌ bitiiaꞌ.  Limoh bulan iyoh diꞌ-e luah soꞌ boli-e.
pairs.target: After these days Elizabeth, his wife, conceived, and she hid herself five months, saying,

pairs.source: Yomoꞌ sina in-e, “Sobab Topaꞌ moꞌ tulung okuꞌ, okuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ tiaꞌ dasaꞌ deꞌ nyaꞌa bogoꞌ.”
pairs.target: “Thus has the Lord done to me in the days in which he looked at me, to take away my reproach among men.”

pairs.source: Takal tiiaꞌ Elisabet moꞌ nuam bulan, Topaꞌ odaꞌ malaikat deꞌ adon-e Gabriel odi keꞌ Nazaret, kota deꞌ propinsi Galilea.
pairs.target: Now in the sixth month, the angel Gabriel was sent from God to a city of Galilee, named Nazareth,

pairs.source: Gabriel odi tuduꞌ dayung bujang tiboon, deꞌ adon-e Maria.  Maria inoh moꞌ bitunang duoh dali deꞌ adon-e Yusuf onak-sukun laja Daud.
pairs.target: to a virgin pledged to be married to a man whose name was Joseph, of David’s house. The virgin’s name was Mary.

pairs.source: Malaikat inoh nog tuduꞌ Maria yoh moꞌ sina in-e, “Salam, muꞌu deꞌ obuah bilokat deꞌ jok-e saꞌan muꞌu soꞌ Topaꞌ, Topaꞌ bisamah duoh muꞌu!”
pairs.target: Having come in, the angel said to her, “Rejoice, you highly favored one! The Lord is with you. Blessed are you among women!”

pairs.source: Maria moꞌ gogoh sijaꞌ-e ngojit sina malaikat inoh, yoh moꞌ sina daang otin-e oni loti salam inoh.
pairs.target: But when she saw him, she was greatly troubled at the saying, and considered what kind of salutation this might be.

pairs.source: Inohleh sobab-e malaikat moꞌ sina in-e, “Maꞌ muꞌ tolu Maria, sobab Topaꞌ yaꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ paguh tuduꞌ muꞌu.
pairs.target: The angel said to her, “Don’t be afraid, Mary, for you have found favor with God.

pairs.source: Ngojit nyeꞌ! Muꞌu totap yaꞌ bitiiaꞌ, mokuaꞌ inoh milaꞌ onak dali deꞌ halus muꞌ biladon Yesus.
pairs.target: Behold, you will conceive in your womb, and give birth to a son, and will call his name ‘Jesus.’

pairs.source: Yoh yaꞌ jadi piayuh timogah duoh yaꞌ obuah sobot Onak Topaꞌ deꞌ Paling Bigatung-e.  Topaꞌ yaꞌ pakat yoh jadi Laja kodaꞌ Daud sumuk babai-E.
pairs.target: He will be great, and will be called the Son of the Most High. The Lord God will give him the throne of his father, David,

pairs.source: Yoh deꞌ yaꞌ militah jadin Laja tun bangsa Israel deꞌ sitelus-e, diꞌ-e ponai obuaꞌ.”
pairs.target: and he will reign over the house of Jacob forever. There will be no end to his Kingdom.”

pairs.source: In Maria tuduꞌ malaikat inoh, “Pak-e okuꞌ tih dayung bujang tiboon, oni wat-e ngan neh ponai jadi watinoh?”
pairs.target: Mary said to the angel, “How can this be, seeing I am a virgin?”

pairs.source: Malaikat inoh moꞌ nyawot Maria in-e, “Iyang Topaꞌ muun tuduꞌ muꞌu, kuasa Topaꞌ inohleh deꞌ odaꞌ muꞌu bitiiaꞌ inoh ngan Onak Kudus deꞌ yaꞌ muꞌu milaꞌ inoh obuah sobot Onak Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: The angel answered her, “The Holy Spirit will come on you, and the power of the Most High will overshadow you. Therefore also the holy one who is born from you will be called the Son of God.

pairs.source: Puꞌan muꞌ kedoh, Elisabet, madihmuꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nyoma, deꞌ diꞌ-e ponai bitiiaꞌ noꞌuh-e sobab yoh manang, adin moꞌ bitiiaꞌ nuam bulan.
pairs.target: Behold, Elizabeth, your relative, also has conceived a son in her old age; and this is the sixth month with her who was called barren.

pairs.source: Sobab doiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ Topaꞌ dapod nai-e.”
pairs.target: For nothing spoken by God is impossible.”

pairs.source: Maria moꞌ sina in-e, “Okuꞌ itih kuli Topaꞌ tanahleh saꞌ-e jadi tuduꞌ okuꞌ kodaꞌ deꞌ nang ingan noh.” Mokuaꞌ noh malaikat moꞌ buu togan Maria.
pairs.target: Mary said, “Behold, the servant of the Lord; let it be done to me according to your word.” The angel departed from her.

pairs.source: Kudu-kudu onu mokuaꞌ inoh, Maria moꞌ bigaut-biguaꞌ odi keꞌ kota deꞌ sinok dolod-dolod deꞌ propinsi Yudea.
pairs.target: Mary arose in those days and went into the hill country with haste, into a city of Judah,

pairs.source: Danoꞌ iyoh molot keꞌ boli Zakharia, yomoꞌ ngin salam tuduꞌ Elisabet.
pairs.target: and entered into the house of Zacharias and greeted Elizabeth.

pairs.source: Takal Elisabet ngojit salam soꞌ Maria, onak daang toꞌin-e moꞌ kimilit, yomoꞌ Elisabet punuaꞌ daang Iyang Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: When Elizabeth heard Mary’s greeting, the baby leaped in her womb, and Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit.

pairs.source: Elisabet moꞌ nang sina dolas-dolas-e, “Obuah bilokat muꞌu soꞌ suaꞌ dayung deꞌ bokon! Obuah bilokat onakmuꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ limokah!
pairs.target: She called out with a loud voice, and said, “Blessed are you among women, and blessed is the fruit of your womb!

pairs.source: Bituah manah okuꞌ itih ngan sinoꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ kuꞌ nog tuduꞌ okuꞌ.
pairs.target: Why am I so favored, that the mother of my Lord should come to me?

pairs.source: Takal okuꞌ ngojit salam muꞌu, onak daang toꞌin kuꞌ lasuꞌ kimilit doon.
pairs.target: For behold, when the voice of your greeting came into my ears, the baby leaped in my womb for joy!

pairs.source: Doonleh muꞌu Maria, sobab muꞌu bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ tanon Topaꞌ inoh tok yaꞌ jadi.”
pairs.target: Blessed is she who believed, for there will be a fulfillment of the things which have been spoken to her from the Lord!”

pairs.source: Maria moꞌ sina in-e, “Otinkuꞌ mudi Topaꞌ,
pairs.target: Mary said, “My soul magnifies the Lord.

pairs.source: duoh kilakuꞌ sonang sobab Topaꞌ Pinyilamat okuꞌ.
pairs.target: My spirit has rejoiced in God my Savior,

pairs.source: Iyoh natong okuꞌ, kuli-E deꞌ hina itih! Soꞌ adin suaꞌ-suaꞌ binua nang okuꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ paling sonang-e.
pairs.target: for he has looked at the humble state of his servant. For behold, from now on, all generations will call me blessed.

pairs.source: Sobab Topaꞌ deꞌ Paling Bikuasa duoh deꞌ moꞌ nai bogoꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ayuh tuduꞌ okuꞌ.  Kudusleh adon-E!
pairs.target: For he who is mighty has done great things for me. Holy is his name.

pairs.source: Duoh Topaꞌ silalu masiꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ idip tolu tuduꞌ Iyoh.
pairs.target: His mercy is for generations of generations on those who fear him.

pairs.source: Iyoh bitanga kuasa pakai tongan-E, Yoh odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ samuh otin-e buu katiꞌ-kanih.
pairs.target: He has shown strength with his arm. He has scattered the proud in the imagination of their hearts.

pairs.source: Topaꞌ pilabuꞌ laja-laja deꞌ militah, pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ hina, Iyoh kakat-e.
pairs.target: He has put down princes from their thrones. And has exalted the lowly.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ pilai Iyoh odaꞌ busuah, pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ kaya Iyoh odaꞌ buꞌu boloh-boloh-e.
pairs.target: He has filled the hungry with good things. He has sent the rich away empty.
He has given help to Israel, his servant, that he might remember mercy,

pairs.source: Iyoh tulung Israel kuli-E sobab Iyoh natong janyi-e tuduꞌ sumuk babai toꞌ.  Topaꞌ natong janyi-e, Iyoh masiꞌ tuduꞌ Abraham baya otoꞌ onak sukun-e nog sitelus-e.”
pairs.target: As he spoke to our fathers, to Abraham and his offspring forever.”

pairs.source: Kulang lobih taluh bulan Maria loꞌo duoh Elisabet, ke iyoh paliꞌ keꞌ boli-e.
pairs.target: Mary stayed with her about three months, and then returned to her house.

pairs.source: Takal-e moꞌ nog onu Elisabet yaꞌ milaꞌ.  Iyoh moꞌ milaꞌ onak dali.
pairs.target: Now the time that Elizabeth should give birth was fulfilled, and she gave birth to a son.

pairs.source: Madih ayua-e baya dingan-e moꞌ suwaꞌ sonang kila-e, takal-e moh klingah gah Topaꞌ sukup paguh otin tuduꞌ Elisabet.
pairs.target: Her neighbors and her relatives heard that the Lord had magnified his mercy towards her, and they rejoiced with her.

pairs.source: Takal onak kueꞌ inoh moih onu umul-e, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nog yaꞌ bisunat-e, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ biladon-e Zakharia kodaꞌ adon samaꞌ-a,
pairs.target: On the eighth day, they came to circumcise the child; and they would have called him Zacharias, after the name of his father.

pairs.source: pak-e sinoꞌ-e nang, “Idoh! Adon-e Yohanes.”
pairs.target: His mother answered, “Not so; but he will be called John.”

pairs.source: Pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nang in-e, “Doiꞌ nak ogiꞌ madih ayuamuꞌ deꞌ adon inoh.”
pairs.target: They said to her, “There is no one among your relatives who is called by this name.”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngin tanda tuduꞌ Zakharia ngan-e yaꞌ sikian adon onak-e.
pairs.target: They made signs to his father, what he would have him called.

pairs.source: Zakharia moꞌ mitiaꞌ batuh, iyoh moꞌ nulis deꞌ tun-e, “Adon-e Yohanes.” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ilan-e.
pairs.target: He asked for a writing tablet, and wrote, “His name is John.” They all marveled.

pairs.source: Takal inoh geh Zakharia moꞌ lasuꞌ ponai paliꞌ sina yoh moꞌ mudi Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: His mouth was opened immediately, and his tongue freed, and he spoke, blessing God.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ loꞌo sinoꞌ iyoh moꞌ tolu, ngojit duoh ningaꞌ oni deꞌ moꞌ jadi, gah inoh suaꞌ-suaꞌ nyaꞌa ngojit-e nog suaꞌ dolod-dolod deꞌ propinsi Yudea.
pairs.target: Fear came on all who lived around them, and all these sayings were talked about throughout all the hill country of Judea.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit gah inoh moꞌ sina daang otin-e, “Yaꞌ jadi oni onak-e inoh tiaꞌ ijoꞌ?” Sobab Topaꞌ moꞌ bisamah duoh-o.
pairs.target: All who heard them laid them up in their heart, saying, “What then will this child be?” The hand of the Lord was with him.

pairs.source: Zakharia, samaꞌ onak kueꞌ inoh punuaꞌ daang Iyang Topaꞌ, yomoꞌ tanon sibaya soꞌ Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: His father, Zacharias, was filled with the Holy Spirit, and prophesied, saying,

pairs.source: Iyoh moꞌ sina in-e, “Jaꞌ otoꞌ mudi Topaꞌ, Topaꞌ bangsa Israel! Sobab Iyoh moꞌ nog tulung duoh pilopas umat-E.
pairs.target: “Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel, for he has visited and redeemed his people;

pairs.source: Iyoh moh ngin pinyilamat deꞌ bikuasa tuduꞌ otoꞌ soꞌ onak-sukun laja Daud, kuli-E.
pairs.target: and has raised up a horn of salvation for us in the house of his servant David

pairs.source: Topaꞌ moꞌ ngin pinyilamat inoh kodaꞌ deꞌ janyi-E, pakai nabi-nabi deꞌ obuah pilih-E noꞌuh-e,
pairs.target: (as he spoke by the mouth of his holy prophets who have been from of old),

pairs.source: kaꞌan pilopas otoꞌ soꞌ musoh baya soꞌ kuasa nyaꞌa deꞌ buꞌui tuduꞌ otoꞌ.
pairs.target: salvation from our enemies, and from the hand of all who hate us;

pairs.source: Ngan-e bitanga nyayang-E tuduꞌ sumuk babai otoꞌ, Iyoh moꞌ nai samah kodaꞌ janyi-E deꞌ kudus.
pairs.target: to show mercy towards our fathers, to remember his holy covenant,
the oath which he swore to Abraham, our father,

pairs.source: Sobab Iyoh moꞌ bijanyi duoh bisupah tuduꞌ Abraham sumuk babai otoꞌ, yomoꞌ bijanyi pilopas otoꞌ soꞌ musoh toꞌ, saꞌ otoꞌ diꞌ toꞌ tolu tiaꞌ takal toꞌ simayang tuduꞌ-E,
pairs.target: to grant to us that we, being delivered out of the hand of our enemies, should serve him without fear,

pairs.source: duoh saꞌ otoꞌ idip bonal duoh nyonang otin-E niꞌ umul idip toꞌ.”
pairs.target: In holiness and righteousness before him all the days of our life.

pairs.source: Zakharia moꞌ sina tuduꞌ onak-e, “Onakkuꞌ, muꞌu yaꞌ obuah sobot nyaꞌa nang nabi Topaꞌ deꞌ Paling Bigatung deꞌ yaꞌ dioꞌ nog soꞌ Topaꞌ saꞌ sidia olan kaꞌan Topaꞌ,
pairs.target: And you, child, will be called a prophet of the Most High, for you will go before the face of the Lord to prepare his ways,

pairs.source: kaꞌan tanon tuduꞌ umat-E, nang odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ yaꞌ obuah nyilamat sobab Topaꞌ moꞌ ngapun dosa-e.
pairs.target: to give knowledge of salvation to his people by the remission of their sins,

pairs.source: Topaꞌ otoꞌ paguh otin-e baya pinyayang; Iyoh nog nyilamat otoꞌ kodaꞌ boton onu deꞌ mokat deꞌ siliꞌ jawaꞌ,
pairs.target: because of the tender mercy of our God, whereby the dawn from on high will visit us,

pairs.source: Iyoh nog toban jawaꞌ-e tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ idip daang mopung baya tolu yaꞌ kobos.  Topaꞌ kayak otoꞌ saꞌ otoꞌ idip bidamai duoh-E.”
pairs.target: to shine on those who sit in darkness and the shadow of death; to guide our feet into the way of peace.”

pairs.source: Yohanes moꞌ mokat bujang yomoꞌ pikil-e moꞌ tuꞌuh daang Topaꞌ.  Iyoh loꞌo deꞌ topat deꞌ otug-otug-e, ngan-e yaꞌ kajon onu-e yaꞌ odi nai kiloja-e deꞌ uluk bangsa Israel.
pairs.target: The child was growing, and becoming strong in spirit, and was in the desert until the day of his public appearance to Israel.

pairs.source: Kila-kila nuam bulan mokuaꞌ Yohanes obuah milaꞌ, takal inoh Kaisar Agustus ngin pilitah tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kerajaan Roma odi daftal odop-e deꞌ kupuaꞌ sumuk babai-e, ngan-e yaꞌ ngituang nyaꞌa.
pairs.target: Now in those days, a decree went out from Caesar Augustus that all the world should be enrolled.

pairs.source: Inohleh ituang nyaꞌa deꞌ sibungas-e deꞌ nai Kirenius takal-e jadi gubenul deꞌ Siria.
pairs.target: This was the first enrollment made when Quirinius was governor of Syria.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ paliꞌ takal inoh, suaꞌ-a paliꞌ keꞌ kupuaꞌ sumuk babai-e ngan-e yaꞌ daftal odop-e masim-masim.
pairs.target: All went to enroll themselves, everyone to his own city.

pairs.source: Yusuf tuang watinoh geh odi soꞌ Nazaret deꞌ Galilea keꞌ Betlehem deꞌ Yudea, topat laja Daud obuah milaꞌ, sobab Yusuf onak-sukun Daud.
pairs.target: Joseph also went up from Galilee, out of the city of Nazareth, into Judea, to David’s city, which is called Bethlehem, because he was of the house and family of David;

pairs.source: Yusuf daftal odop-e baya Maria tunang-e deꞌ bitiiaꞌ.
pairs.target: to enroll himself with Mary, who was pledged to be married to him as wife, being pregnant.

pairs.source: Takal Yusuf duoh Maria deꞌ Betlehem, Maria moꞌ nog onu-e yaꞌ milaꞌ.
pairs.target: While they were there, the day had come for her to give birth.

pairs.source: Maria milaꞌ onak pinuan-e deꞌ dali.  Yoh moꞌ molut-e pakai kain lapin, yomoꞌ piguling onak-e noh deꞌ daang dulang binatang deꞌ topas-e pakai duh sai-e boli-boli soꞌo yaꞌ ngilumon obuaꞌ punuaꞌ.
pairs.target: She gave birth to her firstborn son. She wrapped him in bands of cloth, and laid him in a feeding trough, because there was no room for them in the inn.

pairs.source: Diꞌ-e juuaꞌ soꞌ kota Betlehem ngan onu moꞌ ngalom ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan gembala ngilumon deꞌ padang nguan domba deꞌ kidip-e.
pairs.target: There were shepherds in the same country staying in the field, and keeping watch by night over their flock.

pairs.source: Tang-tang niꞌ naꞌan malaikat Topaꞌ bitanga odop-e, sinok odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, jawaꞌ sijaꞌ-a soꞌ Topaꞌ, deꞌ ting odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ tolu.
pairs.target: Behold, an angel of the Lord stood by them, and the glory of the Lord shone around them, and they were terrified.

pairs.source: Pak-e malaikat inoh moꞌ in-e, “Maꞌ tolu, Sobab Okuꞌ nog tanon Gah deꞌ Paguh kaꞌan ingan, Gah deꞌ odaꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa sonang.”
pairs.target: The angel said to them, “Don’t be afraid, for behold, I bring you good news of great joy which will be to all the people.

pairs.source: Onu itih moꞌ obuah milaꞌ kaꞌan ingan Pinyilamat manusia deꞌ kota laja Daud.  Yoh iyohleh Piayuh, Laja deꞌ janyi Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: For there is born to you today, in David’s city, a Savior, who is Christ the Lord.

pairs.source: Itihleh tanda-e, “Ingan odi kalik Kuweꞌ deꞌ obuah molut kai kain lapin, deꞌ piguling-e deꞌ topat pinguman binatang.”
pairs.target: This is the sign to you: you will find a baby wrapped in strips of cloth, lying in a feeding trough.”

pairs.source: Tang-tang malaikat inoh baya bogoꞌ sidadu malaikat deꞌ bokon, mudi Topaꞌ in-e,
pairs.target: Suddenly, there was with the angel a multitude of the heavenly army praising God, and saying,

pairs.source: “Mudileh Topaꞌ deꞌ topat deꞌ paling bigatung! Baya deꞌ tun tanaꞌ, sonangleh idip manusia deꞌ nyonang otin Topaꞌ!”
pairs.target: “Glory to God in the highest, on earth peace, good will toward men.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh malaikat deꞌ munoꞌ buꞌu togan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ paliꞌ keꞌ sulga.  Kudu-kudu naꞌan gembala deꞌ nguan domba sina siodop-e, “Jaꞌ otoꞌ keꞌ Betlehem ningaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ ogiꞌ danih, deꞌ moꞌ tanon Topaꞌ tuduꞌ otoꞌ.”
pairs.target: When the angels went away from them into the sky, the shepherds said to one another, “Let’s go to Bethlehem, now, and see this thing that has happened, which the Lord has made known to us.”

pairs.source: Kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ nguan domba lasuꞌ odi.  Mokuaꞌ inoh yoh dapod Maria duoh Yusuf baya kuweꞌ-e deꞌ piguling-e deꞌ topat pinguman binatang.
pairs.target: They came with haste, and found both Mary and Joseph, and the baby was lying in the feeding trough.

pairs.source: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ningaꞌ Kuweꞌ inoh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ silita Kuweꞌ Yusuf duoh Maria tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ kodaꞌ deꞌ nang malaikat tuduꞌ-e.
pairs.target: When they saw it, they publicized widely the saying which was spoken to them about this child.

pairs.source: Yoh moꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa ilan takal-e ngojit silita kudu-kudu naꞌan gembala deꞌ nguan domba inoh.
pairs.target: All who heard it wondered at the things which were spoken to them by the shepherds.

pairs.source: Pak-e Maria nak daang kila-e, yoh moꞌ paliꞌ bipikil.
pairs.target: But Mary kept all these sayings, pondering them in her heart.

pairs.source: Kudu-kudu naꞌan gembala deꞌ nguan domba inoh paliꞌ keꞌ padang topat-e nguan binatang simadi-e mudi Topaꞌ deꞌ sulga, sobab suaꞌ oni deꞌ ngojit-e, suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ningaꞌ-e bonal-bonal kodaꞌ deꞌ nang malaikat.
pairs.target: The shepherds returned, glorifying and praising God for all the things that they had heard and seen, just as it was told them.

pairs.source: Takal umul kuweꞌ Maria moꞌ moih onu, yoh moꞌ odi bisunat-E.  Pingoma-E moꞌ biladon kuweꞌ-e inoh Yesus, sobab adon inoh deꞌ tanon malaikat tuduꞌ sinoꞌ-E takal aluaꞌ diꞌ bitiiaꞌ-a.
pairs.target: When eight days were fulfilled for the circumcision of the child, his name was called Jesus, which was given by the angel before he was conceived in the womb.

pairs.source: Nog onu-e Yusuf duoh Maria nai upacara kibisig kaꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ mokuaꞌ milaꞌ kodaꞌ plitah Topaꞌ deꞌ nulis Musa.  Takal inoh geh Yusuf duoh Maria toban onak-E keꞌ Boli Topaꞌ deꞌ Yerusalem kaꞌan ngin tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: When the days of their purification according to the law of Moses were fulfilled, they brought him up to Jerusalem, to present him to the Lord

pairs.source: Sobab deꞌ daang plitah Topaꞌ deꞌ nulis Musa in-e, “Tibilang onak pinuan nyaꞌa deꞌ dali halus nyeꞌ ngin tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: (as it is written in the law of the Lord, “Every male who opens the womb shall be called holy to the Lord”),

pairs.source: Kaꞌan upacara kibisig, odop-e duoh inoh ngin kulban tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.  Yoh moꞌ toban duwoh polong manuk, kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ obuah notu daang pilitah Topaꞌ deꞌ nulis Musa, “Nyouhleh duwoh polong manuk gugul atou duwoh polong manuk merpati.”
pairs.target: and to offer a sacrifice according to that which is said in the law of the Lord, “A pair of turtledoves, or two young pigeons.”

pairs.source: Takal inoh deꞌ Yerusalem ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ adon-e Simeon.  Simeon nyaꞌa deꞌ paguh, nyaꞌa deꞌ taat tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, Iyang Topaꞌ ogiꞌ duoh-e.  Iyoh silalu bialap Laja deꞌ Janyi Topaꞌ nog nyilamat bangsa Israel.
pairs.target: Behold, there was a man in Jerusalem whose name was Simeon. This man was righteous and devout, looking for the consolation of Israel, and the Holy Spirit was on him.

pairs.source: Iyang Topaꞌ moꞌ tanon tuduꞌ Simeon, nang Simeon diꞌ-e dioꞌ kobos ngan-e aluaꞌ diꞌ-e ningaꞌ Laja deꞌ janyi Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: It had been revealed to him by the Holy Spirit that he should not see death before he had seen the Lord’s Christ.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Iyang Topaꞌ moꞌ nutuan Simeon odaꞌ molot keꞌ Boli Topaꞌ.  Takal inoh pingoma-E toban Yesus deꞌ aluaꞌ isoꞌ inoh, ngin tuduꞌ Topaꞌ kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ obuah notu ukum agama Yahudi.
pairs.target: He came in the Spirit into the temple. When the parents brought in the child, Jesus, that they might do concerning him according to the custom of the law,

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Simeon pakuaꞌ Yesus.  Simeon moꞌ mudi Topaꞌ in-e,
pairs.target: then he received him into his arms, and blessed God, and said,

pairs.source: “Topaꞌ, tanahleh adin okuꞌ kobos daang kila deꞌ sonang, sobab Ingan moꞌ nai kodaꞌ deꞌ janyi ingan tuduꞌ okuꞌ.
pairs.target: “Now you are releasing your servant, Master, according to your word, in peace;

pairs.source: Sobab pakai botonkuꞌ, okuꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ Pinyilamat deꞌ soꞌ Ingan.
pairs.target: for my eyes have seen your salvation,

pairs.source: Pinyilamat kaꞌan suaꞌ bangsa, Ingan moꞌ sidia-e.
pairs.target: which you have prepared before the face of all peoples;

pairs.source: Pinyilamat inoh kodaꞌ jawaꞌ deꞌ ngin Topaꞌ kaꞌan bangsa-bangsa deꞌ bokon, iyohleh jawaꞌ deꞌ ngin adon deꞌ paguh kaꞌan umat Ingan, Israel.”
pairs.target: a light for revelation to the nations, and the glory of your people Israel.”

pairs.source: Takal Yusuf duoh Maria ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ nang Simeon yoh moꞌ ilan-e.
pairs.target: Joseph and his mother were marveling at the things which were spoken concerning him,

pairs.source: Yomoꞌ Simeon bidoa saꞌ Topaꞌ blokat Yusuf duoh Maria.  Simeon sina tuduꞌ Maria, “Topaꞌ moꞌ pilih onak itih kaꞌan ngukum duoh nyilamat bogoꞌ ulang Israel.  Yoh kodaꞌ tanda soꞌ Topaꞌ pak-e bogoꞌ nyaꞌa yaꞌ nulak-E.
pairs.target: and Simeon blessed them, and said to Mary, his mother, “Behold, this child is set for the falling and the rising of many in Israel, and for a sign which is spoken against.

pairs.source: Watinoh geh, nyaꞌa yaꞌ puꞌan oniꞌ deꞌ nyikon daang kila nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon.  Yomoꞌ yaꞌ nog onu-e otinmuꞌ monam kodaꞌ obuah ngamuk kai asual deꞌ lojaꞌ.”
pairs.target: Yes, a sword will pierce through your own soul, that the thoughts of many hearts may be revealed.”

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ geh niꞌ nabi, odop-e dayung deꞌ moꞌ nyoma, umul-e moꞌ moih puluꞌ pat sowaꞌ, adon-e Hana.
pairs.target: There was one Anna, a prophetess, the daughter of Phanuel, of the tribe of Asher (she was of a great age, having lived with a husband seven years from her virginity,

pairs.source: Iyoh onak Fanuel soꞌ suku Asyer.  Moꞌ juꞌ sowaꞌ bonon-e doiꞌ, Hana jadin jana.  Hana diꞌ-e buu soꞌ Boli Topaꞌ, pak-e bilang konu singonu singalom simayang, bidoa, baya puasa tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: and she had been a widow for about eighty-four years), who didn’t depart from the temple, worshiping with fastings and petitions night and day.

pairs.source: Takal Simeon aluaꞌ sina tuduꞌ Maria duoh Yusuf, Hana odi tuduꞌ Yesus, yoh mudi Topaꞌ, yomoꞌ Hana silalu silita Yesus obuah milaꞌ tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kajon onu Topaꞌ pilopas ulang Israel soꞌ Roma.
pairs.target: Coming up at that very hour, she gave thanks to the Lord, and spoke of him to all those who were looking for redemption in Jerusalem.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ pingoma Yesus nai suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ halus-e yoh nai-e, nunaꞌ pilitah Topaꞌ deꞌ nulis Musa, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ paliꞌ keꞌ Nazaret deꞌ Galilea.
pairs.target: When they had accomplished all things that were according to the law of the Lord, they returned into Galilee, to their own city, Nazareth.

pairs.source: Onak inoh moꞌ bitamah ayuh, dolas.  Yoh bijak, Yoh moꞌ obuah nyayang odaꞌ Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: The child was growing, and was becoming strong in spirit, being filled with wisdom, and the grace of God was upon him.

pairs.source: Bilang Sowaꞌ pingoma Yesus odi keꞌ Yerusalem nyamut Onu Paskah.
pairs.target: His parents went every year to Jerusalem at the feast of the Passover.

pairs.source: Takal umul Yesus simoong duwoh sowaꞌ, Yesus nunaꞌ pingoma-E odi keꞌ Yerusalem nyamut Onu Paskah inoh kodaꞌ deꞌ silalu-e.
pairs.target: When he was twelve years old, they went up to Jerusalem according to the custom of the feast,

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ nyamut Onu Paskah inoh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ paliꞌ, pak-e Yesus diꞌ-e paliꞌ duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.  Yoh aluaꞌ deꞌ Yerusalem, pingoma-E diꞌ-e puꞌan-e.
pairs.target: and when they had fulfilled the days, as they were returning, the boy Jesus stayed behind in Jerusalem. Joseph and his mother didn’t know it,

pairs.source: Pingoma-E baꞌ-a nang Yesus ponu bibaya duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ ponu duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.  Takal moꞌ niꞌ onu-onu pimonu-e, pingoma-e moꞌ kalik Yesus deꞌ uluk madih ayua-e, deꞌ uluk dingan-dingan-e deꞌ ponu bibaya duoh odop-e.
pairs.target: but supposing him to be in the company, they went a day’s journey, and they looked for him among their relatives and acquaintances.

pairs.source: Pak-e diꞌ-e dapod-e, pingoma-e moꞌ paliꞌ keꞌ Yerusalem kalik Yesus.
pairs.target: When they didn’t find him, they returned to Jerusalem, looking for him.

pairs.source: Moꞌ taluh onu pingoma-e kalik Yesus, pingoma-E moꞌ dapod-E deꞌ Boli Topaꞌ.  Yesus guluꞌ, ngojit simadi-e sikian tuduꞌ gulu agama Yahudi.
pairs.target: After three days they found him in the temple, sitting in the middle of the teachers, both listening to them, and asking them questions.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit sina-E moꞌ ilan-e sobab Yoh bijak, Yoh moꞌ nyawot pinyikian gulu agama suaꞌ-e bonal.
pairs.target: All who heard him were amazed at his understanding and his answers.

pairs.source: Pingoma-E tuang ilan-e geh ningaꞌ Yesus, sinoꞌ-e moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-E, “Oni ngan muꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ wat itih tuduꞌ koꞌih neh? Koꞌih bigaduh kalik Muꞌu!”
pairs.target: When they saw him, they were astonished, and his mother said to him, “Son, why have you treated us this way? Behold, your father and I were anxiously looking for you.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Oni ngan Ingan kalik Okuꞌ? Idoh keh diꞌ Ingan puꞌan-e, Okuꞌ halus ogiꞌ daang Boli Samaꞌ Kuꞌ?”
pairs.target: He said to them, “Why were you looking for me? Didn’t you know that I must be in my Father’s house?”

pairs.source: Pak-e pingoma-E diꞌ-e ngiloti oniꞌ deꞌ nang Yesus.
pairs.target: They didn’t understand the saying which he spoke to them.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ noh Yesus moꞌ paliꞌ duoh pingoma-e keꞌ Nazaret.  Yoh silalu nulut pingunang pingoma-E.  Suaꞌ hal inoh sinoꞌ-E nyikon daang kila-e.
pairs.target: And he went down with them, and came to Nazareth. He was subject to them, and his mother kept all these sayings in her heart.

pairs.source: Yesus bitamah ayuh, bitamah bijak duoh nyonang Topaꞌ baya manusia.
pairs.target: And Jesus increased in wisdom and stature, and in favor with God and men.

pairs.source: Daang sowaꞌ ke simoong limoh Kaisar Tiberius militah Roma, sowaꞌ inoh Pontius Pilatus jadi gubenul deꞌ propinsi Yudea, duoh Herodes laja deꞌ militah deꞌ propinsi Galilea.  Watnoh geh Filipus, madih soꞌ Herodes militah deꞌ propinsi Iturea duoh Trakhonitis, Lisanias iohleh laja deꞌ propinsi Abilene.
pairs.target: Now in the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar, Pontius Pilate being governor of Judea, and Herod being tetrarch of Galilee, and his brother Philip tetrarch of the region of Ituraea and Trachonitis, and Lysanias tetrarch of Abilene,

pairs.source: Takal sowaꞌ inoh geh Hanas duoh Kayafas jadi pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ paling ayuh-e, duoh Topaꞌ sina tuduꞌ Yohanes, onak Zakharia.  Takal inoh Yohanes ogiꞌ deꞌ padang pasil deꞌ sukup ayuh-e.
pairs.target: in the high priesthood of Annas and Caiaphas, the word of God came to John, the son of Zacharias, in the wilderness.

pairs.source: Yohanes odi keꞌ suaꞌ daerah deꞌ sungi Yordan yoh moꞌ tanon saꞌ suaꞌ-suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ odaꞌ paliꞌ keꞌ olan Topaꞌ duoh obuah baptis saꞌ Topaꞌ ngapun dosa-e.
pairs.target: He came into all the region around the Jordan, preaching the baptism of repentance for remission of sins.

pairs.source: Kodaꞌ deꞌ obuah nulis daang buk deꞌ nulis Nabi Yesaya noꞌuh-e, “Ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nang bogan-e dolas-dolas deꞌ padang pasil, sidia leh olan kaꞌan Topaꞌ, pilataleh olan kaꞌan-E.
pairs.target: As it is written in the book of the words of Isaiah the prophet, “The voice of one crying in the wilderness, ‘Make ready the way of the Lord. Make his paths straight.

pairs.source: Nimok nyeꞌ suaꞌ baluah, suaꞌ dolod, suaꞌ punguꞌ obuah pilata.  Olan deꞌ bidikoꞌ bidiyuah obuah nongon, duoh deꞌ muguꞌ moluak obuah pilata.
pairs.target: Every valley will be filled. Every mountain and hill will be brought low. The crooked will become straight, and the rough ways smooth.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ dunia yaꞌ ningaꞌ Topaꞌ nyilamat manusia!”
pairs.target: All flesh will see God’s salvation.’”

pairs.source: Bogoꞌ nyaꞌa odi tuduꞌ Yohanes saꞌ-e obuah baptis.  Yohanes moꞌ sina in-e, “Ingan nyaꞌa deꞌ jaꞌat! Maꞌ ingan pikil ponai lopas soꞌ ukum Topaꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nog, moꞌ ingan jok ngan obuah baptis sijaꞌ-a.
pairs.target: He said therefore to the multitudes who went out to be baptized by him, “You offspring of vipers, who warned you to flee from the wrath to come?

pairs.source: Jadi bitanga leh pakai pingunai pingidipmuꞌ deꞌ paguh, saꞌ-e jadi bukti muꞌu moꞌ bonal-bonal paliꞌ keꞌ olan Topaꞌ! Maꞌ ingan bipikil nang ingan diꞌ-e obuah ukum sai Abraham sumuk babai ingan! Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan, Topaꞌ ponai nai onak-sukun kaꞌan Abraham soꞌ batuh-batuh itih!
pairs.target: Therefore produce fruits worthy of repentance, and don’t begin to say among yourselves, ‘We have Abraham for our father;’ for I tell you that God is able to raise up children to Abraham from these stones!

pairs.source: Ukum Topaꞌ samah kodaꞌ kapak deꞌ moꞌ sidia kaꞌan nobong tongon koyuh baya banang-banang-e deꞌ diꞌ-e ponai bibuaꞌ paguh, duoh yaꞌ obuah timalong kaang opui.”
pairs.target: Even now the ax also lies at the root of the trees. Every tree therefore that doesn’t produce good fruit is cut down, and thrown into the fire.”

pairs.source: Jadi odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ in-e, “Jadi oni mey deꞌ halus koꞌih nai neh?”
pairs.target: The multitudes asked him, “What then must we do?”

pairs.source: Yohanes moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Moꞌ ingan ogiꞌ bojuh duwoh, nginleh niꞌ bojuh tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ doiꞌ bojuh-e nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ pinguman-e, kutungleh tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ pilai.”
pairs.target: He answered them, “He who has two coats, let him give to him who has none. He who has food, let him do likewise.”

pairs.source: Pinagih-pinagih suke tuang nog tuduꞌ Yohanes saꞌ-a baptis odop-e, yomoꞌ sikian tuduꞌ-e, “Gulu, koꞌih halus nai oni?”
pairs.target: Tax collectors also came to be baptized, and they said to him, “Teacher, what must we do?”

pairs.source: Yohanes moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Maꞌ ingan nagih sikiya bogoꞌ soꞌ deꞌ moꞌ obuah notap plitah.”
pairs.target: He said to them, “Collect no more than that which is appointed to you.”

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ geh sidadu sikian tuduꞌ Yohanes, “Oniwat koꞌih neh? Oni deꞌ halus koꞌih nai?” Yohanes moꞌ in-e, “Maꞌ yaꞌ mitiaꞌ kai paksa duoh ngegap saꞌ nyaꞌa ngin duit duꞌ ingan duoh napo nyaꞌa nang nai kiloja diꞌ bonal, pak-e sukupleh duoh pah ingan.”
pairs.target: Soldiers also asked him, saying, “What about us? What must we do?” He said to them, “Extort from no one by violence, neither accuse anyone wrongfully. Be content with your wages.”

pairs.source: Sobab pingunai Yohanes takal inoh nyaꞌa deꞌ kajon duoh bialap janyi Topaꞌ mulai bisikien, podo Yohanes inoh Laja deꞌ janyi Topaꞌ deꞌ kajon manusia.
pairs.target: As the people were in expectation, and all men reasoned in their hearts concerning John, whether perhaps he was the Christ,

pairs.source: Inohleh sobab-e Yohanes sina tuduꞌ suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ, “Okuꞌ baptis ingan pakai piꞌin, pak-e ogiꞌ lagiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ nog deꞌ lobih ayuh soꞌ okuꞌ.  Bukaꞌ tolin kasut-E sijaꞌ-e diꞌ kuꞌ layak.  Yoh yaꞌ baptis ingan pakai Iyang Topaꞌ duoh opui.
pairs.target: John answered them all, “I indeed baptize you with water, but he comes who is mightier than I, the strap of whose sandals I am not worthy to loosen. He will baptize you in the Holy Spirit and fire,

pairs.source: Deꞌ tongan-E ogiꞌ tapan kaꞌan napan suaꞌ podi-E nog-e bisig.  Podi Yoh nguluk-E deꞌ daang basal, pak-e suaꞌ oping-e Yoh nyouh-e deꞌ opui deꞌ diꞌ-e ponai pulaꞌ!”
pairs.target: whose fan is in his hand, and he will thoroughly cleanse his threshing floor, and will gather the wheat into his barn; but he will burn up the chaff with unquenchable fire.”

pairs.source: Watinoh geh Yohanes ngin bogoꞌ buaꞌ ajal deꞌ bokon takal yoh tanon Gah deꞌ Paguh tuduꞌ nyaꞌa bogoꞌ.
pairs.target: Then with many other exhortations he preached good news to the people,

pairs.source: Yohanes ngalah geh laja Herodes, sai-e mit Herodias, sowon madih-e jadi sowon-e duoh suaꞌ pingunai-e deꞌ bokon deꞌ jaꞌat.
pairs.target: but Herod the tetrarch, being reproved by him for Herodias, his brother’s  wife, and for all the evil things which Herod had done,

pairs.source: Yomoꞌ Herodes kibalot Yohanes keꞌ daang jel inohleh pingunai-e deꞌ lobih jaꞌat soꞌ pingunai jaꞌat-e deꞌ bokon.
pairs.target: added this also to them all, that he shut up John in prison.

pairs.source: Takal Yohanes aluaꞌ diꞌ-e obuah jel yoh moꞌ baptis nyaꞌa bogoꞌ, Yesus moꞌ obuah baptis geh.  Takal Yesus bidoa, longit tibukaꞌ,
pairs.target: Now when all the people were baptized, Jesus also had been baptized, and was praying. The sky was opened,

pairs.source: yomoꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ muun keꞌ tun-E kodaꞌ manuk merpati.  Yoh moꞌ klingah sina Topaꞌ deꞌ in-e, “Muꞌu leh Onak Kuꞌ deꞌ ngibalaꞌ Kuꞌ deꞌ nyonang otin Kuꞌ.”
pairs.target: and the Holy Spirit descended in a bodily form like a dove on him; and a voice came out of the sky, saying “You are my beloved Son. In you I am well pleased.”

pairs.source: Takal umul Yesus taluh puluꞌ sowaꞌ Yoh mulai kiloja.  Nyaꞌa pikil nang, Yesus iyohleh onak Yusuf, onak Eli,
pairs.target: Jesus himself, when he began to teach, was about thirty years old, being the son (as was supposed) of Joseph, the son of Heli,

pairs.source: onak Matat, onak Lewi, onak Malkhi, onak Yanai, onak Yusuf,
pairs.target: the son of Matthat, the son of Levi, the son of Melchi, the son of Jannai, the son of Joseph,

pairs.source: onak Matica, onak Amos, onak Nahum, onak Hesli, onak Nagai,
pairs.target: the son of Mattathias, the son of Amos, the son of Nahum, the son of Esli, the son of Naggai,

pairs.source: onak Maat, onak Matica, onak Simei, onak Yosekh, onak Yoda,
pairs.target: the son of Maath, the son of Mattathias, the son of Semein, the son of Joseph, the son of Judah,

pairs.source: onak Yohanan, onak Resa, onak Zerubabel, onak Sealtiel, onak Neri,
pairs.target: the son of Joanan, the son of Rhesa, the son of Zerubbabel, the son of Shealtiel, the son of Neri,

pairs.source: onak Malkhi, onak Adi, onak Kosam, onak Elmadam, onak Er,
pairs.target: the son of Melchi, the son of Addi, the son of Cosam, the son of Elmodam, the son of Er,

pairs.source: onak Yesua, onak Eliezer, onak Yorim, onak Matat, onak Lewi,
pairs.target: the son of Jose, the son of Eliezer, the son of Jorim, the son of Matthat, the son of Levi,

pairs.source: onak Simeon, onak Yehuda, onak Yusuf, onak Yonam, onak Elyakim,
pairs.target: the son of Simeon, the son of Judah, the son of Joseph, the son of Jonan, the son of Eliakim,

pairs.source: onak Melea, onak Mina, onak Matata, onak Natan, onak Daud,
pairs.target: the son of Melea, the son of Menan, the son of Mattatha, the son of Nathan, the son of David,

pairs.source: onak Isai, onak Obed, onak Boas, onak Salmon, onak Nahason,
pairs.target: the son of Jesse, the son of Obed, the son of Boaz, the son of Salmon, the son of Nahshon,

pairs.source: onak Aminadab, onak Admin, onak Arni, onak Hezron, onak Peres, onak Yehuda,
pairs.target: the son of Amminadab, the son of Aram, the son of Hezron, the son of Perez, the son of Judah,

pairs.source: onak Yakub, onak Ishak, onak Abraham, onak Terah, onak Nahor,
pairs.target: the son of Jacob, the son of Isaac, the son of Abraham, the son of Terah, the son of Nahor,

pairs.source: onak Serug, onak Rehu, onak Peleg, onak Eber, onak Salmon,
pairs.target: the son of Serug, the son of Reu, the son of Peleg, the son of Eber, the son of Shelah,

pairs.source: onak Kenan, onak Arpakhsad, onak Sem, onak Nuh, onak Lamekh,
pairs.target: the son of Cainan, the son of Arphaxad, the son of Shem, the son of Noah, the son of Lamech,

pairs.source: onak Metusalah, onak Henokh, onak Yared, onak Mahalaleel, onak Kenan,
pairs.target: the son of Methuselah, the son of Enoch, the son of Jared, the son of Mahalaleel, the son of Cainan,

pairs.source: onak Enos, onak Set, onak Adam, onak Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: the son of Enos, the son of Seth, the son of Adam, the son of God.

pairs.source: Yesus deꞌ punuaꞌ odaꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ yoh moꞌ buu soꞌ sungi Yordan, yomoꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ mipin Yesus keꞌ padang pasil deꞌ ayuh.
pairs.target: Jesus, full of the Holy Spirit, returned from the Jordan, and was led by the Spirit into the wilderness

pairs.source: Danoꞌ Yesus obuah suba odaꞌ Muot laja munua pat puluꞌ onu pat puluꞌ ngalom, deꞌ tian-tian inoh Yoh diꞌ-e man nog Yoh sukup pilai-e.
