pairs.target: for forty days, being tempted by the devil. He ate nothing in those days. Afterward, when they were completed, he was hungry.

pairs.source: Muot moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Yesus, “Muꞌu tih kan Onak Topaꞌ, odaꞌleh batuh itih jadi pinguman!”
pairs.target: The devil said to him, “If you are the Son of God, command this stone to become bread.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Daang Kitab moꞌ obuah nulis, ‘Manusia nak-e idip soꞌ pinguman sijaꞌ-a.’”
pairs.target: Jesus answered him, saying, “It is written, ‘Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word of God.’”

pairs.source: Muot moꞌ toban Yesus keꞌ topat deꞌ bigatung, mun oni deꞌ diep sijaꞌ Muot moꞌ bitanga suaꞌ daerah kerajaan deꞌ dunia.
pairs.target: The devil, leading him up on a high mountain, showed him all the kingdoms of the world in a moment of time.

pairs.source: Muot moꞌ in-e, “Suaꞌ kuasa kerajaan duoh halta inoh okuꞌ yaꞌ ngin tuduꞌ Muꞌu, sobab suaꞌ-e itih moꞌ obuah ngin tuduꞌ okuꞌ, yomoꞌ okuꞌ soꞌon ngin suat simun-e tuduꞌ osi sijaꞌ-a deꞌ kuꞌ suka.
pairs.target: The devil said to him, “I will give you all this authority, and their glory, for it has been delivered to me; and I give it to whomever I want.

pairs.source: Asal muꞌu nyomah okuꞌ, okuꞌ yaꞌ ngin suaꞌ-e tuduꞌ muꞌu.”
pairs.target: If you therefore will worship before me, it will all be yours.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e in-e, “Daang Kitab moꞌ obuah nulis, ‘Jok-e Topaꞌ patut nyeꞌ nyomah-a, layanleh Yoh sijaꞌ-a.’ ”
pairs.target: Jesus answered him, “Get behind me Satan! For it is written, ‘You shall worship the Lord your God, and you shall serve him only.’”

pairs.source: Muot moꞌ toban Yesus keꞌ Yerusalem duoh keꞌ tun bungan Boli Topaꞌ.  Muot moꞌ in-e, “Muꞌu tih kan Onak Topaꞌ, bitabumleh soꞌ itih!
pairs.target: He led him to Jerusalem, and set him on the pinnacle of the temple, and said to him, “If you are the Son of God, cast yourself down from here,

pairs.source: Sobab daang Kitab moꞌ obuah nulis, ‘Topaꞌ odaꞌ malaikat-malaikat-E jaga Ingan.
pairs.target: for it is written, ‘He will put his angels in charge of you, to guard you;’

pairs.source: Malaikat deꞌ munoꞌ Nyamut Muꞌu kai tongan-e saꞌ poꞌon Muꞌu diꞌ-e obuah batuh.’”
pairs.target: and, ‘On their hands they will bear you up, lest perhaps you dash your foot against a stone.’”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e in-e, “Daang Kitab deꞌ moꞌ nulis Musa, ‘Maꞌ yaꞌ suba Topaꞌ muꞌ!’ ”
pairs.target: Jesus answering, said to him, “It has been said, ‘You shall not tempt the Lord your God.’”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ Muot suba Yesus kai masam-masam wat-e, yoh moꞌ buu togan-E yoh moꞌ kajon onu-e deꞌ bitotok.
pairs.target: When the devil had completed every temptation, he departed from him until another time.

pairs.source: Yomoꞌ Yesus paliꞌ keꞌ Galilea punuaꞌ daꞌ kuasa Iyang Topaꞌ.  Gah Yesus moꞌ timogah katiꞌ-kanih deꞌ suaꞌ Galilea.
pairs.target: Jesus returned in the power of the Spirit into Galilee, and news about him spread through all the surrounding area.

pairs.source: Yesus ngajal deꞌ boli-boli topat simayang, yomoꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa mudi-E.
pairs.target: He taught in their synagogues, being glorified by all.

pairs.source: Yesus odi keꞌ Nazaret topat soꞌ Yoh ayuh.  Daang Onu Sabat kodaꞌ deꞌ biasa-e Yoh odi keꞌ boli topat simayang, Yoh mujuag ngan-e yaꞌ basa Kitab.
pairs.target: He came to Nazareth, where he had been brought up. He entered, as was his custom, into the synagogue on the Sabbath day, and stood up to read.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa ngin buk deꞌ nulis nabi Yesaya tuduꞌ Yesus, takal Yoh bukaꞌ buk inoh yoh dapod ayat itih yomoꞌ basa-e,
pairs.target: The book of the prophet Isaiah was handed to him. He opened the book, and found the place where it was written,

pairs.source: “Iyang Topaꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ Okuꞌ, sobab Yoh moꞌ pilih Okuꞌ, odaꞌ tanon Gah deꞌ Paguh kaꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ botak kolag.  Yoh moꞌ ngutus Okuꞌ kaꞌan tanon tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah tawan yaꞌ obuah pilopas, nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ ponai ningaꞌ duoh kaꞌan pilopas nyaꞌa soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bongis.
pairs.target: “The Spirit of the Lord is on me, because he has anointed me to preach good news to the poor. He has sent me to heal the broken hearted, to proclaim release to the captives, recovering of sight to the blind, to deliver those who are crushed,

pairs.source: Duoh tanon nang moꞌ nog onu-e Topaꞌ nai oni deꞌ paguh kaꞌan umat-e.”
pairs.target: and to proclaim the acceptable year of the Lord.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ kuab kitab inoh, Yoh moꞌ paliꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ jugan kitab inoh, Yoh moꞌ guluꞌ yaꞌ ngajal.  Suaꞌ nyaꞌa daang boli topat simayang ngiduang-E.
pairs.target: He closed the book, gave it back to the attendant, and sat down. The eyes of all in the synagogue were fastened on him.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Onu itih ayat-ayat itih moꞌ jadi takal ingan ngojit-e.”
pairs.target: He began to tell them, “Today, this Scripture has been fulfilled in your hearing.”

pairs.source: Pingunang Yesus suaꞌ-e paguh, yoh ngan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nang oniꞌ deꞌ nang Yesus suaꞌ-e bonal duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ jadi ilan, yomoꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ in-e, “Oni ngan-e ponai nang oni watinoh, Yoh kan jok-e onak Yusuf?”
pairs.target: All testified about him, and wondered at the gracious words which proceeded out of his mouth, and they said, “Isn’t this Joseph’s son?”

pairs.source: Inohleh ngan Yesus in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Totap ingan yaꞌ nguyat Okuꞌ nang, ‘Doktol, odaꞌleh odop Ingan mokuaꞌ! Naileh datiꞌ geh deꞌ topat soꞌ muꞌ obuah milaꞌ, kodaꞌ suaꞌ deꞌ ngojit koꞌih deꞌ nai Ingan deꞌ Kapernaum!’ ”
pairs.target: He said to them, “Doubtless you will tell me this parable, ‘Physician, heal yourself! Whatever we have heard done at Capernaum, do also here in your hometown.’”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Doiꞌ nabi deꞌ obuah nabiꞌ deꞌ kupuaꞌ soꞌo obuah milaꞌ.
pairs.target: He said, “Most certainly I tell you, no prophet is acceptable in his hometown.

pairs.source: Pak-e ngojitleh joman nabi Elia, takal logaꞌ taluh sowaꞌ nuam bulan, deꞌ suaꞌ negli doiꞌ pinguman nyaꞌa obuaꞌ pilai miliap.  Takal inoh bogoꞌ jana-jana deꞌ Israel.
pairs.target: But truly I tell you, there were many widows in Israel in the days of Elijah, when the sky was shut up three years and six months, when a great famine came over all the land.

pairs.source: Topaꞌ diꞌ-e odaꞌ Elia odi tuduꞌ jana-jana Israel, pak-e odaꞌ odi jok-e tuduꞌ niꞌ jana deꞌ Sarfat deꞌ Sidon.
pairs.target: Elijah was sent to none of them, except to Zarephath, in the land of Sidon, to a woman who was a widow.

pairs.source: Watinoh geh joman nabi Elisa ogiꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ Israel obuah onam kulit deꞌ sukup palah, pak-e doiꞌ soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ mokuaꞌ, jok-e Naaman nyaꞌa soꞌ negli Siria inoh.”
pairs.target: There were many lepers in Israel in the time of Elisha the prophet, yet not one of them was cleansed, except Naaman, the Syrian.”

pairs.source: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ boli topat simayang inoh, sukup-sukup tiwas takal-e ngojit hal inoh.
pairs.target: They were all filled with wrath in the synagogue, as they heard these things.

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ mujuag yomoꞌ kasig duoh toban Yesus kai paksa keꞌ sopaꞌ kota, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ toban Yesus keꞌ bingon gilongung dolod sobab kota odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ bung dolod, ngan-e yaꞌ tulak Yesus kaang gilongung.
pairs.target: They rose up, threw him out of the city, and led him to the brow of the hill that their city was built on, that they might throw him off the cliff.

pairs.source: Pak-e Yesus ponu deꞌ osah odop-e deꞌ munoh Yoh moꞌ buu.
pairs.target: But he, passing through the middle of them, went his way.

pairs.source: Yomoꞌ Yesus odi keꞌ kota Kapernaum deꞌ Galilea, danoꞌ Yoh ngajal nyaꞌa daang Onu Sabat.
pairs.target: He came down to Capernaum, a city of Galilee. He was teaching them on the Sabbath day,

pairs.source: Buaꞌ ajal duoh sina Yesus punuaꞌ daꞌ kuasa, inoh ngan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bidongo ngojit-e.
pairs.target: and they were astonished at his teaching, for his word was with authority.

pairs.source: Deꞌ boli topat simayang ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munua molot daang gonan-e, yoh moꞌ nang bogan-e,
pairs.target: In the synagogue there was a man who had a spirit of an unclean demon, and he cried out with a loud voice,

pairs.source: “Yesus ulang Nazaret, oni Ingan nog yaꞌ kaso koꞌih? Podo Ingan nog yaꞌ ngukum koꞌih? Puꞌan kuꞌ osi Ingan neh Ingan utusan deꞌ kudus soꞌ Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: saying, “Ah! what have we to do with you, Jesus of Nazareth? Have you come to destroy us? I know you who you are: the Holy One of God!”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nang munua inoh, “Loꞌo! Luahleh soꞌ nyaꞌa itih!” In Yesus tuduꞌ munua inoh.  Munua inoh moꞌ paꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ molot-e daang gonan-e deꞌ jowin suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.  Yomoꞌ munua inoh luah soꞌ gonan nyaꞌa inoh pak-e diꞌ-e kanam-e.
pairs.target: Jesus rebuked him, saying, “Be silent, and come out of him!”  When the demon had thrown him down in the middle of them, he came out of him, having done him no harm.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa ilan-e, yomoꞌ sina siodop-e, “Kuasa oni deꞌ ogiꞌ daang sina Nyaꞌa itih, ngan munua nunaꞌ pingunang-e?”
pairs.target: Amazement came on all, and they spoke together, one with another, saying, “What is this word? For with authority and power he commands the unclean spirits, and they come out!”

pairs.source: Yomoꞌ Gah oni deꞌ nai Yesus katiꞌ-kanih nyaꞌa ngojit-e deꞌ suaꞌ topat deꞌ sinok-sinok inoh.
pairs.target: News about him went out into every place of the surrounding region.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ buꞌu soꞌ boli topat simayang, Yesus odi keꞌ boli Simon.  Madih ayua Simon tanon tuduꞌ Yesus nang tua Simon deꞌ dayung modud, duoh tulung odaꞌ mokuaꞌ.
pairs.target: He rose up from the synagogue, and entered into Simon’s house. Simon’s mother-in-law was afflicted with a great fever, and they begged him for her.

pairs.source: Yesus odi keꞌ topat boꞌos tua Simon.  Yoh odaꞌ modud-e mokuaꞌ.  Yomoꞌ tua Simon lasuꞌ mokat nai pinguman kaꞌan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: He stood over her, and rebuked the fever; and it left her. Immediately she rose up and served them.

pairs.source: Takal onu moꞌ puꞌun ngumi, suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kota inoh toban madih ayua-e deꞌ obuah masam-masam onam.  Yesus moꞌ gan tongan-e keꞌ masim-masim odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ mokuaꞌ odaꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: When the sun was setting, all those who had any sick with various diseases brought them to him; and he laid his hands on every one of them, and healed them.

pairs.source: Munua moꞌ luah soꞌ gonan nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ, simadi-e nang bogan-e, “Inganleh Onak Topaꞌ!” Pak-e Yesus jaman munua deꞌ munoꞌ sina, sobab munua puꞌan nang Yesus Iyohleh Laja deꞌ janyi Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: Demons also came out of many, crying out, and saying, “You are the Christ, the Son of God!” Rebuking them, he didn’t allow them to speak, because they knew that he was the Christ.

pairs.source: Soꞌ siliꞌ jawaꞌ, Yesus ponu keꞌ niꞌ topat deꞌ otug-otug-e doiꞌ manah nyaꞌa daꞌ-e.  Pak-e bogoꞌ nyaꞌa mulai kalik-E, takal nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ tapod-E, yoh moꞌ jaman Yesus buu.
pairs.target: When it was day, he departed and went into an uninhabited place, and the multitudes looked for him, and came to him, and held on to him, so that he wouldn’t go away from them.

pairs.source: Pak-e Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Okuꞌ halus odi tanon Gah deꞌ Paguh deꞌ kota-kota deꞌ bokon, tanon oni wat-e Topaꞌ yaꞌ militah jadin Laja, sobab inohleh Okuꞌ keꞌ dunia.”
pairs.target: But he said to them, “I must preach the good news of God’s Kingdom to the other cities also. For this reason I have been sent.”

pairs.source: Sobab inoh Yesus tanon Gah deꞌ Paguh deꞌ daang boli topat simayang deꞌ suaꞌ kota deꞌ Yudea.
pairs.target: He was preaching in the synagogues of Galilee.

pairs.source: Takal Yesus deꞌ bingon Donu Genezaret Deꞌ ayuh, bogoꞌ nyaꞌa bikuluk yomoꞌ bitodod-todod ngan-e yaꞌ ngojit pingunang Topaꞌ soꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: Now while the multitude pressed on him and heard the word of God, he was standing by the lake of Gennesaret.

pairs.source: Yesus ningaꞌ ogiꞌ duoh olud deꞌ bingon donu inoh doiꞌ nyaꞌa daang, nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ mokuaꞌ paliꞌ kalik ikian yomoꞌ mamiaꞌ jaling-e.
pairs.target: He saw two boats standing by the lake, but the fishermen had gone out of them, and were washing their nets.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ maꞌad keꞌ olud deꞌ kakuꞌ Simon.  Yesus moꞌ odaꞌ Simon bikayuh olud-e keꞌ topat deꞌ botang juuaꞌ sit soꞌ bingon donu yoh moꞌ guluꞌ ngajal nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ soꞌ daang olud.
pairs.target: He entered into one of the boats, which was Simon’s, and asked him to put out a little from the land. He sat down and taught the multitudes from the boat.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ ngajal Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Simon, “Bikayuhleh oludmuꞌ keꞌ topat deꞌ tuluap suba lagiꞌ ngijaling ikian.”
pairs.target: When he had finished speaking, he said to Simon, “Put out into the deep, and let down your nets for a catch.”

pairs.source: Simon moꞌ nyawot-e, “Gulu, koꞌih moh kiloja lolah posah niꞌ ngalom-ngalom, pak-e doiꞌ manah ikian deꞌ soꞌon koꞌih, nyam-e Ingan deꞌ odaꞌ, okuꞌ nai-e, okuꞌ suba lagiꞌ ngijaling.”
pairs.target: Simon answered him, “Master, we worked all night, and took nothing; but at your word I will let down the net.”

pairs.source: Jadi odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nai oni deꞌ nang Yesus yomoꞌ bogoꞌ ikian deꞌ obuah jaling-e nog jaling-e yaꞌ totak.
pairs.target: When they had done this, they caught a great multitude of fish, and their net was breaking.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Simon moꞌ mogan dingan-dingan-e deꞌ pakai olud deꞌ bokon.  Dingan-dingan-e moꞌ nog yomoꞌ ngisiꞌ soꞌ duwoh olud-e nog punuaꞌ duoh odaꞌ olud-e yaꞌ kuom.
pairs.target: They beckoned to their partners in the other boat, that they should come and help them. They came, and filled both boats, so that they began to sink.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ ningaꞌ hal inoh, Simon moꞌ bikunyug deꞌ sulung jowin Yesus, yoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Yesus, “Toganleh okuꞌ sobab okuꞌ itih nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa.”
pairs.target: But Simon Peter, when he saw it, fell down at Jesus’ knees, saying, “Depart from me, for I am a sinful man, Lord.”

pairs.source: Simon duoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ olud inoh moꞌ ilan ningaꞌ bogoꞌ ikian deꞌ soꞌon-e.
pairs.target: For he was amazed, and all who were with him, at the catch of fish which they had caught;

pairs.source: Watnoh geh dingan-dingan Simon, Yakobus duoh Yohanes onak Zebedeus.  Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Simon, “Maꞌ tolu! Soꞌ adin muꞌu idoh tiaꞌ kalik ikian pak-e kalik manusia odaꞌ nunaꞌ Okuꞌ.”
pairs.target: and so also were James and John, sons of Zebedee, who were partners with Simon. Jesus said to Simon, “Don’t be afraid. From now on you will be catching people alive.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Simon duoh dingan-dingan-e nalik olud-e keꞌ bingon donu yomoꞌ togan suaꞌ kiloja-e, yomoꞌ nunaꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: When they had brought their boats to land, they left everything, and followed him.

pairs.source: Takal inoh Yesus odi keꞌ niꞌ kota.  Deꞌ kota inoh ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan dali deꞌ obuah onam kulit deꞌ sukup palah.  Yomoꞌ takal ningaꞌ Yesus yoh moꞌ bikunyug deꞌ jowin Yesus simadi-e nang, “Nyam Ingan laꞌan odaꞌleh okuꞌ mokuaꞌ soꞌ onamkuꞌ.”
pairs.target: While he was in one of the cities, behold, there was a man full of leprosy. When he saw Jesus, he fell on his face, and begged him, saying, “Lord, if you want to, you can make me clean.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ tomaꞌ-e semadiꞌ-e sina, “Laꞌan Kuꞌ mokuaꞌ leh.” Takal inoh geh onam-e lasuꞌ mokuaꞌ.
pairs.target: He stretched out his hand, and touched him, saying, “I want to. Be made clean.” Immediately the leprosy left him.

pairs.source: Yesus jaman nyaꞌa inoh kilakal tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon, Yesus moꞌ sina in-e, “Sus odi tuduꞌ pimipin agama Yahudi mitiaꞌ saꞌ-e ningaꞌ muꞌu moh bonal-bonal mokuaꞌ.  Yomoꞌ odileh ngin kulban kodaꞌ plitah Topaꞌ deꞌ nulis Musa bukti muꞌu moꞌ bonal mokuaꞌ soꞌ onammuꞌ.”
pairs.target: He commanded him to tell no one, “But go your way, and show yourself to the priest, and offer for your cleansing according to what Moses commanded, for a testimony to them.”

pairs.source: Pak-e nyaꞌa moꞌ klingah gah Yesus katiꞌ-kanih, sobab inohleh nyaꞌa bogoꞌ nog ngojit duoh mitiaꞌ saꞌ-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ mokuaꞌ soꞌ onam-e.
pairs.target: But the report concerning him spread much more, and great multitudes came together to hear, and to be healed by him of their infirmities.

pairs.source: Pak-e kodaꞌ deꞌ biasa-e Yesus odi bidoa keꞌ topat deꞌ doiꞌ manah nyaꞌa-e.
pairs.target: But he withdrew himself into the desert, and prayed.

pairs.source: Takal inoh Yesus ngajal ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan ulang Farisi duoh gulu-gulu agama Yahudi guluꞌ danoꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nog soꞌ Yerusalem, soꞌ kota-kota deꞌ Galilea duoh Yudea.  Kuasa Topaꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ Yesus, nyaꞌa deꞌ monam ponai mokuaꞌ.
pairs.target: On one of those days, he was teaching; and there were Pharisees and teachers of the law sitting by, who had come out of every village of Galilee, Judea, and Jerusalem. The power of the Lord was with him to heal them.

pairs.source: Takal inoh ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa nog toban niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ gilagan guling deꞌ tun amuak.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ suba toban nyaꞌa inoh keꞌ daang boli saꞌ tapod gan deꞌ sulung jowin Yesus.
pairs.target: Behold, men brought a paralyzed man on a cot, and they sought to bring him in to lay before Jesus.

pairs.source: Pak-e bogoꞌ nyaꞌa danoꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e ponai toban molot.  Inohleh ngan-e odop-e munoꞌ paꞌad nyaꞌa deꞌ gilagan inoh keꞌ tun bungan boli deꞌ ilow-e lata.  Yomoꞌ odop-e munoꞌ bukaꞌ ilow-e duoh pimuun nyaꞌa inoh baya amuak-e deꞌ sulung jowin Yesus deꞌ uun nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ inoh.
pairs.target: Not finding a way to bring him in because of the multitude, they went up to the housetop, and let him down through the tiles with his cot into the middle before Jesus.

pairs.source: Takal Yesus ningaꞌ ngan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ lobih bisayaꞌ, Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah onam palah inoh, “Dosamuꞌ moh obuah ngapun madih Kuꞌ.”
pairs.target: Seeing their faith, he said to him, “Man, your sins are forgiven you.”

pairs.source: Gulu-gulu agama Yahudi duoh ulang Farisi moꞌ sina sitipan odop-e, “Nyaꞌa itih bilani nguyat Topaꞌ, jok-e Topaꞌ sijaꞌ-e deꞌ ponai ngapun dosa!”
pairs.target: The scribes and the Pharisees began to reason, saying, “Who is this that speaks blasphemies? Who can forgive sins, but God alone?”

pairs.source: Yesus puꞌan pikil odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.  Duoh lasuꞌ sina, “Oni ngan ingan pikil deꞌ watinoh daang otin ingan?
pairs.target: But Jesus, perceiving their thoughts, answered them, “Why are you reasoning so in your hearts?

pairs.source: Ki deꞌ lobih sonang, nang dosamuꞌ moꞌ obuah ngapun atou nang mokatleh duoh ponuleh!
pairs.target: Which is easier to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven you;’ or to say, ‘Arise and walk?’

pairs.source: Pak-e puꞌan muꞌ kedoh deꞌ bumi itih Okuꞌ Onak Manusia ogiꞌ kuasa kaꞌan ngapun dosa.” Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ gilagan inoh, “Mokat tunuk amuakmuꞌ sus paliꞌ.”
pairs.target: But that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins” (he said to the paralyzed man), “I tell you, arise, and take up your cot, and go to your house.”

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa inoh lasuꞌ ganguk mun-e mokat deꞌ jowin odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, yoh moꞌ tunuk amuak-e, duoh paliꞌ simadi mudi Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: Immediately he rose up before them, and took up that which he was laying on, and departed to his house, glorifying God.

pairs.source: Yomoꞌ Nyaꞌa deꞌ ningaꞌ hal inoh ilan-e simadi-e mudi Topaꞌ.  Duoh daang kila tolu nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nang, “Ilan kuꞌ nyam-e ningaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ moh jadi onu itih!”
pairs.target: Amazement took hold on all, and they glorified God. They were filled with fear, saying, “We have seen strange things today.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ noh Yesus luah Yoh moꞌ ningaꞌ niꞌ naꞌan pinagih suke deꞌ, adon-e Lewi, deꞌ guluꞌ deꞌ boli suke.  Yesus sina tuduꞌ-e, “Jaꞌ nunaꞌ Okuꞌ.”
pairs.target: After these things he went out, and saw a tax collector named Levi sitting at the tax office, and said to him, “Follow me!”

pairs.source: Lewi moꞌ mujuag togan kiloja-e, yoh moꞌ nunaꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: He left everything, and rose up and followed him.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ noh Lewi nyamut Yesus yoh moꞌ ngunang pinagih suke duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon saꞌ-e suwaꞌ man samah-samah duoh odop-e.
pairs.target: Levi made a great feast for him in his house. There was a great crowd of tax collectors and others who were reclining with them.

pairs.source: Kudu-kudu naꞌan ulang Farisi duoh gulu-gulu agama Yahudi diꞌ-e sonang, yomoꞌ sina tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus, “Oni ngan ingan suaꞌ man duoh pinagih suke duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa?”
pairs.target: Their scribes and the Pharisees murmured against his disciples, saying, “Why do you eat and drink with the tax collectors and sinners?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ sehat diꞌ-e pilelu doktol jok-e nyaꞌa deꞌ monam sijaꞌ-e.
pairs.target: Jesus answered them, “Those who are healthy have no need for a physician, but those who are sick do.

pairs.source: Watinoh geh Okuꞌ nog nak-e mogan nyaꞌa deꞌ bonal odaꞌ nunaꞌ Okuꞌ, pak-e kaꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa saꞌ-e paliꞌ keꞌ olan Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: I have not come to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.”

pairs.source: Kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa sina tuduꞌ Yesus, “Pinunaꞌ Yohanes duoh pinunaꞌ ulang Farisi silalu puasa duoh bidoa.  Pak-e pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Muꞌ man duoh nuak.”
pairs.target: They said to him, “Why do John’s disciples often fast and pray, likewise also the disciples of the Pharisees, but yours eat and drink?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ odi keꞌ boli topat biluman totu idoh diꞌ-e puasa sobab tunang deꞌ dali aluaꞌ bisamah-samah duoh odop-e.
pairs.target: He said to them, “Can you make the friends of the bridegroom fast, while the bridegroom is with them?

pairs.source: Pak-e takal tunang deꞌ dali inoh obuah mit soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.  Takal inohleh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ puasa.”
pairs.target: But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them. Then they will fast in those days.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus silita tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ perumpamaan itih, “Doiꞌ ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nopung bojuh oma-e kai kain bojuh baꞌuh.  Sobab nyam yoh nai watnoh bojuh baꞌuh inoh totap totak.  Duoh kain bojuh deꞌ baꞌuh inoh geh idoh diꞌ-e bitotok duoh bojuh deꞌ oma.
pairs.target: He also told a parable to them. “No one puts a piece from a new garment on an old garment, or else he will tear the new, and also the piece from the new will not match the old.

pairs.source: Watinoh geh doiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ duwan piꞌin angul baꞌuh keꞌ daang topat piꞌin soꞌ kulit deꞌ oma.  Sobab piꞌin angul baꞌuh inoh tapod yaꞌ odaꞌ topat piꞌin soꞌ kulit inoh totak, jadi piꞌin angul-e soyang duoh topat piꞌin soꞌ kulit inoh lusak.
pairs.target: No one puts new wine into old wine skins, or else the new wine will burst the skins, and it will be spilled, and the skins will be destroyed.

pairs.source: Piꞌin angul deꞌ baꞌuh halus daang topat piꞌin deꞌ soꞌ kulit deꞌ baꞌuh geh.
pairs.target: But new wine must be put into fresh wine skins, and both are preserved.

pairs.source: Watinoh geh doiꞌ nyaꞌa laꞌan nuak piꞌin angul deꞌ baꞌuh mokuaꞌ nuak piꞌin angul deꞌ oma, sobab piꞌin angul deꞌ oma inoh lobih masog in-e.”
pairs.target: No man having drunk old wine immediately desires new, for he says, ‘The old is better.’”

pairs.source: Takal onu Sabat Yesus ngilusuꞌ kobon gandum, pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ tuk buaꞌ gandum deꞌ munoꞌ.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ gisik gandum inoh deꞌ tongan-e ngan-e yaꞌ man isin-e.
pairs.target: Now on the second Sabbath after the first, he was going through the grain fields. His disciples plucked the heads of grain and ate, rubbing them in their hands.

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan ulang Farisi moꞌ ngalah odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nang, “Oni nai ingan diꞌ nunaꞌ ukum daang agama otoꞌ, ingan nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaman nyaꞌa nai-e daang onu Sabat!”
pairs.target: But some of the Pharisees said to them, “Why do you do that which is not lawful to do on the Sabbath day?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot ulang Farisi deꞌ munoꞌ, “Aluaꞌ doiꞌ keh ingan basa silita oni deꞌ nai Daud takal yoh duoh ayua deꞌ nunaꞌ-e pilai?
pairs.target: Jesus, answering them, said, “Haven’t you read what David did when he was hungry, he, and those who were with him;

pairs.source: Yoh molot kaang Boli Topaꞌ, yoh moꞌ mit pinguman deꞌ moꞌ ngin nyaꞌa tuduꞌ Topaꞌ yoh moꞌ man-e.  Mokuaꞌ noh yoh moꞌ ngin geh pinguman inoh tuduꞌ ayua deꞌ nunaꞌ odop-e odaꞌ man-e, nak-e diꞌ-e puꞌan nang ukum daang agama otoꞌ pimipin agama Yahudi sijaꞌ-a deꞌ soꞌon man pinguman inoh.”
pairs.target: how he entered into God’s house, and took and ate the show bread, and gave also to those who were with him, which is not lawful to eat except for the priests alone?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ sina lagiꞌ in-e, “Okuꞌ Onak Manusia deꞌ bikuasa kaꞌan notu oni deꞌ soꞌon duoh deꞌ diꞌ soꞌon nyaꞌa nai daang onu Sabat.”
pairs.target: He said to them, “The Son of Man is lord of the Sabbath.”

pairs.source: Daang onu Sabat deꞌ bokon lagiꞌ Yesus molot keꞌ daang boli topat simayang Yoh moꞌ ngajal danoꞌ ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos tongan toꞌuh-e.
pairs.target: It also happened on another Sabbath that he entered into the synagogue and taught. There was a man there, and his right hand was withered.

pairs.source: Danoꞌ ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan gulu agama Yahudi, ogiꞌ geh ulang Farisi danoꞌ ngite-e yaꞌ kalik salah Yesus saꞌ-e ogiꞌ alasan ngan-e nyalah Yesus.  Jadi odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ kajon podo Yesus yaꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tongan-e kobos noh odaꞌ mokuaꞌ daang onu Sabat.
pairs.target: The scribes and the Pharisees watched him, to see whether he would heal on the Sabbath, that they might find an accusation against him.

pairs.source: Pak-e Yesus puꞌan oniꞌ deꞌ pikil odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, Yoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tongan-e kobos niꞌ kawa noh, “Mujuag katiꞌ got.” Nyaꞌa noh moꞌ mokat mujuag odi tuduꞌ-e.
pairs.target: But he knew their thoughts; and he said to the man who had the withered hand, “Rise up, and stand in the middle.” He arose and stood.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ noh Yesus moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ, “Daang agama otoꞌ oni deꞌ soꞌon nyeꞌ nai-e daang onu Sabat, nai oniꞌ deꞌ paguh atou nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat? Nyilamat nyaꞌa keh kanam nyaꞌa?”
pairs.target: Then Jesus said to them, “I will ask you something: Is it lawful on the Sabbath to do good, or to do harm? To save a life, or to kill?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ ningaꞌ tuduꞌ suaꞌ-suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ.  Yoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos tongan-e inoh, “Jugan tonganmuꞌ.” Nyaꞌa inoh moꞌ jugan tongan-e, tongan-e lasuꞌ mokuaꞌ soꞌ onam-e.
pairs.target: He looked around at them all, and said to the man, “Stretch out your hand.” He did, and his hand was restored as sound as the other.

pairs.source: Pak-e gulu agama Yahudi duoh ulang Farisi deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sukup tiwas, yoh moꞌ biloneng sitipan odop-e, oni deꞌ yaꞌ nai-e tuduꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: But they were filled with rage, and talked with one another about what they might do to Jesus.

pairs.source: Diꞌ-e tuwi soꞌ noh Yesus maꞌad keꞌ punguꞌ soꞌ-e yaꞌ bidoa.  Danoꞌ Yoh niꞌ ngalom-ngalom bidoa tuduꞌ Topaꞌ .
pairs.target: In these days, he went out to the mountain to pray, and he continued all night in prayer to God.

pairs.source: Takal onu moꞌ jawaꞌ Yoh mogan pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, Yoh moꞌ pilih simoong duwoh naꞌan soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.  Yesus biladon simoong duwoh nyaꞌa deꞌ pilih-E noh rasul.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ iyohleh,
pairs.target: When it was day, he called his disciples, and from them he chose twelve, whom he also named apostles:

pairs.source: Simon deꞌ Yesus mogan Petrus, Andreas madih Simon, Yakobus, Yohanes, Filipus, Bartolomeus,
pairs.target: Simon, whom he also named Peter; Andrew, his brother; James; John; Philip; Bartholomew;

pairs.source: Matius, Tomas, Yakobus onak Alfeus, Simon panglima soꞌ Zelot,
pairs.target: Matthew; Thomas; James, the son of Alphaeus; Simon, who was called the Zealot;

pairs.source: Yudas onak Yakobus, yomoꞌ Yudas Iskariot deꞌ ngin Yesus deꞌ musoh-E.
pairs.target: Judas the son of James; and Judas Iscariot, who also became a traitor.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ muun soꞌ punguꞌ inoh bibaya duoh ayua rasul-rasul, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ loꞌo mujuag deꞌ topat deꞌ lata.  Danoꞌ bogoꞌ geh pinunaꞌ-E deꞌ bokon, bogoꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ nog soꞌ kota Yerusalem, duoh bogoꞌ geh soꞌ topat deꞌ bokon, ogiꞌ deꞌ soꞌ propinsi Yudea, kota-kota Tirus, Sidon deꞌ bingon laut.
pairs.target: He came down with them, and stood on a level place, with a crowd of his disciples, and a great number of the people from all Judea and Jerusalem, and the sea coast of Tyre and Sidon, who came to hear him and to be healed of their diseases;

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ odi kanoꞌ yaꞌ ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ nang Yesus, danoꞌ geh Yesus moꞌ odaꞌ onam odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ mokuaꞌ.  Ogiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ munua molot daang gonan-e suaꞌ geh odi kanoꞌ tuang mokuaꞌ geh.
pairs.target: as well as those who were troubled by unclean spirits, and they were being healed.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa yaꞌ tomaꞌ Yesus sobab ogiꞌ kuasa deꞌ luah so-E deꞌ ponai odaꞌ onam tiboꞌi nyaꞌa mokuaꞌ.
pairs.target: All the multitude sought to touch him, for power came out of him and healed them all.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ ngiduang pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, Yoh moꞌ sina in-e, “Sonangleh ingan deꞌ botak kolag sobab Topaꞌ leh deꞌ jadi Laja ingan.
pairs.target: He lifted up his eyes to his disciples, and said, “Blessed are you who are poor, God’s Kingdom is yours.

pairs.source: Sonangleh ingan deꞌ pilai adin sobab tiaꞌ ijoꞌ inganleh deꞌ busuah! Sonangleh ingan deꞌ siꞌian adin sobab tiaꞌ ijoꞌ inganleh deꞌ towoh!
pairs.target: Blessed are you who hunger now, for you will be filled. Blessed are you who weep now, for you will laugh.

pairs.source: Sonangleh ingan simoꞌo nyaꞌa buꞌui deꞌ ingan, nyaꞌa doliaꞌ bisapul duoh ingan, obuah nguyat odaꞌ nyaꞌa, obuah pijaꞌat odaꞌ nyaꞌa sobab ingan nunaꞌ Okuꞌ Onak Manusia!
pairs.target: Blessed are you when men shall hate you, and when they shall exclude and mock you, and throw out your name as evil, for the Son of Man’s sake.

pairs.source: Sonangleh ingan deꞌ obuah nai watinoh geh odaꞌ nyaꞌa, sobab ayuh pah deꞌ moh sidia daang sulga.  Natong nyeꞌ nabi-nabi joman noꞌuh-e obuah nyusah geh odaꞌ sumuk babai nyaꞌa Yahudi.
pairs.target: Rejoice in that day, and leap for joy, for behold, your reward is great in heaven, for their fathers did the same thing to the prophets.

pairs.source: Pak-e binasaleh ingan deꞌ kaya adin sobab ingan moꞌ blasa kiꞌan sonang!
pairs.target: “But woe to you who are rich! For you have received your consolation.

pairs.source: Binasaleh ingan deꞌ busuah adin sobab tiaꞌ ijoꞌ ingan deꞌ yaꞌ pilai! Binasaleh ingan deꞌ towoh adin sobab tiaꞌ ijoꞌ ingan deꞌ yaꞌ siꞌian!
pairs.target: Woe to you, you who are full now, for you will be hungry. Woe to you who laugh now, for you will mourn and weep.

pairs.source: Binasaleh ingan deꞌ obuah mudi suaꞌ nyaꞌa sobab watinoh geh sumuk babai odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ mudi nabi-nabi palsu joman noꞌuh-e.”
pairs.target: Woe, when men speak well of you, for their fathers did the same thing to the false prophets.

pairs.source: “Pak-e tuduꞌ ingan deꞌ ngojit Okuꞌ adin Okuꞌ ngin sibaya itih: Ngibalaleh nyaꞌa deꞌ buꞌui deꞌ ingan, naileh oniꞌ deꞌ paguh tuduꞌ-e.
pairs.target: “But I tell you who hear: love your enemies, do good to those who hate you,

pairs.source: Mitiaꞌ Topaꞌ bilokat nyaꞌa deꞌ lika nyupah ingan, bidoa kaꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ jaꞌat tuduꞌ ingan.
pairs.target: bless those who curse you, and pray for those who mistreat you.

pairs.source: Simoꞌo nyaꞌa napal paningmuꞌ deꞌ nuwaꞌ boit nginleh biaꞌ paningmuꞌ deꞌ nuwaꞌ toꞌuh.  Nyam nyaꞌa mit jubah muꞌ ngin tuduꞌ-e baya bojuhmuꞌ.
pairs.target: To him who strikes you on the cheek, offer also the other; and from him who takes away your cloak, don’t withhold your coat also.

pairs.source: Nyam nyaꞌa mitiaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ muꞌu nginleh inoh tuduꞌ-e, nyam basa-e ogiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ mit nyaꞌa soꞌ muꞌu maꞌ jolaꞌ mitiaꞌ odaꞌ paliꞌ-e.
pairs.target: Give to everyone who asks you, and don’t ask him who takes away your goods to give them back again.

pairs.source: Naileh tuduꞌ nyaꞌa oniꞌ deꞌ suka muꞌu yaꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa nai tuduꞌ odopmuꞌ.
pairs.target: “As you would like people to do to you, do exactly so to them.

pairs.source: Nyam ingan ngibalaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngibalaꞌ ingan sijaꞌ-e, patut keh ingan obuah mudi? Nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa ngibalaꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon deꞌ ngibalaꞌ odop-e!
pairs.target: If you love those who love you, what credit is that to you? For even sinners love those who love them.

pairs.source: Nyam ingan nai oniꞌ deꞌ paguh tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nai paguh duꞌ ingan sijaꞌ-e, patut keh ingan obuah mudi! Nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa tuang nai watnoh geh.
pairs.target: If you do good to those who do good to you, what credit is that to you? For even sinners do the same.

pairs.source: Nyam ingan ngin nyam duit jok-e tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ dapod gati-e, patut keh ingan obuah mudi? Nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa tuang ngin nyam duit tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa geh, yoh moꞌ paliꞌ mitiaꞌ-e!
pairs.target: If you lend to those from whom you hope to receive, what credit is that to you? Even sinners lend to sinners, to receive back as much.

pairs.source: Maꞌ yaꞌ watnoh neh! Nyanyang nyeꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ buꞌui deꞌ ingan neh, nai oniꞌ deꞌ paguh tuduꞌ-e.  Asal ingan ngin nyam maꞌ yaꞌ mitiaꞌ gati-e.  Nyam ingan nai watnoh, pah ingan ayuh, ingan moꞌ jadi onak-onak Topaꞌ deꞌ paling Bigatung.  Sobab Topaꞌ paguh geh otin-E tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ doliaꞌ bisukul duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ jaꞌat.
pairs.target: But love your enemies, and do good, and lend, expecting nothing back; and your reward will be great, and you will be children of the Most High; for he is kind toward the unthankful and evil.

pairs.source: Ingan halus masiꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa kodaꞌ Samaꞌ ingan deꞌ sulga tuang masiꞌ geh tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa.”
pairs.target: “Therefore be merciful, even as your Father is also merciful.

pairs.source: “Maꞌ sibalang nyalah nyaꞌa saꞌ odop ingan diꞌ ngan obuah nyalah odaꞌ Topaꞌ.  Maꞌ lika ngukum nyaꞌa, saꞌ Topaꞌ diꞌ-e ngukum ingan.  Ngin apun tuduꞌ nyaꞌa saꞌ Topaꞌ ngin apun tuduꞌ ingan.
pairs.target: Don’t judge, and you won’t be judged. Don’t condemn, and you won’t be condemned. Set free, and you will be set free.

pairs.source: Ngin oniꞌ deꞌ plelu nyaꞌa saꞌ Topaꞌ ngin geh tuduꞌ ingan, Topaꞌ ngin deꞌ sukup-sukup bogoꞌ-e, obuaꞌ punuaꞌ mipil deꞌ moꞌ obuah nginyon kaꞌan muꞌu sobab oni kiang muꞌ ngin tuduꞌ nyaꞌa, kiang inoh geh Topaꞌ ngin tuduꞌ muꞌu.”
pairs.target: “Give, and it will be given to you: good measure, pressed down, shaken together, and running over, will be given to you. For with the same measure you measure it will be measured back to you.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e ngan-e yaꞌ ngin perumpamaan tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Dapod keh nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ kayak nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ? Doh diꞌ-e soꞌ duwoh odop-e labuꞌ keꞌ lubang neh?
pairs.target: He spoke a parable to them. “Can the blind guide the blind? Won’t they both fall into a pit?

pairs.source: Doiꞌ ogiꞌ murid deꞌ lobih ayuh soꞌ gulu-e, asal murid inoh moꞌ mokuaꞌ bilajal ke yoh ponai jadi samah kodaꞌ gulu-e.
pairs.target: A disciple is not above his teacher, but everyone when he is fully trained will be like his teacher.

pairs.source: Oni ingan ponai ningaꞌ lonas daang boton madih ingan pak-e botang koyuh daang boton odop ingan diꞌ ingan ngoon-e?
pairs.target: Why do you see the speck of chaff that is in your brother’s eye, but don’t consider the beam that is in your own eye?

pairs.source: Oniwat ngan ingan ponai tanon tuduꞌ madih ingan, ‘Tiꞌ kuꞌ kadi lonas soꞌ botonmu,’ daang boton odop ingan sijaꞌ-e ogiꞌ botang koyuh deꞌ diꞌ ingan kilin-e? Maꞌ lika pibulaꞌ kadi dioꞌ botang koyuh deꞌ ogiꞌ daang boton odopmuꞌ.  Ke muꞌu tapod ningaꞌ, mokuaꞌ noh tapod kadi lonas soꞌ boton madihmuꞌ.”
pairs.target: Or how can you tell your brother, ‘Brother, let me remove the speck of chaff that is in your eye,’ when you yourself don’t see the beam that is in your own eye? You hypocrite! First remove the beam from your own eye, and then you can see clearly to remove the speck of chaff that is in your brother’s eye.

pairs.source: “Tongon jojak deꞌ paguh idoh diꞌ-e bibuaꞌ buaꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat.  Watnoh geh tongon jojak deꞌ jaꞌat diꞌ-e bibuaꞌ buaꞌ deꞌ paguh.
pairs.target: For there is no good tree that produces rotten fruit; nor again a rotten tree that produces good fruit.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa puꞌan tongon jojak soꞌ buaꞌ-e, totaꞌ lojaꞌ diꞌ-e bibuaꞌ buaꞌ ara, bikolam diꞌ-e bibuaꞌ buaꞌ angul.
pairs.target: For each tree is known by its own fruit. For people don’t gather figs from thorns, nor do they gather grapes from a bramble bush.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ paguh nai oniꞌ deꞌ paguh sobab otin-e punuaꞌ odaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ paguh.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ jaꞌat nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat sobab otin-e punuaꞌ odaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat.  Sobab oniꞌ deꞌ nang nyaꞌa kai bobaꞌ-e inoh, luah soꞌ otin-e.”
pairs.target: The good man out of the good treasure of his heart brings out that which is good, and the evil man out of the evil treasure of his heart brings out that which is evil, for out of the abundance of the heart, his mouth speaks.

pairs.source: “Doiꞌ guna-e ingan mogan Okuꞌ pimipin, pak-e diꞌ ingan nai oniꞌ deꞌ tanonkuꞌ tuduꞌ ingan!
pairs.target: “Why do you call me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ and don’t do the things which I say?

pairs.source: Okuꞌ yaꞌ ngin soto nyaꞌa deꞌ nog duꞌ Okuꞌ deꞌ ngojit pingunangKuꞌ duoh nai-e.
pairs.target: Everyone who comes to me, and hears my words, and does them, I will show you who he is like.

pairs.source: Iyoh kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngan-e kajuag boli-e, yoh kaliah tanaꞌ nai lubang tuluap-tuluap-e nog-e dapod batuh, yoh moꞌ kajuag tiang tun batuh inoh.  Takal ogiꞌ ubaꞌ, yoh moꞌ ubaꞌ obuah boli inoh, biguyut bigogos idoh geh, sobab boli noh togap.
pairs.target: He is like a man building a house, who dug and went deep, and laid a foundation on the rock. When a flood arose, the stream broke against that house, and could not shake it, because it was founded on the rock.

pairs.source: Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit pingunangkuꞌ, yoh moꞌ idoh diꞌ-e nai kodaꞌ oni deꞌ nang kuꞌ, yoh noh kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kajuag boli-e deꞌ tanaꞌ pak-e lubang deꞌ nai-e ladas diꞌ-e nog batuh.  Nyam ubaꞌ nog, boli-e inoh lasuꞌ patuab lubuh, sobab boli-e inoh goyua.”
pairs.target: But he who hears, and doesn’t do, is like a man who built a house on the earth without a foundation, against which the stream broke, and immediately it fell, and the ruin of that house was great.”

pairs.source: Takal Yesus mokuaꞌ sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ, Yoh moꞌ odi keꞌ Kapernaum.
pairs.target: After he had finished speaking in the hearing of the people, he entered into Capernaum.

pairs.source: Danoꞌ ogiꞌ panglima Roma deꞌ nyayang kuli-e.  Kuli-e inoh monam, sinok-sinok-e yaꞌ kobos.
pairs.target: A certain centurion’s servant, who was dear to him, was sick and at the point of death.

pairs.source: Takal panglima inoh ngojit gah Yesus, yoh moꞌ odaꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan pimipin ulang Yahudi odi tuduꞌ Yesus, odaꞌ mitiaꞌ saꞌ Yesus odi duoh odaꞌ kuli-e mokuaꞌ soꞌ onam-e.
pairs.target: When he heard about Jesus, he sent to him elders of the Jews, asking him to come and save his servant.

pairs.source: Takal nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nog duꞌ Yesus, nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bonal-bonal mitiaꞌ tulung saꞌ Yesus tulung panglima inoh.  In nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ duꞌ Yesus, “Panglima itih patut Ingan tulung-e,
pairs.target: When they came to Jesus, they begged him earnestly, saying, “He is worthy for you to do this for him,

pairs.source: sobab iyoh ngibalaꞌ bangsa otoꞌ, yoh moꞌ nai boli topat simayang kaꞌan koꞌih.”
pairs.target: for he loves our nation, and he built our synagogue for us.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus odi bisamah-samah duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ.  Takal Yesus moꞌ sinok-e yaꞌ nog boli panglima inoh, panglima inoh odaꞌ dingan-dingan-e odi tanon deꞌ Yesus, “Dusah nak lolah posah odi keꞌ bolikuꞌ.  Okuꞌ diꞌ patut tlimaꞌ Ingan deꞌ boli okuꞌ.
pairs.target: Jesus went with them. When he was now not far from the house, the centurion sent friends to him, saying to him, “Lord, don’t trouble yourself, for I am not worthy for you to come under my roof.

pairs.source: Inohleh sobab-e okuꞌ jaꞌ-e diꞌ bilani bidapod duoh Ingan.  Jadi sobot sijaꞌ-e nang mokuaꞌ, kulikuꞌ totap lasuꞌ mokuaꞌ.
pairs.target: Therefore I didn’t even think myself worthy to come to you; but say the word, and my servant will be healed.

pairs.source: Samah kodaꞌ okuꞌ.  Okuꞌ nunaꞌ geh tuduꞌ plitah nyaꞌa deꞌ somu, duoh deꞌ douꞌ okuꞌ, sidadu-sidadu totu yoh lasuꞌ nunaꞌ plitahkuꞌ.  Nyam okuꞌ sobot odaꞌ, ‘Buu,’ yoh buu geh duoh nyam okuꞌ sobot tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon, ‘Got katiꞌ,’ yoh nog geh, duoh nyam kuꞌ sobot tuduꞌ kuli okuꞌ, ‘Nai itih,’ yoh moꞌ nai-e.”
pairs.target: For I also am a man placed under authority, having under myself soldiers. I tell this one, ‘Go!’ and he goes; and to another, ‘Come!’ and he comes; and to my servant, ‘Do this,’ and he does it.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ ilan ngojit-e.  Yoh moꞌ lasuꞌ sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ deꞌ nunaꞌ Iyoh, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Bisayaꞌ deꞌ sukup ayuh deꞌ kakuꞌ panglima itih aluaꞌ doiꞌ geh Kuꞌ tapod deꞌ ulang Israel!”
pairs.target: When Jesus heard these things, he marveled at him, and turned and said to the multitude who followed him, “I tell you, I have not found such great faith, no, not in Israel.”

pairs.source: Takal pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi deꞌ obuah odaꞌ panglima inoh odi tuduꞌ Yesus inoh paliꞌ keꞌ boli, yoh moꞌ ningaꞌ kuli inoh moh mokuaꞌ.
pairs.target: Those who were sent, returning to the house, found that the servant who had been sick was well.

pairs.source: Diꞌ-e tuwi soꞌ inoh, Yesus odi keꞌ kota Nain.  Pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E duoh nyaꞌa bogoꞌ odi bisamah-samah duoh-E.
pairs.target: Soon afterwards, he went to a city called Nain. Many of his disciples, along with a great multitude, went with him.

pairs.source: Takal Yesus moꞌ nog sinok tiban gerbang kota, nyaꞌa katod todang deꞌ sopaꞌ kota.  Deꞌ kobos inoh onak dali, onak sinoꞌ jana deꞌ jok-e niꞌ, bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kota inoh nunaꞌ sinoꞌ nyaꞌa noh.
pairs.target: Now when he came near to the gate of the city, behold, one who was dead was carried out, the only son of his mother, and she was a widow. Many people of the city were with her.

pairs.source: Takal Yesus ningaꞌ sinoꞌ nyaꞌa noh, Yoh moꞌ masiꞌ tuduꞌ-e Yoh moꞌ nang, “Maꞌ siꞌian!”
pairs.target: When the Lord saw her, he had compassion on her, and said to her, “Don’t cry.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ noh Yesus moꞌ odi sinok todang noh Yoh moꞌ tomaꞌ ponam-e, tukang tawiak noh moꞌ loꞌo.  Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, “Onak bujang mokat mey!”
pairs.target: He came near and touched the coffin, and the bearers stood still. He said, “Young man, I tell you, arise!”

pairs.source: Onak bujang deꞌ moꞌ kobos inoh moꞌ mokat guluꞌ yoh moꞌ sina, mokuaꞌ noh Yesus moꞌ ngin tuduꞌ sinoꞌ-e.
pairs.target: He who was dead sat up, and began to speak. And he gave him to his mother.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa obuaꞌ tolu yoh moꞌ mudi Topaꞌ.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ nang, “Niꞌ naꞌan nabi deꞌ ayuh moꞌ nog deꞌ uluk otoꞌ! Topaꞌ moh nog nyilamat umat-e!”
pairs.target: Fear took hold of all, and they glorified God, saying, “A great prophet has arisen among us!” and, “God has visited his people!”

pairs.source: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kupuaꞌ Yudea duoh kupuaꞌ deꞌ sinok noh moꞌ ngojit gah Yesus.
pairs.target: This report went out concerning him in the whole of Judea, and in all the surrounding region.

pairs.source: Pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yohanes tanon tuduꞌ Yohanes suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nai Yesus.  Yohanes moꞌ mogan duwoh naꞌan pinunaꞌ-e.
pairs.target: The disciples of John told him about all these things.

pairs.source: Yoh moꞌ odaꞌ odi sikian tuduꞌ Yesus, “Ingan keh nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ nog kodaꞌ deꞌ janyi Topaꞌ, podo koꞌih kajon nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon?”
pairs.target: John, calling to himself two of his disciples, sent them to Jesus, saying, “Are you the one who is coming, or should we look for another?”

pairs.source: Soꞌ duwoh pinunaꞌ Yohanes inoh odi tuduꞌ Yesus yoh moꞌ nang, “Yohanes Pembaptis odaꞌ koꞌih sikian tuduꞌ Ingan, podo Ingan nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ nog kodaꞌ deꞌ janyi Topaꞌ, podo koꞌih kajon nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon?”
pairs.target: When the men had come to him, they said, “John the Baptizer has sent us to you, saying, ‘Are you he who comes, or should we look for another?’”

pairs.source: Pas takal inoh geh, Yesus odaꞌ nyaꞌa bogoꞌ mokuaꞌ soꞌ onam-e, duoh pibuu munua Yoh moꞌ odaꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ ponai ningaꞌ.
pairs.target: In that hour he cured many of diseases and plagues and evil spirits; and to many who were blind he gave sight.

pairs.source: Jadi Yesus moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Paliꞌleh tuduꞌ Yohanes tanon oni deꞌ ngojit ingan duoh oni deꞌ kilin ingan, nyaꞌa butaꞌ ponai ningaꞌ, nyaꞌa gilagan ponai ponu, nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah onam kulit deꞌ sukup palah ponai mokuaꞌ, nyaꞌa bongam ponai klingah, nyaꞌa kobos ponai paliꞌ idip duoh Gah deꞌ Paguh soꞌ Topaꞌ obuah tanon tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ botak kolag.
pairs.target: Jesus answered them, “Go and tell John the things which you have seen and heard: that the blind receive their sight, the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised up, and the poor have good news preached to them.

pairs.source: Sonangleh nyaꞌa deꞌ totap bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.”
pairs.target: Blessed is he who finds no occasion for stumbling in me.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ noh pinunaꞌ Yohanes moꞌ buu, Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa bogoꞌ in-e, “Noꞌuh-e ingan odi keꞌ padang pasil idoh diꞌ-e kaꞌan ningaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ sasou kila-e kodaꞌ duh deꞌ obuah yup sobak.
pairs.target: When John’s messengers had departed, he began to tell the multitudes about John, “What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken by the wind?

pairs.source: Duoh odi kalik nyaꞌa deꞌ kai pimakai paguh baya idip sonang idoh diꞌ-e deꞌ padang pasil, nyaꞌa deꞌ watinoh iyoh loꞌo deꞌ istana!
pairs.target: But what did you go out to see? A man clothed in soft clothing? Behold, those who are gorgeously dressed, and live delicately, are in kings’ courts.

pairs.source: Ingan itih luah yaꞌ odi ningaꞌ nabi.  Bonal deꞌ ningaꞌ ingan! Pak-e sibonal-e nyaꞌa itih lobih ayuh lagiꞌ soꞌ nabi.
pairs.target: But what did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I tell you, and much more than a prophet.

pairs.source: Sobab Yohanes inoh deꞌ obuah sobot daang ayat Kitab, In Topaꞌ, ‘Itihleh nyaꞌa deꞌ odaꞌ Kuꞌ dioꞌ soꞌ Muꞌu, Saꞌ yoh bukaꞌ olan kaꞌan Muꞌu!’ In Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: This is he of whom it is written, ‘Behold, I send my messenger before your face, who will prepare your way before you.’

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ, “Natong nyeꞌ deꞌ dunia itih doiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ lobih ayuh soꞌ Yohanes Pembaptis.  Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ paling isit soꞌ umat Topaꞌ, lobih ayuh soꞌ Yohanes Pembaptis.”
pairs.target: “For I tell you, among those who are born of women there is not a greater prophet than John the Baptizer, yet he who is least in God’s Kingdom is greater than he.”

pairs.source: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa baya pinagih-pinagih suke ngojit pingunang Yesus, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nunaꞌ pilitah Topaꞌ, sobab odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ obuah baptis odaꞌ Yohanes.
pairs.target: When all the people and the tax collectors heard this, they declared God to be just, having been baptized with John’s baptism.

pairs.source: Pak-e ulang Farisi duoh gulu-gulu agama Yahudi inoh doliaꞌ-e tlimaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nang Topaꞌ tuduꞌ odop-e, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ doliaꞌ-e obuah baptis odaꞌ Yohanes.
pairs.target: But the Pharisees and the lawyers rejected the counsel of God, not being baptized by him themselves.

pairs.source: Yesus sina lagiꞌ in-e, “Okuꞌ baning nyaꞌa joman itih kodaꞌ oni?
pairs.target: “To what then will I liken the people of this generation? What are they like?

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ kodaꞌ onak opot deꞌ nai koduk-e deꞌ pasal, niꞌ uluk nang bogan-e tuduꞌ uluk deꞌ bokon, ‘Koꞌih mamak lagu deꞌ sonang kaꞌan ingan pak-e ingan doliaꞌ ngan gogo! Koꞌih ngilagu saꞌan nyaꞌa kobos pak-e idoh geh diꞌ ingan siꞌian!’
pairs.target: They are like children who sit in the marketplace, and call to one another, saying, ‘We piped to you, and you didn’t dance. We mourned, and you didn’t weep.’

pairs.source: Ingan deꞌ diꞌ-e tilimaꞌ Okuꞌ duoh Yohanes Pembaptis samah kodaꞌ onak opot deꞌ pasal inoh.  Takal Yohanes Pembaptis nog, iyoh puasa diꞌ-e nuak angul, ingan nang, ‘Munua molot daang gonan-e!’
pairs.target: For John the Baptizer came neither eating bread nor drinking wine, and you say, ‘He has a demon.’

pairs.source: Duoh Onak Manusia nog Iyoh man nuak, ingan nang, ‘Ningaꞌ Nyaꞌa noh! Jolua, pimabuk, bidingan duoh pinagih suke duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa!’
pairs.target: The Son of Man has come eating and drinking, and you say, ‘Behold, a gluttonous man, and a drunkard; a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’

pairs.source: Pak-e bijak Topaꞌ tonga soꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tlimaꞌ ajal-E.”
pairs.target: Wisdom is justified by all her children.”

pairs.source: Niꞌ naꞌan ulang Farisi, adon-e Simon, ngijaꞌ Yesus odi man.  Yesus moꞌ odi keꞌ boli-e Yoh moꞌ man.
pairs.target: One of the Pharisees invited him to eat with him. He entered into the Pharisee’s house, and sat at the table.

pairs.source: Deꞌ kota inoh ogiꞌ niꞌ dayung adoh.  Takal yoh ngojit Yesus man deꞌ boli ulang Farisi inoh, yoh moꞌ odi kanoꞌ toban niꞌ jobul deꞌ isiꞌ-e inyuaꞌ lona deꞌ maal.
pairs.target: Behold, a woman in the city who was a sinner, when she knew that he was reclining in the Pharisee’s house, brought an alabaster jar of ointment.

pairs.source: Yoh mujuag deꞌ punuaꞌ Yesus sinok poꞌon-E, daang-e siꞌian deꞌ poꞌon Yesus bisaꞌ sijaꞌ-a odaꞌ piꞌin boton-e.  Mokuaꞌ noh yoh ngisuꞌ poꞌon Yesus pakai buak-e yomoꞌ sium-e, yoh moꞌ duwan inyuaꞌ lona inoh daꞌ-e.
pairs.target: Standing behind at his feet weeping, she began to wet his feet with her tears, and she wiped them with the hair of her head, kissed his feet, and anointed them with the ointment.

pairs.source: Takal Simon deꞌ ngunang Yesus ningaꞌ hal inoh, yoh sina daang otin-e, “Nyam basa nyaꞌa itih nabi oni nai diꞌ-e puꞌan ngan dayung deꞌ tomaꞌ odop-E inoh, dayung adoh!”
pairs.target: Now when the Pharisee who had invited him saw it, he said to himself, “This man, if he were a prophet, would have perceived who and what kind of woman this is who touches him, that she is a sinner.”

pairs.source: Yesus sina duꞌ Simon, “Simon ogiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ tanonkuꞌ tuduꞌ muꞌu!” “Iyoh Gulu, tanon sijaꞌ-a,” in Simon.
pairs.target: Jesus answered him, “Simon, I have something to tell you.”  He said, “Teacher, say on.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ ngin perumpamaan itih, “Ogiꞌ duwoh naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ bilutang tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngin nyam duit-e.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ niꞌ tang-e limoh latus duit pilak, nyaꞌa deꞌ nikan-e lagiꞌ tang-e limoh puluꞌ duit pilak.
pairs.target: “A certain lender had two debtors. The one owed five hundred denarii, and the other fifty.

pairs.source: Soꞌ duwoh odop-e diꞌ-e taan bayal tang-e noh, yomoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ duit noh diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ odaꞌ bayal-e.  Osi leh deꞌ soꞌ duwoh naꞌan nyaꞌa inoh deꞌ lobih ngibalaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nyam duit tuduꞌ-e noh?”
pairs.target: When they couldn’t pay, he forgave them both. Which of them therefore will love him most?”

pairs.source: Simon moꞌ nyawot-e, “Okuꞌ kila nyaꞌa deꞌ paling bogoꞌ tang-e inoh.” Yesus moꞌ nang, “Bonal oni deꞌ nang muꞌu noh.”
pairs.target: Simon answered, “He, I suppose, to whom he forgave the most.” He said to him, “You have judged correctly.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ ngiduang dayung noh yoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Simon, “Muꞌu ningaꞌ dayung itih? Okuꞌ nog keꞌ bolimuꞌ, doiꞌ muꞌu ngin piꞌin kaꞌan mamiaꞌ poꞌonkuꞌ, pak-e dayung tih mamiaꞌ poꞌon Kuꞌ kai piꞌin boton-e, yoh moꞌ ngisuꞌ pakai buak-e.
pairs.target: Turning to the woman, he said to Simon, “Do you see this woman? I entered into your house, and you gave me no water for my feet, but she has wet my feet with her tears, and wiped them with the hair of her head.

pairs.source: Muꞌu diꞌ muꞌ nyamut Okuꞌ kai sium, pak-e dayung itih diꞌ-e mokuaꞌ-mokuaꞌ sium poꞌon Kuꞌ, soꞌ ngan Kuꞌ nog katiꞌ.
pairs.target: You gave me no kiss, but she, since the time I came in, has not ceased to kiss my feet.

pairs.source: Muꞌu diꞌ muꞌ duwan inyuaꞌ deꞌ bakKuꞌ, pak-e dayung tih moh duwan inyuaꞌ lona deꞌ poꞌon Kuꞌ.
pairs.target: You didn’t anoint my head with oil, but she has anointed my feet with ointment.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Dosa-e deꞌ bogoꞌ noh moh obuah ngapun! Dop-e iyoh moꞌ bogoꞌ geh ngibalaꞌ nyaꞌa.  Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ nang dosa odop-e isit, yoh diꞌ-e plelu bogoꞌ obuah ngapun jadi yoh isit geh ngibalaꞌ.”
pairs.target: Therefore I tell you, her sins, which are many, are forgiven, for she loved much. But to whom little is forgiven, the same loves little.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ sina duꞌ dayung noh, “Dosa-dosamuꞌ moꞌ obuah ngapun.”
pairs.target: He said to her, “Your sins are forgiven.”

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon deꞌ bisamah-samah guluꞌ man duoh Yesus, sina sitipan odop-e, “Osi nyaꞌa itih ngan-e dapod ngapun dosa nyaꞌa?”
pairs.target: Those who sat at the table with him began to say to themselves, “Who is this who even forgives sins?”

pairs.source: Pak-e Yesus sina duꞌ dayung noh, “Ngan muꞌu moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, muꞌu obuah nyilamat.  Paliꞌleh toban otin deꞌ sonang.”
pairs.target: He said to the woman, “Your faith has saved you. Go in peace.”

pairs.source: Diꞌ tui mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus ponu soꞌ kota keꞌ kota duoh kupuaꞌ keꞌ kupuaꞌ kaꞌan odi tanon gah deꞌ paguh oniwat Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja.  Soꞌ simoong duwoh pinunaꞌ-E bisamah-samah duoh Iyoh.
pairs.target: Soon afterwards, he went about through cities and villages, preaching and bringing the good news of God’s Kingdom. With him were the twelve,

pairs.source: Mun noh geh ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan dayung deꞌ Yesus odaꞌ mokuaꞌ soꞌ munua duoh onam-e deꞌ bokon.  Soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ogiꞌ Maria geh, deꞌ nyaꞌa sobot Magdalena deꞌ juꞌ munua luah soꞌ ang gonan-e;
pairs.target: and certain women who had been healed of evil spirits and infirmities: Mary who was called Magdalene, from whom seven demons had gone out;

pairs.source: Yohana sowon Khuza, iyohleh pingulus daang istana Herodes; Susana baya bogoꞌ dayung deꞌ bokon tulung Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E kai duit odop-e masim-masim.
pairs.target: and Joanna, the wife of Chuzas, Herod’s steward; Susanna; and many others; who served them from their possessions.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa bogoꞌ telus nog tuduꞌ Yesus soꞌ kudu-kudu kota, takal inoh moꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa bikuluk.  Yesus moꞌ silita tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ pakai perumpamaan itih in-e,
pairs.target: When a great multitude came together, and people from every city were coming to him, he spoke by a parable.

pairs.source: “Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa bilumoh, yoh dabul biniaꞌ deꞌ umoh-e.  Takal-e nabul, ogiꞌ biniaꞌ deꞌ labuꞌ keꞌ olan.  Biniaꞌ-e inoh obuah ngunyak odaꞌ nyaꞌa duoh obuah man odaꞌ manuk nog obuaꞌ-e.
pairs.target: “The farmer went out to sow his seed. As he sowed, some fell along the road, and it was trampled under foot, and the birds of the sky devoured it.

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ geh deꞌ labuꞌ deꞌ tanaꞌ bibatuh-batuh.  Takal tuang-e yaꞌ tumuꞌ, yomoꞌ layuꞌ sobab tanaꞌ-e bodoh.
pairs.target: Other seed fell on the rock, and as soon as it grew, it withered away, because it had no moisture.

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ geh biniaꞌ deꞌ labuꞌ daang totaꞌ lojaꞌ.  Totaꞌ lojaꞌ inoh tumuꞌ bisayaꞌ duoh biniaꞌ inoh.  Yomoꞌ ngapit-e nog-e kobos.
pairs.target: Other fell amid the thorns, and the thorns grew with it, and choked it.

pairs.source: Pak-e ogiꞌ biniaꞌ deꞌ labuꞌ deꞌ tanaꞌ deꞌ paguh, biniaꞌ noh moꞌ tumuꞌ duoh bibuaꞌ silatus kali lipat.” Mokuaꞌ ngin perumpamaan inoh, Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Ngojit nyeꞌ bonal-bonal-e, oni deꞌ nang Kuꞌ itih.”
pairs.target: Other fell into the good ground, and grew, and produced one hundred times as much fruit.” As he said these things, he called out, “He who has ears to hear, let him hear!”

pairs.source: Pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E lasuꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Yesus oni loti soꞌ perumpamaan inoh.
pairs.target: Then his disciples asked him, “What does this parable mean?”

pairs.source: Yesus lasuꞌ nyawot, “Tuduꞌ ingan moꞌ obuah tanon gah deꞌ paguh oniwat Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja, pak-e tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon Kuꞌ tanon kai perumpamaan, saꞌ-e nyam basa odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ningaꞌ-e, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e kilin-e; duoh nyam basa odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ngojit-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e ngiloti-e geh.
pairs.target: He said, “To you it is given to know the mysteries of God’s Kingdom, but to the rest in parables; that ‘seeing they may not see, and hearing they may not understand.’

pairs.source: Itih loti perumpamaan inoh, biniaꞌ inoh Pingunang Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: Now the parable is this: The seed is the word of God.

pairs.source: Biniaꞌ deꞌ labuꞌ deꞌ bingon olan inohleh nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ ngojit; pak-e takal Muot nog, yoh mit Pingunang Topaꞌ soꞌ otin nyaꞌa inoh.  Saꞌ nyaꞌa inoh diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ duoh diꞌ-e obuah nyilamat.
pairs.target: Those along the road are those who hear, then the devil comes, and takes away the word from their heart, that they may not believe and be saved.

pairs.source: Biniaꞌ deꞌ labuꞌ deꞌ tanaꞌ bibatuh iyohleh kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit Pingunang Topaꞌ inoh, yoh moꞌ tilimaꞌ daang otin-e sonang; pak-e Pingunang Topaꞌ inoh diꞌ-e tumuꞌ biaꞌat daang otin-e.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bisayaꞌ niꞌ tiliaꞌ-e geh, pak-e takal pingisuba nog, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e tiaꞌ bisayaꞌ.
pairs.target: Those on the rock are they who, when they hear, receive the word with joy; but these have no root, who believe for a while, then fall away in time of temptation.

pairs.source: Biniaꞌ deꞌ labuꞌ deꞌ uun totaꞌ lojaꞌ iyohleh kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit Pingunang Topaꞌ inoh, yoh tumuꞌ duoh biaꞌat; pak-e yoh bigaduh duoh idip-e, yoh yaꞌ idip mewah duoh sonang deꞌ dunia itih.  Suaꞌ-e inohleh deꞌ odaꞌ odop-e munoꞌ ngapit nog diꞌ-e ponai bibuaꞌ masak.
pairs.target: That which fell among the thorns, these are those who have heard, and as they go on their way they are choked with cares, riches, and pleasures of life, and bring no fruit to maturity.

pairs.source: Biniaꞌ deꞌ labuꞌ deꞌ tanaꞌ deꞌ paguh inoh kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit Pingunang Topaꞌ, yoh moꞌ nyikon daang otin-e deꞌ sukup paguh nog bibuaꞌ.”
pairs.target: Those in the good ground, these are those who with an honest and good heart, having heard the word, hold it tightly, and produce fruit with perseverance.

pairs.source: “Doiꞌ ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tung lapu kadis yomoꞌ kuab kai bona, atou yoh gan-e deꞌ libuaꞌ katel; pak-e lapu kadis inoh iyoh gan-e deꞌ tun pak, saꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ molot dapod ningaꞌ jawaꞌ-e.
pairs.target: “No one, when he has lit a lamp, covers it with a container, or puts it under a bed; but puts it on a stand, that those who enter in may see the light.

pairs.source: Sobab suaꞌ-suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ obuah suan totap yaꞌ obuah tanon, duoh oni deꞌ diꞌ-e tonga adin yaꞌ obuah kilin.
pairs.target: For nothing is hidden, that will not be revealed; nor anything secret, that will not be known and come to light.

pairs.source: Jadi, ngojit nyeꞌ bonal-bonal-e! Sobab nyaꞌa deꞌ tilimaꞌ oni deꞌ nang Kuꞌ, Topaꞌ odaꞌ yoh sukup lobih ngiloti lagiꞌ; pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e tilimaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nang Kuꞌ, bial yoh pikil nang odop-e ngiloti sit, Topaꞌ yaꞌ nai yoh diꞌ-e ngiloti oni-oni.”
pairs.target: Be careful therefore how you hear. For whoever has, to him will be given; and whoever doesn’t have, from him will be taken away even that which he thinks he has.”

pairs.source: Sinoꞌ Yesus duoh madih-madih-E yaꞌ odi tuduꞌ-E, pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e ponai bitapod duoh-E sobab nyaꞌa sikiya bogoꞌ.
pairs.target: His mother and brothers came to him, and they could not come near him for the crowd.

pairs.source: Yomoꞌ ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tanon tuduꞌ Yesus nang, “Sinoꞌ duoh madih ayua Muꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ sopaꞌ.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ bitapod duoh ingan.”
pairs.target: Some people told him, “Your mother and your brothers stand outside, desiring to see you.”

pairs.source: Pak-e Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit Pingunang Topaꞌ duoh nai-e, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ leh sinoꞌ duoh madih ayua Kuꞌ.”
pairs.target: But he answered them, “My mother and my brothers are these who hear the word of God, and do it.”

pairs.source: Niꞌ onu takal inoh Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E maꞌad keꞌ olud.  Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ, “Jaꞌ otoꞌ odi keꞌ polad donu.” Lasuꞌ odop deꞌ munoꞌ ponu.
pairs.target: Now on one of those days, he entered into a boat, himself and his disciples, and he said to them, “Let’s go over to the other side of the lake.” So they launched out.

pairs.source: Takal odop deꞌ munoꞌ bilayal Yesus boꞌos.  Tang-tang sobak libut nog deꞌ donu inoh, piꞌin mulai molot kaang olud-e duoh olud duam-e yaꞌ kuom.
pairs.target: But as they sailed, he fell asleep. A wind storm came down on the lake, and they were taking on dangerous amounts of water.

pairs.source: Lasuꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E odi guyang Yesus.  In nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ, “Gulu, Gulu! Yaꞌ kobos otoꞌ neh!” Yesus mokat yoh moꞌ lasuꞌ sina dolas-dolas-e, “Loꞌo!” Sobak duoh gilumang inoh lasuꞌ loꞌo takal inoh geh.
pairs.target: They came to him, and awoke him, saying, “Master, master, we are dying!” He awoke, and rebuked the wind and the raging of the water, and they ceased, and it was calm.

pairs.source: Yesus lasuꞌ in-e tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E noh, “Maꞌ tolu! Ingan halus bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.” Odop deꞌ-e munoꞌ ilan duoh daang kila tolu tuduꞌ Yesus yomoꞌ in-e sitipan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Osi sibonal-e nyaꞌa itih ngan sobak duoh gilumang nunaꞌ pingunang-e!”
pairs.target: He said to them, “Where is your faith?” Being afraid they marveled, saying to one another, “Who is this then, that he commands even the winds and the water, and they obey him?”

pairs.source: Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E nyamung bilayal nog keꞌ daerah nyaꞌa Gerasa deꞌ polad Donu Galilea.
pairs.target: They arrived at the country of the Gadarenes, which is opposite Galilee.

pairs.source: Takal Yesus muun keꞌ doyoh, ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan dali deꞌ soꞌ kota deꞌ ogiꞌ munua daang gonan-e nog tuduꞌ Yesus.  Moꞌ tui yoh diꞌ kai pimakai-e duoh doliaꞌ loꞌo deꞌ boli, iyoh jok laꞌan loꞌo deꞌ kubul.
pairs.target: When Jesus stepped ashore, a certain man out of the city who had demons for a long time met him. He wore no clothes, and didn’t live in a house, but in the tombs.

pairs.source: Takal-e ningaꞌ Yesus, iyoh nang bogan-e lasuꞌ bikunyug deꞌ sulung jowin Yesus duoh sina, “Oni ulusan Ingan duoh okuꞌ Yesus Onak Topaꞌ deꞌ paling Bigatung-e! Okuꞌ mitiaꞌ tulung duꞌ Ingan saꞌ Ingan maꞌ nyiksa okuꞌ.”
pairs.target: When he saw Jesus, he cried out, and fell down before him, and with a loud voice said, “What do I have to do with you, Jesus, you Son of the Most High God? I beg you, don’t torment me!”

pairs.source: Yoh sina in noh sobab Yesus odaꞌ munua inoh luah soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munua molot daang gonan-e.  Moꞌ silalu manah munua nguasa gonan-e, duoh takal tongan poꞌon-e obuah ngilate duoh nyaꞌa jaga yoh bonal-bonal, pak-e yoh dapod motod late soꞌ tongan poꞌon-e; yomoꞌ munua toban buꞌu keꞌ topat deꞌ otug-otug-e.
pairs.target: For Jesus was commanding the unclean spirit to come out of the man. For the unclean spirit had often seized the man. He was kept under guard, and bound with chains and fetters. Breaking the bonds apart, he was driven by the demon into the desert.

pairs.source: Yesus sikian tuduꞌ nyaꞌa inoh, “Osi adonmuꞌ?” “Adon koꞌih Legion,” in nyaꞌa inoh nyawot-e, sobab moꞌ bogoꞌ manah munua molot nguasa gonan-e.
pairs.target: Jesus asked him, “What is your name?” He said, “Legion,” for many demons had entered into him.

pairs.source: Munua deꞌ munoꞌ bonal-bonal mitiaꞌ saꞌ Yesus diꞌ-e kasig odop deꞌ munoꞌ molot daang lubang deꞌ sukup tuluap-e.
pairs.target: They begged him that he would not command them to go into the abyss.

pairs.source: Deꞌ sinok topat noh ogiꞌ bogoꞌ oyuaꞌ kalik man-e deꞌ tilipang dolod.  Munua moꞌ mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus saꞌ-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ molot daang oyuaꞌ-oyuaꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ.  Yesus moꞌ tanah munua deꞌ munoꞌ molot daang oyuaꞌ inoh.
pairs.target: Now there was there a herd of many pigs feeding on the mountain, and they begged him that he would allow them to enter into those. He allowed them.

pairs.source: Yomoꞌ munua deꞌ munoꞌ luah soꞌ nyaꞌa noh yomoꞌ molot kaang oyuaꞌ-oyuaꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ.  Yomoꞌ oyuaꞌ-oyuaꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ bikoduh buu keꞌ bingon gilongung yomoꞌ bitabum kaang donu.  Susuaꞌ oyua-e kobos longod.
pairs.target: The demons came out of the man, and entered into the pigs, and the herd rushed down the steep bank into the lake, and were drowned.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ jaga oyuaꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bikoduh buu mokuaꞌ ningaꞌ oni deꞌ moꞌ moh.  Yoh moꞌ kilakal hal inoh deꞌ kota Gerasa duoh deꞌ kupuaꞌ-kupuaꞌ deꞌ sinoꞌ noh.
pairs.target: When those who fed them saw what had happened, they fled, and told it in the city and in the country.

pairs.source: Lasuꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ ngumaꞌ ningaꞌ oni deꞌ moꞌ moh.  Odop deꞌ munoꞌ nog tuduꞌ Yesus, danoꞌ geh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ningaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ mokuaꞌ soꞌ munua guluꞌ sinoꞌ poꞌon Yesus, daang yoh moꞌ ogiꞌ pimakai-e duoh pimikil-e moh paguh.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ moꞌ tolu.
pairs.target: People went out to see what had happened. They came to Jesus, and found the man from whom the demons had gone out, sitting at Jesus’ feet, clothed and in his right mind; and they were afraid.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ jaga oyuaꞌ inoh ti-e ningaꞌ hal inoh yoh kilakal oni wat-e ngan odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ molot munua inoh ponai mokuaꞌ.
pairs.target: Those who saw it told them how he who had been possessed by demons was healed.

pairs.source: Yomoꞌ susuaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ daerah Gerasa duoh kupuaꞌ-kupuaꞌ deꞌ sinok inoh mitiaꞌ saꞌ Yesus buu soꞌ kanoꞌ, sobab susuaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ sukup-sukup tolu-e.  Yomoꞌ Yesus maꞌad keꞌ olud yaꞌ buu.
pairs.target: All the people of the surrounding country of the Gadarenes asked him to depart from them, for they were very much afraid. He entered into the boat, and returned.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ mokuaꞌ soꞌ munua inoh mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus saꞌ yoh suwaꞌ duoh-E.  Pak-e Yesus odaꞌ yoh paliꞌ in-e,
pairs.target: But the man from whom the demons had gone out begged him that he might go with him, but Jesus sent him away, saying,

pairs.source: “Paliꞌleh duoh tanon oni deꞌ moꞌ nai Topaꞌ tuduꞌ muꞌu.” Lasuꞌ nyaꞌa noh buu odi tanon keꞌ suaꞌ topat deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ kota-e, oni deꞌ moꞌ nai Yesus tuduꞌ-e.
pairs.target: “Return to your house, and declare what great things God has done for you.” He went his way, proclaiming throughout the whole city what great things Jesus had done for him.

pairs.source: Takal Yesus paliꞌ soꞌ polad donu, nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ moꞌ nyamut Yesus sobab odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ tui ngati-ngati Iyoh nog.
pairs.target: When Jesus returned, the multitude welcomed him, for they were all waiting for him.

pairs.source: Yomoꞌ nog niꞌ naꞌan pimipin boli topat simayang deꞌ adon-e Yairus.  Iyoh bikunyug deꞌ sulung jowin Yesus duoh mitiaꞌ saꞌ Yesus odi keꞌ boli-e,
pairs.target: Behold, there came a man named Jairus, and he was a ruler of the synagogue. He fell down at Jesus’ feet, and begged him to come into his house,

pairs.source: sobab onak tomoꞌ-e deꞌ dayung deꞌ umul-e simoong duwoh sowaꞌ yaꞌ kobos.  Takal Yesus ponu yaꞌ odi keꞌ boli Yairus, nyaꞌa bogoꞌ bitodod-todod kililing Yesus.
pairs.target: for he had an only daughter, about twelve years of age, and she was dying. But as he went, the multitudes pressed against him.

pairs.source: Deꞌ uluk odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan dayung deꞌ moꞌ simoong duwoh sowaꞌ obuah onam bubuꞌ.  Yoh moꞌ kabuaꞌ susuaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ odop-e kaꞌan bilubat tuduꞌ doktol, pak-e doiꞌ deꞌ dapod odaꞌ mokuaꞌ.
pairs.target: A woman who had a flow of blood for twelve years, who had spent all her living on physicians, and could not be healed by any,

pairs.source: Dayung inoh moꞌ odi sinok Yesus soꞌ dug-e, mokuaꞌ noh yoh moꞌ makaꞌ jubah-e.  Takal inoh geh onam bubuꞌ dayung noh moꞌ lasuꞌ mokuaꞌ.
pairs.target: came behind him, and touched the fringe of his cloak, and immediately the flow of her blood stopped.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ sikian deꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Osi deꞌ tomaꞌ Okuꞌ?” Suaꞌ nyaꞌa diꞌ-e ngakuꞌ-e.  Yomoꞌ Petrus moꞌ in-e, “Gulu ogiꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kililing Ingan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bitodod-todod sinok ingan!”
pairs.target: Jesus said, “Who touched me?” When all denied it, Peter and those with him said, “Master, the multitudes press and jostle you, and you say, ‘Who touched me?’”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Pak-e ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tomaꞌ Okuꞌ.  Okuꞌ puꞌan inoh, sobab ogiꞌ kuasa deꞌ luah soꞌ Okuꞌ.”
pairs.target: But Jesus said, “Someone did touch me, for I perceived that power has gone out of me.”

pairs.source: Dayung inoh ngoon pingunai-e moh moꞌ obuah puꞌan.  Jadi yoh moꞌ nog daang-e bigegeg yomoꞌ bikunyug deꞌ sulung jowin Yesus.  Yoh moꞌ silita tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa oni sobab iyoh makaꞌ Yesus; duoh takal iyoh tomaꞌ Yesus pinyakit-e lasuꞌ mokuaꞌ.
pairs.target: When the woman saw that she was not hidden, she came trembling, and falling down before him declared to him in the presence of all the people the reason why she had touched him, and how she was healed immediately.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ dayung inoh, “Madih Kuꞌ, sobab muꞌu bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, muꞌu mokuaꞌ.  Buu leh toban otin deꞌ sonang.”
pairs.target: He said to her, “Daughter, cheer up. Your faith has made you well. Go in peace.”

pairs.source: Ngan Yesus aluaꞌ sina, ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa nog soꞌ boli Yairus.  Yoh sina tuduꞌ Yairus, “Onak ingan moh moꞌ doiꞌ, maꞌ tiyaꞌ nyusah gulu.”
pairs.target: While he still spoke, one from the ruler of the synagogue’s house came, saying to him, “Your daughter is dead. Don’t trouble the Teacher.”

pairs.source: Takal Yesus ngojit hal inoh, Yoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Yairus, “Maꞌ tolu, bisayaꞌ sijaꞌ-e, onakmuꞌ totap mokuaꞌ.”
pairs.target: But Jesus hearing it, answered him, “Don’t be afraid. Only believe, and she will be healed.”

pairs.source: Takal Yesus nog deꞌ boli Yairus, Yoh joman nyaꞌa molot nunaꞌ odop-E; jok-e Petrus, Yohanes, Yakobus duoh sinoꞌ samaꞌ onak opot inoh sijaꞌ-e deꞌ soꞌon molot.
pairs.target: When he came to the house, he didn’t allow anyone to enter in, except Peter, John, James, the father of the child, and her mother.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa siꞌian sobab onak opot inoh moꞌ kobos.  Pak-e Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Maꞌ ingan siꞌian.  Onak opot inoh idoh diꞌ-e kobos neh, yoh jok-e boꞌos sijaꞌ-e.”
pairs.target: All were weeping and mourning her, but he said, “Don’t weep. She isn’t dead, but sleeping.”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ towoh Yesus, sobab odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ puꞌan onak dayung inoh moh moꞌ kobos.
pairs.target: They were ridiculing him, knowing that she was dead.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ kagong tongan onak opot inoh Yoh moꞌ in-e, “Mokat mey!”
pairs.target: But he put them all outside, and taking her by the hand, he called, saying, “Child, arise!”

pairs.source: Onak opot inoh moꞌ paliꞌ idip lagiꞌ, duoh takal inoh geh yoh lasuꞌ mokat.  Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus odaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ maꞌan onak opot inoh.
pairs.target: Her spirit returned, and she rose up immediately. He commanded that something be given to her to eat.

pairs.source: Pingoma onak opot noh moꞌ ilan-e.  Pak-e Yesus jaman odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tanon oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ jadi tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon.
pairs.target: Her parents were amazed, but he commanded them to tell no one what had been done.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ mogan ke simoong duwoh pinunaꞌ-e, Iyoh moꞌ ngin kuasa deꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ odaꞌ pibuu munua duoh odaꞌ nyaꞌa mokuaꞌ soꞌ onam-e.
pairs.target: He called the twelve together, and gave them power and authority over all demons, and to cure diseases.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Iyoh moꞌ odaꞌ pinunaꞌ-E odi saꞌ-a odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ monam mokuaꞌ duoh tanon oniwat Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja.
pairs.target: He sent them out to preach God’s Kingdom and to heal the sick.

pairs.source: In Yesus tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ takal-e aluaꞌ diꞌ-e ponu, “Maꞌ toban oni-oni daang pimonu ingan; maꞌ toban sikuud; maꞌ toban duit; maꞌ toban sikabiat; maꞌ toban onyad ingan; duoh maꞌ toban pimakai ingan deꞌ bokon.
pairs.target: He said to them, “Take nothing for your journey—neither staffs, nor wallet, nor bread, nor money; neither have two coats each.

pairs.source: Daki sijaꞌ-e ingan obuah tilimaꞌ, danoꞌ soꞌ ingan loꞌo nog ingan buu soꞌ topat inoh.
pairs.target: Into whatever house you enter, stay there, and depart from there.

pairs.source: Daki soꞌ ingan diꞌ-e obuah tilimaꞌ, asal ingan buꞌu soꞌ kanoꞌ ingan nguguah debu soꞌ poꞌon ingan, saꞌ jadi tanda tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.”
pairs.target: As many as don’t receive you, when you depart from that city, shake off even the dust from your feet for a testimony against them.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus moꞌ odi keꞌ kupuaꞌ-kupuaꞌ tanon Gah deꞌ Paguh duoh odaꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ daki sijaꞌ-e mokuaꞌ.
pairs.target: They departed, and went throughout the villages, preaching the Good News, and healing everywhere.

pairs.source: Takal Herodes mipin deꞌ daerah Galilea, iyoh klingah gah mukjizat deꞌ nai Yesus.  Iyoh moꞌ bigaduh kila-e, sobab ogiꞌ nyaꞌa nang Yesus inoh Yohanes Pembaptis deꞌ moꞌ paliꞌ idip.
pairs.target: Now Herod the tetrarch heard of all that was done by him; and he was very perplexed, because it was said by some that John had risen from the dead,

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ geh nyaꞌa nang nabi Elia deꞌ moꞌ paliꞌ idip.  Duoh ogiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon nang in-e ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ nabi-nabi deꞌ noꞌuh-e idip lagiꞌ.
pairs.target: and by some that Elijah had appeared, and by others that one of the old prophets had risen again.

pairs.source: Herodes moꞌ in-e, “Tiep okuꞌ moꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa notok tunguaꞌ Yohanes.  Jadi osi bih Yesus itih neh? Moꞌ bogoꞌ kuꞌ klingah gah-e.” Mokuaꞌ noh Herodes bonal-bonal yaꞌ bidapod duoh Yesus.
pairs.target: Herod said, “John I beheaded, but who is this, about whom I hear such things?” He sought to see him.

pairs.source: Takal pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus paliꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ tanon tuduꞌ Yesus oni deꞌ moꞌ nai odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.  Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ ngijaꞌ pinunaꞌ sijaꞌ-a odi keꞌ kota deꞌ adon Betsaida.
pairs.target: The apostles, when they had returned, told him what things they had done. He took them, and withdrew apart to a desert region of a city called Bethsaida.

pairs.source: Pak-e nyaꞌa bogoꞌ puꞌan topat soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ odi, nyaꞌa bogoꞌ inoh moꞌ nusud Yesus.  Takal nyaꞌa bogoꞌ nog Iyoh moꞌ tilimaꞌ-e sijaꞌ.  Iyoh moꞌ silita oniwat Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja; duoh nai odaꞌ nyaꞌa monam mokuaꞌ.
pairs.target: But the multitudes, perceiving it, followed him. He welcomed them, and spoke to them of God’s Kingdom, and he cured those who needed healing.

pairs.source: Takal onu yaꞌ ngumi, keꞌ simoong duwoh pinunaꞌ ti-e odi tuduꞌ Yesus yomoꞌ sina in-e, “Paguh Ingan odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ mutiꞌ buu keꞌ kupuaꞌ-kupuaꞌ deꞌ sinok katiꞌ, saꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ soꞌon pinguman duoh topat-e ngilumon, sobab topat itih doiꞌ oni-oni daꞌ-e.”
pairs.target: The day began to wear away; and the twelve came, and said to him, “Send the multitude away, that they may go into the surrounding villages and farms, and lodge, and get food, for we are here in a deserted place.”

pairs.source: Pak-e in Yesus nyawot pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, “Ingan deꞌ halus ngin pinguman tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ mutiꞌ.” Pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ nang in-e, “Deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ koꞌih itih jok-e limoh kueh baya duwoh polong ikian.  Koꞌih halus odi milih deꞌ baꞌuh lagiꞌ keꞌ sukup kaꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ kiang-kiang itih.”
pairs.target: But he said to them, “You give them something to eat.” They said, “We have no more than five loaves and two fish, unless we should go and buy food for all these people.”

pairs.source: Sobab danoꞌ ogiꞌ kila-kila-e limoh libu naꞌan dali.  Yomoꞌ Yesus moꞌ sina in-e duoh pinunaꞌ-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ guluꞌ bikuluk, kila-kila limoh puluꞌ naꞌan daang niꞌ uluk.”
pairs.target: For they were about five thousand men. He said to his disciples, “Make them sit down in groups of about fifty each.”

pairs.source: Pinunaꞌ-E deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nai kodaꞌ deꞌ nang Yesus, yomoꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa bogoꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ guluꞌ.
pairs.target: They did so, and made them all sit down.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ mit limoh kueh baya duwoh polong ikian, Iyoh moꞌ pakat keꞌ longit.  Iyoh moꞌ bisukul.  Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ piliaꞌ-piliaꞌ kueh-e.  Yoh moꞌ ngin deꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, saꞌ-e kutung tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ.
pairs.target: He took the five loaves and the two fish, and looking up to the sky, he blessed them, and broke them, and gave them to the disciples to set before the multitude.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ limoh libu naꞌan inoh man nog-e busuah.  Yomoꞌ ogiꞌ simoong duwoh bakul kuban pinguman deꞌ diꞌ-e obuah man.
pairs.target: They ate, and were all filled. They gathered up twelve baskets of broken pieces that were left over.

pairs.source: Niꞌ onu takal inoh Yesus bidoa sadiꞌ-E.  Pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-e ogiꞌ geh danoꞌ.  Yomoꞌ Yesus sikian tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-E, “Osi in nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ nang Okuꞌ itih.”
pairs.target: As he was praying alone, the disciples were with him, and he asked them, “Who do the multitudes say that I am?”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-e, “Ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nang Yohanes Pembaptis; ogiꞌ geh nyaꞌa nang Elia; duoh ogiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ nang nabi-nabi deꞌ noꞌuh-e deꞌ moꞌ paliꞌ idip.”
pairs.target: They answered, “‘John the Baptizer,’ but others say, ‘Elijah,’ and others, that one of the old prophets is risen again.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ sikian lagiꞌ tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-E, “Osi Okuꞌ tih?” Petrus moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Inganleh Laja deꞌ janyi Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: He said to them, “But who do you say that I am?” Peter answered, “The Christ of God.”

pairs.source: Ngojit hal inoh Yesus moꞌ jaman pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E tanon tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon.
pairs.target: But he warned them, and commanded them to tell this to no one,

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ sina in-e lagiꞌ, “Okuꞌ Onak Manusia totap halus susah jolaꞌ duoh diꞌ-e obuah tilimaꞌ odaꞌ pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi, pimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh, duoh gulu-gulu agama Yahudi.  Yomoꞌ obuah ngabos, pak-e daang onu keꞌ taluh-e paliꞌ idip.”
pairs.target: saying, “The Son of Man must suffer many things, and be rejected by the elders, chief priests, and scribes, and be killed, and the third day be raised up.”

pairs.source: Yomoꞌ in sina-E tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ, “Osi deꞌ yaꞌ nunaꞌ Okuꞌ, halus sidia lawan oni deꞌ nang kila-e; sidia susah jolaꞌ bilang konu daang idip-e, yomoꞌ sitelus-e nunaꞌ Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: He said to all, “If anyone desires to come after me, let him deny himself, take up his cross, and follow me.

pairs.source: Sobab osi deꞌ nyayang idip-e sonang deꞌ dunia itih, iyoh idoh diꞌ-e idip sitelus-e.  Pak-e osi deꞌ togan idip sonang-e deꞌ dunia itih nog-e kobos ngan-e nunaꞌ Okuꞌ, iyoh yaꞌ idip sitelus-e.
pairs.target: For whoever desires to save his life will lose it, but whoever will lose his life for my sake, the same will save it.

pairs.source: Doiꞌ guna-e nyaꞌa kakuꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ daang dunia itih pak-e odop-e diꞌ-e idip sitelus-e duoh pilugi odop-e!
pairs.target: For what does it profit a man if he gains the whole world, and loses or forfeits his own self?

pairs.source: Moꞌ nyam nyaꞌa dasaꞌ ngakuꞌ Okuꞌ duoh pingunangkuꞌ deꞌ dunia itih, Okuꞌ Onak Manusia dasaꞌ geh yaꞌ ngakuꞌ nyaꞌa inoh takal Okuꞌ yaꞌ nog daang kuasa Kuꞌ, duoh daang kuasa Samaꞌ baya kuasa malaikat-malaikat deꞌ kudus.
pairs.target: For whoever will be ashamed of me and of my words, of him will the Son of Man be ashamed, when he comes in his glory, and the glory of the Father, and of the holy angels.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Ogiꞌ ingan deꞌ mujuag datiꞌ adin totap yaꞌ ningaꞌ Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja.”
pairs.target: But I tell you the truth: There are some of those who stand here, who will in no way taste of death, until they see God’s Kingdom.”

pairs.source: Kila-kila moih onu takal Yesus mokuaꞌ ngajal, Iyoh moꞌ ngijaꞌ Petrus, Yohanes duoh Yakobus maꞌad keꞌ bung dolod; sobab Yesus yaꞌ bidoa.
pairs.target: About eight days after these sayings, he took with him Peter, John, and James, and went up onto the mountain to pray.

pairs.source: Takal-E bidoa, jowin duoh pimakai Yesus moꞌ bilubah jawaꞌ sijaꞌ-e.
pairs.target: As he was praying, the appearance of his face was altered, and his clothing became white and dazzling.

pairs.source: Tang-tang tonga duwoh naꞌan nyaꞌa nog sina tuduꞌ Yesus, deꞌ sina inoh Musa duoh Elia.
