pairs.target: When he had spent all of it, there arose a severe famine in that country, and he began to be in need.

pairs.source: Yomoꞌ iyoh odi kiloja tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ pulow inoh, nyaꞌa inoh moꞌ odaꞌ iyoh jaga oyuaꞌ deꞌ umoh-e.
pairs.target: He went and joined himself to one of the citizens of that country, and he sent him into his fields to feed pigs.

pairs.source: Sobab iyoh moꞌ sukup pilai-e, yoh moꞌ yaꞌ man nyak oyuaꞌ ngan-e ngisiꞌ toꞌin-e.  Sungu-e sukup pilai-e, doiꞌ geh nyaꞌa ngin pinguman tuduꞌ-e.
pairs.target: He wanted to fill his belly with the husks that the pigs ate, but no one gave him any.

pairs.source: Iyoh moꞌ bigoꞌon tiaꞌ, yomoꞌ sina in-e, ‘Nyaꞌa deꞌ bikuli duoh samaꞌkuꞌ bitugung pinguman-e, pak-e okuꞌ datiꞌ yaꞌ miliap!’
pairs.target: But when he came to himself he said, ‘How many hired servants of my father’s have bread enough to spare, and I’m dying with hunger!

pairs.source: Okuꞌ yaꞌ paliꞌ tuduꞌ samaꞌkuꞌ, yomoꞌ okuꞌ yaꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, ‘Samaꞌ, okuꞌ moꞌ bidosa tuduꞌ Topaꞌ baya ingan.
pairs.target: I will get up and go to my father, and will tell him, “Father, I have sinned against heaven, and in your sight.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ patut obuah sobot onak ingan.  Odaꞌ sijaꞌ-a okuꞌ itih jadi kuli ingan.’
pairs.target: I am no more worthy to be called your son. Make me as one of your hired servants.”’

pairs.source: Iyoh moꞌ paliꞌ keꞌ boli samaꞌ-e.  Daang pimonu keꞌ boli-e, soꞌ juuaꞌ samaꞌ-e moꞌ kilin-e, samaꞌ-a moꞌ masiꞌ tuduꞌ-e.  Yomoꞌ bikoduh tuduꞌ-e simadi-e dokuop baya sium-e.
pairs.target: “He arose, and came to his father. But while he was still far off, his father saw him, and was moved with compassion, and ran, and fell on his neck, and kissed him.

pairs.source: Onak-e inoh moꞌ sina in-e, ‘Samaꞌ, okuꞌ moꞌ bidosa tuduꞌ Topaꞌ baya ingan.  Okuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ patut obuah sobot onak ingan.’
pairs.target: The son said to him, ‘Father, I have sinned against heaven, and in your sight. I am no longer worthy to be called your son.’

pairs.source: Pak-e samaꞌ-e inoh moꞌ mogan kuli-kuli-e yomoꞌ sina in-e, ‘Katiꞌ laju-e likas-e! Mit pimakai deꞌ paling paguh-e soꞌ tuduꞌ-e, yomoꞌ soꞌ sisin deꞌ tlinyu-e, duoh soꞌ kasut deꞌ poꞌon-e.
pairs.target: “But the father said to his servants, ‘Bring out the best robe, and put it on him. Put a ring on his hand, and shoes on his feet.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh odi mit onak sapi deꞌ paling gomuꞌ tutuꞌ, nyeꞌ moꞌ simoliah-e.  Saꞌ otoꞌ man lami-lami simadi otoꞌ bisukul.
pairs.target: Bring the fattened calf, kill it, and let us eat, and celebrate;

pairs.source: Sobab onakkuꞌ itih samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ kobos, deꞌ moh paliꞌ idip; samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moyap, deꞌ moh paliꞌ lagiꞌ.  Mokuaꞌ inoh odop-e munoꞌ moꞌ man simadi-e bisukul.’
pairs.target: for this, my son, was dead, and is alive again. He was lost, and is found.’ They began to celebrate.

pairs.source: Pak-e takal inoh onak-e deꞌ pinuan ogiꞌ deꞌ umoh-e, takal iyoh paliꞌ, ngan-e moh sinok boli-e, iyoh moꞌ ngojit sowoꞌ lagu duoh sowoꞌ nyaꞌa bitanaꞌ.
pairs.target: “Now his elder son was in the field. As he came near to the house, he heard music and dancing.

pairs.source: Yomoꞌ mogan niꞌ naꞌan kuli-e, yomoꞌ sikian tuduꞌ-e, ‘Oni deꞌ nai nyaꞌa deꞌ in inoh?’
pairs.target: He called one of the servants to him, and asked what was going on.

pairs.source: Kuli inoh moꞌ nyawot in-e, ‘Sudiꞌ ingan moꞌ paliꞌ! Samaꞌ ingan moꞌ odaꞌ koꞌih simoliah onak sapi deꞌ gomuꞌ tutuꞌ, sobab sudiꞌ ingan paliꞌ daang silamat!’
pairs.target: He said to him, ‘Your brother has come, and your father has killed the fattened calf, because he has received him back safe and healthy.’

pairs.source: Onak deꞌ pinuan inoh moꞌ malah nyam kila-e, yomoꞌ doliaꞌ-e molot kaang boli-e.  Samaꞌ-a inoh moꞌ luah odi tuduꞌ-e tanon odaꞌ molot kaang boli-e.
pairs.target: But he was angry, and would not go in. Therefore his father came out, and begged him.

pairs.source: Pak-e iyoh nyawot samaꞌ-e in-e, ‘Moꞌ bisowaꞌ-sowaꞌ okuꞌ kiloja lolah posah kaꞌan ingan, doiꞌ onukuꞌ lawan sina ingan.  Oni deꞌ ngin ingan tuduꞌ okuꞌ? Niꞌ onak koming tuang doiꞌ geh ingan ngin tuduꞌ okuꞌ saꞌ okuꞌ man duoh dingan-dingankuꞌ neh!
pairs.target: But he answered his father, ‘Behold, these many years I have served you, and I never disobeyed a commandment of yours, but you never gave me a goat, that I might celebrate with my friends.

pairs.source: Pak-e onak ingan deꞌ sibusuꞌ inoh moꞌ bual halta ingan duoh dayung adoh, pak-e takal iyoh paliꞌ ingan moꞌ simoliah onak sapi deꞌ gomuꞌ tutuꞌ kaꞌan-e!’
pairs.target: But when this your son came, who has devoured your living with prostitutes, you killed the fattened calf for him.’

pairs.source: Samaꞌ-a moꞌ nyawot in-e, ‘Onakkuꞌ, muꞌu ali-ali ogiꞌ duoh okuꞌ datiꞌ.  Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ okuꞌ tuang kakuꞌ muꞌu geh.
pairs.target: “He said to him, ‘Son, you are always with me, and all that is mine is yours.

pairs.source: Pak-e otoꞌ patut doon duoh munuas, sobab sudiꞌmuꞌ itih samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ kobos, deꞌ moh paliꞌ idip, samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moyap, deꞌ moh paliꞌ lagiꞌ.’ ”
pairs.target: But it was appropriate to celebrate and be glad, for this, your brother, was dead, and is alive again. He was lost, and is found.’”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ ngin perumpamaan tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, “Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan sidagal.  Iyoh ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ-e odaꞌ ngulus halta-e.  Sidagal inoh ngojit nang nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ-e daꞌ-e saꞌat sayou duit-e.
pairs.target: He also said to his disciples, “There was a certain rich man who had a manager. An accusation was made to him that this man was wasting his possessions.

pairs.source: Yoh moꞌ mogan nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ-e daꞌ-e inoh, yomoꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, ‘Okuꞌ moh ngojit silita oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat deꞌ nai muꞌu sobab inoh muꞌu yaꞌ obuah piloꞌo soꞌ kilojamuꞌ, pak-e muꞌu halus lapol suaꞌ haltakuꞌ deꞌ ngulus muꞌ.’
pairs.target: He called him, and said to him, ‘What is this that I hear about you? Give an accounting of your management, for you can no longer be manager.’

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ ngulus duit inoh moꞌ bipikil, ‘Oni deꞌ yaꞌ nai kuꞌ toke yaꞌ piloꞌo okuꞌ, yaꞌ nyakul kuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ taꞌan, yaꞌ jadi tukang mitiaꞌ-mitiaꞌ kuꞌ dasaꞌ.
pairs.target: “The manager said within himself, ‘What will I do, seeing that my lord is taking away the management position from me? I don’t have strength to dig. I am ashamed to beg.

pairs.source: Puꞌan kuꞌ oni deꞌ yaꞌ nai kuꞌ takal kuꞌ obuah piloꞌo neh, okuꞌ halus bogoꞌ dingan deꞌ laꞌan tlimaꞌ okuꞌ odaꞌ loꞌo deꞌ boli-e.’
pairs.target: I know what I will do, so that when I am removed from management, they may receive me into their houses.’

pairs.source: Yomoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngulus duit inoh moꞌ mogan osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ bilutang tuduꞌ toke-e, yoh moꞌ mogan nyaꞌa deꞌ keꞌ niꞌ-e, yoh sikian tuduꞌ-e, ‘Kudu tang muꞌ tuduꞌ tokekuꞌ?’
pairs.target: Calling each one of his lord’s debtors to him, he said to the first, ‘How much do you owe to my lord?’

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa inoh moꞌ nyawot-e, ‘Silatus bona inyuaꞌ zaitun.’ Nyaꞌa deꞌ ngulus duit inoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, ‘Itih sulat tang muꞌ, guluꞌ mey nulis limoh puluꞌ bona.’
pairs.target: He said, ‘A hundred batos of oil.’ He said to him, ‘Take your bill, and sit down quickly and write fifty.’

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ noh yoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ke duwoh-e, ‘Timuꞌ kudu tang muꞌ?’ Nyaꞌa inoh moꞌ nyawot-e, ‘Silatus kalung gandum.’ Nyaꞌa deꞌ ngulus duit inoh sina tuduꞌ-e, ‘Itih sulat tang muꞌ nulis moih puluꞌ kalung negeh.’
pairs.target: Then he said to another, ‘How much do you owe?’ He said, ‘A hundred cors of wheat.’ He said to him, ‘Take your bill, and write eighty.’

pairs.source: Yomoꞌ takal sidagal inoh puꞌan oniꞌ deꞌ nai nyaꞌa deꞌ ngulus halta-e inoh, yoh moꞌ mudi-e nang nyaꞌa deꞌ ngulus halta-e inoh bijak.” Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ samung sina-e inoh, “Sobab biasa-e nyaꞌa deꞌ idip-e nunaꞌ dunia itih lobih bogoꞌ wat akal-e ngulus idip daang dunia soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ idip daang jawaꞌ.”
pairs.target: “His lord commended the dishonest manager because he had done wisely, for the children of this world are, in their own generation, wiser than the children of the light.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus sina lagiꞌ in-e, “Ngojit nyeꞌ! Kalikleh dingan ingan kai duit deꞌ soꞌon ingan soꞌ dunia itih, saꞌ takal duit ingan deꞌ dunia itih moꞌ diꞌ-e tiꞌaꞌ biguna, ingan tapod idip duoh Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: I tell you, make for yourselves friends by means of unrighteous mammon, so that when you fail, they may receive you into the eternal tents.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ dapod nyeꞌ alap odaꞌ ngulus kiloja deꞌ isit, yoh tuang dapod geh nyeꞌ bisayaꞌ-e odaꞌ ngulus kiloja deꞌ ayuh duoh penting.  Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e jujul ngulus kiloja deꞌ isit, kiloja deꞌ ayuh duoh penting idoh geh diꞌ-e yaꞌ jujul ngulus-e.
pairs.target: He who is faithful in a very little is faithful also in much. He who is dishonest in a very little is also dishonest in much.

pairs.source: Nyam basa-e nyaꞌa diꞌ-e dapod bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ ingan odaꞌ ngulus halta deꞌ isit daang dunia, lobih lagiꞌ Topaꞌ tuang idoh geh diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ ingan odaꞌ ngulus halta sulga deꞌ ayuh.
pairs.target: If therefore you have not been faithful in the unrighteous mammon, who will commit to your trust the true riches?

pairs.source: Duoh nyam basa-e balang deꞌ kakuꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon diꞌ ingan ponai jaga-e, totu Topaꞌ tuang idoh geh diꞌ-e ngin oniꞌ deꞌ patut ingan kakuꞌ.
pairs.target: If you have not been faithful in that which is another’s, who will give you that which is your own?

pairs.source: Doiꞌ ogiꞌ kuli ponai kiloja tuduꞌ duwoh naꞌan toke.  Nyam basa-e watinoh totap ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan toke deꞌ buꞌui kuli-e daꞌ-a, kuli inoh lobih nulut deꞌ toke deꞌ niꞌ soꞌ toke-e deꞌ nikan.  Watinoh geh ingan, doiꞌ ogiꞌ ingan ponai kiloja kaꞌan Topaꞌ nyam basa ingan aluaꞌ kalik halta dunia.”
pairs.target: No servant can serve two masters, for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to one, and despise the other. You aren’t able to serve God and Mammon.”

pairs.source: Ulang Farisi moꞌ ngojit suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nang Yesus, yomoꞌ towoh-e, sobab odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bakoꞌ duit.
pairs.target: The Pharisees, who were lovers of money, also heard all these things, and they scoffed at him.

pairs.source: Pak-e in Yesus sina tuduꞌ ulang Farisi deꞌ munoꞌ, “Inganleh nyaꞌa deꞌ liga pulaꞌ-pulaꞌ bonal deꞌ sulung jowin nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ pak-e Topaꞌ puꞌan isiꞌ otin ingan sobab oniꞌ deꞌ obuah mudi odaꞌ manusia inohleh deꞌ buꞌui Topaꞌ daꞌ-a.
pairs.target: He said to them, “You are those who justify yourselves in the sight of men, but God knows your hearts. For that which is exalted among men is an abomination in the sight of God.

pairs.source: Buk-buk deꞌ nulis Musa duoh buk-buk deꞌ nulis nabi-nabi deꞌ bokon, ingan nunaꞌ buaꞌ ajal-e nog joman Yohanes Pembaptis.  Soꞌ joman iyohleh, Gah deꞌ Paguh oniꞌ wat Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja obuah tanon.  Duoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa bonal-bonal suba ngan-e yaꞌ jadin umat Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: The law and the prophets were until John. From that time the Good News of God’s Kingdom is preached, and everyone is forcing his way into it.

pairs.source: Moꞌ nyam-e watnoh lobih sonang kaꞌan Topaꞌ kasuap longit duoh bumi soꞌ sit ukum Topaꞌ tikadi.
pairs.target: But it is easier for heaven and earth to pass away, than for one tiny stroke of a pen in the law to fall.

pairs.source: Dali deꞌ posan sowon-e yomoꞌ kawin duoh dayung deꞌ bokon yoh inoh biamai.  Dali deꞌ kawin duoh dayung deꞌ moꞌ biposan yoh tuang biamai geh.”
pairs.target: Everyone who divorces his wife, and marries another, commits adultery. He who marries one who is divorced from a husband commits adultery.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ ngajal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ kai perumpamaan itih, “Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan sidagal ali-ali pakai pimakai deꞌ maal duoh man pinguman paguh bilang konu.
pairs.target: “Now there was a certain rich man, and he was clothed in purple and fine linen, living in luxury every day.

pairs.source: Deꞌ boꞌon tiban boli sidagal inoh, ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ botak kolag adon-e Lazarus deꞌ gonan-e punuaꞌ odaꞌ pinonaꞌ deꞌ buꞌuh.
pairs.target: A certain beggar, named Lazarus, was taken to his gate, full of sores,

pairs.source: Lazarus sukup pilai-e, yoh bialap ogiꞌ puluh pinguman labuꞌ soꞌ mija sidagal inoh ngan-e kadu-kadu-e man sisaꞌ-e.  Idoh diꞌ-e jok-e inoh kosuang nog kanoꞌ odi silaꞌian pinonaꞌ deꞌ gonan-e.
pairs.target: and desiring to be fed with the crumbs that fell from the rich man’s table. Yes, even the dogs came and licked his sores.

pairs.source: Lazarus moꞌ kobos, mokuaꞌ inoh malaikat toban tuduꞌ Abraham deꞌ topat deꞌ paling paguh.  Sidagal inoh tuang kobos geh yomoꞌ obuah ngubul.
pairs.target: The beggar died, and he was carried away by the angels to Abraham’s bosom. The rich man also died, and was buried.

pairs.source: Soꞌ daang neraka, sidagal inoh sukup susah jolaꞌ.  Takal iyoh inoh moꞌ bigalong keꞌ somu, soꞌ juuaꞌ yoh moꞌ kilin Lazarus guluꞌ sinoꞌ Abraham deꞌ topat paling paguh-e.
pairs.target: In Hades, he lifted up his eyes, being in torment, and saw Abraham far off, and Lazarus at his bosom.

pairs.source: Sidagal inoh moꞌ nang bogan-e tuduꞌ Abraham, ‘O samaꞌkuꞌ Abraham! Masiꞌleh tuduꞌ okuꞌ! Odaꞌleh Lazarus suad tilinyu-e keꞌ daang piꞌin duoh natiag-e saꞌ-e misaꞌ jolaꞌkuꞌ sobab okuꞌ datiꞌ sukup nyam jolaꞌ-e daang opui datiꞌ.’
pairs.target: He cried and said, ‘Father Abraham, have mercy on me, and send Lazarus, that he may dip the tip of his finger in water, and cool my tongue! For I am in anguish in this flame.’

pairs.source: Abraham moꞌ nyawot-e, ‘Onakkuꞌ natong nyeꞌ muꞌu moꞌ puas tlimaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ paguh takal muꞌ aluaꞌ idip, pak-e Lazarus mala sijaꞌ-e tlimaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat, iyoh ngan-e adin yoh lagi deꞌ kiꞌan oniꞌ deꞌ paguh muꞌu lagiꞌ deꞌ kiꞌan oniꞌ deꞌ jolaꞌ.
pairs.target: “But Abraham said, ‘Son, remember that you, in your lifetime, received your good things, and Lazarus, in the same way, bad things. But here he is now comforted, and you are in anguish.

pairs.source: Duoh ogiꞌ gilongung geh deꞌ sukup ayuh-e deꞌ osah otoꞌ, saꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ soꞌ katiꞌ diꞌ-e dapod odi kanoꞌ duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ soꞌ kanoꞌ diꞌ-e dapod odi katiꞌ.’
pairs.target: Besides all this, between us and you there is a great gulf fixed, that those who want to pass from here to you are not able, and that no one may cross over from there to us.’

pairs.source: Sidagal inoh moꞌ in-e, ‘Nyam-e watinoh tulungleh odaꞌleh Lazarus odi keꞌ boli pingomakuꞌ.
pairs.target: “He said, ‘I ask you therefore, father, that you would send him to my father’s house;

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ limoh naꞌan madihkuꞌ danoꞌ, odaꞌleh Lazarus tanon gah tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ saꞌ-e diꞌ suaꞌ molot tuduꞌ okuꞌ daang topat obuah nyiksa itih.’
pairs.target: for I have five brothers, that he may testify to them, so they won’t also come into this place of torment.’

pairs.source: Pak-e Abraham moꞌ nyawot in-e, ‘Kan-e moꞌ ogiꞌ buk-buk deꞌ nulis Musa duoh buk-buk deꞌ nulis nabi-nabi, tanahleh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ngojit duoh nunaꞌ oni deꞌ nang daang buk-buk inoh.’
pairs.target: “But Abraham said to him, ‘They have Moses and the prophets. Let them listen to them.’

pairs.source: Pak-e sidagal inoh nyawot-e, ‘Inoh jaꞌa idoh diꞌ-e sukup neh, pak-e moꞌ nyam-e ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos paliꞌ idip baꞌuh duoh nog tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ keꞌ yoh laꞌan bitobat.’
pairs.target: “He said, ‘No, father Abraham, but if one goes to them from the dead, they will repent.’

pairs.source: Pak-e Abraham moh nyawot-e, ‘Moꞌ nyam plitah Topaꞌ deꞌ nulis Musa duoh nabi-nabi yoh doliaꞌ-e ngojit duoh nunaꞌ-e lobih lagiꞌ moꞌ nyam nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos paliꞌ idip deꞌ tanon, yoh totap idoh diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ.’ ”
pairs.target: “He said to him, ‘If they don’t listen to Moses and the prophets, neither will they be persuaded if one rises from the dead.’”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, “Oniꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa nai dosa totap ogiꞌ.  Pak-e binasaleh nyaꞌa deꞌ singaji-e odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon nai dosa!
pairs.target: He said to the disciples, “It is impossible that no occasions of stumbling should come, but woe to him through whom they come!

pairs.source: Lobih paguh lagiꞌ nyeꞌ gutan batuh deꞌ ayuh deꞌ tunguaꞌ-a, mokuaꞌ inoh timalong daang laut soꞌ yoh yaꞌ toban niꞌ naꞌan negeh nyaꞌa deꞌ aluaꞌ diꞌ pikil-e tuꞌuh daang Topaꞌ nai dosa-e.
pairs.target: It would be better for him if a millstone were hung around his neck, and he were thrown into the sea, rather than that he should cause one of these little ones to stumble.

pairs.source: Jadin, tauꞌ-tauꞌ saꞌ ingan diꞌ-e nai oniꞌ deꞌ kodaꞌ inoh! Moꞌ nyam ogiꞌ madihmuꞌ deꞌ nai dosa, ngalah nyeꞌ.  Nyam basa iyoh moꞌ jook-e, ngin apun tuduꞌ-e.
pairs.target: Be careful. If your brother sins against you, rebuke him. If he repents, forgive him.

pairs.source: Nyam basa-e daang niꞌ onu, juꞌ sidoh madihmuꞌ nai salah-e tuduꞌ muꞌu, yomoꞌ bilang-e nai salah-e yoh mitiaꞌ apun tuduꞌ muꞌu, apunleh iyoh.”
pairs.target: If he sins against you seven times in the day, and seven times returns, saying, ‘I repent,’ you shall forgive him.”

pairs.source: Yomoꞌ rasul deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Topaꞌ Yesus, “Gulu, tulungleh koꞌih saꞌ koꞌih lobih bisayaꞌ.”
pairs.target: The apostles said to the Lord, “Increase our faith.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Nyam ingan ogiꞌ bisayaꞌ ingan motiꞌ luang sabih negeh, sina sijaꞌ-a tuduꞌ tongon koyuh inoh, ‘Numut odopmuꞌ nyeꞌ moꞌ jug odopmuꞌ deꞌ laut.’ Totap iyoh lasuꞌ nunaꞌ sinamuꞌ.”
pairs.target: The Lord said, “If you had faith like a grain of mustard seed, you would tell this sycamore tree, ‘Be uprooted, and be planted in the sea,’ and it would obey you.

pairs.source: “Nyam basa soꞌ ingan deꞌ mutiꞌ ogiꞌ kuli deꞌ tukang nyakul deꞌ toyaꞌ kobon ingan keh, mokuaꞌ jaga koming ingan keh, asal kuli inoh paliꞌ nog boli podo ingan moꞌ lasuꞌ ngijaꞌ man?
pairs.target: But who is there among you, having a servant plowing or keeping sheep, that will say, when he comes in from the field, ‘Come immediately and sit down at the table,’

pairs.source: Totu idoh! Totap ingan odaꞌ iyoh gati pimakai-e mokuaꞌ inoh ingan odaꞌ iyoh nai pinguman kaꞌan ingan duoh nguan ingan nog mokuaꞌ man, keꞌ ingan odaꞌ yoh man.
pairs.target: and will not rather tell him, ‘Prepare my supper, clothe yourself properly, and serve me, while I eat and drink. Afterward you shall eat and drink’?

pairs.source: Kuli inoh diꞌ-e jolaꞌ obuah mudi sobab iyoh moꞌ nunaꞌ plitah toke-e.
pairs.target: Does he thank that servant because he did the things that were commanded? I think not.

pairs.source: Watinoh geh ingan.  Nyam ingan moꞌ nai suaꞌ-suaꞌ kiloja deꞌ patut ingan nai-e, ingan moꞌ nang sijaꞌ-a, ‘Koꞌih itih madas kuli sijaꞌ-a, koꞌih jok koꞌih nai kiloja deꞌ patut koꞌih nai-e sijaꞌ-a.’ ”
pairs.target: Even so you also, when you have done all the things that are commanded you, say, ‘We are unworthy servants. We have done our duty.’”

pairs.source: Daang pimonu-e keꞌ kota Yerusalem, Yesus ngilusuꞌ baꞌat propinsi Samaria duoh propinsi Galilea.
pairs.target: As he was on his way to Jerusalem, he was passing along the borders of Samaria and Galilee.

pairs.source: Takal-e molot deꞌ niꞌ kupuaꞌ yomoꞌ ogiꞌ simoong naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah onam kulit deꞌ sukup palah odi tuduꞌ-E.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ mujuag muaꞌ juꞌan-e
pairs.target: As he entered into a certain village, ten men who were lepers met him, who stood at a distance.

pairs.source: yomoꞌ sina dolas-dolas-e, “Yesus! Gulu! Masiꞌleh tuduꞌ koꞌih!”
pairs.target: They lifted up their voices, saying, “Jesus, Master, have mercy on us!”

pairs.source: Takal Yesus kilin odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yomoꞌ nang in-e, “Sus odi, bitanga odop ingan tuduꞌ pimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi.” Daang pimonu-e deꞌ olan onam-e moꞌ mokuaꞌ.
pairs.target: When he saw them, he said to them, “Go and show yourselves to the priests.” As they went, they were cleansed.

pairs.source: Takal niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngoon onam-e moꞌ mokuaꞌ, iyoh moꞌ lasuꞌ paliꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus daang-e sina dolas-dolas-e mudi Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: One of them, when he saw that he was healed, turned back, glorifying God with a loud voice.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh deꞌ jowin Yesus iyoh bikunyug ngan-e bisukul tuduꞌ-E.  Nyaꞌa inoh ulang Samaria.
pairs.target: He fell on his face at Jesus’ feet, giving him thanks; and he was a Samaritan.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ sina in-e, “Idoh keh diꞌ-e simoong naꞌan deꞌ mokuaꞌ soꞌ onam-e, ki soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ pliꞌi naꞌan?
pairs.target: Jesus answered, “Weren’t the ten cleansed? But where are the nine?

pairs.source: Jok-e nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e ulang Yahudi tih sijaꞌ-e deꞌ paliꞌ bisukul tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: Were there none found who returned to give glory to God, except this stranger?”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ sina in-e, “Mokat mey nyeꞌ moꞌ buu.  Sobab muꞌu bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ muꞌu mokuaꞌ.”
pairs.target: Then he said to him, “Get up, and go your way. Your faith has healed you.”

pairs.source: Kudu-kudu naꞌan ulang Farisi sikian tuduꞌ Yesus, nang siniaꞌ Topaꞌ yaꞌ nog jadin Laja.  Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Topaꞌ militah jadin laja idoh diꞌ-e mulai soꞌ tanda-tanda deꞌ dapod nyaꞌa kilin-e.
pairs.target: Being asked by the Pharisees when God’s Kingdom would come, he answered them, “God’s Kingdom doesn’t come with observation;

pairs.source: Jadi doiꞌ guna-e, nyaꞌa nang, ‘Jaꞌ otoꞌ odi ningaꞌ-e, itih odop-e atou ningaꞌ nih odop-e!’ Sobab Topaꞌ moh moꞌ militah jadin laja deꞌ uluk ingan deꞌ dunia itih.”
pairs.target: neither will they say, ‘Look, here!’ or, ‘Look, there!’ for behold, God’s Kingdom is within you.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ noh Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, “Yaꞌ nog onu-e ingan ngati Okuꞌ Onak Manusia, yaꞌ militah jadin Laja pak-e ingan diꞌ ngan ponai kilin-e.
pairs.target: He said to the disciples, “The days will come, when you will desire to see one of the days of the Son of Man, and you will not see it.

pairs.source: Tiaꞌ sodiꞌ ogiꞌ nyaꞌa tanon tuduꞌ muꞌu, ‘Ningaꞌ danih soꞌo neh, ningaꞌ datiꞌ soꞌo neh!’ Pak-e maꞌ ingan yaꞌ luah kalik-e.
pairs.target: They will tell you, ‘Look, here!’ or ‘Look, there!’ Don’t go away, nor follow after them,

pairs.source: Sobab samah kodaꞌ jawaꞌ kijat deꞌ longit, munoh geh tieꞌ ijoꞌ takal Okuꞌ Onak Manusia yaꞌ nog lagiꞌ baꞌuh.
pairs.target: for as the lightning, when it flashes out of the one part under the sky, shines to the other part under the sky; so will the Son of Man be in his day.

pairs.source: Pak-e Okuꞌ totap halus dioꞌ yaꞌ ngoon susah jolaꞌ duoh obuah nulak odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ idip joman adin.
pairs.target: But first, he must suffer many things and be rejected by this generation.

pairs.source: Samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ idip deꞌ joman nabi Nuh noꞌuh-e, watinoh geh deꞌ yaꞌ jadi takal Okuꞌ yaꞌ nog.
pairs.target: As it was in the days of Noah, even so will it be also in the days of the Son of Man.

pairs.source: Manusia bidu man nuak, bidu kalik sowon bonon-e, nog onu-e takal Nuh molot daang kapal-e yomoꞌ nog kilamu deꞌ sukup tui-e moꞌ lasuꞌ plongod suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: They ate, they drank, they married, they were given in marriage, until the day that Noah entered into the ship, and the flood came, and destroyed them all.

pairs.source: Samah geh kodaꞌ joman Lot noꞌuh-e nyaꞌa bidu man nuak, bidu bijua, bidu bilumoh yomoꞌ nai boli-e.
pairs.target: Likewise, even as it was in the days of Lot: they ate, they drank, they bought, they sold, they planted, they built;

pairs.source: Pak-e onu Lot buu soꞌ Sodom, onu inoh geh opui muun baya batuh deꞌ biduduꞌ labuꞌ soꞌ longit ngasul odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: but in the day that Lot went out from Sodom, it rained fire and sulfur from the sky, and destroyed them all.

pairs.source: Watinoh geh doiꞌ nyaꞌa sakaꞌ siniaꞌ Okuꞌ Onak Manusia nog duoh tang-tang bitanga odop Kuꞌ.
pairs.target: It will be the same way in the day that the Son of Man is revealed.

pairs.source: Takal onu inoh nyaꞌa deꞌ awah, maꞌ molot lagiꞌ yaꞌ mit balang daang boli.  Watinoh geh nyaꞌa deꞌ motak keꞌ umoh, maꞌ moliꞌ keꞌ kupuaꞌ.
pairs.target: In that day, he who will be on the housetop, and his goods in the house, let him not go down to take them away. Let him who is in the field likewise not turn back.

pairs.source: Natong nyeꞌ oni deꞌ obuah sowon Lot!
pairs.target: Remember Lot’s wife!

pairs.source: Sobab osi deꞌ nyayang idip-e sonang deꞌ dunia itih, idip-e tibuang.  Pak-e osi deꞌ togan idip sonang-e deꞌ dunia itih nog-e kobos ngan-e nunaꞌ Okuꞌ, iyoh dapod idip sitelus-e.
pairs.target: Whoever seeks to save his life loses it, but whoever loses his life preserves it.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Ngalom inoh duwoh naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ boꞌos daang niꞌ tilam, niꞌ naꞌan obuah mit toban buu, niꞌ naꞌan obuah supiah.
pairs.target: I tell you, in that night there will be two people in one bed. The one will be taken, and the other will be left.

pairs.source: Duwoh naꞌan dayung deꞌ poh podi, niꞌ naꞌan obuah toban buu, niꞌ naꞌan obuah supiah.
pairs.target: There will be two grinding grain together. One will be taken, and the other will be left.”

pairs.source: Yomoꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus sikian tuduꞌ-E, “Daki soꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ jadi neh Gulu?” Yesus moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Daki soꞌ ogiꞌ todang, danoꞌ soꞌ ogiꞌ manuk deꞌ man todang.”
pairs.target: They, answering, asked him, “Where, Lord?” He said to them, “Where the body is, there will the vultures also be gathered together.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ ngin perumpamaan tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E saꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ mala bidoa duoh diꞌ-e buꞌon-e.
pairs.target: He also spoke a parable to them that they must always pray, and not give up,

pairs.source: In Yesus, “Daang niꞌ kota ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan hakim idip deꞌ diꞌ-e nulut tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, nyaꞌa tuong idoh geh yoh piduli-e.
pairs.target: saying, “There was a judge in a certain city who didn’t fear God, and didn’t respect man.

pairs.source: Deꞌ kota inoh ogiꞌ geh niꞌ naꞌan jana deꞌ odi telus tuduꞌ hakim noh yomoꞌ in neh, ‘Suba tulungleh nuwaꞌ okuꞌ soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ pilugi okuꞌ inoh.’
pairs.target: A widow was in that city, and she often came to him, saying, ‘Defend me from my adversary!’

pairs.source: Sukup tui hakim inoh doliaꞌ-e yaꞌ tulung jana inoh, pak-e mokuaꞌ noh hakim noh moꞌ bipikil, ‘Daang kuꞌ idip diꞌ kuꞌ nulut tuduꞌ Topaꞌ yomoꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa tuong idoh geh diꞌ kuꞌ piduli,
pairs.target: He wouldn’t for a while, but afterward he said to himself, ‘Though I neither fear God, nor respect man,

pairs.source: pak-e ngan jana noh kaꞌ-kaꞌ odi bikidok okuꞌ, paguh kuꞌ tulung-e negeh, saꞌ diꞌ-e tiaꞌ nog nusah okuꞌ.’”
pairs.target: yet because this widow bothers me, I will defend her, or else she will wear me out by her continual coming.’”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ sina in-e, “Suba ingan tiluti oniꞌ deꞌ nang hakim deꞌ diꞌ-e adil noh!
pairs.target: The Lord said, “Listen to what the unrighteous judge says.

pairs.source: Nyam hakim noh ponai tulung jana inoh, lobih lagiꞌ Topaꞌ yaꞌ tulung nyaꞌa deꞌ pilih-E, deꞌ bidoa singonu singalom tuduꞌ-e.  Iyoh diꞌ-e kajon tui saꞌan nyawot doa nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: Won’t God avenge his chosen ones, who are crying out to him day and night, and yet he exercises patience with them?

pairs.source: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Topaꞌ totap lasuꞌ tulung odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ daang suaꞌ oniꞌ.  Nyam basa-e, Okuꞌ Onak Manusia nog baꞌuh, aluaꞌ ogiꞌ kedoh keh Okuꞌ dapod nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ daang dunia itih?”
pairs.target: I tell you that he will avenge them quickly. Nevertheless, when the Son of Man comes, will he find faith on the earth?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ ngin perumpamaan saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ nang idip odop-e bonal deꞌ jowin Topaꞌ duoh lobih paguh soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon:
pairs.target: He spoke also this parable to certain people who were convinced of their own righteousness, and who despised all others.

pairs.source: “Ogiꞌ duwoh naꞌan nyaꞌa odi bidoa keꞌ Boli Topaꞌ.  Niꞌ naꞌan noh ulang Farisi yoh moꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nikan-e lagiꞌ pinagih suke.
pairs.target: “Two men went up into the temple to pray; one was a Pharisee, and the other was a tax collector.

pairs.source: Ulang Farisi noh mujuag sadiꞌ-e yoh moꞌ bidoa in-e, ‘O Topaꞌ tilimaꞌ kasih tuduꞌ Ingan, sobab okuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon, deꞌ pinganguak, pingakal, duoh biamai.  Okuꞌ bisukul okuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ kodaꞌ pinagih suke inoh.
pairs.target: The Pharisee stood and prayed to himself like this: ‘God, I thank you, that I am not like the rest of men, extortionists, unrighteous, adulterers, or even like this tax collector.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ puasa duwoh sidoh daang niꞌ minggu, simoong-bigien soꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ soꞌon kuꞌ, kuꞌ ngin tuduꞌ Ingan.’
pairs.target: I fast twice a week. I give tithes of all that I get.’

pairs.source: Pak-e pinagih suke inoh mujuag juuaꞌ, kan-e diꞌ-e bilani bigalong keꞌ longit, simadi-e modug-modug soduaꞌ-e sobab yoh moꞌ ngoon nang odop-e bidosa simadi-e bidoa in neh, ‘O Topaꞌ masiꞌleh tuduꞌ okuꞌ ulang bidosa itih!’
pairs.target: But the tax collector, standing far away, wouldn’t even lift up his eyes to heaven, but beat his breast, saying, ‘God, be merciful to me, a sinner!’

pairs.source: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Takal pinagih suke itih paliꞌ keꞌ boli-e yohleh deꞌ obuah tlimaꞌ odaꞌ Topaꞌ nak-e ulang Farisi inoh.  Sobab nyaꞌa deꞌ lika kakat odop-e yoh obuah pimuun pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ pimuun odop-e yoh obuah pakat daꞌ bigatung.”
pairs.target: I tell you, this man went down to his house justified rather than the other; for everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, but he who humbles himself will be exalted.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh nogleh kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa toban onak opot tuduꞌ Yesus, saꞌ Iyoh tomaꞌ ngin bilokat tuduꞌ-e.  Takal pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus kilin-e, yoh moꞌ lasuꞌ ngalah nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: They were also bringing their babies to him, that he might touch them. But when the disciples saw it, they rebuked them.

pairs.source: Pak-e Yesus moꞌ mogan onak opot deꞌ munoꞌ yoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, “Tanah saꞌ onak opot deꞌ munoꞌ odi tuduꞌ Okuꞌ! Maꞌ ingan yaꞌ jaman-e neh, sobab nyaꞌa deꞌ kodaꞌ onak opot deꞌ munoꞌ leh deꞌ yaꞌ jadin ayua umat Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: Jesus summoned them, saying, “Allow the little children to come to me, and don’t hinder them, for God’s Kingdom belongs to such as these.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Nyaꞌa deꞌ nulut pilitah Topaꞌ daang idip-e samah kodaꞌ onak opot deꞌ sipunuaꞌ-e nulut pilitah pingoma-e, yohleh sijaꞌ deꞌ dapod jadin ayua umat Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: Most certainly, I tell you, whoever doesn’t receive God’s Kingdom like a little child, he will in no way enter into it.”

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ pimipin Yahudi sikian tuduꞌ Yesus, “Gulu deꞌ paguh, oni deꞌ patut kuꞌ nai saꞌ kuꞌ soꞌon idip deꞌ sitelus-e?”
pairs.target: A certain ruler asked him, saying, “Good Teacher, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot in neh, “Oni ngan muꞌ nang Okuꞌ deꞌ paguh? Doiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ lobih paguh soꞌ Topaꞌ neh.
pairs.target: Jesus asked him, “Why do you call me good? No one is good, except one—God.

pairs.source: Totu muꞌu moꞌ puꞌan plitah-plitah Topaꞌ: ‘Maꞌ biamai, maꞌ ngabos nyaꞌa, maꞌ noku, maꞌ sina pibulaꞌ, yomoꞌ nulut leh tuduꞌ pingomamuꞌ.’”
pairs.target: You know the commandments: ‘Don’t commit adultery,’ ‘Don’t murder,’ ‘Don’t steal,’ ‘Don’t give false testimony,’ ‘Honor your father and your mother.’”

pairs.source: In nyaꞌa inoh nyawot-e, “Suaꞌ-suaꞌ plitah deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nunaꞌ kuꞌ soꞌ kuꞌ isit geh.”
pairs.target: He said, “I have observed all these things from my youth up.”

pairs.source: Ngojit yoh nyawot in noh Yesus moꞌ in neh, “Aluaꞌ ogiꞌ duom niꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ plelu muꞌ nai: Jualeh suaꞌ haltamuꞌ mokuaꞌ noh ngin duit-e tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ botak kolag, yomoꞌ muꞌu soꞌon halta daang sulga, mokuaꞌ inoh odileh katiꞌ nunaꞌ Okuꞌ.”
pairs.target: When Jesus heard these things, he said to him, “You still lack one thing. Sell all that you have, and distribute it to the poor. You will have treasure in heaven. Come, follow me.”

pairs.source: Takal pimipin Yahudi noh ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ nang Yesus, yoh moꞌ lasuꞌ susah otin-e sobab yoh sukup kaya-e.
pairs.target: But when he heard these things, he became very sad, for he was very rich.

pairs.source: Takal Yesus ningaꞌ pimipin Yahudi inoh susah otin-e, Yesus moꞌ lasuꞌ in, “Lolah posah saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ biduit yaꞌ jadin ayua umat Topaꞌ!
pairs.target: Jesus, seeing that he became very sad, said, “How hard it is for those who have riches to enter into God’s Kingdom!

pairs.source: Sonang dooꞌ niꞌ polong unta molot kaang lubang tuos soꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ biduit yaꞌ jadin umat Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: For it is easier for a camel to enter in through a needle’s eye, than for a rich man to enter into God’s Kingdom.”

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ nang Yesus inoh moꞌ lasuꞌ in-e, “Moꞌ nyam-e watinoh doiꞌ leh nyaꞌa deꞌ dapod silamat?”
pairs.target: Those who heard it said, “Then who can be saved?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot, “Oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ-e molot akal saꞌan otoꞌ manusia, molot akal saꞌan Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: But he said, “The things which are impossible with men are possible with God.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Petrus moꞌ lasuꞌ sina, “Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ koꞌih moꞌ obuaꞌ togan koꞌih ngan koꞌih nunaꞌ Ingan.”
pairs.target: Peter said, “Look, we have left everything, and followed you.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Osi mun ingan deꞌ togan boli-e, sowon-e, madih ayua-e, pingoma-e, duoh onak opot-e saꞌ Topaꞌ dapod militah idip-e,
pairs.target: He said to them, “Most certainly I tell you, there is no one who has left house, or wife, or brothers, or parents, or children, for God’s Kingdom’s sake,

pairs.source: nyaꞌa deꞌ togan suaꞌ-e inoh yaꞌ tilimaꞌ lobih bogoꞌ lagiꞌ daang joman deꞌ adin, duoh deꞌ joman deꞌ yaꞌ nog baꞌuh yoh yaꞌ tilimaꞌ idip deꞌ sitelus-e.”
pairs.target: who will not receive many times more in this time, and in the world to come, eternal life.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ mogan ke simoong duwoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E yomoꞌ sina, “Adin otoꞌ yaꞌ odi keꞌ Yerusalem, suaꞌ deꞌ nutaꞌ ayua nabi daang tulis-e suaꞌ-e yaꞌ jadi tuduꞌ Okuꞌ Onak Manusia.
pairs.target: He took the twelve aside, and said to them, “Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem, and all the things that are written through the prophets concerning the Son of Man will be completed.

pairs.source: Sobab danih Okuꞌ Onak Manusia obuah nyelah tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e puꞌan Topaꞌ, Okuꞌ yaꞌ obuah ngatiaꞌ obuah ngine duoh obuah ngujaꞌ.
pairs.target: For he will be delivered up to the Gentiles, will be mocked, treated shamefully, and spit on.

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ pijolaꞌ duoh ngabos Okuꞌ, pak-e onu ke taluh-e Okuꞌ yaꞌ paliꞌ idip.”
pairs.target: They will scourge and kill him. On the third day, he will rise again.”

pairs.source: Pak-e pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus idoh diꞌ-e ngiloti oniꞌ deꞌ nang Yesus inoh sobab loti-e obuah suꞌan soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ inohleh sobab yoh diꞌ puꞌan loti-e.
pairs.target: They understood none of these things. This saying was hidden from them, and they didn’t understand the things that were said.

pairs.source: Takal Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moh yaꞌ nog keꞌ kota Yerikho, ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ guluꞌ simadi-e mitiaꞌ-mitiaꞌ deꞌ pang olan.
pairs.target: As he came near Jericho, a certain blind man sat by the road, begging.

pairs.source: Takal inoh bogoꞌ nyaꞌa ngilusuꞌ olan inoh, yoh moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ nyaꞌa danoꞌ, “Oni deꞌ in inoh neh?”
pairs.target: Hearing a multitude going by, he asked what this meant.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa danoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-e, “Ogiꞌ Yesus soꞌ Nazaret ngilusuꞌ katiꞌ.”
pairs.target: They told him that Jesus of Nazareth was passing by.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ inoh moꞌ nang bogan-e in-e, “Yesus onak-sukun laja Daud masiꞌleh tuduꞌ okuꞌ!”
pairs.target: He cried out, “Jesus, you son of David, have mercy on me!”

pairs.source: Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ dioꞌ ponu moꞌ ngalah nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ inoh joman bidaluag, pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ inoh makin-e dolas nang bogan-e, “Yesus onak-sukun laja Daud masiꞌleh tuduꞌ okuꞌ!”
pairs.target: Those who led the way rebuked him, that he should be quiet; but he cried out all the more, “You son of David, have mercy on me!”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ loꞌo yoh odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ toban nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ inoh tuduꞌ odop-E.  Takal-e moꞌ nog sinok, Yesus moꞌ sikian-e,
pairs.target: Standing still, Jesus commanded him to be brought to him. When he had come near, he asked him,

pairs.source: “Oni deꞌ laꞌan muꞌu odaꞌ Okuꞌ nai?” Nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ inoh moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Gulu odaꞌleh okuꞌ ponai ningaꞌ.”
pairs.target: “What do you want me to do?” He said, “Lord, that I may see again.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Ningaꞌ mey sobab muꞌu bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ muꞌu mokuaꞌ.”
pairs.target: Jesus said to him, “Receive your sight. Your faith has healed you.”

pairs.source: Ngan-e moꞌ ponai ningaꞌ yomoꞌ nunaꞌ Yesus simadi-e mudi Topaꞌ, suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ningaꞌ hal inoh suwaꞌ geh mudi Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: Immediately he received his sight, and followed him, glorifying God. All the people, when they saw it, praised God.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E nog keꞌ kota Yerikho, Yomoꞌ nyamung pimonu-e ngilusuꞌ kota inoh.
pairs.target: He entered and was passing through Jericho.

pairs.source: Deꞌ kota inoh ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan pimipin pinagih suke deꞌ kaya.  Adon-e Zakheus.
pairs.target: There was a man named Zacchaeus. He was a chief tax collector, and he was rich.

pairs.source: Iyoh yaꞌ ningaꞌ oni mun nyaꞌa deꞌ adon-e Yesus inoh, pak-e ngan juag-e kodoꞌ yomoꞌ diꞌ-e ponai kilin-e sobab nyaꞌa sikiya lami.
pairs.target: He was trying to see who Jesus was, and couldn’t because of the crowd, because he was short.

pairs.source: Yoh moꞌ bikoduh pilowan nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ yomoꞌ nyikoh tongon koyuh ngan-e yaꞌ ningaꞌ Yesus deꞌ yaꞌ ngilusuꞌ kanoꞌ.
pairs.target: He ran on ahead, and climbed up into a sycamore tree to see him, for he was going to pass that way.

pairs.source: Takal Yesus moꞌ nog deꞌ libuaꞌ tongon koyuh inoh, Iyoh moꞌ bigalong keꞌ somu yomoꞌ sina, “Zakheus, muun mey! Onu itih Okuꞌ halus ngilumon deꞌ boli muꞌu.”
pairs.target: When Jesus came to the place, he looked up and saw him, and said to him, “Zacchaeus, hurry and come down, for today I must stay at your house.”

pairs.source: Ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ nang Yesus inoh Zakheus moꞌ lasuꞌ doon kila-e, yomoꞌ lasuꞌ muun soꞌ tongon koyuh inoh yomoꞌ toban Yesus keꞌ boli-e.
pairs.target: He hurried, came down, and received him joyfully.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ningaꞌ hal inoh lasuꞌ bigonom, “Bah Nyaꞌa itih oni nai-e odi ngilumon keꞌ boli nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa inoh neh.”
pairs.target: When they saw it, they all murmured, saying, “He has gone in to lodge with a man who is a sinner.”

pairs.source: Takal Zakheus deꞌ boli-e yomoꞌ mokat mujuag yomoꞌ in-e, “Gulu, okuꞌ yaꞌ kutung binuoh haltakuꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ botak kolag, yomoꞌ nyam basa okuꞌ ogiꞌ ngakal nyaꞌa, okuꞌ paliꞌ tuduꞌ-e pat sidoh soꞌ deꞌ ngakal Kuꞌ!”
pairs.target: Zacchaeus stood and said to the Lord, “Behold, Lord, half of my goods I give to the poor. If I have wrongfully exacted anything of anyone, I restore four times as much.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ sina in-e, “Daang onu itih muꞌu baya madih ayuamuꞌ obuah nyilamat sobab muꞌu tuong onak-sukun Abraham geh.
pairs.target: Jesus said to him, “Today, salvation has come to this house, because he also is a son of Abraham.

pairs.source: Sobab Okuꞌ Onak Manusia nog keꞌ dunia kaꞌan kalik duoh nyilamat nyaꞌa deꞌ moyap.”
pairs.target: For the Son of Man came to seek and to save that which was lost.”

pairs.source: Takal Yesus moꞌ sinok soꞌ kota Yerusalem bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ sakaꞌ nang takal Yesus nog keꞌ Yerusalem, Yoh lasuꞌ militah jadin Laja danoꞌ duoh pilopas negli Israel soꞌ penjajahan Roma.  Sobab inoh Yesus moꞌ ngin perumpamaan, in-e,
pairs.target: As they heard these things, he went on and told a parable, because he was near Jerusalem, and they supposed that God’s Kingdom would be revealed immediately.

pairs.source: “Ogiꞌ onak-sukun laja deꞌ odi keꞌ pulow deꞌ juuaꞌ saꞌ-e obuah pakat jadi laja deꞌ pulow-e odop-e.  Mokuaꞌ tilimaꞌ pakat-e inoh ke iyoh paliꞌ.
pairs.target: He said therefore, “A certain nobleman went into a far country to receive for himself a kingdom, and to return.

pairs.source: Takal-e yaꞌ ponu yomoꞌ mogan simoong naꞌan kuli-e, yomoꞌ ngin kiping duit mas tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.  Iyoh moꞌ sina in-e, ‘Kai leh duit itih kaꞌan modal ingan bidagang nog okuꞌ paliꞌ.’
pairs.target: He called ten servants of his, and gave them ten mina coins,  and told them, ‘Conduct business until I come.’

pairs.source: Pak-e nyaꞌa daang negli-e noh obuaꞌ buꞌui tuduꞌ iyoh, takal-e moꞌ ponu nyaꞌa deꞌ buꞌui daꞌ-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ pait kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa saꞌ-e tanon nang, ‘Koꞌih doliaꞌ koꞌih odaꞌ nyaꞌa itih jadin laja koꞌih.’
pairs.target: But his citizens hated him, and sent an envoy after him, saying, ‘We don’t want this man to reign over us.’

pairs.source: Pak-e iyoh totap obuah pakat jadin laja.  Mokuaꞌ inoh iyoh moꞌ paliꞌ keꞌ negli-e.  Iyoh moꞌ lasuꞌ mogan kuli-e deꞌ simoong inoh ngan-e yaꞌ puꞌan utung soꞌ duit deꞌ moꞌ ngin-e tuduꞌ kuli-e deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: “When he had come back again, having received the kingdom, he commanded these servants, to whom he had given the money, to be called to him, that he might know what they had gained by conducting business.

pairs.source: Kuli-e deꞌ ke niꞌ-e moꞌ in-e, ‘Laja niꞌ kiping duit mas deꞌ ngin ingan tuduꞌ okuꞌ inoh moh moꞌ bitamah jadin simoong kiping.’
pairs.target: The first came before him, saying, ‘Lord, your mina has made ten more minas.’

pairs.source: ‘Paguh,’ in laja inoh, ‘Muꞌu kuli deꞌ paguh, sobab daang oniꞌ deꞌ isit jaꞌ-e muꞌu ponai nyeꞌ bisayaꞌ daꞌ-e, sobab inohleh muꞌu yaꞌ militah tun simoong kota.’
pairs.target: “He said to him, ‘Well done, you good servant! Because you were found faithful with very little, you shall have authority over ten cities.’

pairs.source: Kuli ke duwoh-e moꞌ in-e geh, ‘Niꞌ kiping duit mas deꞌ ngin ingan tuduꞌ okuꞌ moh moꞌ bitamah jadin limoh kiping.’
pairs.target: “The second came, saying, ‘Your mina, Lord, has made five minas.’

pairs.source: ‘Muꞌu yaꞌ militah tun limoh kota,’ in laja inoh.
pairs.target: “So he said to him, ‘And you are to be over five cities.’

pairs.source: Kuli ke taluh-e moꞌ in-e, ‘Itihleh niꞌ kiping duit mas deꞌ ngin ingan tuduꞌ okuꞌ, nyikonkuꞌ daang sapu tongan.
pairs.target: Another came, saying, ‘Lord, behold, your mina, which I kept laid away in a handkerchief,

pairs.source: Okuꞌ tolu deꞌ ingan sobab ingan nyaꞌa deꞌ kolas, ingan mit oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ-e kakuꞌ ingan, duoh ingan ngutuam koyuh deꞌ diꞌ ingan puluah-e.’
pairs.target: for I feared you, because you are an exacting man. You take up that which you didn’t lay down, and reap that which you didn’t sow.’

pairs.source: Laja inoh moꞌ in-e, ‘Muꞌu kuli deꞌ jaꞌat.  Kuꞌ yaꞌ ngukum muꞌu samah kodaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nang odopmuꞌ.  Muꞌu moꞌ puꞌan okuꞌ kolas, deꞌ mit oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ-e kakuꞌ okuꞌ mokuaꞌ inoh ngutuam oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ puluah-e.
pairs.target: “He said to him, ‘Out of your own mouth will I judge you, you wicked servant! You knew that I am an exacting man, taking up that which I didn’t lay down, and reaping that which I didn’t sow.

pairs.source: Moꞌ nyam-e watinoh, oni ngan muꞌ diꞌ muꞌ nyikon duitkuꞌ inoh deꞌ beng? Saꞌ takal kuꞌ paliꞌ, okuꞌ tapod mit duit noh baya bunga-e geh.’
pairs.target: Then why didn’t you deposit my money in the bank, and at my coming, I might have earned interest on it?’

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh laja inoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ mujuag sinok-e, ‘Mit niꞌ kiping duit maskuꞌ soꞌ kuli deꞌ jaꞌat inoh, nyeꞌ moꞌ ngin tuduꞌ kuli deꞌ soꞌon simoong kiping inoh.’
pairs.target: He said to those who stood by, ‘Take the mina away from him, and give it to him who has the ten minas.’

pairs.source: Pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-e, ‘Tung iyoh kan moꞌ ogiꞌ simoong kiping.’
pairs.target: “They said to him, ‘Lord, he has ten minas!’

pairs.source: Laja inoh moꞌ nyawot-e, ‘Osi deꞌ dapod nyeꞌ bisayaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ isit tuduꞌ-e, iyoh dapod nyeꞌ bisayaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ bogoꞌ tuduꞌ-e, pak-e osi deꞌ diꞌ-e nyeꞌ dapod bisayaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ isit tuduꞌ-e oni deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ odop-e bial isit totap obuah mit suaꞌ-e.
pairs.target: ‘For I tell you that to everyone who has, will more be given; but from him who doesn’t have, even that which he has will be taken away from him.

pairs.source: Pak-e adin tobanleh katiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ buꞌui tuduꞌ okuꞌ, deꞌ doliaꞌ-e odaꞌ okuꞌ jadin laja saꞌan odop-e.  Mokuaꞌ inoh ngabos leh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ sulung jowinkuꞌ!’ ”
pairs.target: But bring those enemies of mine who didn’t want me to reign over them here, and kill them before me.’”

pairs.source: Yomoꞌ takal-e mokuaꞌ nang sina-E, Yesus moꞌ nyamung pimonu-e keꞌ Yerusalem.
pairs.target: Having said these things, he went on ahead, going up to Jerusalem.

pairs.source: Takal-e moꞌ yaꞌ nog deꞌ kupuaꞌ Betfage duoh Betania deꞌ punguꞌ Zaitun, Iyoh moꞌ odaꞌ duwoh naꞌan pinunaꞌ-e dioꞌ ponu,
pairs.target: When he came near to Bethsphage and Bethany, at the mountain that is called Olivet, he sent two of his disciples,

pairs.source: in-E, “Odileh keꞌ kupuaꞌ inoh.  Takal ingan moꞌ nog deꞌ kupuaꞌ noh, ingan yaꞌ dapod niꞌ polong keledai deꞌ aluaꞌ doiꞌ onu-e nyaꞌa muat daꞌ-e deꞌ obuah mokos sinok boli nyaꞌa.  Pilopasleh bokos-e inoh soꞌ tiang tobanleh katiꞌ.
pairs.target: saying, “Go your way into the village on the other side, in which, as you enter, you will find a colt tied, which no man had ever sat upon. Untie it, and bring it.

pairs.source: Nyam basa ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ sikian tuduꞌ ingan, ‘Oniꞌ ngan ingan pilopas tolin keledai inoh soꞌ tiang-e neh?’ Tanon daꞌ-e nang Gulu pilelu-e.”
pairs.target: If anyone asks you, ‘Why are you untying it?’ say to him: ‘The Lord needs it.’”

pairs.source: Ke duwoh naꞌan pinunaꞌ Yesus inoh moꞌ odi, yomoꞌ dapod suaꞌ oniꞌ danoꞌ samah kodaꞌ deꞌ nang Yesus tuduꞌ odop-e.
pairs.target: Those who were sent went away, and found things just as he had told them.

pairs.source: Takal-e pilopas tolin keledai inoh soꞌ tiang, nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ moꞌ in-e, “Oni nai ingan pilopas tolin keledai inoh soꞌ tiang-e neh?”
pairs.target: As they were untying the colt, its owners said to them, “Why are you untying the colt?”

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ duwoh inoh moꞌ nyawot-e, “Gulu pilelu-e.”
pairs.target: They said, “The Lord needs it.”

pairs.source: Pinunaꞌ Yesus inoh ti-e moꞌ toban keledai inoh tuduꞌ Yesus, yomoꞌ nopas dug keledai inoh pakai jubah-e yomoꞌ tulung paꞌad Yesus keꞌ tun-e.
pairs.target: They brought it to Jesus. They threw their cloaks on the colt, and set Jesus on them.

pairs.source: Yomoꞌ takal Yesus moꞌ ponu simadi-E maꞌad deꞌ tun keledai inoh, nyaꞌa bogoꞌ moꞌ nopas olan pakai jubah-e.
pairs.target: As he went, they spread their cloaks on the road.

pairs.source: Takal Yesus moꞌ sinok-e yaꞌ nog Yerusalem deꞌ olan muun deꞌ punguꞌ Zaitun, susuaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ponu nunaꞌ Iyoh moꞌ lasuꞌ daang munuas-e nang bogan-e mudi Topaꞌ saꞌan susuaꞌ mukjizat deꞌ moꞌ kilin odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: As he was now getting near, at the descent of the Mount of Olives, the whole multitude of the disciples began to rejoice and praise God with a loud voice for all the mighty works which they had seen,

pairs.source: In odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Obuah bilokatleh Laja itih deꞌ nog daang adon Topaꞌ! Sonang-moꞌon daang sulga duoh mudileh Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: saying, “Blessed is the King who comes in the name of the Lord!  Peace in heaven, and glory in the highest!”

pairs.source: Kudu-kudu naꞌan ulang Farisi deꞌ suaꞌ duoh uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ yomoꞌ sina duoh Yesus, “Gulu odaꞌleh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌmuꞌ inoh saꞌ diꞌ-e sina in tih.”
pairs.target: Some of the Pharisees from the multitude said to him, “Teacher, rebuke your disciples!”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Moꞌ nyam pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌKuꞌ diꞌ-e nang bogan-e, batuh-batuh deꞌ munoꞌ, deꞌ olan itih deꞌ yaꞌ nang bogan in tih geh.”
pairs.target: He answered them, “I tell you that if these were silent, the stones would cry out.”

pairs.source: Takal Yesus moꞌ yaꞌ nog keꞌ kota Yerusalem, Iyoh ningaꞌ kota inoh, Iyoh moꞌ siꞌien ningaꞌ-e.
pairs.target: When he came near, he saw the city and wept over it,

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ sina in-e, “Todah manah mun ingan deꞌ loꞌo deꞌ kota itih.  Sukup paguh-e moꞌ nyam ingan puꞌan oniꞌ wat ingan yaꞌ bidamai duoh Topaꞌ pak-e adin ingan diꞌ ngan ponai ngiloti-e!
pairs.target: saying, “If you, even you, had known today the things which belong to your peace! But now, they are hidden from your eyes.

pairs.source: Sobab yaꞌ nog onu-e musoh yaꞌ nog kapung ingan nunaꞌ sinung kota ingan boit-touh mun neh ngan neh yaꞌ nyelang ingan.
pairs.target: For the days will come on you, when your enemies will throw up a barricade against you, surround you, hem you in on every side,

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ ngasul kota baya soꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ loꞌo daang-e, yomoꞌ niꞌ kiluang batuh idoh geh diꞌ-e yaꞌ tanah-e bisusun deꞌ tun batuh deꞌ bokon, sobab ingan diꞌ ingan puꞌan siniaꞌ totok-e Topaꞌ yaꞌ nog nyilamat ingan.”
pairs.target: and will dash you and your children within you to the ground. They will not leave in you one stone on another, because you didn’t know the time of your visitation.”

pairs.source: Takal Yesus molot deꞌ awah Boli Topaꞌ yoh moꞌ kasig nyaꞌa deꞌ bijua danoꞌ.
pairs.target: He entered into the temple, and began to drive out those who bought and sold in it,

pairs.source: Yomoꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ in-e, “Daang Kitab deꞌ nulis deꞌ in tih, ‘Boli Kuꞌ iyohleh topat nyaꞌa bidoa,’ pak-e ingan pakai topat kaꞌan ngakal nipu nyaꞌa.”
pairs.target: saying to them, “It is written, ‘My house is a house of prayer,’  but you have made it a ‘den of robbers’!”

pairs.source: Bilang konu Yesus ngajal deꞌ awah Boli Topaꞌ, pimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh duoh gulu-gulu agama Yahudi baya nyaꞌa deꞌ timogah adon-e deꞌ uluk ulang Israel kagaꞌ oni wat-e yaꞌ ngabos Yesus,
pairs.target: He was teaching daily in the temple, but the chief priests and the scribes and the leading men among the people sought to destroy him.

pairs.source: pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e puꞌan oniwat gaya-e, sobab nyaꞌa bogoꞌ sonang yaꞌ ngojit oni deꞌ nang Yesus.
pairs.target: They couldn’t find what they might do, for all the people hung on to every word that he said.

pairs.source: Takal Yesus ngajal duoh tanon Gah deꞌ Paguh soꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ awah Boli Topaꞌ.  Takal inoh ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan pimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh, gulu-gulu agama Yahudi duoh pimipin ulang Yahudi nog,
pairs.target: On one of those days, as he was teaching the people in the temple and preaching the Good News, the priests and scribes came to him with the elders.

pairs.source: yomoꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Yesus, “Suba tanon tuduꞌ koꞌih, osi deꞌ ngin hak duoh daang adon osi muꞌu nai suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ?”
pairs.target: They asked him, “Tell us: by what authority do you do these things? Or who is giving you this authority?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Okuꞌ tuong ogiꞌ geh oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ sikian Kuꞌ tuduꞌ ingan, suba tanon tuduꞌ Okuꞌ:
pairs.target: He answered them, “I also will ask you one question. Tell me:

pairs.source: Osi deꞌ ngin hak tuduꞌ Yohanes Pembaptis nyaꞌa? Topaꞌ keh soꞌ odop Yohanes?”
pairs.target: the baptism of John, was it from heaven, or from men?”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ biloneng, “Nyam basa otoꞌ nang soꞌ Topaꞌ, totu Iyoh nang ‘Oni nai ingan diꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yohanes?’
pairs.target: They reasoned with themselves, saying, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ he will say, ‘Why didn’t you believe him?’

pairs.source: Pak-e nyam basa otoꞌ nang, ‘Soꞌ odop Yohanes,’ totu suaꞌ nyaꞌa nyokad otoꞌ pakai batuh, sobab odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bisayaꞌ nang Yohanes inoh nabi.”
pairs.target: But if we say, ‘From men,’ all the people will stone us, for they are persuaded that John was a prophet.”

pairs.source: Jadi odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-e, “Diꞌ koꞌih puꞌan neh.”
pairs.target: They answered that they didn’t know where it was from.

pairs.source: Yomoꞌ Yesus nyawot sina odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Okuꞌ tuong doliaꞌ Kuꞌ geh tanon soꞌ ki Okuꞌ soꞌon hak duoh daang adon osi, ngan Kuꞌ nai suaꞌ onik deꞌ munoꞌ.”
pairs.target: Jesus said to them, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ ngin perumpamaan In-e, “Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ kobon angul-e iyoh moꞌ sewa kobon-e inoh tuduꞌ nyaꞌa, odop-e moꞌ odi loꞌo sukup tui-e keꞌ pulow deꞌ bokon.
pairs.target: He began to tell the people this parable. “A  man planted a vineyard, and rented it out to some farmers, and went into another country for a long time.

pairs.source: Takal moꞌ nog onu-e ngutuam angul, nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ kobon inoh moꞌ pait kuli-e, daꞌ odi mit duman yoh soꞌ ayua deꞌ soꞌ-e sewa kobon-e.  Pak-e ayua deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ makung pijolaꞌ kuli inoh yomoꞌ odaꞌ paliꞌ boloh-boloh-e.
pairs.target: At the proper season, he sent a servant to the farmers to collect his share of the fruit of the vineyard. But the farmers beat him, and sent him away empty.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ kobon inoh, moꞌ pait lagiꞌ kuli-e deꞌ bokon, pak-e kuli inoh obuah pakung pijolaꞌ geh, nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ manguk-nyupah-e yomoꞌ odaꞌ paliꞌ boloh-boloh-e.
pairs.target: He sent yet another servant, and they also beat him, and treated him shamefully, and sent him away empty.

pairs.source: Yomoꞌ odaꞌ kuli-e deꞌ ke taluh-e.  Pak-e kuli-e inoh tuong obuah geh pakung pijolaꞌ nog-e kinaman simadi nyaꞌa munoꞌ matak toban luah soꞌ kobon inoh.
pairs.target: He sent yet a third, and they also wounded him, and threw him out.

pairs.source: Nyuang-nyuang-e nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ kobon inoh moꞌ in-e, ‘Oni deꞌ yaꞌ nai kuꞌ yoh? Kuꞌ pait onak odopkuꞌ deꞌ sukupkuꞌ ngibala-e, podo odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ laꞌan tunuak tuduꞌ-e.’
pairs.target: The lord of the vineyard said, ‘What shall I do? I will send my beloved son. It may be that seeing him, they will respect him.’

pairs.source: Pak-e takal ayua nyaꞌa deꞌ nyewa kobon inoh ningaꞌ onak nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ kobon inoh nog, yomoꞌ sina sitipan odop-e, in-e, ‘Ningaꞌ! Deꞌ nog inoh onak odop nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ kobon, iyoh deꞌ yaꞌ kakuꞌ kobon itih takal samaꞌ-e doiꞌ, jaꞌ toꞌ ngabos-e saꞌ kobon itih jadin kakuꞌ otoꞌ.’
pairs.target: “But when the farmers saw him, they reasoned among themselves, saying, ‘This is the heir. Come, let’s kill him, that the inheritance may be ours.’

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ matak onak nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ kobon inoh toban keꞌ sopaꞌ kobon yomoꞌ ngabos-e.” Yesus moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Moꞌ nyam-e watinoh, oni deꞌ nai nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ kobon inoh tuduꞌ ayua deꞌ munoꞌ?
pairs.target: They threw him out of the vineyard, and killed him. What therefore will the lord of the vineyard do to them?

pairs.source: Totu nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ kobon inoh nog yomoꞌ ngabos ayua deꞌ nyewa kobon-e inoh, yomoꞌ ngin tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon daꞌ sewa-e.” Ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ nai ayua deꞌ sewa kobon inoh, nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ moꞌ nang in tuduꞌ Yesus, “Maꞌ boꞌow-e daꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ watnoh jadi neh!”
pairs.target: He will come and destroy these farmers, and will give the vineyard to others.” When they heard it, they said, “May it never be!”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ ningaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ simadi-e sikian, “Oni mey loti ayat daang Kitab deꞌ in neh: ‘Batuh deꞌ nang tukang-tukang boli moꞌ doiꞌ guna-e iyohleh batuh deꞌ jadin batuh deꞌ sukup biguna-e kaꞌan kajuag boli.’”
pairs.target: But he looked at them, and said, “Then what is this that is written, ‘The stone which the builders rejected, the same was made the chief cornerstone?’

pairs.source: Yomoꞌ Yesus moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ, “Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ labuꞌ keꞌ tun batuh inoh totap iyoh asul, duoh osi deꞌ obuah nyonug odaꞌ batuh inoh totap iyoh asul lumuk.”
pairs.target: Everyone who falls on that stone will be broken to pieces,  but it will crush whomever it falls on to dust.”

pairs.source: Gulu-gulu agama Yahudi duoh pimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh puꞌan-e nang perumpamaan Yesus inoh obuah odop-e, sobab inohleh ngan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ yaꞌ takap Yesus takal inoh geh pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tolu tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ.
pairs.target: The chief priests and the scribes sought to lay hands on him that very hour, but they feared the people—for they knew he had spoken this parable against them.

pairs.source: Jadin odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngite.  Odop deꞌ munoꞌ pait nyaꞌa deꞌ pulaꞌ-pulaꞌ paguh ngan-e ngite-e yomoꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa inoh bogoꞌ sikian oniꞌ deꞌ Yesus ngan kalik salah-e saꞌ-e ponai takap duoh toban tuduꞌ gubenul.
pairs.target: They watched him, and sent out spies, who pretended to be righteous, that they might trap him in something he said, so as to deliver him up to the power and authority of the governor.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sina in neh, “Gulu, puꞌan koꞌih nang buak sina duoh ajal Ingan suaꞌ-e bonal, Ingan diꞌ ngan pilih-pilih nyaꞌa, Ingan ngajal nunaꞌ oni deꞌ paguh soꞌ Topaꞌ kaꞌan manusia.
pairs.target: They asked him, “Teacher, we know that you say and teach what is right, and aren’t partial to anyone, but truly teach the way of God.

pairs.source: Jadi, suba Ingan tanon tuduꞌ koꞌih, podo daang agama otoꞌ soꞌon kedoh keh otoꞌ bayal suke tuduꞌ Kaisar?”
pairs.target: Is it lawful for us to pay taxes to Caesar, or not?”

pairs.source: Pak-e Yesus moꞌ puꞌan pikil jaꞌat odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yomoꞌ in-e,
pairs.target: But he perceived their craftiness, and said to them, “Why do you test me?

pairs.source: “Suba bitanga niꞌ kiping duit pilak tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, gamal duoh adon osi itih?” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-e, “Kaisar!”
pairs.target: Show me a denarius. Whose image and inscription are on it?”  They answered, “Caesar’s.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Oniꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ Kaisar ngin tuduꞌ Kaisar, pak-e oniꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ Topaꞌ ngin tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: He said to them, “Then give to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ diꞌ-e ponai kalik salah Yesus deꞌ jowin nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ loꞌo bidongo simadi-e ilan oni deꞌ nang Yesus.
pairs.target: They weren’t able to trap him in his words before the people. They marveled at his answer, and were silent.

pairs.source: Kudu-kudu naꞌan ulang Saduki odi tuduꞌ Yesus.  (Uluk ulang Saduki iyohleh nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ nang nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ kobos idoh tiaꞌ diꞌ-e ponai paliꞌ idip.) Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Yesus,
pairs.target: Some of the Sadducees came to him, those who deny that there is a resurrection.

pairs.source: “Gulu, Musa nulis plitah saꞌan otoꞌ in tih in-e neh, ‘Moꞌ nyam ogiꞌ sowon nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos bonon-e yoh moꞌ aluaꞌ doiꞌ onak-e, madih soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos inoh halus mit dayung inoh jadin sowon-e saꞌ-e ogiꞌ onak-sukun soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos inoh ti-e.’
pairs.target: They asked him, “Teacher, Moses wrote to us that if a man’s brother dies having a wife, and he is childless, his brother should take the wife, and raise up children for his brother.

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ juꞌ naꞌan sikiaꞌ sudiꞌ.  Deꞌ pinuan kawin, pak-e aluaꞌ doiꞌ onak-e iyoh moꞌ kobos.
pairs.target: There were therefore seven brothers. The first took a wife, and died childless.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh sudiꞌ-e kawin duoh ipal-e pak-e iyoh kobos geh, doiꞌ onak-e.
pairs.target: The second took her as wife, and he died childless.

pairs.source: Watinoh geh deꞌ obuah sudiꞌ-e deꞌ nomol taluh nog ke juꞌ-e.
pairs.target: The third took her, and likewise the seven all left no children, and died.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh dayung inoh tuong kobos geh.
pairs.target: Afterward the woman also died.

pairs.source: Soꞌ juꞌ madih odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ kawin duoh dayung inoh.  Moꞌ nyam-e watinoh, osi mun-e soꞌ juꞌ naꞌan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ jadin bonon dayung inoh, takal onu nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos paliꞌ idip?”
pairs.target: Therefore in the resurrection whose wife of them will she be? For the seven had her as a wife.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot sina odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ idip daang dunia suaꞌ-e kawin.
pairs.target: Jesus said to them, “The children of this age marry, and are given in marriage.

pairs.source: Pak-e daang dunia deꞌ yaꞌ nog dali duoh dayung deꞌ ngakuꞌ deꞌ boton Topaꞌ kaꞌan-e paliꞌ idip baꞌuh idoh tiyaꞌ diꞌ-e kawin.
pairs.target: But those who are considered worthy to attain to that age and the resurrection from the dead, neither marry, nor are given in marriage.

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ samah kodaꞌ malaikat diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ ponai kobos, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ jadi onak Topaꞌ.  Sobab odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ paliꞌ idip baꞌuh.
pairs.target: For they can’t die any more, for they are like the angels, and are children of God, being children of the resurrection.

pairs.source: Odop Musa deꞌ tanon nang nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos paliꞌ idip baꞌuh, daang silita Musa opui biduduꞌ daang totaꞌ duh, iyoh sobot nang Topaꞌ iyohleh Topaꞌ deꞌ obuah nyomah odaꞌ Abraham, Ishak duoh Yakub,
pairs.target: But that the dead are raised, even Moses showed at the bush, when he called the Lord ‘The God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.’

pairs.source: sobab idoh diꞌ-e nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos deꞌ nyomah Topaꞌ, pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ idip deꞌ nyomah Topaꞌ, sobab kaꞌan Topaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ suaꞌ-e idip.”
pairs.target: Now he is not the God of the dead, but of the living, for all are alive to him.”

pairs.source: Ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ nang Yesus noh, kudu-kudu naꞌan gulu-gulu agama Yahudi nang, “Bonal oniꞌ deꞌ nang Ingan inoh neh.”
pairs.target: Some of the scribes answered, “Teacher, you speak well.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e tiaꞌ blani sikian oni-oni tuduꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: They didn’t dare to ask him any more questions.

pairs.source: Pak-e Yesus moꞌ sikian lagiꞌ tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Oni ngan nyaꞌa ponai nang Laja deꞌ janyi Topaꞌ inoh onak-sukun laja Daud?
pairs.target: He said to them, “Why do they say that the Christ is David’s son?

pairs.source: Sobab odop Daud deꞌ sina daang buk Mazmur nang, ‘Topaꞌ moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Tuankuꞌ: Guluꞌ leh deꞌ nuwaꞌ toꞌuh-Ku
pairs.target: David himself says in the book of Psalms, ‘The Lord said to my Lord, “Sit at my right hand,

pairs.source: nog Okuꞌ monang tun musohmuꞌ.’
pairs.target: until I make your enemies the footstool of your feet.”’

pairs.source: Jadi, Daud nang Laja deꞌ janyi Topaꞌ inohleh Tuan-e.  Watki wat-e Iyoh ponai soꞌ onak-sukun Daud?”
pairs.target: “David therefore calls him Lord, so how is he his son?”

pairs.source: Takal nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ danoꞌ ngojit Yesus sina, Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E,
pairs.target: In the hearing of all the people, he said to his disciples,

pairs.source: “Tauꞌ-tauꞌ maꞌ kodaꞌ gulu-gulu agama Yahudi deꞌ munoꞌ.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ suka ponu katiꞌ-kanih pakai jubah deꞌ omu ngan-e yaꞌ blagah odop-e, saꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ pasal nabiꞌ-e, duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ suka guluꞌ deꞌ topat saꞌan piayuh deꞌ boli topat simayang duoh topat nyaꞌa bluman.
pairs.target: “Beware of those scribes who like to walk in long robes, and love greetings in the marketplaces, the best seats in the synagogues, and the best places at feasts;

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ konyat ngakal jana-jana yomoꞌ mit halta-e.  Ngan-e nutu pingunai-e inoh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bidoa omu-omu-e, pak-e inoh pibulaꞌ jaꞌ-e.  Sobab inohleh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ totap yaꞌ obuah ngukum lobih baat lagiꞌ!”
pairs.target: who devour widows’ houses, and for a pretense make long prayers: these will receive greater condemnation.”

pairs.source: Takal Yesus deꞌ awah Boli Topaꞌ Iyoh ningaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kaya suad duit kaang poti persembahan.
pairs.target: He looked up, and saw the rich people who were putting their gifts into the treasury.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh yoh moꞌ ningaꞌ geh niꞌ naꞌan jana deꞌ botak kolag kibalot duwoh kiping duit tibaga.
pairs.target: He saw a certain poor widow casting in two small brass coins.

pairs.source: Yomoꞌ Yesus moꞌ sina in-e, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Jana inoh suad duit-e lobih bogoꞌ soꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon.
pairs.target: He said, “Truly I tell you, this poor widow put in more than all of them,

pairs.source: Sobab suaꞌ nyaꞌa ngin sit soꞌ halta-e deꞌ bogoꞌ, pak-e jana itih sungu-e botak kolag iyoh ngin suaꞌ-suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ-e.”
pairs.target: for all these put in gifts for God from their abundance, but she, out of her poverty, put in all that she had to live on.”

pairs.source: Takal inoh ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa kilakal sitipan odop-e simadi-e mudi Boli Topaꞌ deꞌ nai nyaꞌa pakai sinung batuh deꞌ paguh duoh balang-balang persembahan Topaꞌ.  Yomoꞌ Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop deꞌ munoꞌ,
pairs.target: As some were talking about the temple and how it was decorated with beautiful stones and gifts, he said,

pairs.source: “Tieꞌ sodiꞌ, suaꞌ oni deꞌ ningaꞌ ingan itih obuah pilubuh, niꞌ kiluang batuh tuang doiꞌ geh deꞌ lokat bisusun duoh dingan-e, suaꞌ-suaꞌ obuaꞌ posik-polai katiꞌ-kanih.”
pairs.target: “As for these things which you see, the days will come, in which there will not be left here one stone on another that will not be thrown down.”

pairs.source: Odop deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Yesus, “Gulu siniaꞌ hal inoh yaꞌ jadi? Duoh oni tanda-e moꞌ nog onu-e hal inoh yaꞌ jadi?”
pairs.target: They asked him, “Teacher, so when will these things be? What is the sign that these things are about to happen?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ sina in-e, “Tauꞌ-tauꞌ nyeꞌ, maꞌ ingan obuah mogo.  Sobab bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ nog pakai adon Okuꞌ duoh nang: ‘Okuꞌ leh odop-E neh’ duoh ‘Moꞌ yaꞌ nog onu-e tiyaꞌ.’ Pak-e maꞌleh ingan nunaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: He said, “Watch out that you don’t get led astray, for many will come in my name, saying, ‘I am he,’ and, ‘The time is at hand.’ Therefore don’t follow them.

pairs.source: Asal ingan ngojit nyaꞌa bogoꞌ bipolang yomoꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa blawan, maꞌ ingan gogoh sobab suaꞌ inoh totap yaꞌ dioꞌ jadi, pak-e takal inoh idoh diꞌ-e lasuꞌ Onu Kiamat.”
pairs.target: When you hear of wars and disturbances, don’t be terrified, for these things must happen first, but the end won’t come immediately.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ nyamung sina-e in-e, “Yaꞌ ogiꞌ polang, suku deꞌ niꞌ lawan suku deꞌ bokon duoh negara deꞌ niꞌ lawan negara deꞌ bokon,
pairs.target: Then he said to them, “Nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom.

pairs.source: duoh tieꞌ sodiꞌ-e, daki-daki sijaꞌ-e yaꞌ jadi gempa bumi deꞌ dolas, bogoꞌ nyaꞌa miliap duoh obuah pinyakit deꞌ bijakit.  Yaꞌ jadi oniꞌ deꞌ saluh-saluh deꞌ tolu nyaꞌa daꞌ-a duoh tanda-tanda dahsyat deꞌ longit.
pairs.target: There will be great earthquakes, famines, and plagues in various places. There will be terrors and great signs from heaven.

pairs.source: Pak-e takal suaꞌ hal inoh aluaꞌ diꞌ-e jadi ingan obuah takap nyaꞌa nyiksa ingan, ingan obuah ngadel deꞌ boli topat simayang yomoꞌ kibalot ingan kaang jel, ingan moꞌ obuah toban keꞌ jowin laja-laja duoh pinguasa sobab ingan bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: But before all these things, they will lay their hands on you and will persecute you, delivering you up to synagogues and prisons, bringing you before kings and governors for my name’s sake.

pairs.source: Takal onu inohleh ingan tanon Gah deꞌ Paguh soꞌ Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: It will turn out as a testimony for you.

pairs.source: Maꞌ bigaduh duoh oni in sina deꞌ halus ingan nang takal ingan obuah ngadel.
pairs.target: Settle it therefore in your hearts not to meditate beforehand how to answer,

pairs.source: Sobab Okuꞌ moꞌ ngin bijak tuduꞌ ingan saꞌ ingan ponai nang sina deꞌ diꞌ musoh ingan ponai nyawot-e.
pairs.target: for I will give you a mouth and wisdom which all your adversaries will not be able to withstand or to contradict.

pairs.source: Ingan yaꞌ obuah nyelah tuduꞌ musoh odaꞌ pingoma ngan, odaꞌ madih ayua ngan, odaꞌ dingan-dingan ngan, kudu naꞌan soꞌ ingan deꞌ mutiꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ obuah ngabos odaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: You will be handed over even by parents, brothers, relatives, and friends. They will cause some of you to be put to death.

pairs.source: Ingan yaꞌ obuah buꞌui sobab ingan bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: You will be hated by all men for my name’s sake.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ ponai ngabos polong ingan pak-e sibonal-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e ponai yaꞌ nai oni-oni-e tuduꞌ ingan.  Niꞌ kiluang geh buak deꞌ bak ingan diꞌ-e moyap!
pairs.target: And not a hair of your head will perish.

pairs.source: Asal ingan taan sabal ngadap suaꞌ-e inoh ingan yaꞌ soꞌon idip deꞌ sitelus-e.”
pairs.target: “By your endurance you will win your lives.

pairs.source: “Nyam ingan ningaꞌ Yerusalem obuah kapung odaꞌ sidadu, ingan moꞌ puꞌan nang patuab lubuh-e moh sinok,
pairs.target: “But when you see Jerusalem surrounded by armies, then know that its desolation is at hand.

pairs.source: Takal inoh, nyaꞌa deꞌ propinsi Yudea totap lasuꞌ bikoduh buꞌu keꞌ dolod.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ loꞌo deꞌ kota halus buꞌu luah soꞌ kota, duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ loꞌo deꞌ kupuaꞌ maꞌ molot daang kota.
pairs.target: Then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains. Let those who are in the middle of her depart. Let those who are in the country not enter therein.

pairs.source: Sobab onu inohleh onu bangsa itih obuah ukum, saꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ obuah nulis odaꞌ nabi-nabi jadi.
pairs.target: For these are days of vengeance, that all things which are written may be fulfilled.

pairs.source: Masiꞌ manah nyeꞌ ningaꞌ dayung-dayung deꞌ bitiiaꞌ duoh deꞌ aluaꞌ siduaꞌ onak-e takal inoh.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ jolaꞌ sobab lolah posah saꞌan-e bikoduh buꞌu.  Susuaꞌ nyaꞌa daang kota inoh yaꞌ sukup jolaꞌ-e takal bangsa itih obuah ngukum.
pairs.target: Woe to those who are pregnant and to those who nurse infants in those days! For there will be great distress in the land, and wrath to this people.

pairs.source: Bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ soꞌ bangsa Israel yaꞌ obuah ngabos pakai podang, duoh bogoꞌ geh deꞌ yaꞌ obuah takap duoh obuah toban keꞌ negli-negli bangsa deꞌ bokon, duoh bangsa-bangsa inoh yaꞌ militah kota Yerusalem nog onu deꞌ moh moꞌ notap Topaꞌ saꞌan bangsa-bangsa inoh.”
pairs.target: They will fall by the edge of the sword, and will be led captive into all the nations. Jerusalem will be trampled down by the Gentiles, until the times of the Gentiles are fulfilled.

pairs.source: “Tiaꞌ sodiꞌ ogiꞌ tanda deꞌ saluh-saluh wat-e yaꞌ tonga deꞌ boton onu, bitang duoh bulan.  Suaꞌ nyaꞌa daang dunia yaꞌ tolu duoh ilan ngojit doong duoh gilumang laut deꞌ dolas
pairs.target: There will be signs in the sun, moon, and stars; and on the earth anxiety of nations, in perplexity for the roaring of the sea and the waves;

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa obuaꞌ yaꞌ kobos-kobos nyam-e tolu tuduꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ jadi deꞌ tun dunia tih, sobab deꞌ tun auu longit obuaꞌ yaꞌ tiguyang-tikusuok.
pairs.target: men fainting for fear, and for expectation of the things which are coming on the world: for the powers of the heavens will be shaken.

pairs.source: Takal inoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa kilin Okuꞌ Onak Manusia nog daang abun duoh punuaꞌ odaꞌ kuasa baya jawaꞌ deꞌ sukup telang.
pairs.target: Then they will see the Son of Man coming in a cloud with power and great glory.

pairs.source: Asal suaꞌ inoh moꞌ jadi, mokatleh nyeꞌ moꞌ pakat jowinmuꞌ, maꞌ tolu sobab diꞌ-e tiaꞌ tui Topaꞌ yaꞌ nog nyilamat muꞌu.”
pairs.target: But when these things begin to happen, look up, and lift up your heads, because your redemption is near.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh, Yesus moꞌ ngin perumpamaan, “Suba ningaꞌ tongon dunuk atou tongon koyuh oni sijaꞌ-e,
pairs.target: He told them a parable. “See the fig tree, and all the trees.

pairs.source: asal ingan moh ningaꞌ tongon koyuh deꞌ tuang-e bisuat ingan puꞌan nang yaꞌ nog musim buaꞌ.
pairs.target: When they are already budding, you see it and know by your own selves that the summer is already near.

pairs.source: Watinoh geh moꞌ nyam ingan moꞌ kilin suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ tanon Kuꞌ inoh ti-e jadi, ingan moꞌ puꞌan nang onu-e Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja moꞌ sinok.
pairs.target: Even so you also, when you see these things happening, know that God’s Kingdom is near.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ idip joman itih aluaꞌ diꞌ-e kobos takal suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ tok-tok yaꞌ jadi.”
pairs.target: Most certainly I tell you, this generation will not pass away until all things are accomplished.

pairs.source: “Longit duoh bumi yaꞌ musuap-moyap pak-e sina Kuꞌ itih diꞌ-e yaꞌ ponai musuap-moyap.
pairs.target: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will by no means pass away.

pairs.source: Natong nyeꞌ! Maꞌ sikiya pikil idip ingan duoh nuak mabuk jaꞌ ingan diꞌ ingan siap takal onu inoh tang-tang nog.
pairs.target: “So be careful, or your hearts will be loaded down with carousing, drunkenness, and cares of this life, and that day will come on you suddenly.

pairs.source: Sobab onu inoh nog saꞌan suaꞌ nyaꞌa samah kodaꞌ binatang tang-tang obuah jolat.
pairs.target: For it will come like a snare on all those who dwell on the surface of all the earth.

pairs.source: Natong nyeꞌ! Duoh silaluleh bidoa saꞌ ingan taꞌan ngadap suaꞌ-e inoh duoh saꞌ ingan diꞌ-e dasaꞌ duoh munuas takal ingan nyamut Okuꞌ Onak Manusia.”
pairs.target: Therefore be watchful all the time, praying that you may be counted worthy to escape all these things that will happen, and to stand before the Son of Man.”

pairs.source: Bilang konu-e daang minggu inoh Yesus ngajal deꞌ awah Boli Topaꞌ, yomoꞌ onu ngalom-e iyoh odi ngilumon deꞌ punguꞌ Zaitun.
pairs.target: Every day Jesus was teaching in the temple, and every night he would go out and spend the night on the mountain that is called Olivet.

pairs.source: Suam-suam pagi bogoꞌ nyaꞌa nog Boli Topaꞌ yaꞌ ngojit pingunang-E.
pairs.target: All the people came early in the morning to him in the temple to hear him.

pairs.source: Takal sinok onu-e yaꞌ Paskah,
pairs.target: Now the feast of unleavened bread, which is called the Passover, was approaching.

pairs.source: pimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh duoh gulu-gulu agama Yahudi kalik watki wat gaya-e yaꞌ ngabos Yesus pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tolu jaꞌ nyaꞌa bogoꞌ puꞌan oni deꞌ yaꞌ nai-e.
pairs.target: The chief priests and the scribes sought how they might put him to death, for they feared the people.

pairs.source: Yomoꞌ Muot moꞌ molot kaang Yudas deꞌ sobot nyaꞌa geh Iskariot.  Iyoh niꞌ soꞌ ke simoong duwoh pinunaꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: Satan entered into Judas, who was also called Iscariot, who was counted with the twelve.

pairs.source: Yoh odi bidapod duoh pimipin-pimipin agama deꞌ ayuh duoh pimipin-pimipin nyaꞌa deꞌ tukang jaga Boli Topaꞌ ngan-e tanon watki wat gaya-e yaꞌ ngin Yesus tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: He went away, and talked with the chief priests and captains about how he might deliver him to them.

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ lasuꞌ sonang manah kila-e yomoꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bijanyi yaꞌ ngin duit tuduꞌ Yudas.
pairs.target: They were glad, and agreed to give him money.

pairs.source: Yudas moꞌ situju duoh kalik oni wat-e baya onu deꞌ pas kaꞌan-e ngin Yesus tuduꞌ musoh-e takal nyaꞌa bogoꞌ diꞌ-e puꞌan-e.
pairs.target: He consented, and sought an opportunity to deliver him to them in the absence of the multitude.

pairs.source: Takal onu keꞌ niꞌ Paskah moꞌ nog suaꞌ nyaꞌa moꞌ halus simoliah domba Paskah.
pairs.target: The day of unleavened bread came, on which the Passover must be sacrificed.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ noh Yesus sina odaꞌ Petrus duoh Yohanes, “Odileh sidia pinguman Paskah kaꞌan otoꞌ.”
pairs.target: Jesus sent Peter and John, saying, “Go and prepare the Passover for us, that we may eat.”

pairs.source: Odop-e duwoh inoh moꞌ nyawot-e, “Daki ingan odaꞌ koꞌih nyidia-e?”
pairs.target: They said to him, “Where do you want us to prepare?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Takal ingan molot daang kota Yerusalem danih ingan yaꞌ bidapod duoh dali deꞌ toban piꞌin daang bona.  Nunaꞌ negeh iyoh keꞌ boli soꞌ-e molot,
pairs.target: He said to them, “Behold, when you have entered into the city, a man carrying a pitcher of water will meet you. Follow him into the house which he enters.

pairs.source: nyeꞌ moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ boli daki soꞌ topat kaꞌan Gulu duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-e yaꞌ man Paskah.
pairs.target: Tell the master of the house, ‘The Teacher says to you, “Where is the guest room, where I may eat the Passover with my disciples?”’

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ boli inoh deꞌ yaꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan kamal deꞌ somu deꞌ muaꞌ motiꞌ-e deꞌ moꞌ bilasa sidia, danoꞌ leh ingan nyidia pinguman Paskah toꞌ.”
pairs.target: He will show you a large, furnished upper room. Make preparations there.”

pairs.source: Yomoꞌ Petrus duoh Yohanes odi keꞌ Yerusalem yoh moꞌ tapod samah kodaꞌ deꞌ nang Yesus tuduꞌ odop-e noh ti-e yomoꞌ nyidia pinguman Paskah-e.
pairs.target: They went, found things as Jesus had told them, and they prepared the Passover.

pairs.source: Takal onu moh yaꞌ ngalom, Yesus moꞌ man duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E.
pairs.target: When the hour had come, he sat down with the twelve apostles.

pairs.source: Yomoꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e munoꞌ, “Jobong nyam Kuꞌ yaꞌ man pinguman paskah itih duoh ingan ngan-e aluaꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ obuah jolaꞌ.
pairs.target: He said to them, “I have earnestly desired to eat this Passover with you before I suffer,

pairs.source: Sobab inoh, Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ tiaꞌ man itih lagiꞌ nog loti paskah itih jadi takal Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja.”
pairs.target: for I tell you, I will no longer by any means eat of it until it is fulfilled in God’s Kingdom.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ noh Yesus moꞌ mit gelas deꞌ ogiꞌ piꞌin angul daang-e, Yoh moꞌ bisukul tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, yomoꞌ sina, “Mit duoh kutungleh itih.
pairs.target: He received a cup, and when he had given thanks, he said, “Take this, and share it among yourselves,

pairs.source: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Soꞌ adin Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ tiyaꞌ nuak angul itih nog Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja.”
pairs.target: for I tell you, I will not drink at all again from the fruit of the vine, until God’s Kingdom comes.”

pairs.source: Yomoꞌ mit kueh duoh bisukul tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, yomoꞌ nyipiek kueh inoh yomoꞌ kutung tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E duoh sina, “Itihleh gonan Kuꞌ deꞌ ngin Kuꞌ tuduꞌ ingan.  Naileh wat itih Saꞌ ingan natong Okuꞌ.”
pairs.target: He took bread, and when he had given thanks, he broke, and gave it to them, saying, “This is my body which is given for you. Do this in memory of me.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ man kueh inoh Yesus moꞌ mit gelas deꞌ ogiꞌ piꞌin angul inoh duoh ngin tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-e Yoh moꞌ sina, “Piꞌin angul daang gelas itih iyohleh janyi Topaꞌ deꞌ baꞌuh, janyi-bipokat deꞌ obuah nogap pakai doyaꞌ Kuꞌ deꞌ soyang kaꞌan ingan.
pairs.target: Likewise, he took the cup after supper, saying, “This cup is the new covenant in my blood, which is poured out for you.

pairs.source: Pak-e maꞌ ingan gogoh takal Kuꞌ nang nyaꞌa deꞌ ngin Okuꞌ deꞌ musoh Kuꞌ ogiꞌ datiꞌ,
pairs.target: But behold, the hand of him who betrays me is with me on the table.

pairs.source: Onak Manusia totap yaꞌ kobos samah kodaꞌ oni deꞌ moꞌ notap Topaꞌ, nyaꞌa deꞌ ngin Okuꞌ inoh, tok-tok yaꞌ obuah ngukum.”
pairs.target: The Son of Man indeed goes, as it has been determined, but woe to that man through whom he is betrayed!”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus moꞌ sikian sitipan odop-e osi nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ nai hal inoh.
pairs.target: They began to question among themselves, which of them it was who would do this thing.

pairs.source: Kudu-kudu naꞌan soꞌ pinunaꞌ Yesus moꞌ bikalah osi deꞌ paling penting soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: There arose also a contention among them, which of them was considered to be greatest.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Laja-laja bangsa deꞌ diꞌ-e piluh Topaꞌ siwat-simun-e tuduꞌ rakyat-e, pak-e sungu-e watnoh rakyat-e silalu sobot laja inoh pinulung-e.
pairs.target: He said to them, “The kings of the nations lord it over them, and those who have authority over them are called ‘benefactors.’

pairs.source: Pak-e ingan diꞌ ngan soꞌon watinoh! Soꞌ ingan deꞌ mutiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ paling penting halus jadi kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ paling hina-e duoh pimipin halus leh kodaꞌ jadin pelayan.
pairs.target: But not so with you. But one who is the greater among you, let him become as the younger, and one who is governing, as one who serves.

pairs.source: Osi leh deꞌ lobih penting, nyaꞌa deꞌ guluꞌ man deꞌ mija keh nyaꞌa deꞌ layan inoh keh? Totu nyaꞌa deꞌ guluꞌ! Pak-e Okuꞌ ogiꞌ datiꞌ sinok ingan jadi pelayan.
