pairs.target: For who is greater, one who sits at the table, or one who serves? Isn’t it he who sits at the table? But I am among you as one who serves.

pairs.source: Daang suaꞌ susahkuꞌ ingan totap ogiꞌ bisamah-samah duoh Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: But you are those who have continued with me in my trials.

pairs.source: Sobab inohleh Okuꞌ yaꞌ ngin tuduꞌ ingan hak kaꞌan militah keꞌ tun suaꞌ nyaꞌa, kodaꞌ Samaꞌ Kuꞌ ngin tuduꞌ Okuꞌ hak kaꞌan militah.
pairs.target: I confer on you a kingdom, even as my Father conferred on me,

pairs.source: Ngan-e watinoh ingan dapod suaꞌ sonang-doon duoh Okuꞌ takal Okuꞌ jadin Laja duoh ingan guluꞌ militah keꞌ tun ke simoong duwoh suku bangsa Israel.”
pairs.target: that you may eat and drink at my table in my Kingdom. You will sit on thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Simon Petrus, “Simon, Simon, ngojit nyeꞌ! Muot moꞌ obuah ngin ijin odaꞌ nguji ingan samah kodaꞌ podi deꞌ obuah napan saꞌ-e pisah isin-e soꞌ oping-e.
pairs.target: The Lord said, “Simon, Simon, behold, Satan asked to have all of you, that he might sift you as wheat,

pairs.source: Pak-e Okuꞌ moh bidoa kaꞌan muꞌu Simon, saꞌ bisayaꞌ muꞌ togap duoh takal muꞌu moꞌ paliꞌ bitobat muꞌu ponai ngin simangat tuduꞌ madih ayuamuꞌ.”
pairs.target: but I prayed for you, that your faith wouldn’t fail. You, when once you have turned again, establish your brothers.”

pairs.source: Petrus nyawot-e, “Gulu okuꞌ sangup molot jel duoh kobos duoh Ingan!”
pairs.target: He said to him, “Lord, I am ready to go with you both to prison and to death!”

pairs.source: Pak-e Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e: “Petrus, Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ muꞌu: Aluaꞌ diꞌ siuak babang bitadu sipagi itih muꞌu moꞌ taluh sidoh diꞌ muꞌ ngakuꞌ Okuꞌ.”
pairs.target: He said, “I tell you, Peter, the rooster will by no means crow today until you deny that you know me three times.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Noꞌuh-e takal Okuꞌ odaꞌ ingan odi dusah toban lopet beg duoh kasut podo ingan ogiꞌ kulang oni-oni-e?” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot, “Doiꞌ.”
pairs.target: He said to them, “When I sent you out without purse, and wallet, and shoes, did you lack anything?” They said, “Nothing.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ: “Pak-e adin osi deꞌ ogiꞌ lopet duoh beg halus yoh toban-e, duoh osi deꞌ doiꞌ podang-e yoh halus jua jubah-e kai-e milih podang.
pairs.target: Then he said to them, “But now, whoever has a purse, let him take it, and likewise a wallet. Whoever has none, let him sell his cloak, and buy a sword.

pairs.source: Sobab Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Ayat Kitab deꞌ nang in-e, ‘Iyoh obuah sobot nyaꞌa nang yoh inoh ulang jaꞌat,’ halus jadi tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.  Sobab oni deꞌ obuah nulis daang Kitab moh jadi tuduꞌ Okuꞌ adin.”
pairs.target: For I tell you that this which is written must still be fulfilled in me: ‘He was counted with transgressors.’ For that which concerns me has an end.”

pairs.source: Yomoꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Gulu ningaꞌ katiꞌ ogiꞌ duoh podang.” “Mohleh,” in Yesus.
pairs.target: They said, “Lord, behold, here are two swords.” He said to them, “That is enough.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ togan kota duoh odi keꞌ punguꞌ Zaitun kodaꞌ deꞌ biasa-e duoh pinunaꞌ-e suaꞌ geh odi.
pairs.target: He came out, and went, as his custom was, to the Mount of Olives. His disciples also followed him.

pairs.source: Takal yoh nog danih Yesus sina tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-e, “Bidoa leh saꞌ ingan diꞌ ngan labuꞌ daang dosa takal ngan obuah pingisuba.”
pairs.target: When he was at the place, he said to them, “Pray that you don’t enter into temptation.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ buꞌu muaꞌ juꞌan-e.  Kila-e taluh puluꞌ meter soꞌ pinunaꞌ-e, Iyoh moꞌ bikunyug duoh bidoa
pairs.target: He was withdrawn from them about a stone’s throw, and he knelt down and prayed,

pairs.source: in-e, “Samaꞌ daang sulga nyam ponai maꞌleh odaꞌ Okuꞌ obuah susah jolaꞌ itih.  Pak-e maꞌleh nunaꞌ oni deꞌ laꞌan okuꞌ pak-e jadileh kodaꞌ oni deꞌ laꞌan Ingan.”
pairs.target: saying, “Father, if you are willing, remove this cup from me. Nevertheless, not my will, but yours, be done.”

pairs.source: Yomoꞌ niꞌ naꞌan malaikat nog tuduꞌ Yesus duoh nguat simangat Yesus.
pairs.target: An angel from heaven appeared to him, strengthening him.

pairs.source: Yesus sukup nyam jolaꞌ daang otin-e inoh ngan yoh bidoa bonal-bonal nog das-e kodaꞌ doyaꞌ natiag deꞌ tanaꞌ.
pairs.target: Being in agony he prayed more earnestly. His sweat became like great drops of blood falling down on the ground.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ bidoa Yesus paliꞌ lagi tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, Yoh ningaꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E boꞌos sobab odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ kowok duoh susah otin-e.
pairs.target: When he rose up from his prayer, he came to the disciples, and found them sleeping because of grief,

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, “Oni ngan ingan boꞌos? Mokatleh duoh bidoa saꞌ ingan diꞌ ngan obuah pingisuba.”
pairs.target: and said to them, “Why do you sleep? Rise and pray that you may not enter into temptation.”

pairs.source: Takal Yesus aluaꞌ sina, nogleh nyaꞌa bogoꞌ deꞌ obuah mipin odaꞌ Yudas, pinunaꞌ odop Yesus.  Mokuaꞌ inoh Yudas moꞌ odi sinoꞌ Yesus yoh moꞌ lasuꞌ sium-E.
pairs.target: While he was still speaking, behold, a multitude, and he who was called Judas, one of the twelve, was leading them. He came near to Jesus to kiss him.

pairs.source: Pak-e Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, “Yudas, Podo pakai salam sium muꞌu yaꞌ ngin Okuꞌ Onak Manusia?”
pairs.target: But Jesus said to him, “Judas, do you betray the Son of Man with a kiss?”

pairs.source: Takal pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus ningaꞌ oniꞌ jadi inoh, nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ lasuꞌ nang, “Gulu, podo ingan odaꞌ koꞌih nyelang negeh nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ pakai podang?”
pairs.target: When those who were around him saw what was about to happen, they said to him, “Lord, shall we strike with the sword?”

pairs.source: Yomoꞌ niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ pinunaꞌ Yesus moꞌ lasuꞌ nyopaꞌ kojit toꞌuh kuli pimipin agama deꞌ ayuh noh nog-e potod.
pairs.target: A certain one of them struck the servant of the high priest, and cut off his right ear.

pairs.source: Pak-e Yesus moꞌ lasuꞌ nang, “Moh tiaꞌ!” Daang-e lasuꞌ tomaꞌ kojit nyaꞌa inoh ngan-e daꞌ mokuaꞌ.
pairs.target: But Jesus answered, “Let me at least do this”—and he touched his ear, and healed him.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ noh Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ pimipin-pimipin agama deꞌ ayuh, sidadu-sidadu deꞌ jaga Boli Topaꞌ duoh pimipin-pimipin Yahudi deꞌ suaꞌ odi kanoꞌ yaꞌ takap Odop-e, “Ulang jaꞌat keh Okuꞌ tih ngan ingan nog toban podang duoh pakung saꞌan takap Okuꞌ?
pairs.target: Jesus said to the chief priests, captains of the temple, and elders, who had come against him, “Have you come out as against a robber, with swords and clubs?

pairs.source: Bilang konu okuꞌ deꞌ awah Boli Topaꞌ, doiꞌ ingan odi takap Okuꞌ.  Pak-e moꞌ nog onu-e saꞌan ingan yaꞌ takap okuꞌ, onu Laja Muot kiloja.”
pairs.target: When I was with you in the temple daily, you didn’t stretch out your hands against me. But this is your hour, and the power of darkness.”

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ takap Yesus yomoꞌ toban keꞌ boli pimipin agama deꞌ paling ayuh-e, Petrus moꞌ nunaꞌ-e soꞌ juuaꞌ.
pairs.target: They seized him, and led him away, and brought him into the high priest’s house. But Peter followed from a distance.

pairs.source: Deꞌ uun limang boli pimipin agama inoh, ogiꞌ nyaꞌa nai opui daꞌ-e yomoꞌ Petrus moꞌ suaꞌ geh guluꞌ sinok nyaꞌa deꞌ bikuluk ngan-e ngunuh.
pairs.target: When they had kindled a fire in the middle of the courtyard, and had sat down together, Peter sat among them.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan kuli dayung kilin Petrus guluꞌ deꞌ bingon opui inoh, yoh moꞌ nakit-e ningaꞌ Petrus daang-e lasuꞌ nang in-e, “Nyaꞌa itih tuong ogiꞌ geh duoh Yesus ti-e neh!”
pairs.target: A certain servant girl saw him as he sat in the light, and looking intently at him, said, “This man also was with him.”

pairs.source: Pak-e Petrus lasuꞌ nang, “Doiꞌ leh! Idoh diꞌ kuꞌ piluh nyaꞌa inoh neh!”
pairs.target: He denied Jesus, saying, “Woman, I don’t know him.”

pairs.source: Diꞌ-e tui mokuaꞌ inoh, nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon lagiꞌ ningaꞌ Petrus yomoꞌ nang, “Muꞌu tuang lika bitunaꞌ-tunaꞌ geh duoh Nyaꞌa inoh!” Pak-e petrus nyawot nang, “Doiꞌ leh, idoh diꞌ-e okuꞌ neh!”
pairs.target: After a little while someone else saw him, and said, “You also are one of them!” But Peter answered, “Man, I am not!”

pairs.source: Kila-e niꞌ jam mokuaꞌ inoh, ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon lagi nokan sina-e, “Nyaꞌa inoh bih bonal pinunaꞌ Yesus, sobab yoh tuong nyaꞌa soꞌ Galilea geh!”
pairs.target: After about one hour passed, another confidently affirmed, saying, “Truly this man also was with him, for he is a Galilean!”

pairs.source: Pak-e Petrus moꞌ nyawot nang, “Oni bih deꞌ nang muꞌ neh, doiꞌ kuꞌ ngiloti-e!” Daang Petrus aluaꞌ sina siuak moꞌ bitadu.
pairs.target: But Peter said, “Man, I don’t know what you are talking about!” Immediately, while he was still speaking, a rooster crowed.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ kumiat ningaꞌ Petrus.  Mokuaꞌ inoh Petrus moꞌ lasuꞌ natong sina Topaꞌ tuduꞌ odop-e, “Aluaꞌ diꞌ siuak bitadu onu tih, ogiꞌ taluh sidoh muꞌu diꞌ muꞌ ngakuꞌ Okuꞌ neh.”
pairs.target: The Lord turned, and looked at Peter. Then Peter remembered the Lord’s word, how he said to him, “Before the rooster crows you will deny me three times.”

pairs.source: Petrus moꞌ lasuꞌ luah soꞌ kanoꞌ daang-e siꞌien ngilasod.
pairs.target: He went out, and wept bitterly.

pairs.source: Yomoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tukang jaga Yesus moꞌ ngatiaꞌ kaso Yesus simadi nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ biposud bipupuꞌ duoh-E.
pairs.target: The men who held Jesus mocked him and beat him.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ nutu boton-e pakai kain yomoꞌ sikian tuduꞌ-E, “Suba tanon, puꞌan Muꞌ kedoh keh nyaꞌa deꞌ mupuꞌ mosut Muꞌu?”
pairs.target: Having blindfolded him, they struck him on the face and asked him, “Prophesy! Who is the one who struck you?”

pairs.source: Yomoꞌ masam-masam geh in-e nguyat Yesus.
pairs.target: They spoke many other things against him, insulting him.

pairs.source: Sipagi-e, pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi, pimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh duoh gulu-gulu agama Yahudi bikuluk, nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ toban Yesus keꞌ Pengadilan Agama-e.
pairs.target: As soon as it was day, the assembly of the elders of the people were gathered together, both chief priests and scribes, and they led him away into their council, saying,

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ sina tuduꞌ Yesus, “Tanon tuduꞌ koꞌih, podo muꞌu tih Laja deꞌ janyi Topaꞌ?” Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Daang kuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan tuang idoh geh ingan bisayaꞌ-e.
pairs.target: “If you are the Christ, tell us.” But he said to them, “If I tell you, you won’t believe,

pairs.source: Yomoꞌ nyam Kuꞌ sikian tuduꞌ ingan tuang idoh geh diꞌ ingan laꞌan nyawot-e.
pairs.target: and if I ask, you will in no way answer me or let me go.

pairs.source: Pak-e soꞌ adin, Onak Manusia yaꞌ guluꞌ nuwaꞌ toꞌuh sinok Topaꞌ deꞌ Paling Bikuasa-E.”
pairs.target: From now on, the Son of Man will be seated at the right hand of the power of God.”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nang, “Moꞌ nyam-e in noh, muꞌu itih Onak Topaꞌ?” Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Odop ingan deꞌ nang in inoh neh.”
pairs.target: They all said, “Are you then the Son of God?” He said to them, “You say it, because I am.”

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nang, “Idoh tiyaꞌ diꞌ otoꞌ pilelu bukti, dop-e otoꞌ moꞌ ngojit lasuꞌ soꞌ bobaꞌ Odop-E.”
pairs.target: They said, “Why do we need any more witness? For we ourselves have heard from his own mouth!”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh susuaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ Pengadilan Agama inoh mokat mujuag, yoh moꞌ toban Yesus tuduꞌ Pilatus.
pairs.target: The whole company of them rose up and brought him before Pilate.

pairs.source: Danoꞌ susuaꞌ odop deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ napo Yesus, odop deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e, “Koꞌih dapod Nyaꞌa tih lawan kerajaan Roma, Iyoh tanon tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bangsa koꞌih, saꞌ-e jaman bayal suke tuduꞌ Kaisar duoh Yoh nang odop-e Laja deꞌ janyi Topaꞌ, Laja ulang Yahudi.”
pairs.target: They began to accuse him, saying, “We found this man perverting the nation, forbidding paying taxes to Caesar, and saying that he himself is Christ, a king.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh, Pilatus moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Yesus, “Podo bonal muꞌu Laja ulang Yahudi?” Yesus nyawot-e, “Odop ingan deꞌ nang in noh.”
pairs.target: Pilate asked him, “Are you the King of the Jews?” He answered him, “So you say.”

pairs.source: Pilatus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ pimipin-pimipin agama deꞌ ayuh duoh suaꞌ odop deꞌ munoꞌ, “Doiꞌ kuꞌ dapod oni salah nyaꞌa tih ngan kuꞌ ponai yaꞌ ngukum-e.”
pairs.target: Pilate said to the chief priests and the multitudes, “I find no basis for a charge against this man.”

pairs.source: Pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bitokan paksa Pilatus lagiꞌ, “Pak-e soꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal-e, yoh ngasut susuaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ Yudea; sibungas-e deꞌ Galilea, yoh moꞌ adin moꞌ nog katiꞌ.”
pairs.target: But they insisted, saying, “He stirs up the people, teaching throughout all Judea, beginning from Galilee even to this place.”

pairs.source: Takal Pilatus ngojit-e, yoh moꞌ sikian-e, “Podo nyaꞌa itih ulang Galilea?”
pairs.target: But when Pilate heard Galilee mentioned, he asked if the man was a Galilean.

pairs.source: Takal yoh puꞌan nang Yesus soꞌ pulow deꞌ mipin Herodes, Pilatus moꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ toban tuduꞌ Herodes, deꞌ takal noh boot-boot-e Herodes ogiꞌ deꞌ Yerusalem.
pairs.target: When he found out that he was in Herod’s jurisdiction, he sent him to Herod, who was also in Jerusalem during those days.

pairs.source: Herodes sonang otin-e takal-e kilin Yesus, sobab yoh moꞌ tui ngojit gah Yesus duoh yaꞌ ningaꞌ mun-e.  Yoh bialap yaꞌ ningaꞌ Yesus nai mukjizat.
pairs.target: Now when Herod saw Jesus, he was exceedingly glad, for he had wanted to see him for a long time, because he had heard many things about him. He hoped to see some miracle done by him.

pairs.source: Sobab inoh Herodes sikian bogoꞌ tuduꞌ-E, pak-e Yesus doiꞌ manah nyawot sina-e.
pairs.target: He questioned him with many words, but he gave no answers.

pairs.source: Takal inoh geh pimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh duoh gulu-gulu agama Yahudi masam-masam in-e napo Yesus.
pairs.target: The chief priests and the scribes stood, vehemently accusing him.

pairs.source: Herodes duoh sidadu-sidadu-e moꞌ ngunyak duoh nguyat Yesus, yomoꞌ odaꞌ sidadu-e sok jubah-e tuduꞌ Yesus, jubah deꞌ tok-tok mun sangon-e, mokuaꞌ inoh Herodes moꞌ daꞌ sidadu-e paliꞌ toban Yesus tuduꞌ Pilatus.
pairs.target: Herod with his soldiers humiliated him and mocked him. Dressing him in luxurious clothing, they sent him back to Pilate.

pairs.source: Daang onu inoh geh Herodes duoh Pilatus paliꞌ bidingan, deꞌ dioꞌ-e odop-e duwoh bitomi.
pairs.target: Herod and Pilate became friends with each other that very day, for before that they were enemies with each other.

pairs.source: Pilatus moꞌ nguluk pimipin-pimipin agama deꞌ ayuh, pimipin-pimipin Yahudi, duoh nyaꞌa bogoꞌ.
pairs.target: Pilate called together the chief priests, the rulers, and the people,

pairs.source: Yoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Ingan toban nyaꞌa itih tuduꞌ okuꞌ duoh napo nyaꞌa tih nang yoh ngasut rakyat.  Adin deꞌ sulung jowin ingan, okuꞌ moꞌ sikian Iyoh, pak-e doiꞌ kuꞌ dapod salah-e kodaꞌ deꞌ napo ingan tuduꞌ-e.
pairs.target: and said to them, “You brought this man to me as one that perverts the people, and behold, having examined him before you, I found no basis for a charge against this man concerning those things of which you accuse him.

pairs.source: Herodes tuong doiꞌ geh dapod salah nyaꞌa itih, sobab inoh iyoh paliꞌ Yesus tuduꞌ otoꞌ datiꞌ.  Niꞌ doiꞌ geh soꞌ salah deꞌ nai Yesus deꞌ patut odaꞌ Yoh obuah ukum kobos.
pairs.target: Neither has Herod, for I sent you to him, and see, nothing worthy of death has been done by him.

pairs.source: Sobab inohleh okuꞌ yaꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa mosut pijolaꞌ-e mokuaꞌ inoh pilopas-e.”
pairs.target: I will therefore chastise him and release him.”

pairs.source: Sobab bilang Onu Paskah, Pilatus halus pilopas niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa kaꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ,
pairs.target: Now he had to release one prisoner to them at the feast.

pairs.source: pak-e susuaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bikuluk danoꞌ moꞌ nang bogan-e, “Ngabos nyaꞌa inoh! Pilopas Barabas kaꞌan koꞌih!”
pairs.target: But they all cried out together, saying, “Away with this man! Release to us Barabbas!”—

pairs.source: (Barabas obuah jel luban-e yoh ngijaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ loꞌo deꞌ kota Yerusalem lawan plitah Roma duoh ngabos nyaꞌa.)
pairs.target: one who was thrown into prison for a certain revolt in the city, and for murder.

pairs.source: Pilatus yaꞌ pilopas Yesus, sobab inoh iyoh sina lagiꞌ dolas-dolas-e tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: Then Pilate spoke to them again, wanting to release Jesus,

pairs.source: Pak-e makin dolas geh nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ nang bogan-e, “Nyalip yoh noh! Nyalip yoh Noh!”
pairs.target: but they shouted, saying, “Crucify! Crucify him!”

pairs.source: Yomoꞌ saꞌan ketaluh sidoh-e Pilatus sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Pak-e oni salah deꞌ nai nyaꞌa itih? Doiꞌ kuꞌ dapod oni-oni salah deꞌ yaꞌ patut nyeꞌ odaꞌ Yoh obuah ukum ngabos! Sobab inohleh okuꞌ yaꞌ mosut pijolaꞌ-E, yoh moꞌ pilopas-e.”
pairs.target: He said to them the third time, “Why? What evil has this man done? I have found no capital crime in him. I will therefore chastise him and release him.”

pairs.source: Pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ makin dolas nang bogan-e odaꞌ Yesus obuah nyalip.  Nyuang-nyuang Pilatus nunaꞌ sijaꞌ sina nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: But they were urgent with loud voices, asking that he might be crucified. Their voices and the voices of the chief priests prevailed.

pairs.source: Lasuꞌ Pilatus ngin hukum ngabos deꞌ Yesus nunaꞌ oni in deꞌ nang nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: Pilate decreed that what they asked for should be done.

pairs.source: Yoh moꞌ pilopas Barabas kodaꞌ deꞌ mitiaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, deꞌ obuah jel sobab bogoꞌ salah-e duoh ngabos nyaꞌa.  Pilatus moꞌ ngin Yesus tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ daꞌ nai siwat-simun deꞌ laꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ tuduꞌ-E.
pairs.target: He released him who had been thrown into prison for insurrection and murder, for whom they asked, but he delivered Jesus up to their will.

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ toban Yesus.  Daang pimonu-e, bidapod duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ adon Simon soꞌ Kirene, deꞌ tuong-e yaꞌ molot keꞌ kota.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ gan salip noh deꞌ tun papi-e, odaꞌ yoh golong-e salip inoh gati Yesus.
pairs.target: When they led him away, they grabbed one Simon of Cyrene, coming from the country, and laid on him the cross, to carry it after Jesus.

pairs.source: Bogoꞌ nyaꞌa ponu nunaꞌ Yesus, soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan dayung deꞌ siꞌien masiꞌ ningaꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: A great multitude of the people followed him, including women who also mourned and lamented him.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ kumiat Yoh moꞌ sina, “Ingan dayung-dayung Yerusalem! Maꞌ ngan siꞌien saꞌan Okuꞌ.  Siꞌien leh saꞌan odop ingan duoh onak opot ingan.
pairs.target: But Jesus, turning to them, said, “Daughters of Jerusalem, don’t weep for me, but weep for yourselves and for your children.

pairs.source: Sobab yaꞌ nog onu-e ogiꞌ nyaꞌa yaꞌ nang, ‘Utung manah dayung deꞌ manang deꞌ doiꞌ onu-e ogiꞌ onak-e duoh siduaꞌ onak-e!’
pairs.target: For behold, the days are coming in which they will say, ‘Blessed are the barren, the wombs that never bore, and the breasts that never nursed.’

pairs.source: Sobab susah jolaꞌ deꞌ sikiya mun-e deꞌ pulow inoh, nyaꞌa deꞌ loꞌo danoꞌ moꞌ sina tuduꞌ dolod duoh punguꞌ, ‘Patuab mey nyonug leh koꞌih!’
pairs.target: Then they will begin to tell the mountains, ‘Fall on us!’ and tell the hills, ‘Cover us.’

pairs.source: Sobab nyam adin nyaꞌa ponai nai wat itih tuduꞌ tongon koyuh deꞌ idip, nyaꞌa yaꞌ nai lobih lagiꞌ soꞌ itih tuduꞌ tongon koyuh deꞌ kobos.”
pairs.target: For if they do these things in the green tree, what will be done in the dry?”

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ geh duwoh naꞌan ulang jaꞌat deꞌ toban odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ obuah ukum ngabos bibaya duoh Yesus.
pairs.target: There were also others, two criminals, led with him to be put to death.

pairs.source: Takal-e moꞌ nog tanaꞌ deꞌ adon-e Tikuluok, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nyalip Yesus bisamah duoh ulang jaꞌat deꞌ duwoh noh, niꞌ naꞌan nuwaꞌ boit-E, deꞌ niꞌ naꞌan kawa toꞌuh-e.
pairs.target: When they came to the place that is called The Skull, they crucified him there with the criminals, one on the right and the other on the left.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ lasuꞌ bidoa, “Samaꞌ, ngapunleh odop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ! Odop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ diꞌ puꞌan oniꞌ deꞌ nai-e.” Sidadu-sidadu deꞌ munoꞌ ngundi ngan-e yaꞌ kutung bojuh Yesus.
pairs.target: Jesus said, “Father, forgive them, for they don’t know what they are doing.” Dividing his garments among them, they cast lots.

pairs.source: Bogoꞌ nyaꞌa ningaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ jadin danoꞌ.  Pak-e ayua pimipin agama Yahudi sina ngine Yesus in-e, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon Yoh nyilamat-e: tanah saꞌ-e nyilamat odop-e, nyam yoh inoh tok Laja deꞌ janyi Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: The people stood watching. The rulers with them also scoffed at him, saying, “He saved others. Let him save himself, if this is the Christ of God, his chosen one!”

pairs.source: Sidadu-sidadu deꞌ munoꞌ ngatiaꞌ ngine Yesus.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nog ngin angul deꞌ masuam tuduꞌ-E
pairs.target: The soldiers also mocked him, coming to him and offering him vinegar,

pairs.source: simadi-e sina, “Moꞌ nyam Ingan tok Laja ulang Yahudi, nyilamat leh odop Ingan!”
pairs.target: and saying, “If you are the King of the Jews, save yourself!”

pairs.source: Deꞌ bung bak Yesus, ogiꞌ tulis deꞌ in-e: “Itihleh Laja ulang Yahudi.”
pairs.target: An inscription was also written over him in letters of Greek, Latin, and Hebrew: “THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS.”

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan ulang jaꞌat deꞌ obuah salip bisamah duoh Yesus, ngine Yesus.  Yoh sina in-e, “Nyam Muꞌu Laja Pinyilamat, nyilamat leh odop Muꞌ duoh koꞌih!”
pairs.target: One of the criminals who was hanged insulted him, saying, “If you are the Christ, save yourself and us!”

pairs.source: Pak-e niꞌ naꞌan ulang jaꞌat deꞌ nuwaꞌ kawa-e ngalah dingan-e, in-e, “Maꞌ nang inoh! Sipatut-e muꞌu tolu tuduꞌ Topaꞌ sobab muꞌu ulang jaꞌat tilimaꞌ ukum deꞌ samah duoh Iyoh.
pairs.target: But the other answered, and rebuking him said, “Don’t you even fear God, seeing you are under the same condemnation?

pairs.source: Otoꞌ duwoh tih deꞌ patut obuah ngukum odaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai toꞌ, pak-e Yoh diꞌ-e patut obuah ukum sobab Yoh doiꞌ salah-E.”
pairs.target: And we indeed justly, for we receive the due reward for our deeds, but this man has done nothing wrong.”

pairs.source: Yoh moꞌ nyamung sina-e, “Yesus, natongleh okuꞌ, takal Ingan nog jadin Laja!”
pairs.target: He said to Jesus, “Lord, remember me when you come into your Kingdom.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ muꞌu: Soꞌ onu itih muꞌu moꞌ bisamah-samah duoh Okuꞌ deꞌ sulga.”
pairs.target: Jesus said to him, “Assuredly I tell you, today you will be with me in Paradise.”

pairs.source: Kila-kila pukul simoong duwoh uun onu, susuaꞌ pulow inoh bilubah jadi mopung kodaꞌ onu ngalom nog pukul taluh ngumi.
pairs.target: It was now about the sixth hour, and darkness came over the whole land until the ninth hour.

pairs.source: Duoh tabial deꞌ daang Boli Topaꞌ totak tipiliaꞌ duwoh.
pairs.target: The sun was darkened, and the veil of the temple was torn in two.

pairs.source: Yomoꞌ Yesus nang sina deꞌ dolas-E, “Samaꞌ! Keꞌ daang tongan Ingan, Kuꞌ ngin asongKuꞌ!” Mokuaꞌ Yoh nang sina inoh, Yoh lasuꞌ kobos.
pairs.target: Jesus, crying with a loud voice, said, “Father, into your hands I commit my spirit!” Having said this, he breathed his last.

pairs.source: Takal pimipin sidadu noh ningaꞌ oni deꞌ moꞌ, jadi iyoh moꞌ mudi Topaꞌ.  Yoh moꞌ sina, “Bonal, nyaꞌa itih tok doiꞌ salah-e!”
pairs.target: When the centurion saw what was done, he glorified God, saying, “Certainly this was a righteous man.”

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa bogoꞌ deꞌ nog ningaꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ jadi.  Susuaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ paliꞌ daang otin deꞌ sukup masiꞌ-e.
pairs.target: All the multitudes that came together to see this, when they saw the things that were done, returned home beating their breasts.

pairs.source: Duoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ piluh Yesus, baya dayung-dayung deꞌ nunaꞌ Yoh soꞌ Galilea, ningaꞌ soꞌ juuaꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moh jadi.
pairs.target: All his acquaintances, and the women who followed with him from Galilee, stood at a distance, watching these things.
Behold, a man named Joseph, who was a member of the council, a good and righteous man

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ adon Yusuf deꞌ soꞌ kota Arimatea deꞌ propinsi Yudea, iyoh inoh nyaꞌa deꞌ paguh duoh deꞌ aluaꞌ kajon nog onu-e Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja deꞌ dunia.  Iyoh inoh anggota daang Pengadilan Agama Yahudi, pak-e yoh diꞌ-e situju duoh oniꞌ deꞌ nai nyaꞌa munoꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: (he had not consented to their counsel and deed), from Arimathaea, a city of the Jews, who was also waiting for God’s Kingdom:

pairs.source: Jadi takal Yesus moꞌ kobos, Yusuf moꞌ bigaut-biguaꞌ odi tuduꞌ Pilatus saꞌan-e mitiaꞌ todang Yesus.
pairs.target: this man went to Pilate, and asked for Jesus’ body.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh yoh moꞌ pimuun todang Yesus soꞌ koyuh salip, yoh moꞌ molut todang-e kai kain mopuꞌ.  Mokuaꞌ inoh iyoh piguling todang Yesus deꞌ kubul deꞌ obuah nai daang dolod batuh.  Kubul inoh aluaꞌ tiboon duoh aluaꞌ doiꞌ manah obuah pakai.
pairs.target: He took it down, and wrapped it in a linen cloth, and laid him in a tomb that was cut in stone, where no one had ever been laid.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ jadi daang onu limoh.  Takal gituang-e yaꞌ Onu Sabat.
pairs.target: It was the day of the Preparation, and the Sabbath was drawing near.

pairs.source: Dayung-dayung deꞌ nunaꞌ duoh Yesus soꞌ Galilea nunaꞌ Yusuf soꞌ juuaꞌ ngan-e yaꞌ ningaꞌ kubul Yesus duoh oniwat Yusuf posan todang Yesus daang kubul.
pairs.target: The women, who had come with him out of Galilee, followed after, and saw the tomb, and how his body was laid.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh dayung-dayung deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ paliꞌ keꞌ Yerusalem kaꞌan-e nyidia inyuaꞌ lona kaꞌan nginyuaꞌ todang Yesus.  Daang Onu Sabat, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ loꞌo soꞌ kiloja-e saꞌan-e taat tuduꞌ ukum agama-e.
pairs.target: They returned, and prepared spices and ointments. On the Sabbath they rested according to the commandment.

pairs.source: Daang onu Minggu, suom-suom pagi-e dayung-dayung deꞌ munoꞌ odi keꞌ kubul.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ toban inyuaꞌ lona deꞌ moꞌ sidia-e.
pairs.target: But on the first day of the week, at early dawn, they and some others came to the tomb, bringing the spices which they had prepared.

pairs.source: Takal-e nog keꞌ kubul inoh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ batuh deꞌ pakai-e kuab kubul inoh moꞌ tiligian soꞌ lubang kubul.
pairs.target: They found the stone rolled away from the tomb.

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ molot kaang kubul inoh pak-e todang Yesus moꞌ doiꞌ daang-e.
pairs.target: They entered in, and didn’t find the Lord Jesus’ body.

pairs.source: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ aluaꞌ mujuag daang-e ilan ningaꞌ oni deꞌ jadi danoꞌ, tang-tang sijaꞌ-e duwoh naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ bikilap jaꞌ-e pimakai-e mujuag sinok odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: While they were greatly perplexed about this, behold, two men stood by them in dazzling clothing.

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ obuaꞌ tolu daang-e bikunyug keꞌ tanaꞌ.  Nyaꞌa inoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Dusah negeh ingan kalik nyaꞌa deꞌ idip daang uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos!
pairs.target: Becoming terrified, they bowed their faces down to the earth. They said to them, “Why do you seek the living among the dead?

pairs.source: Yesus doiꞌ datiꞌ.  Iyoh moꞌ paliꞌ idip! Natong ingan kedoh oni deꞌ moꞌ tanon-e deꞌ ingan takal-e aluaꞌ deꞌ Galilea?
pairs.target: He isn’t here, but is risen. Remember what he told you when he was still in Galilee,

pairs.source: Takal Yesus nang, ‘Okuꞌ Onak Manusia halus yaꞌ obuah nyelah keꞌ tongan nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa duoh Okuꞌ halus obuah nyalip, pak-e Okuꞌ paliꞌ idip baꞌuh lagiꞌ daang onu ke taluh-e.’”
pairs.target: saying that the Son of Man must be delivered up into the hands of sinful men, and be crucified, and the third day rise again?”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh dayung-dayung deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ lasuꞌ natong sina Yesus inoh.
pairs.target: They remembered his words,

pairs.source: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ paliꞌ soꞌ kubul inoh, dayung-dayung deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ lasuꞌ tanon suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ tuduꞌ ke simoong niꞌ naꞌan rasul duoh pinunaꞌ deꞌ bokon.
pairs.target: returned from the tomb, and told all these things to the eleven, and to all the rest.

pairs.source: Dayung-dayung deꞌ tanon oniꞌ deꞌ moh ningaꞌ-e inoh iohleh Maria Magdalena, Yohana duoh Maria sinoꞌ Yakobus, baya dayung-dayung deꞌ bokon deꞌ suaꞌ odi duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: Now they were Mary Magdalene, Joanna, and Mary the mother of James. The other women with them told these things to the apostles.

pairs.source: Pak-e rasul-rasul deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ silita dayung deꞌ munoꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ pikil nang dayung deꞌ munoꞌ madas nang koyuh adoh.
pairs.target: These words seemed to them to be nonsense, and they didn’t believe them.

pairs.source: Pak-e Petrus mokat mujuag yoh moꞌ bikoduh keꞌ kubul inoh.  Iyoh ningaꞌ keꞌ daang lubang kubul inoh, jok-e kilin kain deꞌ pakai nyaꞌa molut Yesus deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ.  Petrus moꞌ buꞌu paliꞌ daang-e bipikil, ilan oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ jadi deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: But Peter got up and ran to the tomb. Stooping and looking in, he saw the strips of linen lying by themselves, and he departed to his home, wondering what had happened.

pairs.source: Daang onu inoh geh, duwoh naꞌan pinunaꞌ Yesus ponu keꞌ kupuaꞌ Emaus deꞌ sikital simoong niꞌ kilometer soꞌ Yerusalem.
pairs.target: Behold, two of them were going that very day to a village named Emmaus, which was sixty stadia from Jerusalem.

pairs.source: Daang-e ponu odop-e deꞌ duwoh noh kilakal suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ jadi.
pairs.target: They talked with each other about all of these things which had happened.

pairs.source: Takal odop-e deꞌ duwoh noh kilakal, Yesus moꞌ nog ponu bibaya duoh-e.
pairs.target: While they talked and questioned together, Jesus himself came near, and went with them.

pairs.source: Soꞌ duwoh odop-e kilin Yesus pak-e ogiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ daꞌ odop-e duwoh inoh diꞌ-e piluh-e.
pairs.target: But their eyes were kept from recognizing him.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e duwoh, “Oni leh deꞌ kilakal ingan neh?” Yomoꞌ soꞌ duwoh odop-e moꞌ tog mun-e loꞌo daang susah otin-e.
pairs.target: He said to them, “What are you talking about as you walk, and are sad?”

pairs.source: Niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ duwoh noh adon-e Kleopas, sikian tuduꞌ Yesus, “Podo jok-e Ingan binua deꞌ Yerusalem, deꞌ diꞌ puꞌan oni deꞌ moꞌ jadi datiꞌ baꞌuh-baꞌuh tih?”
pairs.target: One of them, named Cleopas, answered him, “Are you the only stranger in Jerusalem who doesn’t know the things which have happened there in these days?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ sikian, “Oni deꞌ jadi neh?” Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-e, “Oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ jadi tuduꞌ Yesus nyaꞌa deꞌ soꞌ Nazaret inoh.  Iyoh inoh nabi.  Sina duoh oniꞌ deꞌ nai-e suaꞌ-e bikuasa, paguh duoh bonal deꞌ sulung jowin Topaꞌ duoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa.
pairs.target: He said to them, “What things?” They said to him, “The things concerning Jesus, the Nazarene, who was a prophet mighty in deed and word before God and all the people;

pairs.source: Pimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh duoh pimipin bangsa toꞌ nyelah yoh saꞌ-e obuah ngukum ngabos, yomoꞌ nyalip-E.
pairs.target: and how the chief priests and our rulers delivered him up to be condemned to death, and crucified him.

pairs.source: Pak-e koꞌih bialap nang Iyoh deꞌ yaꞌ pilopas bangsa Israel.  Duoh onu tih iyohleh onu ke taluh-e soꞌ takal suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ jadi.
pairs.target: But we were hoping that it was he who would redeem Israel. Yes, and besides all this, it is now the third day since these things happened.

pairs.source: Pak-e kudu-kudu naꞌan-e soꞌ dayung uluk koꞌih ngoꞌgoh koꞌih, Pagia-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ odi keꞌ kubul,
pairs.target: Also, certain women of our company amazed us, having arrived early at the tomb;

pairs.source: pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e dapod todang Yesus.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nog yoh moꞌ kilakal oniꞌ deꞌ ningaꞌ-e tuduꞌ koꞌih nog odop-e bitapod duoh malaikat.  Malaikat inoh tanon nang Yesus idip.
pairs.target: and when they didn’t find his body, they came saying that they had also seen a vision of angels, who said that he was alive.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh kudu-kudu naꞌan dingan koꞌih moꞌ odi keꞌ kubul.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ ningaꞌ nang suaꞌ oniꞌ samah kodaꞌ deꞌ tanon dayung deꞌ munoꞌ, pak-e Yesus doiꞌ yoh kilin-e neh.”
pairs.target: Some of us went to the tomb, and found it just like the women had said, but they didn’t see him.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Tok budua ingan deꞌ mutiꞌ neh! Sikiya lamat ingan yaꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ tanon nabi-nabi!
pairs.target: He said to them, “Foolish men, and slow of heart to believe in all that the prophets have spoken!

pairs.source: Laja Pinyilamat halus susah jolaꞌ dioꞌ ke Yoh obuah pakat jadin Laja deꞌ tun suaꞌ oniꞌ.”
pairs.target: Didn’t the Christ have to suffer these things and to enter into his glory?”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ tanon-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ duwoh noh oni deꞌ obuah nulis daang susuaꞌ Kitab tentang odop-E, soꞌ takal buk-buk Musa duoh buk nabi-nabi.
pairs.target: Beginning from Moses and from all the prophets, he explained to them in all the Scriptures the things concerning himself.

pairs.source: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sinok-e yaꞌ nog keꞌ kupuaꞌ Emaus.  Yesus singaji-e mun nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ pilasuꞌ pimonu-e.
pairs.target: They came near to the village, where they were going, and he acted like he would go further.

pairs.source: Pak-e odop-e deꞌ duwoh noh odaꞌ Yesus loꞌo duoh odop-e, in-e, “Loꞌo negeh duoh koꞌih sobab onu tuong moꞌ ngalom geh.” Yomoꞌ Yesus moꞌ molot nglumon duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: They urged him, saying, “Stay with us, for it is almost evening, and the day is almost over.” He went in to stay with them.

pairs.source: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ guluꞌ man, Yesus moꞌ mit kueh deꞌ ayuh kiping-e yomoꞌ bisukul tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, mokuaꞌ inoh Yoh piliaꞌ-piliaꞌ kueh inoh kaꞌan-e ngin tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: When he had sat down at the table with them, he took the bread and gave thanks. Breaking it, he gave it to them.

pairs.source: Takal inoh nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngoon-e nang inoh Yesus, pak-e Yesus moꞌ musuap soꞌ jowin odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: Their eyes were opened, and they recognized him, and he vanished out of their sight.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ duwoh noh moꞌ lasuꞌ nang, “Takal Iyoh sina simadi-e tanon isiꞌ Kitab tuduꞌ koꞌih deꞌ olan, otin koꞌih kan-e sukup nyam sonang-e.”
pairs.target: They said to one another, “Weren’t our hearts burning within us, while he spoke to us along the way, and while he opened the Scriptures to us?”

pairs.source: Takal inoh odop-e deꞌ duwoh inoh lasuꞌ mokat piet odop-e paliꞌ keꞌ Yerusalem.  Danoꞌ odop-e deꞌ duwoh noh dapod pinunaꞌ Yesus deꞌ simoong niꞌ naꞌan inoh moꞌ tikuluꞌ duoh dingan-dingan-e deꞌ bokon.
pairs.target: They rose up that very hour, returned to Jerusalem, and found the eleven gathered together, and those who were with them,

pairs.source: Yomoꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus tanon tuduꞌ duwoh naꞌan nyaꞌa inoh ti-e, “Yesus tok moꞌ paliꞌ idip.  Iyoh bitanga odop-e tuduꞌ Simon.”
pairs.target: saying, “The Lord is risen indeed, and has appeared to Simon!”

pairs.source: Soꞌ duwoh pinunaꞌ Yesus deꞌ tuang-e nog noh moꞌ lasuꞌ silita oni deꞌ jadi deꞌ odop-e daang olan-e takal yaꞌ odi keꞌ kota Emaus duoh watki wat-e paliꞌ piluh Yesus, takal Yesus piliaꞌ kueh.
pairs.target: They related the things that happened along the way, and how he was recognized by them in the breaking of the bread.

pairs.source: Daang odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ aluaꞌ kilakal, tang-tang jaꞌ-e Yesus mujuag deꞌ uun odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ simadi-e nang, “Sonangleh ingan!”
pairs.target: As they said these things, Jesus himself stood among them, and said to them, “Peace be to you.”

pairs.source: Pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-e deꞌ munoꞌ obuaꞌ gogoh duoh tolu, baꞌ-e nang inoh munua.
pairs.target: But they were terrified and filled with fear, and supposed that they had seen a spirit.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Oni ingan diꞌ bisayaꞌ daang otin ingan? Oni deꞌ soꞌ ingan tolu?
pairs.target: He said to them, “Why are you troubled? Why do doubts arise in your hearts?

pairs.source: Ningaꞌ tongan duoh poꞌon Kuꞌ, Okuꞌ leh itih! Tomaꞌ duoh ningaꞌ nyeꞌ, munua doiꞌ tulang duoh isin-e kodaꞌ deꞌ ningaꞌ ingan deꞌ Okuꞌ tih.”
pairs.target: See my hands and my feet, that it is truly me. Touch me and see, for a spirit doesn’t have flesh and bones, as you see that I have.”

pairs.source: Yesus sina inoh simadi-E bitanga tongan duoh poꞌon-E tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: When he had said this, he showed them his hands and his feet.

pairs.source: Pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ, sobab sikiya munuas duoh ilan, saꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ dapod bisayaꞌ Yesus moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Podo ogiꞌ pinguman ingan?”
pairs.target: While they still didn’t believe for joy, and wondered, he said to them, “Do you have anything here to eat?”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngin niꞌ polong ikian deꞌ moꞌ masak-e tuduꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: They gave him a piece of a broiled fish and some honeycomb.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ mit ikian inoh yomoꞌ lasuꞌ man-e deꞌ jowin nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: He took them, and ate in front of them.

pairs.source: Yesus sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Itihleh deꞌ tanon Kuꞌ deꞌ ingan takal Kuꞌ aluaꞌ duoh ingan.  Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ obuah nulis tentang Okuꞌ daang buk-buk deꞌ nulis Musa duoh buk nabi-nabi, duoh Mazmur halus jadi.”
pairs.target: He said to them, “This is what I told you, while I was still with you, that all things which are written in the law of Moses, the prophets, and the psalms, concerning me must be fulfilled.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ tulung odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ saꞌ-e ngiloti Kitab.
pairs.target: Then he opened their minds, that they might understand the Scriptures.

pairs.source: Iyoh sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Daang Kitab moꞌ obuaꞌ nulis nang, Laja deꞌ janyi Topaꞌ inoh halus susah jolaꞌ duoh yaꞌ paliꞌ idip soꞌ kobos-e daang onu ke taluh.
pairs.target: He said to them, “Thus it is written, and thus it was necessary for the Christ to suffer and to rise from the dead the third day,

pairs.source: Duoh deꞌ daang adon Laja Pinyilamat inoh, ingan yaꞌ tanon gah silamat tuduꞌ susuaꞌ bangsa mulai soꞌ Yerusalem nang nyam basa nyaꞌa bitobat Topaꞌ ngapun dosa-e.
pairs.target: and that repentance and remission of sins should be preached in his name to all the nations, beginning at Jerusalem.

pairs.source: Ingan deꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ jadi deꞌ munoꞌ, ingan geh deꞌ halus tanon gah inoh tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon.
pairs.target: You are witnesses of these things.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ geh yaꞌ pait tuduꞌ ingan oni deꞌ moꞌ janyi Topaꞌ Samaꞌ Kuꞌ.  Pak-e ingan halus kajon deꞌ kota itih nog kuasa deꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ muun tun ingan.”
pairs.target: Behold, I send out the promise of my Father on you. But wait in the city of Jerusalem until you are clothed with power from on high.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus toban odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ keꞌ sopaꞌ kota Yerusalem keꞌ kupuaꞌ Betania.  Danoꞌ iyoh moꞌ kakat tongan-e yomoꞌ bilokat odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: He led them out as far as Bethany, and he lifted up his hands, and blessed them.

pairs.source: Daang-E aluaꞌ bilokat odop-e munoꞌ, Yoh moꞌ tipakat-tilununk keꞌ sulga yomoꞌ bipisah duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: While he blessed them, he withdrew from them, and was carried up into heaven.

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bikunyug nyomah Yoh, yomoꞌ paliꞌ keꞌ Yerusalem daang otin deꞌ sonang manah-manah-e,
pairs.target: They worshiped him, and returned to Jerusalem with great joy,

pairs.source: duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ silalu mudi Topaꞌ deꞌ awah Boli Topaꞌ.     GAH DEꞌ PAGUH DEꞌ TANON YOHANES
pairs.target: and were continually in the temple, praising and blessing God. Amen.

pairs.source: Takal dunia aluaꞌ doiꞌ, Pingunang Topaꞌ moꞌ dioꞌ ogiꞌ.  Pingunang Topaꞌ samah-samah duoh Topaꞌ, Pingunang inoh odop Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.

pairs.source: Soꞌ sibungas-e Pingunang inoh samah-samah duoh Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: The same was in the beginning with God.

pairs.source: Pingunang inoh leh deꞌ nai suaꞌ oniꞌ odaꞌ ogiꞌ duoh moꞌ-e doiꞌ Pingunang inoh, doiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ dunia itih deꞌ obuah nai.
pairs.target: All things were made through him. Without him was not anything made that has been made.

pairs.source: Daang Pingunang inoh ogiꞌ idip, idip inoh leh deꞌ ngin jawaꞌ tuduꞌ manusia.
pairs.target: In him was life, and the life was the light of men.

pairs.source: Telang inoh jawaꞌ daang mopung, oniꞌ deꞌ mopung diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ ponai mulaꞌ jawaꞌ inoh.
pairs.target: The light shines in the darkness, and the darkness hasn’t overcome  it.

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ pait Topaꞌ deꞌ adon-e Yohanes, iyoh inoh tukang baptis nyaꞌa.
pairs.target: There came a man, sent from God, whose name was John.

pairs.source: Iyoh nog jadin tukang tanon, iyoh tanon tentang jawaꞌ inoh, saꞌ soꞌ iyoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa jadin bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ jawaꞌ inoh.
pairs.target: The same came as a witness, that he might testify about the light, that all might believe through him.

pairs.source: Odop iyoh inoh idoh diꞌ-e jawaꞌ inoh, iyoh jok-e tukang magah tentang jawaꞌ inoh.
pairs.target: He was not the light, but was sent that he might testify about the light.

pairs.source: Jawaꞌ deꞌ sibonal-e deꞌ ngin jawaꞌ tuduꞌ manusia, adin nog kaang dunia.
pairs.target: The true light that enlightens everyone was coming into the world.

pairs.source: Pingunang inoh moꞌ ogiꞌ daang dunia duoh Iyoh deꞌ nai dunia, pak-e dunia diꞌ-e piluh-E.
pairs.target: He was in the world, and the world was made through him, and the world didn’t recognize him.

pairs.source: Iyoh nog tuduꞌ bangsa odop-E, pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ niꞌ bangsa duoh-E doliaꞌ-e tilimaꞌ-E.
pairs.target: He came to his own, and those who were his own didn’t receive him.

pairs.source: Pak-e suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tilimaꞌ Iyoh, Iyoh ngin kuasa tuduꞌ-e, saꞌ-e jadin onak-onak Topaꞌ.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ jadin onak-onak Topaꞌ iyohleh nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ daang adon-E.
pairs.target: But as many as received him, to them he gave the right to become God’s children, to those who believe in his name:

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa dapod jadin onak-onak Topaꞌ idoh diꞌ-e ngan iyoh obuah bilanak soꞌ sinoꞌ-e, idoh diꞌ-e soꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ laꞌan odop manusia, idoh geh diꞌ-e nunaꞌ daang pikil manusia, pak-e odop Topaꞌ sadiꞌ-E deꞌ odaꞌ yoh jadin onak-onak-E.
pairs.target: who were born not of blood, nor of the will of the flesh, nor of the will of man, but of God.

pairs.source: Pingunang inoh moꞌ obuah milaꞌ jadin manusia duoh moꞌ loꞌo daang uluk otoꞌ.  Otoꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ kuasa-E deꞌ ayuh.  Topaꞌ Samaꞌ deꞌ ngin kuasa-E deꞌ ayuh inoh tuduꞌ-E dop-e Iyoh inoh Onak Topaꞌ Samaꞌ deꞌ Jok-e Niꞌ.  Otin Topaꞌ deꞌ Paguh duoh suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ bonal tentang Topaꞌ ogiꞌ daang idip Iyoh.
pairs.target: The Word became flesh, and lived among us. We saw his glory, such glory as of the one and only Son of the Father, full of grace and truth.

pairs.source: Yohanes Pembaptis moꞌ silita tentang Iyoh, in-e daang-e luꞌow-luꞌow-e, “Itih leh odop-E deꞌ nang kuꞌ: Mokuaꞌ okuꞌ, ke Iyoh nog, pak-e Iyoh lobih penting soꞌ okuꞌ, dop-e takal okuꞌ aluaꞌ doiꞌ, Iyoh moꞌ bilasa ogiꞌ.”
pairs.target: John testified about him. He cried out, saying, “This was he of whom I said, ‘He who comes after me has surpassed me, for he was before me.’”

pairs.source: Dop-e Otin-E deꞌ sukup Paguh, Iyoh diꞌ-e mokuaꞌ-mokuaꞌ bilokat otoꞌ.
pairs.target: From his fullness we all received grace upon grace.

pairs.source: Topaꞌ ngin atulan-atulan-E tuduꞌ otoꞌ pakai nabi Musa.  Pak-e Topaꞌ ngin bilokat duoh oniꞌ deꞌ bonal pakai Yesus Kristus.
pairs.target: For the law was given through Moses. Grace and truth were realized through Jesus Christ.

pairs.source: Niꞌ naꞌan tuang doiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ sidoh-e kilin Topaꞌ.  Onak Topaꞌ deꞌ jok-e niꞌ, odop-E inoh sadiꞌ-E Topaꞌ duoh silalu ogiꞌ deꞌ otin Topaꞌ Samaꞌ.  Jok-e Iyoh deꞌ moꞌ bitanga Topaꞌ Samaꞌ tuduꞌ otoꞌ.
pairs.target: No one has seen God at any time. The one and only Son, who is in the bosom of the Father, he has declared him.

pairs.source: Itih leh in silita Yohanes pembaptis takal ulang Yahudi soꞌ Yerusalem pait kudu-kudu naꞌan pimipin agama duoh ulang-ulang Lewi nog sikian tuduꞌ odop-e, “Osi sibonal-e ingan itih?”
pairs.target: This is John’s testimony, when the Jews sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him, “Who are you?”

pairs.source: Iyoh ngakuꞌ-e duoh diꞌ-e pibulaꞌ, iyoh moꞌ in-e, “Okuꞌ idoh diꞌ-e Laja Pinyilamat.”
pairs.target: He declared, and didn’t deny, but he declared, “I am not the Christ.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ sikian lagiꞌ tuduꞌ-e, “Moꞌ-e wat inoh, osi mey ingan tih neh? Podo ingan tih Elia?” Yohanes moꞌ nyawot-e in-e, “Idoh!” “Podo ingan Nabi deꞌ kajon koꞌih inoh?” Yohanes moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Idoh!”
pairs.target: They asked him, “What then? Are you Elijah?” He said, “I am not.” “Are you the prophet?” He answered, “No.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ Yohanes, “Osi mey ingan itih neh? Dop-e koꞌih halus tanon tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ pait koꞌih, oni in sawot deꞌ tanon ingan.  Oni mey in ingan nang odop ingan?”
pairs.target: They said therefore to him, “Who are you? Give us an answer to take back to those who sent us. What do you say about yourself?”

pairs.source: Yohanes moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Okuꞌ leh nyaꞌa deꞌ tanon Nabi Yesaya deꞌ nang-e: ‘Ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ luꞌow-luꞌow sina deꞌ padang pasil: Nongon leh olan saꞌan Topaꞌ!’ ”
pairs.target: He said, “I am the voice of one crying in the wilderness, ‘Make straight the way of the Lord,’ as Isaiah the prophet said.”

pairs.source: Soꞌ odop-e deꞌ obuah pait inoh ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ soꞌ uluk ulang Farisi.
pairs.target: The ones who had been sent were from the Pharisees.

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ sikian tuduꞌ-e, “Oni nai ingan baptis nyaꞌa, moꞌ diꞌ ingan Laja Pinyilamat, diꞌ-e Elia, duoh diꞌ-e Nabi deꞌ yaꞌ nog?”
pairs.target: They asked him, “Why then do you baptize, if you are not the Christ, nor Elijah, nor the prophet?”

pairs.source: Yohanes nyawot odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ in-e, “Okuꞌ baptis nyaꞌa pakai piꞌin; pak-e deꞌ uun ingan, ogiꞌ Iyoh deꞌ mujuag deꞌ diꞌ ingan piluh osi Iyoh sibonal-e,
pairs.target: John answered them, “I baptize in water, but among you stands one whom you don’t know.

pairs.source: Iyoh nog mokuaꞌ okuꞌ.  Bukaꞌ tolin kasut-E tuang doiꞌ geh nyam kuꞌ patut.”
pairs.target: He is the one who comes after me, who is preferred before me, whose sandal strap I’m not worthy to loosen.”

pairs.source: Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ jadi deꞌ kota Betania, deꞌ polad sungi Yordan, topat soꞌ Yohanes baptis nyaꞌa.
pairs.target: These things were done in Bethany beyond the Jordan, where John was baptizing.

pairs.source: Tiaꞌ pagi-e, Yohanes Pembaptis ningaꞌ Yesus nog tuduꞌ odop-e.  Yohanes moꞌ in-e, “Ningaꞌ leh Onak Domba Topaꞌ deꞌ ngisuꞌ dosa dunia.
pairs.target: The next day, he saw Jesus coming to him, and said, “Behold, the Lamb of God, who takes away the sin of the world!

pairs.source: Iyoh inoh leh deꞌ nang kuꞌ: Mokuaꞌ soꞌ okuꞌ, ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ nog deꞌ lobih penting soꞌ okuꞌ, dop-e Iyoh moꞌ bilasa ogiꞌ takal okuꞌ aluaꞌ doiꞌ.
pairs.target: This is he of whom I said, ‘After me comes a man who is preferred before me, for he was before me.’

pairs.source: Deꞌ dioꞌ okuꞌ tuang idoh geh diꞌ kuꞌ puꞌan tentang Iyoh inoh, pak-e adin okuꞌ moꞌ puꞌan-e.  Yoh leh ngan okuꞌ nog duoh baptis nyaꞌa pakai piꞌin, saꞌ bangsa Israel piluh Iyoh.”
pairs.target: I didn’t know him, but for this reason I came baptizing in water: that he would be revealed to Israel.”

pairs.source: Yohanes moꞌ silita nang in-e, “Okuꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ muun soꞌ longit kodaꞌ manuk asang, yohmoꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ inoh loꞌo daꞌ-E.
pairs.target: John testified, saying, “I have seen the Spirit descending like a dove out of heaven, and it remained on him.

pairs.source: Takal inoh okuꞌ aluaꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ puꞌan tentang osi odop-E, pak-e Topaꞌ deꞌ pait okuꞌ odaꞌ baptis pakai piꞌin, in-e tuduꞌ okuꞌ: ‘Moꞌ muꞌ ningaꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ muun deꞌ tun Nyaꞌa inoh, Iyoh inoh leh deꞌ yaꞌ baptis nyaꞌa pakai Iyang Topaꞌ.’
pairs.target: I didn’t recognize him, but he who sent me to baptize in water, he said to me, ‘On whomever you will see the Spirit descending, and remaining on him, the same is he who baptizes in the Holy Spirit.’

pairs.source: Odop kuꞌ deꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ Iyoh, okuꞌ moꞌ tanon nang: Iyoh itih leh Onak Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: I have seen, and have testified that this is the Son of God.”

pairs.source: Tiaꞌ pagi-e Yohanes Pembaptis odi lagiꞌ keꞌ topat inoh samah-samah duoh pinunaꞌ-e duwoh naꞌan.
pairs.target: Again, the next day, John was standing with two of his disciples,

pairs.source: Takal Yohanes ningaꞌ Yesus ngilusuꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, iyoh moꞌ in-e, “Ningaꞌ! Inoh leh Onak Domba Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: and he looked at Jesus as he walked, and said, “Behold, the Lamb of God!”

pairs.source: Soꞌ duwoh pinunaꞌ Yohanes ngojit oni deꞌ nang-e inoh, yoh moꞌ odi nunaꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: The two disciples heard him speak, and they followed Jesus.

pairs.source: Pak-e Yesus moꞌ kumiat keꞌ dug-E.  Iyoh ningaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bitunaꞌ duoh odop-E, Iyoh moꞌ in-e, “Oni nai ingan nunaꞌ Okuꞌ?” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ-E, “Rabi (loti-e: Gulu), daki soꞌ Ingan loꞌo?”
pairs.target: Jesus turned, and saw them following, and said to them, “What are you looking for?” They said to him, “Rabbi” (which is to say, being interpreted, Teacher), “where are you staying?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Jaꞌ nunaꞌ Okuꞌ, saꞌ ingan ningaꞌ-e.” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nunaꞌ Yesus duoh ningaꞌ daki soꞌ-E loꞌo.  Takal inoh kila-kila aluaꞌ pukul pat ngumi.  Onu inoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ loꞌo duoh Yesus.
pairs.target: He said to them, “Come, and see.” They came and saw where he was staying, and they stayed with him that day. It was about the tenth hour.

pairs.source: Niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ odop-e deꞌ duwoh deꞌ ngojit sina Yohanes yohmoꞌ nunaꞌ Yesus yoh inoh Andreas, sudiꞌ Simon Petrus.
pairs.target: One of the two who heard John, and followed him, was Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother.

pairs.source: Likas-likas Andreas kalik Simon, sikiaꞌ-e inoh, iyoh moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ Simon, “Koꞌih moꞌ bitapod duoh Mesias!” (Mesias deꞌ nang-e geh Kristus, loti-e Laja Pinyilamat.)
pairs.target: He first found his own brother, Simon, and said to him, “We have found the Messiah!” (which is, being interpreted, Christ).

pairs.source: Andreas moꞌ toban Simon tuduꞌ Yesus.  Yesus moꞌ ngiduang-e, Iyoh moꞌ sina, “Muꞌu Simon, onak Yohanes (Idoh diꞌ-e Yohanes Pembaptis), muꞌu yaꞌ adon Kefas.” (Kefas deꞌ nang-e geh Petrus, loti-e ‘dolod batuh’.)
pairs.target: He brought him to Jesus. Jesus looked at him, and said, “You are Simon the son of Jonah. You shall be called Cephas” (which is by interpretation, Peter).

pairs.source: Onu tiaꞌ pagi-e, Yesus motod nang odop-E odi keꞌ Galilea.  Iyoh bitapod duoh Filipus yohmoꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, “Jaꞌ nunaꞌ Okuꞌ!”
pairs.target: On the next day, he was determined to go out into Galilee, and he found Philip. Jesus said to him, “Follow me.”

pairs.source: Filipus, nyaꞌa soꞌ Betsaida, kota soꞌ Andreas duoh Petrus loꞌo.
pairs.target: Now Philip was from Bethsaida, of the city of Andrew and Peter.

pairs.source: Filipus bitapod duoh Natanael, iyoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, “Koꞌih moꞌ bitapod duoh Iyoh deꞌ sobot Musa daang Buk-e deꞌ nulis-e duoh deꞌ tanon bala nabi.  Iyoh inoh Yesus soꞌ Nazaret, onak Yusuf.”
pairs.target: Philip found Nathanael, and said to him, “We have found him, of whom Moses in the law, and the prophets, wrote: Jesus of Nazareth, the son of Joseph.”

pairs.source: Pak-e Natanael moꞌ in-e, “Diꞌ patut ogiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ paguh nog soꞌ Nazaret!”
pairs.target: Nathanael said to him, “Can any good thing come out of Nazareth?” Philip said to him, “Come and see.”

pairs.source: “Jaꞌ leh toꞌ ningaꞌ-E.” In Filipus.  Takal Yesus ningaꞌ Natanael nog tuduꞌ odop-E.  Yesus moꞌ sobot tentang Natanael in-E, “Ningaꞌ itih leh nyaꞌa deꞌ bonal-bonal ulang Israel, doiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ palsu daꞌ-e.”
pairs.target: Jesus saw Nathanael coming to him, and said about him, “Behold, an Israelite indeed, in whom is no deceit!”

pairs.source: Natanael moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ Yesus, “Wat ki Ingan ponai puꞌan okuꞌ?” Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Takal Filipus aluaꞌ diꞌ-e mogan muꞌu, Okuꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ muꞌu deꞌ libuaꞌ tongon ara.”
pairs.target: Nathanael said to him, “How do you know me?” Jesus answered him, “Before Philip called you, when you were under the fig tree, I saw you.”

pairs.source: Natanael moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ-E, “Gulu, Ingan Onak Topaꞌ, Ingan Laja ulang Israel!”
pairs.target: Nathanael answered him, “Rabbi, you are the Son of God! You are King of Israel!”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Dop-e Okuꞌ sina tuduꞌ muꞌu, Okuꞌ ningaꞌ muꞌu deꞌ libuaꞌ tongon ara, podo inoh deꞌ odaꞌ muꞌu bisayaꞌ? Muꞌu yaꞌ ningaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ lobih ayuh soꞌ inoh.”
pairs.target: Jesus answered him, “Because I told you, ‘I saw you underneath the fig tree,’ do you believe? You will see greater things than these!”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ-e, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ muꞌu bonal-bonal, muꞌu yaꞌ ningaꞌ longit tibukaꞌ duoh malaikat-malaikat Topaꞌ maꞌad muun tuduꞌ Onak Manusia.”
pairs.target: He said to him, “Most certainly, I tell you all, hereafter you will see heaven opened, and the angels of God ascending and descending on the Son of Man.”

pairs.source: Duwoh onu mokuaꞌ inoh ogiꞌ biluman kawin daang kota Kana deꞌ propinsi Galilea, sinoꞌ Yesus ogiꞌ danoꞌ.
pairs.target: The third day, there was a marriage in Cana of Galilee. Jesus’ mother was there.

pairs.source: Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E obuah ngunang deꞌ biluman kawin inoh.
pairs.target: Jesus also was invited, with his disciples, to the marriage.

pairs.source: Takal tuak anggul ngan nyaꞌa biluman inoh moꞌ obuaꞌ nuak nyaꞌa, sinoꞌ Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ Yesus, “Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ obuaꞌ tuak anggul-e.”
pairs.target: When the wine ran out, Jesus’ mother said to him, “They have no wine.”

pairs.source: In Yesus tuduꞌ sinoꞌ-E, “Noꞌ, oni nai ingan tanon hal inoh tuduꞌ Okuꞌ? Aluaꞌ diꞌ-e nog onu-e Okuꞌ yaꞌ tanon osi odop Kuꞌ.”
pairs.target: Jesus said to her, “Woman, what does that have to do with you and me? My hour has not yet come.”

pairs.source: Pak-e sinoꞌ Yesus moꞌ tanon tuduꞌ kuli-kuli deꞌ topat biluman inoh in-e, “Nai negeh oni deꞌ tanon-E tuduꞌ ingan.”
pairs.target: His mother said to the servants, “Whatever he says to you, do it.”

pairs.source: Danoꞌ ogiꞌ nuam bona topat piꞌin ngan nyaꞌa mamiaꞌ odop-e nunaꞌ adat ulang Yahudi.  Isiꞌ masim-masim bona inoh moih puluꞌ nog silatus litel.
pairs.target: Now there were six water pots of stone set there after the Jews’ way of purifying, containing two or three metretes apiece.

pairs.source: Yesus sina tuduꞌ kuli-kuli deꞌ munoꞌ, “Ngisiꞌ piꞌin daang bona-bona deꞌ munoꞌ odaꞌ punuaꞌ.” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngisiꞌ bona deꞌ munoꞌ nog-e punuaꞌ.
pairs.target: Jesus said to them, “Fill the water pots with water.” They filled them up to the brim.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh, Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ kuli-kuli deꞌ munoꞌ, “Adin, ingan nyaꞌuak-e nyeꞌ moꞌ toban tuduꞌ pimipin nyaꞌa deꞌ biluman.” Yohmoꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nai kodaꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ Yesus yoh nai-e.
pairs.target: He said to them, “Now draw some out, and take it to the ruler of the feast.” So they took it.

pairs.source: Pimipin nyaꞌa deꞌ biluman inoh diꞌ-e puꞌan soꞌ ki soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ mit tuak anggul inoh, pak-e kuli-kuli deꞌ duwan piꞌin inoh jaꞌ-e deꞌ puꞌan.  Jadin, takal iyoh kiꞌan piꞌin deꞌ moꞌ bilubah jadin tuak anggul inoh, iyoh moꞌ lasuꞌ odi sinok pinganten deꞌ dali,
pairs.target: When the ruler of the feast tasted the water now become wine, and didn’t know where it came from (but the servants who had drawn the water knew), the ruler of the feast called the bridegroom,

pairs.source: iyoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, “Biasa-e nyaꞌa nguliaꞌ tuak anggul deꞌ paling paguh deꞌ dioꞌ, takal nyaꞌa deꞌ nog moꞌ puas nuak, ke yoh moꞌ nguliaꞌ tuak anggul deꞌ kulang paguh.  Pak-e muꞌu nyikon tuak anggul deꞌ paling paguh-e nog adin.”
pairs.target: and said to him, “Everyone serves the good wine first, and when the guests have drunk freely, then that which is worse. You have kept the good wine until now!”

pairs.source: Inoh leh tanda deꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ sibungas-e deꞌ nai Yesus daang kota Kana deꞌ propinsi Galilea.  Pakai tanda inoh leh Iyoh moꞌ bitanga kuasa-E deꞌ sukup ayuh-e.  Yoh ngan pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ-E.
pairs.target: This beginning of his signs Jesus did in Cana of Galilee, and revealed his glory; and his disciples believed in him.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus odi keꞌ kota Kapernaum samah-samah duoh sinoꞌ-E, suaꞌ sudiꞌ-E baya pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ loꞌo kudu-kudu onu-e danoꞌ.
pairs.target: After this, he went down to Capernaum, he, and his mother, his brothers, and his disciples; and they stayed there a few days.

pairs.source: Takal-e moꞌ sinok onu ayuh Paskah ulang Yahudi, Yesus odi keꞌ Yerusalem.
pairs.target: The Passover of the Jews was at hand, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.

pairs.source: Deꞌ limang Boli Topaꞌ, Iyoh ningaꞌ ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bijua sapi, domba baya manuk asang, ogiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ tukang nukal duit deꞌ guluꞌ danoꞌ.
pairs.target: He found in the temple those who sold oxen, sheep, and doves, and the changers of money sitting.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nai posut soꞌ tolin yohmoꞌ kasig suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ baya binatang-binatang-e, bait domba, bait sapi soꞌ limang Boli Topaꞌ.  Mija-mija nyaꞌa deꞌ tukang nukal duit obuaꞌ ngibolui-E sape duit-e posik polai katiꞌ-kanih.
pairs.target: He made a whip of cords, and threw all out of the temple, both the sheep and the oxen; and he poured out the changers’ money, and overthrew their tables.

pairs.source: Iyoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ jua manuk asang, in-E, “Tunuk suaꞌ-e soꞌ itih, maꞌ yaꞌ odaꞌ Boli Samaꞌ Kuꞌ jadin topat nyaꞌa bijua.”
pairs.target: To those who sold the doves, he said, “Take these things out of here! Don’t make my Father’s house a marketplace!”

pairs.source: Takal inoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E natong nang ogiꞌ deꞌ obuah nulis daang buk Kitab deꞌ in-e, “Nyayang Boli Muꞌ, odaꞌ odop Kuꞌ souh.”
pairs.target: His disciples remembered that it was written, “Zeal for your house will eat me up.”

pairs.source: Ayua pimipin ulang Yahudi moꞌ tiwas tuduꞌ Yesus, in-e, “Osi deꞌ ngin kuasa deꞌ Muꞌu odaꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ wat itih? Suba bitanga tuduꞌ koꞌih tanda deꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: The Jews therefore answered him, “What sign do you show us, seeing that you do these things?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Pilubuh Boli Topaꞌ itih, daang taluh onu paliꞌ mujuag odaꞌ kuꞌ.”
pairs.target: Jesus answered them, “Destroy this temple, and in three days I will raise it up.”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ-E, “Pat puluꞌ nuam sowaꞌ nyaꞌa kajuag Boli Topaꞌ itih, pak-e Muꞌu nang yaꞌ kajuag daang taluh onu?”
pairs.target: The Jews therefore said, “It took forty-six years to build this temple! Will you raise it up in three days?”

pairs.source: Pak-e deꞌ nang-E Boli Topaꞌ inoh iyohleh polong odop-E.
pairs.target: But he spoke of the temple of his body.

pairs.source: Takal Yesus moꞌ paliꞌ idip soꞌ kobos-E, pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E natong oniꞌ deꞌ nang-E, yoh moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ oni deꞌ obuah nulis daang buk Kitab duoh oni deꞌ nang Yesus.
pairs.target: When therefore he was raised from the dead, his disciples remembered that he said this, and they believed the Scripture, and the word which Jesus had said.

pairs.source: Takal aluaꞌ onu ayuh Paskah ulang Yahudi, Yesus aluaꞌ deꞌ Yerusalem, bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ jadin bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ-E, dop-e nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ ningaꞌ bogoꞌ tanda soꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa deꞌ nai-E.
pairs.target: Now when he was in Jerusalem at the Passover, during the feast, many believed in his name, observing his signs which he did.

pairs.source: Pak-e Yesus diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, dop-e Iyoh moꞌ piluh otin odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: But Jesus didn’t entrust himself to them, because he knew everyone,

pairs.source: Dusah nyaꞌa tanon tuduꞌ-E tentang osi odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, Yesus moꞌ puꞌan isiꞌ otin odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: and because he didn’t need for anyone to testify concerning man; for he himself knew what was in man.

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan pimipin agama soꞌ uluk ulang Farisi deꞌ adon Nikodemus.
pairs.target: Now there was a man of the Pharisees named Nicodemus, a ruler of the Jews.

pairs.source: Iyoh nog tuduꞌ Yesus takal onu ngalom, yoh moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ Yesus, “Gulu, koꞌih puꞌan nang Ingan obuah pait odaꞌ Topaꞌ, dop-e niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa tuang doiꞌ geh deꞌ tapod nai tanda soꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa, kodaꞌ deꞌ nai Ingan, simoꞌ-e doiꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ duoh-E.”
pairs.target: The same came to him by night, and said to him, “Rabbi, we know that you are a teacher come from God, for no one can do these signs that you do, unless God is with him.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e in-E, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan bonal-bonal, moꞌ diꞌ ingan obuah bilanak baꞌuh, idoh diꞌ ingan tapod ningaꞌ Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja.”
pairs.target: Jesus answered him, “Most certainly, I tell you, unless one is born anew,  he can’t see God’s Kingdom.”

pairs.source: Nikodemus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ Yesus, “Wat ki wat nyaꞌa yaꞌ obuah bilanak baꞌuh moꞌ-e yoh moꞌ nyoma? Podo ponai keh yoh paliꞌ molot kaang toꞌin sinoꞌ-e yoh moꞌ paliꞌ obuah bilanak baꞌuh?”
pairs.target: Nicodemus said to him, “How can a man be born when he is old? Can he enter a second time into his mother’s womb, and be born?”

pairs.source: Yesus nyawot in-E, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan bonal-bonal, moꞌ ingan diꞌ-e paliꞌ obuah bilanak baꞌuh soꞌ piꞌin duoh soꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ, idoh diꞌ ingan tapod jadin umat Topaꞌ deꞌ militah jadin Laja.
pairs.target: Jesus answered, “Most certainly I tell you, unless one is born of water and spirit, he can’t enter into God’s Kingdom.

pairs.source: Oni deꞌ bilanak nyaꞌa soꞌ gonan manusia iyoh leh manusia, oni deꞌ bilanak soꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ iyoh leh iyang.
pairs.target: That which is born of the flesh is flesh. That which is born of the Spirit is spirit.

pairs.source: Maꞌ ingan yaꞌ ilan moꞌ Kuꞌ sina tuduꞌ ingan nang ingan halus obuah bilanak baꞌuh.
pairs.target: Don’t marvel that I said to you, ‘You must be born anew.’

pairs.source: Sobak yup kaki sijaꞌ-e soꞌ-e yaꞌ odi, otoꞌ ngojit sidoong-e, pak-e diꞌ nyeꞌ puꞌan soꞌ ki soꞌ-e nog duoh kaki soꞌ-e odi.  Wat noh geh nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah bilanak soꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: The wind blows where it wants to, and you hear its sound, but don’t know where it comes from and where it is going. So is everyone who is born of the Spirit.”

pairs.source: “Oni wat oniꞌ deꞌ wat inoh ponai jadi?” In Nikodemus.
pairs.target: Nicodemus answered him, “How can these things be?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Muꞌu jadin gulu deꞌ Israel masaꞌ diꞌ muꞌ puꞌan-e?
pairs.target: Jesus answered him, “Are you the teacher of Israel, and don’t understand these things?

pairs.source: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan bonal-bonal, koꞌih tanon oniꞌ deꞌ puꞌan koꞌih duoh oniꞌ deꞌ ningaꞌ koꞌih, pak-e ingan diꞌ ingan tilimaꞌ oni deꞌ tanon koꞌih.
pairs.target: Most certainly I tell you, we speak that which we know, and testify of that which we have seen, and you don’t receive our witness.

pairs.source: Ingan diꞌ ingan bisayaꞌ, takal Okuꞌ sina duoh ingan tentang suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ dunia, wat ki ingan yaꞌ bisayaꞌ simoꞌ Okuꞌ sina duoh ingan tentang oniꞌ deꞌ siluga?
pairs.target: If I told you earthly things and you don’t believe, how will you believe if I tell you heavenly things?

pairs.source: Niꞌ naꞌan tuang doiꞌ geh deꞌ moꞌ maꞌad keꞌ siluga, simoꞌ-e diꞌ-e Iyoh deꞌ moꞌ muun soꞌ siluga, Iyoh inoh Onak Manusia.
pairs.target: No one has ascended into heaven, but he who descended out of heaven, the Son of Man, who is in heaven.

pairs.source: Samah kodaꞌ Musa najul deꞌ tun koyuh tipaduaꞌ dipoh deꞌ nai nyaꞌa soꞌ tibaga, wat inoh geh Onak Manusia yaꞌ obuah najul deꞌ tun koyuh,
pairs.target: As Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness, even so must the Son of Man be lifted up,

pairs.source: saꞌ-e suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ-E soꞌon idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah.”
pairs.target: that whoever believes in him should not perish, but have eternal life.

pairs.source: Dop-e Topaꞌ sukup ngibalaꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ daang dunia, noh leh ngan Iyoh moꞌ ngin Onak-E deꞌ Jok-e Niꞌ, saꞌ-e suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ-E diꞌ-e kobos nah-nah, pak-e soꞌon idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah.
pairs.target: For God so loved the world, that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him should not perish, but have eternal life.

pairs.source: Dop-e Topaꞌ pait Onak-E kaang dunia idoh diꞌ-e ngan-e ngukum nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ daang dunia, pak-e ngan-e nyilamat nyaꞌa pakai Onak-E.
pairs.target: For God didn’t send his Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world should be saved through him.

pairs.source: Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ-E, iyoh diꞌ-e obuah ngukum.  Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ moꞌ obuah ngukum odaꞌ Topaꞌ, dop-e iyoh diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Onak Topaꞌ deꞌ Jok-e Niꞌ.
pairs.target: He who believes in him is not judged. He who doesn’t believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the one and only Son of God.

pairs.source: Iyoh yaꞌ obuah ukum luban itih: Jawaꞌ inoh moꞌ nog kaang dunia, pak-e manusia lobih suka daang mopung soꞌ daang jawaꞌ, dop-e manusia suka nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat.
pairs.target: This is the judgment, that the light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the light; for their works were evil.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ suka nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat buꞌui deꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ jawaꞌ, iyoh doliaꞌ-e odi keꞌ topat deꞌ jawaꞌ, dop-e jak-e oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat deꞌ nai-e tonga.
pairs.target: For everyone who does evil hates the light, and doesn’t come to the light, lest his works would be exposed.

pairs.source: Pak-e suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ bonal, iyoh nog kaang topat deꞌ jawaꞌ, saꞌ-e suaꞌ pingunai-e deꞌ paguh tonga, dop-e suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai-e, yoh nai nunaꞌ deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: But he who does the truth comes to the light, that his works may be revealed, that they have been done in God.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus odi keꞌ tanaꞌ Yudea duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E.  Iyoh loꞌo danoꞌ duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.  Yesus moꞌ baptis nyaꞌa danoꞌ.
pairs.target: After these things, Jesus came with his disciples into the land of Judea. He stayed there with them, and baptized.

pairs.source: Yohanes tuang baptis-e geh nyaꞌa deꞌ Ainon, diꞌ-e juuaꞌ soꞌ Salim, dop-e danoꞌ bogoꞌ piꞌin.  Bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nog tuduꞌ-e, yohmoꞌ baptis odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: John also was baptizing in Enon near Salim, because there was much water there. They came, and were baptized.

pairs.source: Takal inoh Yohanes aluaꞌ diꞌ-e molot jel.
pairs.target: For John was not yet thrown into prison.

pairs.source: Kudu-kudu naꞌan pinunaꞌ Yohanes mulai bikalah duoh ulang Yahudi tentang atulan kibisig odop-e.
pairs.target: There arose therefore a questioning on the part of John’s disciples with some Jews about purification.

pairs.source: Yohmoꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nog tuduꞌ Yohanes yohmoꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, “Gulu, nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ samah-samah duoh ingan takal deꞌ polad sungi Yordan duoh deꞌ silita ingan inoh, adin Iyoh tuang baptis-e geh nyaꞌa, yohmoꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa nog tuduꞌ-E.”
pairs.target: They came to John, and said to him, “Rabbi, he who was with you beyond the Jordan, to whom you have testified, behold, the same baptizes, and everyone is coming to him.”

pairs.source: Yohanes moꞌ nyawot-e, “Niꞌ naꞌan tuang doiꞌ geh deꞌ tapod mit oniꞌ saꞌan odop-e simoꞌ-e diꞌ-e obuah ngin tuduꞌ-e soꞌ siluga.
pairs.target: John answered, “A man can receive nothing, unless it has been given him from heaven.

pairs.source: Ingan tuang ponai geh tanon nang okuꞌ moꞌ sina nang: okuꞌ idoh diꞌ-e Laja Pinyilamat, pak-e okuꞌ obuah pait dioꞌ soꞌ Iyoh.
pairs.target: You yourselves testify that I said, ‘I am not the Christ,’ but, ‘I have been sent before him.’

pairs.source: Deꞌ kakuꞌ pinganten dayung iyohleh pinganten dali.  Dingan pinganten dali mujuag sinok-e duoh ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ nang-e.  Dingan pinganten dali inoh sukup doon ngojit sina pinganten dali inoh.  Wat inoh leh okuꞌ doon, adin otin kuꞌ punuaꞌ odaꞌ doon.
pairs.target: He who has the bride is the bridegroom; but the friend of the bridegroom, who stands and hears him, rejoices greatly because of the bridegroom’s voice. This, my joy, therefore is made full.

pairs.source: Iyoh halus makin penting, yohmoꞌ okuꞌ halus makin diꞌ-e penting.”
pairs.target: He must increase, but I must decrease.

pairs.source: Osi deꞌ nog soꞌ somu, Iyoh deꞌ lobih ayuh kuasa-E soꞌ suaꞌ manusia.  Osi deꞌ nog soꞌ dunia, iyoh ulang dunia duoh sina tentang oniꞌ deꞌ dunia.  Pak-e Iyoh deꞌ nog soꞌ siluga, Iyoh deꞌ lobih ayuh kuasa-E soꞌ suaꞌ manusia.
pairs.target: He who comes from above is above all. He who is from the earth belongs to the earth, and speaks of the earth. He who comes from heaven is above all.

pairs.source: Iyoh tanon tentang suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ningaꞌ-E duoh deꞌ ngojit-E, pak-e niꞌ naꞌan tuang doiꞌ geh deꞌ tilimaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ tanon-E.
pairs.target: What he has seen and heard, of that he testifies; and no one receives his witness.

pairs.source: Osi deꞌ tilimaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ tanon-E inoh, iyoh moꞌ ngakuꞌ nang Topaꞌ inoh bonal.
pairs.target: He who has received his witness has set his seal to this, that God is true.

pairs.source: Dop-e osi deꞌ obuah pait odaꞌ Topaꞌ, Iyoh noh leh deꞌ tanon Pingunang Topaꞌ, dop-e Topaꞌ moꞌ ngin sipunuaꞌ-e Iyang-E tuduꞌ-E.
pairs.target: For he whom God has sent speaks the words of God; for God gives the Spirit without measure.

pairs.source: Samaꞌ ngibalaꞌ Onak-E, duoh moꞌ nyelah suaꞌ oniꞌ tuduꞌ-E.
pairs.target: The Father loves the Son, and has given all things into his hand.

pairs.source: Osi deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Onak, iyoh soꞌon idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah, pak-e osi deꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Onak inoh, iyoh diꞌ-e tilimaꞌ idip, pak-e ukum Topaꞌ totap ogiꞌ deꞌ polong odop-e.
pairs.target: One who believes in the Son has eternal life, but one who disobeys  the Son won’t see life, but the wrath of God remains on him.”

pairs.source: Ayua ulang Farisi ngojit nang nyaꞌa deꞌ nunaꞌ duoh deꞌ obuah baptis odaꞌ Yesus lobih bogoꞌ soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah baptis odaꞌ Yohanes.
pairs.target: Therefore when the Lord knew that the Pharisees had heard that Jesus was making and baptizing more disciples than John

pairs.source: Pak-e sibonal-e idoh diꞌ-e Yesus deꞌ baptis nyaꞌa, pak-e jok-e pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E.
pairs.target: (although Jesus himself didn’t baptize, but his disciples),

pairs.source: Takal Yesus puꞌan nang ayua ulang Farisi moꞌ ngojit tentang hal inoh, Iyoh moꞌ buu soꞌ propinsi Yudea paliꞌ keꞌ propinsi Galilea.
pairs.target: he left Judea, and departed into Galilee.

pairs.source: Daang pimonu-e Iyoh halus ponu ngilusuꞌ propinsi Samaria.
pairs.target: He needed to pass through Samaria.

pairs.source: Takal inoh Iyoh moꞌ nog keꞌ kota deꞌ adon-e Sikhar deꞌ Samaria, diꞌ-e juuaꞌ soꞌ tanaꞌ deꞌ ngin Yakub noꞌuh-e tuduꞌ Yusuf, onak-e.
pairs.target: So he came to a city of Samaria, called Sychar, near the parcel of ground that Jacob gave to his son, Joseph.

pairs.source: Danoꞌ ogiꞌ lubang piꞌin deꞌ kaliah Yakub noꞌuh-e.  Yesus sukup kowok odaꞌ pimonu-E.  Noh leh ngan-E guluꞌ deꞌ bingon lubang piꞌin inoh.  Takal inoh kila-kila pukul simoong duwoh uun onu,
pairs.target: Jacob’s well was there. Jesus therefore, being tired from his journey, sat down by the well. It was about the sixth hour.
A woman of Samaria came to draw water. Jesus said to her, “Give me a drink.”

pairs.source: pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus moꞌ odi milih pinguman keꞌ kota.  Mokuaꞌ inoh niꞌ naꞌan dayung Samaria odi nyaꞌuak piꞌin deꞌ lubang piꞌin inoh.  Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, “Soꞌon yeh Okuꞌ mitiaꞌ piꞌin ngan Kuꞌ yaꞌ nuak neh?”
pairs.target: For his disciples had gone away into the city to buy food.

pairs.source: Dayung Samaria inoh moꞌ nyawot-E, “Ingan ulang Yahudi, oni nai Ingan mitiaꞌ nuak tuduꞌ okuꞌ, ulang Samaria?” (Dop-e ulang Yahudi sisiꞌ tuduꞌ ulang Samaria.)
pairs.target: The Samaritan woman therefore said to him, “How is it that you, being a Jew, ask for a drink from me, a Samaritan woman?” (For Jews have no dealings with Samaritans.)

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Simoꞌ muꞌ puꞌan oni deꞌ yaꞌ ngin Topaꞌ duoh osi deꞌ mitiaꞌ nuak tuduꞌ muꞌu, pasti muꞌu deꞌ yaꞌ mitiaꞌ nuak tuduꞌ-E, Iyoh moꞌ ngin piꞌin deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa idip tuduꞌ muꞌu.”
pairs.target: Jesus answered her, “If you knew the gift of God, and who it is who says to you, ‘Give me a drink,’ you would have asked him, and he would have given you living water.”

pairs.source: Dayung inoh moꞌ in-e, “Ingan doiꞌ saꞌuak Ingan, lubang piꞌin itih sukup tuluap-e.  Soꞌ ki Ingan yaꞌ soꞌon piꞌin deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa idip?
pairs.target: The woman said to him, “Sir, you have nothing to draw with, and the well is deep. So where do you get that living water?

pairs.source: Yakub sumuk babai koꞌih ngin lubang piꞌin itih.  Odop-e tuang nuak soꞌ itih geh, wat inoh geh onak-onak-e baya binatang deꞌ piala-e.  Podo Ingan nyaꞌa deꞌ lobih penting soꞌ sumuk babai koꞌih Yakub?”
pairs.target: Are you greater than our father, Jacob, who gave us the well, and drank of it himself, as did his children, and his livestock?”

pairs.source: Yesus nyawot in-e, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ nuak piꞌin itih, asong-e yaꞌ paliꞌ bodoh.
pairs.target: Jesus answered her, “Everyone who drinks of this water will thirst again,

pairs.source: Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ nuak piꞌin deꞌ yaꞌ ngin Kuꞌ, iyoh diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ yaꞌ noman asong-e bodoh.  Dop-e piꞌin deꞌ yaꞌ ngin Kuꞌ yaꞌ jadin boton piꞌin daang odop-e deꞌ soyuak-soyuak-e duoh ngin idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah.”
pairs.target: but whoever drinks of the water that I will give him will never thirst again; but the water that I will give him will become in him a well of water springing up to eternal life.”

pairs.source: In dayung inoh, “Ingan ngin tuduꞌ okuꞌ piꞌin inoh, saꞌ asong kuꞌ diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ bodoh duoh diꞌ kuꞌ tiyaꞌ paliꞌ mit piꞌin katiꞌ.”
pairs.target: The woman said to him, “Sir, give me this water, so that I don’t get thirsty, neither come all the way here to draw.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Paliꞌ mogan bonon muꞌ, nyeꞌ moꞌ paliꞌ katiꞌ.”
pairs.target: Jesus said to her, “Go, call your husband, and come here.”

pairs.source: In dayung inoh, “Okuꞌ doiꞌ bonon kuꞌ.” Yohmoꞌ in Yesus, “Tok bonal oniꞌ deꞌ nang muꞌ inoh.
pairs.target: The woman answered, “I have no husband.” Jesus said to her, “You said well, ‘I have no husband,’

pairs.source: Dop-e muꞌu moꞌ limoh sidoh bibonon, dali deꞌ idip samah-samah duoh muꞌu adin idoh diꞌ-e bonon muꞌ.”
pairs.target: for you have had five husbands; and he whom you now have is not your husband. This you have said truly.”

pairs.source: Dayung inoh moꞌ in-e, “Adin okuꞌ moꞌ puꞌan nang Ingan nabi.
pairs.target: The woman said to him, “Sir, I perceive that you are a prophet.

pairs.source: Sumuk babai koꞌih nyomah Topaꞌ deꞌ tun punguꞌ itih, pak-e bangsa Ingan nang jok-e deꞌ Yerusalem topat nyaꞌa nyomah Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: Our fathers worshiped in this mountain, and you Jews say that in Jerusalem is the place where people ought to worship.”

pairs.source: In Yesus tuduꞌ-e, “Bisayaꞌ leh tuduꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nang Kuꞌ itih, ogiꞌ onu-e nyaꞌa yaꞌ nyomah Topaꞌ diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ deꞌ punguꞌ itih, duoh idoh geh diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ deꞌ Yerusalem.
pairs.target: Jesus said to her, “Woman, believe me, the hour comes, when neither in this mountain, nor in Jerusalem, will you worship the Father.

pairs.source: Ingan ulang Samaria nyomah oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ ingan puꞌan-e, pak-e koꞌih ulang Yahudi nyomah Iyoh deꞌ puꞌan koꞌih, dop-e deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa silamat nog soꞌ ulang Yahudi.
pairs.target: You worship that which you don’t know. We worship that which we know; for salvation is from the Jews.

pairs.source: Pak-e onu-e yaꞌ nog, duoh adin geh onu inoh moꞌ nog, suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bonal-bonal nyomah yaꞌ nyomah Samaꞌ pakai obuah mipin odaꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ duoh nunaꞌ olan deꞌ bonal.  Dop-e oni deꞌ laꞌan Samaꞌ iyoh leh saꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa nyomah odop-E nunaꞌ olan deꞌ bonal.
pairs.target: But the hour comes, and now is, when the true worshipers will worship the Father in spirit and truth, for the Father seeks such to be his worshipers.

pairs.source: Topaꞌ inoh Iyang, osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ nyomah Iyoh, halus obuah mipin odaꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ duoh nunaꞌ olan deꞌ bonal ngan-e nyomah-E.”
pairs.target: God is spirit, and those who worship him must worship in spirit and truth.”

pairs.source: Dayung inoh moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Okuꞌ puꞌan nang Laja Pinyilamat deꞌ sobot nyaꞌa geh nang Kristus yaꞌ nog.  Moꞌ nyam Iyoh nog, Iyoh yaꞌ tanon suaꞌ oniꞌ tuduꞌ koꞌih.”
pairs.target: The woman said to him, “I know that Messiah comes, he who is called Christ. When he has come, he will declare to us all things.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ-e, “Okuꞌ leh odop-E, deꞌ sina duoh muꞌu adin.”
pairs.target: Jesus said to her, “I am he, the one who speaks to you.”

pairs.source: Takal inoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus paliꞌ nog, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ gogoh ningaꞌ Yesus sina duoh dayung inoh.  Pak-e doiꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ puus sikian tuduꞌ Yesus, ‘Oni deꞌ pilelu Ingan soꞌ dayung itih?’ atou ‘Oni ngan Ingan sina duoh-e?’
pairs.target: At this, his disciples came. They marveled that he was speaking with a woman; yet no one said, “What are you looking for?” or, “Why do you speak with her?”

pairs.source: Dayung inoh moꞌ supiah bona-e, iyoh moꞌ buu soꞌ kanoꞌ yohmoꞌ odi keꞌ kota, iyoh tanon tuduꞌ nyaꞌa danoꞌ in-e,
pairs.target: So the woman left her water pot, and went away into the city, and said to the people,

pairs.source: “Jaꞌ nunaꞌ okuꞌ, odi ningaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tanon tuduꞌ okuꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ ogiꞌ onu kuꞌ nai-e.  Laꞌan-e tok kedin-e Iyoh inoh Laja Pinyilamat.”
pairs.target: “Come, see a man who told me everything that I did. Can this be the Christ?”

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nunaꞌ dayung inoh odi keꞌ sopaꞌ kota ngan-e yaꞌ ningaꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: They went out of the city, and were coming to him.

pairs.source: Takal inoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E ngijaꞌ Yesus man in-e, “Gulu, jaꞌ mey man.”
pairs.target: In the meanwhile, the disciples urged him, saying, “Rabbi, eat.”

pairs.source: Pak-e Yesus nyawot-e, “Ogiꞌ pinguman deꞌ Okuꞌ deꞌ diꞌ ingan puꞌan-e.”
pairs.target: But he said to them, “I have food to eat that you don’t know about.”

pairs.source: Pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ sitipan odop-e, “Podo ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ toban pinguman tuduꞌ-E?”
pairs.target: The disciples therefore said to one another, “Has anyone brought him something to eat?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ sina, “Pinguman Kuꞌ yohleh nai oniꞌ deꞌ laꞌan Iyoh deꞌ pait Okuꞌ, duoh pijadi suaꞌ kiloja deꞌ nyelah-E tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: Jesus said to them, “My food is to do the will of him who sent me, and to accomplish his work.

pairs.source: Ingan puꞌan nang pat bulan mokuaꞌ bipuluah nyaꞌa ngutuam.  Pak-e Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Suba ningaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ nog deꞌ munoꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ samah kodaꞌ gandum deꞌ umoh deꞌ moꞌ obuaꞌ siaꞌ duoh moꞌ masak, moꞌ sodang ngan nyaꞌa yaꞌ ngutuam-e.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ yaꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: Don’t you say, ‘There are yet four months until the harvest?’ Behold, I tell you, lift up your eyes, and look at the fields, that they are white for harvest already.

pairs.source: Adin geh nyaꞌa deꞌ ngutuam tilimaꞌ pah-e duoh nguluk asil-e, iyoh leh nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ ngan-e soꞌon idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah.  Yohmoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bipuluah duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ ngutuam samah-samah doon.
pairs.target: He who reaps receives wages, and gathers fruit to eternal life; that both he who sows and he who reaps may rejoice together.

pairs.source: Tok bonal ogiꞌ sina deꞌ in-e, ‘Ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ puluah, ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngutuam.’
