pairs.target: For in this the saying is true, ‘One sows, and another reaps.’

pairs.source: Okuꞌ pait ingan odaꞌ ngutuam oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ ingan puluah-e, nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon moꞌ kiloja, ingan moꞌ ngutuam soꞌ kiloja nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ.”
pairs.target: I sent you to reap that for which you haven’t labored. Others have labored, and you have entered into their labor.”

pairs.source: Bogoꞌ ulang Samaria soꞌ kota bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus odaꞌ sina deꞌ tanon dayung inoh, “Iyoh tanon tuduꞌ okuꞌ tentang suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ ogiꞌ onu kuꞌ nai-e.”
pairs.target: From that city many of the Samaritans believed in him because of the word of the woman, who testified, “He told me everything that I did.”

pairs.source: Takal ulang-ulang Samaria deꞌ munoꞌ bitapod duoh Yesus, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ulih-ulih mitiaꞌ odaꞌ Yesus loꞌo duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, Yesus moꞌ loꞌo danoꞌ duwoh onu.
pairs.target: So when the Samaritans came to him, they begged him to stay with them. He stayed there two days.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh lobih bogoꞌ lagiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ-E odaꞌ oni deꞌ moꞌ ngajal-E.
pairs.target: Many more believed because of his word.

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ sina tuduꞌ dayung inoh in-e, “ Adin koꞌih bisayaꞌ idoh diꞌ-e odaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ tanon muꞌ tuduꞌ koꞌih, pak-e odop koꞌih moꞌ ngojit Iyoh duoh puꞌan nang Iyoh bonal-bonal Pinyilamat dunia.”
pairs.target: They said to the woman, “Now we believe, not because of your speaking; for we have heard for ourselves, and know that this is indeed the Christ, the Savior of the world.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ duwoh onu loꞌo deꞌ Sikhar, Yesus paliꞌ odi lagiꞌ keꞌ propinsi Galilea.
pairs.target: After the two days he went out from there and went into Galilee.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ ogiꞌ sidoh-e sina in-e, “Doiꞌ nabi deꞌ pimodo nyaꞌa daꞌ-e deꞌ kupuaꞌ odop-e.”
pairs.target: For Jesus himself testified that a prophet has no honor in his own country.

pairs.source: Pak-e takal-E nog Galilea ulang-ulang danoꞌ sonang otin nyamut-E, dop-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai-E deꞌ Yerusalem takal onu ayuh Paskah.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ suaꞌ-e ogiꞌ danoꞌ takal onu inoh.
pairs.target: So when he came into Galilee, the Galileans received him, having seen all the things that he did in Jerusalem at the feast, for they also went to the feast.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus paliꞌ lagi keꞌ kota Kana, deꞌ Galilea, topat soꞌ Iyoh ngubah piꞌin jadin tuak anggul.  Deꞌ Kapernaum ogiꞌ pegawai deꞌ kiloja deꞌ istana, onak-e deꞌ dali monam.
pairs.target: Jesus came therefore again to Cana of Galilee, where he made the water into wine. There was a certain nobleman whose son was sick at Capernaum.

pairs.source: Takal pegawai istana inoh ngojit nang Yesus moꞌ nog soꞌ Yudea odi keꞌ Galilea, iyoh moꞌ odi tuduꞌ-E, yohmoꞌ mitiaꞌ odaꞌ Yesus nog duoh odaꞌ onak-e mokuaꞌ soꞌ onam-e, dop-e onak-e inoh moꞌ yaꞌ kobos.
pairs.target: When he heard that Jesus had come out of Judea into Galilee, he went to him, and begged him that he would come down and heal his son, for he was at the point of death.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ-e, “Moꞌ diꞌ ingan ningaꞌ tanda soꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa deꞌ nai Kuꞌ, idoh diꞌ ingan bisayaꞌ.”
pairs.target: Jesus therefore said to him, “Unless you see signs and wonders, you will in no way believe.”

pairs.source: Pegawai istana inoh moꞌ in-e, “Tulung leh nog takal onak kuꞌ aluaꞌ diꞌ-e kobos.”
pairs.target: The nobleman said to him, “Sir, come down before my child dies.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ, “Paliꞌ negeh, onak muꞌ moꞌ mokuaꞌ monam.” Pegawai istana inoh moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ sina deꞌ nang Yesus tuduꞌ-e, iyoh moꞌ paliꞌ.
pairs.target: Jesus said to him, “Go your way. Your son lives.” The man believed the word that Jesus spoke to him, and he went his way.

pairs.source: Takal-e aluaꞌ deꞌ lopot olan, bala kuli-e moꞌ nog nusud-e tanon nang onak-e moꞌ mokuaꞌ monam.
pairs.target: As he was now going down, his servants met him and reported, saying “Your child lives!”

pairs.source: Iyoh moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Pukul kudu onak kuꞌ mulai mokuaꞌ soꞌ onam-e?” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Sumia-e kila-kila pukul niꞌ uun onu, bongoh-e moꞌ muun.”
pairs.target: So he inquired of them the hour when he began to get better. They said therefore to him, “Yesterday at the seventh hour, the fever left him.”

pairs.source: Samaꞌ onak opot inoh moꞌ natong nang jam inoh leh Yesus in-e tuduꞌ-e, “Onak muꞌ moꞌ mokuaꞌ monam.” Iyoh moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus baya suaꞌ odop-e daang boli-e.
pairs.target: So the father knew that it was at that hour in which Jesus said to him, “Your son lives.” He believed, as did his whole house.

pairs.source: Inoh leh tanda soꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa soꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ keꞌ duwoh-e deꞌ nai Yesus takal Iyoh paliꞌ soꞌ Yudea odi keꞌ Galilea.
pairs.target: This is again the second sign that Jesus did, having come out of Judea into Galilee.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh ogiꞌ onu ayuh ulang Yahudi, Yesus odi keꞌ Yerusalem nyamut onu ayuh inoh.
pairs.target: After these things, there was a feast of the Jews, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.

pairs.source: Deꞌ Yerusalem ogiꞌ pagung deꞌ adon Betesda daang sina Ibrani.  Pagung inoh sinok Tiban ayuh Domba, deꞌ bingon pagung inoh ogiꞌ limoh awah-e.
pairs.target: Now in Jerusalem by the sheep gate, there is a pool, which is called in Hebrew, “Bethesda”, having five porches.

pairs.source: Deꞌ awah-awah deꞌ munoꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ monam guling, ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ, ogiꞌ deꞌ bojang, ogiꞌ deꞌ kobos gonan-e.  (Suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ kajon piꞌin deꞌ pagung inoh bilayaꞌ.
pairs.target: In these lay a great multitude of those who were sick, blind, lame, or paralyzed, waiting for the moving of the water;

pairs.source: Dop-e ogiꞌ onu-e malaikat Topaꞌ muun kaang pagung inoh odaꞌ piꞌin-e bilayaꞌ.  Yohmoꞌ osi deꞌ monam deꞌ dioꞌ muun kaang pagung takal piꞌin-e bilayaꞌ, yoh yaꞌ mokuaꞌ soꞌ onam oni sijaꞌ-e deꞌ noman-e.)
pairs.target: for an angel went down at certain times into the pool, and stirred up the water. Whoever stepped in first after the stirring of the water was healed of whatever disease he had.

pairs.source: Deꞌ topat inoh ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan dali deꞌ monam moꞌ taluh puluꞌ moih sowaꞌ.
pairs.target: A certain man was there, who had been sick for thirty-eight years.

pairs.source: Takal Yesus ningaꞌ yoh guling, Yesus moꞌ puꞌan nang iyoh moꞌ tuui monam.  Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ-e, “Laꞌan muꞌ yeh yaꞌ mokuaꞌ neh?”
pairs.target: When Jesus saw him lying there, and knew that he had been sick for a long time, he asked him, “Do you want to be made well?”

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa inoh moꞌ nyawot-e, “Doiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ pimuun okuꞌ kaang pagung inoh takal piꞌin-e bilayaꞌ, takal okuꞌ yaꞌ muun kaang pagung inoh, nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon moꞌ dioꞌ muun soꞌ okuꞌ.”
pairs.target: The sick man answered him, “Sir, I have no one to put me into the pool when the water is stirred up, but while I’m coming, another steps down before me.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ-e, “Mokat leh, tunuk tilam muꞌ, nyeꞌ moꞌ ponu.”
pairs.target: Jesus said to him, “Arise, take up your mat, and walk.”

pairs.source: Takal inoh geh nyaꞌa inoh lasuꞌ mokuaꞌ yohmoꞌ tunuk tilam-e yohmoꞌ mokat ponu.  Takal inoh Onu Sabat, onu ulang Yahudi loꞌo diꞌ-e nai oni-oni-e.
pairs.target: Immediately, the man was made well, and took up his mat and walked. Now it was the Sabbath on that day.

pairs.source: Inoh leh ngan pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tuang-e mokuaꞌ soꞌ onam-e inoh in-e, “Onu itih onu Simayang agama Yahudi, idoh diꞌ muꞌ soꞌon golong tilam muꞌ.”
pairs.target: So the Jews said to him who was cured, “It is the Sabbath. It is not lawful for you to carry the mat.”

pairs.source: Pak-e iyoh in-e nyawot odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ odaꞌ okuꞌ mokuaꞌ soꞌ onam kuꞌ, Iyoh deꞌ tanon tuduꞌ okuꞌ, ‘Tunuk tilam muꞌ, nyeꞌ moꞌ ponu.’ ”
pairs.target: He answered them, “He who made me well, the same said to me, ‘Take up your mat, and walk.’”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ nyaꞌa inoh, “Osi odop-E deꞌ sina tuduꞌ muꞌu odaꞌ muꞌu tunuk tilam muꞌ duoh odaꞌ muꞌu ponu?”
pairs.target: Then they asked him, “Who is the man who said to you, ‘Take up your mat, and walk’?”

pairs.source: Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ tuang-e mokuaꞌ monam inoh diꞌ-e puꞌan osi nyaꞌa inoh, dop-e Yesus moꞌ molot daang uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ, Iyoh diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ tonga.
pairs.target: But he who was healed didn’t know who it was, for Jesus had withdrawn, a crowd being in the place.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ bitapod duoh-e lagiꞌ deꞌ limang Boli Topaꞌ, Iyoh moꞌ sina duoh-e in-e, “Ningaꞌ, muꞌu moꞌ mokuaꞌ monam, maꞌ tiyaꞌ nai dosa muꞌ, saꞌ diꞌ muꞌ obuah susah jolaꞌ deꞌ lobih soꞌ deꞌ moꞌ ngoon muꞌ.”
pairs.target: Afterward Jesus found him in the temple, and said to him, “Behold, you are made well. Sin no more, so that nothing worse happens to you.”

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa inoh luah, yoh moꞌ silita tuduꞌ pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi nang Yesus leh deꞌ moꞌ odaꞌ odop-e mokuaꞌ soꞌ onam-e.
pairs.target: The man went away, and told the Jews that it was Jesus who had made him well.

pairs.source: Noh leh ngan pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi kagaꞌ odop-e yaꞌ pijolaꞌ Yesus, dop-e Yesus nai oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ daang Onu Sabat.
pairs.target: For this cause the Jews persecuted Jesus, and sought to kill him, because he did these things on the Sabbath.

pairs.source: Pak-e Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Samaꞌ Kuꞌ diꞌ loꞌo-loꞌo nai kiloja-E nog adin, Okuꞌ tuang kiloja geh.”
pairs.target: But Jesus answered them, “My Father is still working, so I am working, too.”

pairs.source: Sina deꞌ nang Yesus inoh deꞌ odaꞌ pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi makin malah, yoh moꞌ kagaꞌ yaꞌ ngabos Yesus.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nai deꞌ wat inoh, dop-e Yesus idoh diꞌ-e jok-e ngilangal atulan onu Simayang agama Yahudi, pak-e Iyoh nang Topaꞌ inoh Samaꞌ-E, loti-e Iyoh moꞌ nyamah odop-E duoh Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: For this cause therefore the Jews sought all the more to kill him, because he not only broke the Sabbath, but also called God his own Father, making himself equal with God.

pairs.source: Yesus nyawot pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi deꞌ munoꞌ in-E, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan bonal-bonal, tok Onak diꞌ-e ponai nai oni-oni-e soꞌ odop-E sadiꞌ-e.  Iyoh jok-e ponai nai oniꞌ kodaꞌ deꞌ ningaꞌ-e Samaꞌ-E nai-e.  Dop-e oni deꞌ nai Samaꞌ, inoh geh deꞌ nai Onak.
pairs.target: Jesus therefore answered them, “Most certainly, I tell you, the Son can do nothing of himself, but what he sees the Father doing. For whatever things he does, these the Son also does likewise.

pairs.source: Dop-e Samaꞌ ngibalaꞌ Onak duoh bitanga suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai odop-E tuduꞌ Onak-E.  Lobih soꞌ inoh Samaꞌ yaꞌ bitanga kiloja-kiloja deꞌ lobih ayuh ngan-e odaꞌ Onak-E nai-e, sape ingan moꞌ ilan-e.
pairs.target: For the Father has affection for the Son, and shows him all things that he himself does. He will show him greater works than these, that you may marvel.

pairs.source: Dop-e samah kodaꞌ Samaꞌ kidip nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos duoh odaꞌ idip, wat inoh geh Onak odaꞌ osi sijaꞌ-e idip nunaꞌ deꞌ laꞌan odop-E.
pairs.target: For as the Father raises the dead and gives them life, even so the Son also gives life to whom he desires.

pairs.source: Samaꞌ idoh diꞌ-e yaꞌ ngadel osi-osi-e, pak-e Iyoh nyelah suaꞌ kuasa-E tuduꞌ Onak-E ngan-e ngadel nyaꞌa,
pairs.target: For the Father judges no one, but he has given all judgment to the Son,

pairs.source: saꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa pimodo tuduꞌ Onak samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa pimodo tuduꞌ Samaꞌ.  Osi deꞌ diꞌ-e pimodo tuduꞌ Onak, iyoh diꞌ-e pimodo tuduꞌ Samaꞌ deꞌ pait Iyoh.
pairs.target: that all may honor the Son, even as they honor the Father. He who doesn’t honor the Son doesn’t honor the Father who sent him.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan bonal-bonal, osi deꞌ ngojit pingunang Kuꞌ duoh bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Samaꞌ deꞌ pait Okuꞌ, iyoh yaꞌ kakuꞌ idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah baya diꞌ-e suwaꞌ obuah ukum, dop-e iyoh moꞌ lopas soꞌ kuasa deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa kobos yohmoꞌ molot kaang idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah.
pairs.target: “Most certainly I tell you, he who hears my word, and believes him who sent me, has eternal life, and doesn’t come into judgment, but has passed out of death into life.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ sina tuduꞌ ingan bonal-bonal, yaꞌ nog onu-e, kan-e adin geh moꞌ nog onu-e, nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ kobos.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ kobos yaꞌ ngojit sina Okuꞌ, Onak Topaꞌ, duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nang Kuꞌ yaꞌ soꞌon idip.
pairs.target: Most certainly, I tell you, the hour comes, and now is, when the dead will hear the Son of God’s voice; and those who hear will live.

pairs.source: Idip tok nog soꞌ Odop Samaꞌ.  Wat noh geh Samaꞌ ngin kuasa tuduꞌ Onak ngan-e ngin idip.
pairs.target: For as the Father has life in himself, even so he gave to the Son also to have life in himself.

pairs.source: Samaꞌ moꞌ ngin tuduꞌ Onak-E kuasa ngan-e pilabuꞌ ukum, dop-e Iyoh Onak Manusia.
pairs.target: He also gave him authority to execute judgment, because he is a son of man.

pairs.source: Maꞌ ingan yaꞌ ilan, dop-e yaꞌ nog onu-e suaꞌ nyaꞌa daang kubul yaꞌ klingah Iyoh mogan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ,
pairs.target: Don’t marvel at this, for the hour comes, in which all that are in the tombs will hear his voice,

pairs.source: yohmoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ paguh yaꞌ luah soꞌ kubul duoh paliꞌ idip, ngan-e yaꞌ soꞌon idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah.  Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat yaꞌ paliꞌ idip saꞌ-e obuah ukum.
pairs.target: and will come out; those who have done good, to the resurrection of life; and those who have done evil, to the resurrection of judgment.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ ponai nai oni-oni soꞌ odop Kuꞌ, Okuꞌ pilabuꞌ ukum samah kodaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ ngojit Kuꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ.  Ukum deꞌ pilabuꞌ Kuꞌ moꞌ bitotok duoh salah deꞌ nai-e, dop-e Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ nunaꞌ oni deꞌ laꞌan odop Kuꞌ, pak-e nunaꞌ oni deꞌ laꞌan Iyoh deꞌ pait Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: I can of myself do nothing. As I hear, I judge, and my judgment is righteous; because I don’t seek my own will, but the will of my Father who sent me.

pairs.source: Moꞌ odop Kuꞌ deꞌ tanon tentang odop Kuꞌ, doiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ dapod yaꞌ bisayaꞌ daꞌ-e.
pairs.target: “If I testify about myself, my witness is not valid.

pairs.source: Pak-e ogiꞌ deꞌ bokon, Iyoh inoh Samaꞌ Kuꞌ, deꞌ sobot tentang Okuꞌ, Okuꞌ puꞌan nang oniꞌ deꞌ tanon-E tentang Okuꞌ tok bonal.”
pairs.target: It is another who testifies about me. I know that the testimony which he testifies about me is true.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ tuduꞌ pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi deꞌ munoꞌ, “Ingan moꞌ pait nyaꞌa tuduꞌ Yohanes, iyoh moꞌ tanon oniꞌ deꞌ bonal tentang Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: You have sent to John, and he has testified to the truth.

pairs.source: Pak-e Okuꞌ sibonal-e idoh diꞌ Kuꞌ pilelu oni deꞌ tanon manusia tentang Okuꞌ.  Okuꞌ jok Kuꞌ tanon oni deꞌ nang Yohanes saꞌ ingan obuah nyilamat.
pairs.target: But the testimony which I receive is not from man. However, I say these things that you may be saved.

pairs.source: Pingunang Yohanes kodaꞌ lapu kadis deꞌ jawaꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ ingan ngoon sonang, pak-e jawaꞌ-e inoh jok-e niꞌ tiliaꞌ.
pairs.target: He was the burning and shining lamp, and you were willing to rejoice for a while in his light.

pairs.source: Pak-e oni deꞌ tanon Kuꞌ lobih penting soꞌ oni deꞌ tanon Yohanes, oni deꞌ tanon Kuꞌ itih yohleh suaꞌ kiloja deꞌ odaꞌ Samaꞌ Okuꞌ nai-e.  Kiloja inoh leh deꞌ nai Kuꞌ adin duoh deꞌ jadin bukti nang Samaꞌ deꞌ pait Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: But the testimony which I have is greater than that of John, for the works which the Father gave me to accomplish, the very works that I do, testify about me, that the Father has sent me.

pairs.source: Samaꞌ deꞌ pait Okuꞌ, Iyoh leh deꞌ tanon tentang Okuꞌ.  Aluaꞌ doiꞌ onu ingan ngojit sina-E, jowin-E tuang aluaꞌ doiꞌ geh ingan ningaꞌ-E.
pairs.target: The Father himself, who sent me, has testified about me. You have neither heard his voice at any time, nor seen his form.

pairs.source: Pingunang-E doiꞌ daang otin ingan, dop-e ingan diꞌ ingan bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ deꞌ pait-E.
pairs.target: You don’t have his word living in you; because you don’t believe him whom he sent.

pairs.source: Ingan bilajal buk Kitab, dop-e ingan sakaꞌ nang ingan yaꞌ soꞌon idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah soꞌ buk Kitab inoh.  Sibonal-e buk Kitab inoh moꞌ tanon tentang Okuꞌ,
pairs.target: “You search the Scriptures, because you think that in them you have eternal life; and these are they which testify about me.

pairs.source: pak-e doliaꞌ ingan nog tuduꞌ Okuꞌ ngan ingan yaꞌ soꞌon idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah.
pairs.target: Yet you will not come to me, that you may have life.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ kalik pudi soꞌ manusia.
pairs.target: I don’t receive glory from men.

pairs.source: Pak-e Okuꞌ piluh ingan.  Okuꞌ puꞌan nang idoh diꞌ ingan ngibalaꞌ Topaꞌ daang otin ingan.
pairs.target: But I know you, that you don’t have God’s love in yourselves.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ nog pakai kuasa Samaꞌ Kuꞌ, pak-e diꞌ ingan tilimaꞌ Okuꞌ.  Pak-e takal nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon nog pakai kuasa odop-e ingan tilimaꞌ-e.
pairs.target: I have come in my Father’s name, and you don’t receive me. If another comes in his own name, you will receive him.

pairs.source: Wat ki wat ingan dapod yaꞌ bisayaꞌ, moꞌ jok ingan kalik pudi soꞌ tipan odop ingan duoh doliaꞌ ingan kagaꞌ kalik mudi soꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ jok-e niꞌ?
pairs.target: How can you believe, who receive glory from one another, and you don’t seek the glory that comes from the only God?

pairs.source: Maꞌ pikil nang Okuꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nyalah ingan deꞌ sulung jowin Samaꞌ.  Deꞌ yaꞌ nyalah ingan iyoh leh Musa, tiap iyoh leh deꞌ alap ingan nang yaꞌ nuaꞌ odop ingan.
pairs.target: “Don’t think that I will accuse you to the Father. There is one who accuses you, even Moses, on whom you have set your hope.

pairs.source: Dop-e moꞌ ingan bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Musa, totu ingan bisayaꞌ geh tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, dop-e Musa moꞌ nulis tentang Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: For if you believed Moses, you would believe me; for he wrote about me.

pairs.source: Pak-e moꞌ diꞌ ingan bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nulis Musa, wat ki wat ingan dapod yaꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nang Kuꞌ?”
pairs.target: But if you don’t believe his writings, how will you believe my words?”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ motas keꞌ polad donu Galilea deꞌ nang nyaꞌa geh donu Tiberias.
pairs.target: After these things, Jesus went away to the other side of the sea of Galilee, which is also called the Sea of Tiberias.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa bogoꞌ moꞌ siuah-siuah nunaꞌ-E, dop-e nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ bogoꞌ tanda soꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa deꞌ nai-E tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ monam, takal-E odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ mokuaꞌ.
pairs.target: A great multitude followed him, because they saw his signs which he did on those who were sick.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ maꞌad ke dolod yohmoꞌ guluꞌ duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E danoꞌ.
pairs.target: Jesus went up into the mountain, and he sat there with his disciples.

pairs.source: Takal inoh onu ayuh Paskah ulang Yahudi moꞌ sinok.
pairs.target: Now the Passover, the feast of the Jews, was at hand.

pairs.source: Takal Yesus ningaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ siuah-siuah-e nog tuduꞌ odop-E, Iyoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Filipus in-E, “Daki toꞌ yaꞌ milih kueh saꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ itih dapod man?”
pairs.target: Jesus therefore lifting up his eyes, and seeing that a great multitude was coming to him, said to Philip, “Where are we to buy bread, that these may eat?”

pairs.source: Yesus sikian in inoh ngan-e yaꞌ nguji Filipus, dop-e odop Yesus moꞌ puꞌan oni deꞌ yaꞌ nai-E.
pairs.target: This he said to test him, for he himself knew what he would do.

pairs.source: Filipus moꞌ nyawot-E, “Bial nyeꞌ milih kueh pakai duit duwoh latus kiping pilak tuang idoh geh diꞌ-e sukup saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ mutiꞌ, bial nyeꞌ bikutung pakai nyipiak kueh-e ngaꞌ sit ngaꞌ sit.”
pairs.target: Philip answered him, “Two hundred denarii worth of bread is not sufficient for them, that everyone of them may receive a little.”

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus, deꞌ adon-e Andreas, sudiꞌ Simon Petrus, iyoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Yesus,
pairs.target: One of his disciples, Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother, said to him,

pairs.source: “Datiꞌ ogiꞌ niꞌ onak opot dali deꞌ kakuꞌ limoh kiping kueh gandum baya duwoh polong ikian, pak-e doiꞌ-e sukup saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ kiang kiang itih.”
pairs.target: “There is a boy here who has five barley loaves and two fish, but what are these among so many?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ guluꞌ.” Topat inoh sida duh-e.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ guluꞌ deꞌ totaꞌ duh.  Odop-e deꞌ dali sijaꞌ-a ogiꞌ kulang lobih limoh libu naꞌan.
pairs.target: Jesus said, “Have the people sit down.” Now there was much grass in that place. So the men sat down, in number about five thousand.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ mit kueh inoh, Iyoh moꞌ bidoa bisukul.  Mokuaꞌ inoh Iyoh moꞌ odaꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E bikutung kueh inoh tuduꞌ ayua deꞌ guluꞌ inoh, wat noh geh Iyoh nai duoh ikian-e.  Suaꞌ nyaꞌa man nog-e busuah.
pairs.target: Jesus took the loaves; and having given thanks, he distributed to the disciples, and the disciples to those who were sitting down; likewise also of the fish as much as they desired.

pairs.source: Takal nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ busuah, Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, “Nguluk suaꞌ lobih-e saꞌ-a doiꞌ deꞌ saꞌat nyaꞌa.”
pairs.target: When they were filled, he said to his disciples, “Gather up the broken pieces which are left over, that nothing be lost.”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nguluk-e.  Soꞌ deꞌ limoh kiping kueh gandum deꞌ man nyaꞌa, aluaꞌ ogiꞌ lobih-e simoong duwoh bakul deꞌ bagaꞌ.
pairs.target: So they gathered them up, and filled twelve baskets with broken pieces from the five barley loaves, which were left over by those who had eaten.

pairs.source: Takal nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ ningaꞌ tanda soꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa deꞌ nai Yesus, nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sina, “Iyoh itih bonal-bonal Nabi deꞌ sobot nyaꞌa nang yaꞌ nog kaang dunia.”
pairs.target: When therefore the people saw the sign which Jesus did, they said, “This is truly the prophet who comes into the world.”

pairs.source: Dop-e Yesus puꞌan nang odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ paksa odop-E odaꞌ jadin laja.  Yoh ngan Yesus moꞌ buu keꞌ dolod sadiꞌ-E.
pairs.target: Jesus therefore, perceiving that they were about to come and take him by force, to make him king, withdrew again to the mountain by himself.

pairs.source: Takal onu moꞌ yaꞌ ngalom, pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus moꞌ odi keꞌ donu, yoh moꞌ muat kaang olud,
pairs.target: When evening came, his disciples went down to the sea,

pairs.source: yohmoꞌ motas keꞌ kota Kapernaum.  Nog onu moꞌ mopung, Yesus aluaꞌ geh diꞌ-e nog tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: and they entered into the boat, and were going over the sea to Capernaum. It was now dark, and Jesus had not come to them.

pairs.source: Takal inoh sobak libut moꞌ nog, gilumang ayuh moꞌ mokat deꞌ donu.
pairs.target: The sea was tossed by a great wind blowing.

pairs.source: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bikayuh olud-e daang limoh nog nuam kilo, yoh moꞌ ningaꞌ   odi sinok olud odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ tolu.
pairs.target: When therefore they had rowed about twenty-five or thirty stadia,  they saw Jesus walking on the sea, and drawing near to the boat; and they were afraid.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Itih Okuꞌ, maꞌ tolu!”
pairs.target: But he said to them, “It is I. Don’t be afraid.”

pairs.source: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ngojit Yesus sina in noh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ doon otin-e ngijaꞌ Yesus maꞌad kaang olud-e.  Takal inoh geh tang-tang olud-e moꞌ lasuꞌ nog keꞌ polad donu.
pairs.target: They were willing therefore to receive him into the boat. Immediately the boat was at the land where they were going.

pairs.source: Tiaꞌ pagi-e nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ deꞌ aluaꞌ loꞌo deꞌ polad donu moꞌ ningaꞌ olud deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ sumia-e moꞌ doiꞌ, dop-e pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus moꞌ ponu pakai olud inoh, pak-e deꞌ puꞌan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, Yesus diꞌ-e suwaꞌ duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E.
pairs.target: On the next day, the multitude that stood on the other side of the sea saw that there was no other boat there, except the one in which his disciples had embarked, and that Jesus hadn’t entered with his disciples into the boat, but his disciples had gone away alone.

pairs.source: Takal inoh nog kudu-kudu olud soꞌ Tiberias.  Olud-olud deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ loꞌo sinok topat soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ man kueh, takal Yesus mokuaꞌ bidoa bisukul.
pairs.target: However boats from Tiberias came near to the place where they ate the bread after the Lord had given thanks.

pairs.source: Takal nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ ningaꞌ Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E doiꞌ danoꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ muat kaang olud-olud deꞌ tuang-e nog deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ odi kalik Yesus keꞌ Kapernaum.
pairs.target: When the multitude therefore saw that Jesus wasn’t there, nor his disciples, they themselves got into the boats, and came to Capernaum, seeking Jesus.

pairs.source: Takal nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ bitapod duoh Yesus deꞌ polad donu inoh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, “Gulu, siniaꞌ Ingan nog katiꞌ?”
pairs.target: When they found him on the other side of the sea, they asked him, “Rabbi, when did you come here?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan bonal-bonal, ingan kalik Okuꞌ, dop-e ingan moꞌ man kueh nog ingan busuah, idoh diꞌ-e ngan ingan moꞌ ningaꞌ tanda-tanda deꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: Jesus answered them, “Most certainly I tell you, you seek me, not because you saw signs, but because you ate of the loaves, and were filled.

pairs.source: Maꞌ kiloja saꞌan pinguman deꞌ ponai obuaꞌ duoh moduaꞌ, pak-e kiloja leh saꞌan pinguman deꞌ taan nah-nah deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah, deꞌ yaꞌ ngin Onak Manusia tuduꞌ ingan.  Topaꞌ Samaꞌ moꞌ ngin tanda situju jok-e tuduꞌ Iyoh.”
pairs.target: Don’t work for the food which perishes, but for the food which remains to eternal life, which the Son of Man will give to you. For God the Father has sealed him.”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Yesus, “Oni deꞌ halus koꞌih nai-e ngan koꞌih nai oni deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ?”
pairs.target: They said therefore to him, “What must we do, that we may work the works of God?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Bisayaꞌ leh tuduꞌ Iyoh deꞌ pait Topaꞌ, inohleh deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: Jesus answered them, “This is the work of God, that you believe in him whom he has sent.”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e, “Tanda oni deꞌ nai Ingan, saꞌ koꞌih ningaꞌ-e duoh saꞌ koꞌih bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Ingan? Oni wat oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nai Ingan?
pairs.target: They said therefore to him, “What then do you do for a sign, that we may see, and believe you? What work do you do?

pairs.source: Sumuk babai koꞌih moꞌ man kueh manna deꞌ soꞌ siluga takal-e deꞌ padang pasil, kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ obuah nulis, ‘Iyoh ngin man tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, kueh deꞌ soꞌ siluga.’ ”
pairs.target: Our fathers ate the manna in the wilderness. As it is written, ‘He gave them bread out of heaven to eat.’”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan bonal-bonal: Idoh diꞌ-e Musa deꞌ ngin man kueh soꞌ siluga deꞌ ingan, pak-e Samaꞌ Kuꞌ leh deꞌ ngin man kueh deꞌ bonal-bonal soꞌ siluga deꞌ ingan.
pairs.target: Jesus therefore said to them, “Most certainly, I tell you, it wasn’t Moses who gave you the bread out of heaven, but my Father gives you the true bread out of heaven.

pairs.source: Dop-e kueh deꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ iyoh leh kueh deꞌ muun soꞌ siluga duoh ngin idip saꞌan manusia deꞌ dunia.”
pairs.target: For the bread of God is that which comes down out of heaven, and gives life to the world.”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ Yesus, “Gulu, ngin leh telus-telus kueh inoh tuduꞌ koꞌih.”
pairs.target: They said therefore to him, “Lord, always give us this bread.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Okuꞌ leh kueh deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa idip.  Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ nog tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, nah-nah diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ yaꞌ pilai, duoh osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ iyoh nah-nah diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ asong-e bodoh.
pairs.target: Jesus said to them, “I am the bread of life. He who comes to me will not be hungry, and he who believes in me will never be thirsty.

pairs.source: Pak-e samah kodaꞌ deꞌ dioꞌ Kuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan, bial ingan moꞌ ningaꞌ Okuꞌ, pak-e diꞌ ingan bisayaꞌ.
pairs.target: But I told you that you have seen me, and yet you don’t believe.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ Kuꞌ deꞌ ngin Samaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, yaꞌ nog tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.  Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ nulak osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ nog tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: All those whom the Father gives me will come to me. He who comes to me I will in no way throw out.

pairs.source: Dop-e Okuꞌ muun soꞌ siluga, idoh diꞌ-e ngan Okuꞌ yaꞌ nai oni deꞌ laꞌan odop Kuꞌ, pak-e ngan Okuꞌ nai oni deꞌ laꞌan Iyoh deꞌ pait Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: For I have come down from heaven, not to do my own will, but the will of him who sent me.

pairs.source: Itih leh deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ deꞌ pait Okuꞌ: saꞌ-e suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngin-E tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, doiꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ moyap, pak-e Okuꞌ yaꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ paliꞌ idip takal piobuaꞌ dunia.
pairs.target: This is the will of my Father who sent me, that of all he has given to me I should lose nothing, but should raise him up at the last day.

pairs.source: Dop-e itih leh deꞌ laꞌan Samaꞌ Kuꞌ, saꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ Onak duoh bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ-E, soꞌon idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah, duoh saꞌ Okuꞌ odaꞌ paliꞌ idip takal piobuaꞌ dunia.”
pairs.target: This is the will of the one who sent me, that everyone who sees the Son, and believes in him, should have eternal life; and I will raise him up at the last day.”

pairs.source: Ayua pimipin ulang Yahudi moꞌ bikutuk-bigonom, dop-e Yesus nang, “Okuꞌ leh kueh deꞌ muun soꞌ Siluga.”
pairs.target: The Jews therefore murmured concerning him, because he said, “I am the bread which came down out of heaven.”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sina, “Idoh keh diꞌ-e Iyoh itih Yesus, onak Yusuf, sinoꞌ samaꞌ-e otoꞌ puꞌan-e? Oni nai-e adin Iyoh nang odop-e muun soꞌ siluga?”
pairs.target: They said, “Isn’t this Jesus, the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? How then does he say, ‘I have come down out of heaven?’”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Maꞌ ingan bikutuk-bigonom deꞌ in inoh.
pairs.target: Therefore Jesus answered them, “Don’t murmur among yourselves.

pairs.source: Niꞌ tuang doiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ tapod nog tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, simoꞌ-e diꞌ-e Samaꞌ deꞌ pait Okuꞌ deꞌ toban nyaꞌa inoh tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.  Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ nog tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, Okuꞌ yaꞌ odaꞌ iyoh paliꞌ idip takal piobuaꞌ dunia.
pairs.target: No one can come to me unless the Father who sent me draws him, and I will raise him up in the last day.

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ deꞌ obuah nulis deꞌ buk nabi-nabi in-e: ‘Suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ obuah ngajal odaꞌ Topaꞌ.’ Ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ ngojit duoh bilajal soꞌ Samaꞌ nog tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: It is written in the prophets, ‘They will all be taught by God.’   Therefore everyone who hears from the Father, and has learned, comes to me.

pairs.source: Idoh diꞌ-e loti-e moꞌ ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ Samaꞌ.  Jok-e Okuꞌ sijaꞌ-e, dop-e Okuꞌ deꞌ nog soꞌ Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: Not that anyone has seen the Father, except he who is from God. He has seen the Father.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan bonal-bonal, osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ bisayaꞌ, iyoh kakuꞌ idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah.
pairs.target: Most certainly, I tell you, he who believes in me has eternal life.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ leh kueh deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa idip.
pairs.target: I am the bread of life.

pairs.source:
sumuk babai ingan moꞌ man kueh manna takal-e aluaꞌ deꞌ padang pasil, pak-e
odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ obuaꞌ kobos.
pairs.target: Your fathers ate the manna in the wilderness, and they died.

pairs.source: Pak-e kueh deꞌ muun soꞌ siluga adin ogiꞌ datiꞌ; Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ man, iyoh diꞌ-e yaꞌ kobos.
pairs.target: This is the bread which comes down out of heaven, that anyone may eat of it and not die.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ leh kueh deꞌ muun soꞌ siluga, kueh deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa idip.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ man kueh itih yaꞌ nah-nah idip.  Kueh deꞌ yaꞌ ngin Kuꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ manusia daang dunia idip iyoh leh dagin odop Kuꞌ.”
pairs.target: I am the living bread which came down out of heaven. If anyone eats of this bread, he will live forever. Yes, the bread which I will give for the life of the world is my flesh.”

pairs.source: Ayua pimipin ulang Yahudi moꞌ bikaꞌi bikalah tipan odop-e, yoh moꞌ in-e, “Oni wat Iyoh yaꞌ ngin dagin-E tuduꞌ otoꞌ odaꞌ otoꞌ man-e?”
pairs.target: The Jews therefore contended with one another, saying, “How can this man give us his flesh to eat?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan bonal-bonal, simoꞌ diꞌ ingan man dagin Onak Manusia duoh nuak doyaꞌ-E, idoh diꞌ ingan yaꞌ bonal-bonal idip.
pairs.target: Jesus therefore said to them, “Most certainly I tell you, unless you eat the flesh of the Son of Man and drink his blood, you don’t have life in yourselves.

pairs.source: Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ man dagin Kuꞌ duoh nuak doyaꞌ Kuꞌ, iyoh kakuꞌ idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah, duoh Okuꞌ yaꞌ odaꞌ iyoh paliꞌ idip takal piobuaꞌ dunia.
pairs.target: He who eats my flesh and drinks my blood has eternal life, and I will raise him up at the last day.

pairs.source: Dop-e dagin Kuꞌ pinguman deꞌ sibonal-e duoh doyaꞌ Kuꞌ pingunuak deꞌ sibonal-e.
pairs.target: For my flesh is food indeed, and my blood is drink indeed.

pairs.source: Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ man dagin Kuꞌ duoh nuak doyaꞌ Kuꞌ, iyoh idip niꞌ duoh Okuꞌ, Okuꞌ duoh iyoh.
pairs.target: He who eats my flesh and drinks my blood lives in me, and I in him.

pairs.source: Samaꞌ deꞌ ngin idip inoh, moꞌ pait Okuꞌ, Okuꞌ moꞌ idip odaꞌ Samaꞌ.  Wat inoh geh nyaꞌa deꞌ man dagin Kuꞌ yaꞌ idip odaꞌ Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: As the living Father sent me, and I live because of the Father; so he who feeds on me, he will also live because of me.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ itih leh kueh deꞌ muun soꞌ siluga: idoh diꞌ-e kodaꞌ kueh deꞌ man sumuk babai ingan, dop-e odop-e deꞌ man kueh inoh tuang kobos geh.  Pak-e osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ man kueh itih, iyoh yaꞌ idip nah-nah.”
pairs.target: This is the bread which came down out of heaven—not as our fathers ate the manna, and died. He who eats this bread will live forever.”

pairs.source: Suaꞌ pingunang itih Yesus tanon-e takal-e ngajal deꞌ topat simayang agama Yahudi deꞌ Kapernaum.
pairs.target: He said these things in the synagogue, as he taught in Capernaum.

pairs.source: Takal-e mokuaꞌ ngojit pingajal Yesus inoh, bogoꞌ soꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Pingajal itih sikiya baat.  Doiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tapod tilimaꞌ.”
pairs.target: Therefore many of his disciples, when they heard this, said, “This is a hard saying! Who can listen to it?”

pairs.source: Daang otin-E Yesus puꞌan nang pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E bikutuk-bigonom deꞌ in inoh.  Yesus moꞌ sina in-e, “Pingajal kuꞌ itih kaso pikil ingan keh?
pairs.target: But Jesus knowing in himself that his disciples murmured at this, said to them, “Does this cause you to stumble?

pairs.source: Oni jadin-e simoꞌ ingan ningaꞌ Onak Manusia paliꞌ maꞌad keꞌ topat-E soꞌ-e nog?
pairs.target: Then what if you would see the Son of Man ascending to where he was before?

pairs.source: Iyang Topaꞌ leh deꞌ odaꞌ manusia idip.  Odop manusia diꞌ-e tapod odaꞌ manusia idip.  Pingunang deꞌ tanon Kuꞌ tuduꞌ ingan inoh soꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ, pingunang deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa idip.
pairs.target: It is the spirit who gives life. The flesh profits nothing. The words that I speak to you are spirit, and are life.

pairs.source: Pak-e ogiꞌ deꞌ soꞌ ingan deꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ.” (Dop-e Yesus moꞌ dioꞌ puꞌan osi deꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ duoh osi deꞌ yaꞌ jua Yesus tuduꞌ musuh-musuh-E.)
pairs.target: But there are some of you who don’t believe.” For Jesus knew from the beginning who they were who didn’t believe, and who it was who would betray him.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ sina lagiꞌ, “Inoh leh ngan Okuꞌ moꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Niꞌ naꞌan tuang doiꞌ geh deꞌ tapod nog tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, simoꞌ Samaꞌ diꞌ-e ngin tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.”
pairs.target: He said, “For this cause I have said to you that no one can come to me, unless it is given to him by my Father.”

pairs.source: Mulai takal inoh bogoꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E deꞌ buu togan Yesus, diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ nunaꞌ-E.
pairs.target: At this, many of his disciples went back, and walked no more with him.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-E deꞌ simoong duwoh naꞌan inoh, “Podo ingan yaꞌ togan Okuꞌ geh?”
pairs.target: Jesus said therefore to the twelve, “You don’t also want to go away, do you?”

pairs.source: Simon Petrus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Tuduꞌ osi koꞌih yaꞌ odi? Pingunang Ingan yohleh pingunang deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah.
pairs.target: Simon Peter answered him, “Lord, to whom would we go? You have the words of eternal life.

pairs.source: Koꞌih moꞌ bonal-bonal bisayaꞌ duoh puꞌan nang Ingan leh deꞌ jok-e Topaꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ, deꞌ pait-E.”
pairs.target: We have come to believe and know that you are the Christ, the Son of the living God.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Okuꞌ sadiꞌ Kuꞌ deꞌ moꞌ pilih ingan deꞌ simoong duwoh naꞌan itih, pak-e ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ ingan itih Laja Muat munua.”
pairs.target: Jesus answered them, “Didn’t I choose you, the twelve, and one of you is a devil?”

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ nang Yesus inoh yohleh Yudas, onak Simon Iskariot, dop-e iyoh leh deꞌ yaꞌ jua Yesus tuduꞌ musuh-musuh-E, tiap iyoh inoh niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ odop-e deꞌ simoong duwoh naꞌan pinunaꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: Now he spoke of Judas, the son of Simon Iscariot, for it was he who would betray him, being one of the twelve.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ ponu keꞌ kota-kota deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ Galilea.  Iyoh doliaꞌ-e ponu keꞌ kota-kota deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ Yudea, dop-e deꞌ Yudea ayua pimipin ulang Yahudi kagaꞌ yaꞌ ngabos Iyoh.
pairs.target: After these things, Jesus was walking in Galilee, for he wouldn’t walk in Judea, because the Jews sought to kill him.

pairs.source: Takal inoh moꞌ sinok onu ayuh ulang Yahudi deꞌ sobot-e nang Onu Ayuh Pondok Daun.
pairs.target: Now the feast of the Jews, the Feast of Booths, was at hand.

pairs.source: Sudiꞌ-E deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Yesus, “Lobih paguh muꞌu togan topat itih nyeꞌ moꞌ odi keꞌ Yudea, saꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Muꞌ tapod ningaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai Muꞌ.
pairs.target: His brothers therefore said to him, “Depart from here, and go into Judea, that your disciples also may see your works which you do.

pairs.source: Moꞌ nyam Muꞌ laꞌan jadin nyaꞌa deꞌ timogah, maꞌ yaꞌ suwan oniꞌ deꞌ nai Muꞌ, bitanga odop Muꞌ saꞌ suaꞌ manusia deꞌ dunia puꞌan-e.”
pairs.target: For no one does anything in secret, and himself seeks to be known openly. If you do these things, reveal yourself to the world.”

pairs.source: Dop-e sudiꞌ-E deꞌ munoꞌ tuang idoh geh diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Iyoh.
pairs.target: For even his brothers didn’t believe in him.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot sudiꞌ-E deꞌ munoꞌ, “Aluaꞌ diꞌ-e nog onu Kuꞌ, pak-e ingan siniaꞌ sijaꞌ-e ponai odi.
pairs.target: Jesus therefore said to them, “My time has not yet come, but your time is always ready.

pairs.source: Manusia deꞌ dunia diꞌ-e tapod buꞌui tuduꞌ ingan.  Pak-e yoh buꞌui tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, dop-e Okuꞌ mala tanon tentang oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat deꞌ nai nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: The world can’t hate you, but it hates me, because I testify about it, that its works are evil.

pairs.source: Odi negeh ingan daang onu ayuh inoh.  Idoh diꞌ Kuꞌ odi dop-e aluaꞌ diꞌ-e nog onu Kuꞌ.”
pairs.target: You go up to the feast. I am not yet going up to this feast, because my time is not yet fulfilled.”

pairs.source: In inoh leh Yesus sina tuduꞌ sudiꞌ-E deꞌ munoꞌ, Iyoh sadiꞌ-E totap loꞌo deꞌ Galilea.
pairs.target: Having said these things to them, he stayed in Galilee.

pairs.source: Takal sudiꞌ-E deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ odi keꞌ Onu Ayuh Pondok Daun, kudu-kudu onu-e mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus tuang odi geh, pak-e diꞌ-e tanon deꞌ osi-osi-e duoh doiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ puꞌan.
pairs.target: But when his brothers had gone up to the feast, then he also went up, not publicly, but as it were in secret.

pairs.source: Pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi moꞌ kalik Iyoh daang onu ayuh inoh, yohmoꞌ sina in-e, “Daki soꞌ Iyoh?”
pairs.target: The Jews therefore sought him at the feast, and said, “Where is he?”

pairs.source: Bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bikayas-kayas tentang Iyoh.  Ogiꞌ deꞌ sina in-e, “Iyoh ulang deꞌ paguh.” Ogiꞌ geh deꞌ In-e, “Idoh! Iyoh tukang odaꞌ nyaꞌa bogoꞌ moyap soꞌ olan deꞌ bonal.”
pairs.target: There was much murmuring among the multitudes concerning him. Some said, “He is a good man.” Others said, “Not so, but he leads the multitude astray.”

pairs.source: Pak-e niꞌ tuang doiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ puus sina suang-suang in-e tentang Yesus, dop-e tolu tuduꞌ pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi.
pairs.target: Yet no one spoke openly of him for fear of the Jews.

pairs.source: Takal lopot nyaꞌa nyamut Onu Ayuh, Yesus molot kaang limang Boli Topaꞌ, yohmoꞌ ngajal nyaꞌa.
pairs.target: But when it was now the middle of the feast, Jesus went up into the temple and taught.

pairs.source: Ayua pimipin ulang Yahudi moꞌ sukup ilan-e, yohmoꞌ sitipan odop-e in-e, “Oni nai nyaꞌa itih bogoꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ puꞌan-e, tiap doiꞌ-e nak ogiꞌ sidoh-E bilajal kodaꞌ otoꞌ?”
pairs.target: The Jews therefore marveled, saying, “How does this man know letters, having never been educated?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal Kuꞌ, idoh diꞌ-e soꞌ odop Kuꞌ, pak-e soꞌ Iyoh deꞌ pait Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: Jesus therefore answered them, “My teaching is not mine, but his who sent me.

pairs.source: Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ nai oni deꞌ laꞌan Iyoh, nyaꞌa inoh yaꞌ puꞌan nang oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal Kuꞌ nog soꞌ Topaꞌ, idoh diꞌ-e soꞌ odop Kuꞌ.
pairs.target: If anyone desires to do his will, he will know about the teaching, whether it is from God, or if I am speaking from myself.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ ngajal oniꞌ soꞌ odop-e sadiꞌ-e, iyoh kalik odaꞌ nyaꞌa pimodo tuduꞌ odop-e.  Pak-e simoꞌ Okuꞌ kalik saꞌ nyaꞌa pimodo tuduꞌ Iyoh deꞌ moꞌ pait Okuꞌ, nyaꞌa dapod bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ pingunang Kuꞌ duoh diꞌ Kuꞌ pibulaꞌ.
pairs.target: He who speaks from himself seeks his own glory, but he who seeks the glory of him who sent him is true, and no unrighteousness is in him.

pairs.source: Musa moꞌ ngin atulan Topaꞌ tuduꞌ ingan, pak-e niꞌ naꞌan tuang doiꞌ geh soꞌ ingan deꞌ nunaꞌ atulan Topaꞌ inoh.  Oni nai ingan kagaꞌ yaꞌ ngabos Okuꞌ?”
pairs.target: Didn’t Moses give you the law, and yet none of you keeps the law? Why do you seek to kill me?”

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-E, “Ingan obuah nguasa odaꞌ muat! Osi deꞌ kagaꞌ yaꞌ ngabos Ingan?”
pairs.target: The multitude answered, “You have a demon! Who seeks to kill you?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Jok-e niꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai Kuꞌ daang onu Sabat, pak-e ingan moꞌ ilan-e.
pairs.target: Jesus answered them, “I did one work, and you all marvel because of it.

pairs.source: Musa ngin atulan odaꞌ ingan bisunat, inoh leh ngan-e ogiꞌ geh onu ingan bisunat nyaꞌa daang onu Sabat.  (Sibonal-e atulan bisunat inoh idoh diꞌ-e soꞌ Musa, pak-e soꞌ sumuk babai otoꞌ deꞌ dioꞌ soꞌ Musa.)
pairs.target: Moses has given you circumcision (not that it is of Moses, but of the fathers), and on the Sabbath you circumcise a boy.

pairs.source: Ingan bisunat nyaꞌa daang onu Sabat, saꞌ diꞌ ingan lawan atulan bisunat deꞌ soꞌ Musa.  Moꞌ-e wat inoh maꞌ ingan malah tuduꞌ Okuꞌ dop-e Okuꞌ odaꞌ gonan nyaꞌa deꞌ monam mokuaꞌ suaꞌ-e daang onu Sabat.
pairs.target: If a boy receives circumcision on the Sabbath, that the law of Moses may not be broken, are you angry with me, because I made a man completely healthy on the Sabbath?

pairs.source: Maꞌ yaꞌ motod nang nyaꞌa salah soꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ tonga, pak-e motod leh pakai olan deꞌ bonal.”
pairs.target: Don’t judge according to appearance, but judge righteous judgment.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh kudu-kudu naꞌan ulang Yerusalem sina, “Idoh keh diꞌ-e Iyoh itih deꞌ obuah kalik odaꞌ ayua pimipin otoꞌ ngan-e yaꞌ ngabos-E?
pairs.target: Therefore some of them of Jerusalem said, “Isn’t this he whom they seek to kill?

pairs.source: Suba ningaꞌ Iyoh sina suang-suang in-e, pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ doiꞌ deꞌ nang oni-oni-e tuduꞌ-E.  Podo tok keh pimipin otoꞌ moꞌ puꞌan nang Iyoh inoh Laja Pinyilamat?
pairs.target: Behold, he speaks openly, and they say nothing to him. Can it be that the rulers indeed know that this is truly the Christ?

pairs.source: Pak-e Nyaꞌa itih otoꞌ puꞌan soꞌ ki soꞌ-E nog, pak-e moꞌ Laja Pinyilamat nog, doiꞌ osi-osi deꞌ puꞌan soꞌ ki Iyoh nog.”
pairs.target: However we know where this man comes from, but when the Christ comes, no one will know where he comes from.”

pairs.source: Takal Yesus ngajal deꞌ limang Boli Topaꞌ, Iyoh sina luꞌow-luꞌow-E in-e, “Tok ingan puꞌan osi Okuꞌ duoh soꞌ ki soꞌ Kuꞌ nog; pak-e Okuꞌ nog idoh diꞌ-e odop Kuꞌ deꞌ laꞌan.  Pak-e Okuꞌ obuah pait odaꞌ Iyoh deꞌ dapod nyaꞌa bisayaꞌ daꞌ-E, deꞌ diꞌ ingan puꞌan-E.
pairs.target: Jesus therefore cried out in the temple, teaching and saying, “You both know me, and know where I am from. I have not come of myself, but he who sent me is true, whom you don’t know.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ piluh Iyoh, dop-e Okuꞌ nog soꞌ Iyoh, duoh Iyoh leh deꞌ pait Okuꞌ.”
pairs.target: I know him, because I am from him, and he sent me.”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ kagaꞌ yaꞌ takap Yesus, pak-e doiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ supot yaꞌ nyonguam Iyoh, dop-e aluaꞌ diꞌ-e nog onu-e.
pairs.target: They sought therefore to take him; but no one laid a hand on him, because his hour had not yet come.

pairs.source: Pak-e soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ inoh, bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e, “Simoꞌ Laja Pinyilamat nog, dapod keh Iyoh nai lobih bogoꞌ tanda soꞌ Topaꞌ, soꞌ deꞌ nai Yesus itih?”
pairs.target: But of the multitude, many believed in him. They said, “When the Christ comes, he won’t do more signs than those which this man has done, will he?”

pairs.source: Kudu-kudu naꞌan ulang Farisi ngojit nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ bikayas-kayas tentang Yesus.  Inoh leh ngan ayua pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh duoh ulang-ulang Farisi odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tukang jaga Boli Topaꞌ takap Iyoh.
pairs.target: The Pharisees heard the multitude murmuring these things concerning him, and the chief priests and the Pharisees sent officers to arrest him.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ, “Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ tiyaꞌ tuui ogiꞌ duoh ingan.  Mokuaꞌ inoh Okuꞌ yaꞌ paliꞌ tuduꞌ Iyoh deꞌ pait Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: Then Jesus said, “I will be with you a little while longer, then I go to him who sent me.

pairs.source: Ingan yaꞌ kalik Okuꞌ, pak-e diꞌ ingan tungang dapod Okuꞌ, dop-e diꞌ ingan tungang nog keꞌ topat soꞌ Okuꞌ odi inoh.”
pairs.target: You will seek me, and won’t find me; and where I am, you can’t come.”

pairs.source: Yoh ngan pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi moꞌ sina sitipan odop-e, “Kaki soꞌ Iyoh yaꞌ odi, ngan-e nang otoꞌ diꞌ toꞌ tungang yaꞌ tapod odop-E? Oni keh Iyoh odi tuduꞌ ulang-ulang Yahudi deꞌ loꞌo deꞌ sopaꞌ Israel, deꞌ kota-kota ulang Yunani, duoh ngajal ulang Yunani?
pairs.target: The Jews therefore said among themselves, “Where will this man go that we won’t find him? Will he go to the Dispersion among the Greeks, and teach the Greeks?

pairs.source: Oni loti sina deꞌ nang-E in tih: ‘Ingan yaꞌ kalik Okuꞌ, pak-e diꞌ ingan tungang dapod Okuꞌ,’ duoh: ‘Diꞌ ingan tungang nog topat soꞌ Okuꞌ odi inoh?’ ”
pairs.target: What is this word that he said, ‘You will seek me, and won’t find me; and where I am, you can’t come’?”

pairs.source: Daang onu piobuaꞌ Onu Ayuh Pondok Daun, yohleh onu deꞌ paling penting-e, Yesus moꞌ mokat mujuag deꞌ limang Boli Topaꞌ, Iyoh moꞌ sina luꞌow-luꞌow-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ asong-e bodoh, nog leh tuduꞌ Okuꞌ saꞌ-e nuak!
pairs.target: Now on the last and greatest day of the feast, Jesus stood and cried out, “If anyone is thirsty, let him come to me and drink!

pairs.source: Osi sijaꞌ deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, kodaꞌ deꞌ obuah nulis daang buk Kitab, ‘Soꞌ aang otin-e paman piꞌin deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa idip.’ ”
pairs.target: He who believes in me, as the Scripture has said, from within him will flow rivers of living water.”

pairs.source: Loti oniꞌ deꞌ tanon Yesus inoh iyoh leh Iyang Topaꞌ, deꞌ yaꞌ tilimaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus.  Dop-e Iyang Topaꞌ aluaꞌ diꞌ-e obuah ngin, dop-e Yesus aluaꞌ diꞌ-e obuah pakat ngan-e yaꞌ obuah pimodo.
pairs.target: But he said this about the Spirit, which those believing in him were to receive. For the Holy Spirit was not yet given, because Jesus wasn’t yet glorified.

pairs.source: Kudu-kudu naꞌan soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ deꞌ ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ tanon Yesus moꞌ sina in-e, “Iyoh tih pasti Nabi deꞌ kajon toꞌ.”
pairs.target: Many of the multitude therefore, when they heard these words, said, “This is truly the prophet.”

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon deꞌ in-e, “Iyoh itih leh Laja Pinyilamat.” Pak-e in nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon, “Idoh! Laja Pinyilamat doiꞌ-e nog soꞌ Galilea!
pairs.target: Others said, “This is the Christ.” But some said, “What, does the Christ come out of Galilee?

pairs.source: Daang buk Kitab moꞌ obuah nulis nang Laja Pinyilamat inoh soꞌ onak sukun Laja Daud, duoh yaꞌ nog soꞌ Betlehem, kupuaꞌ topat Laja Daud obuah bilanak.”
pairs.target: Hasn’t the Scripture said that the Christ comes of the offspring of David,  and from Bethlehem, the village where David was?”

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ inoh moꞌ bikalah tentang Yesus.
pairs.target: So there arose a division in the multitude because of him.

pairs.source: Kudu-kudu naꞌan soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ yaꞌ takap Yesus, pak-e niꞌ naꞌan tuang doiꞌ geh deꞌ puus kagian-E.
pairs.target: Some of them would have arrested him, but no one laid hands on him.

pairs.source: Takal ayua nyaꞌa deꞌ jaga Boli Topaꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ-e takap Yesus moꞌ paliꞌ, ayua pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh duoh ulang-ulang Farisi moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Oni nai diꞌ ingan takap Iyoh toban katiꞌ?”
pairs.target: The officers therefore came to the chief priests and Pharisees, and they said to them, “Why didn’t you bring him?”

pairs.source: Ayua nyaꞌa deꞌ jaga Boli Topaꞌ moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Aluaꞌ doiꞌ sidoh koꞌih ngojit nyaꞌa deꞌ sina in Iyoh inoh!”
pairs.target: The officers answered, “No man ever spoke like this man!”

pairs.source: Ulang-ulang Farisi moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Podo ingan moꞌ suwaꞌ moyap soꞌ olan deꞌ bonal odaꞌ Iyoh?
pairs.target: The Pharisees therefore answered them, “You aren’t also led astray, are you?

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ keh nyaꞌa deꞌ soꞌ pimipin-pimipin otoꞌ keh ulang-ulang Farisi keh deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ-E?
pairs.target: Have any of the rulers believed in him, or of the Pharisees?

pairs.source: Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ inoh diꞌ-e puꞌan atulan-atulan Topaꞌ deꞌ nulis nabi Musa, ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ tulah!”
pairs.target: But this multitude that doesn’t know the law is accursed.”

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ adon Nikodemus soꞌ uluk ulang Farisi, deꞌ ogiꞌ sidoh-e nog tuduꞌ Yesus.  Iyoh moꞌ sina in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ,
pairs.target: Nicodemus (he who came to him by night, being one of them) said to them,

pairs.source: “Podo atulan Topaꞌ deꞌ nulis nabi Musa tanah odaꞌ otoꞌ ngukum nyaꞌa, simoꞌ-e aluaꞌ diꞌ nyeꞌ ngojit iyoh sina duoh aluaꞌ diꞌ nyeꞌ puꞌan oni wat oniꞌ deꞌ nai-e?”
pairs.target: “Does our law judge a man, unless it first hears from him personally and knows what he does?”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyinel Nikodemus in-e, “Podo muꞌu itih tuang ulang Galilea geh? Bilajal dioꞌ buk Kitab, saꞌ muꞌ puꞌan nang doiꞌ nabi deꞌ nog soꞌ Galilea!”
pairs.target: They answered him, “Are you also from Galilee? Search, and see that no prophet has arisen out of Galilee.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ motas keꞌ boli-e masim-masim.
pairs.target: Everyone went to his own house,

pairs.source: Pak-e Yesus odi keꞌ punguꞌ Zaitun.
pairs.target: but Jesus went to the Mount of Olives.

pairs.source: Onu tiaꞌ pagi-e, suam-suam pagi Iyoh paliꞌ odi keꞌ Boli Topaꞌ, bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nog tuduꞌ-E.  Yesus moꞌ guluꞌ, yohmoꞌ mulai ngajal nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: Now very early in the morning, he came again into the temple, and all the people came to him. He sat down, and taught them.

pairs.source: Kudu-kudu naꞌan gulu agama Yahudi duoh ulang Yahudi soꞌ uluk ulang Farisi moꞌ toban dayung deꞌ obuah nisog biamai.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ odaꞌ dayung inoh mujuag deꞌ uun uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ.
pairs.target: The scribes and the Pharisees brought a woman taken in adultery. Having set her in the middle,

pairs.source: Yohmoꞌ in odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus, “Gulu, dayung itih obuah nisog biamai.
pairs.target: they told him, “Teacher, we found this woman in adultery, in the very act.

pairs.source: Atulan Topaꞌ deꞌ nulis nabi Musa militah odaꞌ otoꞌ nyokad pakai batuh dayung-dayung deꞌ wat inoh nog-e kobos.  Oni wat-e moꞌ-e nunaꞌ pikil Ingan?”
pairs.target: Now in our law, Moses commanded us to stone such women. What then do you say about her?”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ sikian oniꞌ deꞌ in inoh madas ngan-e yaꞌ kalik sina Yesus deꞌ salah ngan-e nyalah-E.  Pak-e Yesus moꞌ nyuduk yohmoꞌ nulis deꞌ tanaꞌ pakai tilinyuꞌ-E.
pairs.target: They said this testing him, that they might have something to accuse him of. But Jesus stooped down, and wrote on the ground with his finger.

pairs.source: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ paliꞌ-paliꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Yesus, Iyoh moꞌ mokat mujuag yohmoꞌ in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ soꞌ ingan deꞌ mutiꞌ deꞌ diꞌ-e bidosa, iyoh leh deꞌ paling pidioꞌ-e nyokad dayung itih pakai batuh.”
pairs.target: But when they continued asking him, he looked up and said to them, “He who is without sin among you, let him throw the first stone at her.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ paliꞌ lagiꞌ nyuduk yohmoꞌ nulis deꞌ tanaꞌ.
pairs.target: Again he stooped down, and with his finger wrote on the ground.

pairs.source: Pak-e takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ngojit sina Yesus inoh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ buu ngaꞌ niꞌ ngaꞌ niꞌ soꞌ kanoꞌ, mulai soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ sukup nyoma.  Nyuang-nyuang-e duam Yesus sadiꞌ-e duoh dayung inoh deꞌ aluaꞌ deꞌ topat inoh.
pairs.target: They, when they heard it, being convicted by their conscience, went out one by one, beginning from the oldest, even to the last. Jesus was left alone with the woman where she was, in the middle.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ mokat mujuag yohmoꞌ sina tuduꞌ dayung inoh in-E, “Oi dayung, ki mey soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tiꞌ-e neh? Doiꞌ yeh odop-e deꞌ ngukum muꞌu neh?”
pairs.target: Jesus, standing up, saw her and said, “Woman, where are your accusers? Did no one condemn you?”

pairs.source: Dayung inoh moꞌ nyawot Yesus in-e, “Doiꞌ.” Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Okuꞌ tuang idoh geh diꞌ Kuꞌ ngukum muꞌu.  Paliꞌ negeh, mulai soꞌ adin maꞌ tiyaꞌ nai dosa.”
pairs.target: She said, “No one, Lord.” Jesus said, “Neither do I condemn you. Go your way. From now on, sin no more.”

pairs.source: Yesus sina lagiꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ in-E, “Okuꞌ leh jawaꞌ saꞌan manusia deꞌ dunia.  Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ nunaꞌ Okuꞌ, iyoh diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ ponu daang mopung, pak-e iyoh moꞌ ogiꞌ jawaꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa idip.”
pairs.target: Again, therefore, Jesus spoke to them, saying, “I am the light of the world. He who follows me will not walk in the darkness, but will have the light of life.”

pairs.source: Ulang Yahudi soꞌ uluk ulang Farisi moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ Yesus, “Ingan jadin tukang tanon tentang odop Ingan, jadin diꞌ koꞌih tilimaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ tanon Ingan inoh.”
pairs.target: The Pharisees therefore said to him, “You testify about yourself. Your testimony is not valid.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Bial Okuꞌ jadin tukang tanon tentang odop Kuꞌ, pak-e oniꞌ deꞌ tanon Kuꞌ bonal, dop-e Okuꞌ puꞌan soꞌ ki soꞌ Kuꞌ nog duoh kaki soꞌ Okuꞌ yaꞌ odi.  Pak-e ingan diꞌ ingan puꞌan Okuꞌ nog soꞌ kaki duoh kaki soꞌ Okuꞌ yaꞌ odi.
pairs.target: Jesus answered them, “Even if I testify about myself, my testimony is true, for I know where I came from, and where I am going; but you don’t know where I came from, or where I am going.

pairs.source: Ingan motod nang nyaꞌa salah duoh bonal nunaꞌ pikil odop ingan, pak-e Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ motod nang nyaꞌa salah duoh bonal.
pairs.target: You judge according to the flesh. I judge no one.

pairs.source: Pak-e simoꞌ Kuꞌ motod nang nyaꞌa salah duoh bonal, oniꞌ deꞌ motod Kuꞌ inoh bonal, dop-e Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ sadiꞌ Kuꞌ, Samaꞌ deꞌ pait Okuꞌ ogiꞌ samah-samah duoh Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: Even if I do judge, my judgment is true, for I am not alone, but I am with the Father who sent me.

pairs.source: Daang buk atulan Topaꞌ deꞌ nulis nabi Musa, ogiꞌ deꞌ in-e: Simoꞌ-e ogiꞌ duwoh naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ jadin tukang tanon tentang oni sijaꞌ-e, oniꞌ deꞌ tanon-e inoh tapod obuah tilimaꞌ.
pairs.target: It’s also written in your law that the testimony of two people is valid.

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ duwoh deꞌ tukang tanon tentang Okuꞌ, keꞌ niꞌ-e odop Kuꞌ, deꞌ keꞌ duwoh-e Samaꞌ Kuꞌ deꞌ pait Okuꞌ.”
pairs.target: I am one who testifies about myself, and the Father who sent me testifies about me.”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Yesus in-e, “Daki soꞌ Samaꞌ Ingan?” Yesus moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Ingan diꞌ ingan piluh bait Okuꞌ bait Samaꞌ Kuꞌ.  Simoꞌ ingan piluh Okuꞌ, totu ingan piluh Samaꞌ Kuꞌ.”
pairs.target: They said therefore to him, “Where is your Father?” Jesus answered, “You know neither me, nor my Father. If you knew me, you would know my Father also.”

pairs.source: Suaꞌ sina deꞌ munoꞌ Yesus tanon-e takal-E ngajal nyaꞌa deꞌ awah Boli Topaꞌ sinok kutak-kutak soꞌ nyaꞌa suad duit persembahan.  Pak-e niꞌ naꞌan tuang doiꞌ geh deꞌ takap Iyoh, dop-e aluaꞌ diꞌ-e nog onu-E.
pairs.target: Jesus spoke these words in the treasury, as he taught in the temple. Yet no one arrested him, because his hour had not yet come.

pairs.source: Yesus sina lagiꞌ tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Okuꞌ moꞌ yaꞌ buu yohmoꞌ ingan moꞌ yaꞌ kalik Okuꞌ, pak-e ingan yaꞌ kobos samah-samah duoh dosa ingan.  Doiꞌ ingan tungang nog topat soꞌ Okuꞌ odi.”
pairs.target: Jesus said therefore again to them, “I am going away, and you will seek me, and you will die in your sins. Where I go, you can’t come.”

pairs.source: Ayua pimipin ulang Yahudi deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sina, “Oni keh Iyoh yaꞌ ngabos odop-E ngan-e nang sina deꞌ in-e, ‘Ingan diꞌ ingan tungang nog topat soꞌ Okuꞌ odi?’ ”
pairs.target: The Jews therefore said, “Will he kill himself, because he says, ‘Where I am going, you can’t come’?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Ingan nog soꞌ douꞌ, Okuꞌ nog soꞌ somu; ingan nog soꞌ dunia itih, Okuꞌ idoh diꞌ Kuꞌ nog soꞌ dunia itih.
pairs.target: He said to them, “You are from beneath. I am from above. You are of this world. I am not of this world.

pairs.source: Iyoh leh ngan tiꞌ-e Okuꞌ tanon nang ingan yaꞌ kobos samah-samah duoh dosa ingan.  Dop-e simoꞌ diꞌ ingan bisayaꞌ nang Okuꞌ inoh leh odop-E, tok ingan yaꞌ kobos samah-samah duoh dosa ingan.”
pairs.target: I said therefore to you that you will die in your sins; for unless you believe that I am he, you will die in your sins.”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ, “Osi Ingan itih sibonal-e?” Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Okuꞌ moꞌ silalu tanon tuduꞌ ingan tentang osi Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: They said therefore to him, “Who are you?” Jesus said to them, “Just what I have been saying to you from the beginning.

pairs.source: Aluaꞌ bogoꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ dapod Kuꞌ tanon-e ngan Kuꞌ nang ingan salah.  Pak-e Iyoh deꞌ pait Okuꞌ tapod nyeꞌ bisayaꞌ daꞌ-E.  Okuꞌ jok Kuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ manusia daang dunia oni deꞌ moꞌ ngojit Kuꞌ soꞌ Iyoh.”
pairs.target: I have many things to speak and to judge concerning you. However he who sent me is true; and the things which I heard from him, these I say to the world.”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e ngiloti nang Yesus tanon tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tentang Samaꞌ.
pairs.target: They didn’t understand that he spoke to them about the Father.

pairs.source: Yoh ngan Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Simoꞌ ingan moꞌ paꞌad Onak Manusia deꞌ tun koyuh salip, ke ingan yaꞌ puꞌan nang Okuꞌ leh odop-E.  Ingan tuang yaꞌ puꞌan ingan geh nang suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai Kuꞌ, idoh diꞌ Kuꞌ nai nunaꞌ soꞌ odop Kuꞌ sadiꞌ Kuꞌ, pak-e Okuꞌ jok Kuꞌ tanon suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal Samaꞌ Kuꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: Jesus therefore said to them, “When you have lifted up the Son of Man, then you will know that I am he, and I do nothing of myself, but as my Father taught me, I say these things.

pairs.source: Iyoh deꞌ pait Okuꞌ, ogiꞌ samah-samah duoh Okuꞌ.  Iyoh diꞌ-e tanah odaꞌ Okuꞌ sadiꞌ Kuꞌ, dop-e Okuꞌ silalu nai oniꞌ deꞌ nyonang otin-E.”
pairs.target: He who sent me is with me. The Father hasn’t left me alone, for I always do the things that are pleasing to him.”

pairs.source: Takal Yesus mokuaꞌ tanon suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ, yohmoꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ-E.
pairs.target: As he spoke these things, many believed in him.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ ulang-ulang Yahudi deꞌ moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ odop-E, “Simoꞌ ingan idip nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal Kuꞌ, ingan bonal-bonal pinunaꞌ Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: Jesus therefore said to those Jews who had believed him, “If you remain in my word, then you are truly my disciples.

pairs.source: Ingan yaꞌ puꞌan pingajal deꞌ bonal tentang Topaꞌ, duoh pingajal deꞌ bonal inoh yaꞌ odaꞌ ingan obuah pilopas.”
pairs.target: You will know the truth, and the truth will make you free.”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-e, “Koꞌih deꞌ mutiꞌ onak sukun Abraham, doiꞌ sidoh koꞌih bikuli saꞌan osi-osi-e.  Oni loti sina deꞌ nang Ingan: ‘Ingan yaꞌ obuah pilopas?’ ”
pairs.target: They answered him, “We are Abraham’s offspring, and have never been in bondage to anyone. How do you say, ‘You will be made free’?”

pairs.source: In Yesus tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan bonal-bonal, nyaꞌa deꞌ nai dosa-e obuah nguasa odaꞌ dosa-e, samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ jadin kuli deꞌ diꞌ-e ponai lopas soꞌ toke-e.
pairs.target: Jesus answered them, “Most certainly I tell you, everyone who commits sin is the bondservant of sin.

pairs.source: Kuli doiꞌ topat-e deꞌ totap daang lomin boli nyaꞌa soꞌ-e kiloja, pak-e onak silalu ogiꞌ topat-e daang lomin boli odop-e.
pairs.target: A bondservant doesn’t live in the house forever. A son remains forever.

pairs.source: Ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh, simoꞌ Onak inoh moꞌ pilopas ingan, ingan moꞌ bonal-bonal lopas.”
pairs.target: If therefore the Son makes you free, you will be free indeed.

pairs.source: “Okuꞌ puꞌan nang ingan deꞌ mutiꞌ onak sukun Abraham, pak-e ingan kagaꞌ yaꞌ ngabos Okuꞌ, dop-e ingan doliaꞌ ingan tilimaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: I know that you are Abraham’s offspring, yet you seek to kill me, because my word finds no place in you.

pairs.source: Oni deꞌ ningaꞌ Kuꞌ soꞌ Samaꞌ Kuꞌ, inoh leh oniꞌ deꞌ tanon Kuꞌ.  Wat inoh geh ingan nai oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal samaꞌ ingan.”
pairs.target: I say the things which I have seen with my Father; and you also do the things which you have seen with your father.”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot Yesus in-e, “Koꞌih deꞌ mutiꞌ onak-sukun Abraham.” In Yesus tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Simoꞌ ingan bonal-bonal onak sukun Abraham, totu leh ingan nai oni deꞌ nai Abraham.
pairs.target: They answered him, “Our father is Abraham.” Jesus said to them, “If you were Abraham’s children, you would do the works of Abraham.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan, oniꞌ deꞌ bonal deꞌ ngojit Kuꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ, pak-e ingan yaꞌ ngabos Okuꞌ.  Abraham doiꞌ yoh nai oniꞌ deꞌ wat inoh.
pairs.target: But now you seek to kill me, a man who has told you the truth, which I heard from God. Abraham didn’t do this.

pairs.source: Ingan nai oniꞌ nunaꞌ deꞌ nai odop samaꞌ ingan.” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-E in-e, “Idoh diꞌ koꞌih onak opang.  Samaꞌ koꞌih jok-e niꞌ, yohleh Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: You do the works of your father.” They said to him, “We were not born of sexual immorality. We have one Father, God.”

pairs.source: In Yesus lagiꞌ tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Simoꞌ Topaꞌ inoh Samaꞌ ingan, totu leh ingan ngibalaꞌ Okuꞌ, dop-e Okuꞌ nog soꞌ Topaꞌ, adin Okuꞌ ogiꞌ datiꞌ.  Okuꞌ nog idoh diꞌ-e odop Kuꞌ deꞌ laꞌan, pak-e Iyoh leh deꞌ pait Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: Therefore Jesus said to them, “If God were your father, you would love me, for I came out and have come from God. For I haven’t come of myself, but he sent me.

pairs.source: Oni nai ingan diꞌ ingan ngiloti oniꞌ deꞌ tanon Kuꞌ? Dop-e diꞌ ingan ponai tilimaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal Kuꞌ.
pairs.target: Why don’t you understand my speech? Because you can’t hear my word.

pairs.source: Laja Muat inoh leh samaꞌ ingan, ingan yaꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ laꞌan samaꞌ ingan inoh.  Soꞌ sibungas-e iyoh tukang ngabos manusia.  Iyoh diꞌ-e suka ajal deꞌ bonal, dop-e daang iyoh doiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ bonal.  Moꞌ iyoh pibulaꞌ, inoh kan-e moꞌ gaya-e, dop-e iyoh inoh pibulaꞌ, samaꞌ soꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ pibulaꞌ.
pairs.target: You are of your father, the devil, and you want to do the desires of your father. He was a murderer from the beginning, and doesn’t stand in the truth, because there is no truth in him. When he speaks a lie, he speaks on his own; for he is a liar, and the father of lies.

pairs.source: Pak-e Okuꞌ tanon oniꞌ deꞌ bonal tuduꞌ ingan, yohleh ngan diꞌ ingan bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: But because I tell the truth, you don’t believe me.

pairs.source: Osi deꞌ soꞌ ingan deꞌ mutiꞌ deꞌ dapod ngin bukti nang Okuꞌ nai dosa? Moꞌ Okuꞌ tanon oniꞌ deꞌ bonal, oni nai diꞌ ingan bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ?
pairs.target: Which of you convicts me of sin? If I tell the truth, why do you not believe me?

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ nog soꞌ Topaꞌ, iyoh ngojit pingunang Topaꞌ, pak ingan diꞌ ingan nog soꞌ Topaꞌ, inoh leh ngan ingan doliaꞌ ingan ngojit-E.”
pairs.target: He who is of God hears the words of God. For this cause you don’t hear, because you are not of God.”

pairs.source: Pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi moꞌ nyawot Yesus, “Kan-e bonal oniꞌ deꞌ nang koꞌih, Muꞌu ulang Samaria deꞌ obuah nguasa muat.”
pairs.target: Then the Jews answered him, “Don’t we say well that you are a Samaritan, and have a demon?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Idoh diꞌ Kuꞌ obuah nguasa odaꞌ muat, pak-e Okuꞌ pimodo tuduꞌ Samaꞌ Kuꞌ, pak-e ingan diꞌ ingan pimodo tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: Jesus answered, “I don’t have a demon, but I honor my Father, and you dishonor me.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ kalik odaꞌ nyaꞌa mudi odop Kuꞌ, pak-e ogiꞌ niꞌ deꞌ kagaꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa mudi Okuꞌ, Iyoh geh deꞌ motod nang nyaꞌa salah atou bonal.
pairs.target: But I don’t seek my own glory. There is one who seeks and judges.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan bonal-bonal, osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ nunaꞌ pingunang Kuꞌ, iyoh doiꞌ sidoh-e yaꞌ kobos.”
pairs.target: Most certainly, I tell you, if a person keeps my word, he will never see death.”

pairs.source: Pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi in-e duoh Yesus, “Adin koꞌih moꞌ puꞌan nang Muꞌu obuah nguasa odaꞌ muat.  Abraham moꞌ kobos, wat inoh geh ayua nabi.  Pak-e in Muꞌ: ‘Nyaꞌa deꞌ nunaꞌ pingunang Kuꞌ, iyoh doiꞌ sidoh-e yaꞌ kobos.’
pairs.target: Then the Jews said to him, “Now we know that you have a demon. Abraham died, and the prophets; and you say, ‘If a man keeps my word, he will never taste of death.’

pairs.source: Moꞌ Abraham sadiꞌ-e moꞌ kobos, nabi-nabi suaꞌ-e moꞌ kobos, Muꞌu odaꞌ odop Muꞌ samah kodaꞌ osi? Podo Muꞌu lobih penting soꞌ samaꞌ koꞌih Abraham?”
pairs.target: Are you greater than our father, Abraham, who died? The prophets died. Who do you make yourself out to be?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Simoꞌ Okuꞌ kalik odaꞌ nyaꞌa mudi odop Kuꞌ, pudi inoh doiꞌ loti-e.  Samaꞌ Kuꞌ deꞌ mudi Okuꞌ, Iyoh leh deꞌ nang ingan Topaꞌ odop ingan,
pairs.target: Jesus answered, “If I glorify myself, my glory is nothing. It is my Father who glorifies me, of whom you say that he is our God.

pairs.source: doiꞌ ingan nak puꞌan-E.  Pak-e Okuꞌ puꞌan Iyoh.  Simoꞌ Okuꞌ nang odop Kuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ puꞌan Iyoh, loti-e Okuꞌ tukang pibulaꞌ, samah kodaꞌ ingan.  Pak-e Okuꞌ puꞌan Iyoh duoh nunaꞌ pingunang-E.
pairs.target: You have not known him, but I know him. If I said, ‘I don’t know him,’ I would be like you, a liar. But I know him, and keep his word.

pairs.source: Sumuk babai ingan Abraham sukup doon-e yaꞌ ningaꞌ Okuꞌ nog.  Iyoh moꞌ ningaꞌ-e, iyoh moꞌ doon otin-e.”
pairs.target: Your father Abraham rejoiced to see my day. He saw it, and was glad.”

pairs.source: Pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi moꞌ in-e duoh Yesus, “Umul Muꞌ aluaꞌ diꞌ-e limoh puluꞌ sowaꞌ, pak-e Muꞌu nang odop Muꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ Abraham?”
pairs.target: The Jews therefore said to him, “You are not yet fifty years old, and have you seen Abraham?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan bonal-bonal, takal Abraham aluaꞌ doiꞌ, Okuꞌ moꞌ ogiꞌ.”
pairs.target: Jesus said to them, “Most certainly, I tell you, before Abraham came into existence, I AM.”

pairs.source: Pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ mit batuh yaꞌ nyokad Yesus ngan-e yaꞌ ngabos-E, pak-e Yesus moꞌ bisukan yohmoꞌ buu soꞌ Boli Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: Therefore they took up stones to throw at him, but Jesus was hidden, and went out of the temple, having gone through the middle of them, and so passed by.

pairs.source: Takal Yesus ponu, Iyoh ningaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ soꞌ takal sinoꞌ-e bitiiaꞌ-a.
pairs.target: As he passed by, he saw a man blind from birth.

pairs.source: Pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Yesus in-e, “Gulu, osi deꞌ nai dosa-e, odop nyaꞌa itih keh, pingoma-e keh, ngan yoh butaꞌ takal sinoꞌ-e bitiiaꞌ-a?”
pairs.target: His disciples asked him, “Rabbi, who sinned, this man or his parents, that he was born blind?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Iyoh butaꞌ idoh diꞌ-e odaꞌ dosa odop-e, idoh geh diꞌ-e odaꞌ dosa pingoma-e, pak-e saꞌ nyaꞌa dapod ningaꞌ kiloja Topaꞌ kiloja daang polong-e.
pairs.target: Jesus answered, “Neither did this man sin, nor his parents; but, that the works of God might be revealed in him.

pairs.source: Takal onu aluaꞌ jawaꞌ otoꞌ halus nai kiloja Iyoh deꞌ moꞌ pait Okuꞌ.  Onu ngalom yaꞌ nog, takal inoh niꞌ tuang doiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ ponai kiloja.
pairs.target: I must work the works of him who sent me, while it is day. The night is coming, when no one can work.

pairs.source: Takal Okuꞌ aluaꞌ daang dunia, Okuꞌ leh jawaꞌ saꞌan manusia deꞌ dunia.”
pairs.target: While I am in the world, I am the light of the world.”

pairs.source: Takal Yesus mokuaꞌ nang sina deꞌ in inoh, Iyoh moꞌ ngujaꞌ keꞌ tanaꞌ nai tanaꞌ lunyak pakai loyang-E.  Mokuaꞌ inoh Iyoh moꞌ gasak deꞌ boton nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ inoh.
pairs.target: When he had said this, he spat on the ground, made mud with the saliva, anointed the blind man’s eyes with the mud,

pairs.source: Yohmoꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, “Odi mamiaꞌ jowin muꞌ deꞌ pagung Siloam.” Siloam loti-e, ‘Deꞌ obuah pait’.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ inoh moꞌ odi mamiaꞌ jowin-e.  Takal iyoh paliꞌ keꞌ boli-e, iyoh moꞌ ponai ningaꞌ.
pairs.target: and said to him, “Go, wash in the pool of Siloam” (which means “Sent”). So he went away, washed, and came back seeing.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ bilinok boli-e duoh boli iyoh baya suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ dioꞌ soꞌ kanoꞌ ningaꞌ iyoh tukang mitiaꞌ-mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa, suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ sina in-e si odop-e , “Idoh keh diꞌ-e iyoh itih nyaꞌa deꞌ lika guluꞌ mitiaꞌ-mitiaꞌ duit soꞌ nyaꞌa?”
pairs.target: The neighbors therefore, and those who saw that he was blind before, said, “Isn’t this he who sat and begged?”

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ sina nang, “Iyoh itih leh odop-e.” Pak-e ogiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ nang, “Idoh, iyoh jok-e niꞌ mun duoh nyaꞌa inoh.” Pak-e odop nyaꞌa inoh moꞌ sina in-e, “Okuꞌ leh odop-e.”
pairs.target: Others were saying, “It is he.” Still others were saying, “He looks like him.” He said, “I am he.”

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ-e, “Oni wat-e ngan muꞌ ponai ningaꞌ?”
pairs.target: They therefore were asking him, “How were your eyes opened?”

pairs.source: Iyoh moꞌ nyawot-e, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ adon Yesus inoh nai tanaꞌ lunyak, Iyoh moꞌ gasak deꞌ boton kuꞌ, yohmoꞌ in-e, ‘Odi mamiaꞌ jowin muꞌ keꞌ pagung Siloam.’ Yohmoꞌ okuꞌ moꞌ odi, takal okuꞌ mokuaꞌ mamiaꞌ jowin kuꞌ, okuꞌ moꞌ ponai ningaꞌ.”
pairs.target: He answered, “A man called Jesus made mud, anointed my eyes, and said to me, ‘Go to the pool of Siloam, and wash.’ So I went away and washed, and I received sight.”

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ-e, “Daki soꞌ odop-E?” Nyaꞌa inoh moꞌ nyawot-e, “Idoh diꞌ kuꞌ puꞌan-e.”
pairs.target: Then they asked him, “Where is he?” He said, “I don’t know.”

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ toban nyaꞌa deꞌ dioꞌ soꞌ kanoꞌ butaꞌ boton-e inoh tuduꞌ ulang-ulang Farisi.
pairs.target: They brought him who had been blind to the Pharisees.

pairs.source: Onu takal Yesus nai tanaꞌ lunyak duoh odaꞌ boton nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ inoh ponai ningaꞌ yohleh daang onu Sabat, onu Simayang ulang Yahudi.
pairs.target: It was a Sabbath when Jesus made the mud and opened his eyes.

pairs.source: Yohleh ngan ulang-ulang Farisi sikian-e geh tuduꞌ-e, oni wat-e ngan iyoh ponai ningaꞌ.  Nyaꞌa inoh moꞌ nyawot-e, “Iyoh gasak tanaꞌ lunyak deꞌ boton kuꞌ, mokuaꞌ inoh okuꞌ moꞌ mamiaꞌ jowin kuꞌ, yohmoꞌ okuꞌ moꞌ ponai ningaꞌ.”
pairs.target: Again therefore the Pharisees also asked him how he received his sight. He said to them, “He put mud on my eyes, I washed, and I see.”

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan soꞌ ulang Farisi inoh moꞌ in-e, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ wat itih diꞌ-e nog soꞌ Topaꞌ, dop-e Iyoh moꞌ lawan atulan onu Sabat.” Pak-e ogiꞌ geh ulang Farisi deꞌ bokon deꞌ in-e, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa diꞌ-e tapod nai tanda soꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa kodaꞌ deꞌ wat tih!” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bikalah siodop-e.
pairs.target: Some therefore of the Pharisees said, “This man is not from God, because he doesn’t keep the Sabbath.” Others said, “How can a man who is a sinner do such signs?” There was division among them.

pairs.source: Ulang-ulang Farisi deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sikian lagiꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ mokuaꞌ butaꞌ inoh, “Oni in pikil muꞌ tentang Iyoh? Dop-e muꞌu moꞌ ponai ningaꞌ odaꞌ Iyoh.” Nyaꞌa inoh moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Iyoh inoh nabi.”
pairs.target: Therefore they asked the blind man again, “What do you say about him, because he opened your eyes?” He said, “He is a prophet.”

pairs.source: Pak-e pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ nang deꞌ dioꞌ nyaꞌa inoh tok butaꞌ yohmoꞌ adin iyoh ponai ningaꞌ.  Yohleh ngan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ mogan pingoma nyaꞌa deꞌ mokuaꞌ butaꞌ inoh.
pairs.target: The Jews therefore did not believe concerning him, that he had been blind, and had received his sight, until they called the parents of him who had received his sight,

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ sinoꞌ samaꞌ nyaꞌa inoh in-e, “Podo tok iyoh tih onak ingan? Tok bonal keh iyoh butaꞌ soꞌ takal iyoh obuah bilanak? Oni wat-e ngan-e adin iyoh ponai ningaꞌ?”
pairs.target: and asked them, “Is this your son, whom you say was born blind? How then does he now see?”

pairs.source: Sinoꞌ samaꞌ nyaꞌa inoh moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Tok iyoh onak koꞌih, iyoh tok butaꞌ soꞌ takal iyoh obuah bilanak.
pairs.target: His parents answered them, “We know that this is our son, and that he was born blind;

pairs.source: Pak-e oni wat-e iyoh tapod ningaꞌ adin, diꞌ koꞌih puꞌan-e.  Osi deꞌ odaꞌ iyoh tapod ningaꞌ tuang idoh geh diꞌ koꞌih puꞌan-e.  Iyoh moꞌ ayuh, sikian negeh tuduꞌ odop-e.  Odop-e sadiꞌ-e tapod nyawot ingan.”
pairs.target: but how he now sees, we don’t know; or who opened his eyes, we don’t know. He is of age. Ask him. He will speak for himself.”

pairs.source: Sinoꞌ samaꞌ nyaꞌa inoh ngan-e nang sina in inoh, dop-e yoh tolu tuduꞌ pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi.  Dop-e pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi moꞌ bipokat, nyaꞌa deꞌ ngakuꞌ nang Yesus inoh Laja Pinyilamat diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ soꞌon molot kaang boli topat simayang.
pairs.target: His parents said these things because they feared the Jews; for the Jews had already agreed that if any man would confess him as Christ, he would be put out of the synagogue.

pairs.source: Yoh ngan sinoꞌ samaꞌ nyaꞌa inoh sina nang, “Iyoh moꞌ ayuh, sikian negeh tuduꞌ odop-e.”
pairs.target: Therefore his parents said, “He is of age. Ask him.”

pairs.source: Pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi deꞌ munoꞌ paliꞌ mogan baꞌuh keꞌ duwoh sidoh-e nyaꞌa deꞌ mokuaꞌ butaꞌ inoh, yoh moꞌ in-e, “Bijanyi leh muꞌu yaꞌ sina bonal.  Koꞌih puꞌan nang Nyaꞌa inoh ulang bidosa.”
pairs.target: So they called the man who was blind a second time, and said to him, “Give glory to God. We know that this man is a sinner.”

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ mokuaꞌ butaꞌ inoh moꞌ nyawot-e, “Oni keh Iyoh ulang bidosa keh idoh, okuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ puꞌan-e.  Pak-e niꞌ deꞌ puꞌan kuꞌ, deꞌ dioꞌ okuꞌ butaꞌ, adin moꞌ ponai ningaꞌ.”
pairs.target: He therefore answered, “I don’t know if he is a sinner. One thing I do know: that though I was blind, now I see.”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ sikian lagiꞌ tuduꞌ-e, “Oni deꞌ nai-E tuduꞌ muꞌu? Wat ki wat-E odaꞌ muꞌu ponai ningaꞌ?”
pairs.target: They said to him again, “What did he do to you? How did he open your eyes?”

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ mokuaꞌ butaꞌ inoh nyawot-e, “Moꞌ mokuaꞌ kuꞌ tanon-e tuduꞌ ingan, pak-e doliaꞌ ingan ngojit-e.  Oni nai ingan yaꞌ ngojit-e lagiꞌ? Kodaꞌ oni' deꞌ ingan yaꞌ jadin pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E.”
pairs.target: He answered them, “I told you already, and you didn’t listen. Why do you want to hear it again? You don’t also want to become his disciples, do you?”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nguyat nyaꞌa deꞌ mokuaꞌ butaꞌ inoh in-e, “Muꞌu leh pinunaꞌ-E, pak-e koꞌih idoh! Koꞌih pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Musa.
pairs.target: They insulted him and said, “You are his disciple, but we are disciples of Moses.

pairs.source: Koꞌih puꞌan nang deꞌ dioꞌ Topaꞌ moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Musa, pak-e tentang nyaꞌa deꞌ adon Yesus inoh, diꞌ koꞌih puꞌan soꞌ ki soꞌ-E nog.”
pairs.target: We know that God has spoken to Moses. But as for this man, we don’t know where he comes from.”

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ mokuaꞌ butaꞌ inoh moꞌ nyawot-e, “Ilan kuꞌ manah ingan, diꞌ ingan puꞌan soꞌ ki soꞌ-E nog, pak-e Iyoh moꞌ odaꞌ okuꞌ ponai ningaꞌ.
pairs.target: The man answered them, “How amazing! You don’t know where he comes from, yet he opened my eyes.

pairs.source: Otoꞌ puꞌan nang Topaꞌ doliaꞌ-e ngojit nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa, pak-e Topaꞌ jok-e ngojit nyaꞌa deꞌ tunuak tuduꞌ-E duoh nai oni deꞌ laꞌan-E.
pairs.target: We know that God doesn’t listen to sinners, but if anyone is a worshiper of God, and does his will, he listens to him.

pairs.source: Soꞌ sibungas-e ogiꞌ dunia aluaꞌ doiꞌ nyeꞌ ngojit ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ odaꞌ boton nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ soꞌ takal sinoꞌ-e bitiiaꞌ-a ponai ningaꞌ.
pairs.target: Since the world began it has never been heard of that anyone opened the eyes of someone born blind.

pairs.source: Simoꞌ nyaꞌa inoh diꞌ-e soꞌ Topaꞌ, Iyoh diꞌ-e tapod nai oni-oni-e.”
pairs.target: If this man were not from God, he could do nothing.”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-e, “Muꞌu itih moꞌ punuaꞌ odaꞌ dosa soꞌ takal muꞌ obuah bilanak geh! Bilani manah muꞌu yaꞌ ngajal koꞌih!” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ kasig odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ mokuaꞌ butaꞌ inoh luah.
pairs.target: They answered him, “You were altogether born in sins, and do you teach us?” They threw him out.

pairs.source: Yesus ngojit nang nyaꞌa deꞌ mokuaꞌ butaꞌ inoh obuah kasig soꞌ boli simayang.  Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ kalik nyaꞌa deꞌ mokuaꞌ butaꞌ inoh, yohmoꞌ dapod-e daang-e sikian tuduꞌ-e in-E, “Podo muꞌu bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Onak Manusia?”
pairs.target: Jesus heard that they had thrown him out, and finding him, he said, “Do you believe in the Son of God?”

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa inoh moꞌ nyawot-E, “Podo Ingan puꞌan osi odop-E? Tanon tuduꞌ okuꞌ saꞌ okuꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ-E.”
pairs.target: He answered, “Who is he, Lord, that I may believe in him?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ mokuaꞌ butaꞌ inoh, “Muꞌu moꞌ ningaꞌ odop-E.  Iyoh leh deꞌ sina duoh muꞌu adin.”
pairs.target: Jesus said to him, “You have both seen him, and it is he who speaks with you.”

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa inoh moꞌ in-e, “Okuꞌ bisayaꞌ, Topaꞌ.” Iyoh moꞌ guluꞌ bikunyug deꞌ sulung jowin Yesus ngan-e nyomah Yesus.
pairs.target: He said, “Lord, I believe!” and he worshiped him.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Okuꞌ nog kaang dunia saꞌ-e tonga nyaꞌa deꞌ bonal duoh deꞌ salah.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ ponai ningaꞌ, duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ ponai ningaꞌ jadin butaꞌ.”
pairs.target: Jesus said, “I came into this world for judgment, that those who don’t see may see; and that those who see may become blind.”

pairs.source: Kudu-kudu naꞌan ulang Farisi danoꞌ ngojit Yesus sina in inoh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Yesus in-e, “Podo Ingan nang koꞌih deꞌ mutiꞌ butaꞌ geh?”
