pairs.target: Those of the Pharisees who were with him heard these things, and said to him, “Are we also blind?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Moꞌ nyam ingan butaꞌ idoh diꞌ ingan bidosa.  Pak-e ngan ingan nang, ‘Koꞌih ponai ningaꞌ,’ inoh loti-e ingan aluaꞌ bidosa.”
pairs.target: Jesus said to them, “If you were blind, you would have no sin; but now you say, ‘We see.’ Therefore your sin remains.

pairs.source: “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan bonal-bonal, osi sijaꞌ deꞌ molot daang topat domba loꞌo diꞌ-e molot soꞌ tiban-e, pak-e nyikoh soꞌ topat deꞌ bokon, iyoh inoh pinoku duoh pilapok.
pairs.target: “Most certainly, I tell you, one who doesn’t enter by the door into the sheep fold, but climbs up some other way, the same is a thief and a robber.

pairs.source: Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ molot soꞌ aluang tiban, iyoh inoh gembala domba.
pairs.target: But one who enters in by the door is the shepherd of the sheep.

pairs.source: Jok-e saꞌan gembala inoh leh nyaꞌa deꞌ tukang jaga topat domba loꞌo bukaꞌ tiban.  Suaꞌ domba-e ngojit bogan gembala-e yohmoꞌ nunaꞌ-e takal iyoh mogan adon domba-e masim-masim duoh nutuan toban domba-e luah.
pairs.target: The gatekeeper opens the gate for him, and the sheep listen to his voice. He calls his own sheep by name, and leads them out.

pairs.source: Takal suaꞌ domba deꞌ kakuꞌ-e moꞌ luah, gembala inoh ponu dioꞌ nuaꞌ jowin, yohmoꞌ suaꞌ domba-e bitunaꞌ duoh-e, dop-e suaꞌ domba-e piluh sina-e.
pairs.target: Whenever he brings out his own sheep, he goes before them, and the sheep follow him, for they know his voice.

pairs.source: Domba-domba-e doliaꞌ-e nunaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon.  Domba-domba-e makin tilajak buu dop-e diꞌ-e piluh sina nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon inoh.”
pairs.target: They will by no means follow a stranger, but will flee from him; for they don’t know the voice of strangers.”

pairs.source: Yesus ngajal pakai nang silita itih, pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e ngiloti oniꞌ deꞌ silita-E.
pairs.target: Jesus spoke this parable to them, but they didn’t understand what he was telling them.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan bonal-bonal, Okuꞌ leh tiban saꞌan suaꞌ domba deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: Jesus therefore said to them again, “Most certainly, I tell you, I am the sheep’s door.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nog dioꞌ soꞌ Okuꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ leh pinoku duoh pilapok, domba-domba tuang doliaꞌ-e geh nunaꞌ sina odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: All who came before me are thieves and robbers, but the sheep didn’t listen to them.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ leh tiban; suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ molot soꞌ Okuꞌ yaꞌ silamat.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ molot duoh luah baya tapod padang duh deꞌ paguh.
pairs.target: I am the door. If anyone enters in by me, he will be saved, and will go in and go out, and will find pasture.

pairs.source: Pinoku nog jok-e ngan-e yaꞌ noku, ngabos, duoh katuab.  Okuꞌ nog saꞌ domba-domba kuꞌ dapod idip.  Idip deꞌ diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ ponai kulang oni-oni-e.
pairs.target: The thief only comes to steal, kill, and destroy. I came that they may have life, and may have it abundantly.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ leh gembala deꞌ paguh.  Gembala deꞌ paguh sangup kobos ngan-e nyilamat domba-domba-e.
pairs.target: I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd lays down his life for the sheep.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah ngupah deꞌ diꞌ-e gembala domba yaꞌ bikoduh buu takal kosuang tolun nog, dop-e domba-domba inoh diꞌ-e tung odop-e.  Kosuang tolun moꞌ bitakap duoh domba-domba deꞌ munoꞌ ngilajak odaꞌ sobak sobul buu.
pairs.target: He who is a hired hand, and not a shepherd, who doesn’t own the sheep, sees the wolf coming, leaves the sheep, and flees. The wolf snatches the sheep, and scatters them.

pairs.source: Iyoh bikoduh buu dop-e iyoh jok-e kiloja ngan-e yaꞌ soꞌon pah-e, yoh diꞌ-e piduli domba-domba deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: The hired hand flees because he is a hired hand, and doesn’t care for the sheep.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ leh gembala deꞌ paguh.  Okuꞌ piluh domba-domba Kuꞌ, wat noh geh domba-domba Kuꞌ piluh Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: I am the good shepherd. I know my own, and I’m known by my own;

pairs.source: Samah kodaꞌ Samaꞌ Kuꞌ piluh Okuꞌ duoh Okuꞌ tuang piluh Kuꞌ geh Samaꞌ Kuꞌ.  Okuꞌ sangup kobos ngan Kuꞌ nyilamat domba-domba Kuꞌ.
pairs.target: even as the Father knows me, and I know the Father. I lay down my life for the sheep.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ tuang ogiꞌ geh domba-domba Kuꞌ deꞌ bokon deꞌ diꞌ-e soꞌ kaban domba itih.  Domba-domba deꞌ bokon deꞌ munoꞌ halus Okuꞌ nutuan-e geh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ ngojit sina Kuꞌ.  Soꞌ duwoh kaban domba inoh moꞌ tikuluk jadin niꞌ kaban duoh niꞌ gembala-e.
pairs.target: I have other sheep, which are not of this fold. I must bring them also, and they will hear my voice. They will become one flock with one shepherd.

pairs.source: Samaꞌ ngibalaꞌ Okuꞌ dop-e Okuꞌ sangup ngin idip Kuꞌ, ngan Kuꞌ yaꞌ paliꞌ soꞌon idip Kuꞌ.
pairs.target: Therefore the Father loves me, because I lay down my life,  that I may take it again.

pairs.source: Doiꞌ nyaꞌa dapod mit asong Kuꞌ.  Okuꞌ ngin asong Kuꞌ nunaꞌ deꞌ laꞌan odop Kuꞌ.  Okuꞌ ogiꞌ kuasa Kuꞌ ngin asong duoh ogiꞌ kuasa Kuꞌ paliꞌ mit-e.  Inoh leh deꞌ odaꞌ Samaꞌ Kuꞌ Okuꞌ nai-e.”
pairs.target: No one takes it away from me, but I lay it down by myself. I have power to lay it down, and I have power to take it again. I received this commandment from my Father.”

pairs.source: Sina Yesus deꞌ in inoh moꞌ odaꞌ ulang-ulang Yahudi bikaꞌi bikalah lagiꞌ si odop-e.
pairs.target: Therefore a division arose again among the Jews because of these words.

pairs.source: Bogoꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nang in-e, “Iyoh obuah nguasa odaꞌ muat munua duoh moꞌ bakoꞌ, oni nai ingan ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ nang-E?”
pairs.target: Many of them said, “He has a demon, and is insane! Why do you listen to him?”

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon nang in-e, “Idoh diꞌ-e in inoh sina nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah nguasa muat neh.  Dapod yeh bih muat odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ ponai ningaꞌ?”
pairs.target: Others said, “These are not the sayings of one possessed by a demon. It isn’t possible for a demon to open the eyes of the blind, is it?”

pairs.source: Deꞌ Yerusalem nyaꞌa julah-e nyamut Onu Ayuh Lesmi Boli Topaꞌ.  Takal inoh musim modud.
pairs.target: It was the Feast of the Dedication at Jerusalem.

pairs.source: Yesus ponu-ponu deꞌ topat deꞌ nang-e Awah Salomo, deꞌ limang Boli Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: It was winter, and Jesus was walking in the temple, in Solomon’s porch.

pairs.source: Kudu-kudu naꞌan ulang Yahudi nog mujuag kilulung Yesus duoh sina tuduꞌ-E in-e, “Oni tian-e lagiꞌ Ingan odaꞌ koꞌih pikajon-kajon? Tanon tuduꞌ koꞌih osi sibonal-e Ingan itih.  Suang-suang negeh in nyeꞌ tanon-e simoꞌ-e Ingan inoh tok Laja Pinyilamat deꞌ moꞌ obuah janyi Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: The Jews therefore came around him and said to him, “How long will you hold us in suspense? If you are the Christ, tell us plainly.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Okuꞌ moꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan pak-e diꞌ ingan bisayaꞌ.  Kiloja-kiloja deꞌ nai Kuꞌ pakai kuasa soꞌ Samaꞌ Kuꞌ, inoh leh deꞌ jadin bukti osi Okuꞌ itih.
pairs.target: Jesus answered them, “I told you, and you don’t believe. The works that I do in my Father’s name, these testify about me.

pairs.source: Pak-e diꞌ ingan bisayaꞌ dop-e ingan diꞌ-e domba-domba Kuꞌ.
pairs.target: But you don’t believe, because you are not of my sheep, as I told you.

pairs.source: Domba-domba Kuꞌ ngojit sina Kuꞌ.  Okuꞌ piluh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, duoh yoh nunaꞌ Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: My sheep hear my voice, and I know them, and they follow me.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ ngin idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, yoh doiꞌ sidoh-e yaꞌ mutuab duoh doiꞌ tiyaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ ponai ngilatak odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ soꞌ tongan Kuꞌ.
pairs.target: I give eternal life to them. They will never perish, and no one will snatch them out of my hand.

pairs.source: Samaꞌ Kuꞌ leh deꞌ moꞌ ngin odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, Iyoh inoh lobih ayuh kuasa-E soꞌ osi sijaꞌ-e, duoh niꞌ naꞌan tuang doiꞌ geh deꞌ tapod ngilatak odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ soꞌ tongan Samaꞌ Kuꞌ.
pairs.target: My Father, who has given them to me, is greater than all. No one is able to snatch them out of my Father’s hand.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ duoh Samaꞌ yohleh niꞌ geh.”
pairs.target: I and the Father are one.”

pairs.source: Yohmoꞌ ulang-ulang Yahudi moꞌ mit lagiꞌ batuh ngan-e yaꞌ nyokad Yesus ngan-e yaꞌ ngabos-E.
pairs.target: Therefore Jews took up stones again to stone him.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Ingan moꞌ ningaꞌ bogoꞌ kiloja deꞌ paguh deꞌ nai Kuꞌ deꞌ soꞌ Samaꞌ Kuꞌ.  Soꞌ suaꞌ kiloja deꞌ munoꞌ, ki kiloja deꞌ odaꞌ ingan yaꞌ nyokad Okuꞌ pakai batuh?”
pairs.target: Jesus answered them, “I have shown you many good works from my Father. For which of those works do you stone me?”

pairs.source: Ulang-ulang Yahudi inoh moꞌ nyawot-e, “Idoh diꞌ-e odaꞌ kiloja deꞌ paguh deꞌ nai Ingan koꞌih yaꞌ nyokad Ingan pakai batuh, pak-e Ingan moꞌ nguyat Topaꞌ.  Ingan manusia, pak-e Ingan moꞌ tanon nang odop Ingan samah duoh Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: The Jews answered him, “We don’t stone you for a good work, but for blasphemy: because you, being a man, make yourself God.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Daang buk Kitab ingan, ogiꞌ deꞌ obuah nulis in-e: In Topaꞌ, ‘Ingan deꞌ mutiꞌ kodaꞌ Topaꞌ.’
pairs.target: Jesus answered them, “Isn’t it written in your law, ‘I said, you are gods?’

pairs.source: Otoꞌ puꞌan nang oni deꞌ obuah nulis daang buk Kitab idoh diꞌ-e ponai bilubah.  Daang buk Kitab inoh Topaꞌ nang ‘Ingan deꞌ mutiꞌ kodaꞌ Topaꞌ’ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tilimaꞌ pingunang-E.
pairs.target: If he called them gods, to whom the word of God came (and the Scripture can’t be broken),

pairs.source: Pak-e Okuꞌ sadiꞌ Kuꞌ moꞌ obuah pilih duoh moꞌ obuah pait odaꞌ Samaꞌ Kuꞌ.  Moꞌ-e wat inoh, oni nai ingan nang Okuꞌ nguyat Topaꞌ ngan Kuꞌ nang Okuꞌ Onak Topaꞌ?
pairs.target: do you say of him whom the Father sanctified and sent into the world, ‘You blaspheme,’ because I said, ‘I am the Son of God?’

pairs.source: Simoꞌ Kuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ nai kiloja-kiloja deꞌ soꞌ Samaꞌ Kuꞌ, maꞌ yaꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: If I don’t do the works of my Father, don’t believe me.

pairs.source: Pak-e moꞌ Okuꞌ nai kiloja deꞌ soꞌ Samaꞌ Kuꞌ, ingan halus bisayaꞌ deꞌ kiloja deꞌ munoꞌ.  Bial diꞌ ingan bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ pingunang Kuꞌ, ingan halus bisayaꞌ deꞌ kiloja deꞌ munoꞌ.  Saꞌ ingan puꞌan duoh ngiloti, nang Samaꞌ ogiꞌ daang Okuꞌ, wat noh geh Okuꞌ ogiꞌ daang Samaꞌ.”
pairs.target: But if I do them, though you don’t believe me, believe the works; that you may know and believe that the Father is in me, and I in the Father.”

pairs.source: Niꞌ sidoh lagiꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ suba takap Yesus, pak-e diꞌ-e soꞌon-E.
pairs.target: They sought again to seize him, and he went out of their hand.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus odi lagiꞌ keꞌ polad sungi Yordan, keꞌ topat deꞌ dioꞌ soꞌ kanoꞌ soꞌ Yohanes baptis nyaꞌa, Yesus moꞌ loꞌo danoꞌ.
pairs.target: He went away again beyond the Jordan into the place where John was baptizing at first, and there he stayed.

pairs.source: Yohmoꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa nog tuduꞌ-E.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sina siodop-e in-e , “Sungu Yohanes diꞌ-e nai tanda deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa, pak-e suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ tanon-e tentang nyaꞌa itih tok bonal.”
pairs.target: Many came to him. They said, “John indeed did no sign, but everything that John said about this man is true.”

pairs.source: Yohmoꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa danoꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: Many believed in him there.

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ dali deꞌ adon Lazarus, iyoh monam.  Iyoh loꞌo samah-samah duoh madih-e deꞌ dayung, deꞌ adon   , deꞌ kupuaꞌ Betania.
pairs.target: Now a certain man was sick, Lazarus from Bethany, of the village of Mary and her sister, Martha.

pairs.source: Maria itih leh dayung deꞌ yaꞌ duwan inyuaꞌ wangi deꞌ poꞌon Topaꞌ Yesus yohmoꞌ ngisuꞌ pakai buak-e odaꞌ bodoh.
pairs.target: 2 It was that Mary who had anointed the Lord with ointment, and wiped his feet with her hair, whose brother, Lazarus, was sick.

pairs.source: Yohmoꞌ soꞌ duwoh madih-e pait gah tuduꞌ Yesus nang in-e, “Gulu, iyoh deꞌ obuah ngibalaꞌ odaꞌ Ingan, monam.”
pairs.target: The sisters therefore sent to him, saying, “Lord, behold, he for whom you have great affection is sick.”

pairs.source: Takal Yesus ngojit gah inoh, Iyoh moꞌ in-e, “Onam inoh idoh diꞌ-e yaꞌ odaꞌ yoh kobos, pak-e onam inoh ogiꞌ saꞌ nyaꞌa ningaꞌ kuasa Topaꞌ deꞌ ayuh, saꞌ nyaꞌa mudi duoh pimodo tuduꞌ Onak Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: But when Jesus heard it, he said, “This sickness is not to death, but for the glory of God, that God’s Son may be glorified by it.”

pairs.source: Tok bonal Yesus ngibalaꞌ Marta, Maria, duoh Lazarus,
pairs.target: Now Jesus loved Martha, and her sister, and Lazarus.

pairs.source: pak-e takal Yesus ngojit gah nang Lazarus monam, Iyoh saji-e loꞌo duwoh onu lagiꞌ deꞌ topat inoh.
pairs.target: When therefore he heard that he was sick, he stayed two days in the place where he was.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh ke Iyoh moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, “Jaꞌ mey otoꞌ paliꞌ odi lagiꞌ keꞌ Yudea.”
pairs.target: Then after this he said to the disciples, “Let’s go into Judea again.”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nyawot, “Gulu, baꞌuh geh ulang-ulang Yahudi yaꞌ nyokad Ingan pakai batuh ngan-e yaꞌ ngabos Ingan, adin Ingan yaꞌ paliꞌ lagiꞌ kanih?”
pairs.target: The disciples told him, “Rabbi, the Jews were just trying to stone you, and are you going there again?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e pakai nang silita, “Maꞌ ingan yaꞌ tolu.  Idoh keh diꞌ-e onu jawaꞌ simoong duwoh jam daang niꞌ onu? Nyaꞌa deꞌ ponu daang onu jawaꞌ iyoh diꞌ-e simikiak dop-e iyoh kilin jawaꞌ deꞌ dunia itih.
pairs.target: Jesus answered, “Aren’t there twelve hours of daylight? If a man walks in the day, he doesn’t stumble, because he sees the light of this world.

pairs.source: Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ ponu daang onu ngalom, iyoh simikiak dop-e doiꞌ jawaꞌ deꞌ kilin-e.”
pairs.target: But if a man walks in the night, he stumbles, because the light isn’t in him.”

pairs.source: In inoh leh in Yesus.  Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ, “Dingan otoꞌ Lazarus moꞌ boꞌos, pak-e Okuꞌ yaꞌ odi kanoꞌ ngan Kuꞌ odaꞌ iyoh ngooh.”
pairs.target: He said these things, and after that, he said to them, “Our friend, Lazarus, has fallen asleep, but I am going so that I may awake him out of sleep.”

pairs.source: Pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Gulu, moꞌ Lazarus boꞌos, iyoh yaꞌ mokuaꞌ soꞌ onam-e.”
pairs.target: The disciples therefore said, “Lord, if he has fallen asleep, he will recover.”

pairs.source: Sibonal-e Yesus tanon nang Lazarus moꞌ kobos, pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ baꞌ-e nang Yesus nang Lazarus boꞌos biasa.
pairs.target: Now Jesus had spoken of his death, but they thought that he spoke of taking rest in sleep.

pairs.source: Noh leh ngan Yesus moꞌ sina tanon deꞌ sibonal-e, in-E, “Lazarus moꞌ kobos.
pairs.target: So Jesus said to them plainly then, “Lazarus is dead.

pairs.source: Pak-e Okuꞌ sonang dop-e Okuꞌ doiꞌ danoꞌ takal inoh.  Dop-e ogiꞌ paguh-e saꞌan ingan, saꞌ ingan dapod bisayaꞌ.  Adin, jaꞌ otoꞌ odi tuduꞌ Lazarus.”
pairs.target: I am glad for your sakes that I was not there, so that you may believe. Nevertheless, let’s go to him.”

pairs.source: Tomas deꞌ sobot nyaꞌa geh nang Didimus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ dingan-dingan-e deꞌ samah-samah jadin pinunaꞌ Yesus, “Jaꞌ otoꞌ suwaꞌ odi duoh Gulu, saꞌ otoꞌ kobos samah-samah duoh-E!”
pairs.target: Thomas therefore, who is called Didymus, said to his fellow disciples, “Let’s go also, that we may die with him.”

pairs.source: Takal Yesus nog sinok kupuaꞌ Betania, Iyoh moꞌ ngojit soꞌ nyaꞌa nang todang Lazarus moꞌ pat onu daang kubul.
pairs.target: So when Jesus came, he found that he had been in the tomb four days already.

pairs.source: Betania diꞌ-e sikiya juuaꞌ soꞌ Yerusalem, kulang lobih taluh kilometel geh.
pairs.target: Now Bethany was near Jerusalem, about fifteen stadia away.

pairs.source: Bogoꞌ ulang-ulang Yahudi deꞌ moꞌ nog tuduꞌ Marta duoh Maria ngan-e yaꞌ ngilibul odop-e deꞌ duwoh deꞌ susah otin-e odaꞌ madih-e deꞌ dali deꞌ moꞌ doiꞌ.
pairs.target: Many of the Jews had joined the women around Martha and Mary, to console them concerning their brother.

pairs.source: Takal Marta ngojit nang Yesus moꞌ sinok-e yaꞌ nog, iyoh lasuꞌ odi bitapod duoh Yesus, pak-e Maria loꞌo deꞌ boli.
pairs.target: Then when Martha heard that Jesus was coming, she went and met him, but Mary stayed in the house.

pairs.source: Marta moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ Yesus, “Gulu, simoꞌ ingan ogiꞌ datiꞌ takal inoh, pasti madih kuꞌ deꞌ dali itih diꞌ-e kobos.
pairs.target: Therefore Martha said to Jesus, “Lord, if you would have been here, my brother wouldn’t have died.

pairs.source: Pak-e adin tuang puꞌan kuꞌ geh nang Topaꞌ yaꞌ ngin tuduꞌ Ingan suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ mitiaꞌ Ingan tuduꞌ-E.”
pairs.target: Even now I know that, whatever you ask of God, God will give you.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ Marta, “Madih muꞌ deꞌ dali yaꞌ paliꞌ mokat idip.”
pairs.target: Jesus said to her, “Your brother will rise again.”

pairs.source: In Marta tuduꞌ-E, “Puꞌan kuꞌ nang iyoh yaꞌ paliꞌ mokat idip takal piobuaꞌ dunia takal suaꞌ nyaꞌa paliꞌ mokat idip.”
pairs.target: Martha said to him, “I know that he will rise again in the resurrection at the last day.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Okuꞌ leh deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ kobos paliꞌ mokat idip duoh deꞌ ngin idip tuduꞌ nyaꞌa.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, iyoh yaꞌ idip bial-e moꞌ kobos.
pairs.target: Jesus said to her, “I am the resurrection and the life. He who believes in me will still live, even if he dies.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ idip duoh deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, iyoh doiꞌ sidoh-e yaꞌ kobos.  Bisayaꞌ yeh muꞌu duoh sina deꞌ nang Kuꞌ itih?”
pairs.target: Whoever lives and believes in me will never die. Do you believe this?”

pairs.source: Marta moꞌ nyawot-E, “Gulu, okuꞌ bisayaꞌ nang Ingan Onak Topaꞌ, Laja Pinyilamat deꞌ nog kaang dunia.”
pairs.target: She said to him, “Yes, Lord. I have come to believe that you are the Christ, God’s Son, he who comes into the world.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ sina in inoh Marta moꞌ paliꞌ keꞌ boli-e yohmoꞌ mogan Maria, madih-e deꞌ dayung.  Marta moꞌ bikayas tuduꞌ-e in-e, “Gulu ogiꞌ danih, Iyoh mitiaꞌ odaꞌ muꞌu odi kanih.”
pairs.target: When she had said this, she went away, and called Mary, her sister, secretly, saying, “The Teacher is here, and is calling you.”

pairs.source: Maria ngojit deꞌ in inoh iyoh lasuꞌ mokat yohmoꞌ odi bitapod duoh Yesus.
pairs.target: When she heard this, she arose quickly, and went to him.

pairs.source: Takal inoh Yesus aluaꞌ diꞌ-e nog kupuaꞌ inoh, Iyoh aluaꞌ deꞌ topat soꞌ Marta bitapod duoh-E.
pairs.target: Now Jesus had not yet come into the village, but was in the place where Martha met him.

pairs.source: Takal inoh bogoꞌ ulang Yahudi deꞌ nog keꞌ boli Maria ngan-e yaꞌ ngilibul-e.  Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ningaꞌ Maria mokat yohmoꞌ likas-likas luah soꞌ boli-e, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bitunaꞌ duoh-e, dop-e baꞌ-e nang Maria odi siꞌian keꞌ kubul.
pairs.target: Then the Jews who were with her in the house, and were consoling her, when they saw Mary, that she rose up quickly and went out, followed her, saying, “She is going to the tomb to weep there.”

pairs.source: Takal Maria nog deꞌ topat Yesus duoh ningaꞌ-E, iyoh moꞌ bikunyug deꞌ sulung jowin-E daang-e in-e, “Gulu, simoꞌ Ingan ogiꞌ datiꞌ takal inoh, pasti madih kuꞌ deꞌ dali diꞌ-e kobos.”
pairs.target: Therefore when Mary came to where Jesus was, and saw him, she fell down at his feet, saying to him, “Lord, if you would have been here, my brother wouldn’t have died.”

pairs.source: Takal Yesus ningaꞌ Maria siꞌian, ulang-ulang Yahudi deꞌ suwaꞌ nog duoh Maria suwaꞌ geh siꞌian, otin Yesus moꞌ sukup nyam susah-E duoh ngilobuꞌ.
pairs.target: When Jesus therefore saw her weeping, and the Jews weeping who came with her, he groaned in the spirit, and was troubled,

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ in-E, “Daki soꞌ ingan ngubul-e?” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e, “Gulu, jaꞌ otoꞌ odi ningaꞌ kubul-e.”
pairs.target: and said, “Where have you laid him?” They told him, “Lord, come and see.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ duwan siꞌian-E.
pairs.target: Jesus wept.

pairs.source: Ulang-ulang Yahudi deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e, “Ningaꞌ, Iyoh sukup ngibalaꞌ Lazarus.”
pairs.target: The Jews therefore said, “See how much affection he had for him!”

pairs.source: Pak-e ogiꞌ deꞌ soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ in-e, “Iyoh odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ ponai kilin.  Sipatut-e Iyoh tuang ponai geh odaꞌ Lazarus mokuaꞌ soꞌ onam-e saꞌ-e diꞌ-e kobos.”
pairs.target: Some of them said, “Couldn’t this man, who opened the eyes of him who was blind, have also kept this man from dying?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ paliꞌ ngilobuꞌ otin-E, yohmoꞌ odi keꞌ kubul.  Kubul inoh lubang gua deꞌ kuab nyaꞌa pakai batuh deꞌ ayuh.
pairs.target: Jesus therefore, again groaning in himself, came to the tomb. Now it was a cave, and a stone lay against it.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Sigian batuh inoh.” Marta madih nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos inoh moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ Yesus, “Gulu, iyoh moꞌ pat onu daang kubul, iyoh moꞌ buꞌun moduaꞌ.”
pairs.target: Jesus said, “Take away the stone.” Martha, the sister of him who was dead, said to him, “Lord, by this time there is a stench, for he has been dead four days.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Moꞌ mokuaꞌ Kuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ muꞌu nang moꞌ muꞌu bisayaꞌ, muꞌu yaꞌ ningaꞌ kuasa Topaꞌ deꞌ sukup ayuh-e!”
pairs.target: Jesus said to her, “Didn’t I tell you that if you believed, you would see God’s glory?”

pairs.source: Kudu-kudu naꞌan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sigian batuh inoh.  Yesus moꞌ bigalong keꞌ longit simadi-E sina, “Samaꞌ, Okuꞌ bisukul tuduꞌ Ingan dop-e Ingan moꞌ ngojit Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: So they took away the stone from the place where the dead man was lying. Jesus lifted up his eyes, and said, “Father, I thank you that you listened to me.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ puꞌan nang Ingan silalu ngojit Okuꞌ, pak-e Okuꞌ nang in itih saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ datiꞌ saꞌ odop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ bisayaꞌ nang Ingan leh deꞌ pait Okuꞌ.”
pairs.target: I know that you always listen to me, but because of the multitude standing around I said this, that they may believe that you sent me.”

pairs.source: Takal Yesus mokuaꞌ nang sina deꞌ in inoh, Iyoh moꞌ mogan Lazarus dolas-dolas-e in-e, “Lazarus luah mey!”
pairs.target: When he had said this, he cried with a loud voice, “Lazarus, come out!”

pairs.source: Dali deꞌ kobos inoh moꞌ luah soꞌ aang lubang gua deꞌ jadin kubul-e.  Soꞌ duwoh tongan poꞌon-e aluaꞌ bibolut kain todang duoh jowin-e obuah nutu pakai sapu tongan.  Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Bukaꞌ leh kain-kain deꞌ molut gonan-e, nyeꞌ moꞌ tanah saꞌ-e buu.”
pairs.target: He who was dead came out, bound hand and foot with wrappings, and his face was wrapped around with a cloth. Jesus said to them, “Free him, and let him go.”

pairs.source: Bogoꞌ soꞌ ulang-ulang Yahudi deꞌ nog tuduꞌ Maria moꞌ ningaꞌ oni deꞌ nai Yesus.  Bogoꞌ soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: Therefore many of the Jews, who came to Mary and saw what Jesus did, believed in him.

pairs.source: Pak-e ogiꞌ soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ odi tuduꞌ uluk ulang Farisi ngan-e tanon tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nai Yesus inoh.
pairs.target: But some of them went away to the Pharisees, and told them the things which Jesus had done.

pairs.source: Yohmoꞌ ayua pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh duoh uluk ulang Farisi ngijaꞌ Pengadilan Agama tikuluk.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e, “Oni mey wat toꞌ neh? Nyaꞌa itih bogoꞌ nai tanda-tanda deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa!
pairs.target: The chief priests therefore and the Pharisees gathered a council, and said, “What are we doing? For this man does many signs.

pairs.source: Simoꞌ toꞌ tanah Iyoh deꞌ wat itih, suaꞌ nyaꞌa yaꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ-E, yohmoꞌ pimipin ulang Roma yaꞌ nog ngasul Boli Topaꞌ duoh bangsa otoꞌ!”
pairs.target: If we leave him alone like this, everyone will believe in him, and the Romans will come and take away both our place and our nation.”

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ adon Kayafas deꞌ jadin Pimipin Agama Yahudi deꞌ Paling Ayuh takal sowaꞌ inoh.  Iyoh sina in-e, “Ingan diꞌ ingan puꞌan oni-oni-e!
pairs.target: But a certain one of them, Caiaphas, being high priest that year, said to them, “You know nothing at all,

pairs.source: Ingan diꞌ ingan bingoon nang paguh dooꞌ kaꞌan ingan, niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa kobos saꞌan bangsa otoꞌ, saꞌ suaꞌ bangsa otoꞌ diꞌ-e mutuab.”
pairs.target: nor do you consider that it is advantageous for us that one man should die for the people, and that the whole nation not perish.”

pairs.source: Sibonal-e sina deꞌ nang-e inoh, idoh diꞌ-e soꞌ odop-e sadiꞌ-e.  Pak-e ngan iyoh deꞌ jadin Pimipin Agama Yahudi deꞌ Paling Ayuh sowaꞌ inoh, iyoh moꞌ tanon sibaya soꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ nang-e Yesus yaꞌ kobos saꞌan bangsa Yahudi.
pairs.target: Now he didn’t say this of himself, but being high priest that year, he prophesied that Jesus would die for the nation,

pairs.source: Iyoh yaꞌ kobos idoh diꞌ-e jok-e saꞌan bangsa Yahudi sijaꞌ-e, pak-e ngan-e nguluk onak-onak Topaꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ daki-daki sijaꞌ-a saꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tikuluk.
pairs.target: and not for the nation only, but that he might also gather together into one the children of God who are scattered abroad.

pairs.source: Mulai soꞌ onu inoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bipokat yaꞌ ngabos Yesus.
pairs.target: So from that day forward they took counsel that they might put him to death.

pairs.source: Noh leh ngan Yesus diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ bitanga odop-E deꞌ jowin nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ soꞌ bangsa Yahudi.  Iyoh buu soꞌ kanoꞌ keꞌ kota deꞌ adon Efraim, deꞌ sinok padang pasil.  Iyoh moꞌ loꞌo danoꞌ samah-samah duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E.
pairs.target: Jesus therefore walked no more openly among the Jews, but departed from there into the country near the wilderness, to a city called Ephraim. He stayed there with his disciples.

pairs.source: Takal inoh Onu Ayuh Paskah ulang Yahudi moꞌ sinok, yohmoꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa soꞌ kupuaꞌ-kupuaꞌ odi keꞌ Yerusalem.  Dop-e nunaꞌ adat ulang Yahudi, nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ halus kibisig odop-e takal-e aluaꞌ diꞌ-e nog onu Paskah.
pairs.target: Now the Passover of the Jews was at hand. Many went up from the country to Jerusalem before the Passover, to purify themselves.

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ kalik Yesus duoh simadi-e mujuag deꞌ limang Boli Topaꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ sina tipan si odop-e in-e, “Oni nyam nunaꞌ pikil ingan, oni keh Iyoh yaꞌ nog keh idoh daang onu ayuh itih?”
pairs.target: Then they sought for Jesus and spoke one with another, as they stood in the temple, “What do you think—that he isn’t coming to the feast at all?”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nang in inoh dop-e pimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh duoh uluk ulang Farisi moꞌ ngin pilitah, nang osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ puꞌan daki soꞌ Yesus, halus lapol saꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ dapod takap-E.
pairs.target: Now the chief priests and the Pharisees had commanded that if anyone knew where he was, he should report it, that they might seize him.

pairs.source: Nuam onu takal-e aluaꞌ diꞌ-e Onu Ayuh Paskah ulang Yahudi, Yesus nog keꞌ kupuaꞌ Betania, topat Lazarus loꞌo.  Danoꞌ leh topat soꞌ Yesus odaꞌ Lazarus paliꞌ idip soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos.
pairs.target: Then six days before the Passover, Jesus came to Bethany, where Lazarus was, who had been dead, whom he raised from the dead.

pairs.source: Danoꞌ leh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ biluman ngan-e nyamut Yesus.  Marta suwaꞌ tulung katod pinguman.  Lazarus suwaꞌ man duoh Yesus baya nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon.
pairs.target: So they made him a supper there. Martha served, but Lazarus was one of those who sat at the table with him.

pairs.source: Maria moꞌ mit sitengah litel inyuaꞌ wangi deꞌ maal loga-e deꞌ nai nyaꞌa soꞌ aat Narwastu.  Iyoh moꞌ duwan inyuaꞌ inoh deꞌ poꞌon Yesus, yohmoꞌ ngisuꞌ pakai buak-e saꞌ-e bodoh.  Aang boli inoh moꞌ suaꞌ-e wangi odaꞌ inyuaꞌ inoh.
pairs.target: Mary, therefore, took a pound of ointment of pure nard, very precious, and anointed the feet of Jesus, and wiped his feet with her hair. The house was filled with the fragrance of the ointment.

pairs.source: Pak-e Yudas Iskariot, niꞌ naꞌan pinunaꞌ Yesus, deꞌ yaꞌ jua Yesus tuduꞌ musuh-musuh-E moꞌ sina,
pairs.target: Then Judas Iscariot, Simon’s son, one of his disciples, who would betray him, said,

pairs.source: “Oni nai diꞌ-e jua negeh inyuaꞌ wangi inoh taluh latus kiping pilak, duit-e tapod nyeꞌ ngin tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ botak?”
pairs.target: “Why wasn’t this ointment sold for three hundred denarii, and given to the poor?”

pairs.source: Yudas sina in inoh nak-e tok masiꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ botak, pak-e saai odop-e pinoku.  Iyoh mala lika noku duit kas odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ kagian-e.
pairs.target: Now he said this, not because he cared for the poor, but because he was a thief, and having the money box, used to steal what was put into it.

pairs.source: Pak-e Yesus moꞌ sina, “Tanah negeh! Maria moꞌ dioꞌ nginyuaꞌ gonan Kuꞌ saꞌan onu takal Okuꞌ yaꞌ obuah ngubul.
pairs.target: But Jesus said, “Leave her alone. She has kept this for the day of my burial.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ botak mala ogiꞌ sinok ingan, jadin ingan ponai tulung-e siniaꞌ sijaꞌ-e.  Pak-e Okuꞌ diꞌ silalu ogiꞌ duoh ingan.”
pairs.target: For you always have the poor with you, but you don’t always have me.”

pairs.source: Bogoꞌ ulang Yahudi ngojit nang Yesus ogiꞌ deꞌ Betania, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ odi kanoꞌ.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ odi idoh diꞌ-e yaꞌ ningaꞌ Yesus sijaꞌ-e, pak-e yaꞌ ningaꞌ-e geh Lazarus deꞌ moꞌ paliꞌ Yesus kidip-e soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos.
pairs.target: A large crowd therefore of the Jews learned that he was there, and they came, not for Jesus’ sake only, but that they might see Lazarus also, whom he had raised from the dead.

pairs.source: Yoh leh ngan ayua pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh yaꞌ ngabos-e geh Lazarus.
pairs.target: But the chief priests conspired to put Lazarus to death also,

pairs.source: Dop-e oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ jadi duoh Lazarus odaꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa togan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ duoh bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: because on account of him many of the Jews went away and believed in Jesus.

pairs.source: Onu tiaꞌ pagi-e nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ deꞌ nog yaꞌ nyamut onu ayuh Paskah moꞌ ngojit nang Yesus aluaꞌ deꞌ lopot olan nuju Yerusalem.
pairs.target: On the next day a great multitude had come to the feast. When they heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem,

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ kopog-kopog dowon-dowon koyuh deꞌ kodaꞌ dowon uwi yohmoꞌ odi nyamut Yesus simadi-e luꞌow-luꞌow sina, “Mudi Topaꞌ deꞌ siluga! Obuah bilokat Iyoh, Laja Israel deꞌ obuah pait daang adon Topaꞌ!
pairs.target: they took the branches of the palm trees, and went out to meet him, and cried out, “Hosanna! Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord, the King of Israel!”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ mit keledai deꞌ mudaꞌ, Iyoh moꞌ muat deꞌ tun-e.  Moꞌ jadi leh nunaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ obuah nulis daang buk Kitab:
pairs.target: Jesus, having found a young donkey, sat on it. As it is written,

pairs.source: “Maꞌ tolu oi layat Yerusalem! Ningaꞌ Laja muꞌ nog, guluꞌ deꞌ tun keledai deꞌ aluaꞌ mudaꞌ.”
pairs.target: “Don’t be afraid, daughter of Zion. Behold, your King comes, sitting on a donkey’s colt.”

pairs.source: Takal inoh Pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus aluaꞌ diꞌ-e ngiloti suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ.  Pak-e takal Yesus moꞌ paliꞌ idip yohmoꞌ maꞌad keꞌ Siluga, ngan-e yaꞌ obuah pimodo, ke odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ natong nang suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ jadi tuduꞌ Yesus samah kodaꞌ deꞌ obuah nulis daang buk Kitab.
pairs.target: His disciples didn’t understand these things at first, but when Jesus was glorified, then they remembered that these things were written about him, and that they had done these things to him.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ deꞌ suwaꞌ duoh Yesus takal Iyoh mogan Lazarus odaꞌ luah soꞌ aang kubul duoh odaꞌ yoh paliꞌ idip, odop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ leh deꞌ telus-telus silita oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon.
pairs.target: The multitude therefore that was with him when he called Lazarus out of the tomb, and raised him from the dead, was testifying about it.

pairs.source: Inoh leh ngan nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ odi nyamut Yesus, dop-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ngojit nang Yesus leh deꞌ moꞌ nai tanda deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa deꞌ wat inoh.
pairs.target: For this cause also the multitude went and met him, because they heard that he had done this sign.

pairs.source: Uluk ulang Farisi moꞌ sina tipan odop-e, “Suba ingan ningaꞌ-e! Sukup bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ odi nunaꞌ Iyoh.  Otoꞌ diꞌ toꞌ tapod nai oni-oni-e!”
pairs.target: The Pharisees therefore said among themselves, “See how you accomplish nothing. Behold, the world has gone after him.”

pairs.source: Deꞌ soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ deꞌ odi simayang keꞌ Yerusalem yaꞌ nyamut onu ayuh inoh, ogiꞌ geh kudu-kudu naan ulang Yunani.
pairs.target: Now there were certain Greeks among those that went up to worship at the feast.

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ odi tuduꞌ Filipus, ulang Betsaida deꞌ Galilea.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e, “Koꞌih yaꞌ bitapod duoh Yesus.”
pairs.target: These, therefore, came to Philip, who was from Bethsaida of Galilee, and asked him, saying, “Sir, we want to see Jesus.”

pairs.source: Filipus moꞌ odi tanon hal inoh tuduꞌ Andreas, odop-e deꞌ duwoh moꞌ odi tanon tuduꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: Philip came and told Andrew, and in turn, Andrew came with Philip, and they told Jesus.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Moꞌ nog takal-e Onak Manusia yaꞌ obuah pakat ngan-e yaꞌ obuah pimodo.
pairs.target: Jesus answered them, “The time has come for the Son of Man to be glorified.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan bonal-bonal: Simoꞌ luang gandum diꞌ nyeꞌ puluah kaang tanaꞌ duoh kobos, iyoh totap jok-e niꞌ kiluang.  Pak-e simoꞌ kiluang gandum inoh kobos, ke yoh bogoꞌ buaꞌ-e.
pairs.target: Most certainly I tell you, unless a grain of wheat falls into the earth and dies, it remains by itself alone. But if it dies, it bears much fruit.

pairs.source: Osi deꞌ nyayang asong-e daang dunia itih, iyoh yaꞌ mutuab, pak-e osi deꞌ diꞌ-e nyayang asong-e daang dunia itih, iyoh yaꞌ soꞌon idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah.
pairs.target: He who loves his life will lose it. He who hates his life in this world will keep it to eternal life.

pairs.source: Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ yaꞌ jadin pilayan Kuꞌ, yoh mesti nunaꞌ Okuꞌ saꞌ-e daki soꞌ Okuꞌ ogiꞌ yoh tuang ogiꞌ geh danoꞌ samah-samah duoh Okuꞌ.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ jadin pilayan Kuꞌ yaꞌ obuah pimodo odaꞌ Samaꞌ Kuꞌ.
pairs.target: If anyone serves me, let him follow me. Where I am, there will my servant also be. If anyone serves me, the Father will honor him.

pairs.source: Adin kila Kuꞌ susah.  Oni in oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nang Kuꞌ? Podo kuꞌ halus nang, ‘Samaꞌ pilopas leh Okuꞌ soꞌ susah jolaꞌ itih’? Idoh diꞌ Kuꞌ ponai nang inoh, dop-e ngan Okuꞌ nog kaang dunia itih yaꞌ obuah susah jolaꞌ itih.
pairs.target: “Now my soul is troubled. What shall I say? ‘Father, save me from this time?’ But for this cause I came to this time.

pairs.source: Samaꞌ bitanga leh kuasa Ingan deꞌ sukup ayuh-e!” Yohmoꞌ ogiꞌ sina Topaꞌ soꞌ siluga in-e, “Okuꞌ moꞌ bitanga kuasa Kuꞌ deꞌ ayuh yohmoꞌ Okuꞌ yaꞌ nai-e lagiꞌ.”
pairs.target: Father, glorify your name!” Then there came a voice out of the sky, saying, “I have both glorified it, and will glorify it again.”

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ suaꞌ-e klingah sowoꞌ inoh.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e, “Inoh sowoꞌ dudu!” Pak-e ogiꞌ geh deꞌ sina, “Inoh sina malaikat soꞌ siluga sina tuduꞌ Iyoh!”
pairs.target: The multitude therefore, who stood by and heard it, said that it had thundered. Others said, “An angel has spoken to him.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Sowoꞌ inoh ingan kilingah-e idoh diꞌ-e saꞌan Okuꞌ, pak-e saꞌan ingan.
pairs.target: Jesus answered, “This voice hasn’t come for my sake, but for your sakes.

pairs.source: Adin moꞌ nog takal-e Topaꞌ yaꞌ motod salah manusia deꞌ dunia itih.  Adin geh Iyoh odaꞌ Laja Muat Munua deꞌ nguasa dunia itih doiꞌ kuasa-e tiyaꞌ.
pairs.target: Now is the judgment of this world. Now the prince of this world will be cast out.

pairs.source: Pak-e simoꞌ Okuꞌ obuah najul tun dunia itih, Okuꞌ yaꞌ odaꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa nog tuduꞌ odop Kuꞌ.”
pairs.target: And I, if I am lifted up from the earth, will draw all people to myself.”

pairs.source: Iyoh sina in inoh ngan-e tanon oni wat Iyoh yaꞌ kobos.
pairs.target: But he said this, signifying by what kind of death he should die.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ inoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-E, “Moꞌ-e nunaꞌ daang buk Kitab, Laja Pinyilamat yaꞌ idip nah-nah.  Koꞌih diꞌ koꞌih ngiloti-e oni nai Ingan ponai nang Onak Manusia halus obuah najul tun dunia itih saꞌ-a kobos? Osi Onak Manusia inoh?”
pairs.target: The multitude answered him, “We have heard out of the law that the Christ remains forever. How do you say, ‘The Son of Man must be lifted up?’ Who is this Son of Man?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Duam jok-e niꞌ tiliaꞌ jawaꞌ ogiꞌ duoh ingan.  Ponuleh takal jawaꞌ inoh aluaꞌ ogiꞌ, saꞌ mopung diꞌ-e tang-tang nyokuab olan ingan.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ ponu daang mopung, diꞌ-e puꞌan kaki soꞌ-e yaꞌ odi.
pairs.target: Jesus therefore said to them, “Yet a little while the light is with you. Walk while you have the light, that darkness doesn’t overtake you. He who walks in the darkness doesn’t know where he is going.

pairs.source: Bisayaꞌ leh tuduꞌ jawaꞌ inoh, takal jawaꞌ inoh aluaꞌ ogiꞌ duoh ingan, saꞌ ingan jadin onak-onak deꞌ idip-e kodaꞌ jawaꞌ.” Mokuaꞌ nang sina deꞌ in inoh, Yesus moꞌ odi bisukan soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: While you have the light, believe in the light, that you may become children of light.” Jesus said these things, and he departed and hid himself from them.

pairs.source: Bial-e bogoꞌ tanda deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa deꞌ nai Yesus deꞌ jowin odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ-E.
pairs.target: But though he had done so many signs before them, yet they didn’t believe in him,

pairs.source: Ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh, moꞌ jadi leh deꞌ tanon nabi Yesaya, “Topaꞌ, osi deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ gah deꞌ tanon koꞌih? Ingan moꞌ bitanga kuasa Ingan, pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ totap doliaꞌ-e bisayaꞌ.”
pairs.target: that the word of Isaiah the prophet might be fulfilled, which he spoke, “Lord, who has believed our report? To whom has the arm of the Lord been revealed?”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e ponai bisayaꞌ, dop-e Yesaya tuang moꞌ sina geh in-e, “ In itih leh in Pingunang Topaꞌ,
pairs.target: For this cause they couldn’t believe, for Isaiah said again,

pairs.source: ‘Okuꞌ odaꞌ boton odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ butaꞌ, saꞌ-e diꞌ-e tapod ningaꞌ, Okuꞌ ngolas otin odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, saꞌ-e diꞌ-e ponai ngiloti.  Simoꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ponai ngiloti, totu diꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ paliꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.  Wat noh leh Okuꞌ paliꞌ odaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ paguh.’ ”
pairs.target: “He has blinded their eyes and he hardened their heart, lest they should see with their eyes, and perceive with their heart, and would turn, and I would heal them.”

pairs.source: Yesaya sina in inoh dop-e yoh moꞌ dioꞌ ningaꞌ kuasa Yesus deꞌ sukup ayuh-e, yoh ngan Yesaya sina tanon tentang Iyoh.
pairs.target: Isaiah said these things when he saw his glory, and spoke of him.

pairs.source: Pak-e bial-e wat inoh, bogoꞌ geh soꞌ pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus.  Pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e bilani suang-suang in-e ngakuꞌ-e, dop-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tolu jak ulang-ulang Farisi jaman yoh molot kaang boli simayang.
pairs.target: Nevertheless even of the rulers many believed in him, but because of the Pharisees they didn’t confess it, so that they wouldn’t be put out of the synagogue,

pairs.source: Dop-e pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi lobih suka obuah mudi odaꞌ manusia.  Odop deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e kalik pudi soꞌ Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: for they loved men’s praise more than God’s praise.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ sina biluꞌow, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, idoh diꞌ-e jok-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, pak-e tuduꞌ Iyoh deꞌ pait Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: Jesus cried out and said, “Whoever believes in me, believes not in me, but in him who sent me.

pairs.source: Osi deꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ  Okuꞌ, moꞌ ningaꞌ-e geh Iyoh deꞌ pait Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: He who sees me sees him who sent me.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ nog kaang dunia itih jadin jawaꞌ, saꞌ-e suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ loꞌo daang mopung.
pairs.target: I have come as a light into the world, that whoever believes in me may not remain in the darkness.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit pingunang Kuꞌ, pak-e yoh diꞌ-e nunaꞌ-e, idoh diꞌ-e Okuꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ motod nang iyoh salah.  Dop-e Okuꞌ nog idoh diꞌ-e ngan Kuꞌ yaꞌ motod nang manusia deꞌ dunia itih salah, pak-e ngan Kuꞌ nyilamat odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: If anyone listens to my sayings, and doesn’t believe, I don’t judge him. For I came not to judge the world, but to save the world.

pairs.source: Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ nulak Okuꞌ duoh diꞌ-e tilimaꞌ pingunang Kuꞌ, moꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ motod nang yoh salah.  Pingunang deꞌ tanon Kuꞌ inoh leh deꞌ yaꞌ motod nang yoh salah.
pairs.target: He who rejects me, and doesn’t receive my sayings, has one who judges him. The word that I spoke, the same will judge him in the last day.

pairs.source: Dop-e Okuꞌ sina idoh diꞌ-e nunaꞌ deꞌ laꞌan odop Kuꞌ.  Samaꞌ deꞌ pait Okuꞌ, Iyoh leh deꞌ odaꞌ Okuꞌ tanon oni deꞌ halus Okuꞌ tanon-e.
pairs.target: For I spoke not from myself, but the Father who sent me, he gave me a commandment, what I should say, and what I should speak.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ puꞌan pilitah-E inoh ngin idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah.  Yohleh ngan-e suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ tanon Kuꞌ, samah kodaꞌ deꞌ ngajal Samaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.”
pairs.target: I know that his commandment is eternal life. The things therefore which I speak, even as the Father has said to me, so I speak.”

pairs.source: Niꞌ onu takal-e aluaꞌ diꞌ-e Onu Ayuh Paskah Ulang Yahudi, Yesus puꞌan nang moꞌ sinok onu-e Iyoh yaꞌ buu soꞌ dunia itih tuduꞌ Samaꞌ-E.  Iyoh silalu ngibalaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ-E deꞌ dunia, Iyoh totap ngibalaꞌ-e nog piobuaꞌ idip-E.
pairs.target: Now before the feast of the Passover, Jesus, knowing that his time had come that he would depart from this world to the Father, having loved his own who were in the world, he loved them to the end.

pairs.source: Takal onu ngalom Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E man samah-samah, Laja Muat Munua moꞌ dioꞌ bikayas daang otin Yudas, onak Simon Iskariot, saꞌ-e jua Yesus tuduꞌ musuh-musuh-E.
pairs.target: During supper, the devil having already put into the heart of Judas Iscariot, Simon’s son, to betray him,

pairs.source: Yesus puꞌan nang Samaꞌ-E moꞌ ngin suaꞌ kuasa tuduꞌ odop-E.  Iyoh tuang puꞌan geh nang odop-E nog soꞌ Topaꞌ duoh yaꞌ paliꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: Jesus, knowing that the Father had given all things into his hands, and that he came from God, and was going to God,

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ mokat mujuag, yohmoꞌ bukaꞌ jubah-E.  Yesus moꞌ mokos kain deꞌ kupuang-E.
pairs.target: arose from supper, and laid aside his outer garments. He took a towel, and wrapped a towel around his waist.

pairs.source: Iyoh moꞌ duwan piꞌin daang mepun, yohmoꞌ mulai mamiaꞌ poꞌon pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, mokuaꞌ inoh Iyoh moꞌ kibadoh-e pakai kain deꞌ mokos-e deꞌ kupuang-E.
pairs.target: Then he poured water into the basin, and began to wash the disciples’ feet, and to wipe them with the towel that was wrapped around him.

pairs.source: Takal-e moꞌ nog Petrus, Petrus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ Yesus, “Gulu, idoh diꞌ-e patut Ingan deꞌ mamiaꞌ poꞌon okuꞌ.”
pairs.target: Then he came to Simon Peter. He said to him, “Lord, do you wash my feet?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Adin muꞌu aluaꞌ diꞌ muꞌ ngiloti oni deꞌ nai Kuꞌ itih, pak-e sunih onu-e ke muꞌu yaꞌ ngiloti-e.”
pairs.target: Jesus answered him, “You don’t know what I am doing now, but you will understand later.”

pairs.source: In Petrus lagiꞌ, “Maꞌ, Gulu-e.  Diꞌ soꞌon Ingan yaꞌ mamiaꞌ poꞌon okuꞌ!” Pak-e Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Simoꞌ Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ mamiaꞌ poꞌon muꞌ, muꞌu diꞌ muꞌ bitolin duoh Okuꞌ.”
pairs.target: Peter said to him, “You will never wash my feet!” Jesus answered him, “If I don’t wash you, you have no part with me.”

pairs.source: Simon Petrus sina lagiꞌ, “Simoꞌ-e wat inoh, Topaꞌ, idoh diꞌ-e poꞌon kuꞌ sijaꞌ-e, pak-e tongan duoh bak kuꞌ geh!”
pairs.target: Simon Peter said to him, “Lord, not my feet only, but also my hands and my head!”

pairs.source: In Yesus tuduꞌ-e, “Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ moꞌ mamuh, iyoh diꞌ-e pilelu mamiaꞌ gonan-e, jok-e poꞌon-e sijaꞌ-e, dop-e gonan-e moꞌ suaꞌ-e bisig.  Ingan deꞌ mutiꞌ moꞌ bisig, pak-e diꞌ-e suaꞌ-e.”
pairs.target: Jesus said to him, “Someone who has bathed only needs to have his feet washed, but is completely clean. You are clean, but not all of you.”

pairs.source: Yesus puꞌan osi pinunaꞌ-E deꞌ yaꞌ jua odop Yesus tuduꞌ musuh-musuh-E.  Yohleh ngan Yesus nang in-e, “Ingan deꞌ mutiꞌ moꞌ bisig, pak-e diꞌ-e suaꞌ-e.”
pairs.target: For he knew him who would betray him, therefore he said, “You are not all clean.”

pairs.source: Takal Yesus mokuaꞌ mamiaꞌ poꞌon odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, Iyoh moꞌ paliꞌ pakai jubah-E yohmoꞌ paliꞌ guluꞌ.  Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ in-E, “Puꞌan ingan keh idoh oniꞌ deꞌ gituang Kuꞌ mokuaꞌ nai-e tuduꞌ ingan?
pairs.target: So when he had washed their feet, put his outer garment back on, and sat down again, he said to them, “Do you know what I have done to you?

pairs.source: Ingan sobot nang Okuꞌ Gulu duoh Pimipin deꞌ Ayuh, inoh suaꞌ-e bonal.
pairs.target: You call me, ‘Teacher’ and ‘Lord.’ You say so correctly, for so I am.

pairs.source: Simoꞌ Okuꞌ, deꞌ jadin Pimipin deꞌ Ayuh duoh Gulu saꞌan ingan, mamiaꞌ poꞌon ingan, wat inoh geh ingan halus bigati-gati mamiaꞌ poꞌon siodop ingan.
pairs.target: If I then, the Lord and the Teacher, have washed your feet, you also ought to wash one another’s feet.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ moꞌ ngin niꞌ tilodan tuduꞌ ingan, saꞌ ingan nai nunaꞌ deꞌ nai Kuꞌ tuduꞌ ingan.
pairs.target: For I have given you an example, that you also should do as I have done to you.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan bonal-bonal: Bala kuli diꞌ-e lobih penting soꞌ toke-e, wat inoh geh ayua nyaꞌa deꞌ toban sibaya diꞌ-e lobih penting soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ pait sibaya.
pairs.target: Most certainly I tell you, a servant is not greater than his lord, neither one who is sent greater than he who sent him.

pairs.source: Ingan moꞌ puꞌan suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ tanon Kuꞌ itih.  Simoꞌ ingan nai-e, ingan moꞌ yaꞌ doon.
pairs.target: If you know these things, blessed are you if you do them.

pairs.source: Oni deꞌ tanon Kuꞌ itih idoh diꞌ-e tentang suaꞌ ingan.  Okuꞌ puꞌan osi-osi deꞌ moꞌ pilih Kuꞌ.  Pak-e oni deꞌ moꞌ obuah nulis daang buk Kitab halus jadi, ‘Nyaꞌa deꞌ man samah-samah duoh Okuꞌ, yaꞌ lawan Okuꞌ.’
pairs.target: I don’t speak concerning all of you. I know whom I have chosen. But that the Scripture may be fulfilled, ‘He who eats bread with me has lifted up his heel against me.’

pairs.source: Oniꞌ deꞌ in inoh dioꞌ Kuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan adin, takal-e aluaꞌ diꞌ-e jadi, saꞌ-e takal oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ jadi, ingan bisayaꞌ nang Okuꞌ inoh leh Odop-E deꞌ ogiꞌ nah-nah.
pairs.target: From now on, I tell you before it happens, that when it happens, you may believe that I am he.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan bonal-bonal: Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ tilimaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ pait Kuꞌ, tilimaꞌ-e geh Okuꞌ.  Wat inoh geh osi sijaꞌ deꞌ tilimaꞌ Okuꞌ, tilimaꞌ-e geh Iyoh deꞌ pait Okuꞌ.”
pairs.target: Most certainly I tell you, he who receives whomever I send, receives me; and he who receives me, receives him who sent me.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ sina in inoh, Yesus moꞌ sukup nyam kila-E susah.  Yesus moꞌ sina tanon in-E, “Tok bonal deꞌ nang Kuꞌ itih: Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ ingan deꞌ mutiꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ jua Okuꞌ tuduꞌ musuh-musuh Kuꞌ.”
pairs.target: When Jesus had said this, he was troubled in spirit, and testified, “Most certainly I tell you that one of you will betray me.”

pairs.source: Pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bikiduang si odop-e daang-e sukup ilan-e, dop-e diꞌ-e puꞌan osi deꞌ nang Yesus inoh.
pairs.target: The disciples looked at one another, perplexed about whom he spoke.

pairs.source: Pinunaꞌ deꞌ obuah ngibalaꞌ odaꞌ Yesus guluꞌ sinok Yesus nuaꞌ toꞌuh-E.
pairs.target: One of his disciples, whom Jesus loved, was at the table, leaning against Jesus’ breast.

pairs.source: Simon Petrus moꞌ ngin kode tuduꞌ-e, saꞌ-e sikian tuduꞌ Yesus, osi deꞌ nang Yesus inoh.
pairs.target: Simon Peter therefore beckoned to him, and said to him, “Tell us who it is of whom he speaks.”

pairs.source: Pinunaꞌ-E inoh moꞌ kos odop-e tuduꞌ Yesus, yohmoꞌ sikian-e, “Gulu, osi bih odop-e neh?”
pairs.target: He, leaning back, as he was, on Jesus’ breast, asked him, “Lord, who is it?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ ngin Kuꞌ kueh deꞌ mokuaꞌ Kuꞌ suad daang makup, inoh leh odop-e.” Yesus moꞌ mit niꞌ sipiak kueh, yohmoꞌ suad daang makup, Iyoh moꞌ ngin tuduꞌ Yudas onak Simon Iskariot.
pairs.target: Jesus therefore answered, “It is he to whom I will give this piece of bread when I have dipped it.” So when he had dipped the piece of bread, he gave it to Judas, the son of Simon Iscariot.

pairs.source: Takal Yudas mokuaꞌ man kueh inoh, Laja Muat Munua moꞌ molot daang otin-e.  Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, “Nai likas-e oni deꞌ yaꞌ nai muꞌ.”
pairs.target: After the piece of bread, then Satan entered into him. Then Jesus said to him, “What you do, do quickly.”

pairs.source: Pak-e niꞌ tuang doiꞌ geh soꞌ odop-e deꞌ guluꞌ man duoh Yesus deꞌ puꞌan oni nai Yesus sina in inoh tuduꞌ Yudas.
pairs.target: Now no man at the table knew why he said this to him.

pairs.source: Pak-e ogiꞌ odop-e deꞌ sakaꞌ nang Yesus odaꞌ Yudas odi milih oniꞌ deꞌ pilelu-e daang biluman onu ayuh inoh, atou Iyoh odaꞌ Yudas ngin oniꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ botak, dop-e Yudas deꞌ tukang kagian duit odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: For some thought, because Judas had the money box, that Jesus said to him, “Buy what things we need for the feast,” or that he should give something to the poor.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ man kueh inoh, Yudas moꞌ lasuꞌ buu.  Takal inoh onu moꞌ ngalom.
pairs.target: Therefore having received that morsel, he went out immediately. It was night.

pairs.source: Takal Yudas moꞌ buu, Yesus moꞌ sina, “Adin moꞌ nog onu-e nyaꞌa ningaꞌ nang Onak Manusia inoh sukup ayuh kuasa-E, duoh soꞌ Iyoh inoh leh nyaꞌa ningaꞌ nang sukup ayuh kuasa Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: When he had gone out, Jesus said, “Now the Son of Man has been glorified, and God has been glorified in him.

pairs.source: Simoꞌ nyaꞌa ningaꞌ nang sukup ayuh kuasa Topaꞌ daang Iyoh, odop Topaꞌ tuang yaꞌ bitanga-e geh tuduꞌ manusia nang sukup ayuh kuasa Onak Manusia inoh.  Diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ tuui Topaꞌ yaꞌ bitanga nang kuasa Onak Manusia inoh sukup ayuh-e.
pairs.target: If God has been glorified in him, God will also glorify him in himself, and he will glorify him immediately.

pairs.source: Onak-onak Kuꞌ, Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ tiyaꞌ tuui duoh ingan.  Ingan moꞌ yaꞌ kalik Okuꞌ, pak-e adin Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan samah kodaꞌ deꞌ tanon Kuꞌ tuduꞌ pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi, ‘Keꞌ topat Okuꞌ odi, ingan diꞌ ingan tapod odi.’
pairs.target: Little children, I will be with you a little while longer. You will seek me, and as I said to the Jews, ‘Where I am going, you can’t come,’ so now I tell you.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ ngin pilitah deꞌ baꞌuh tuduꞌ ingan, saꞌ ingan ngibalaꞌ tipan siodop ingan.  Samah kodaꞌ Okuꞌ ngibalaꞌ ingan, wat inoh geh ingan halus ngibalaꞌ tipan siodop ingan.
pairs.target: A new commandment I give to you, that you love one another. Just as I have loved you, you also love one another.

pairs.source: Simoꞌ ingan samah-samah ngibalaꞌ siodop ingan, suaꞌ nyaꞌa yaꞌ puꞌan nang ingan pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Kuꞌ.”
pairs.target: By this everyone will know that you are my disciples, if you have love for one another.”

pairs.source: Simon Petrus sikian tuduꞌ Yesus, “Gulu, kaki Ingan yaꞌ odi?” Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Kaki soꞌ Okuꞌ yaꞌ odi, adin diꞌ muꞌ tapod suwaꞌ.  Pak-e tiaꞌ ijoꞌ muꞌu tuang kanoꞌ geh.”
pairs.target: Simon Peter said to him, “Lord, where are you going?” Jesus answered, “Where I am going, you can’t follow now, but you will follow afterwards.”

pairs.source: Petrus moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ, “Gulu, oni nai okuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ tapod nunaꞌ Ingan adin? Okuꞌ siap kobos saꞌan Ingan.”
pairs.target: Peter said to him, “Lord, why can’t I follow you now? I will lay down my life for you.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Tok bonal keh muꞌu siap yaꞌ kobos saꞌan Okuꞌ? Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ muꞌu bonal-bonal, takal siuak aluaꞌ diꞌ-e bitadu, muꞌu moꞌ dioꞌ taluh sidoh nang odop muꞌ diꞌ muꞌ piluh Okuꞌ!”
pairs.target: Jesus answered him, “Will you lay down your life for me? Most certainly I tell you, the rooster won’t crow until you have denied me three times.

pairs.source: In Yesus tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, “Maꞌ yaꞌ bigaduh kila muꞌ.  Bisayaꞌ leh tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, bisayaꞌ geh tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: “Don’t let your heart be troubled. Believe in God. Believe also in me.

pairs.source: Daang boli Samaꞌ Kuꞌ bogoꞌ topat soꞌ nyeꞌ loꞌo.  Okuꞌ paliꞌ kanih nyidia topat saꞌan ingan.  Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ sina in inoh tuduꞌ ingan simoꞌ-e doiꞌ topat.
pairs.target: In my Father’s house are many homes. If it weren’t so, I would have told you. I am going to prepare a place for you.

pairs.source: Simoꞌ Okuꞌ moꞌ odi kanoꞌ duoh moꞌ mokuaꞌ nyidia topat saꞌan ingan, Okuꞌ moꞌ yaꞌ paliꞌ nog mit ingan, saꞌ-e daki soꞌ Okuꞌ loꞌo ingan tuang danoꞌ geh.
pairs.target: If I go and prepare a place for you, I will come again, and will receive you to myself; that where I am, you may be there also.

pairs.source: Keꞌ topat Kuꞌ odi, ingan moꞌ puꞌan olan-e.”
pairs.target: Where I go, you know, and you know the way.”

pairs.source: Tomas moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Yesus in-e, “Gulu, koꞌih diꞌ koꞌih puꞌan kaki soꞌ Ingan odi, oni wat koꞌih yaꞌ puꞌan olan-e?”
pairs.target: Thomas said to him, “Lord, we don’t know where you are going. How can we know the way?”

pairs.source: In Yesus nyawot Tomas, “Okuꞌ leh olan ngan ingan odi tuduꞌ Samaꞌ Kuꞌ.  Okuꞌ leh deꞌ tanon ajal deꞌ bonal.  Okuꞌ geh deꞌ ngin idip.  Jok-e soꞌ Okuꞌ nyaꞌa ponai odi tuduꞌ Samaꞌ Kuꞌ, doiꞌ olan deꞌ bokon.
pairs.target: Jesus said to him, “I am the way, the truth, and the life. No one comes to the Father, except through me.

pairs.source: Simoꞌ ingan piluh Okuꞌ, ingan tuang piluh geh Samaꞌ Kuꞌ.  Adin ingan moꞌ piluh Iyoh, duoh moꞌ ningaꞌ-E.”
pairs.target: If you had known me, you would have known my Father also. From now on, you know him, and have seen him.”

pairs.source: Filipus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Yesus, “Gulu, bitanga Samaꞌ tuduꞌ koꞌih, saꞌ koꞌih munuas.”
pairs.target: Philip said to him, “Lord, show us the Father, and that will be enough for us.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Filipus, idoh keh diꞌ muꞌ piluh Okuꞌ? Tiap moꞌ sukup tuui-e Okuꞌ ogiꞌ samah-samah duoh ingan.  Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ Okuꞌ, moꞌ ningaꞌ-e geh Samaꞌ Kuꞌ.  Oni nai muꞌu nang, ‘Bitanga leh Samaꞌ tuduꞌ koꞌih’?
pairs.target: Jesus said to him, “Have I been with you such a long time, and do you not know me, Philip? He who has seen me has seen the Father. How do you say, ‘Show us the Father?’

pairs.source: Idoh keh diꞌ muꞌ bisayaꞌ nang Okuꞌ ogiꞌ daang Samaꞌ, Samaꞌ ogiꞌ daang Okuꞌ? Pingunang deꞌ tanon Kuꞌ tuduꞌ muꞌu idoh diꞌ-e soꞌ odop Kuꞌ.  Pak-e Samaꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ daang Okuꞌ, Iyoh inoh leh deꞌ nai kiloja-E.
pairs.target: Don’t you believe that I am in the Father, and the Father in me? The words that I tell you, I speak not from myself; but the Father who lives in me does his works.

pairs.source: Bisayaꞌ negeh tuduꞌ Okuꞌ moꞌ Kuꞌ tanon nang Okuꞌ duoh Samaꞌ niꞌ geh.  Samaꞌ duoh Okuꞌ tuang niꞌ geh.  Atou simoꞌ diꞌ ingan bisayaꞌ duoh oniꞌ deꞌ tanon Kuꞌ inoh, bisayaꞌ leh dop-e ingan moꞌ ningaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ nai Kuꞌ.
pairs.target: Believe me that I am in the Father, and the Father in me; or else believe me for the very works’ sake.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan bonal-bonal: Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, yoh tuang yaꞌ nai-e geh oniꞌ deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nai Kuꞌ.  Idoh diꞌ-e jok-e inoh, pak-e ngan Okuꞌ paliꞌ tuduꞌ Samaꞌ, nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ lobih ayuh-e.
pairs.target: Most certainly I tell you, he who believes in me, the works that I do, he will do also; and he will do greater works than these, because I am going to my Father.

pairs.source: Oni sijaꞌ-e deꞌ mitiaꞌ ingan deꞌ odaꞌ ingan Okuꞌ nai-e pakai adon Okuꞌ, Okuꞌ nai saꞌan ingan, saꞌ Okuꞌ bitanga tuduꞌ ingan nang kuasa Samaꞌ sukup ayuh-e.
pairs.target: Whatever you will ask in my name, that will I do, that the Father may be glorified in the Son.

pairs.source: Oni sijaꞌ-e deꞌ mitiaꞌ ingan pakai adon Okuꞌ, Okuꞌ yaꞌ ngin-e.”
pairs.target: If you will ask anything in my name, I will do it.

pairs.source: “Simoꞌ ingan ngibalaꞌ Okuꞌ, ingan yaꞌ nai suaꞌ pilitah Kuꞌ.
pairs.target: If you love me, keep my commandments.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ yaꞌ mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ Samaꞌ, saꞌ Iyoh pait Pinulung deꞌ bokon tuduꞌ ingan, deꞌ mala ogiꞌ duoh ingan.
pairs.target: I will pray to the Father, and he will give you another Counselor,  that he may be with you forever,—

pairs.source: Iyoh inoh Iyang Topaꞌ, deꞌ yaꞌ tanon oniꞌ deꞌ bonal tentang Topaꞌ.  Manusia daang dunia diꞌ-e tapod tilimaꞌ Iyoh, dop-e nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e kilin-E duoh diꞌ-e puꞌan-E.  Pak-e ingan puꞌan Iyoh, dop-e Yoh loꞌo duoh ingan, yohmoꞌ loꞌo daang ingan.
pairs.target: the Spirit of truth, whom the world can’t receive; for it doesn’t see him, neither knows him. You know him, for he lives with you, and will be in you.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ yaꞌ togan ingan kodaꞌ tumang patu.  Okuꞌ yaꞌ paliꞌ nog tuduꞌ ingan.
pairs.target: I will not leave you orphans. I will come to you.

pairs.source: Duam niꞌ tiliaꞌ lagiꞌ manusia daang dunia itih diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ yaꞌ ningaꞌ Okuꞌ, pak-e ingan yaꞌ ningaꞌ Okuꞌ.  Dop-e Okuꞌ idip, ingan tuang yaꞌ idip geh.
pairs.target: Yet a little while, and the world will see me no more; but you will see me. Because I live, you will live also.

pairs.source: Takal inoh ke ingan yaꞌ puꞌan-e nang Okuꞌ idip niꞌ daang Samaꞌ, ingan idip niꞌ daang Okuꞌ, duoh Okuꞌ idip niꞌ daang ingan.
pairs.target: In that day you will know that I am in my Father, and you in me, and I in you.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ tilimaꞌ suaꞌ pilitah Kuꞌ yohmoꞌ nunaꞌ-e, iyoh leh deꞌ ngibala' Okuꞌ.  Simoꞌ nyaꞌa ngibala' Okuꞌ, Samaꞌ Kuꞌ yaꞌ ngibala' iyoh.  Okuꞌ tuang yaꞌ ngibalaꞌ geh iyoh duoh Okuꞌ yaꞌ bitanga odop Kuꞌ tuduꞌ-e.”
pairs.target: One who has my commandments, and keeps them, that person is one who loves me. One who loves me will be loved by my Father, and I will love him, and will reveal myself to him.”

pairs.source: Yudas deꞌ bokon (idoh diꞌ-e Yudas Iskariot) moꞌ in-e, “Topaꞌ, oni nai Ingan yaꞌ bitanga odop Ingan tuduꞌ koꞌih, diꞌ Ingan bitanga tuduꞌ suaꞌ manusia daang dunia?”
pairs.target: Judas (not Iscariot) said to him, “Lord, what has happened that you are about to reveal yourself to us, and not to the world?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ ngibalaꞌ Okuꞌ, yoh yaꞌ nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal Kuꞌ.  Samaꞌ Kuꞌ yaꞌ ngibalaꞌ iyoh.  Samaꞌ duoh Okuꞌ yaꞌ nog tuduꞌ-e yohmoꞌ loꞌo duoh iyoh.
pairs.target: Jesus answered him, “If a man loves me, he will keep my word. My Father will love him, and we will come to him, and make our home with him.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e ngibalaꞌ Okuꞌ, iyoh diꞌ-e nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal Kuꞌ.  Pingajal deꞌ ngojit ingan inoh, idoh diꞌ-e soꞌ Okuꞌ, pak-e soꞌ Samaꞌ deꞌ pait Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: He who doesn’t love me doesn’t keep my words. The word which you hear isn’t mine, but the Father’s who sent me.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ Kuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan takal Kuꞌ aluaꞌ ogiꞌ samah-samah duoh ingan.
pairs.target: I have said these things to you, while still living with you.

pairs.source: Pak-e Iyang Topaꞌ, Pinulung deꞌ yaꞌ pait Samaꞌ daang kuasa Okuꞌ, Iyoh leh deꞌ yaꞌ ngajal ingan tentang suaꞌ oniꞌ duoh odaꞌ ingan natong suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ ngajal Kuꞌ tuduꞌ ingan.
pairs.target: But the Counselor, the Holy Spirit, whom the Father will send in my name, he will teach you all things, and will remind you of all that I said to you.

pairs.source: Idip bidanah Okuꞌ supiah tuduꞌ ingan, idip bidanah deꞌ nog soꞌ Okuꞌ inoh leh deꞌ ngin Kuꞌ tuduꞌ ingan.  Deꞌ ngin Kuꞌ tuduꞌ ingan idoh diꞌ-e kodaꞌ deꞌ ngin manusia daang dunia itih.  Maꞌ bigaduh, maꞌ tolu.
pairs.target: Peace I leave with you. My peace I give to you; not as the world gives, give I to you. Don’t let your heart be troubled, neither let it be fearful.

pairs.source: Ingan moꞌ ngojit Okuꞌ sina tanon nang, ‘Okuꞌ yaꞌ buu, pak-e Okuꞌ yaꞌ paliꞌ nog tuduꞌ ingan.’ Simoꞌ ingan ngibalaꞌ Okuꞌ, totu ingan sonang Okuꞌ odi tuduꞌ Samaꞌ, dop-e Samaꞌ lobih penting soꞌ Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: You heard how I told you, ‘I go away, and I come to you.’ If you loved me, you would have rejoiced, because I said ‘I am going to my Father;’ for the Father is greater than I.

pairs.source: Adin geh Okuꞌ dioꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan, takal oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ aluaꞌ diꞌ-e jadi', saꞌ-e takal-e jadi ingan puꞌan nang oniꞌ deꞌ tanon Kuꞌ tok bonal.
pairs.target: Now I have told you before it happens so that, when it happens, you may believe.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ tiyaꞌ yaꞌ sina bogoꞌ tuduꞌ ingan, dop-e Laja Muat Munua deꞌ nguasa dunia itih nog.  Iyoh sit tuang idoh geh diꞌ-e ponai nguasa Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: I will no more speak much with you, for the prince of the world comes, and he has nothing in me.

pairs.source: Pak-e suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ jadi, saꞌ manusia daang dunia puꞌan nang Okuꞌ ngibalaꞌ Samaꞌ duoh nai suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ Samaꞌ Okuꞌ nai-e.  Jaꞌ otoꞌ buu soꞌ katiꞌ adin.”
pairs.target: But that the world may know that I love the Father, and as the Father commanded me, even so I do. Arise, let us go from here.

pairs.source: Yesus sina lagiꞌ, “Okuꞌ leh tongon anggul deꞌ sibonal-e, duoh Samaꞌ Kuꞌ leh tukang kobon-e.
pairs.target: “I am the true vine, and my Father is the farmer.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ daꞌan Kuꞌ deꞌ jowoh, Samaꞌ Kuꞌ kopog-e, duoh suaꞌ daꞌan Kuꞌ deꞌ bibuaꞌ Iyoh sayan-e saꞌ buaꞌ-e pisong.
pairs.target: Every branch in me that doesn’t bear fruit, he takes away. Every branch that bears fruit, he prunes, that it may bear more fruit.

pairs.source: Ingan moꞌ tawas odaꞌ pingajal deꞌ ngajal Kuꞌ tuduꞌ ingan.
pairs.target: You are already pruned clean because of the word which I have spoken to you.

pairs.source: Totap leh idip niꞌ duoh Okuꞌ, Okuꞌ idip niꞌ duoh Ingan.  Doiꞌ daꞌan deꞌ tapod bibuaꞌ simoꞌ-e sokiag soꞌ tongon-e, pak-e jok-e daꞌan deꞌ lokat duoh tongon-e deꞌ bibuaꞌ.  Wat inoh geh diꞌ ingan tapod bibuaꞌ simoꞌ diꞌ ingan totap idip niꞌ duoh Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: Remain in me, and I in you. As the branch can’t bear fruit by itself, unless it remains in the vine, so neither can you, unless you remain in me.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ leh tongon anggul, ingan daꞌan-daꞌan-e.  Simoꞌ nyaꞌa totap idip niꞌ duoh Okuꞌ, Okuꞌ idip niꞌ duoh iyoh, yoh yaꞌ pisong buaꞌ-e.  Simoꞌ-e diꞌ ingan idip niꞌ duoh Okuꞌ, ingan diꞌ ingan ponai nai oni-oni-e.
pairs.target: I am the vine. You are the branches. He who remains in me, and I in him, the same bears much fruit, for apart from me you can do nothing.

pairs.source: Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ diꞌ-e idip niꞌ duoh Okuꞌ, iyoh obuah tolan kodaꞌ daꞌan deꞌ obuah kopog yohmoꞌ jadin pisok, mokuaꞌ inoh nyaꞌa moꞌ nguluk-e ngan-e tolan kaang opui yohmoꞌ souh.
pairs.target: If a man doesn’t remain in me, he is thrown out as a branch, and is withered; and they gather them, throw them into the fire, and they are burned.

pairs.source: Simoꞌ ingan idip niꞌ duoh Okuꞌ, yohmoꞌ pingunang Kuꞌ totap ogiꞌ daang otin ingan, mitiaꞌ oni sijaꞌ-e deꞌ laꞌan ingan, ingan yaꞌ soꞌon-e.
pairs.target: If you remain in me, and my words remain in you, you will ask whatever you desire, and it will be done for you.

pairs.source: Simoꞌ ingan bibuaꞌ pisong, Samaꞌ obuah pakat ngan-e yaꞌ obuah pimodo.  Ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh ingan tok-tok pinunaꞌ Okuꞌ.”
pairs.target: “In this is my Father glorified, that you bear much fruit; and so you will be my disciples.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ, “Samah kodaꞌ Samaꞌ ngibalaꞌ Okuꞌ, wat inoh geh Okuꞌ ngibalaꞌ ingan.  Totap leh idip niꞌ duoh Okuꞌ, saꞌ ingan puꞌan nang Okuꞌ ngibalaꞌ ingan.
pairs.target: Even as the Father has loved me, I also have loved you. Remain in my love.

pairs.source: Simoꞌ ingan nunaꞌ pilitah Kuꞌ, Okuꞌ totap ngibalaꞌ ingan, samah kodaꞌ Samaꞌ totap ngibalaꞌ Okuꞌ, dop-e Okuꞌ nunaꞌ pilitah-pilitah-E.
pairs.target: If you keep my commandments, you will remain in my love; even as I have kept my Father’s commandments, and remain in his love.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ-e deꞌ munoꞌ Kuꞌ dioꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan, saꞌ ingan suwaꞌ ngoon oni nyam kila Kuꞌ deꞌ doon, yohmoꞌ kila ingan deꞌ doon inoh moꞌ jadin punuaꞌ.
pairs.target: I have spoken these things to you, that my joy may remain in you, and that your joy may be made full.

pairs.source: Itih leh pilitah Kuꞌ tuduꞌ ingan, saꞌ ingan samah-samah ngibalaꞌ tipan odop ingan, samah kodaꞌ Okuꞌ ngibalaꞌ ingan.
pairs.target: “This is my commandment, that you love one another, even as I have loved you.

pairs.source: Doiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngibalaꞌ lobih soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngin asong-e saꞌan dingan-dingan-e.
pairs.target: Greater love has no one than this, that someone lay down his life for his friends.

pairs.source: Ingan leh dingan-dingan Kuꞌ, simoꞌ ingan nai oni deꞌ pilitah Kuꞌ tuduꞌ ingan.
pairs.target: You are my friends, if you do whatever I command you.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ tiyaꞌ sobot ingan kuli, dop-e kuli diꞌ-e puꞌan oni deꞌ nai toke-e.  Okuꞌ sobot nang ingan dingan, dop-e Okuꞌ moꞌ tanon suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ngojit Kuꞌ soꞌ Samaꞌ Kuꞌ tuduꞌ ingan.
pairs.target: No longer do I call you servants, for the servant doesn’t know what his lord does. But I have called you friends, for everything that I heard from my Father, I have made known to you.

pairs.source: Idoh diꞌ-e ingan deꞌ pilih Okuꞌ.  Okuꞌ deꞌ pilih ingan, duoh odaꞌ ingan odi saꞌ-e bibuaꞌ, buaꞌ-e inoh totap taan nah-nah.  Ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh Samaꞌ ngin tuduꞌ ingan oni sijaꞌ-e deꞌ mitiaꞌ ingan tuduꞌ-E daang adon Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: You didn’t choose me, but I chose you, and appointed you, that you should go and bear fruit, and that your fruit should remain; that whatever you will ask of the Father in my name, he may give it to you.

pairs.source: Itih leh pilitah Kuꞌ tuduꞌ ingan: Saꞌ ingan samah-samah ngibalaꞌ sitipan odop ingan.”
pairs.target: “I command these things to you, that you may love one another.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ, “Simoꞌ nyaꞌa daang dunia buꞌui tuduꞌ ingan, natong negeh nang nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ dioꞌ buꞌui tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: If the world hates you, you know that it has hated me before it hated you.

pairs.source: Moꞌ nyam ingan niꞌ pikil duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ daang dunia, ingan yaꞌ obuah ngibalaꞌ odaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ dop-e ingan samah kodaꞌ onak odop-e.  Pak-e Okuꞌ moꞌ pilih ingan soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ daang dunia itih, ingan moꞌ diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ jadin nyaꞌa deꞌ niꞌ pikil duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ.  Yoh ngan nyaꞌa daang dunia buꞌui tuduꞌ ingan.
pairs.target: If you were of the world, the world would love its own. But because you are not of the world, since I chose you out of the world, therefore the world hates you.

pairs.source: Natong negeh oniꞌ deꞌ dioꞌ Kuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan, ‘Bala kuli diꞌ-e lobih penting soꞌ toke-e.’ Simoꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ pijolaꞌ Okuꞌ, wat inoh geh yoh yaꞌ pijolaꞌ ingan.  Simoꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal Kuꞌ, yoh tuang yaꞌ nunaꞌ-e geh oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal ingan.
pairs.target: Remember the word that I said to you: ‘A servant is not greater than his lord.’ If they persecuted me, they will also persecute you. If they kept my word, they will also keep yours.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa daang dunia yaꞌ pijolaꞌ ingan, dop-e ingan moꞌ jadin pinunaꞌ Kuꞌ.  Dop-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e piluh Topaꞌ Samaꞌ deꞌ pait Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: But all these things will they do to you for my name’s sake, because they don’t know him who sent me.

pairs.source: Moꞌ nyam Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ nog tanon oniꞌ deꞌ bonal tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, doiꞌ deꞌ tapod nang odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ salah odaꞌ dosa-e.  Pak-e adin Okuꞌ moꞌ nog duoh tanon suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ, ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ ponai nang, ‘Koꞌih diꞌ koꞌih puꞌan nang oni deꞌ nai koꞌih inoh dosa’.
pairs.target: If I had not come and spoken to them, they would not have had sin; but now they have no excuse for their sin.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ buꞌui tuduꞌ Okuꞌ buꞌui geh tuduꞌ Samaꞌ Kuꞌ.
pairs.target: He who hates me, hates my Father also.

pairs.source: Deꞌ uun nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ, Okuꞌ moꞌ nai oni' deꞌ doiꞌ sidoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon nai-e.  Moꞌ nyam Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ, nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e salah odaꞌ dosa-e.  Pak-e adin nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ kilin suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai Kuꞌ, pak-e aluaꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ buꞌui tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, buꞌui geh tuduꞌ Samaꞌ Kuꞌ.
pairs.target: If I hadn’t done among them the works which no one else did, they wouldn’t have had sin. But now have they seen and also hated both me and my Father.

pairs.source: Tok bonal halus wat inoh, saꞌ-e jadi kodaꞌ deꞌ obuah nulis daang buk Kitab: ‘Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ buꞌui tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, tiap doiꞌ nak ogiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai Kuꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ yoh yaꞌ buꞌui tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.’
pairs.target: But this happened so that the word may be fulfilled which was written in their law, ‘They hated me without a cause.’

pairs.source: Okuꞌ yaꞌ pait tuduꞌ ingan Pinulung deꞌ nog soꞌ Samaꞌ.  Iyoh leh Iyang deꞌ yaꞌ tanon deꞌ bonal tentang  Topaꞌ.  Takal Iyoh nog, Iyoh yaꞌ sobot oni deꞌ puꞌan-E tentang Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: “When the Counselor has come, whom I will send to you from the Father, the Spirit of truth, who proceeds from the Father, he will testify about me.

pairs.source: Wat inoh geh ingan halus sobot oni deꞌ puꞌan ingan tentang Okuꞌ, dop-e soꞌ sibungas-e Okuꞌ mulai nai kiloja Kuꞌ, ingan moꞌ samah-samah duoh Okuꞌ.”
pairs.target: You will also testify, because you have been with me from the beginning.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ, “Suaꞌ-e itih Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan saꞌ diꞌ ingan togan bisayaꞌ ingan tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: “I have said these things to you so that you wouldn’t be caused to stumble.

pairs.source: Ingan yaꞌ obuah piluah soꞌ boli-boli simayang.  Idoh diꞌ-e jok-e inoh, pak-e yaꞌ ogiꞌ takal-e nyaꞌa deꞌ ngabos ingan, yoh sakaꞌ nang odop-e moꞌ layan Topaꞌ ngan-e nai oniꞌ deꞌ wat inoh.
pairs.target: They will put you out of the synagogues. Yes, the time comes that whoever kills you will think that he offers service to God.

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ wat inoh, dop-e yoh diꞌ-e piluh bait Samaꞌ, bait Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: They will do these things because they have not known the Father, nor me.

pairs.source: Pak-e suaꞌ-e itih Kuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan, saꞌ-e moꞌ-e moꞌ nog onu-e, ingan natong nang Okuꞌ moꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan.”    Yesus in-e lagiꞌ, “Tentang oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ aluaꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan soꞌ sibungas-e, dop-e Okuꞌ aluaꞌ ogiꞌ samah-samah duoh ingan.
pairs.target: But I have told you these things, so that when the time comes, you may remember that I told you about them. I didn’t tell you these things from the beginning, because I was with you.

pairs.source: Pak-e adin Okuꞌ odi tuduꞌ Iyoh deꞌ moꞌ pait Okuꞌ.  Yohmoꞌ niꞌ naꞌan tuang doiꞌ geh deꞌ soꞌ ingan deꞌ mutiꞌ deꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Okuꞌ: ‘Kaki soꞌ Ingan yaꞌ odi?’
pairs.target: But now I am going to him who sent me, and none of you asks me, ‘Where are you going?’

pairs.source: Pak-e ngan Kuꞌ moꞌ tanon oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ tuduꞌ ingan, otin ingan moꞌ susah.
pairs.target: But because I have told you these things, sorrow has filled your heart.

pairs.source: Pak-e bonal deꞌ tanon Kuꞌ itih tuduꞌ ingan: Lobih biguna saꞌan ingan moꞌ Kuꞌ buu.  Dop-e moꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ buu, Pinulung inoh diꞌ-e yaꞌ nog tuduꞌ ingan.  Pak-e moꞌ Kuꞌ buu, Okuꞌ yaꞌ pait Iyoh tuduꞌ ingan.
pairs.target: Nevertheless I tell you the truth: It is to your advantage that I go away, for if I don’t go away, the Counselor won’t come to you. But if I go, I will send him to you.

pairs.source: Takal Iyoh nog, Iyoh bitanga tuduꞌ nyaꞌa daang dunia nang nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ salah tentang dosa, tentang oniꞌ deꞌ bonal, duoh tentang ukum.
pairs.target: When he has come, he will convict the world about sin, about righteousness, and about judgment;

pairs.source: Tentang dosa: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ bidosa dop-e doliaꞌ-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: about sin, because they don’t believe in me;

pairs.source: Tentang oniꞌ deꞌ bonal: Okuꞌ moꞌ tanon nang Okuꞌ odi tuduꞌ Samaꞌ yohmoꞌ diꞌ ingan tiyaꞌ kilin Okuꞌ;
pairs.target: about righteousness, because I am going to my Father, and you won’t see me any more;

pairs.source: Tentang ukum: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ puꞌan nang Topaꞌ tok yaꞌ ngukum nyaꞌa deꞌ salah daang dunia, dop-e Topaꞌ moꞌ ngukum Laja Muat deꞌ nguasa dunia itih.
pairs.target: about judgment, because the prince of this world has been judged.

pairs.source: Aluaꞌ bogoꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ halus Kuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan, pak-e adin aluaꞌ diꞌ ingan sangup tilimaꞌ-e.
pairs.target: “I have yet many things to tell you, but you can’t bear them now.

pairs.source: Pak-e yaꞌ nog Iyang Topaꞌ deꞌ tanon oniꞌ deꞌ bonal tentang Topaꞌ.  Takal Iyoh nog, Iyoh leh deꞌ yaꞌ kayak ingan, saꞌ ingan ponai ngiloti suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ bonal.  Iyoh diꞌ-e yaꞌ sina soꞌ odop-E sadiꞌ-E, pak-e Iyoh tanon oni deꞌ moꞌ ngojit-E.  Iyoh tuang yaꞌ tanon-e geh tuduꞌ ingan suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nog tiaꞌ ijoꞌ.
pairs.target: However when he, the Spirit of truth, has come, he will guide you into all truth, for he will not speak from himself; but whatever he hears, he will speak. He will declare to you things that are coming.

pairs.source: Iyoh yaꞌ odaꞌ Okuꞌ obuah mudi duoh obuah pimodo, dop-e oniꞌ deꞌ tanon-E tuduꞌ ingan, Iyoh tilimaꞌ soꞌ Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: He will glorify me, for he will take from what is mine, and will declare it to you.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ Samaꞌ, inoh Okuꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ.  Inoh ngan Kuꞌ nang, oni deꞌ tanon Iyang tuduꞌ ingan, Iyoh tilimaꞌ soꞌ Okuꞌ.”
pairs.target: All things whatever the Father has are mine; therefore I said that he takes of mine, and will declare it to you.

pairs.source: Yesus in-e lagiꞌ, “Duam niꞌ tiliaꞌ lagiꞌ idoh tiyaꞌ diꞌ ingan kilin Okuꞌ, duam niꞌ tiliaꞌ lagiꞌ ingan yaꞌ kilin Okuꞌ.”
pairs.target: A little while, and you will not see me. Again a little while, and you will see me.”

pairs.source: Kudu-kudu naꞌan pinunaꞌ-E sina tipan si odop-e, “Oni loti sina deꞌ nang-E: ‘Duam niꞌ tiliaꞌ lagiꞌ idoh tiyaꞌ diꞌ ingan kilin Okuꞌ, duoh niꞌ tiliaꞌ lagiꞌ ingan yaꞌ kilin Okuꞌ?’ Yohmoꞌ oni loti sina deꞌ nang-E: ‘Okuꞌ odi tuduꞌ Samaꞌ?’ ”
pairs.target: Some of his disciples therefore said to one another, “What is this that he says to us, ‘A little while, and you won’t see me, and again a little while, and you will see me;’ and, ‘Because I go to the Father’?”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e, “Oni loti sina deꞌ nang-E: ‘Duam niꞌ tiliaꞌ lagiꞌ?’ Otoꞌ diꞌ toꞌ puꞌan oni loti-e.”
pairs.target: They said therefore, “What is this that he says, ‘A little while’? We don’t know what he is saying.”

pairs.source: Yesus puꞌan nang ogiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ sikian odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tuduꞌ odop-E, Iyoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Tiꞌ-e Okuꞌ sina nang ‘Duam niꞌ tiliaꞌ lagiꞌ idoh tiyaꞌ diꞌ ingan kilin Okuꞌ, duoh niꞌ tiliaꞌ lagiꞌ ingan yaꞌ kilin Okuꞌ.’ Podo-e inoh oniꞌ deꞌ sikian ingan tipan siodop ingan?
pairs.target: Therefore Jesus perceived that they wanted to ask him, and he said to them, “Do you inquire among yourselves concerning this, that I said, ‘A little while, and you won’t see me, and again a little while, and you will see me?’

pairs.source: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan bonal-bonal: Ingan yaꞌ siꞌian duoh muꞌas, pak-e nyaꞌa daang dunia deꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ yaꞌ doon.  Ingan yaꞌ susah otin pak-e ingan deꞌ susah yaꞌ bilubah jadin doon.
pairs.target: Most certainly I tell you, that you will weep and lament, but the world will rejoice. You will be sorrowful, but your sorrow will be turned into joy.

pairs.source: Moꞌ-e dayung deꞌ bitiiaꞌ sinok-e yaꞌ bilanak, iyoh susah otin-e, dop-e moꞌ nog onu-e iyoh yaꞌ jolaꞌ.  Pak-e takal onak-e moꞌ obuah bilanak, dayung inoh moꞌ komut susah jolaꞌ deꞌ ngoon-e, dop-e iyoh moꞌ doon saꞌan onak-e moꞌ obuah bilanak kaang dunia.
pairs.target: A woman, when she gives birth, has sorrow, because her time has come. But when she has delivered the child, she doesn’t remember the anguish any more, for the joy that a human being is born into the world.

pairs.source: Wat inoh geh duoh ingan: Adin otin ingan susah, pak-e Okuꞌ yaꞌ bitapod lagiꞌ duoh ingan.  Takal inoh leh otin ingan yaꞌ doon, doiꞌ tiyaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ponai kayap doon inoh soꞌ otin ingan.
pairs.target: Therefore you now have sorrow, but I will see you again, and your heart will rejoice, and no one will take your joy away from you.

pairs.source: Takal onu inoh, ingan diꞌ ingan sikian oni-oni-e tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.  Okuꞌ tanon bonal-bonal tuduꞌ ingan: Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ mitiaꞌ ingan tuduꞌ Samaꞌ daang adon Okuꞌ yaꞌ obuah ngin tuduꞌ ingan.
pairs.target: “In that day you will ask me no questions. Most certainly I tell you, whatever you may ask of the Father in my name, he will give it to you.

pairs.source: Sape nog adin ingan diꞌ ingan mitiaꞌ oni-oni daang adon Okuꞌ.  Mitiaꞌ leh daang adon Okuꞌ, ingan moꞌ tilimaꞌ-e saꞌ ingan sukup doon-e.”
pairs.target: Until now, you have asked nothing in my name. Ask, and you will receive, that your joy may be made full.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ, “Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan pakai nang silita, pak-e yaꞌ ogiꞌ takal-e Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ tiyaꞌ pakai nang silita, Okuꞌ yaꞌ lasuꞌ sina suang-suang in Kuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan tentang Samaꞌ.
pairs.target: I have spoken these things to you in figures of speech. But the time is coming when I will no more speak to you in figures of speech, but will tell you plainly about the Father.

pairs.source: Takal inoh leh ingan yaꞌ mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ Samaꞌ daang adon Okuꞌ.  Ingan halus puꞌan nang Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ tiyaꞌ jolaꞌ mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ Samaꞌ saꞌan ingan.
pairs.target: In that day you will ask in my name; and I don’t say to you, that I will pray to the Father for you,

pairs.source: Dop-e odop Samaꞌ ngibalaꞌ ingan.  Iyoh ngibalaꞌ ingan dop-e ingan ngibalaꞌ Okuꞌ duoh bisayaꞌ nang Okuꞌ nog soꞌ Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: for the Father himself loves you, because you have loved me, and have believed that I came from God.

pairs.source: Tok Okuꞌ nog soꞌ Samaꞌ, duoh moꞌ nog kaang dunia.  Pak-e adin Okuꞌ buu soꞌ dunia ngan Kuꞌ paliꞌ tuduꞌ Samaꞌ.”
pairs.target: I came from the Father, and have come into the world. Again, I leave the world, and go to the Father.”

pairs.source: Yohmoꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus sina tuduꞌ-E, “Adin suang-suang in Ingan sina, diꞌ Ingan pakai nang silita.
pairs.target: His disciples said to him, “Behold, now you are speaking plainly, and using no figures of speech.

pairs.source: Adin koꞌih puꞌan nang Ingan puꞌan suaꞌ oniꞌ, dusah nyaꞌa sikian tuduꞌ Ingan.  Inoh leh ngan koꞌih bisayaꞌ nang Ingan nog soꞌ Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: Now we know that you know all things, and don’t need for anyone to question you. By this we believe that you came from God.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Bisayaꞌ keh idoh ingan adin?
pairs.target: Jesus answered them, “Do you now believe?

pairs.source: Pak-e ningaꞌ onu-e moꞌ yaꞌ nog, adin geh moꞌ onu inoh moꞌ nog! Ingan yaꞌ sobak sobul buu, ingan yaꞌ masim-masim paliꞌ keꞌ boli, duoh togan Okuꞌ sadiꞌ Kuꞌ.  Pak-e Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ sadiꞌ Kuꞌ dop-e Samaꞌ ogiꞌ samah-samah duoh Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: Behold, the time is coming, yes, and has now come, that you will be scattered, everyone to his own place, and you will leave me alone. Yet I am not alone, because the Father is with me.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan, saꞌ ingan idip bidanah dop-e ingan idip niꞌ duoh Okuꞌ.  Daang dunia, ingan yaꞌ idip jolaꞌ, pak-e maꞌ tolu dop-e Okuꞌ moꞌ monang lawan dunia itih.”
pairs.target: I have told you these things, that in me you may have peace. In the world you have oppression; but cheer up! I have overcome the world.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ sina in inoh, Yesus moꞌ bigalong keꞌ longit yohmoꞌ in-e, “Oi Samaꞌ Kuꞌ, adin moꞌ nog onu-e.  Bitanga leh nang Onak Muꞌ itih ayuh kuasa-E, saꞌ Onak Muꞌ bitanga Ingan deꞌ ayuh kuasa-E.
pairs.target: Jesus said these things, and lifting up his eyes to heaven, he said, “Father, the time has come. Glorify your Son, that your Son may also glorify you;
