pairs.source: Dop-e Ingan moꞌ ngin kuasa deꞌ Onak odaꞌ nguasa suaꞌ manusia, saꞌ Iyoh dapod ngin idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ ngin Ingan tuduꞌ-E.
pairs.target: even as you gave him authority over all flesh, so he will give eternal life to all whom you have given him.

pairs.source: Itih leh idip nah-nah duoh Topaꞌ: Nyaꞌa piluh Ingan inoh, Topaꞌ deꞌ bonal, duoh piluh Okuꞌ, Yesus Kristus, deꞌ moꞌ obuah pait odaꞌ Ingan kaang dunia.
pairs.target: This is eternal life, that they should know you, the only true God, and him whom you sent, Jesus Christ.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ moꞌ bitanga kuasa Ingan deꞌ ayuh deꞌ dunia takal Okuꞌ mokuaꞌ nai kiloja deꞌ odaꞌ Ingan Okuꞌ nai-e.
pairs.target: I glorified you on the earth. I have accomplished the work which you have given me to do.

pairs.source: Adin, oi Samaꞌ Kuꞌ, odaꞌ leh Okuꞌ obuah pimodo deꞌ sulung jowin Ingan samah kodaꞌ Okuꞌ obuah pimodo takal dunia aluaꞌ diꞌ-e obuah nai.
pairs.target: Now, Father, glorify me with your own self with the glory which I had with you before the world existed.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ moꞌ magah tentang Ingan tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ ngin Ingan tuduꞌ Okuꞌ soꞌ dunia.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ Ingan deꞌ kakuꞌ duoh Ingan moꞌ ngin odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tuang moꞌ nunaꞌ-e geh pingunang Ingan.
pairs.target: I revealed your name to the people whom you have given me out of the world. They were yours, and you have given them to me. They have kept your word.

pairs.source: Adin odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ puꞌan nang suaꞌ-e deꞌ kakuꞌ Okuꞌ, Ingan deꞌ ngin tuduꞌ Okuꞌ,
pairs.target: Now they have known that all things whatever you have given me are from you,

pairs.source: dop-e suaꞌ pingunang deꞌ ngin Ingan tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, moꞌ tanon Kuꞌ tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, yoh moꞌ tilimaꞌ-e.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bonal-bonal puꞌan nang Okuꞌ nog soꞌ Ingan.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bisayaꞌ nang Ingan leh deꞌ pait Okuꞌ kaang dunia.
pairs.target: for the words which you have given me I have given to them, and they received them, and knew for sure that I came from you, and they have believed that you sent me.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ bidoa saꞌan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.  Idoh diꞌ-e saꞌan suaꞌ nyaꞌa daang dunia pak-e Okuꞌ bidoa saꞌan odop-e deꞌ moꞌ ngin Ingan tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, dop-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ Ingan deꞌ kakuꞌ.
pairs.target: I pray for them. I don’t pray for the world, but for those whom you have given me, for they are yours.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ Kuꞌ, Ingan deꞌ kakuꞌ.  Wat inoh geh suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ Ingan, kakuꞌ Kuꞌ geh.  Okuꞌ moꞌ obuah mudi odaꞌ idip odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: All things that are mine are yours, and yours are mine, and I am glorified in them.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ doiꞌ tiyaꞌ daang dunia, pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ aluaꞌ daang dunia.  Okuꞌ nog tuduꞌ Ingan.  Oi Samaꞌ Kuꞌ deꞌ bisig, jaga leh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ pakai kuasa adon Ingan, adon deꞌ ngin Ingan tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, saꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ jadin niꞌ samah kodaꞌ Otoꞌ.
pairs.target: I am no more in the world, but these are in the world, and I am coming to you. Holy Father, keep them through your name which you have given me, that they may be one, even as we are.

pairs.source: Takal Okuꞌ aluaꞌ ogiꞌ samah-samah duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, Okuꞌ jaga odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ daang adon Ingan deꞌ moꞌ ngin Ingan tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.  Okuꞌ moꞌ jaga odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ saꞌ-e niꞌ naꞌan tuang doiꞌ geh soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ moyap soꞌ olan deꞌ bonal, pak-e jok-e niꞌ deꞌ soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ moyap soꞌ olan deꞌ bonal.  Saꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ jadi samah kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ obuah nulis daang buk Kitab.
pairs.target: While I was with them in the world, I kept them in your name. Those whom you have given me I have kept. None of them is lost, except the son of destruction, that the Scripture might be fulfilled.

pairs.source: Adin Okuꞌ nog tuduꞌ Ingan duoh mitiaꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ takal Okuꞌ aluaꞌ ogiꞌ daang dunia, saꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bonal-bonal ngoon doon samah kodaꞌ doon deꞌ ngoon Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: But now I come to you, and I say these things in the world, that they may have my joy made full in themselves.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ moꞌ magah pingunang deꞌ soꞌ Ingan tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.  Nyaꞌa daang dunia moꞌ buꞌui tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ dop-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e dunia deꞌ kakuꞌ, samah kodaꞌ Okuꞌ, idoh diꞌ-e dunia deꞌ kakuꞌ.
pairs.target: I have given them your word. The world hated them, because they are not of the world, even as I am not of the world.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ mitiaꞌ saꞌ Ingan mit odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ soꞌ dunia itih, pak-e Okuꞌ mitiaꞌ saꞌ Ingan jaga odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ saꞌ-e silamat soꞌ Laja Muat Munua.
pairs.target: I pray not that you would take them from the world, but that you would keep them from the evil one.

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ idoh diꞌ-e dunia deꞌ kakuꞌ, samah kodaꞌ Okuꞌ, idoh diꞌ-e dunia deꞌ kakuꞌ.
pairs.target: They are not of the world even as I am not of the world.

pairs.source: Odaꞌ leh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ jadin nyaꞌa deꞌ jok-e Ingan deꞌ kakuꞌ daang oniꞌ deꞌ bonal.  Pingunang Ingan inoh leh oniꞌ deꞌ bonal.
pairs.target: Sanctify them in your truth. Your word is truth.

pairs.source: Samah kodaꞌ Ingan pait Okuꞌ kaang dunia, wat inoh geh Okuꞌ pait odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ kaang dunia.
pairs.target: As you sent me into the world, even so I have sent them into the world.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ ngin odop kuꞌ jok-e saꞌan Ingan.  Okuꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ saꞌan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, saꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ jadin nyaꞌa deꞌ jok-e saꞌan Ingan pakai ajal Ingan deꞌ bonal.
pairs.target: For their sakes I sanctify myself, that they themselves also may be sanctified in truth.

pairs.source: Idoh diꞌ Kuꞌ bidoa jok-e saꞌan odop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ, pak-e saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ ngan-e ngojit gah deꞌ tanon odop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ.
pairs.target: Not for these only do I pray, but for those also who will believe in me through their word,

pairs.source: Okuꞌ bidoa tuduꞌ Ingan saꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ jadin niꞌ.  Samah kodaꞌ Ingan, oi Samaꞌ Kuꞌ, Ingan ogiꞌ daang Okuꞌ, Okuꞌ ogiꞌ daang Ingan, saꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ogiꞌ geh daang Otoꞌ.  Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ jadi saꞌ dunia bisayaꞌ nang Ingan leh deꞌ moꞌ pait Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: that they may all be one; even as you, Father, are in me, and I in you, that they also may be one in us; that the world may believe that you sent me.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ moꞌ odaꞌ idip odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ obuah mudi samah kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nai Ingan tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, saꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ jadin niꞌ, samah kodaꞌ Otoꞌ itih niꞌ.
pairs.target: The glory which you have given me, I have given to them; that they may be one, even as we are one;

pairs.source: Okuꞌ ogiꞌ daang odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, Ingan ogiꞌ daang Okuꞌ, saꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bonal-bonal jadin niꞌ.  Ngan-e wat inoh dunia yaꞌ puꞌan nang Ingan leh deꞌ moꞌ pait Okuꞌ, duoh Ingan ngibalaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ kodaꞌ Ingan ngibalaꞌ Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: I in them, and you in me, that they may be perfected into one; that the world may know that you sent me, and loved them, even as you loved me.

pairs.source: Oi Samaꞌ Kuꞌ, Okuꞌ laꞌan odaꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngin Ingan tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, ogiꞌ samah-samah duoh Okuꞌ deꞌ topat daki soꞌ Okuꞌ ogiꞌ.  Ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ dapod ningaꞌ kuasa deꞌ ayuh deꞌ ngin Ingan tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, dop-e Ingan ngibalaꞌ Okuꞌ soꞌ takal dunia aluaꞌ diꞌ-e obuah nai.
pairs.target: Father, I desire that they also whom you have given me be with me where I am, that they may see my glory, which you have given me, for you loved me before the foundation of the world.

pairs.source: Oi Samaꞌ Kuꞌ deꞌ adil, dunia diꞌ-e piluh Ingan, pak-e Okuꞌ piluh Ingan, odop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ tuang puꞌan-e geh nang Ingan deꞌ moꞌ pait Okuꞌ.
pairs.target: Righteous Father, the world hasn’t known you, but I knew you; and these knew that you sent me.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ moꞌ magah tentang Ingan tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, duoh Okuꞌ moꞌ jokowat Kuꞌ yaꞌ magah tentang Ingan, saꞌ-e samah kodaꞌ Ingan deꞌ moꞌ ngibalaꞌ Okuꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tuang ngibalaꞌ geh Okuꞌ duoh Okuꞌ idip niꞌ duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: I made known to them your name, and will make it known; that the love with which you loved me may be in them, and I in them.”

pairs.source: Takal Yesus mokuaꞌ bidoa in inoh, Iyoh duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E odi keꞌ polad sungi Kidron.  Deꞌ danoꞌ ogiꞌ taman, Iyoh duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ molot kanoꞌ.
pairs.target: When Jesus had spoken these words, he went out with his disciples over the brook Kidron, where there was a garden, into which he and his disciples entered.

pairs.source: Yudas, nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ jua Yesus tuduꞌ musuh-musuh-E, tuang puꞌan-e geh topat inoh, dop-e Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E lika tikuluk danoꞌ.
pairs.target: Now Judas, who betrayed him, also knew the place, for Jesus often met there with his disciples.

pairs.source: Yudas moꞌ odi keꞌ topat inoh toban baya bala sidadu Romawi.  Iyoh toban-e geh ayua nyaꞌa deꞌ jaga Boli Topaꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ ayua pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh duoh uluk ulang Farisi.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ toban podang, asual, baya lapu kadis duoh obol.
pairs.target: Judas then, having taken a detachment of soldiers and officers from the chief priests and the Pharisees, came there with lanterns, torches, and weapons.

pairs.source: Yesus deꞌ moꞌ dioꞌ puꞌan oni deꞌ yaꞌ obuah odop-E, Iyoh moꞌ maju sinok odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, Iyoh moꞌ in-e, “Osi leh deꞌ kalik ingan neh?”
pairs.target: Jesus therefore, knowing all the things that were happening to him, went out, and said to them, “Who are you looking for?”

pairs.source: In odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nyawot-E, “Yesus soꞌ kota Nazaret.” Yohmoꞌ in Yesus nyawot odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Okuꞌ itih leh odop-E.” Yudas deꞌ jua Yesus tuduꞌ musuh-musuh-E mujuag danoꞌ duoh ayua deꞌ toban-e kanoꞌ.
pairs.target: They answered him, “Jesus of Nazareth.” Jesus said to them, “I am he.” Judas also, who betrayed him, was standing with them.

pairs.source: Takal Yesus sina nang, “Okuꞌ itih leh odop-E,” odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ suaꞌ-e munul yohmoꞌ labuꞌ keꞌ tanaꞌ.
pairs.target: When therefore he said to them, “I am he,” they went backward, and fell to the ground.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ sikian lagiꞌ tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Ingan kalik osi?” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-E in-e, “Yesus soꞌ Nazaret.”
pairs.target: Again therefore he asked them, “Who are you looking for?” They said, “Jesus of Nazareth.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ sina in-E, “Tuang Kuꞌ mokuaꞌ tanon-e, Okuꞌ itih leh odop-E.  Simoꞌ-o tok ingan kalik Okuꞌ, tanah saꞌ ayua pinunaꞌ Kuꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ buu.” (
pairs.target: Jesus answered, “I told you that I am he. If therefore you seek me, let these go their way,”

pairs.source: Sina Yesus inoh jadi kodaꞌ deꞌ nang-E daang doa-E, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ ngin Ingan tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, niꞌ tuang doiꞌ geh deꞌ moyap soꞌ olan deꞌ bonal.”)
pairs.target: that the word might be fulfilled which he spoke, “Of those whom you have given me, I have lost none.”

pairs.source: Simon Petrus deꞌ toban podang deꞌ kodit moꞌ nyitak podang-e yohmoꞌ nyopaꞌ kojit toꞌuh kuli Pimipin Agama Yahudi deꞌ Paling Ayuh odaꞌ sopial.  Adon kuli-e inoh Malkus.
pairs.target: Simon Peter therefore, having a sword, drew it, and struck the high priest’s servant, and cut off his right ear. The servant’s name was Malchus.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ Petrus, “Sok podang muꞌ kaang duuang-e! Dop-e Okuꞌ halus nuak soꞌ sakil susah jolaꞌ deꞌ ngin Samaꞌ Kuꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.”
pairs.target: Jesus therefore said to Peter, “Put the sword into its sheath. The cup which the Father has given me, shall I not surely drink it?”

pairs.source: Komandan sidadu Romawi duoh sidadu-sidadu-e baya nyaꞌa deꞌ jaga Boli Topaꞌ moꞌ takap Yesus yohmoꞌ pasung-E.
pairs.target: So the detachment, the commanding officer, and the officers of the Jews, seized Jesus and bound him,

pairs.source: Sibungas-e nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ toban tuduꞌ Hanas, tua Kayafas deꞌ dali.  Kayafas inoh Pimipin Agama Yahudi deꞌ Paling Ayuh sowaꞌ inoh.
pairs.target: and led him to Annas first, for he was father-in-law to Caiaphas, who was high priest that year.

pairs.source: Kayafas inoh leh deꞌ moꞌ ngin sibaya deꞌ in-e tuduꞌ ayua pimipin Yahudi, “Paguh dooꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa kobos saꞌan suaꞌ bangsa.”
pairs.target: Now it was Caiaphas who advised the Jews that it was expedient that one man should perish for the people.

pairs.source: Simon Petrus duoh niꞌ naꞌan pinunaꞌ Yesus deꞌ bokon bitunaꞌ duoh Yesus.  Pinunaꞌ Yesus deꞌ niꞌ naꞌan itih moꞌ piluh Pimipin Agama Yahudi deꞌ Paling Ayuh, iyoh moꞌ suwaꞌ molot samah-samah duoh Yesus keꞌ limang boli Pimipin Agama Yahudi deꞌ Paling Ayuh.
pairs.target: Simon Peter followed Jesus, as did another disciple. Now that disciple was known to the high priest, and entered in with Jesus into the court of the high priest;

pairs.source: Pak-e Petrus kajon deꞌ sopaꞌ sinok tiban ijuam.  Pinunaꞌ Yesus deꞌ niꞌ tiꞌ-e luah sina tuduꞌ kuli deꞌ dayung deꞌ jaga tiban, yohmoꞌ toban Petrus molot.
pairs.target: but Peter was standing at the door outside. So the other disciple, who was known to the high priest, went out and spoke to her who kept the door, and brought in Peter.

pairs.source: Kuli deꞌ dayung deꞌ jaga tiban inoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Petrus, “Bah, idoh keh diꞌ-e muꞌu itih pinunaꞌ Iyoh deꞌ obuah takap inoh neh?” Petrus moꞌ nyawot-e in-e, “Idoh!”
pairs.target: Then the maid who kept the door said to Peter, “Are you also one of this man’s disciples?” He said, “I am not.”

pairs.source: Ngalom inoh modud, yoh leh ngan ayua kuli baya ayua deꞌ jaga Boli Topaꞌ moꞌ bilasa nai opui yohmoꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ngunuh.  Petrus suwaꞌ odi ngunuh duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.  Pimipin Agama Yahudi deꞌ Paling Ayuh sikian tuduꞌ Yesus
pairs.target: Now the servants and the officers were standing there, having made a fire of coals, for it was cold. They were warming themselves. Peter was with them, standing and warming himself.

pairs.source: Pimipin Agama Yahudi deꞌ Paling Ayuh sikian tuduꞌ Yesus tentang pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E duoh oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal-E.
pairs.target: The high priest therefore asked Jesus about his disciples, and about his teaching.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Okuꞌ mala sina suang-suang in Kuꞌ deꞌ sulung jowin nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ, Okuꞌ mala ngajal deꞌ boli-boli topat simayang agama Yahudi duoh deꞌ Boli Topaꞌ, topat soꞌ ulang Yahudi tikuluk.  Doiꞌ sidoh Kuꞌ suwan-suwan tanon oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal Kuꞌ.
pairs.target: Jesus answered him, “I spoke openly to the world. I always taught in synagogues, and in the temple, where the Jews always meet. I said nothing in secret.

pairs.source: Adin oni nai ingan sikian tuduꞌ Okuꞌ? Sikian leh tuduꞌ ayua deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ moꞌ ngojit Okuꞌ ngajal, totu ayua deꞌ munoꞌ puꞌan oni deꞌ moꞌ tanon Kuꞌ.”
pairs.target: Why do you ask me? Ask those who have heard me what I said to them. Behold, these know the things which I said.”

pairs.source: Takal Yesus sina deꞌ in inoh, niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ jaga deꞌ mujuag danoꞌ moꞌ napal jowin-E simadi-e sina, “Bilani manah muꞌu nyawot in inoh tuduꞌ Pimipin Agama Yahudi deꞌ Paling Ayuh!”
pairs.target: When he had said this, one of the officers standing by slapped Jesus with his hand, saying, “Do you answer the high priest like that?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot in-E, “Simoꞌ sina Okuꞌ inoh salah, tanon leh daki salah-e, pak-e moꞌ sina Kuꞌ inoh bonal, oni nai ingan napal Okuꞌ?”
pairs.target: Jesus answered him, “If I have spoken evil, testify of the evil; but if well, why do you beat me?”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Hanas moꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa toban Yesus deꞌ aluaꞌ obuah pasung tuduꞌ Kayafas, Pimipin Agama Yahudi deꞌ Paling Ayuh.
pairs.target: Annas sent him bound to Caiaphas, the high priest.

pairs.source: Simon Petrus aluaꞌ mujuag ngunuh, in nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ tuduꞌ-e, “Idoh keh diꞌ-e muꞌu itih pinunaꞌ-E?” Petrus moꞌ diꞌ-e ngakuꞌ-e, in-e, “Idoh.”
pairs.target: Now Simon Peter was standing and warming himself. They said therefore to him, “You aren’t also one of his disciples, are you?” He denied it, and said, “I am not.”

pairs.source: Niꞌ naꞌan kuli Pimipin Agama Yahudi deꞌ Paling Ayuh, iyoh inoh aluaꞌ madih nyaꞌa deꞌ nyopaꞌ Petrus kojit-e, in-e tuduꞌ Petrus “Idoh keh diꞌ-e muꞌu deꞌ kilin kuꞌ deꞌ taman inoh samah-samah duoh Iyoh?”
pairs.target: One of the servants of the high priest, being a relative of him whose ear Peter had cut off, said, “Didn’t I see you in the garden with him?”

pairs.source: Petrus moꞌ diꞌ-e ngakuꞌ-e lagiꞌ, takal inoh geh, babang siuak bitadu.
pairs.target: Peter therefore denied it again, and immediately the rooster crowed.

pairs.source: Suam-suam pagi ayua pimipin agama Yahudi toban Yesus soꞌ boli Kayafas odi keꞌ istana Pilatus deꞌ jadin gubelnul Roma.  Ulang-ulang Yahudi diꞌ-e suwaꞌ molot kaang istana saꞌ-e diꞌ-e kaꞌis odop-e nunaꞌ atulan agama Yahudi dop-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ man pinguman Paskah.
pairs.target: They led Jesus therefore from Caiaphas into the Praetorium. It was early, and they themselves didn’t enter into the Praetorium, that they might not be defiled, but might eat the Passover.

pairs.source: Inoh leh ngan Pilatus luah bitapod duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, iyoh moꞌ sikian in-e, “Oni deꞌ nuduh ingan tuduꞌ nyaꞌa itih?”
pairs.target: Pilate therefore went out to them, and said, “What accusation do you bring against this man?”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-e, “Simoꞌ Iyoh itih diꞌ-e ulang jaꞌat, idoh diꞌ koꞌih toban Iyoh tuduꞌ ingan!”
pairs.target: They answered him, “If this man weren’t an evildoer, we wouldn’t have delivered him up to you.”

pairs.source: In Pilatus tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Mit negeh Iyoh itih, motod negeh salah-E nunaꞌ ukum odop ingan!” In ayua ulang Yahudi deꞌ munoꞌ, “Koꞌih diꞌ soꞌon ngukum ngabos nyaꞌa.” (
pairs.target: Pilate therefore said to them, “Take him yourselves, and judge him according to your law.” Therefore the Jews said to him, “It is not lawful for us to put anyone to death,”

pairs.source: Wat inoh leh wat-e saꞌ-e jadi samah kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ tanon Yesus tentang wat ki wat Iyoh yaꞌ kobos.)
pairs.target: that the word of Jesus might be fulfilled, which he spoke, signifying by what kind of death he should die.

pairs.source: Pilatus moꞌ paliꞌ molot kaang istana gubelnul, yohmoꞌ odaꞌ sidadu-e toban Yesus molot, yohmoꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Yesus in-e, “Podo Muꞌu Laja ulang Yahudi?”
pairs.target: Pilate therefore entered again into the Praetorium, called Jesus, and said to him, “Are you the King of the Jews?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Podo pinyikian ingan itih soꞌ odop ingan keh ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan tentang Okuꞌ?”
pairs.target: Jesus answered him, “Do you say this by yourself, or did others tell you about me?”

pairs.source: Pilatus moꞌ nyawot-E, “Podo okuꞌ itih ulang Yahudi? Deꞌ nyelah Muꞌu tuduꞌ okuꞌ, bangsa odop Muꞌ duoh ayua pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh.  Oni deꞌ moꞌ nai Muꞌ?”
pairs.target: Pilate answered, “I’m not a Jew, am I? Your own nation and the chief priests delivered you to me. What have you done?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ sina, “ Okuꞌ militah idoh diꞌ-e soꞌ dunia itih.  Simoꞌ Okuꞌ militah soꞌ dunia itih, totu nyaꞌa deꞌ nunaꞌ Okuꞌ moꞌ lawan saꞌ Okuꞌ diꞌ-e obuah nyelah tuduꞌ ayua pimipin Yahudi, pak-e Okuꞌ militah tok idoh diꞌ-e soꞌ dunia itih.”
pairs.target: Jesus answered, “My Kingdom is not of this world. If my Kingdom were of this world, then my servants would fight, that I wouldn’t be delivered to the Jews. But now my Kingdom is not from here.”

pairs.source: Yoh leh ngan Pilatus moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ-E, “Podo loti-e Muꞌu nang odop Muꞌ Laja?” Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Ingan deꞌ sobot nang Okuꞌ Laja.  Saꞌan inoh leh Okuꞌ obuah bilanak duoh nog kaang dunia itih, saꞌ Okuꞌ tanon tentang oniꞌ deꞌ bonal.  Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tilimaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ bonal ngojit sina Kuꞌ.”
pairs.target: Pilate therefore said to him, “Are you a king then?” Jesus answered, “You say that I am a king. For this reason I have been born, and for this reason I have come into the world, that I should testify to the truth. Everyone who is of the truth listens to my voice.”

pairs.source: In Pilatus tuduꞌ-E, “Oni oniꞌ deꞌ bonal inoh?”   Takal-e mokuaꞌ nang sina deꞌ in inoh, Pilatus moꞌ luah lagiꞌ tuduꞌ ulang-ulang Yahudi, yohmoꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, in-e, “Okuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ tapod oni-oni salah-E.
pairs.target: Pilate said to him, “What is truth?” When he had said this, he went out again to the Jews, and said to them, “I find no basis for a charge against him.

pairs.source: Pak-e nunaꞌ deꞌ konyat ingan nai daang onu ayuh Paskah, okuꞌ pilopas niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah naan saꞌan ingan.  Laꞌan ingan yeh okuꞌ pilopas Laja ulang Yahudi saꞌan ingan?”
pairs.target: But you have a custom, that I should release someone to you at the Passover. Therefore, do you want me to release to you the King of the Jews?”

pairs.source: Ayua deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nang bogan-e, “Maꞌ! Idoh diꞌ-e Iyoh neh, pak-e Barabas!” Barabas inoh yohleh nyaꞌa deꞌ lawan pilitah.
pairs.target: Then they all shouted again, saying, “Not this man, but Barabbas!” Now Barabbas was a robber.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Pilatus moꞌ odaꞌ ayua sidadu bipodos duoh Yesus.
pairs.target: So Pilate then took Jesus, and flogged him.

pairs.source: Ayua sidadu deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngolung daꞌan koyuh deꞌ ogiꞌ lojaꞌ-a nai kodaꞌ mahkota yohmoꞌ naꞌ deꞌ bak Yesus.  Mokuaꞌ inoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sok jubah ungu tuduꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: The soldiers twisted thorns into a crown, and put it on his head, and dressed him in a purple garment.

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e mokuaꞌ-mokuaꞌ  odi keꞌ sulung jowin Yesus daang-e nguyat-E, in-e, “Tabiꞌ laja ulang Yahudi!” Mokuaꞌ inoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ napal jowin-E.
pairs.target: They kept saying, “Hail, King of the Jews!” and they kept slapping him.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Pilatus moꞌ luah lagiꞌ yohmoꞌ in-e tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ inoh, “Ningaꞌ, okuꞌ toban Iyoh luah tuduꞌ ingan, saꞌ ingan puꞌan nang okuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ tapod oni-oni salah-E.”
pairs.target: Then Pilate went out again, and said to them, “Behold, I bring him out to you, that you may know that I find no basis for a charge against him.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ luah, Iyoh aluaꞌ pakai mahkota deꞌ soꞌ daꞌan koyuh deꞌ bilojaꞌ duoh pakai jubah ungu.  Pilatus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ, “Ningaꞌ mey nyaꞌa itih!”
pairs.target: Jesus therefore came out, wearing the crown of thorns and the purple garment. Pilate said to them, “Behold, the man!”

pairs.source: Takal ayua pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ jaga inoh ningaꞌ Yesus, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nang bogan-e, “Masak Iyoh tun salip, masak Iyoh tun salip!” Pilatus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ, “Odop ingan mit Iyoh masak Iyoh deꞌ salip, dop-e okuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ tapod oni oni salah-E.”
pairs.target: When therefore the chief priests and the officers saw him, they shouted, saying, “Crucify! Crucify!” Pilate said to them, “Take him yourselves, and crucify him, for I find no basis for a charge against him.”

pairs.source: Ayua ulang Yahudi deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e, “Iyoh nang odop-E Onak Topaꞌ! Yoh leh ngan-e nunaꞌ atulan koꞌih, Iyoh halus obuah ukum ngabos”
pairs.target: The Jews answered him, “We have a law, and by our law he ought to die, because he made himself the Son of God.”

pairs.source: Takal Pilatus ngojit sina ayua deꞌ munoꞌ iyoh moꞌ makin tolu.
pairs.target: When therefore Pilate heard this saying, he was more afraid.

pairs.source: Iyoh moꞌ paliꞌ molot kaang istana gubelnul duoh sina tuduꞌ Yesus, “Soꞌ ki soꞌ Muꞌ nog?” Pak-e Yesus diꞌ-e nyawot-e.
pairs.target: He entered into the Praetorium again, and said to Jesus, “Where are you from?” But Jesus gave him no answer.

pairs.source: Yoh leh ngan Pilatus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ-E, “Idoh keh diꞌ Muꞌu yaꞌ sina duoh okuꞌ? Idoh diꞌ Muꞌu puꞌan nang okuꞌ ogiꞌ kuasa kuꞌ pilopas Muꞌu duoh ogiꞌ kuasa kuꞌ odaꞌ Muꞌu obuah masak deꞌ tun salip?”
pairs.target: Pilate therefore said to him, “Aren’t you speaking to me? Don’t you know that I have power to release you, and have power to crucify you?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Ingan doiꞌ kuasa oni-oni tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, simoꞌ kuasa inoh diꞌ obuah ngin tuduꞌ muꞌu soꞌ Topaꞌ.  Inoh leh ngan iyoh deꞌ nyelah Okuꞌ tuduꞌ ingan, lobih ayuh dosa-e soꞌ ingan.”
pairs.target: Jesus answered, “You would have no power at all against me, unless it were given to you from above. Therefore he who delivered me to you has greater sin.”

pairs.source: Takal Pilatus ngojit sina deꞌ nang Yesus inoh, iyoh kagaꞌ ngan-e yaꞌ pilopas-E.  Pak-e ulang-ulang Yahudi nang bogan-e, “Simoꞌ ingan pilopas Iyoh, idoh diꞌ ingan dingan laja Roma deꞌ paling ayuh.  Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nang odop-e laja, iyoh musuh laja Roma deꞌ paling ayuh.”
pairs.target: At this, Pilate was seeking to release him, but the Jews cried out, saying, “If you release this man, you aren’t Caesar’s friend! Everyone who makes himself a king speaks against Caesar!”

pairs.source: Takal Pilatus ngojit sina deꞌ in inoh, yoh moꞌ odaꞌ toban Yesus luah.  Pilatus moꞌ guluꞌ deꞌ topat soꞌ-e ngadel nyaꞌa.  Topat guluꞌ inoh adon-e Topas Batuh.  Daang sina Ibrani adon-e Gabata.
pairs.target: When Pilate therefore heard these words, he brought Jesus out, and sat down on the judgment seat at a place called “The Pavement”, but in Hebrew, “Gabbatha.”

pairs.source: Takal inoh kila-kila pukul simoong duwoh uun onu, takal inoh geh ulang-ulang Yahudi yaꞌ siap-siap yaꞌ nyamut onu ayuh paskah.  Pilatus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ ulang-ulang Yahudi, “Ningaꞌ mey laja ingan!”
pairs.target: Now it was the Preparation Day of the Passover, at about the sixth hour. He said to the Jews, “Behold, your King!”

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nang bogan-e, “Ngabos Iyoh! Ngabos Iyoh! Masak Iyoh deꞌ tun salip!” Pilatus moꞌ sikian, “Podo ingan odaꞌ okuꞌ masak laja ingan deꞌ tun salip?” Ayua pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh nyawot-e, “Jok-e laja Roma deꞌ paling ayuh sijaꞌ-e laja koꞌih!”
pairs.target: They cried out, “Away with him! Away with him! Crucify him!” Pilate said to them, “Shall I crucify your King?” The chief priests answered, “We have no king but Caesar!”

pairs.source: Pilatus moꞌ nunaꞌ deꞌ mitiaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.  Iyoh moꞌ nyelah Yesus tuduꞌ sidadu-sidadu-e saꞌ-e masak Iyoh deꞌ tun salip.   Ayua sidadu deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ mit Yesus.
pairs.target: So then he delivered him to them to be crucified. So they took Jesus and led him away.

pairs.source: Yesus golong salip-e yohmoꞌ luah soꞌ kota, Iyoh odi keꞌ topat deꞌ adon ‘Topat Tikuluak’, daang sina Ibrani nyaꞌa sobot nang Golgota.
pairs.target: He went out, bearing his cross, to the place called “The Place of a Skull”, which is called in Hebrew, “Golgotha”,

pairs.source: Danoꞌ leh soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ masak Yesus deꞌ tun salip.  Ogiꞌ duwoh naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ bibaya obuah masak deꞌ tun salip deꞌ kajuag nyaꞌa deꞌ bingon salip Yesus, niꞌ nuaꞌ boit, niꞌ nuaꞌ toꞌuh-E, Yesus deꞌ uun.
pairs.target: where they crucified him, and with him two others, on either side one, and Jesus in the middle.

pairs.source: Deꞌ tun salip Yesus, Pilatus odaꞌ nyaꞌa nopia papan deꞌ ogiꞌ tulis deꞌ in-e, “Yesus soꞌ Nazaret, Laja ulang Yahudi.”
pairs.target: Pilate wrote a title also, and put it on the cross. There was written, “JESUS OF NAZARETH, THE KING OF THE JEWS.”

pairs.source: Bogoꞌ ulang-ulang Yahudi deꞌ basa tulis inoh dop-e topat soꞌ Yesus obuah masak deꞌ tun salip diꞌ-e juuaꞌ soꞌ kota.  Sina inoh obuah nulis daang sina Ibrani, sina Latin, duoh sina Yunani.
pairs.target: Therefore many of the Jews read this title, for the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city; and it was written in Hebrew, in Latin, and in Greek.

pairs.source: Yohmoꞌ ayua pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh in-e tuduꞌ Pilatus, “Maꞌ ingan nulis nang ‘Laja ulang Yahudi’ pak-e nulis negeh nang, ‘Iyoh nang in-e: Okuꞌ leh Laja ulang Yahudi.’ ”
pairs.target: The chief priests of the Jews therefore said to Pilate, “Don’t write, ‘The King of the Jews,’ but, ‘he said, “I am King of the Jews.”’”

pairs.source: Pilatus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Oni deꞌ nulis kuꞌ, diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ yaꞌ bilubah.”
pairs.target: Pilate answered, “What I have written, I have written.”

pairs.source: Takal sidadu-sidadu mokuaꞌ masak Yesus deꞌ tun salip, ayua deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ mit pimakai Yesus.  Yohmoꞌ bikutung odop-e pat, masim-masim sidadu soꞌon niꞌ duman.  Ayua deꞌ munoꞌ mit baya jubah-E.  Jubah inoh doiꞌ samung-e dop-e soꞌ somu nog douꞌ doiꞌ jiꞌit-e.
pairs.target: Then the soldiers, when they had crucified Jesus, took his garments and made four parts, to every soldier a part; and also the coat. Now the coat was without seam, woven from the top throughout.

pairs.source: Yoh leh ngan ayua sidadu inoh sina tipan si odop-e, “Jubah-E itih dusah toꞌ notak-e.  Jaꞌ otoꞌ pilabuꞌ undi saꞌ otoꞌ ningaꞌ osi deꞌ soꞌon.” Oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ jadi saꞌ-e samah kodaꞌ deꞌ nulis daang buk Kitab deꞌ in-e, “Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bikutung-kutung pimakai Kuꞌ, duoh pilabuꞌ undi ngan-e yaꞌ soꞌon jubah Kuꞌ.”
pairs.target: Then they said to one another, “Let’s not tear it, but cast lots for it to decide whose it will be,” that the Scripture might be fulfilled, which says, “They parted my garments among them. For my cloak they cast lots.” Therefore the soldiers did these things.

pairs.source: Deꞌ sinok salip Yesus, mujuag sinoꞌ-E, madih sinoꞌ-E deꞌ dayung, Maria sowon Klopas, duoh Maria Magdalena.
pairs.target: But there were standing by the cross of Jesus his mother, and his mother’s sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene.

pairs.source: Takal Yesus ningaꞌ pinunaꞌ-E deꞌ ngibalaꞌ-E ogiꞌ duoh sinoꞌ-E mujuag danoꞌ, Iyoh moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ sinoꞌ-E, “Noꞌ, itih onak ingan!”
pairs.target: Therefore when Jesus saw his mother, and the disciple whom he loved standing there, he said to his mother, “Woman, behold, your son!”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Iyoh moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ niꞌ naꞌan pinunaꞌ-E inoh tiꞌ-e, “Itih leh sinoꞌ muꞌ!” Mulai soꞌ takal inoh pinunaꞌ-E inoh tilimaꞌ sinoꞌ Yesus loꞌo deꞌ boli-e.
pairs.target: Then he said to the disciple, “Behold, your mother!” From that hour, the disciple took her to his own home.

pairs.source: Yesus puꞌan nang suaꞌ kiloja-E deꞌ dunia moꞌ obuaꞌ jadi, Iyoh moꞌ sina in-e, “Asong Kuꞌ bodoh.” Iyoh nang in inoh saꞌ-e jadi samah kodaꞌ deꞌ obuah nulis daang buk Kitab.
pairs.target: After this, Jesus, seeing that all things were now finished, that the Scripture might be fulfilled, said, “I am thirsty.”

pairs.source: Danoꞌ ogiꞌ kobuk deꞌ punuaꞌ odaꞌ tuak anggul deꞌ masuam.  Ayua deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ mit lumut deꞌ nyolap piꞌin yohmoꞌ suad deꞌ tuak anggul deꞌ masuam yohmoꞌ mokos deꞌ tisuk deꞌ nai-e soꞌ tongon koyuh deꞌ adon hisop yohmoꞌ nyog nog-e obuah bobaꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: Now a vessel full of vinegar was set there; so they put a sponge full of the vinegar on hyssop, and held it at his mouth.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ Yesus kiꞌan tuak anggul inoh, Iyoh moꞌ sina in-e, “Moh, suaꞌ-e moꞌ jadi!” Iyoh moꞌ nyuduk daang-e lasuꞌ kobos.
pairs.target: When Jesus therefore had received the vinegar, he said, “It is finished.” He bowed his head, and gave up his spirit.

pairs.source: Onu inoh nyaꞌa moꞌ siap-siap yaꞌ nyamut onu Sabat ulang Yahudi, deꞌ bibaya duoh onu ayuh Paskah ulang Yahudi.  Ayua pimipin ulang Yahudi mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ Pilatus saꞌ ayua sidadu mugat poꞌon nyaꞌa deꞌ taluh deꞌ tun salip inoh saꞌ-e laju kobos, yohmoꞌ pimuun todang odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ takal-e aluaꞌ diꞌ-e nog onu Sabat, saꞌ todang deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e boli-tamong deꞌ tun salip daang onu Sabat inoh.
pairs.target: Therefore the Jews, because it was the Preparation Day, so that the bodies wouldn’t remain on the cross on the Sabbath (for that Sabbath was a special one), asked of Pilate that their legs might be broken, and that they might be taken away.

pairs.source: Sidadu-sidadu moꞌ odi mugat poꞌon odop-e deꞌ duwoh deꞌ samah-samah obuah masak deꞌ tun salip.
pairs.target: Therefore the soldiers came, and broke the legs of the first, and of the other who was crucified with him;

pairs.source: Pak-e takal nog Yesus, yoh moꞌ ningaꞌ Yesus moꞌ kobos, inoh leh ngan sidadu deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e jadi mugat poꞌon-E.
pairs.target: but when they came to Jesus, and saw that he was already dead, they didn’t break his legs.

pairs.source: Pak-e ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ sidadu deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngamuk kubuan Yesus pakai asual, doyaꞌ duoh piꞌin moꞌ luah soꞌ kubuan-E.
pairs.target: However one of the soldiers pierced his side with a spear, and immediately blood and water came out.

pairs.source: Odop nyaꞌa deꞌ nulis buk itih, moꞌ ningaꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ, iyoh leh deꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan duoh oniꞌ deꞌ tanon-e inoh tok bonal.  Odop-e puꞌan nang oniꞌ deꞌ tanon-e inoh bonal, saꞌ ingan tuang bisayaꞌ geh.
pairs.target: He who has seen has testified, and his testimony is true. He knows that he tells the truth, that you may believe.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ jadi saꞌ-e samah kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nulis daang buk Kitab deꞌ in-e, “Niꞌ tuang doiꞌ geh tulang-E deꞌ yaꞌ obuah mugat.”
pairs.target: For these things happened, that the Scripture might be fulfilled, “A bone of him will not be broken.”

pairs.source: Yohmoꞌ ogiꞌ geh deꞌ obuah nulis daang buk Kitab deꞌ in-e, “Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ ningaꞌ Iyoh deꞌ moꞌ ngamuk-e.”
pairs.target: Again another Scripture says, “They will look on him whom they pierced.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yusuf soꞌ Arimatea odi tuduꞌ Pilatus ngan-e yaꞌ mitiaꞌ todang Yesus.  Pilatus moꞌ odaꞌ-e, Yusuf moꞌ odi mit todang Yesus.  Yusuf inoh pinunaꞌ Yesus, pak-e iyoh doliaꞌ-e odaꞌ ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ puꞌan, dop-e iyoh tolu tuduꞌ pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi.
pairs.target: After these things, Joseph of Arimathaea, being a disciple of Jesus, but secretly for fear of the Jews, asked of Pilate that he might take away Jesus’ body. Pilate gave him permission. He came therefore and took away his body.

pairs.source: Nikodemus deꞌ ogiꞌ sidoh-e nog tuduꞌ Yesus daang onu ngalom, suwaꞌ odi duoh Yusuf.  Nikodemus toban inyuaꞌ deꞌ sapul-e duoh mur baya inyuaꞌ koyuh gaharu deꞌ baat-e kulang lobih taluh puluh kilo gram, ngan-e yaꞌ nginyuaꞌ todang Yesus.
pairs.target: Nicodemus, who at first came to Jesus by night, also came bringing a mixture of myrrh and aloes, about a hundred Roman pounds.

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ mit todang Yesus, yohmoꞌ molut pakai kain todang, simadi-e gan inyuaꞌ inoh tiꞌ-e daang kain todang inoh, nunaꞌ adat ulang Yahudi takal-e ngubul nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ kobos.
pairs.target: So they took Jesus’ body, and bound it in linen cloths with the spices, as the custom of the Jews is to bury.

pairs.source: Sinok topat Yesus obuah masak deꞌ tun salip ogiꞌ taman.  Daang taman inoh ogiꞌ kubul gua deꞌ aluaꞌ baꞌuh, deꞌ aluaꞌ doiꞌ nyaꞌa pakai ngan-e ngubul todang nyaꞌa.
pairs.target: Now in the place where he was crucified there was a garden. In the garden was a new tomb in which no man had ever yet been laid.

pairs.source: Dop-e kubul inoh sinok, onu Sabat tuang moꞌ yaꞌ mulai geh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ posan todang Yesus danih.
pairs.target: Then because of the Jews’ Preparation Day (for the tomb was near at hand) they laid Jesus there.

pairs.source: Takal sipagi onu Mingu, takal onu aluaꞌ mopung, Maria Magdalena odi keꞌ kubul, iyoh ningaꞌ batuh deꞌ ngan nyaꞌa nutu kubul inoh moꞌ obuah sigian soꞌ lubang kubul inoh.
pairs.target: Now on the first day of the week, Mary Magdalene went early, while it was still dark, to the tomb, and saw the stone taken away from the tomb.

pairs.source: Iyoh moꞌ bikoduh kalik Simon Petrus duoh pinunaꞌ Yesus deꞌ ngibalaꞌ-E, yoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ duwoh inoh in-e, “Ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ mit todang Topaꞌ soꞌ kubul-E, okuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ puꞌan daki soꞌ todang-E adin.”
pairs.target: Therefore she ran and came to Simon Peter, and to the other disciple whom Jesus loved, and said to them, “They have taken away the Lord out of the tomb, and we don’t know where they have laid him!”

pairs.source: Petrus duoh pinunaꞌ Yesus deꞌ niꞌ inoh moꞌ odi keꞌ kubul.
pairs.target: Therefore Peter and the other disciple went out, and they went toward the tomb.

pairs.source: Soꞌ duwoh odop-e bikoduh, pak-e pinunaꞌ Yesus deꞌ niꞌ inoh bikoduh lobih laju soꞌ Petrus, yoh ngan-e dioꞌ nog deꞌ kubul.
pairs.target: They both ran together. The other disciple outran Peter, and came to the tomb first.

pairs.source: Iyoh moꞌ nyiguaꞌ kaang kubul, iyoh kilin kain ngan-e molut todang polong-polong danoꞌ, pak-e iyoh diꞌ-e molot kaang kubul.
pairs.target: Stooping and looking in, he saw the linen cloths lying, yet he didn’t enter in.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh ke Simon Petrus nog, iyoh moꞌ lasuꞌ molot kaang kubul inoh.  Iyoh kilin kain todang polong-polong danoꞌ.
pairs.target: Then Simon Peter came, following him, and entered into the tomb. He saw the linen cloths lying,

pairs.source: Pak-e kain ngan-e nutu jowin Yesus doiꞌ sinok kain ngan-e molut todang-E, pak-e tikupiat deꞌ topat deꞌ bokon.
pairs.target: and the cloth that had been on his head, not lying with the linen cloths, but rolled up in a place by itself.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh pinunaꞌ Yesus deꞌ niꞌ tiꞌ-e deꞌ moꞌ dioꞌ nog suwaꞌ molot kaang kubul inoh yohmoꞌ kilin suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ, iyoh moꞌ bisayaꞌ nang Yesus moꞌ paliꞌ idip soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ kobos.
pairs.target: So then the other disciple who came first to the tomb also entered in, and he saw and believed.

pairs.source: Dop-e deꞌ dioꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ aluaꞌ diꞌ-e ngiloti oni deꞌ obuah nulis daang buk Kitab nang Yesus yaꞌ paliꞌ idip soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ kobos.
pairs.target: For as yet they didn’t know the Scripture, that he must rise from the dead.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh soꞌ duwoh pinunaꞌ Yesus inoh paliꞌ keꞌ topat-e soꞌ-e ngilumon.
pairs.target: So the disciples went away again to their own homes.

pairs.source: Pak-e Maria aluaꞌ mujuag siꞌian deꞌ sopaꞌ kubul inoh.  Iyoh siꞌian simadi-e nyiguaꞌ ningaꞌ kaang kubul,
pairs.target: But Mary was standing outside at the tomb weeping. So, as she wept, she stooped and looked into the tomb,

pairs.source: iyoh moꞌ ningaꞌ duwoh malaikat pakai pimakai deꞌ mopuꞌ guluꞌ deꞌ topat soꞌ nyaꞌa posan todang Yesus deꞌ dioꞌ, niꞌ guluꞌ nuaꞌ bak-E, deꞌ nikan guluꞌ nuaꞌ poꞌon-E.
pairs.target: and she saw two angels in white sitting, one at the head, and one at the feet, where the body of Jesus had lain.

pairs.source: In malaikat-malaikat inoh tuduꞌ-e, “Oni nai ingan siꞌian neh?” Maria moꞌ nyawot-e, “Nyaꞌa moꞌ mit todang Topaꞌ kuꞌ, adin okuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ puꞌan daki soꞌ nyaꞌa naꞌ todang-E.”
pairs.target: They told her, “Woman, why are you weeping?” She said to them, “Because they have taken away my Lord, and I don’t know where they have laid him.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ sina in inoh, yoh moꞌ kumiat keꞌ dug duoh ningaꞌ Yesus mujuag danoꞌ, pak-e iyoh diꞌ-e piluh nang inoh Yesus.
pairs.target: When she had said this, she turned around and saw Jesus standing, and didn’t know that it was Jesus.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ-e, “Oni nai ingan siꞌian neh? Ingan kalik osi?” Maria sakaꞌ nang nyaꞌa inoh tukang kobon, iyoh moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ-E, “Simoꞌ-e ingan deꞌ mit Iyoh soꞌ itih, tulung tanon deꞌ okuꞌ daki soꞌ ingan gan-E, saꞌ okuꞌ dapod mit-E.”
pairs.target: Jesus said to her, “Woman, why are you weeping? Who are you looking for?” She, supposing him to be the gardener, said to him, “Sir, if you have carried him away, tell me where you have laid him, and I will take him away.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ-e, “Maria!” Maria moꞌ kumiat tuduꞌ Yesus yoh moꞌ sina daang sina Ibrani, “Rabuni!” (Loti-e ‘Gulu’)
pairs.target: Jesus said to her, “Mary.” She turned and said to him, “Rabboni!” which is to say, “Teacher!”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e in-e, “Maꞌ tomaꞌ Okuꞌ, dop-e Okuꞌ aluaꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ maꞌad tuduꞌ Samaꞌ.  Pak-e odi leh tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Kuꞌ, duoh tanon tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nang adin Okuꞌ yaꞌ maꞌad tuduꞌ Samaꞌ Kuꞌ duoh Samaꞌ ingan, Topaꞌ Kuꞌ duoh Topaꞌ ingan.”
pairs.target: Jesus said to her, “Don’t hold me, for I haven’t yet ascended to my Father; but go to my brothers, and tell them, ‘I am ascending to my Father and your Father, to my God and your God.’”

pairs.source: Maria Magdalena moꞌ odi tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus, yohmoꞌ in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Okuꞌ moꞌ kilin Topaꞌ!” Maria tuang tanon-e geh suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ tanon Yesus tuduꞌ odop-e.
pairs.target: Mary Magdalene came and told the disciples that she had seen the Lord, and that he had said these things to her.

pairs.source: Daang onu Mingu inoh geh, takal onu moꞌ ngalom, pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus tikuluk daang boli deꞌ suaꞌ tiban-e bilobot, dop-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tolu tuduꞌ pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi.  Tang-tang Yesus nog yohmoꞌ mujuag deꞌ uun odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, Iyoh moꞌ sina, “Salam bidanah saꞌan ingan!”
pairs.target: When therefore it was evening, on that day, the first day of the week, and when the doors were locked where the disciples were assembled, for fear of the Jews, Jesus came and stood in the middle, and said to them, “Peace be to you.”

pairs.source: Takal-E mokuaꞌ sina in inoh, Iyoh moꞌ bitanga tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ dian kinaman deꞌ soꞌ duwoh tongan-E duoh dian kinaman deꞌ toꞌin-E.  Takal-e moꞌ ningaꞌ Topaꞌ Yesus, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ sukup doon-e.
pairs.target: When he had said this, he showed them his hands and his side. The disciples therefore were glad when they saw the Lord.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ niꞌ sidoh lagiꞌ in-E, “Salam bidanah saꞌan ingan.  Samah kodaꞌ Samaꞌ pait Okuꞌ, wat inoh geh adin Okuꞌ pait ingan.”
pairs.target: Jesus therefore said to them again, “Peace be to you. As the Father has sent me, even so I send you.”

pairs.source: Iyoh moꞌ puuah asong-E tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ duoh in-e, “Tilimaꞌ leh Iyang Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: When he had said this, he breathed on them, and said to them, “Receive the Holy Spirit!

pairs.source: Simoꞌ ingan ngapun dosa nyaꞌa, Topaꞌ tuang ngapun-e geh ingan.  Simoꞌ ingan diꞌ ingan ngapun dosa nyaꞌa, Topaꞌ tuang idoh geh diꞌ-e ngapun-e.”
pairs.target: If you forgive anyone’s sins, they have been forgiven them. If you retain anyone’s sins, they have been retained.”

pairs.source: Niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ simoong duwoh pinunaꞌ Yesus deꞌ adon Tomas deꞌ sobot nyaꞌa geh nang Didimus doiꞌ duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus deꞌ bokon takal Yesus nog.
pairs.target: But Thomas, one of the twelve, called Didymus, wasn’t with them when Jesus came.

pairs.source: Yohmoꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E deꞌ bokon moꞌ tanon tuduꞌ Tomas in-e, “Koꞌih moꞌ ningaꞌ Topaꞌ.” Pak-e in Tomas nyawot-e, “Simoꞌ okuꞌ aluaꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ ningaꞌ dian pasak deꞌ soꞌ duwoh tongan-E duoh kibalot tilinyuꞌ kuꞌ daang lubang pasak inoh, baya tomaꞌ dian kinaman deꞌ toꞌin-E, idoh diꞌ kuꞌ bisayaꞌ.”
pairs.target: The other disciples therefore said to him, “We have seen the Lord!” But he said to them, “Unless I see in his hands the print of the nails, put my finger into the print of the nails, and put my hand into his side, I will not believe.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ niꞌ mingu, pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus paliꞌ lagiꞌ tikuluk daang boli inoh, adin Tomas moꞌ ogiꞌ samah-samah duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ danoꞌ.  Suaꞌ tiban-e boli obuaꞌ ngobot, tang-tang Yesus nog, mujuag deꞌ uun odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yohmoꞌ in-E, “Salam bidanah saꞌan ingan!”
pairs.target: After eight days again his disciples were inside, and Thomas was with them. Jesus came, the doors being locked, and stood in the middle, and said, “Peace be to you.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Tomas, “Ningaꞌ dian pasak deꞌ soꞌ duwoh tongan Kuꞌ, kibalot tilinyuꞌ muꞌ daang lubang pasak inoh, nyeꞌ moꞌ tomaꞌ dian kinaman deꞌ toꞌin Kuꞌ.  Maꞌ tiyaꞌ diꞌ muꞌ bisayaꞌ, pak-e bisayaꞌ leh bonal-bonal.”
pairs.target: Then he said to Thomas, “Reach here your finger, and see my hands. Reach here your hand, and put it into my side. Don’t be unbelieving, but believing.”

pairs.source: Tomas moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Yesus, “Tuan deꞌ nguasa idip kuꞌ duoh Topaꞌ kuꞌ!”
pairs.target: Thomas answered him, “My Lord and my God!”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, “Tomas muꞌu bisayaꞌ dop-e muꞌu kilin Okuꞌ.  Obuah bilokat nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e kilin Okuꞌ pak-e bisayaꞌ.”
pairs.target: Jesus said to him, “Because you have seen me, you have believed. Blessed are those who have not seen, and have believed.”

pairs.source: Tok aluaꞌ bogoꞌ lagiꞌ tanda soꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ nai Yesus deꞌ jowin pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, pak-e idoh diꞌ-e suaꞌ-e obuah nulis daang buk Kitab itih.
pairs.target: Therefore Jesus did many other signs in the presence of his disciples, which are not written in this book;

pairs.source: Pak-e suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah nulis daang buk Kitab itih saꞌ ingan bisayaꞌ nang Yesus leh Laja Pinyilamat, Onak Topaꞌ, duoh saꞌ ingan soꞌon idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah dop-e ingan bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ-E.
pairs.target: but these are written, that you may believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and that believing you may have life in his name.

pairs.source: Kudu-kudu onu mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus bitanga odop-E lagiꞌ tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E deꞌ pang donu Tiberias, wat itih wat Iyoh bitanga odop-E.
pairs.target: After these things, Jesus revealed himself again to the disciples at the sea of Tiberias. He revealed himself this way.

pairs.source: Takal inoh Simon Petrus, Tomas deꞌ sobot nyaꞌa Onak Opid, Natanael soꞌ Kana deꞌ Galilea, soꞌ duwoh naꞌan onak Zebedeus baya duwoh naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon soꞌ pinunaꞌ Yesus tikuluk deꞌ pang donu.
pairs.target: Simon Peter, Thomas called Didymus, Nathanael of Cana in Galilee, and the sons of Zebedee, and two others of his disciples were together.

pairs.source: In Simon Petrus tuduꞌ dingan-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Okuꞌ yaꞌ odi ngijaling ikian.” In odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Koꞌih yaꞌ suwaꞌ duoh muꞌu.” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ muat deꞌ olud odi samah-samah, pak-e ngalom inoh doiꞌ manah odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ soꞌon ikian.
pairs.target: Simon Peter said to them, “I’m going fishing.” They told him, “We are also coming with you.” They immediately went out, and entered into the boat. That night, they caught nothing.

pairs.source: Suam-suam pagi Yesus mujuag deꞌ pang donu, pak-e pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E diꞌ-e puꞌan nang inoh Yesus.
pairs.target: But when day had already come, Jesus stood on the beach, yet the disciples didn’t know that it was Jesus.

pairs.source: In Yesus tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Oi dingan, ogiꞌ yeh ikian deꞌ soꞌon ingan neh?” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-E, “Doiꞌ.”
pairs.target: Jesus therefore said to them, “Children, have you anything to eat?”  They answered him, “No.”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ in-e, “Tolan jaling ingan nuaꞌ toꞌuh olud ingan, saꞌ ingan soꞌon ikian.” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ tolan jaling-e, mokuaꞌ inoh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nalik jaling-e pak-e diꞌ-e taan, dop-e ikian daang jaling inoh sikiya bogoꞌ.
pairs.target: He said to them, “Cast the net on the right side of the boat, and you will find some.” They cast it therefore, and now they weren’t able to draw it in for the multitude of fish.

pairs.source: Pinunaꞌ deꞌ obuah ngibalaꞌ odaꞌ Yesus sina tuduꞌ Simon Petrus in-e, “Inoh Topaꞌ.” Takal Simon Petrus ngojit nang inoh Topaꞌ, iyoh moꞌ sok bojuh-e, dop-e yoh diꞌ-e pakai bojuh, yohmoꞌ bitabum kaang piꞌin.
pairs.target: That disciple therefore whom Jesus loved said to Peter, “It’s the Lord!” So when Simon Peter heard that it was the Lord, he wrapped his coat around him (for he was naked), and threw himself into the sea.

pairs.source: Pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus deꞌ bokon bikayuh olud-e ngan-e keꞌ doyoh simadi-e bitalik duoh jaling deꞌ bogoꞌ ikian daang-e.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e sikiya juuaꞌ soꞌ doyoh, kulang lobih silatus metel.
pairs.target: But the other disciples came in the little boat (for they were not far from the land, but about two hundred cubits away), dragging the net full of fish.

pairs.source: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ maꞌad soꞌ aang olud keꞌ doyoh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ningaꞌ ogiꞌ kueh, ogiꞌ ikian deꞌ madang-e deꞌ tun tuluah opui.
pairs.target: So when they got out on the land, they saw a fire of coals there, and fish laid on it, and bread.

pairs.source: In Yesus tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Toban katiꞌ kudu-kudu polong ikian deꞌ tuang ingan soꞌon-e.”
pairs.target: Jesus said to them, “Bring some of the fish which you have just caught.”

pairs.source: Simon Petrus moꞌ muun kaang olud yohmoꞌ nalik jaling inoh toban keꞌ doyoh.  Jaling inoh bogoꞌ ikian deꞌ bagaꞌ daꞌ-e, suaꞌ-e ogiꞌ silatus limoh puluh taluh polong.  Sungu-e bogoꞌ ikian daang jaling inoh, jaling inoh idoh geh diꞌ-e totak.
pairs.target: Simon Peter went up, and drew the net to land, full of great fish, one hundred fifty-three; and even though there were so many, the net wasn’t torn.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Got toꞌ man.” Pak-e doiꞌ soꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E deꞌ bilani sikian tuduꞌ Yesus in-e, “Osi Ingan tih?” dop-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ puꞌan nang Iyoh inoh Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: Jesus said to them, “Come and eat breakfast.” None of the disciples dared inquire of him, “Who are you?” knowing that it was the Lord.

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ odi sinok odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, Iyoh moꞌ mit kueh ngin tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, wat inoh geh Iyoh ngin ikian-e.
pairs.target: Then Jesus came and took the bread, gave it to them, and the fish likewise.

pairs.source: Inoh leh keꞌ taluh sidoh-e Yesus bitanga odop-E tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, takal Iyoh moꞌ paliꞌ idip soꞌ kobos-E.
pairs.target: This is now the third time that Jesus was revealed to his disciples, after he had risen from the dead.

pairs.source: Takal Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ mokuaꞌ man, Yesus sina tuduꞌ Simon Petrus, “Simon, onak Yohanes, podo muꞌu ngibalaꞌ Okuꞌ lobih soꞌ odop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ ngibalaꞌ Okuꞌ?” Petrus moꞌ nyawot-E, “Tok bonal Topaꞌ, Ingan puꞌan nang okuꞌ ngibalaꞌ Ingan.” In Yesus tuduꞌ-e, “Jaga leh onak-onak domba Kuꞌ.”
pairs.target: So when they had eaten their breakfast, Jesus said to Simon Peter, “Simon, son of Jonah, do you love me more than these?” He said to him, “Yes, Lord; you know that I have affection for you.” He said to him, “Feed my lambs.”

pairs.source: In Yesus keꞌ duwoh sidoh-e, “Simon, onak Yohanes, podo muꞌu ngibalaꞌ Okuꞌ?” Petrus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Tok bonal Topaꞌ, Ingan puꞌan nang okuꞌ ngibalaꞌ Ingan.” Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ-e, “Jaga leh suaꞌ domba Kuꞌ.”
pairs.target: He said to him again a second time, “Simon, son of Jonah, do you love me?” He said to him, “Yes, Lord; you know that I have affection for you.” He said to him, “Tend my sheep.”

pairs.source: In Yesus keꞌ taluh sidoh-e, “Simon, onak Yohanes, podo muꞌu ngibalaꞌ Okuꞌ?” Petrus moꞌ susah otin-e dop-e Yesus moꞌ sikian nog taluh sidoh-e.  Petrus moꞌ nyawot-e lagiꞌ in-e, “Topaꞌ, Ingan puꞌan suaꞌ oniꞌ.  Ingan puꞌan nang okuꞌ ngibalaꞌ Ingan.” In Yesus lagiꞌ, “Jaga leh suaꞌ domba Kuꞌ.
pairs.target: He said to him the third time, “Simon, son of Jonah, do you have affection for me?” Peter was grieved because he asked him the third time, “Do you have affection for me?” He said to him, “Lord, you know everything. You know that I have affection for you.” Jesus said to him, “Feed my sheep.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ muꞌu bonal-bonal, takal muꞌu aluaꞌ mudaꞌ, odop muꞌ dapod sok soot kupuang muꞌ ngan muꞌ siap-siap yaꞌ ponu kaki sijaꞌ-e soꞌ muꞌ yaꞌ odi.  Pak-e takal muꞌu moꞌ nyoma, muꞌu yaꞌ suual tongan muꞌ, nyaꞌa moꞌ yaꞌ mokos muꞌu duoh toban keꞌ topat deꞌ doliaꞌ muꞌ yaꞌ odi daꞌ-e.”
pairs.target: Most certainly I tell you, when you were young, you dressed yourself, and walked where you wanted to. But when you are old, you will stretch out your hands, and another will dress you, and carry you where you don’t want to go.”

pairs.source: Ngan Yesus in inoh, Iyoh yaꞌ tanon wat ki wat Petrus yaꞌ kobos duoh odaꞌ nyaꞌa mudi adon Topaꞌ.  Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus sina tuduꞌ Petrus in-E, “Jaꞌ nunaꞌ Okuꞌ.”
pairs.target: Now he said this, signifying by what kind of death he would glorify God. When he had said this, he said to him, “Follow me.”

pairs.source: Simon Petrus kumiat yohmoꞌ ningaꞌ ogiꞌ pinunaꞌ deꞌ obuah ngibalaꞌ odaꞌ Yesus bitunaꞌ duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.  (Iyoh inoh leh deꞌ guluꞌ sinok Yesus takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ man samah-samah pingobuaꞌ sidoh-e duoh Yesus.  Iyoh inoh geh deꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Yesus, “Topaꞌ, osi odop-e deꞌ yaꞌ jua Ingan?”)
pairs.target: Then Peter, turning around, saw a disciple following. This was the disciple whom Jesus loved, the one who had also leaned on Jesus’ breast at the supper and asked, “Lord, who is going to betray You?”

pairs.source: Takal Petrus ningaꞌ iyoh inoh, Petrus moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Yesus, “Topaꞌ, oni wat oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ obuah iyoh itih?”
pairs.target: Peter seeing him, said to Jesus, “Lord, what about this man?”

pairs.source: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Simoꞌ Okuꞌ laꞌan odaꞌ iyoh totap idip nog Okuꞌ paliꞌ baꞌuh, muꞌu diꞌ muꞌ jolaꞌ yaꞌ puꞌan-e, pak-e muꞌu, jaꞌ nunaꞌ Okuꞌ.”
pairs.target: Jesus said to him, “If I desire that he stay until I come, what is that to you? You follow me.”

pairs.source: Dop-e sina Yesus inoh leh deꞌ odaꞌ timul gah deꞌ uluk ayua nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ deꞌ nunaꞌ Yesus, nang pinunaꞌ deꞌ obuah ngibalaꞌ odaꞌ Yesus diꞌ-e yaꞌ kobos.  Tiap idoh diꞌ Yesus tanon in inoh, pak-e jok Yesus nang, “Simoꞌ Okuꞌ laꞌan odaꞌ iyoh totap idip nog Okuꞌ paliꞌ baꞌuh, muꞌu diꞌ muꞌ jolaꞌ yaꞌ puꞌan-e.”
pairs.target: This saying therefore went out among the brothers, that this disciple wouldn’t die. Yet Jesus didn’t say to him that he wouldn’t die, but, “If I desire that he stay until I come, what is that to you?”

pairs.source: Pinunaꞌ deꞌ obuah ngibalaꞌ odaꞌ Yesus inoh leh deꞌ moꞌ tanon tentang suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ jadi.  Iyoh geh deꞌ moꞌ nulis suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ.  Otoꞌ moꞌ puꞌan nang oni deꞌ moꞌ tanon-e inoh tok bonal.
pairs.target: This is the disciple who testifies about these things, and wrote these things. We know that his witness is true.

pairs.source: Aluaꞌ bogoꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ bokon deꞌ moꞌ nai Yesus.  Moꞌ nyam suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ obuah nulis ngaꞌ niꞌ ngaꞌ niꞌ, nunaꞌ pikil kuꞌ diꞌ-e sukup topat deꞌ dunia itih soꞌ nyeꞌ nyikon suaꞌ kitab deꞌ obuah nulis inoh.    Silita Rasul-Rasul
pairs.target: There are also many other things which Jesus did, which if they would all be written, I suppose that even the world itself wouldn’t have room for the books that would be written.

pairs.source: Tuduꞌ ingan Teofilus, daang buk okuꞌ deꞌ sibungas-e okuꞌ moꞌ nulis susuaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nai-e duoh deꞌ moꞌ ngajal Yesus.
pairs.target: The first book I wrote, Theophilus, concerned all that Jesus began both to do and to teach,

pairs.source: Nog Iyoh tipaꞌad keꞌ siluga.  Takal Iyoh aluaꞌ diꞌ-e tipaꞌad ke siluga, Iyoh moꞌ ngin pilitah pakai kuasa Iyang Topaꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ pilih yohmoꞌ pait-e deꞌ nang-e rasul-rasul.
pairs.target: until the day in which he was received up, after he had given commandment through the Holy Spirit to the apostles whom he had chosen.

pairs.source: Takal-e jolaꞌ, Iyoh moꞌ kobos deꞌ tun salip, mokuaꞌ inoh Iyoh moꞌ paliꞌ idip lagiꞌ.  Iyoh moꞌ bitanga odop-e bonal-bonal tuduꞌ rasul-rasul inoh, daang pat puluꞌ onu moꞌ bogoꞌ oni deꞌ nai-E ngan-e yaꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ puꞌan nang Odop-e moꞌ tok-tok paliꞌ idip lagiꞌ.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ Iyoh, Iyoh sina duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, watki wat Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ nunaꞌ Odop-E.
pairs.target: To these he also showed himself alive after he suffered, by many proofs, appearing to them over a period of forty days, and speaking about God’s Kingdom.

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ niꞌ onu takal Iyoh man bisamah-samah duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, Iyoh moꞌ pilitah tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ in-e, “Maꞌ dioꞌ buu soꞌ Yerusalem, pak-e kajon dioꞌ datiꞌ nog Topaꞌ, Samaꞌ Kuꞌ, pait Iyang Topaꞌ tuduꞌ ingan.  Iyoh moꞌ bijanyi in inoh.  Okuꞌ moꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan.
pairs.target: Being assembled together with them, he commanded them, “Don’t depart from Jerusalem, but wait for the promise of the Father, which you heard from me.

pairs.source: Dioꞌ soꞌ kanoꞌ Yohanes baptis pakai piꞌin, pak-e diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ tuui ingan yaꞌ obuah baptis pakai Iyang Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: For John indeed baptized in water, but you will be baptized in the Holy Spirit not many days from now.”

pairs.source: Takal iyoh aluaꞌ tikuluk duoh Yesus, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bisikian duoh Yesus, “Topaꞌ, laꞌan Ingan yeh adin paliꞌ kajuag kerajaan kaꞌan Israel?”
pairs.target: Therefore when they had come together, they asked him, “Lord, are you now restoring the kingdom to Israel?”

pairs.source: Yoh moꞌ nyawot-e, “Ingan diꞌ pilelu puꞌan siniaꞌ takal-e, deꞌ moꞌ notap-e, Samaꞌ sadiꞌ-e deꞌ moꞌ notu nunaꞌ kuasa-E.
pairs.target: He said to them, “It isn’t for you to know times or seasons which the Father has set within his own authority.

pairs.source: Pak-e ingan yaꞌ soꞌon kuasa, takal Topaꞌ pait Iyang-E tuduꞌ ingan.  Takal inoh ingan yaꞌ jadin tukang tanon tuduꞌ nyaꞌa wat pingidip Okuꞌ, mulai soꞌ kota Yerusalem, daang suaꞌ tanaꞌ Yudea, daang suaꞌ tanaꞌ Samaria nog tubon longit.”
pairs.target: But you will receive power when the Holy Spirit has come upon you. You will be witnesses to me in Jerusalem, in all Judea and Samaria, and to the uttermost parts of the earth.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ Iyoh nang sina deꞌ in inoh, Iyoh lasuꞌ tipaꞌad keꞌ siluga deꞌ jowin rasul-rasul nog abun moꞌ maput-e.
pairs.target: When he had said these things, as they were looking, he was taken up, and a cloud received him out of their sight.

pairs.source: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ aluaꞌ ningaꞌ Iyoh tipaꞌad keꞌ longit, tang-tang ogiꞌ duwoh naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ pakai pimakai deꞌ mopuꞌ mujuag deꞌ umiah odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: While they were looking steadfastly into the sky as he went, behold, two men stood by them in white clothing,

pairs.source: Yohmo' sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Oi ulang Galilea, oni ngan ingan mujuag bigalong ke longit? Yesus itih deꞌ tipaꞌad ke' siluga togan ingan, Iyoh yaꞌ paliꞌ muun samah kodaꞌ ngan-e Iyoh maꞌad keꞌ siluga.”
pairs.target: who also said, “You men of Galilee, why do you stand looking into the sky? This Jesus, who was received up from you into the sky, will come back in the same way as you saw him going into the sky.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh rasul-rasul deꞌ munoꞌ buu soꞌ Punguꞌ Zaitun paliꞌ keꞌ kota Yerusalem deꞌ juuaꞌ-e kila-kila niꞌ kilometel soꞌ kota inoh.
pairs.target: Then they returned to Jerusalem from the mountain called Olivet, which is near Jerusalem, a Sabbath day’s journey away.

pairs.source: Takal moꞌ nog keꞌ kota, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ maꞌad keꞌ longah topat odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ngilumon.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ogiꞌ Petrus, Yohanes, Yakobus, Andreas, Filipus, Tomas, Bartolomeus, Matius, Yakobus onak Alfeus, Simon soꞌ golongan ulang Yahudi deꞌ bijuang odaꞌ Israel lopas soꞌ kerajaan Romawi, Yudas onak Yakobus.
pairs.target: When they had come in, they went up into the upper room, where they were staying; that is Peter, John, James, Andrew, Philip, Thomas, Bartholomew, Matthew, James the son of Alphaeus, Simon the Zealot, and Judas the son of James.

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ niꞌ otin daang-e bidoa samah-samah yohmoꞌ ogiꞌ kudu-kudu dayung baya Maria sinoꞌ Yesus duoh madih ayua odop Yesus.
pairs.target: All these with one accord continued steadfastly in prayer and supplication, along with the women, and Mary the mother of Jesus, and with his brothers.

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ onu takal inoh, kila-kila silatus duwoh puluꞌ naꞌan deꞌ jadin pinunaꞌ Yesus bikuluk danoꞌ ngan-e yaꞌ bidoa.  Petrus mujuag yohmoꞌ sina,
pairs.target: In these days, Peter stood up in the middle of the disciples (and the number of names was about one hundred twenty), and said,

pairs.source: “Oi madih ayua, suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ tanon Iyang Topaꞌ tuduꞌ Daud deꞌ moꞌ nulis-e daang Kitab tentang Yudas pimipin nyaꞌa deꞌ takap Yesus halus jadi.
pairs.target: “Brothers, it was necessary that this Scripture should be fulfilled, which the Holy Spirit spoke before by the mouth of David concerning Judas, who was guide to those who took Jesus.

pairs.source: Deꞌ dioꞌ inoh, iyoh samah kodaꞌ koꞌih geh tukang toban Gah deꞌ Paguh tentang Yesus.
pairs.target: For he was counted with us, and received his portion in this ministry.

pairs.source: Yudas itih moꞌ milih niꞌ ongan tanaꞌ pakai upah jaꞌat-e takal-e jua Yesus.  Danoꞌ geh iyoh labuꞌ tipuꞌuab toꞌin-e moꞌ lutuap daang suaꞌ isiꞌ toꞌin-e luah.
pairs.target: Now this man obtained a field with the reward for his wickedness, and falling headlong, his body burst open, and all his intestines gushed out.

pairs.source: Gah inoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa daang Yerusalem tuang puꞌan-e geh, yoh ngan nyaꞌa moꞌ biladon daang sina odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ Hakaldama loti-e: ‘Tanaꞌ Doyaꞌ.’
pairs.target: It became known to everyone who lived in Jerusalem that in their language that field was called ‘Akeldama,’ that is, ‘The field of blood.’

pairs.source: Noꞌuh-e laja Daud moꞌ nulis daang buk Mazmur wat silita pingidip Yudas: ‘Tanah leh sa' topat-e loꞌo itih doiꞌ liuak daluag-e, yohmoꞌ tanah leh sa' doiꞌ' nyaꞌa deꞌ loꞌo daang-e, duoh: Tanah saꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon mit topat-e.’
pairs.target: For it is written in the book of Psalms, ‘Let his habitation be made desolate. Let no one dwell therein;’ and, ‘Let another take his office.’
“Of the men therefore who have accompanied us all the time that the Lord Jesus went in and out among us,

pairs.source: Noh leh ngan-e pilelu pilih nyaꞌa deꞌ gati Yudas saꞌ-e suwaꞌ tanon nang Yesus paliꞌ idip lagiꞌ.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ obuah pilih halus leh nyaꞌa deꞌ silalu ogiꞌ bisamah duoh otoꞌ takal Topaꞌ Yesus aluaꞌ ogiꞌ daang uluk otoꞌ, mulai soꞌ takal Yohanes baptis-E nog Iyoh tipaꞌad ke siluga togan uluk otoꞌ.”
pairs.target: beginning from the baptism of John, to the day that he was received up from us, of these one must become a witness with us of his resurrection.”

pairs.source: Yohmoꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyok duoh naꞌan deꞌ yaꞌ gati Yudas: Keꞌ niꞌ-e Yusuf (ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ sobot iyoh Barsabas, ogiꞌ geh nyaꞌa sobot nang Yustus), deꞌ keꞌ duwoh-e Matias.
pairs.target: They put forward two, Joseph called Barsabbas, who was also called Justus, and Matthias.
They prayed, and said, “You, Lord, who know the hearts of all men, show which one of these two you have chosen

pairs.source: Suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bidoa daang-e sina, “Oi Topaꞌ, Ingan puꞌan otin suaꞌ nyaꞌa.  Yudas moꞌ togan kiloja deꞌ ngin Ingan daꞌ-e yoh moꞌ kobos.  Nyok leh sa'an koꞌih mun ki soꞌ odop-e deꞌ duwoh deꞌ yaꞌ pilih Topaꞌ deꞌ ngin-e kiloja deꞌ yaꞌ gati Yudas.”
pairs.target: to take part in this ministry and apostleship from which Judas fell away, that he might go to his own place.”

pairs.source: Yohmoꞌ pilabuꞌ uni-e saꞌan odop-e deꞌ duwoh, uni-e moꞌ labuꞌ tuduꞌ Matias, iyohleh deꞌ tamah bilang deꞌ simoong niꞌ naꞌan rasul saꞌa paliꞌ simoong duoh naꞌan.
pairs.target: They drew lots for them, and the lot fell on Matthias, and he was counted with the eleven apostles.

pairs.source: Takal onu ayuh ulang Yahudi mokuaꞌ ngutuam deꞌ sobot-e nang Onu Ayuh Pentakosta, susuaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus tikuluk niꞌ boli.
pairs.target: Now when the day of Pentecost had come, they were all with one accord in one place.

pairs.source: Tang-tang susuaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ moꞌ klingah sowoꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ kodaꞌ sowoꞌ sobak deꞌ dolas soꞌ longit.   Suaꞌ aang boli topat-e tikuluk moꞌ punuaꞌ odaꞌ sowoꞌ inoh.
pairs.target: Suddenly there came from the sky a sound like the rushing of a mighty wind, and it filled all the house where they were sitting.

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ kodaꞌ siduduꞌ opui deꞌ bijiliab deꞌ timilib katiꞌ kanih yohmoꞌ map tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: Tongues like fire appeared and were distributed to them, and one sat on each of them.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ punuaꞌ odaꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ponai sina daang sina deꞌ bokon kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ ngin Iyang Topaꞌ tuduꞌ-e odaꞌ iyoh nang-e.
pairs.target: They were all filled with the Holy Spirit, and began to speak with other languages, as the Spirit gave them the ability to speak.

pairs.source: Takal inoh ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ Agama Yahudi soꞌ susuaꞌ pulou deꞌ daang dunia moꞌ nog keꞌ kota Yerusalem.   Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ, nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nyomah Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: Now there were dwelling in Jerusalem Jews, devout men, from every nation under the sky.

pairs.source: Takal nyaꞌa deꞌ nog deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ klingah sowoꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ kodaꞌ sobak, yohmoꞌ tikuluk kaang boli inoh yohmoꞌ ilan takal-e ngojit rasul-rasul deꞌ munoꞌ sina pakai sina odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: When this sound was heard, the multitude came together, and were bewildered, because everyone heard them speaking in his own language.

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bolidongo daang-e ilan nyam-e, yohmoꞌ sina, “Idoh keh diꞌ-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ sina sowoꞌ inoh nyaꞌa soꞌ Galilea?
pairs.target: They were all amazed and marveled, saying to one another, “Behold, aren’t all these who speak Galileans?

pairs.source: Oni wat-e otoꞌ ponai masim-masim ngojit odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ sina pakai sina basa otoꞌ?
pairs.target: How do we hear, everyone in our own native language?

pairs.source: Otoꞌ ulang Partia, Media, Elam; nyaꞌa deꞌ loꞌo deꞌ Mesopotamia, Yudea duoh Kapadokia; Pontus duoh Asia,
pairs.target: Parthians, Medes, Elamites, and people from Mesopotamia, Judea, Cappadocia, Pontus, Asia,

pairs.source: Frigia duoh Pamfilia, Mesir duoh pulou-pulou Libia deꞌ bilinok duoh Kirene; nyaꞌa deꞌ nog soꞌ Roma,
pairs.target: Phrygia, Pamphylia, Egypt, the parts of Libya around Cyrene, visitors from Rome, both Jews and proselytes,

pairs.source: ogiꞌ ulang Yahudi duoh basa deꞌ bokon deꞌ molot agama Yahudi; ulang Kreta duoh ulang Arab.   Otoꞌ ngojit odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ sina sowoꞌ daang sina otoꞌ silita pingunai kiloja deꞌ ayuh deꞌ moꞌ nai Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: Cretans and Arabians: we hear them speaking in our languages the mighty works of God!”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ akoꞌ-akoꞌ ilan-e, daang-e bisikian in-e, “Oni loti oniꞌ deꞌ wat itih?”
pairs.target: They were all amazed, and were perplexed, saying to one another, “What does this mean?”

pairs.source: Pak-e ogiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ nyinel, “Suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ moꞌ mabuk tuak anggul!”
pairs.target: Others, mocking, said, “They are filled with new wine.”

pairs.source: Petrus duoh simoong niꞌ naꞌan Rasul inoh moꞌ mokat mujuag, iyoh moꞌ sina pakai sina deꞌ dolas tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ bogoꞌ danoꞌ, yohmoꞌ in-e, “Madih ayua kuꞌ ulang Yahudi duoh suaꞌ ingan deꞌ loꞌo deꞌ Yerusalem! Ngojit bonal-bonal-e oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ tanon kuꞌ itih, saꞌ ingan puꞌan oniꞌ deꞌ sibonal-e.
pairs.target: But Peter, standing up with the eleven, lifted up his voice, and spoke out to them, “You men of Judea, and all you who dwell at Jerusalem, let this be known to you, and listen to my words.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ mutiꞌ idoh diꞌ-e mabuk kodaꞌ deꞌ kila ingan, sobab adin aluaꞌ pukul pliꞌi pagi.
pairs.target: For these aren’t drunken, as you suppose, seeing it is only the third hour of the day.

pairs.source: Pak-e inohleh kodaꞌ deꞌ nang nabi Yoel deꞌ moꞌ tanon Topaꞌ tuduꞌ-e,
pairs.target: But this is what has been spoken through the prophet Joel:

pairs.source: ‘Topaꞌ moꞌ tanon: Sinok onu kiamat Okuꞌ yaꞌ pimuun Iyang Topaꞌ tuduꞌ suaꞌ manusia.   Onak opot ingan deꞌ dali duoh deꞌ dayung ponai bitutaꞌ.   Onak-onak bujang ponai kilin oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ bitanga Topaꞌ.   Nyaꞌa deꞌ nyomaꞌ yaꞌ soꞌon pimoh soꞌ Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: ‘It will be in the last days, says God, that I will pour out my Spirit on all flesh. Your sons and your daughters will prophesy. Your young men will see visions. Your old men will dream dreams.

pairs.source: Ulang-ulang deꞌ kiloja saꞌan Okuꞌ, bait deꞌ dali duoh deꞌ dayung, daang onu-onu inoh geh Okuꞌ pimuun Iyang kuꞌ tuduꞌ-e.   Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tuang-e ponai bitutaꞌ.
pairs.target: Yes, and on my servants and on my handmaidens in those days, I will pour out my Spirit, and they will prophesy.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ yaꞌ bitanga kuasa Kuꞌ deꞌ ayuh deꞌ somu deꞌ longit, Okuꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ aluaꞌ doiꞌ sidoh nyaꞌa kilin-e deꞌ douꞌ deꞌ tanaꞌ; ogiꞌ doyaꞌ duoh opui duoh tibokol asuh.
pairs.target: I will show wonders in the sky above, and signs on the earth beneath; blood, and fire, and billows of smoke.

pairs.source: Boton onu yaꞌ bilubah jadin mopung pipiat duoh bulan yaꞌ jadin biliah kodaꞌ doyaꞌ ngan-e aluaꞌ' diꞌ-e nog Onu Topaꞌ, onu deꞌ ayuh, onu deꞌ doiꞌ sidoh nyaꞌa kilin-e.
pairs.target: The sun will be turned into darkness, and the moon into blood, before the great and glorious day of the Lord comes.

pairs.source: Osi sijaꞌ-a deꞌ mogan adon Topaꞌ yoh yaꞌ obuah nyilamat.’”
pairs.target: It will be that whoever will call on the name of the Lord will be saved.’

pairs.source: Petrus moꞌ sina lagiꞌ, “Oi madih ayua kuꞌ, ulang-ulang Israel! Ngojit leh dioꞌ sina kuꞌ itih: Deꞌ nang okuꞌ inoh iyohleh Yesus soꞌ kota Nazaret, nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ notu Topaꞌ duoh deꞌ moꞌ tanon-e tuduꞌ ingan pakai kuasa soꞌ Topaꞌ.   Inoh moꞌ tonga daang pingunai-E deꞌ nai-E pakai kuasa Topaꞌ duoh oniꞌ deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ puꞌan ingan.
pairs.target: “Men of Israel, hear these words! Jesus of Nazareth, a man approved by God to you by mighty works and wonders and signs which God did by him among you, even as you yourselves know,

pairs.source: Topaꞌ moꞌ dioꞌ notu duoh puꞌan soꞌ puꞌun-e, Iyoh yaꞌ nyelah Yesus tuduꞌ ingan.   Ingan moꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ jaꞌat ngabos Iyoh pakai masak tongan poꞌon-E deꞌ tun salip.
pairs.target: him, being delivered up by the determined counsel and foreknowledge of God, you have taken by the hand of lawless men, crucified and killed;

pairs.source: Pak-e Topaꞌ odaꞌ Iyoh paliꞌ mokat idip lagiꞌ, sa' Iyoh lopas soꞌ idip jolaꞌ kobos, dop-e Iyoh diꞌ-e patut yaꞌ nah-nah kobos.
pairs.target: whom God raised up, having freed him from the agony of death, because it was not possible that he should be held by it.

pairs.source: Dop-e Iyoh moꞌ obuah sobot odaꞌ laja Daud: ‘Okuꞌ silalu ningaꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ sulung jowin kuꞌ; doiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ tapod kaso okuꞌ, dop-e Iyoh silalu sinok okuꞌ.
pairs.target: For David says concerning him, ‘I saw the Lord always before my face, For he is on my right hand, that I should not be moved.

pairs.source: Noh leh ngan otinkuꞌ sonang, okuꞌ mudi Topaꞌ daang otin kuꞌ doon.   Okuꞌ yaꞌ idip lagiꞌ, dop-e kuꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: Therefore my heart was glad, and my tongue rejoiced. Moreover my flesh also will dwell in hope;

pairs.source: Dop-e Ingan diꞌ Ingan tanah odaꞌ okuꞌ loꞌo deꞌ topat nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ kobos.   Duoh diꞌ-e tanah nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ Ingan odaꞌ yaꞌ obuaꞌ asul.
pairs.target: because you will not leave my soul in Hades, neither will you allow your Holy One to see decay.

pairs.source: Ingan moꞌ tanon tuduꞌ okuꞌ olan deꞌ nuju odaꞌ nyaꞌa idip, sinok duoh Ingan otinkuꞌ sukup doon-e.’
pairs.target: You made known to me the ways of life. You will make me full of gladness with your presence.’

pairs.source: Madih ayua, okuꞌ yaꞌ lasuꞌ sina, tanon silita Daud deꞌ jadin sumuk babai otoꞌ.   Iyoh moꞌ kobos iyoh moꞌ obuah ngubul, kubul-e aluaꞌ ogiꞌ nog adin.
pairs.target: “Brothers, I may tell you freely of the patriarch David, that he both died and was buried, and his tomb is with us to this day.

pairs.source: Pak-e Daud inoh nabi.   Yoh moꞌ puꞌan nang Topaꞌ moꞌ nai supah janyi-E, Daud moꞌ dioꞌ puꞌan ogiꞌ onak sukun-e deꞌ yaꞌ pakat Topaꞌ odaꞌ yaꞌ jadin laja.
pairs.target: Therefore, being a prophet, and knowing that God had sworn with an oath to him that of the fruit of his body, according to the flesh, he would raise up the Christ to sit on his throne,

pairs.source: Iyoh moꞌ puꞌan oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nai Topaꞌ, yohmoꞌ bitutaꞌ, Laja Pinyilamat paliꞌ idip soꞌ pingobos-e, Daud tanon nang: ‘Iyoh diꞌ-e tanah odaꞌ loꞌo deꞌ topat nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ kobos; duoh gonan-e diꞌ-e obuaꞌ asul.’ ”
pairs.target: he foreseeing this spoke about the resurrection of the Christ, that his soul wasn’t left in Hades, and his flesh didn’t see decay.

pairs.source: Petrus moꞌ sina lagiꞌ, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ silita Daud noꞌuh-e, Yesus itih leh Laja Pinyilamat deꞌ tanon koꞌih sobab Iyohleh deꞌ kidip Topaꞌ soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos.   Koꞌih deꞌ mutiꞌ leh deꞌ bonal-bonal kilin Iyoh paliꞌ idip.
pairs.target: This Jesus God raised up, to which we all are witnesses.

pairs.source: Topaꞌ Samaꞌ moꞌ pakat Iyoh keꞌ topat deꞌ paling bigatung nuaꞌ toꞌuh-E, duoh ngin kuasa tuduꞌ-E, yohmoꞌ tilimaꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ obuah janyi odop Topaꞌ Samaꞌ dioꞌ soꞌ kanoꞌ.   Adin Yesus moꞌ pait Iyang-E, inohleh deꞌ ningaꞌ ingan adin duoh deꞌ ngojit Ingan deꞌ soꞌ koꞌih.
pairs.target: Being therefore exalted by the right hand of God, and having received from the Father the promise of the Holy Spirit, he has poured out this, which you now see and hear.

pairs.source: Idoh diꞌ-e Daud deꞌ yaꞌ maꞌad ke siluga neh, ogiꞌ yoh tanon-e: ‘Topaꞌ moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Tuan deꞌ nguasa idipkuꞌ:
pairs.target: For David didn’t ascend into the heavens, but he says himself, ‘The Lord said to my Lord, “Sit by my right hand,

pairs.source: Gulu' leh deꞌ nuaꞌ toꞌuh Okuꞌ, nog Kuꞌ odaꞌ musoh-musoh muꞌ tunuak tuduꞌ muꞌu.’
pairs.target: until I make your enemies a footstool for your feet.”’

pairs.source: Jadin suaꞌ ulang Israel moꞌ puꞌan dop-e Topaꞌ moꞌ pakat Yesus deꞌ masak ingan tun salip, inohleh deꞌ moꞌ jadin Topaꞌ deꞌ nguasa idip otoꞌ duoh Laja Pinyilamat.”
pairs.target: “Let all the house of Israel therefore know certainly that God has made him both Lord and Christ, this Jesus whom you crucified.”

pairs.source: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngojit silita inoh, otin-e moꞌ ngilobuꞌ yohmoꞌ bisikian tuduꞌ Petrus duoh rasul-rasul deꞌ bokon, “Oni mey wat oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nai koꞌih neh?”
pairs.target: Now when they heard this, they were cut to the heart, and said to Peter and the rest of the apostles, “Brothers, what shall we do?”

pairs.source: Petrus moꞌ nyawot odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Paliꞌ leh keꞌ olan Topaꞌ, masim-masim ingan nog tuduꞌ-E, nyeꞌ moꞌ baptis daang adon Topaꞌ Yesus Kristus saꞌ dosa ingan obuah ngapun, duoh tilimaꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: Peter said to them, “Repent, and be baptized, every one of you, in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of sins, and you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.

pairs.source: Inoh leh janyi Topaꞌ saꞌan ingan duoh kaꞌan onak-onak sukun ingan, kaꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ topat-topat deꞌ juuaꞌ duoh sikiang-kiang nyaꞌa deꞌ mogan-e nog tuduꞌ odop Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: For the promise is to you, and to your children, and to all who are far off, even as many as the Lord our God will call to himself.”

pairs.source: Bogoꞌ lagiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ tanon-e takal-e sibaya odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, yohmoꞌ in-e, “Maꞌ tiyaꞌ nai jaꞌat kodaꞌ nyaꞌa joman deꞌ adin neh, nyeꞌ moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ saꞌ ingan silamat duoh diꞌ-e obuah ukum.”
pairs.target: With many other words he testified, and exhorted them, saying, “Save yourselves from this crooked generation!”

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ pingunang Petrus yohmoꞌ baptis.   Daang onu inoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus moꞌ bitamah kila-kila taluh libu naꞌan.
pairs.target: Then those who gladly received his word were baptized. There were added that day about three thousand souls.

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ lajin tikuluk, odop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal ayua rasul.   Yoh moꞌ man samah-samah duoh man kueh ngan-e natong Topaꞌ Yesus duoh bidoa.
pairs.target: They continued steadfastly in the apostles’ teaching and fellowship, in the breaking of bread, and prayer.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ mutiꞌ moꞌ tolu ningaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai rasul-rasul pakai kuasa Topaꞌ, duoh oni' deꞌ aluaꞌ doiꞌ onu nyaꞌa kilin-e.
pairs.target: Fear came on every soul, and many wonders and signs were done through the apostles.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ bisayaꞌ inoh moꞌ samah kila-e, balang deꞌ kakuꞌ-e deꞌ ogiꞌ samah-samah yoh kakuꞌ-e.
pairs.target: All who believed were together, and had all things in common.

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ sijaꞌ-a odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ jua balang deꞌ kakuꞌ-e yohmoꞌ bikutung-e tuduꞌ suaꞌ odop-e, nunaꞌ deꞌ pilelu-e.
pairs.target: They sold their possessions and goods, and distributed them to all, according as anyone had need.

pairs.source: Bilang konu odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tikuluk deꞌ lobuh Boli Topaꞌ, yoh moꞌ man samah-samah deꞌ boli odop-e daang kila doon duoh doiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ samuh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ man kueh natong Topaꞌ Yesus,
pairs.target: Day by day, continuing steadfastly with one accord in the temple, and breaking bread at home, they took their food with gladness and singleness of heart,

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ telus mudi adon Topaꞌ, suaꞌ nyaꞌa suka tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ, yohmoꞌ bilang konu Topaꞌ namah bilang odop-e deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: praising God, and having favor with all the people. The Lord added to the assembly day by day those who were being saved.

pairs.source: Kila-kila pukul taluh ngumi sinok jam nyaꞌa yaꞌ simayang, Petrus duoh Yohanes odi keꞌ Boli Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: Peter and John were going up into the temple at the hour of prayer, the ninth hour.

pairs.source: Deꞌ boꞌon tiban awah Boli Topaꞌ deꞌ adon “Pintu Indah”, ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan dali deꞌ kobos gonan-e soꞌ takal sinoꞌ-e milaꞌ-a.   Bilang konu nyaꞌa tawiak iyoh naꞌ danoꞌ saꞌ-e mitiaꞌ pilasiꞌ soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ molot simayang.
pairs.target: A certain man who was lame from his mother’s womb was being carried, whom they laid daily at the door of the temple which is called Beautiful, to ask gifts for the needy of those who entered into the temple.

pairs.source: Takal iyoh ningaꞌ Petrus duoh Yohanes yaꞌ molot kaang awah Boli Topaꞌ, yoh moꞌ mitiaꞌ pilasiꞌ.
pairs.target: Seeing Peter and John about to go into the temple, he asked to receive gifts for the needy.

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngiduang daang-e sina, “Ningaꞌ tuduꞌ koꞌih”.
pairs.target: Peter, fastening his eyes on him, with John, said, “Look at us.”

pairs.source: Yohmoꞌ ningaꞌ tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, baꞌ-e nang ogiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ ngin-e tuduꞌ odop-e.
pairs.target: He listened to them, expecting to receive something from them.

pairs.source: Pak-e Petrus moꞌ sina, “Duit doiꞌ deꞌ okuꞌ neh, pak-e oni deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ okuꞌ, kuꞌ ngin tuduꞌ muꞌu: Daang adon Yesus Kristus, soꞌ Nazaret, ponuleh!”
pairs.target: But Peter said, “I have no silver or gold, but what I have, that I give you. In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, get up and walk!”

pairs.source: Petrus moꞌ kagian tongan toꞌuh-e yohmoꞌ tulung odaꞌ mujuag, takal inoh geh yoh moꞌ lasuꞌ taan mujuag.
pairs.target: He took him by the right hand, and raised him up. Immediately his feet and his ankle bones received strength.

pairs.source: Yohmoꞌ lasuꞌ bitatol daang-e lasuꞌ ponu katiꞌ kanih, yohmoꞌ nunaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ molot kaang awah Boli Topaꞌ simadi-e ponu daang-e ngilokid, simadi-e mudi adon Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: Leaping up, he stood, and began to walk. He entered with them into the temple, walking, leaping, and praising God.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ iyoh ponu daang-e mudi Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: All the people saw him walking and praising God.

pairs.source: Deꞌ puꞌan nyaꞌa, iyoh noh deꞌ silalu guluꞌ mitiaꞌ pilasiꞌ deꞌ “Pintu Indah” deꞌ awah Boli Topaꞌ.   Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ sukup ilan oni deꞌ moꞌ jadi tuduꞌ-e.
pairs.target: They recognized him, that it was he who used to sit begging for gifts for the needy at the Beautiful Gate of the temple. They were filled with wonder and amazement at what had happened to him.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa inoh telus sijaꞌ-a nunaꞌ Petrus duoh Yohanes, suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ ilan duoh ngubun iyoh deꞌ awah Boli Topaꞌ deꞌ sobot nyaꞌa nang Awah Salomo.
pairs.target: As the lame man who was healed held on to Peter and John, all the people ran together to them in the porch that is called Solomon’s, greatly wondering.

pairs.source: Petrus ningaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ yohmoꞌ in-e, “Oi madih ayua kuꞌ ulang Israel! Oni nai ingan ilan oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ jadi? Oni nai ingan ngiduang koꞌih telus.   Baꞌ ingan nang nyaꞌa deꞌ ponai ponu itih odaꞌ kuasa koꞌih? Baꞌ ingan nang koꞌih taat tuduꞌ Topaꞌ ngan koꞌih tapod nai oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ?
pairs.target: When Peter saw it, he responded to the people, “You men of Israel, why do you marvel at this man? Why do you fasten your eyes on us, as though by our own power or godliness we had made him walk?

pairs.source: Topaꞌ deꞌ nyomah Abraham, Ishak, Yakub, Topaꞌ sumuk babai otoꞌ, Topaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ pakat Yesus odaꞌ timogah dop-e Iyoh moꞌ nai kiloja saꞌan Topaꞌ.   Iyoh leh deꞌ nyelah ingan tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ kuasa danoꞌ, ingan moꞌ nulak Iyoh deꞌ jowin Pilatus, takal Pilatus yaꞌ pilopas-E.
pairs.target: The God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, the God of our fathers, has glorified his Servant Jesus, whom you delivered up, and denied in the presence of Pilate, when he had determined to release him.

pairs.source: Pak-e ingan nulak Iyoh deꞌ kudus duoh bonal, ingan moꞌ paksa Pilatus odaꞌ pilopas nyaꞌa deꞌ pingabos saꞌan odop ingan.
