pairs.target: But you denied the Holy and Righteous One, and asked for a murderer to be granted to you,

pairs.source: Iyoh leh deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa idip, ingan moꞌ ngabos-E, pak-e Topaꞌ moꞌ paliꞌ kidip soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos.   Koꞌih deꞌ mutiꞌ leh deꞌ suwaꞌ kilin.
pairs.target: and killed the Prince of life, whom God raised from the dead, to which we are witnesses.

pairs.source: Dop-e nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos gonan-e inoh bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus leh, nyaꞌa inoh moꞌ taan ponu.   Adin ingan moꞌ ningaꞌ yoh moꞌ mokuaꞌ.
pairs.target: By faith in his name, his name has made this man strong, whom you see and know. Yes, the faith which is through him has given him this perfect soundness in the presence of you all.

pairs.source: Madih ayua! Okuꞌ ngiloti nang ingan ngabos Yesus, dop-e ingan samah kodaꞌ pimipin-pimipin ingan diꞌ-e puꞌan nang Iyoh noh Laja Pinyilamat.
pairs.target: “Now, brothers, I know that you did this in ignorance, as did also your rulers.

pairs.source: Noꞌuh-e Topaꞌ moꞌ tanon pakai bobaꞌ nabi-nabi, nang Laja Pinyilamat deꞌ yaꞌ pait-E, halus yaꞌ jolaꞌ idip-E.   Adin moꞌ jadi samah kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ notap Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: But the things which God announced by the mouth of all his prophets, that Christ should suffer, he thus fulfilled.

pairs.source: Nyeꞌ moꞌ paliꞌ keꞌ olan Topaꞌ, saꞌ Iyoh ngapun suaꞌ dosa ingan.
pairs.target: “Repent therefore, and turn again, that your sins may be blotted out, so that there may come times of refreshing from the presence of the Lord,

pairs.source: Topaꞌ yaꞌ pilopas oniꞌ deꞌ nokan idip ingan, duoh Iyoh yaꞌ pait Yesus tuduꞌ ingan.   Iyoh noh leh deꞌ moꞌ notu Topaꞌ deꞌ jadin Laja Pinyilamat saꞌan ingan.
pairs.target: and that he may send Christ Jesus, who was ordained for you before,

pairs.source: Laja Pinyilamat inoh yaꞌ totap loꞌo daang siluga nog onu Topaꞌ ngubah odaꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ jadin baꞌuh, samah kodaꞌ deꞌ tanon-e pakai sina nabi-nabi noꞌuh-e.
pairs.target: whom heaven must receive until the times of restoration of all things, which God spoke long ago by the mouth of his holy prophets.

pairs.source: Samah kodaꞌ deꞌ tanon nabi Musa, ‘Topaꞌ yaꞌ pait tuduꞌ ingan niꞌ naꞌan nabi soꞌ basa odop ingan, samah kodaꞌ Iyoh pait okuꞌ.   Ingan halus ngojit suaꞌ oni deꞌ tanon nabi inoh tuduꞌ ingan.
pairs.target: For Moses indeed said to the fathers, ‘The Lord God will raise up a prophet for you from among your brothers, like me. You shall listen to him in all things whatever he says to you.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ tanon nabi inoh, obuah tolan soꞌ uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ nyomah Topaꞌ duoh obuah katuab.’
pairs.target: It will be that every soul that will not listen to that prophet will be utterly destroyed from among the people.’

pairs.source: Suaꞌ nabi deꞌ moꞌ ogiꞌ onu-e tanon sibaya deꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ mulai soꞌ nabi Samuel nog nabi-nabi deꞌ bokon, suaꞌ-e tanon oniꞌ joman deꞌ adin.
pairs.target: Yes, and all the prophets from Samuel and those who followed after, as many as have spoken, they also told of these days.

pairs.source: Noꞌuh-e janyi-janyi inoh soꞌ Topaꞌ, deꞌ tanon-e pakai bobaꞌ nabi-nabi ngan-e bijanyi duoh sumuk babai ingan.   Topaꞌ moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ Abraham sumuk babai otoꞌ, ‘Soꞌ onak sukun muꞌ leh, suaꞌ basa deꞌ bumi soꞌon bilokat.’
pairs.target: You are the children of the prophets, and of the covenant which God made with our fathers, saying to Abraham, ‘In your offspring will all the families of the earth be blessed.’

pairs.source: Inoh leh ngan Topaꞌ dioꞌ pait Kuli-E saꞌan otoꞌ ulang Israel.   Iyoh moꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ paguh saꞌan ingan, odaꞌ ingan paliꞌ kaang olan Topaꞌ, duoh togan pingidip ingan deꞌ jaꞌat.”
pairs.target: God, having raised up his servant Jesus, sent him to you first to bless you, in turning away every one of you from your wickedness.”

pairs.source: Takal Petrus duoh Yohanes aluaꞌ sina duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ, tang-tangpimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi, duoh piayuh nyaꞌa deꞌ jaga Boli Topaꞌ,baya nyaꞌa Yahudi soꞌ golongan Saduki nog nisog odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: As they spoke to the people, the priests and the captain of the temple and the Sadducees came to them,

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ tiwas tuduꞌ Petrus duoh Yohanes, dop-e iyoh moꞌngajal nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ yoh nang Yesus moꞌ paliꞌ idip soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos.Odop-e deꞌ duwoh inoh ngajal geh nang Yesus moꞌ jadin bukti nang nyaꞌadeꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus yaꞌ paliꞌ idip lagi'
pairs.target: being upset because they taught the people and proclaimed in Jesus the resurrection from the dead.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa moꞌ takap odop-e deꞌduwoh  Dop-e onu moꞌ yaꞌ ngalom, yoh moꞌ naan daang jel nog sipagi.
pairs.target: They laid hands on them, and put them in custody until the next day, for it was now evening.

pairs.source: Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ ngajal rasul-rasul deꞌ munoꞌ, bogoꞌnyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus  Suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesusbitamah nog kila-kila limoh libu naꞌan.
pairs.target: But many of those who heard the word believed, and the number of the men came to be about five thousand.

pairs.source: Tiaꞌ pagi-e nyam-e pimipin-pimipin Agama Yahudi deꞌ Ayuh,pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi deꞌ bokon duoh gulu-gulu Agama Yahudi moꞌtikuluk deꞌ Yerusalem
pairs.target: In the morning, their rulers, elders, and scribes were gathered together in Jerusalem.

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bitapod duoh Pimipin AgamaYahudi deꞌ Paling Ayuh Hanas, Kayafas, Yohanes, Alexsander, duoh susuaꞌnyaꞌa deꞌ molot daang madih ayua Pimipin Agama Yahudi deꞌ Paling Ayuhinoh
pairs.target: Annas the high priest was there, with Caiaphas, John, Alexander, and as many as were relatives of the high priest.

pairs.source: Yohmoꞌ toban Petrus duoh Yohanes, deꞌ sulung jowin-e, yohmoꞌmulai pilisa pakai bisikian, “Kuasa oni deꞌ pakai ingan, daang adon osiingan moꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ?”
pairs.target: When they had stood Peter and John in the middle of them, they inquired, “By what power, or in what name, have you done this?”

pairs.source: Iyang Topaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nguasa Petrus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Oi ingan deꞌ mipinPengadilan Agama duoh pimipin ulang Yahudi deꞌ bokon!
pairs.target: Then Peter, filled with the Holy Spirit, said to them, “You rulers of the people, and elders of Israel,

pairs.source: Moꞌ inganbilituang duoh koꞌih simoꞌ-o koꞌih nai oniꞌ deꞌ paguh tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kobosgonan-e  Ingan moꞌ odaꞌ koꞌih tanon pakai kuasa oni ngan odaꞌ nyaꞌa inohmokuaꞌ monam
pairs.target: if we are examined today concerning a good deed done to a crippled man, by what means this man has been healed,

pairs.source: Saꞌ ingan pimipin duoh suaꞌ ulang Israel puꞌan nangdaang adon Yesus Kristus soꞌ Nazaret deꞌ tak ingan nyalip-E, pak-e Iyohmoꞌ paliꞌ idip lagiꞌ  Daang adon Yesus Kristus inoh leh, nyaꞌa inoh ponaimujuag daang-e sehat
pairs.target: be it known to you all, and to all the people of Israel, that in the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, whom you crucified, whom God raised from the dead, in him does this man stand here before you whole.

pairs.source: Yesus inoh leh deꞌ nang-e daang Kitab deꞌ in-e,‘Batuh deꞌ saꞌat tukang nai boli deꞌ diꞌ-e biguna,’ tukang-tukanginoh leh ingan deꞌ mutiꞌ odop-e,‘pak-e Topaꞌ moꞌ odaꞌ batuh inoh paling biguna.’
pairs.target: He is ‘the stone which was regarded as worthless by you, the builders, which has become the head of the corner.’

pairs.source: Doiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon dapod nyilamat otoꞌ moꞌ nyam diꞌ-e Yesus, dop-edeꞌ daang dunia itih doiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan deꞌ ogiꞌ kuasa deꞌ ngin Topaꞌ tuduꞌ-ekaꞌan nyilamat otoꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ.”
pairs.target: There is salvation in none other, for neither is there any other name under heaven, that is given among men, by which we must be saved!”

pairs.source: Pimipin-pimipin deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ilan ngan-e ningaꞌ Petrus duoh Yohanesbilani nyawot sina odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ  Deꞌ puꞌan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, Petrusduoh Yohanes nyaꞌa biasa duoh deꞌ doiꞌ sikolah-e, pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌpuꞌan-e geh nang odop-e deꞌ duwoh noh nyaꞌa deꞌ silalu nunaꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: Now when they saw the boldness of Peter and John, and had perceived that they were unlearned and ignorant men, they marveled. They recognized that they had been with Jesus.

pairs.source: Pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e ponai nang oni-oni-e, dop-e nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌmokuaꞌ inoh ogiꞌ mujuag sinok rasul deꞌ munoꞌ
pairs.target: Seeing the man who was healed standing with them, they could say nothing against it.

pairs.source: Yohmoꞌ odaꞌ odop-edeꞌ duwoh inoh buu luah soꞌ topat inoh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ biloneng.
pairs.target: But when they had commanded them to go aside out of the council, they conferred among themselves,

pairs.source: Yohmoꞌ sina, “Oni wat toꞌ yaꞌ duoh odop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ? Sobab susuaꞌ nyaꞌadeꞌ Yerusalem moꞌ puꞌan nang tok odop-e deꞌ duwoh inoh moꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌpakai kuasa Topaꞌ, yohmoꞌ diꞌ toꞌ ponai yaꞌ nyakal-e
pairs.target: saying, “What shall we do to these men? Because indeed a notable miracle has been done through them, as can be plainly seen by all who dwell in Jerusalem, and we can’t deny it.

pairs.source: Saꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌdiꞌ-e sikiya puꞌan-e yohmoꞌ nalu odop-e deꞌ duwoh daang-e jaman odop-edeꞌ duwoh, kilakal adon Yesus tuduꞌ osi sijaꞌ-a.”
pairs.target: But so that this spreads no further among the people, let’s threaten them, that from now on they don’t speak to anyone in this name.”

pairs.source: Yohmoꞌ mogan odop-e deꞌ duwoh odaꞌ paliꞌ molot, yohmoꞌ jamansobot adon Yesus duoh maꞌ tiyaꞌ yaꞌ ngajal daang adon Yesus.
pairs.target: They called them, and commanded them not to speak at all nor teach in the name of Jesus.

pairs.source: Pak-e Petrus duoh Yohanes moꞌ nyawot-e, “Suba ingan pikil-e, ki deꞌbonal deꞌ jowin Topaꞌ: nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nang ingan keh nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nangTopaꞌ
pairs.target: But Peter and John answered them, “Whether it is right in the sight of God to listen to you rather than to God, judge for yourselves,

pairs.source: Dop-e koꞌih diꞌ ponai dusah yaꞌ sobot-e duoh yaꞌ silita oni deꞌmoꞌ ningaꞌ koꞌih duoh oni deꞌ moꞌ ngojit koꞌih.”
pairs.target: for we can’t help telling the things which we saw and heard.”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌulih-ulih ngegap odop-e deꞌ duwoh, pak-e nyuang-nyuang-e tuang pilopas-egeh dop-e doiꞌ yoh tapod alasan ngan-e yaꞌ ngukum odop-e deꞌ duwoh,dop-e yoh tolu tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ deꞌ moꞌ mudi Topaꞌ takal-e ningaꞌoniꞌ deꞌ nai-e pakai kuasa Topaꞌ
pairs.target: When they had further threatened them, they let them go, finding no way to punish them, because of the people; for everyone glorified God for that which was done.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ mokuaꞌ odaꞌ kuasa Topaꞌinoh moꞌ pat puluꞌ lobih sowaꞌ gonan-e kobos.
pairs.target: For the man on whom this miracle of healing was performed was more than forty years old.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ Petrus duoh Yohanes obuah pilopas soꞌ jel, odop-e deꞌ duwohinoh moꞌ paliꞌ tuduꞌ dingan-dingan-e, yohmoꞌ kilakal susuaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌnang pimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh, duoh pimipin-pimipin ulangYahudi deꞌ bokon tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ duwoh
pairs.target: Being let go, they came to their own company, and reported all that the chief priests and the elders had said to them.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ dingan-e deꞌ munoꞌmoꞌ ngojit gah inoh, iyoh moꞌ samah-samah bidoa tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, in sinaodop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Oi Topaꞌ, Inganleh deꞌ moꞌ nai longit duoh bumi, lautduoh susuaꞌ isiꞌ-e
pairs.target: When they heard it, they lifted up their voice to God with one accord, and said, “O Lord, you are God, who made the heaven, the earth, the sea, and all that is in them;

pairs.source: Iyang Topaꞌ moꞌ pakai bobaꞌ sumuk babai koꞌih lajaDaud deꞌ nai kiloja deꞌ odaꞌ Ingan  Iyang Topaꞌ moꞌ sina tuduꞌ laja Daud,in-e,‘Oni nai nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e puꞌan Topaꞌ malah;oni nai suaꞌ basa deꞌ ogiꞌ daang dunia itih nai oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ-e biguna?
pairs.target: who by the mouth of your servant, David, said, ‘Why do the nations rage, and the peoples plot a vain thing?

pairs.source: Laja-laja deꞌ dunia moꞌ siap-siap yaꞌ bipolang,ayua pimipin moꞌ bipokatlawan Topaꞌ duoh Laja Pinyilamat deꞌ moꞌ notu-E.’
pairs.target: The kings of the earth take a stand, and the rulers take council together, against the Lord, and against his Christ.’

pairs.source: Tok Herodes duoh Pontius Pilatus moꞌ bitapod duoh ulang-ulang deꞌdiꞌ-e Yahudi duoh ulang-ulang Israel daang kota itih  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌbipokat yaꞌ lawan Yesus, Kuli Ingan deꞌ kudus, deꞌ odaꞌ Ingan jadin LajaPinyilamat
pairs.target: “For truly, in this city against your holy servant, Jesus, whom you anointed, both Herod and Pontius Pilate, with the Gentiles and the people of Israel, were gathered together

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bipokat ngan-e yaꞌ pijadi susuaꞌ oniꞌdeꞌ moꞌ notu Topaꞌ soꞌ sibungas-e
pairs.target: to do whatever your hand and your council foreordained to happen.

pairs.source: Topaꞌ, ningaꞌ leh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌmoꞌ ngegap koꞌih deꞌ nai kiloja deꞌ odaꞌ Ingan, nginleh odaꞌ koꞌih bilanimagah Gah deꞌ Paguh
pairs.target: Now, Lord, look at their threats, and grant to your servants to speak your word with all boldness,

pairs.source: Topaꞌ, bitanga leh kuasa Ingan deꞌ ayuh saꞌ nyaꞌaningaꞌ nang Ingan tok ogiꞌ kuasa, nai geh oniꞌ pakai kuasa Ingan saꞌ nyaꞌamonam mokuaꞌ daang adon Yesus, Kuli Ingan deꞌ kudus.”
pairs.target: while you stretch out your hand to heal; and that signs and wonders may be done through the name of your holy Servant Jesus.”

pairs.source: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ mokuaꞌ bidoa, topat soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌtikuluk moꞌ biguyut  Iyang Topaꞌ moꞌ nguasa odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, yohmoꞌbilani magah Pingunang Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: When they had prayed, the place was shaken where they were gathered together. They were all filled with the Holy Spirit, and they spoke the word of God with boldness.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus idip samah otin, samah kila-e.Doiꞌ tiyaꞌ deꞌ soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ nang tung odop-esadiꞌ-e  Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ pakai samah-samah.
pairs.target: The multitude of those who believed were of one heart and soul. Not one of them claimed that anything of the things which he possessed was his own, but they had all things in common.

pairs.source: Pakai kuasa deꞌ ayuh, rasul-rasul deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ tanon nang Yesus moꞌpaliꞌ idip lagiꞌ  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ soꞌon bilokat deꞌ ayuh soꞌ Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: With great power, the apostles gave their testimony of the resurrection of the Lord Jesus. Great grace was on them all.

pairs.source: Doiꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ngoon nang odop-e ogiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ kulang  Dop-eogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ jua tanaꞌ, ogiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ jua boli-e,
pairs.target: For neither was there among them any who lacked, for as many as were owners of lands or houses sold them, and brought the proceeds of the things that were sold,

pairs.source: yohmoꞌ ngin loga-etuduꞌ rasul-rasul  Rasul-rasul deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bikutung tuduꞌ nyaꞌa nunaꞌkiang deꞌ pilelu-e.
pairs.target: and laid them at the apostles’ feet, and distribution was made to each, according as anyone had need.

pairs.source: Wat inoh geh wat Yusuf, deꞌ mogan rasul-rasul geh nang Barnabas,loti-e nyaꞌa deꞌ ponai ngin simangat tuduꞌ nyaꞌa  Yusuf inoh soꞌ pulouSiprus, onak sukun Lewi
pairs.target: Joses, who by the apostles was also called Barnabas (which is, being interpreted, Son of Encouragement), a Levite, a man of Cyprus by race,

pairs.source: Iyoh moꞌ jua umoh-o, loga-e yoh toban tuduꞌrasul-rasul.
pairs.target: having a field, sold it, and brought the money and laid it at the apostles’ feet.

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ lagiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ adon Ananias, duoh sowon-e deꞌ adon Safira moꞌ juaniꞌ ongan tanaꞌ
pairs.target: But a certain man named Ananias, with Sapphira, his wife, sold a possession,

pairs.source: Yoh moꞌ bipokat duoh sowon-e duit loga tanaꞌ inohyoh mit kodaꞌ-e saꞌan odop-e, kuban-e yoh moꞌ nyelah tuduꞌ rasul-rasul.
pairs.target: and kept back part of the price, his wife also being aware of it, and brought a certain part, and laid it at the apostles’ feet.

pairs.source: Petrus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, “Ananias, oni nai muꞌ tanah odaꞌ Laja Muatmunua nguasa otin muꞌ, sape muꞌu bilani mogo Iyang Topaꞌ, muꞌu moꞌmit loga tanaꞌ inoh kodaꞌ-a saꞌan odop muꞌ
pairs.target: But Peter said, “Ananias, why has Satan filled your heart to lie to the Holy Spirit, and to keep back part of the price of the land?

pairs.source: Takal tanaꞌ inoh aluaꞌ diꞌmuꞌ jua-e, tanaꞌ inoh aluaꞌ kakuꞌ odop muꞌ, takal muꞌ moꞌ jua-e loga-ealuaꞌ tung odop muꞌ geh  Oni muꞌ nai niat jaꞌat daang otin muꞌ? Idoh diꞌmuꞌ mogo manusia pak-e muꞌu mogo Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: While you kept it, didn’t it remain your own? After it was sold, wasn’t it in your power? How is it that you have conceived this thing in your heart? You haven’t lied to men, but to God.”

pairs.source: Takal-e ngojit sina inohgeh, Ananias moꞌ lasuꞌ tumang daang-e lasuꞌ kobos  Takal suaꞌ nyaꞌa moꞌngojit gah inoh, nyaꞌa moꞌ tolu
pairs.target: Ananias, hearing these words, fell down and died. Great fear came on all who heard these things.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh nog kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌadeꞌ aluaꞌ mudaꞌ moꞌ molot molut todang-e yohmoꞌ tawiak toban keꞌ sopaꞌyohmoꞌ ngubul-e.
pairs.target: The young men arose and wrapped him up, and they carried him out and buried him.

pairs.source: Kila-kila taluh jam takal nyaꞌa moꞌ mokuaꞌ ngubul Ananias, sowon-emoꞌ molot, pak-e diꞌ-e puꞌan nang bonon-e moꞌ kobos
pairs.target: About three hours later, his wife, not knowing what had happened, came in.

pairs.source: Petrus moꞌ sikiantuduꞌ-e, “Tok kiang inoh keh loga tanaꞌ deꞌ jua ingan?” Yoh moꞌ nyawot-e,“Tok kiang inoh”.
pairs.target: Peter answered her, “Tell me whether you sold the land for so much.” She said, “Yes, for so much.”

pairs.source: Petrus moꞌ sina, “Oni nai ingan duwoh bipokat yaꞌ mogo Iyang Topaꞌ?Ningaꞌ leh nyaꞌa deꞌ tuang paliꞌ ngubul bonon muꞌ moꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ bolot tiban,ngan-e yaꞌ molot tawiak todang muꞌu”
pairs.target: But Peter asked her, “How is it that you have agreed together to tempt the Spirit of the Lord? Behold, the feet of those who have buried your husband are at the door, and they will carry you out.”

pairs.source: Takal inoh geh sowon Ananiasmoꞌ lasuꞌ tumang daang-e lasuꞌ kobos, deꞌ sulung jowin Petrus  Takal nyaꞌadeꞌ aluaꞌ bujang deꞌ munoꞌ molot yohmoꞌ ningaꞌ yoh moꞌ doiꞌ asong-e, yohmoꞌ tawiak toban keꞌ sopaꞌ yoh moꞌ odi ngubul deꞌ bingon kubul bonon-e.
pairs.target: She fell down immediately at his feet, and died. The young men came in and found her dead, and they carried her out and buried her by her husband.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus duoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon deꞌ ngojitgah inoh moꞌ jadin tolu.
pairs.target: Great fear came on the whole assembly, and on all who heard these things.

pairs.source: Rasul-rasul deꞌ mutiꞌ moꞌ nai pingunai kiloja deꞌ diꞌ nyaꞌa ponai nai-eduoh deꞌ doiꞌ sidoh nyaꞌa kilin-e, deꞌ uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ  Odop-e deꞌbisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus deꞌ mutiꞌ moꞌ kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bimadih, yoh moꞌ lajintikuluk deꞌ Awah Salomo deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ Boli Topaꞌ
pairs.target: By the hands of the apostles many signs and wonders were done among the people. They were all with one accord in Solomon’s porch.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌdiꞌ-e puus tikuluk duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ  Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ moꞌ pimodotuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ
pairs.target: None of the rest dared to join them, however the people honored them.

pairs.source: Tibilang konu, nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ bitamah bogoꞌ,bait dali bait dayung
pairs.target: More believers were added to the Lord, multitudes of both men and women.

pairs.source: Bogoꞌ nyaꞌa moꞌ toban nyaꞌa deꞌ monam keꞌ sopaꞌ,keꞌ pang olan yohmoꞌ piguling tun topat nyaꞌa boꞌos duoh amuak, saꞌ-atakal Petrus ngilusuꞌ-e, sibamia-e obuah odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ saꞌ-e mokuaꞌ.
pairs.target: They even carried out the sick into the streets, and laid them on cots and mattresses, so that as Peter came by, at the least his shadow might overshadow some of them.

pairs.source: Siuah-siuah nyaꞌa nog soꞌ kota-kota deꞌ ogiꞌ sinok Yerusalem, nyaꞌa deꞌmunoꞌ moꞌ toban nyaꞌa deꞌ monam duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bikalui muat munua,suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ iyoh odaꞌ mokuaꞌ.
pairs.target: The multitude also came together from the cities around Jerusalem, bringing sick people, and those who were tormented by unclean spirits: and they were all healed.

pairs.source: Yohmoꞌ Pimipin Agama Yahudi deꞌ Paling Ayuh duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ nuaꞌiyoh kodaꞌ ulang Saduki moꞌ mulai nai ulah-e tuduꞌ rasul-rasul deꞌ munoꞌ,odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ siniaꞌ
pairs.target: But the high priest rose up, and all those who were with him (which is the sect of the Sadducees), and they were filled with jealousy,

pairs.source: Iyoh moꞌ takap rasul-rasul deꞌ munoꞌ yohmoꞌkibalot daang jel deꞌ ogiꞌ daang kota inoh
pairs.target: and laid hands on the apostles, and put them in public custody.

pairs.source: Pak-e takal onu ngalom,malaikat Topaꞌ moꞌ nog bukaꞌ tiban jel, yohmoꞌ toban luah, yoh moꞌ in-e,
pairs.target: But an angel of the Lord opened the prison doors by night, and brought them out, and said,

pairs.source: “Odi leh mujuag deꞌ Boli Topaꞌ.Tanon leh olan idip deꞌ baꞌuh tuduꞌ nyaꞌadeꞌ bogoꞌ.”
pairs.target: “Go stand and speak in the temple to the people all the words of this life.”

pairs.source: Rasul-rasul moꞌ nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ tanon malaikat  Suam-suam pagi odop-edeꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ odi keꞌ Boli Topaꞌ, yohmoꞌ mulai ngajal.Takal inoh Pimipin Agama Yahudi deꞌ Paling Ayuh-e duohpinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-e baya pimipin-pimipin Yahudi deꞌ bokon moꞌ bilituangdeꞌ Pengadilan Agama, yohmoꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa odi mit rasul-rasul soꞌ aang jel,odaꞌ toban ngaduap odop-e.
pairs.target: When they heard this, they entered into the temple about daybreak, and taught. But the high priest came, and those who were with him, and called the council together, and all the senate of the children of Israel, and sent to the prison to have them brought.

pairs.source: Pak-e takal nyaꞌa deꞌ odaꞌ-e odi keꞌ jel moꞌ nog, yohmoꞌ ningaꞌrasul-rasul inoh doiꞌ daang jel  Yoh moꞌ paliꞌ tanon tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: But the officers who came didn’t find them in the prison. They returned and reported,

pairs.source: Yohmoꞌ in-e, “Koꞌih ningaꞌ tiban jel aluaꞌ bonal-bonal obuah ngusi, nyaꞌadeꞌ jaga tiban jel suaꞌ aluaꞌ ogiꞌ  Takal koꞌih moꞌ bukaꞌ tiban jel koꞌih ningaꞌmoꞌ osan.”
pairs.target: “We found the prison shut and locked, and the guards standing before the doors, but when we opened them, we found no one inside!”

pairs.source: Takal piayuh nyaꞌa deꞌ jaga Boli Topaꞌ duoh pimipin-pimipinAgama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh moꞌ ngojit gah inoh, yohmoꞌ bigaduh daang-ebisikian, “Oni deꞌ moꞌ obuah rasul-rasul deꞌ munoꞌ?”
pairs.target: Now when the high priest, the captain of the temple, and the chief priests heard these words, they were very perplexed about them and what might become of this.

pairs.source: Pak-e ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌannyaꞌa deꞌ nog tanon tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Ningaꞌ, nyaꞌa deꞌ ngejel inganadin moꞌ ogiꞌ daang Boli Topaꞌ, yoh julah-e ngajal nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ”.
pairs.target: One came and told them, “Behold, the men whom you put in prison are in the temple, standing and teaching the people.”

pairs.source: Yohmoꞌ piayuh nyaꞌa deꞌ jaga Boli Topaꞌ duoh onak buah-a moꞌ odimit rasul-rasul inoh lagiꞌ, pak-e idoh diꞌ-e pakai pijolaꞌ duoh diꞌ-e mokos-e,dop-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tolu, jak nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ nyokad pakai batuh.
pairs.target: Then the captain went with the officers, and brought them without violence, for they were afraid that the people might stone them.

pairs.source: Yohmoꞌtoban rasul-rasul deꞌ munoꞌ molot ngaduap pengadilan.Pimipin Agama Yahudi deꞌ Paling Ayuh moꞌ mulai bisikian tuduꞌ odop-edeꞌ munoꞌ
pairs.target: When they had brought them, they set them before the council. The high priest questioned them,

pairs.source: In sina-e, “Moꞌ bonal-bonal koꞌih jaman ingan yaꞌ ngajalnyaꞌa tentang Nyaꞌa inoh  Pak-e adin ningaꞌ wat oniꞌ deꞌ nai ingan! Inganmoꞌ kapah pingunang ingan deꞌ suaꞌ Yerusalem, ingan moꞌ yaꞌ nuduh nangkoꞌih leh deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa inoh kobos.”
pairs.target: saying, “Didn’t we strictly command you not to teach in this name? Behold, you have filled Jerusalem with your teaching, and intend to bring this man’s blood on us.”

pairs.source: Pak-e Petrus duoh rasul-rasul deꞌ bokon moꞌ nyawot-e, “Lobih paguhkoꞌih nunaꞌ pilitah Topaꞌ soꞌ koꞌih nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nang manusia
pairs.target: But Peter and the apostles answered, “We must obey God rather than men.

pairs.source: Yesus deꞌnyalib ingan moꞌ paliꞌ idip lagiꞌ odaꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ nyomah sumuk babai otoꞌ.
pairs.target: The God of our fathers raised up Jesus, whom you killed, hanging him on a tree.

pairs.source: Topaꞌ moꞌ pakat Iyoh, Yoh moꞌ ngin kuasa deꞌ ayuh, odaꞌ jadin Pimipinduoh Pinyilamat saꞌ basa Israel tapod paliꞌ ke olan Topaꞌ saꞌ-e soꞌon apun.
pairs.target: God exalted him with his right hand to be a Prince and a Savior, to give repentance to Israel, and remission of sins.

pairs.source: Koꞌih moꞌ ningaꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ, koꞌih moꞌ tukang tanon susuaꞌ oniꞌdeꞌ moꞌ nai-E  Iyang Topaꞌ moꞌ suwaꞌ tanon  Iyang Topaꞌ inoh Topaꞌ ngintuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ taat tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: We are His witnesses of these things; and so also is the Holy Spirit, whom God has given to those who obey him.”

pairs.source: Takal ayua deꞌ ogiꞌ daang Pengadilan Agama moꞌ ngojit pingunangodop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, otin-e moꞌ nginyas  Yohmoꞌ bipokat yaꞌ ngabos rasul-rasuldeꞌ munoꞌ
pairs.target: But they, when they heard this, were cut to the heart, and were determined to kill them.

pairs.source: Pak-e ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan ulang Farisi deꞌ suwaꞌ jadin ulang deꞌpingadel deꞌ adon Gamaliel, gulu agama Yahudi deꞌ sukup ulang Israeltunuak deꞌ pingunang-e  Iyoh moꞌ mujuag, odaꞌ rasul-rasul inoh luah niꞌtiliaꞌ keꞌ sopaꞌ
pairs.target: But one stood up in the council, a Pharisee named Gamaliel, a teacher of the law, honored by all the people, and commanded to put the apostles out for a little while.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh iyoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ ogiꞌ daangPengadilan Agama, “Oi ulang Israel, pikil dioꞌ bonal-bonal-e oni deꞌ yaꞌ naiingan duoh odop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ!
pairs.target: He said to them, “You men of Israel, be careful concerning these men, what you are about to do.

pairs.source: Dop-e noꞌuh-e ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ adon Teudas,deꞌ ngakuꞌ nang odop-e ulang deꞌ bonal, yohmoꞌ ogiꞌ kulang lobih-e patlatus naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ nunaꞌ iyoh  Takal yoh moꞌ obuah ngabos, nyaꞌa deꞌnunaꞌ iyoh moꞌ sobak-sobul buu, yohmoꞌ obuaꞌ silita-e
pairs.target: For before these days Theudas rose up, making himself out to be somebody; to whom a number of men, about four hundred, joined themselves: who was slain; and all, as many as obeyed him, were dispersed, and came to nothing.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh,takal nyaꞌa ngituang bilang layat-e, timul lagiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ adon Yudas soꞌGalilea  Iyoh moꞌ ngaluh nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ odaꞌ nunaꞌ odop-e' pak-e yohtuang kobos geh, suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nunaꞌ yoh moꞌ sobak-sobul buu
pairs.target: After this man, Judas of Galilee rose up in the days of the enrollment, and drew away some people after him. He also perished, and all, as many as obeyed him, were scattered abroad.

pairs.source: Noh lehngan okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Maꞌ kaso odop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ, tanah! Simoꞌ-eoniꞌ deꞌ ngajal-e duoh oniꞌ deꞌ nai-e soꞌ manusia, yoh totap ponai obuaꞌ.
pairs.target: Now I tell you, withdraw from these men, and leave them alone. For if this counsel or this work is of men, it will be overthrown.

pairs.source: Pak-e moꞌ pingunai-e soꞌ Topaꞌ, idoh diꞌ toꞌ ponai yaꞌ lawan-e  Simoꞌ toꞌlawan-e samah duoh otoꞌ lawan Topaꞌ.” Nasehat inoh nyaꞌa tilimaꞌ-e.
pairs.target: But if it is of God, you will not be able to overthrow it, and you would be found even to be fighting against God!”

pairs.source: Yoh moꞌ mogan rasul-rasul deꞌ munoꞌ, yohmoꞌ mosut-e, yoh moꞌ jamanngajal nyaꞌa tentang Yesus, mokuaꞌ inoh yoh pilopas-e
pairs.target: They agreed with him. Summoning the apostles, they beat them and commanded them not to speak in the name of Jesus, and let them go.

pairs.source: Rasul-rasul deꞌmunoꞌ moꞌ buu togan Pengadilan Agama, daang otin-e deꞌ sonang, dop-eTopaꞌ moꞌ odaꞌ yoh jolaꞌ odaꞌ adon Yesus
pairs.target: They therefore departed from the presence of the council, rejoicing that they were counted worthy to suffer dishonor for Jesus’ name.

pairs.source: Bilang konu yoh telus ngajalnyaꞌa deꞌ Boli Topaꞌ duoh deꞌ boli-boli nyaꞌa, yoh tanon Gah deꞌ Paguhtentang Yesus, Yesus inoh leh Laja deꞌ nyilamat nyaꞌa, deꞌ moꞌ tanon-edaang janyi-E.
pairs.target: Every day, in the temple and at home, they never stopped teaching and preaching Jesus, the Christ.

pairs.source: Makin tuui nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus bitamah bogoꞌ  Takal inohulang Yahudi deꞌ pakai sina Yunani diꞌ puas tuduꞌ ulang Yahudi deꞌpakai sina Ibrani  Dop-e sinoꞌ-sinoꞌ janda deꞌ pakai sina Yunani diꞌ-e soꞌonduman-e deꞌ kutung nyaꞌa bilang konu
pairs.target: Now in those days, when the number of the disciples was multiplying, a complaint arose from the Hellenists against the Hebrews, because their widows were neglected in the daily service.

pairs.source: Inoh leh sobab soꞌ simoong duohnaꞌan rasul moꞌ nguluk suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus, yohmoꞌ in-e,“Diꞌ-e paguh simoꞌ-o jok koꞌih ngulus soal pinguman, pak-e koꞌih diꞌ koꞌihpoyaꞌ yaꞌ tanon Pingunang Topaꞌ
pairs.target: The twelve summoned the multitude of the disciples and said, “It is not appropriate for us to forsake the word of God and serve tables.

pairs.source: Wat itih negeh otoꞌ pilih juꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌadeꞌ ogiꞌ daang uluk otoꞌ itih, nyaꞌa deꞌ puꞌan otoꞌ nang paguh, deꞌ nguasaIyang Topaꞌ, deꞌ bijak saꞌ koꞌih ngin odaꞌ yoh ngulus oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ,
pairs.target: Therefore select from among you, brothers, seven men of good report, full of the Holy Spirit and of wisdom, whom we may appoint over this business.

pairs.source: saꞌjok koꞌih tukang bidoa duoh tanon Pingunang Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: But we will continue steadfastly in prayer and in the ministry of the word.”

pairs.source: Suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ situju deꞌ pingunang rasul-rasul, yohmoꞌ pilihStefanus nyaꞌa deꞌ sukup bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus duoh Iyang Topaꞌ moꞌnguasa idip-e, yohmoꞌ Filipus, Prokhorus, Nikanor, Timon, Parmenas duohNikolaus  Nikolaus inoh ulang Antiokhia; yoh diꞌ-e ulang Yahudi pak-eyoh moꞌ molot Agama Yahudi
pairs.target: These words pleased the whole multitude. They chose Stephen, a man full of faith and of the Holy Spirit, Philip, Prochorus, Nicanor, Timon, Parmenas, and Nicolaus, a proselyte of Antioch;

pairs.source: Juꞌ naꞌan itih yohmoꞌ toban ngaduaprasul-rasul  Rasul-rasul moꞌ naꞌ tongan-e deꞌ tun odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ daang-ebidoa saꞌ-a odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nai kiloja inoh.
pairs.target: whom they set before the apostles. When they had prayed, they laid their hands on them.

pairs.source: Watnoh leh Pingunang Topaꞌ moꞌ popah, yohmoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌtuduꞌ Yesus deꞌ Yerusalem moꞌ bitamah bogoꞌ  Daang odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ,bogoꞌ geh pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ suwaꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: The word of God increased and the number of the disciples multiplied in Jerusalem exceedingly. A great company of the priests were obedient to the faith.

pairs.source: Stefanus moꞌ soꞌon bilokat soꞌ Topaꞌ, yohmoꞌ bogoꞌ moꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌsukup nyaꞌa ilan-e duoh nai oniꞌ deꞌ jok nyaꞌa ponai nai pakai kuasaTopaꞌ deꞌ uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ
pairs.target: Stephen, full of faith and power, performed great wonders and signs among the people.

pairs.source: Pak-e ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa bikalahduoh Stefanus  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ silalu bikuluk daang boli topatsimayang deꞌ adon Nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ Bebas  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ soꞌ Kireneduoh Aleksandria  Ogiꞌ geh ulang Yahudi deꞌ soꞌ Kilikia duoh deꞌ soꞌ Asia.
pairs.target: But some of those who were of the synagogue called “The Libertines”, and of the Cyrenians, of the Alexandrians, and of those of Cilicia and Asia arose, disputing with Stephen.

pairs.source: Pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e tapod yaꞌ lawan oniꞌ deꞌ nang Stefanus,dop-e Iyang Topaꞌ moꞌ ngin kuasa odaꞌ iyoh ponai sina
pairs.target: They weren’t able to withstand the wisdom and the Spirit by which he spoke.

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌmoꞌ nyogok kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa pakai duit saꞌ-e nang sina pibulaꞌ-a,“Koꞌih ngojit yoh itih pijaꞌat adon Musa duoh Topaꞌ”
pairs.target: Then they secretly induced men to say, “We have heard him speak blasphemous words against Moses and God.”

pairs.source: Wat inoh leh watodop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngaluh nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ duoh pimipin-pimipin Yahudideꞌ bokon, tamah lagiꞌ gulu-gulu agama Yahudi, mokuaꞌ inoh odop-e deꞌmunoꞌ moꞌ takap Stefanus, yohmoꞌ toban keꞌ Pengadilan Agama
pairs.target: They stirred up the people, the elders, and the scribes, and came against him and seized him, and brought him in to the council,

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌinoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ jadin tukang tanon deꞌ sina pibulaꞌngan-e pijaꞌat Stefanus inoh, sina in-e, “Nyaꞌa itih silalu pijaꞌat Boli Topaꞌduoh yaꞌ ngubah ukum-ukum deꞌ nulis nabi Musa deꞌ saꞌan otoꞌ
pairs.target: and set up false witnesses who said, “This man never stops speaking blasphemous words against this holy place and the law.

pairs.source: Dop-ekoꞌih moꞌ ngojit iyoh moꞌ nang sina: ‘Yesus soꞌ Nazaret inoh yaꞌ pilubuhBoli Topaꞌ tih duoh yoh yaꞌ ngubah ukum-ukum deꞌ nulis nabi Musa deꞌsaꞌan otoꞌ’.”
pairs.target: For we have heard him say that this Jesus of Nazareth will destroy this place, and will change the customs which Moses delivered to us.”

pairs.source: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ guluꞌ daang Pengadilan Agama moꞌ ngiduangStefanus, yohmo ningaꞌ jowin Stefanus samah kodaꞌ jowin malaikat.
pairs.target: All who sat in the council, fastening their eyes on him, saw his face like it was the face of an angel.

pairs.source: In Pimipin agama deꞌ paling ayuh inoh, “Tok yeh in inoh?”
pairs.target: The high priest said, “Are these things so?”

pairs.source: Stefanusmoꞌ nyawot-e, “Oi madih ayua duoh bala samaꞌ  Ngojit dioꞌ! Topaꞌ deꞌdoiꞌ baning-e inoh, moꞌ bitanga odop-E tuduꞌ sumuk babai otoꞌ Abraham,takal yoh aluaꞌ deꞌ Mesopotamia, ngan-e aluaꞌ diꞌ-e loꞌo deꞌ Haran
pairs.target: He said, “Brothers and fathers, listen. The God of glory appeared to our father Abraham, when he was in Mesopotamia, before he lived in Haran,

pairs.source: Topaꞌmoꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, ‘Buu leh soꞌ negeli muꞌ, soꞌ uluk madih muꞌ, ponu lehnuju negeli deꞌ yaꞌ tanon kuꞌ tuduꞌ muꞌu.’
pairs.target: and said to him, ‘Get out of your land, and from your relatives, and come into a land which I will show you.’

pairs.source: Abraham bilakat buu soꞌ negeliulang Kasdim, yohmoꞌ odi loꞌo deꞌ Haran.Takal samaꞌ-a moꞌ kobos, Topaꞌmoꞌ odaꞌ Abraham pinah keꞌ tanaꞌ itih, topat otoꞌ loꞌo adin
pairs.target: Then he came out of the land of the Chaldaeans, and lived in Haran. From there, when his father was dead, God moved him into this land, where you are now living.

pairs.source: Takal inohsit tuang doiꞌ geh tanaꞌ deꞌ topat otoꞌ adin deꞌ ngin Topaꞌ tuduꞌ Abrahamdeꞌ jadin bisaka, pak-e Topaꞌ bijanyi yaꞌ ngin tuduꞌ Abraham duoh onaksukun-e nang Odop-e yaꞌ ngin tanaꞌ daꞌ-a.Takal inoh Abraham aluaꞌ doiꞌonak-e
pairs.target: He gave him no inheritance in it, no, not so much as to set his foot on. He promised that he would give it to him for a possession, and to his offspring after him, when he still had no child.

pairs.source: Topaꞌ moꞌ tanon in-e, ‘Onak sukun muꞌ yaꞌ jadin ulang nog deꞌnupang deꞌ topat basa deꞌ bokon  Nyaꞌa danoꞌ yaꞌ paksa odaꞌ kiloja pak-edoiꞌ pah-a, yohmoꞌ obuah nyiksa sape nog pat latus sowaꞌ
pairs.target: God spoke in this way: that his offspring would live as aliens in a strange land, and that they would be enslaved and mistreated for four hundred years.

pairs.source: Pak-e Okuꞌyaꞌ ngukum basa nyaꞌa deꞌ paksa onak sukun Abraham odaꞌ kiloja, mokuaꞌinoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ buu togan negeli inoh yohmoꞌ paliꞌ nyomah Okuꞌdatiꞌ.’
pairs.target: ‘I will judge the nation to which they will be in bondage,’ said God, ‘and after that will they come out, and serve me in this place.’

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ Topaꞌ bijanyi, Yoh moꞌ mokos janyi-e noh pakai bisunat.Takal onak Abraham deꞌ adon Ishak sinoꞌ-o milaꞌ-e yohmoꞌ bisunat-e takal umul-e aluaꞌ moih onu  Mokuaꞌ inoh, Ishak moꞌ bisunat onak-e deꞌ adonYakub  Wat noh geh Yakub moꞌ bisunat soꞌ simoong duoh onak-e deꞌ jadinsumuk babai otoꞌ ulang Yahudi.
pairs.target: He gave him the covenant of circumcision. So Abraham became the father of Isaac, and circumcised him the eighth day. Isaac became the father of Jacob, and Jacob became the father of the twelve patriarchs.

pairs.source: Sumuk babai otoꞌ siniaꞌ deꞌ Yusuf yohmoꞌ jua Yusuf odaꞌ jadin kuli deꞌdiꞌ nyaꞌa bayal gaji-e tuduꞌ ulang Mesir, pak-e Topaꞌ silalu tulung Yusuf.
pairs.target: “The patriarchs, moved with jealousy against Joseph, sold him into Egypt. God was with him,

pairs.source: Topaꞌ moꞌ pilopas yoh soꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ jolaꞌ yohmoꞌ ngin otin deꞌ paguhduoh bijak, takal yoh ngaduap laja ulang Mesir  Laja ulang Mesir moꞌ pakatyoh odaꞌ jadin gubelnul deꞌ moꞌ nguasa tanaꞌ Mesir duoh nguasa istana laja.
pairs.target: and delivered him out of all his afflictions, and gave him favor and wisdom before Pharaoh, king of Egypt. He made him governor over Egypt and all his house.

pairs.source: Takal nog musim nyaꞌa sotok, mulai soꞌ tanaꞌ Mesir nog tanaꞌ Kanaan,nyaꞌa moꞌ sukup susah idip-e  Sumuk babai otoꞌ moꞌ doiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ man-e.
pairs.target: Now a famine came over all the land of Egypt and Canaan, and great affliction. Our fathers found no food.

pairs.source: Takal Yakub moꞌ ngojit nang deꞌ Mesir ogiꞌ ganum, yohmoꞌ odaꞌ onak deꞌjadin sumuk babai otoꞌ odi kanoꞌ  Takal inoh leh sibungas-e yoh odi kanoꞌ.
pairs.target: But when Jacob heard that there was grain in Egypt, he sent out our fathers the first time.

pairs.source: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ odi keꞌ duwoh sidoh-e, Yusuf moꞌ tanon odop-etuduꞌ madih ayua-e deꞌ munoꞌ nang odop-e leh Yusuf  Takal inoh leh lajaMesir moꞌ puꞌan madih ayua Yusuf
pairs.target: On the second time Joseph was made known to his brothers, and Joseph’s race was revealed to Pharaoh.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yusuf moꞌ sibaya odaꞌsamaꞌ-a baya suaꞌ madih ayua deꞌ ogiꞌ juꞌ puluꞌ limoh naꞌan pinah ke Mesir.
pairs.target: Joseph sent, and summoned Jacob, his father, and all his relatives, seventy-five souls.

pairs.source: Yakub moꞌ pinah keꞌ Mesir, yoh moꞌ loꞌo danoꞌ nog odop-e baya suaꞌonak sukun-e deꞌ jadin sumuk babai otoꞌ kobos
pairs.target: Jacob went down into Egypt, and he died, himself and our fathers,

pairs.source: Tulang-tulang sumukbabai otoꞌ obuah toban paliꞌ ke Sikhem, yohmoꞌ naꞌ daang kubul deꞌ milihAbraham pakai duit pilak  Kubul inoh iyoh milih soꞌ onak-onak Hemor deꞌSikhem.
pairs.target: and they were brought back to Shechem, and laid in the tomb that Abraham bought for a price in silver from the children of Hamor of Shechem.

pairs.source: Takal-e moꞌ sinok onu deꞌ janyi Topaꞌ tuduꞌ Abraham, ulang otoꞌ moꞌbitamah bogoꞌ deꞌ Mesir
pairs.target: “But as the time of the promise came close which God had sworn to Abraham, the people grew and multiplied in Egypt,

pairs.source: Takal bigati laja deꞌ bokon deꞌ militah tanaꞌMesir, yoh diꞌ-e puꞌan osi Yusuf
pairs.target: until there arose a different king, who didn’t know Joseph.

pairs.source: Laja itih moꞌ pakai akal jaꞌat-e tuduꞌbasa otoꞌ duoh iyoh paksa sumuk babai otoꞌ, yoh odaꞌ ngabos onak-onakkuweꞌ, saꞌ ulang otoꞌ diꞌ-e bitamah
pairs.target: The same took advantage of our race, and mistreated our fathers, and forced them to throw out their babies, so that they wouldn’t stay alive.

pairs.source: Takal itih leh sinoꞌ-o milaꞌ Musa,iyoh sukup sangon deꞌ boton Topaꞌ.Taluh bulan geh iyoh obuah somondeꞌ boli pingoma-e
pairs.target: At that time Moses was born, and was exceedingly handsome. He was nourished three months in his father’s house.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh pingoma-e moꞌ posan deꞌ sungi yohmoꞌmaman-e, onak dayung laja ulang Mesir moꞌ mit-e, yoh moꞌ piala odaꞌjadin onak odop-e
pairs.target: When he was thrown out, Pharaoh’s daughter took him up, and reared him as her own son.

pairs.source: Gulu-gulu ulang Mesir ngajal Musa pakai ilmu ulangMesir, takal yoh moꞌ ayuh yoh moꞌ sukup bijak daang pingunang duohpingunai-e.
pairs.target: Moses was instructed in all the wisdom of the Egyptians. He was mighty in his words and works.

pairs.source: Takal umul-e moꞌ pat puluꞌ sowaꞌ, yoh moꞌ ogiꞌ kila-e yaꞌ odi nomimadih ayua-e ulang Israel
pairs.target: But when he was forty years old, it came into his heart to visit his brothers, the children of Israel.

pairs.source: Takal inoh yoh moꞌ ningaꞌ ogiꞌ ulang Israelobuah pijolaꞌ odaꞌ ulang Mesir  Yoh moꞌ lasuꞌ tulung-e, yoh ngabos ulangMesir inoh
pairs.target: Seeing one of them suffer wrong, he defended him, and avenged him who was oppressed, striking the Egyptian.

pairs.source: Baꞌ Musa nang madih ayua-e deꞌ munoꞌ puꞌan nang Topaꞌyaꞌ pakai odop-e ngan-e yaꞌ nyilamat odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, pak-e odop-e deꞌmunoꞌ diꞌ-e puꞌan-e
pairs.target: He supposed that his brothers understood that God, by his hand, was giving them deliverance; but they didn’t understand.

pairs.source: Onu tiaꞌ pagi-e, yoh ningaꞌ lagiꞌ ogiꞌ duwoh naꞌanulang Israel deꞌ bikaꞌi, yohmoꞌ odi niyaꞌ-a, daang sina in-e, ‘Ingan deꞌ mutiꞌaluaꞌ bimadih, oni nai ingan bikaꞌi?’
pairs.target: “The day following, he appeared to them as they fought, and urged them to be at peace again, saying, ‘Sirs, you are brothers. Why do you wrong one another?’

pairs.source: Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ pijolaꞌ dingan-einoh moꞌ tulak Musa, daang-e nang sina, ‘Osi deꞌ moꞌ pakat muꞌu odaꞌjadin pimipin duoh pingadel saꞌan koꞌih?
pairs.target: But he who did his neighbor wrong pushed him away, saying, ‘Who made you a ruler and a judge over us?

pairs.source: Oni keh muꞌu yaꞌ ngabos okuꞌkodaꞌ muꞌu ngabos ulang Mesir inoh sumia-e?’
pairs.target: Do you want to kill me, as you killed the Egyptian yesterday?’

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ yoh ngojit sinanyaꞌa inoh, yoh lasuꞌ bikoduh buu keꞌ tanaꞌ Midian.Yoh loꞌo danoꞌ jadinulang nog  Takal-e danoꞌ leh sowon-e milaꞌ duwoh naꞌan onak dali-e.
pairs.target: Moses fled at this saying, and became a stranger in the land of Midian, where he became the father of two sons.

pairs.source: Takal-e moꞌ pat puluꞌ sowaꞌ yoh loꞌo danoꞌ, Malaikat Topaꞌ moꞌbitanga odop-e tuduꞌ yoh deꞌ padang pasil, deꞌ sinok Dolod Sinai daangsiduduꞌ opui deꞌ man totaꞌ lojaꞌ
pairs.target: “When forty years were fulfilled, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in the wilderness of Mount Sinai, in a flame of fire in a bush.

pairs.source: Musa sukup ilan duoh oniꞌ deꞌ ningaꞌ-einoh, yohmoꞌ odi ningaꞌ soꞌ sinok, yohmoꞌ ngojit sina Topaꞌ tuduꞌ odop-e,in-e,
pairs.target: When Moses saw it, he wondered at the sight. As he came close to see, a voice of the Lord came to him,

pairs.source: ‘Okuꞌ leh Topaꞌ deꞌ nyomah sumuk babai muꞌ; Topaꞌ deꞌ nyomahAbraham, Ishak duoh Yakub.’ Musa lasuꞌ kimotol tolu, yohmoꞌ diꞌ-e bilaniningaꞌ opui inoh
pairs.target: ‘I am the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.’ Moses trembled, and dared not look.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Topaꞌ moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, ‘Pilusut silipal deꞌpakai muꞌ inoh, dop-e topat muꞌ mujuag itih topat deꞌ kakuꞌ Okuꞌ
pairs.target: The Lord said to him, ‘Take off your sandals, for the place where you stand is holy ground.

pairs.source: Okuꞌmoꞌ ningaꞌ umat Kuꞌ deꞌ sukup mun jolaꞌ-e deꞌ Mesir  Okuꞌ moꞌ ngojit puasbogan-e  Okuꞌ moꞌ muun nyilamat odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ  Jaꞌ mey, Okuꞌ yaꞌpait muꞌu keꞌ Mesir.’
pairs.target: I have surely seen the affliction of my people that is in Egypt, and have heard their groaning. I have come down to deliver them. Now come, I will send you into Egypt.’

pairs.source: Musa itih deꞌ moꞌ obuah nulak ulang Israel, takal-e sina, ‘Osi deꞌ pakatingan odaꞌ jadin pimipin duoh pingadel koꞌih?’ Pak-e Musa itih geh deꞌobuah pait Topaꞌ deꞌ jadin pimipin duoh pinyilamat, deꞌ tanon malaikat,takal-e bitanga Odop-e daang siduduꞌ opui deꞌ man totaꞌ lojaꞌ
pairs.target: “This Moses, whom they refused, saying, ‘Who made you a ruler and a judge?’—God has sent him as both a ruler and a deliverer by the hand of the angel who appeared to him in the bush.

pairs.source: Musa itihleh deꞌ moꞌ toban bala deꞌ munoꞌ luah soꞌ Mesir, daang-e bogoꞌ nai oni'pakai kuasa Topaꞌ duoh oniꞌ deꞌ doiꞌ onu nyaꞌa kilin-e deꞌ Mesir, deꞌ LautBiliah duoh deꞌ padang pasil silamaꞌ pat puluꞌ sowaꞌ
pairs.target: This man led them out, having worked wonders and signs in Egypt, in the Red Sea, and in the wilderness for forty years.

pairs.source: Musa itih leh deꞌmoꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ulang Israel, yoh moꞌ in-e, ‘Topaꞌ yaꞌ pakat nabi saꞌaningan soꞌ ulang odop ingan samah kodaꞌ Iyoh pilih okuꞌ.’
pairs.target: This is that Moses, who said to the children of Israel, ‘The Lord our God will raise up a prophet for you from among your brothers, like me.’

pairs.source: Musa itih lehpimipin ulang Israel deꞌ padang pasil, deꞌ tukang tanon sina Topaꞌ takalmalaikat sina duoh-o deꞌ Dolod Sinai  Iyoh leh deꞌ tilimaꞌ sina Topaꞌ deꞌodaꞌ otoꞌ idip, deꞌ odaꞌ tanon tuduꞌ otoꞌ.
pairs.target: This is he who was in the assembly in the wilderness with the angel that spoke to him on Mount Sinai, and with our fathers, who received living revelations to give to us,

pairs.source: Pak-e sumuk babai otoꞌ doliaꞌ-a yaꞌ nunaꞌ pingunang-e duoh nulakodop Musa  Yoh moꞌ yaꞌ paliꞌ keꞌ Mesir
pairs.target: to whom our fathers wouldn’t be obedient, but rejected him, and turned back in their hearts to Egypt,

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ tanontuduꞌ Harun, ‘Nai leh Topaꞌ deꞌ bokon saꞌan koꞌih, saꞌ iyoh leh deꞌ gatiMusa deꞌ nutuan koꞌih buu soꞌ Mesir  Dop-e otoꞌ diꞌ toꞌ puꞌan oni-oni deꞌobuah Musa.’
pairs.target: saying to Aaron, ‘Make us gods that will go before us, for as for this Moses, who led us out of the land of Egypt, we don’t know what has become of him.’

pairs.source: Takal inoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nai tipaduaꞌ onak sapi,yohmo' simoliah binatang kaꞌan-e, duoh nai pesta ngan-e nyomah oniꞌ deꞌnai odop-e
pairs.target: They made a calf in those days, and brought a sacrifice to the idol, and rejoiced in the works of their hands.

pairs.source: Topaꞌ moꞌ togan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, Topaꞌ tanah odaꞌ yohnyomah boton onu, bulan, bitang deꞌ longit, kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nulis nabi-nabidaang buk-e deꞌ noꞌuh-e,‘Oi ulang Israel, silamaꞌ pat puluꞌ sowaꞌ,doiꞌ sidoh ingan simoliah binatang saꞌan Okuꞌ deꞌ jadinpersembahan ingan takal ingan deꞌ padang pasil.
pairs.target: But God turned, and gave them up to serve the army of the sky, as it is written in the book of the prophets, ‘Did you offer to me slain animals and sacrifices forty years in the wilderness, O house of Israel?

pairs.source: Galang topat tipaduaꞌ deꞌ adon Molokhduoh tipaduaꞌ bitang Revan, ingan tawiak toban katiꞌ kanih.Tipaduaꞌ deꞌ nai ingan, inoh leh deꞌ nyomah ingan.Noh leh ngan Okuꞌ yaꞌ tolan ingan juuaꞌ-juuaꞌ-e keꞌumiah negeli Babel.’
pairs.target: You took up the tabernacle of Moloch, the star of your god Rephan, the figures which you made to worship. I will carry you away beyond Babylon.’

pairs.source: Galang topat Topaꞌ nog tuduꞌ manusia, ogiꞌ tuduꞌ sumuk babai otoꞌ deꞌpadang pasil  Galang inoh yoh nai nunaꞌ deꞌ tanon Topaꞌ tuduꞌ Musa samahduoh soto-e deꞌ tanon-e tuduꞌ Musa
pairs.target: “Our fathers had the tabernacle of the testimony in the wilderness, even as he who spoke to Moses commanded him to make it according to the pattern that he had seen;

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh galang itih deꞌ tobansumuk babai otoꞌ takal Yosua odi ngilobut tanaꞌ otoꞌ itih soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌnguasa deꞌ moꞌ kasig Topaꞌ soꞌ jowin otoꞌ  Galang itih ogiꞌ danoꞌ nog jomanDaud
pairs.target: which also our fathers, in their turn, brought in with Joshua when they entered into the possession of the nations, whom God drove out before the face of our fathers, to the days of David,

pairs.source: Daud nyonang otin Topaꞌ, yoh moꞌ mitiaꞌ saꞌ Topaꞌ odaꞌ odop-enai Boli saꞌan Topaꞌ deꞌ nyomah Yakub
pairs.target: who found favor in the sight of God, and asked to find a habitation for the God of Jacob.

pairs.source: Pak-e takal Salomo deꞌ jadinlaja, Salomo moꞌ nai boli saꞌan Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: But Solomon built him a house.

pairs.source: Pak-e Topaꞌ deꞌ Ayuh Kuasa-E diꞌ-e loꞌo deꞌ boli deꞌ nai manusia,dop-e moꞌ ogiꞌ daang buk nabi, in-e,
pairs.target: However, the Most High doesn’t dwell in temples made with hands, as the prophet says,

pairs.source: ‘Siluga topat Kuꞌ militah,duoh tanaꞌ topat Kuꞌ mujuag.Boli deꞌ mun ki deꞌ yaꞌ nai muꞌ saꞌan Okuꞌ?Daki topat soꞌ Okuꞌ yaꞌ loꞌo?
pairs.target: ‘heaven is my throne, and the earth a footstool for my feet. What kind of house will you build me?’ says the Lord. ‘Or what is the place of my rest?

pairs.source: Idoh keh diꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ tongan odop Kuꞌ deꞌ nai?’Inoh leh in sina Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: Didn’t my hand make all these things?’

pairs.source: Stefanus moꞌ sina lagi, “Oi suaꞌ ingan deꞌ kolas otin! Ingan diꞌ-etunuak tuduꞌ Topaꞌ! Kojit ingan tikukuab tuduꞌ pingunang Topaꞌ! Ingansamah kodaꞌ sumuk babai ingan deꞌ lika lawan Iyang Topaꞌ!
pairs.target: “You stiff-necked and uncircumcised in heart and ears, you always resist the Holy Spirit! As your fathers did, so you do.

pairs.source: Podo ogiꞌnabi deꞌ diꞌ sumuk babai ingan pijolaꞌ-a? Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ngabos nyaꞌadeꞌ pait Topaꞌ, deꞌ moꞌ dioꞌ tanon nang ogiꞌ Ulang deꞌ Bonal yaꞌ nog  Adiningan nyelah tuduꞌ musuh-E, ingan moꞌ ngabos-E
pairs.target: Which of the prophets didn’t your fathers persecute? They killed those who foretold the coming of the Righteous One, of whom you have now become betrayers and murderers.

pairs.source: Malaikat-malaikat moꞌtanon ukum-ukum Topaꞌ tuduꞌ ingan deꞌ nulis nabi Musa, pak-e diꞌ ingannunaꞌ-a.”
pairs.target: You received the law as it was ordained by angels, and didn’t keep it!”

pairs.source: Suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ daang Pengadilan Agama inoh moꞌ monam otin-edaang-e malah, takal-e moꞌ ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ tanon Stefanus
pairs.target: Now when they heard these things, they were cut to the heart, and they gnashed at him with their teeth.

pairs.source: Pak-e Stefanusdeꞌ moꞌ obuah nguasa Iyang Topaꞌ moꞌ bigalong keꞌ longit, yohmoꞌ ningaꞌjawaꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ duoh ningaꞌ Yesus mujuag deꞌ topat-e militah nuaꞌ toꞌuhSamaꞌ-a
pairs.target: But he, being full of the Holy Spirit, looked up steadfastly into heaven, and saw the glory of God, and Jesus standing on the right hand of God,

pairs.source: Yohmoꞌ in-e, “Okuꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ longit tibukaꞌ, okuꞌ moꞌ kilinOnak Manusia mujuag nuaꞌ toꞌuh Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: and said, “Behold, I see the heavens opened, and the Son of Man standing at the right hand of God!”

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ moꞌ maput kojit-e daang-e nang bogan-e, yoh moꞌsamah-samah nyelang Stefanus
pairs.target: But they cried out with a loud voice, and stopped their ears, and rushed at him with one accord.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa moꞌ matak toban luah soꞌ kotayohmoꞌ nyokad pakai batuh ngan-e yaꞌ ngabos-e, nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ nyok-e odaꞌjadin tukang tanon moꞌ bukaꞌ jubah-a saꞌ diꞌ-e balut ngan-e nyokad, yohmoꞌposan jubah-a deꞌ sinok poꞌon onak mudaꞌ deꞌ adon Saulus
pairs.target: They threw him out of the city, and stoned him. The witnesses placed their garments at the feet of a young man named Saul.

pairs.source: Daang nyaꞌanyokad-e, Stefanus moꞌ bidoa in-e, “Oi Topaꞌ Yesus, tilimaꞌ leh asong kuꞌ.”
pairs.target: They stoned Stephen as he called out, saying, “Lord Jesus, receive my spirit!”

pairs.source: Daang-e bikunyug iyoh mitiaꞌ pakai sina deꞌ dolas, “Topaꞌ maꞌ yaꞌ odaꞌodop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ yaꞌ nangung dosa itih!” Mokuaꞌ nang sina deꞌ in nohyohmoꞌ lasuꞌ kobos.
pairs.target: He kneeled down, and cried with a loud voice, “Lord, don’t hold this sin against them!” When he had said this, he fell asleep.

pairs.source: Saulus situju takal Stefanus obuah ngabos.  Takal inoh geh ulang-ulang deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus deꞌ Yerusalemobuah pijolaꞌ odaꞌ ulang Yahudi, suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus obuaꞌsobak-sobul buu keꞌ propinsi deꞌ bokon, kodaꞌ Yudea duoh Samaria  Jok-erasul-rasul deꞌ diꞌ-e buu
pairs.target: Saul was consenting to his death. A great persecution arose against the assembly which was in Jerusalem in that day. They were all scattered abroad throughout the regions of Judea and Samaria, except for the apostles.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ moꞌ ngubul Stefanussimadi-e muꞌas-e.
pairs.target: Devout men buried Stephen, and lamented greatly over him.

pairs.source: Pak-e Saulus moꞌ ulih-ulih yaꞌ katuab nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ TopaꞌYesus  Iyoh moꞌ odi keꞌ boli-boli nyaꞌa, yohmoꞌ matak suaꞌ, nyaꞌa bait dalibait dayung deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus yohmoꞌ kibalot kaang jel.
pairs.target: But Saul ravaged the assembly, entering into every house, and dragged both men and women off to prison.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ buu keꞌ topat-topat deꞌ bokon simadi-etanon Gah deꞌ Paguh tentang Topaꞌ Yesus
pairs.target: Therefore those who were scattered abroad went around preaching the word.

pairs.source: Filipus odi keꞌ niꞌ kota deꞌogiꞌ deꞌ Samaria yohmoꞌ tanon tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ danoꞌ silita Laja Pinyilamat.
pairs.target: Philip went down to the city of Samaria, and proclaimed to them the Christ.

pairs.source: Takal nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ moꞌ ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ tanon Filipus duoh ningaꞌ oniꞌdeꞌ nai-e pakai kuasa Topaꞌ bogoꞌ, nyaꞌa deꞌ tibukaꞌ otin-e ngojit oni' deꞌtanon-e
pairs.target: The multitudes listened with one accord to the things that were spoken by Philip, when they heard and saw the signs which he did.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah nguasa muat munua gonan-e inoh moꞌ nangsilais-e takal muat munua inoh luah soꞌ gonan-e  Nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos gonan-eduoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bojang suaꞌ-a obuaꞌ mokuaꞌ
pairs.target: For unclean spirits came out of many of those who had them. They came out, crying with a loud voice. Many who had been paralyzed and lame were healed.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ moꞌsukup doꞌon otin-e.
pairs.target: There was great joy in that city.

pairs.source: Deꞌ kota inoh ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ adon Simon deꞌ moꞌ tuui tukang bidukunnyaꞌa iyoh noh leh deꞌ mudi ulang Samaria nang ponai, Simon moꞌ nangodop-e leh deꞌ jago deꞌ ayuh kuasa-e
pairs.target: But there was a certain man, Simon by name, who used to practice sorcery in the city, and amazed the people of Samaria, making himself out to be some great one,

pairs.source: Mulai soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ timogah nognyaꞌa deꞌ biasa, suaꞌ-e obuaꞌ nunaꞌ iyoh, nyaꞌa moꞌ sina nang, “Iyoh itih,nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ Kuasa Topaꞌ deꞌ nang nyaꞌa Kuasa deꞌ Sukup Ayuh.”
pairs.target: to whom they all listened, from the least to the greatest, saying, “This man is that great power of God.”

pairs.source: Nyaꞌamoꞌ ningaꞌ bonal-bonal-e, dop-e yoh moꞌ tuui odaꞌ kila nyaꞌa danoꞌ munuaspakai kuasa dukun-e
pairs.target: They listened to him, because for a long time he had amazed them with his sorceries.

pairs.source: Pak-e adin odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Gah deꞌPaguh deꞌ tanon Filipus tentang oni wat Topaꞌ jadin Laja saꞌan manusiaduoh tentang Yesus Kristus  Filipus moꞌ baptis odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, bait dalibait dayung
pairs.target: But when they believed Philip preaching good news concerning God’s Kingdom and the name of Jesus Christ, they were baptized, both men and women.

pairs.source: Odop Simon tuang bisayaꞌ geh, iyoh moꞌ obuah baptis,mokuaꞌ inoh iyoh moꞌ nunaꞌ Filipus  Simon moꞌ ilan-e takal iyoh ningaꞌoniꞌ deꞌ nai Filipus pakai kuasa Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: Simon himself also believed. Being baptized, he continued with Philip. Seeing signs and great miracles occurring, he was amazed.

pairs.source: Takal rasul-rasul deꞌ Yerusalem moꞌ ngojit nang ulang-ulang Samariamoꞌ tilimaꞌ pingunang Topaꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ odaꞌ Petrus duohYohanes odi keꞌ topat inoh
pairs.target: Now when the apostles who were at Jerusalem heard that Samaria had received the word of God, they sent Peter and John to them,

pairs.source: Takal Petrus duoh Yohanes moꞌ nog pulouinoh, odop-e deꞌ duwoh moꞌ bidoa kaꞌan ulang Samaria deꞌ munoꞌ saꞌ iyohsoꞌon Iyang Topaꞌ
pairs.target: who, when they had come down, prayed for them, that they might receive the Holy Spirit;

pairs.source: Dop-e Iyang Topaꞌ aluaꞌ diꞌ-e muun deꞌ tun nyaꞌa deꞌmunoꞌ, dop-e nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ jok-e moꞌ obuah baptis daang adon TopaꞌYesus
pairs.target: for as yet he had fallen on none of them. They had only been baptized in the name of Christ Jesus.

pairs.source: Yohmoꞌ soꞌ duwoh odop-e moꞌ naꞌ tongan-e deꞌ tun nyaꞌa deꞌmunoꞌ  Mokuaꞌ inoh Iyang Topaꞌ muun deꞌ tun susuaꞌ odop-e.
pairs.target: Then they laid their hands on them, and they received the Holy Spirit.

pairs.source: Takal Simon moꞌ ningaꞌ nang Iyang Topaꞌ moꞌ muun deꞌ tun nyaꞌadeꞌ munoꞌ odaꞌ Topaꞌ, iyoh moꞌ jugan duit tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ duwoh inoh.
pairs.target: Now when Simon saw that the Holy Spirit was given through the laying on of the apostles’ hands, he offered them money,

pairs.source: Simadi-e sina nang, “Ngin geh tuduꞌ okuꞌ kuasa inoh saꞌ moꞌ nyam okuꞌnaꞌ tongan kuꞌ deꞌ tun nyaꞌa, iyoh dapod tilimaꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: saying, “Give me also this power, that whomever I lay my hands on may receive the Holy Spirit.”

pairs.source: Pak-e Petrus moꞌ nyawot sina-e, “Mutuab leh muꞌu bibaya duoh duitmuꞌ, dop-e muꞌu pikil nang odop muꞌ dapod milih pilasiꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ pakaiduit
pairs.target: But Peter said to him, “May your silver perish with you, because you thought you could obtain the gift of God with money!

pairs.source: Doiꞌ duman muꞌu daang oniꞌ deꞌ nai koꞌih itih, dop-e otin muꞌ diꞌ-etongon deꞌ sulung jowin Topaꞌ
pairs.target: You have neither part nor lot in this matter, for your heart isn’t right before God.

pairs.source: Toganleh olan deꞌ jaꞌat inoh, nyeꞌ moꞌbidoa tuduꞌ Topaꞌ saꞌ Iyoh dapod ngapun otin muꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat noh!
pairs.target: Repent therefore of this, your wickedness, and ask God if perhaps the thought of your heart may be forgiven you.

pairs.source: Dop-eokuꞌ ningaꞌ otin muꞌ bonal-bonal siniaꞌ, muꞌu jok-e pikil duoh nai oniꞌ deꞌjaꞌat.”
pairs.target: For I see that you are in the poison of bitterness and in the bondage of iniquity.”

pairs.source: Simon moꞌ nyawot-e, “Laꞌan ingan yeh bidoa kaꞌan okuꞌ, saꞌ oni deꞌmoꞌ nang muꞌ noh tiꞌ-e diꞌ-e tok obuah okuꞌ.”
pairs.target: Simon answered, “Pray for me to the Lord, that none of the things which you have spoken happen to me.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ odop-e deꞌ duwoh inoh tanon silita Pingunang Topaꞌ, iyohmoꞌ paliꞌ keꞌ Yerusalem  Daang pimonu-e inoh, iyoh nosaꞌ tanon Gah deꞌPaguh deꞌ kupuaꞌ-kupuaꞌ deꞌ Samaria.
pairs.target: They therefore, when they had testified and spoken the word of the Lord, returned to Jerusalem, and preached the Good News to many villages of the Samaritans.

pairs.source: Malaikat Topaꞌ moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Filipus, Yoh moꞌ odaꞌ odi keꞌ olannuaꞌ toꞌuh boton onu tumuꞌ, nunaꞌ olan deꞌ muun soꞌ kota Yerusalem,ke' Gaza, olan inoh doiꞌ nyaꞌa ponu-e
pairs.target: But an angel of the Lord spoke to Philip, saying, “Arise, and go toward the south to the way that goes down from Jerusalem to Gaza. This is a desert.”
He arose and went; and behold, there was a man of Ethiopia, a eunuch of great authority under Candace, queen of the Ethiopians, who was over all her treasure, who had come to Jerusalem to worship.

pairs.source: Filipus moꞌ bilakat ponu keꞌYerusalem, daang pimonu-e Filipus moꞌ ningaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ dali soꞌ negliEtiopia paliꞌ soꞌ Yerusalem keꞌ Etiopia takal-e mokuaꞌ simayang  Nyaꞌainoh pigawai kerajaan deꞌ tukang ngulus duit Kandake, latu ulang Etiopia.Daang pimonu-e paliꞌ inoh yoh guluꞌ deꞌ gilobak deꞌ obuah nalik kuda,yoh basa buk deꞌ nulis nabi Yesaya pakai sina deꞌ jelas
pairs.target: He was returning and sitting in his chariot, and was reading the prophet Isaiah.

pairs.source: Iyang Topaꞌsina tuduꞌ Filipus, “Odi leh sinok gilobak deꞌ matak kuda inoh.”
pairs.target: The Spirit said to Philip, “Go near, and join yourself to this chariot.”

pairs.source: Filipusmoꞌ odi sinok gilobak deꞌ matak kuda inoh, yoh moꞌ ngojit nyaꞌa deꞌ tungilobak inoh basa buk deꞌ nulis Nabi Yesaya  Filipus moꞌ sikian-e, “Puꞌaningan keh idoh loti oniꞌ deꞌ basa ingan inoh?”
pairs.target: Philip ran to him, and heard him reading Isaiah the prophet, and said, “Do you understand what you are reading?”

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa inoh moꞌ nyawot-e, “Oni wat okuꞌ yaꞌ ngiloti-e simoꞌ-o doiꞌnyaꞌa deꞌ tanon loti-e?” Yoh moꞌ odaꞌ Filipus maꞌad guluꞌ sinok odop-e.
pairs.target: He said, “How can I, unless someone explains it to me?” He begged Philip to come up and sit with him.

pairs.source: In tih in ayat deꞌ basa-e,“Iyoh kodaꞌ domba deꞌ matak nyaꞌa takal-e yaꞌ simoliah-e,kodaꞌ onak domba diꞌ-e sowoꞌ takal nyaꞌa ngutin bulun-e,wat inoh leh Iyoh diꞌ-e bukaꞌ bobaꞌ-e.
pairs.target: Now the passage of the Scripture which he was reading was this, “He was led as a sheep to the slaughter. As a lamb before his shearer is silent, so he doesn’t open his mouth.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa pijaꞌat duoh diꞌ-e adil duoh-E.Doiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tapod magah oni wat silita idip-Edop-e nyaꞌa moꞌ numut asong-E soꞌ polong-E.”
pairs.target: In his humiliation, his judgment was taken away. Who will declare His generation? For his life is taken from the earth.”

pairs.source: Pegawai kerajaan soꞌ Etiopia moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Filipus, “Suba tanonloti-e, osi odop-e deꞌ tanon nabi deꞌ in itih, odop-e keh, nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon?”
pairs.target: The eunuch answered Philip, “Who is the prophet talking about? About himself, or about someone else?”

pairs.source: Filipus moꞌ mulai sina pakai ayat deꞌ nulis nabi inoh, yoh moꞌ mulai tanonGah deꞌ Paguh tentang Yesus tuduꞌ iyoh
pairs.target: Philip opened his mouth, and beginning from this Scripture, preached to him about Jesus.

pairs.source: Deꞌ lopot pimonu-e odop-e deꞌmunoꞌ, yohmoꞌ nog topat deꞌ ogiꞌ piꞌin-e, pigawai inoh moꞌ in-e, “Ningaꞌdanoꞌ ogiꞌ piꞌin, tapod yeh muꞌu baptis okuꞌ neh?”
pairs.target: As they went on the way, they came to some water, and the eunuch said, “Behold, here is water. What is keeping me from being baptized?”

pairs.source: Filipus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Moꞌ ingan bisayaꞌ sipunuaꞌ otin ingan, ingansoꞌon baptis.”Yoh moꞌ nyawot Filipus in-e, “Okuꞌ bisayaꞌ Yesus Kristus Onak Topaꞌ!”
pairs.target: And Philip said, If thou dost believe with all thine heart, thou may. And he answered and said, I believe that Jesus Christ is the Son of God.

pairs.source: Yoh moꞌ odaꞌ gilobak loꞌo, Filipus duoh pigawai ayuh inoh moꞌ muunkeꞌ piꞌin, Filipus moꞌ baptis-e
pairs.target: He commanded the chariot to stand still, and they both went down into the water, both Philip and the eunuch, and he baptized him.

pairs.source: Takal yoh maꞌad soꞌ piꞌin, Iyang Topaꞌ moꞌtoban Filipus musuap buu  Daang kila-e deꞌ doon, yoh moꞌ paliꞌ lanyutpimonu-e
pairs.target: When they came up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord caught Philip away, and the eunuch didn’t see him any more, for he went on his way rejoicing.

pairs.source: Tang-tang Filipus moꞌ ningaꞌ odop-e moꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ kota Asdot.Takal yoh nah-nah ponu, suaꞌ topat deꞌ ngilusuꞌ-e yoh tanon Gah deꞌ Paguhsoꞌ Yesus, mulai soꞌ Asdot nog Kaisarea.
pairs.target: But Philip was found at Azotus. Passing through, he preached the Good News to all the cities, until he came to Caesarea.

pairs.source: Takal inoh kila Saulus nyam oniꞌ deꞌ nyouh, ngan-e nalu duoh ngabospinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus, yoh moꞌ odi ngaduap pimipin agama Yahudideꞌ paling ayuh
pairs.target: But Saul, still breathing threats and slaughter against the disciples of the Lord, went to the high priest,

pairs.source: Yohmoꞌ mitiaꞌ sulat kuasa soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ngan-eyaꞌ odi ngaduap pimipin-pimipin boli topat simayang ulang-ulang Yahudideꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ Damsyik, simoꞌ-o ogiꞌ yoh tapod nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesusbait dali bait dayung, yoh tapod takap toban ke Yerusalem.
pairs.target: and asked for letters from him to the synagogues of Damascus, that if he found any who were of the Way, whether men or women, he might bring them bound to Jerusalem.

pairs.source: Daang pimonu-e nuju keꞌ Damsyik, takal iyoh moꞌ sinok kota inoh,tang-tang wat-e ogiꞌ sokad jawaꞌ deꞌ soꞌ longit moꞌ obuah Saulus
pairs.target: As he traveled, he got close to Damascus, and suddenly a light from the sky shone around him.

pairs.source: Iyohmoꞌ labuꞌ keꞌ tanaꞌ yohmoꞌ ngojit kodaꞌ nyaꞌa sina tuduꞌ odop-e, “Saulus,Saulus, oni muꞌu pijolaꞌ Okuꞌ?”
pairs.target: He fell on the earth, and heard a voice saying to him, “Saul, Saul, why do you persecute me?”

pairs.source: Saulus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Osi ingan?” Yoh moꞌ nyawot-e, “Okuꞌ leh Yesusdeꞌ pijolaꞌ muꞌ
pairs.target: He said, “Who are you, Lord?” The Lord said, “I am Jesus, whom you are persecuting.

pairs.source: Pak-e adin mokat mujuag, nyeꞌ moꞌ molot keꞌ kota, danihmoꞌ ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ tanon oni deꞌ yaꞌ nai muꞌu.”
pairs.target: But rise up, and enter into the city, and you will be told what you must do.”

pairs.source: Dingan-dingan Saulus obuaꞌ gogoh daang-e obuaꞌ diꞌ-e ponai sina, yohogiꞌ ngojit sina-e pak-e diꞌ-e kilin polong-e
pairs.target: The men who traveled with him stood speechless, hearing the sound, but seeing no one.

pairs.source: Saulus moꞌ mokat mujuag,yohmoꞌ bukaꞌ boton-e pak-e diꞌ-e ponai ningaꞌ oni-oni-e, dingan-e moꞌkagian tongan-e yoh moꞌ kayak toban keꞌ kota Damsyik
pairs.target: Saul arose from the ground, and when his eyes were opened, he saw no one. They led him by the hand, and brought him into Damascus.

pairs.source: Taluh onu iyohdiꞌ-e ponai ningaꞌ, taluh onu geh yoh diꞌ-e man diꞌ-e nuak.
pairs.target: He was without sight for three days, and neither ate nor drank.

pairs.source: Deꞌ Damsyik ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan pinunaꞌ Topaꞌ Yesus, deꞌ adon Ananias.Jok-e yoh sadiꞌ-e deꞌ kilin Topaꞌ Yesus sina tuduꞌ odop-e, in-E, “Ananias!”Iyoh moꞌ nyawot-e, “Iyoh, itih okuꞌ, Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: Now there was a certain disciple at Damascus named Ananias. The Lord said to him in a vision, “Ananias!” He said, “Behold, it’s me, Lord.”

pairs.source: Topaꞌ moꞌ sina, “Bilakat adin, odi leh keꞌ boli Yudas deꞌ olan deꞌ adonOlan Tongon  Tiaꞌ nyeꞌ sikian nyaꞌa deꞌ adon Saulus, iyoh soꞌ Tarsus, adinyoh aluaꞌ bidoa
pairs.target: The Lord said to him, “Arise, and go to the street which is called Straight, and inquire in the house of Judah for one named Saul, a man of Tarsus. For behold, he is praying,

pairs.source: Saulus moꞌ ningaꞌ oniꞌ kodaꞌ daang pimoh, ogiꞌ nyaꞌadeꞌ adon Ananias nog tuduꞌ odop-e, yoh moꞌ tomaꞌ tun bak-e, saꞌ yoh tapodningaꞌ lagiꞌ.”
pairs.target: and in a vision he has seen a man named Ananias coming in, and laying his hands on him, that he might receive his sight.”

pairs.source: Ananias moꞌ nyawot-e, “Topaꞌ, okuꞌ moꞌ ngojit soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ,yoh itih nyaꞌa deꞌ jaꞌat, bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nunaꞌ Ingan deꞌ Yerusalem deꞌnyiksa-e
pairs.target: But Ananias answered, “Lord, I have heard from many about this man, how much evil he did to your saints at Jerusalem.

pairs.source: Adin yoh moꞌ nog katiꞌ takal-e soꞌon ijin soꞌ pimipin-pimipinagama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh, ngan-e yaꞌ takap suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌIngan.”
pairs.target: Here he has authority from the chief priests to bind all who call on your name.”

pairs.source: Pak-e Topaꞌ moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Ananias, “Odi negeh, Okuꞌ moꞌ nyok iyohodaꞌ jadin tukang layan Okuꞌ, saꞌ-e yoh deꞌ tukang tanon gah Okuꞌ tuduꞌbasa-basa deꞌ bokon, deꞌ diꞌ-e ulang Yahudi, tuduꞌ laja-laja duoh ulangYahudi geh
pairs.target: But the Lord said to him, “Go your way, for he is my chosen vessel to bear my name before the nations and kings, and the children of Israel.

pairs.source: Odop Kuꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ tanon tuduꞌ-e suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ jolaꞌ deꞌ yaꞌkiꞌan-e dop-e ngan-e odaꞌ nyaꞌa puꞌan Okuꞌ.”
pairs.target: For I will show him how many things he must suffer for my name’s sake.”

pairs.source: Ananias moꞌ odi keꞌ boli deꞌ tanon Topaꞌ tuduꞌ-e, yoh moꞌ tomaꞌ bungbak Saulus  Ananias moꞌ sina, “Madih kuꞌ Saulus, Topaꞌ Yesus deꞌ bitangaodop-E tuduꞌ muꞌu deꞌ lopot olan takal muꞌu yaꞌ odi katiꞌ, Iyoh leh deꞌ moꞌodaꞌ okuꞌ odi tuduꞌ muꞌu saꞌ muꞌu tapod ningaꞌ lagi duoh obuah nguasaIyang Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: Ananias departed, and entered into the house. Laying his hands on him, he said, “Brother Saul, the Lord, who appeared to you on the road by which you came, has sent me, that you may receive your sight, and be filled with the Holy Spirit.”

pairs.source: Takal inoh geh oniꞌ deꞌ kodaꞌ nap ikian deꞌ nutu boton-elasuꞌ tikadi  Iyoh moꞌ lasuꞌ ponai ningaꞌ lagiꞌ  Saulus moꞌ mokat, mokuaꞌinoh Ananias moꞌ baptis-e
pairs.target: Immediately something like scales fell from his eyes, and he received his sight. He arose and was baptized.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh, iyoh moꞌ man iyoh moꞌ paliꞌsehat. Saulus moꞌ loꞌo kudu-kudu onu-e duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus deꞌDamsyik
pairs.target: He took food and was strengthened. Saul stayed several days with the disciples who were at Damascus.

pairs.source: Yohmoꞌ lasuꞌ odi keꞌ boli-boli topat simayang, yohmoꞌ tanonnang Yesus inoh Onak Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: Immediately in the synagogues he proclaimed the Christ, that he is the Son of God.

pairs.source: Susuaꞌ nyaꞌa ilan ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ nang Saulus, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌin-e, “Bah idoh diꞌ-e yoh deꞌ ngabos suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus deꞌYerusalem neh? Yoh nog katiꞌ ngan-e yaꞌ takap nyaꞌa duoh toban tuduꞌpimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh!”
pairs.target: All who heard him were amazed, and said, “Isn’t this he who in Jerusalem made havoc of those who called on this name? And he had come here intending to bring them bound before the chief priests!”

pairs.source: Pak-e Saulus ponai odaꞌ nyaꞌa lobih bisayaꞌ pakai bukti-bukti deꞌtanon-e, nang Yesus inoh leh Laja pinyilamat, ngan ulang-ulang Yahudideꞌ loꞌo deꞌ Damsyik diꞌ-e tapod yaꞌ nulak-e
pairs.target: But Saul increased more in strength, and confounded the Jews who lived at Damascus, proving that this is the Christ.

pairs.source: Kudu-kudu onu mokuaꞌ inoh, ulang Yahudi moꞌ bipokat yaꞌ ngabosSaulus
pairs.target: When many days were fulfilled, the Jews conspired together to kill him,

pairs.source: Pak-e Saulus moꞌ dioꞌ puꞌan oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ  Singonu singalomnyaꞌa nguan deꞌ bolot tiban kota, ngan-e yaꞌ ngabos Saulus
pairs.target: but their plot became known to Saul. They watched the gates both day and night that they might kill him,

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ ngalom-etakal nyaꞌa deꞌ nunaꞌ Saulus moꞌ odi mit-e, yoh moꞌ pimuun-e keꞌ sopaꞌ soꞌtun ijuam kota deꞌ pakai batuh, daang bakul.
pairs.target: but his disciples took him by night, and let him down through the wall, lowering him in a basket.

pairs.source: Saulus moꞌ buu keꞌ Yerusalem, yoh moꞌ bikuluk duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌYesus deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ Yerusalem, pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ tolu daꞌ-e  Dop-e odop-edeꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ nang Saulus noh tok-tok moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: When Saul had come to Jerusalem, he tried to join himself to the disciples; but they were all afraid of him, not believing that he was a disciple.

pairs.source: Barnabas moꞌ odi tuduꞌ-e, yoh moꞌ toban tuduꞌ rasul-rasul  Barnabas moꞌsilita tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, oni wat Saulus bitapod duoh Topaꞌ, daangpimonu-e deꞌ lopot olan, duoh oni wat Topaꞌ sina duoh-e  Barnabas moꞌtanon nang Saulus moꞌ bilani ngajal nyaꞌa deꞌ Damsyik daang adon Yesus.
pairs.target: But Barnabas took him, and brought him to the apostles, and declared to them how he had seen the Lord on the way, and that he had spoken to him, and how at Damascus he had preached boldly in the name of Jesus.

pairs.source: Saulus loꞌo tikuluk duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, yoh diꞌ-e tolu ngajal nyaꞌadaang adon Topaꞌ deꞌ suaꞌ topat deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ Yerusalem
pairs.target: He was with them entering into Jerusalem,

pairs.source: Iyoh sina daang-ebikalah duoh ulang Yahudi deꞌ pakai sina ulang Yunani, yoh ngan odop-edeꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ kagaꞌ yaꞌ ngabos Saulus
pairs.target: preaching boldly in the name of the Lord Jesus. He spoke and disputed against the Hellenists, but they were seeking to kill him.

pairs.source: Takal nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌYesus deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ puꞌan nang nyaꞌa yaꞌ ngabos Saulus, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌmoꞌ toban Saulus keꞌ Kaisarea, mokuaꞌ inoh yohmoꞌ katod keꞌ Tarsus.
pairs.target: When the brothers knew it, they brought him down to Caesarea, and sent him off to Tarsus.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus deꞌ propinsi Yudea, propinsiGalilea duoh propinsi Samaria moꞌ bidanah  Makin tuui makin bogoꞌ nyaꞌamoꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ Yesus, dop-e Iyang Topaꞌ deꞌ tulung odop-e deꞌmunoꞌ  Suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ idip taat nyomah Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: So the assemblies throughout all Judea and Galilee and Samaria had peace, and were built up. They were multiplied, walking in the fear of the Lord and in the comfort of the Holy Spirit.

pairs.source: Petrus odi katiꞌ kanih bidapod duoh uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌYesus  Ogiꞌ onu takal inoh iyoh odi bidapod duoh uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌdeꞌ kota Lida
pairs.target: As Peter went throughout all those parts, he came down also to the saints who lived at Lydda.

pairs.source: Danoꞌ iyoh bitapod duoh niꞌ naꞌan dali deꞌ adon Eneas, deꞌ kobos gonan-e, moꞌ moih sowaꞌ diꞌ-e taan mokat soꞌ topat boꞌos-e.
pairs.target: There he found a certain man named Aeneas, who had been bedridden for eight years, because he was paralyzed.

pairs.source: Petrus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, “Eneas, Yesus Kristus odaꞌ muꞌu mokuaꞌ! Mokatleh duoh ponyap leh topat boꞌos muꞌ!” Takal inoh geh Eneas moꞌ ponaimokat
pairs.target: Peter said to him, “Aeneas, Jesus Christ heals you. Get up and make your bed!” Immediately he arose.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ loꞌo deꞌ kota Lida duoh tanaꞌ labak Saron moꞌningaꞌ Eneas  Yohmoꞌ suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: All who lived at Lydda and in Sharon saw him, and they turned to the Lord.

pairs.source: Deꞌ kota Yope ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan dayung deꞌ adon Tabita, iyoh ulang deꞌbisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus  (Deꞌ adon-e geh Dorkas, daang sina ulang Yunani loti-elusaꞌ.) Iyoh mala nai oni' deꞌ paguh, duoh tulung ulang-ulang deꞌ sotok.
pairs.target: Now there was at Joppa a certain disciple named Tabitha, which when translated, means Dorcas. This woman was full of good works and acts of mercy which she did.

pairs.source: Takal inoh iyoh moꞌ obuah onam deꞌ odaꞌ iyoh kobos  Mokuaꞌ nyaꞌamamuh todang-e nyaꞌa moꞌ piguling daang bilit-e deꞌ longah
pairs.target: In those days, she became sick, and died. When they had washed her, they laid her in an upper room.

pairs.source: Kota Lidadiꞌ-e juuaꞌ soꞌ kota Yope  Takal pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus moꞌ ngojit Petrusogiꞌ deꞌ Lida, nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ odaꞌ duwoh naꞌan nyaꞌa odi nusudPetrus, yoh moꞌ sibaya in-e, “Odaꞌ yoh likas nog katiꞌ.”
pairs.target: As Lydda was near Joppa, the disciples, hearing that Peter was there, sent two men to him, imploring him not to delay in coming to them.

pairs.source: Takal odop-edeꞌ munoꞌ tanon sibaya inoh tuduꞌ Petrus, Petrus lasuꞌ mokat ponu nunaꞌodop-e deꞌ munoꞌ  Takal yoh moꞌ nog kanoꞌ yoh lasuꞌ toban iyoh keꞌ bilitDorkas deꞌ longah  Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ janda moꞌ ngubun Petrus daang-e siꞌiansimadi-e tanon bojuh-bojuh duoh jubah-jubah deꞌ nai Dorkas saꞌan-e takalyoh aluaꞌ idip
pairs.target: Peter got up and went with them. When he had come, they brought him into the upper room. All the widows stood by him weeping, and showing the coats and garments which Dorcas had made while she was with them.

pairs.source: Petrus moꞌ odaꞌ suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ luah, yoh moꞌbikunyug daang-e bidoa, mokuaꞌ inoh yoh moꞌ kos odop-e nuaꞌ todangDorkas, daang-e sina, “Tabita mokat mey!” Dorkas moꞌ lasuꞌ bukaꞌ boton-e,takal yoh ningaꞌ Petrus yoh moꞌ lasuꞌ mokat gulu'
pairs.target: Peter sent them all out, and knelt down and prayed. Turning to the body, he said, “Tabitha, get up!” She opened her eyes, and when she saw Peter, she sat up.

pairs.source: Petrus moꞌ kagiantongan-e, yoh moꞌ tulung odaꞌ mokat mujuag  Mokuaꞌ inoh Petrus moꞌmogan nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ duoh ayua janda deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ, yoh moꞌ odaꞌningaꞌ Dorkas deꞌ moꞌ paliꞌ idip
pairs.target: He gave her his hand, and raised her up. Calling the saints and widows, he presented her alive.

pairs.source: Gah Dorkas deꞌ paliꞌ idip, moꞌ obuahkapah katiꞌ kanih' deꞌ kota Yope  Yohleh ngan-e bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌtuduꞌ Yesus deꞌ jadin Laja Pinyilamat saꞌan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ
pairs.target: And it became known throughout all Joppa, and many believed in the Lord.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌinoh, Petrus moꞌ loꞌo kudu-kudu onu-e deꞌ kota Yope, deꞌ boli nyaꞌa deꞌadon Simon, deꞌ tukang nai bilulang soꞌ kulit binatang.
pairs.target: He stayed many days in Joppa with a tanner named Simon.

pairs.source: Deꞌ Kaisarea ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ adon Kornelius, piayuh Pasukan SidaduItalia
pairs.target: Now there was a certain man in Caesarea, Cornelius by name, a centurion of what was called the Italian Regiment,

pairs.source: Iyoh ulang deꞌ taat, suaꞌ odop-e daang boli-e nyomah tuduꞌTopaꞌ  Iyoh bogoꞌ tulung ulang-ulang Yahudi deꞌ botak, iyoh silalu bidoatuduꞌ Topaꞌ
pairs.target: a devout man, and one who feared God with all his house, who gave gifts for the needy generously to the people, and always prayed to God.

pairs.source: Kila-kila pukul taluh ngumi, Kornelius ningaꞌ oniꞌ kodaꞌdaang pimoh, ogiꞌ malaikat Topaꞌ tok nog tuduꞌ-e duoh mogan odop-e.
pairs.target: At about the ninth hour of the day, he clearly saw in a vision an angel of God coming to him, and saying to him, “Cornelius!”

pairs.source: Kornelius moꞌ ningaꞌ malaikat simadi-e tolu, yoh moꞌ sina, “Oni deꞌyaꞌ tanon ingan tuduꞌ okuꞌ?”Malaikat moꞌ nyawot-e, “Topaꞌ munuas ngojit doa muꞌ duoh pilasiꞌ deꞌngin muꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ botak  Topaꞌ diꞌ-e komut-e
pairs.target: He, fastening his eyes on him, and being frightened, said, “What is it, Lord?” He said to him, “Your prayers and your gifts to the needy have gone up for a memorial before God.

pairs.source: Adin odaꞌ nyaꞌaodi keꞌ kota Yope nusud nyaꞌa deꞌ adon Simon deꞌ sobot nyaꞌa geh nangPetrus
pairs.target: Now send men to Joppa, and get Simon, who is also called Peter.

pairs.source: Iyoh ngilumon deꞌ boli nyaꞌa deꞌ tukang kiloja nai bilulang soꞌkulit binatang deꞌ adon Simon, boli-e deꞌ sinok pang laut.”
pairs.target: He lodges with a tanner named Simon, whose house is by the seaside.

pairs.source: Takal Malaikatdeꞌ sina duoh Kornelius moꞌ buu, Kornelius moꞌ mogan duwoh naꞌan kuli-edaang boli-e duoh niꞌ naꞌan sidadu-e deꞌ taat tuduꞌ Topaꞌ
pairs.target: When the angel who spoke to him had departed, Cornelius called two of his household servants and a devout soldier of those who waited on him continually.

pairs.source: Kornelius moꞌsilita oniꞌ deꞌ ningaꞌ duoh deꞌ ngojit-e, yoh moꞌ odaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ odikeꞌ Yope.
pairs.target: Having explained everything to them, he sent them to Joppa.

pairs.source: Onu tiaꞌ pagi-e, kila-kila uun onu, takal odop-e deꞌ taluh inoh moꞌyaꞌ nog keꞌ Yope, Petrus maꞌad keꞌ longah yaꞌ bidoa
pairs.target: Now on the next day as they were on their journey, and got close to the city, Peter went up on the housetop to pray at about noon.

pairs.source: Iyoh moꞌ ngoontoꞌin-e pilai daang-e yaꞌ man nyam-e, pak-e nyaꞌa julah-e nai pinguman.Yohmoꞌ ningaꞌ oni' deꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ kodaꞌ nyaꞌa pimoh
pairs.target: He became hungry and desired to eat, but while they were preparing, he fell into a trance.

pairs.source: Yoh moꞌ ningaꞌlongit tibukaꞌ, yoh moꞌ kilin amal kain deꞌ ayuh deꞌ obuah mokos soꞌ patsikojit-e deꞌ pimuun soꞌ longit pakai tolin keꞌ tanaꞌ
pairs.target: He saw heaven opened and a certain container descending to him, like a great sheet let down by four corners on the earth,

pairs.source: Daang amal kain inohogiꞌ bogoꞌ pasia binatang, ogiꞌ deꞌ pat poꞌon-e, ogiꞌ deꞌ ponu pakai bigasaktoꞌin-e, duoh pasia-pasia manuk
pairs.target: in which were all kinds of four-footed animals of the earth, wild animals, reptiles, and birds of the sky.

pairs.source: Iyoh moꞌ ngojit nyaꞌa sina tuduꞌ odop-e,“Oi Petrus, mokat, simoliah leh binatang deꞌ munoꞌ, nyeꞌ moꞌ man-e!”
pairs.target: A voice came to him, “Rise, Peter, kill and eat!”

pairs.source: Pak-e Petrus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Doliaꞌ kuꞌ Topaꞌ, dop-e aluaꞌ doiꞌ sidohkuꞌ man oniꞌ deꞌ polih duoh oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ-e bisig nunaꞌ agama koꞌih ulangYahudi”
pairs.target: But Peter said, “Not so, Lord; for I have never eaten anything that is common or unclean.”

pairs.source: Pak-e yoh moꞌ ngojit lagiꞌ sina inoh, “Moꞌ Topaꞌ nang diꞌ-e polihmaꞌ tiyaꞌ muꞌu nang polih.”
