pairs.target: A voice came to him again the second time, “What God has cleansed, you must not call unclean.”

pairs.source: Oniꞌ deꞌ jok-e sadiꞌ-e kilin-e tonga nog taluhsidoh, mokuaꞌ inoh kain inoh moꞌ paliꞌ tipaꞌad keꞌ longit.
pairs.target: This was done three times, and immediately the vessel was received up into heaven.

pairs.source: Petrus ilan daang-e pikil oni loti oniꞌ deꞌ kilin-e inoh  Takal-e aluaꞌbipikil, nyaꞌa deꞌ taluh deꞌ odaꞌ Kornelius odi nusud moꞌ dapod boli Simon,odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ mujuag deꞌ bolot tiban-e
pairs.target: Now while Peter was very perplexed in himself what the vision which he had seen might mean, behold, the men who were sent by Cornelius, having made inquiry for Simon’s house, stood before the gate,

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌmogan nyaꞌa, yoh moꞌ sikian in-e, “Ogiꞌ yeh nyaꞌa deꞌ ngilumon datiꞌ deꞌadon Simon Petrus?”
pairs.target: and called and asked whether Simon, who was also called Peter, was lodging there.

pairs.source: Takal Petrus aluaꞌ pikil oni loti oniꞌ deꞌ ningaꞌ-e sadiꞌ-e, Iyang Topaꞌmoꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, “Oi Petrus ogiꞌ taluh naꞌan nyaꞌa kalik muꞌu
pairs.target: While Peter was pondering the vision, the Spirit said to him, “Behold, three  men seek you.

pairs.source: Mokat leh,nyeꞌ moꞌ muun keꞌ douꞌ nyeꞌ moꞌ nunaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, maꞌ tolu-puusdop-e Okuꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ iyoh odi katiꞌ.”
pairs.target: But arise, get down, and go with them, doubting nothing; for I have sent them.”

pairs.source: Petrus moꞌ muun tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌmunoꞌ, yohmoꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Okuꞌ leh Petrus deꞌ ingankalik  Oni nai ingan kalik okuꞌ?”
pairs.target: Peter went down to the men, and said, “Behold, I am he whom you seek. Why have you come?”

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-e, “Piayuh sidadu deꞌ adon Kornelius,nyaꞌa deꞌ nang ulang Yahudi timogah paguh duoh taat tuduꞌ Topaꞌ  MalaikatTopaꞌ moꞌ nog tuduꞌ-e, yohmoꞌ odaꞌ nusud ingan odi keꞌ boli-e saꞌ-e ngojitoniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ tanon ingan tuduꞌ-e.”
pairs.target: They said, “Cornelius, a centurion, a righteous man and one who fears God, and well spoken of by all the nation of the Jews, was directed by a holy angel to invite you to his house, and to listen to what you say.”

pairs.source: Petrus moꞌ odaꞌ odop-e taluh inohmolot, yoh moꞌ odaꞌ ngilumon danoꞌ duoh odop-e.Tiaꞌ pagi-e Petrus moꞌ mokat, yoh moꞌ odi samah-samah duoh odop-edeꞌ munoꞌ  Kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus deꞌ soꞌ Yopesuwaꞌ odi.
pairs.target: So he called them in and provided a place to stay. On the next day Peter arose and went out with them, and some of the brothers from Joppa accompanied him.

pairs.source: Onu deꞌ nikan-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nog keꞌ Kaisarea  Danoꞌ Korneliusmoꞌ kajon odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ duoh madih ayua-e, duoh dingan-dingan sinok-e,deꞌ moꞌ ngunang odaꞌ keꞌ boli-e
pairs.target: On the next day they entered into Caesarea. Cornelius was waiting for them, having called together his relatives and his near friends.

pairs.source: Takal Petrus moꞌ nog, Kornelius moꞌnog nyamut-e daang-e nungang nog oloꞌ-e nyatuak ke tanaꞌ ngan-e nyomahPetrus
pairs.target: When Peter entered, Cornelius met him, fell down at his feet, and worshiped him.

pairs.source: Pak-e Petrus pakat odaꞌ yoh mujuag, daang-e in-e, “Mokat maꞌwat inoh, okuꞌ tuang manusia kodaꞌ muꞌu geh.”
pairs.target: But Peter raised him up, saying, “Stand up! I myself am also a man.”

pairs.source: Simadi-e sina duohKornelius, Petrus molot kaang boli  Danoꞌ yoh moꞌ ningaꞌ nyaꞌa bogoꞌ deꞌtikuluk
pairs.target: As he talked with him, he went in and found many gathered together.

pairs.source: Yohmoꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Madih ayua, ingan tuangpuꞌan geh nang agama ulang Yahudi jaman odaꞌ koꞌih odi nomi nyaꞌa duohbidingan tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e ulang Yahudi  Pak-e Topaꞌ moꞌ tanon tuduꞌokuꞌ diꞌ soꞌon nyeꞌ yaꞌ nang bangsa deꞌ bokon koꞌis duoh polih
pairs.target: He said to them, “You yourselves know how it is an unlawful thing for a man who is a Jew to join himself or come to one of another nation, but God has shown me that I shouldn’t call any man unholy or unclean.

pairs.source: Inoh lehtakal ingan odaꞌ okuꞌ nog, okuꞌ odi diꞌ kuꞌ nulak-e  Adin okuꞌ yaꞌ puꞌan oninai ingan odaꞌ okuꞌ nog katiꞌ.”
pairs.target: Therefore also I came without complaint when I was sent for. I ask therefore, why did you send for me?”

pairs.source: Kornelius moꞌ nyawot-e, “Pat onu deꞌ dioꞌ, onu wat adin geh, pukultaluh takal kuꞌ bidoa deꞌ boli kuꞌ, tang-tang ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ dali mujuag deꞌsulung jowin kuꞌ, pimakai-e bikilap
pairs.target: Cornelius said, “Four days ago, I was fasting until this hour, and at the ninth hour, I prayed in my house, and behold, a man stood before me in bright clothing,

pairs.source: Yohmoꞌ sina, ‘Kornelius! Topaꞌ moꞌmunuas ngojit doa muꞌ duoh pilasiꞌ deꞌ ngin muꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ botak.Topaꞌ diꞌ-e komut-e
pairs.target: and said, ‘Cornelius, your prayer is heard, and your gifts to the needy are remembered in the sight of God.

pairs.source: Odaꞌ leh nyaꞌa odi keꞌ Yope, mogan nyaꞌa deꞌ adonSimon Petrus, deꞌ ngilumon deꞌ boli nyaꞌa deꞌ tukang nai bilulang soꞌ kulitbinatang deꞌ adon Simon, boli-e deꞌ sinok pang laut.’
pairs.target: Send therefore to Joppa, and summon Simon, who is also called Peter. He lodges in the house of a tanner named Simon, by the seaside. When he comes, he will speak to you.’

pairs.source: Noh leh ngan okuꞌlasuꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa nusud ingan, daang sonang otin ingan moꞌ nog katiꞌ, adinsuaꞌ koꞌih moꞌ tikuluk datiꞌ deꞌ jowin Topaꞌ ngan koꞌih yaꞌ ngojit suaꞌ oniꞌdeꞌ tanon Topaꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ ingan tanon tuduꞌ koꞌih.”
pairs.target: Therefore I sent to you at once, and it was good of you to come. Now therefore we are all here present in the sight of God to hear all things that have been commanded you by God.”

pairs.source: Petrus moꞌ sina, in-e, “Adin ke kuꞌ puꞌan-e, deꞌ jowin Topaꞌ suaꞌ bangsasamah
pairs.target: Peter opened his mouth and said, “Truly I perceive that God doesn’t show favoritism;

pairs.source: Susuaꞌ bangsa deꞌ taat tuduꞌ Topaꞌ duoh nai oniꞌ deꞌ bonal Topaꞌtilimaꞌ-e, iyoh soꞌ bangsa ki sijaꞌ-e
pairs.target: but in every nation he who fears him and works righteousness is acceptable to him.

pairs.source: Inoh leh Gah deꞌ Paguh deꞌ odaꞌ-eokuꞌ tanon-e tuduꞌ ulang Israel  Noh leh Gah deꞌ Paguh deꞌ moꞌ odaꞌ otoꞌbidamai duoh Topaꞌ pakai odop Yesus  Iyohleh Topaꞌ saꞌan suaꞌ nyaꞌa.
pairs.target: The word which he sent to the children of Israel, preaching good news of peace by Jesus Christ—he is Lord of all—

pairs.source: Ingan moꞌ puꞌan suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ jadi deꞌ suaꞌ negeli ulang Israel, mulaisoꞌ Galilea, takal Yohanes moꞌ tanon odaꞌ nyaꞌa baptis
pairs.target: you yourselves know what happened, which was proclaimed throughout all Judea, beginning from Galilee, after the baptism which John preached;

pairs.source: Ingan moꞌ puꞌannang Topaꞌ moꞌ pilih Yesus ulang Nazaret, Yoh moꞌ ngin Iyang Topaꞌ duohkuasa tuduꞌ-E  Ingan tuang moꞌ puꞌan nang Yesus odi katiꞌ kanih nai oniꞌdeꞌ paguh  Iyoh moꞌ pilopas suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nguasa Laja muat munua, dop-eIyoh ogiꞌ kuasa Topaꞌ daꞌ-a
pairs.target: even Jesus of Nazareth, how God anointed him with the Holy Spirit and with power, who went about doing good and healing all who were oppressed by the devil, for God was with him.

pairs.source: Koꞌih deꞌ mutiꞌ leh deꞌ ningaꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌnai-e deꞌ kota Yerusalem, duoh suaꞌ propinsi Yudea  Pak-e ulang-ulangYahudi moꞌ ngabos-e pakai masak tongan poꞌon-e deꞌ tun salip
pairs.target: We are witnesses of everything he did both in the country of the Jews, and in Jerusalem; whom they also killed, hanging him on a tree.

pairs.source: Pak-e onukeꞌ taluh-e Topaꞌ moꞌ odaꞌ paliꞌ idip soꞌ kobos-e, yohmoꞌ bitanga Odop-E,
pairs.target: God raised him up the third day, and gave him to be revealed,

pairs.source: Jok-e tuduꞌ koꞌih deꞌ moꞌ dioꞌ-e pilih-E odaꞌ jadin tukang tanon gahIyoh  Koꞌih leh deꞌ moꞌ man-nuak duoh-E takal-e moꞌ paliꞌ idip soꞌ kobos-e.
pairs.target: not to all the people, but to witnesses who were chosen before by God, to us, who ate and drank with him after he rose from the dead.

pairs.source: Iyoh moꞌ odaꞌ koꞌih tanon Gah deꞌ Paguh inoh tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa, yohmoꞌmoꞌ tanon nang Iyoh leh deꞌ pakat Topaꞌ jadin tukang ngituang nyaꞌa deꞌidip duoh deꞌ kobos
pairs.target: He commanded us to preach to the people and to testify that this is he who is appointed by God as the Judge of the living and the dead.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ nabi moꞌ dioꞌ tanon tentang Yesus, nyaꞌa deꞌmunoꞌ moꞌ in-e, ‘Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus obuah ngapun dosa-e,odaꞌ kuasa Yesus.’ ”
pairs.target: All the prophets testify about him, that through his name everyone who believes in him will receive remission of sins.”

pairs.source: Takal Petrus aluaꞌ sina, Iyang Topaꞌ moꞌ muun nguasa susuaꞌ nyaꞌadeꞌ ngojit gah inoh
pairs.target: While Peter was still speaking these words, the Holy Spirit fell on all those who heard the word.

pairs.source: Ulang-ulang Yahudi deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus yohmoꞌnunaꞌ Petrus soꞌ Yope, suaꞌ-suaꞌ-a ilan ningaꞌ Topaꞌ ngin Iyang-E tuduꞌ basadeꞌ diꞌ-e ulang Yahudi
pairs.target: They of the circumcision who believed were amazed, as many as came with Peter, because the gift of the Holy Spirit was also poured out on the Gentiles.

pairs.source: Dop-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngojit nyaꞌa sinapakai sina nyaꞌa deꞌ aluaꞌ doiꞌ onu-e bilajal-e, yoh moꞌ mudi Topaꞌ  Petrusmoꞌ sina',
pairs.target: For they heard them speaking in other languages and magnifying God. Then Peter answered,

pairs.source: “Suba ningaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ mutiꞌ moꞌ soꞌon Iyang Topaꞌ samahkodaꞌ otoꞌ  Adin doiꞌ tiyaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tapod yaꞌ jaman koꞌih baptis odop-edeꞌ mutiꞌ pakai piꞌin.”
pairs.target: “Can anyone forbid these people from being baptized with water? They have received the Holy Spirit just like us.”

pairs.source: Petrus moꞌ mitiaꞌ odaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ baptis daang adon Yesus Kristus  Mokuaꞌ inoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ mitiaꞌ odaꞌPetrus loꞌo kudu-kudu onu-e duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: He commanded them to be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ. Then they asked him to stay some days.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ rasul duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ propinsiYudea moꞌ ngojit nang nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e ulang Yahudi tuang moꞌtilimaꞌ Pingunang Topaꞌ
pairs.target: Now the apostles and the brothers who were in Judea heard that the Gentiles had also received the word of God.

pairs.source: Takal Petrus odi keꞌ Yerusalem, danoꞌ ogiꞌulang-ulang Yahudi deꞌ moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus deꞌ aluaꞌ kagong adatbisunat moꞌ diꞌ-e tilimaꞌ oni deꞌ nai Petrus
pairs.target: When Peter had come up to Jerusalem, those who were of the circumcision contended with him,

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sina,“Oni nai muꞌ odi keꞌ boli nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e bangsa otoꞌ ulang Yahudi? Muꞌutikuluk man samah-samah duoh-o lagiꞌ!”
pairs.target: saying, “You went in to uncircumcised men, and ate with them!”

pairs.source: Inoh leh ngan Petrus moꞌ tanontuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ jadi soꞌ puꞌun-e nog piobuaꞌ-e.
pairs.target: But Peter began, and explained to them in order, saying,

pairs.source: Yoh moꞌ in-e, “Takal kuꞌ aluaꞌ bidoa deꞌ kota Yope okuꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌoni' deꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ kodaꞌ daang pimoh  Okuꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ amal kain deꞌ ayuhdeꞌ obuah mokos soꞌ pat sikojit-e deꞌ pimuun soꞌ longit pakai tolin keꞌtanaꞌ, yohmoꞌ loꞌo deꞌ sulung jowin kuꞌ
pairs.target: “I was in the city of Joppa praying, and in a trance I saw a vision: a certain container descending, like it was a great sheet let down from heaven by four corners. It came as far as me.

pairs.source: Takal okuꞌ ningaꞌ daang-e, ogiꞌbipasia-pasia binatang deꞌ pat poꞌon-e deꞌ diꞌ nyaꞌa piala-e duoh binatangdeꞌ pimonu-e pakai gasak soduaꞌ-e duoh bipasia-pasia manuk deꞌ polihulang Yahudi man-e
pairs.target: When I had looked intently at it, I considered, and saw the four-footed animals of the earth, wild animals, creeping things, and birds of the sky.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ moꞌ ngojit ogiꞌ nyaꞌa sina tuduꞌ okuꞌ, ‘Petrusmokat mey! Mit simoliah leh binatang deꞌ mutiꞌ nyeꞌ moꞌ man-e.’
pairs.target: I also heard a voice saying to me, ‘Rise, Peter, kill and eat!’

pairs.source: Pak-eokuꞌ moꞌ nyawot-e, ‘Idoh Topaꞌ, dop-e okuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ man oniꞌ deꞌ polih duohoniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ-e bisig.’
pairs.target: But I said, ‘Not so, Lord, for nothing unholy or unclean has ever entered into my mouth.’

pairs.source: Pak-e duwoh sidoh sina deꞌ soꞌ siluga inoh tanon tuduꞌokuꞌ, ‘Takal Topaꞌ nang diꞌ-e polih maꞌ tiyaꞌ muꞌu yaꞌ nang polih!’
pairs.target: But a voice answered me the second time out of heaven, ‘What God has cleansed, don’t you call unclean.’

pairs.source: Oniꞌdeꞌ bitanga-e inoh nog taluh sidoh, mokuaꞌ inoh yohmoꞌ paliꞌ tipaꞌad keꞌlongit
pairs.target: This was done three times, and all were drawn up again into heaven.

pairs.source: Takal inoh geh ogiꞌ taluh naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ soꞌ Kaisarea mujuag deꞌjowin boli topat koꞌih ngilumon, nyaꞌa deꞌ odaꞌ-e odi kalik okuꞌ
pairs.target: Behold, immediately three men stood before the house where I was, having been sent from Caesarea to me.

pairs.source: Takalinoh Iyang Topaꞌ moꞌ odaꞌ okuꞌ odi duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, diꞌ kuꞌ tiaꞌtolu-puus  Soꞌ nuam odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nunaꞌ okuꞌ keꞌ Kaisarea, koꞌihmoꞌ molot keꞌ boli Kornelius.”
pairs.target: The Spirit told me to go with them, without discriminating. These six brothers also accompanied me, and we entered into the man’s house.

pairs.source: Petrus moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ, “Kornelius moꞌ silita tuduꞌ koꞌih takal iyoh ningaꞌmalaikat nog mujuag daang boli-e, yoh moꞌ tanon tuduꞌ Kornelius, ‘Odaꞌleh nyaꞌa odi keꞌ Yope, kalik nyaꞌa deꞌ adon Simon deꞌ sobot nyaꞌa gehnang Petrus
pairs.target: He told us how he had seen the angel standing in his house, and saying to him, ‘Send to Joppa, and get Simon, who is called Peter,

pairs.source: Iyoh yaꞌ tanon gah deꞌ odaꞌ muꞌu silamat duoh suaꞌ nyaꞌadeꞌ ogiꞌ daang boli muꞌ.’ ”
pairs.target: who will speak to you words by which you will be saved, you and all your house.’

pairs.source: Petrus moꞌ lanyut sina-e, “Takal okuꞌ mulai sina, Iyang Topaꞌ muuntuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ samah kodaꞌ takal-e muun tuduꞌ otoꞌ deꞌ sibungas-e.
pairs.target: As I began to speak, the Holy Spirit fell on them, even as on us at the beginning.

pairs.source: Takal inoh lasuꞌ kuꞌ natong sina Topaꞌ nang, ‘Yohanes baptis nyaꞌa pakaipiꞌin, pak-e ingan yaꞌ obuah baptis pakai Iyang Topaꞌ.’
pairs.target: I remembered the word of the Lord, how he said, ‘John indeed baptized in water, but you will be baptized in the Holy Spirit.’

pairs.source: Simoꞌ Topaꞌ nginIyang-E tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e ulang Yahudi samah kodaꞌ Iyoh ngin tuduꞌotoꞌ takal toꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ Yesus, wat ki wat kuꞌ yaꞌ jaman Iyoh.”
pairs.target: If then God gave to them the same gift as us, when we believed in the Lord Jesus Christ, who was I, that I could withstand God?”

pairs.source: Takal nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngojit pingunang Petrus inoh ke odop-edeꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ sina.Yohmoꞌ mudi Topaꞌ daang-e in-e, “Moꞌ watnoh, Topaꞌ ngin-e geh tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e ulang Yahudi odaꞌ togan olandeꞌ jaꞌat, saꞌ-e soꞌon idip deꞌ baꞌuh duoh Topaꞌ, kodaꞌ otoꞌ ulang Yahudi.”
pairs.target: When they heard these things, they held their peace, and glorified God, saying, “Then God has also granted to the Gentiles repentance to life!”

pairs.source: Takalnyaꞌa mokuaꞌ ngabos Stefanus, nyaꞌa moꞌ mulai pijolaꞌulang-ulang deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus, nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ buu katiꞌ kanihmisah odop-e, ogiꞌ deꞌ buu keꞌ negli Fenisia, keꞌ pulou Siprus duoh keꞌkota Antiokhia  Pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ jok-e tanon Gah deꞌ Paguh tentangTopaꞌ Yesus tuduꞌ ulang Yahudi
pairs.target: They therefore who were scattered abroad by the oppression that arose about Stephen traveled as far as Phoenicia, Cyprus, and Antioch, speaking the word to no one except to Jews only.

pairs.source: Pak-e ogiꞌ geh daang odop-e deꞌ munoꞌulang deꞌ soꞌ pulou Siprus duoh kota Kirene deꞌ odi keꞌ kota Antiokhia.Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tanon Gah deꞌ Paguh nang Yesus inoh leh Topaꞌ tuduꞌnyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e ulang Yahudi
pairs.target: But there were some of them, men of Cyprus and Cyrene, who, when they had come to Antioch, spoke to the Hellenists, preaching the Lord Jesus.

pairs.source: Topaꞌ moꞌ ngin kuasa tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌmunoꞌ, yoh ngan-e takal-e sina, bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e ulang Yahudi deꞌ moꞌbisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ Yesus, yohmoꞌ jadin pinunaꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: The hand of the Lord was with them, and a great number believed and turned to the Lord.

pairs.source: Uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus deꞌ Yerusalem moꞌ pait Barnabaskeꞌ Antiokhia, takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngojit nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e ulangYahudi danoꞌ moꞌ bisayaꞌ geh tuduꞌ Yesus
pairs.target: The report concerning them came to the ears of the assembly which was in Jerusalem. They sent out Barnabas to go as far as Antioch,

pairs.source: Takal Barnabas moꞌ nog yohmoꞌ ningaꞌ sukup bogoꞌ bilokat deꞌ nai Topaꞌ tuduꞌ odop-e danoꞌ, iyoh moꞌdoon munuas  Iyoh moꞌ tanon odaꞌ nyaꞌa danoꞌ bonal-bonal tunuak tuduꞌTopaꞌ sipunuaꞌ otin-e
pairs.target: who, when he had come, and had seen the grace of God, was glad. He exhorted them all, that with purpose of heart they should remain near to the Lord.

pairs.source: Barnabas nyaꞌa deꞌ paguh otin-e, ogiꞌ Iyang Topaꞌdeꞌ nguasa idip-e duoh sukup bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, yoh leh ngan-e bogoꞌnyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: For he was a good man, and full of the Holy Spirit and of faith, and many people were added to the Lord.

pairs.source: Barnabas moꞌ odi kalik Saulus keꞌ kota Tarsus.Takal-e bitapod duohSaulus, yoh moꞌ toban Saulus keꞌ kota Antiokhia
pairs.target: Barnabas went out to Tarsus to look for Saul.

pairs.source: Niꞌ sowaꞌ iyoh loꞌobikuluk duoh uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ danoꞌ, simadi-e ngajal nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ.Deꞌ Antiokhia noh leh sibungas-e nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus nyaꞌa sobotnang Kristen.
pairs.target: When he had found him, he brought him to Antioch. For a whole year they were gathered together with the assembly, and taught many people. The disciples were first called Christians in Antioch.

pairs.source: Takal inohleh kudu-kudu nabi nog soꞌ Yerusalem keꞌ Antiokhia
pairs.target: Now in these days, prophets came down from Jerusalem to Antioch.

pairs.source: Niꞌnaꞌan soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ adon Agabus  Iyang Topaꞌ moꞌ odaꞌ iyohnutaꞌ nang sowaꞌ-sowaꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nog suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ dunia yaꞌ sibolok-natuag.(Oniꞌ deꞌ nang Agabus inoh tok jadi takal Klaudius jadin Laja Roma deꞌpaling ayuh.)
pairs.target: One of them named Agabus stood up, and indicated by the Spirit that there should be a great famine all over the world, which also happened in the days of Claudius.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ deꞌ Yesus moꞌ bipokat yaꞌ pait pasia-etuduꞌ ulang-ulang deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus deꞌ loꞌo deꞌ Yudea  Masim-masimngin nunaꞌ deꞌ mapu-e
pairs.target: As any of the disciples had plenty, each determined to send relief to the brothers who lived in Judea;

pairs.source: Oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ situju yoh yaꞌ nai-e, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌmoꞌ pait Barnabas duoh Saulus odaꞌ odi katod pasia deꞌ moꞌ nguluk-e tuduꞌpimipin uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus deꞌ Yerusalem odaꞌ bikutung-e.
pairs.target: which they also did, sending it to the elders by the hands of Barnabas and Saul.

pairs.source: Takal inoh geh laja Herodes mulai nai ulah duoh kudu-kudu naꞌannyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ Yesus
pairs.target: Now about that time, King Herod stretched out his hands to oppress some of the assembly.

pairs.source: Iyoh noh geh deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌangabos Yakobus madih Yohanes notok pakai podang
pairs.target: He killed James, the brother of John, with the sword.

pairs.source: Takal yoh ningaꞌulang Yahudi simakin sonang otin-e ningaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai-e, yohmoꞌ nai lagiulah odaꞌ takap baya Petrus  Takal inoh pas onu ayuh Paskah
pairs.target: When he saw that it pleased the Jews, he proceeded to seize Peter also. This was during the days of unleavened bread.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌtakap-e Herodes moꞌ odaꞌ kibalot Petrus kaang jel  Ogiꞌ pat kilopok sidadudeꞌ odaꞌ jaga-e, tiap kilopok ogiꞌ pat naꞌan pingawal  Mokuaꞌ Onu ayuhPaskah ke iyoh moꞌ yaꞌ bilituang deꞌ jowin nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ
pairs.target: When he had arrested him, he put him in prison, and delivered him to four squads of four soldiers each to guard him, intending to bring him out to the people after the Passover.

pairs.source: Wat noh lehPetrus obuah naan daang jel  Pak-e uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ Yesusdiꞌ-e buwon-buwon bidoa tuduꞌ Topaꞌ saꞌan Petrus.
pairs.target: Peter therefore was kept in the prison, but constant prayer was made by the assembly to God for him.

pairs.source: Tiaꞌ pagi-e nyam-e Herodes yaꞌ bilituang deꞌ jowin nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ.Ngalom itih-e Petrus boꞌos deꞌ osah duwoh pingawal deꞌ jaga iyoh daangsoꞌ duwoh tongan-e obuah ngilate duoh sidadu deꞌ jaga  Diꞌ-e jok-e noh,ogiꞌ lagi nyaꞌa deꞌ jaga deꞌ aluang tiban
pairs.target: The same night when Herod was about to bring him out, Peter was sleeping between two soldiers, bound with two chains. Guards in front of the door kept the prison.

pairs.source: Tang-tang niꞌ naꞌan malaikatTopaꞌ mujuag sinok Petrus takal inoh geh aang jel moꞌ jawaꞌ  Malaikat nohmoꞌ nupap-nupap daang-e guyang Petrus odaꞌ mokat, yoh moꞌ in-e, “Mokatmey!” Takal inoh geh late bosi luluh soꞌ tongan-e
pairs.target: And behold, an angel of the Lord stood by him, and a light shone in the cell. He struck Peter on the side, and woke him up, saying, “Stand up quickly!” His chains fell off from his hands.

pairs.source: Malaikat inoh moꞌsina, “Pakai soot kupuang muꞌ, sok kasut muꞌ!” Petrus moꞌ nai kodaꞌ deꞌtanon-e  Mokuaꞌ inoh malaikat moꞌ sina lagiꞌ, “Pakai jubah muꞌ nyeꞌ moꞌnunaꞌ okuꞌ.”
pairs.target: The angel said to him, “Get dressed and put on your sandals.” He did so. He said to him, “Put on your cloak, and follow me.”

pairs.source: Yoh moꞌ nunaꞌ malaikat luah, yoh diꞌ-e puꞌan oniꞌ deꞌ nai-e noh tok sibonal-e, baꞌ-a nang daang pimoh
pairs.target: And he went out and followed him. He didn’t know that what was being done by the angel was real, but thought he saw a vision.

pairs.source: Takal-e moꞌ lowan nyaꞌa deꞌjaga keꞌ niꞌ, keꞌ duwoh, yoh moꞌ nog tiban bosi deꞌ nuju keꞌ kota.Tibannoh tibukaꞌ sadiꞌ-e, mokuaꞌ noh yoh moꞌ luah ponu nunaꞌ lolong, tang-tangmalaikat noh moꞌ togan Petrus.
pairs.target: When they were past the first and the second guard, they came to the iron gate that leads into the city, which opened to them by itself. They went out, and went down one street, and immediately the angel departed from him.

pairs.source: Takal inoh ke yoh moꞌ ngoon-e, yoh moꞌ in-e daang pikil-e, “Puꞌan kuꞌtiyaꞌ, Topaꞌ bonal-bonal piluah okuꞌ.Yoh ngan-e odaꞌ malaikat odi pilopasokuꞌ soꞌ tongan laja Herodes duoh ulang Yahudi deꞌ bialap odaꞌ okuꞌ yaꞌlobih susah.”
pairs.target: When Peter had come to himself, he said, “Now I truly know that the Lord has sent out his angel and delivered me out of the hand of Herod, and from everything the Jewish people were expecting.”

pairs.source: Takal iyoh moꞌ ngiloti oniꞌ deꞌ nai malaikat tuduꞌ odop-e, Petrus moꞌodi keꞌ boli Maria sinoꞌ Yohanes deꞌ mogan nyaꞌa geh nang Markus  Danoꞌmoꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa tikuluk bidoa
pairs.target: Thinking about that, he came to the house of Mary, the mother of John who was called Mark, where many were gathered together and were praying.

pairs.source: Petrus moꞌ gotuag tiban soꞌ sopaꞌ, ogiꞌ niꞌnaꞌan onak dayung deꞌ jadin kuli deꞌ adon Rode odi yaꞌ bukaꞌ tiban
pairs.target: When Peter knocked at the door of the gate, a maid named Rhoda came to answer.

pairs.source: Iyohmoꞌ lasuꞌ puꞌan nang deꞌ sina noh Petrus  Dop-e yoh sikiya doon, yoh moꞌkomut bukaꞌ tiban yohmoꞌ paliꞌ molot ngan-e yaꞌ tanon tuduꞌ nyaꞌa nangPetrus ogiꞌ deꞌ sopaꞌ
pairs.target: When she recognized Peter’s voice, she didn’t open the gate for joy, but ran in, and reported that Peter was standing in front of the gate.

pairs.source: “Bakoꞌ muꞌ!” In odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ  Pak-e Rode nanginoh bih bonal-bonal Petrus  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nang, “Inoh malaikat deꞌjaga-e konik keh!”
pairs.target: They said to her, “You are crazy!” But she insisted that it was so. They said, “It is his angel.”

pairs.source: Pak-e Petrus aluaꞌ geh gotuag tiban, takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bukaꞌtiban yoh moꞌ ningaꞌ Petrus, yoh moꞌ sukup ilan-e
pairs.target: But Peter continued knocking. When they had opened, they saw him, and were amazed.

pairs.source: Petrus moꞌ pakattongan-e saꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e kilingot  Mokuaꞌ noh yohmoꞌ silitatuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ wat takal malaikat Topaꞌ toban odop-e luah soꞌjel yoh moꞌ, in-e, “Tanon leh tuduꞌ Yakobus duoh madih ayua deꞌ bokon.”Mokuaꞌ noh Petrus moꞌ buu togan topat noh, iyoh odi keꞌ topat deꞌ bokon.
pairs.target: But he, beckoning to them with his hand to be silent, declared to them how the Lord had brought him out of the prison. He said, “Tell these things to James, and to the brothers.” Then he departed, and went to another place.

pairs.source: Tiaꞌ pagi-e, sidadu deꞌ jaga jel moꞌ bigaduh daang-e tolu, yoh moꞌilan-e oni wat Petrus ponai buu
pairs.target: Now as soon as it was day, there was no small stir among the soldiers about what had become of Peter.

pairs.source: Herodes odaꞌ nyaꞌa kalik Petrus  Pak-ediꞌ-e tungang tapod-e  Herodes odaꞌ nyaꞌa pilisa suaꞌ pengawal deꞌ odaꞌ-ejaga, mokuaꞌ inoh yoh moꞌ ngabos odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.Mokuaꞌ noh Herodes moꞌ buu soꞌ propinsi Yudea yoh moꞌ odi keꞌ kotaKaisarea yoh moꞌ loꞌo tuui danoꞌ.
pairs.target: When Herod had sought for him, and didn’t find him, he examined the guards, and commanded that they should be put to death. He went down from Judea to Caesarea, and stayed there.

pairs.source: Herodes sukup tiwas tuduꞌ ulang Tirus duoh Sidon  Noh leh nganodop-e deꞌ munoꞌ soꞌ Tirus duoh Sidon odi samah-samah ngaduap Herodes.Deꞌ pidioꞌ-o yoh mujok Blastus deꞌ jadin kepala istana Herodes saꞌ-a nuaꞌodop-e  Mokuaꞌ noh, yoh odi ngaduap Herodes yaꞌ mitiaꞌ bidamai, dop-epinguman saꞌan odop-e danoꞌ bialap soꞌ negeli Herodes.
pairs.target: Now Herod was very angry with the people of Tyre and Sidon. They came with one accord to him, and, having made Blastus, the king’s personal aide, their friend, they asked for peace, because their country depended on the king’s country for food.

pairs.source: Daang onu deꞌ moꞌ notu-e, Herodes pakai pimakai laja-e, yoh moꞌguluꞌ deꞌ topat guluꞌ laja-e, yoh moꞌ mulai sina deꞌ jowin layat-e
pairs.target: On an appointed day, Herod dressed himself in royal clothing, sat on the throne, and gave a speech to them.

pairs.source: Layat-edeꞌ ngojit pingunang Herodes, moꞌ nyamut nang liyuak-aꞌab-e, “Itih sinadewa, idoh diꞌ sina manusia neh!”
pairs.target: The people shouted, “The voice of a god, and not of a man!”

pairs.source: Takal inoh geh malaikat Topaꞌ lasuꞌodaꞌ Herodes monam, dop-e Herodes tilimaꞌ pudi soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ, iyohdiꞌ-e tanon odaꞌ nyaꞌa mudi Topaꞌ sijaꞌ-e, likiyuah moꞌ man toꞌin-e yoh moꞌkobos.
pairs.target: Immediately an angel of the Lord struck him, because he didn’t give God the glory, and he was eaten by worms and died.

pairs.source: Pingunang Topaꞌ moꞌ popah katiꞌ kanih, yoh ngan-e makin onu makinbogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: But the word of God grew and multiplied.

pairs.source: Barnabas duoh Saulus paliꞌ soꞌ Yerusalem takal-e moꞌ mokuaꞌ naikiloja danoꞌ yoh moꞌ toban Yohanes Markus samah-samah duoh odop-e.
pairs.target: Barnabas and Saul returned to Jerusalem, when they had fulfilled their service, also taking with them John who was called Mark.

pairs.source: Takal inoh daang uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ Yesus deꞌAntiokhia ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan nabi duoh gulu-gulu deꞌ ngajaltentang Pingunang Topaꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ: Barnabas, Simeon deꞌ nangnyaꞌa Ulang deꞌ Songot, Lukius soꞌ kota Kirene, Menahem (deꞌ obuah somonsamah-samah duoh laja Herodes takal-e aluaꞌ isoꞌ), duoh Saulus
pairs.target: Now in the assembly that was at Antioch there were some prophets and teachers: Barnabas, Simeon who was called Niger, Lucius of Cyrene, Manaen the foster brother of Herod the tetrarch, and Saul.

pairs.source: Takalodop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ moꞌ nyomah Topaꞌ daang-e puasa, Iyang Topaꞌ moꞌ sinatuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ, “Nyok Saulus duoh Barnabas saꞌan Kuꞌ saꞌ-e naikiloja deꞌ moꞌ notu Kuꞌ odaꞌ odop-e deꞌ duwoh nai-e.”
pairs.target: As they served the Lord and fasted, the Holy Spirit said, “Separate Barnabas and Saul for me, for the work to which I have called them.”

pairs.source: Takal odop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ moꞌ mokuaꞌ bidoa duoh puasa, odop-e deꞌ mutiꞌmoꞌ naꞌ tongan-e deꞌ tun bak Barnabas duoh Saulus ngan-e pakat odop-edeꞌ duwoh odaꞌ odi tanon Gah deꞌ Paguh keꞌ topat deꞌ bokon, mokuaꞌ inohyohmoꞌ odi.
pairs.target: Then, when they had fasted and prayed and laid their hands on them, they sent them away.

pairs.source: Saulus duoh Barnabas moꞌ bilakat keꞌ pelabuhan Seleukia, soꞌ kanoꞌyohmoꞌ bilayal lagiꞌ keꞌ pulou Siprus nunaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ tanon Iyang Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: So, being sent out by the Holy Spirit, they went down to Seleucia. From there they sailed to Cyprus.

pairs.source: Takal-e moꞌ nog keꞌ kota Salamis yoh moꞌ tanon Pingunang Topaꞌ deꞌtopat-topat simayang ulang Yahudi  Yohanes Markus moꞌ nunaꞌ yoh ngan-eyaꞌ tulung daang pimonu-e.
pairs.target: When they were at Salamis, they proclaimed God’s word in the Jewish synagogues. They had also John as their attendant.

pairs.source: Yohmoꞌ ponu kodak suaꞌ pulou deꞌ munoꞌ, soꞌ tubon kawa nog tubondeꞌ bokon yoh moꞌ nog ke' kota Pafos  Danoꞌ iyoh bitapod duoh ulangYahudi deꞌ adon-e Baryesus  Iyoh inoh dukun, pak-e yoh nang odop-e nabiTopaꞌ
pairs.target: When they had gone through the island to Paphos, they found a certain sorcerer, a false prophet, a Jew, whose name was Bar Jesus,

pairs.source: Dukun itih bidingan sinok duoh Sergius Paulus gubelnul pulouinoh  Sergius itih ulang deꞌ pital daang-e bijak  Iyoh odaꞌ nyaꞌa moganSaulus duoh Barnabas odaꞌ bitapod duoh odop-e, dop-e yoh linuꞌ yaꞌ ngojitPingunang Topaꞌ
pairs.target: who was with the proconsul, Sergius Paulus, a man of understanding. This man summoned Barnabas and Saul, and sought to hear the word of God.

pairs.source: Pak-e dukun deꞌ adon Baryesus daang sina YunaniElimas, mala kaso kiloja Barnabas duoh Saulus yaꞌ tanon pingunang Topaꞌtuduꞌ gubelnul saꞌ gubelnul diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ Yesus
pairs.target: But Elymas the sorcerer (for so is his name by interpretation) withstood them, seeking to turn the proconsul away from the faith.

pairs.source: Pak-e Saulusdeꞌ sobot nyaꞌa geh Paulus deꞌ moꞌ obuah nguasa Iyang Topaꞌ iyoh moꞌngiduang dukun inoh,
pairs.target: But Saul, who is also called Paul, filled with the Holy Spirit, fastened his eyes on him,

pairs.source: daang-e sina, “Elimas, muꞌ samah kodaꞌ Laja muatmunua deꞌ suka pinipu duoh nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat  Muꞌu tukang lawan suaꞌ oniꞌdeꞌ bonal soꞌ Topaꞌ  Kangan tiyaꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat!
pairs.target: and said, “Full of all deceit and all cunning, you son of the devil, you enemy of all righteousness, will you not cease to pervert the right ways of the Lord?

pairs.source: Ningaꞌ, adin Topaꞌyaꞌ ngukum muꞌu! Boton muꞌu butaꞌ saꞌ diꞌ muꞌ tiyaꞌ kilin jawaꞌ onu daangkudu-kudu onu-e deꞌ notu Topaꞌ.”Takal inoh geh boton-e lasuꞌ bilabun daang-e lasuꞌ mopung' yohmoꞌponu bikaap simadi-e kalik nyaꞌa odaꞌ kayak odop-e
pairs.target: Now, behold, the hand of the Lord is on you, and you will be blind, not seeing the sun for a season!” Immediately a mist and darkness fell on him. He went around seeking someone to lead him by the hand.

pairs.source: Takal gubelnulinoh ningaꞌ Baryesus moꞌ lasuꞌ butaꞌ, yohmoꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ Yesusdop-e yoh sukup ilan-e ngojit pingajal tentang Topaꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: Then the proconsul, when he saw what was done, believed, being astonished at the teaching of the Lord.

pairs.source: Soꞌ Pafos, Paulus duoh dingan-dingan-e moꞌ bilayal nuju Perga deꞌpropinsi Pamfilia  Danoꞌ Yohanes Markus togan Paulus duoh Barnabas,yohmoꞌ paliꞌ keꞌ Yerusalem
pairs.target: Now Paul and his company set sail from Paphos, and came to Perga in Pamphylia. John departed from them and returned to Jerusalem.

pairs.source: Soꞌ Perga, odop-e deꞌ duwoh moꞌ odi keꞌAntiokhia deꞌ propinsi Pisidia  Takal Onu Simayang ulang Yahudi, Paulusduoh Barnabas odi keꞌ boli topat simayang, yohmoꞌ guluꞌ simayang duohnyaꞌa danoꞌ
pairs.target: But they, passing on from Perga, came to Antioch of Pisidia. They went into the synagogue on the Sabbath day, and sat down.

pairs.source: Takal nyaꞌa mokuaꞌ basa ayat-ayat soꞌ buk deꞌ nulis nabiMusa duoh buk deꞌ nulis nabi-nabi deꞌ bokon, pimipin-pimipin boli topatsimayang inoh moꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa bisikian tuduꞌ Paulus duoh Barnabas, “Madihayua simoꞌ-o ogiꞌ nasehat deꞌ yaꞌ tanon ingan tuduꞌ nyaꞌa datiꞌ, silahkaningan tanon-e!”
pairs.target: After the reading of the law and the prophets, the rulers of the synagogue sent to them, saying, “Brothers, if you have any word of exhortation for the people, speak.”

pairs.source: Paulus moꞌ mokat mujuag yohmoꞌ kakat tongan-e odaꞌnyaꞌa diꞌ-e bidaluag, yohmoꞌ sina in-e,“Madih ayua kuꞌ ulang-ulang Israel duoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ taat tuduꞌ Topaꞌngojit Pingunang kuꞌ!
pairs.target: Paul stood up, and beckoning with his hand said, “Men of Israel, and you who fear God, listen.

pairs.source: Topaꞌ deꞌ nyomah ulang Israel moꞌ pilih sumukbabai otoꞌ odaꞌ popah  Yoh moꞌ odaꞌ jadin basa deꞌ ayuh takal yoh aluaꞌnupang deꞌ negli Mesir  Topaꞌ deꞌ ayuh kuasa-e moꞌ toban sumuk babaiotoꞌ luah soꞌ Mesir
pairs.target: The God of this people chose our fathers, and exalted the people when they stayed as aliens in the land of Egypt, and with an uplifted arm, he led them out of it.

pairs.source: Pat puluꞌ sowaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ loꞌo deꞌ padangpasil, yoh mala lawan oniꞌ deꞌ tanon Topaꞌ, pak-e Topaꞌ aluaꞌ geh tulung-e.
pairs.target: For a period of about forty years he put up with them in the wilderness.

pairs.source: Takal Topaꞌ moꞌ mokuaꞌ katuab juꞌ bangsa deꞌ tanaꞌ Kanaan, yohmoꞌbikutung tanaꞌ deꞌ ngin-E tuduꞌ sumuk babai otoꞌ odaꞌ yoh kakuꞌ-e
pairs.target: When he had destroyed seven nations in the land of Canaan, he gave them their land for an inheritance, for about four hundred fifty years.

pairs.source: Suaꞌoniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ponu silamaꞌ pat latus limoh puluꞌ sowaꞌ  Mokuaꞌ Topaꞌngin tanaꞌ Kanaan tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, Iyoh moꞌ pakat pimipin-pimipinsaꞌan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, nog joman nabi Samuel deꞌ jadin pimipin.
pairs.target: After these things he gave them judges until Samuel the prophet.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh odop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ mitiaꞌ niꞌ naꞌan laja  Topaꞌ moꞌ nginSaul onak Kish soꞌ suku Benyamin odaꞌ jadi laja silamaꞌ pat puluꞌ sowaꞌ.
pairs.target: Afterward they asked for a king, and God gave to them Saul the son of Kish, a man of the tribe of Benjamin, for forty years.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ Topaꞌ pimuun yoh, Topaꞌ moꞌ pakat Daud jadin laja odop-e deꞌmunoꞌ  Topaꞌ moꞌ tanon in tih in-e tentang Daud, ‘Okuꞌ tapod nyaꞌa deꞌnyonang otin Kuꞌ duoh nunaꞌ oni deꞌ tanon Kuꞌ  Iyoh inoh Daud onakIsai.’
pairs.target: When he had removed him, he raised up David to be their king, to whom he also testified, ‘I have found David the son of Jesse, a man after my heart, who will do all my will.’

pairs.source: Soꞌ onak sukun-e inoh leh Topaꞌ yaꞌ pakat Laja Pinyilamat saꞌanbasa Israel kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ tanon-e daang janyi-E  Yesus inohleh Odop-e.
pairs.target: From this man’s offspring, God has brought salvation to Israel according to his promise,

pairs.source: Takal Yesus aluaꞌ diꞌ-e mulai nai kiloja-E, Yohanes moꞌ dioꞌ tanon tuduꞌulang-ulang Israel odaꞌ togan olan deꞌ jaꞌat duoh nyelah odop-e yohmoꞌbaptis
pairs.target: before his coming, when John had first preached the baptism of repentance to Israel.

pairs.source: Sinok piobuaꞌ kiloja-e Yohanes moꞌ sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa, ‘Osi okuꞌ tihin ingan nang-e? Doh diꞌ-e okuꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ ingan kajon! Natong leh, mokuaꞌokuꞌ ke Yoh nog  Tulung bukaꞌ kasut soꞌ poꞌon-E tuang doh geh diꞌ-e patut.’
pairs.target: As John was fulfilling his course, he said, ‘What do you suppose that I am? I am not he. But behold, one comes after me, the sandals of whose feet I am not worthy to untie.’

pairs.source: Madih ayua deꞌ soꞌ onak sukun Abraham, duoh suaꞌ madih ayua deꞌdiꞌ-e soꞌ ulang Yahudi deꞌ moꞌ nyomah Topaꞌ  Topaꞌ moꞌ pait tuduꞌ otoꞌ gahpinyilamat
pairs.target: Brothers, children of the stock of Abraham, and those among you who fear God, the word of this salvation is sent out to you.

pairs.source: Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ loꞌo deꞌ Yerusalem duoh pimipin-pimipin-edeꞌ munoꞌ, diꞌ-e puꞌan nang Yesus leh Laja Pinyilamat inoh  Yoh diꞌ-epuꞌan pingajal ayua nabi deꞌ basa-e bilang Onu Simayang ulang Yahudi,yoh ngan-e ngukum ngabos Yesus  Pak oni deꞌ nai-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bonalnunaꞌ oni deꞌ nutaꞌ nabi-nabi deꞌ dioꞌ
pairs.target: For those who dwell in Jerusalem, and their rulers, because they didn’t know him, nor the voices of the prophets which are read every Sabbath, fulfilled them by condemning him.

pairs.source: Takal-e kalik salah Yesus, odop-edeꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e tapod salah deꞌ nai-e deꞌ bitotok duoh ukum ngabos, pakodop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ mitiaꞌ deꞌ Pilatus odaꞌ Iyoh obuah ukum ngabos.
pairs.target: Though they found no cause for death, they still asked Pilate to have him killed.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ nai suaꞌ oniꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ sobot nabi-nabi noꞌuh-e,pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ pimuun todang-E soꞌ salip yohmoꞌ posan daangkubul gua
pairs.target: When they had fulfilled all things that were written about him, they took him down from the tree, and laid him in a tomb.

pairs.source: Pak-e Topaꞌ moꞌ pakat Yoh daꞌ paliꞌ idip lagiꞌ soꞌ kobos-e.
pairs.target: But God raised him from the dead,

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh pat puluꞌ onu Iyoh paliꞌ-paliꞌ bitanga Odop-E tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌdioꞌ soꞌ kanoꞌ nunaꞌ Iyoh soꞌ propinsi Galilea ke' kota Yerusalem  Odop-edeꞌ mutiꞌ leh deꞌ ningaꞌ yohmoꞌ tukang tanon gah tentang Yesus tuduꞌulang Israel
pairs.target: and he was seen for many days by those who came up with him from Galilee to Jerusalem, who are his witnesses to the people.

pairs.source: Adin koꞌih tanon tuduꞌ ingan Gah deꞌ Paguh tentang Yesusdeꞌ moꞌ tanon Topaꞌ pakai janyi-E noꞌuh-e tuduꞌ sumuk babai otoꞌ ulangIsrael
pairs.target: We bring you good news of the promise made to the fathers,

pairs.source: Suaꞌ oni deꞌ mutiꞌ moꞌ nai-e tuduꞌ otoꞌ takal Yoh paliꞌ kidip Yesusdeꞌ moꞌ kobos  Ogiꞌ deꞌ nulis-e daang Mazmur deꞌ keꞌ duwoh-e:‘Muꞌu leh Onak Kuꞌ!Daang onu itih Okuꞌ moꞌ jadin Samaꞌ Muꞌ.’
pairs.target: that God has fulfilled the same to us, their children, in that he raised up Jesus. As it is also written in the second psalm, ‘You are my Son. Today I have become your father.’

pairs.source: Topaꞌ moꞌ pakat Iyoh odaꞌ paliꞌ idip soꞌ kobos-e, adin Iyoh diꞌ-e tiyaꞌkiꞌan kobos daang kubul lagiꞌ  Oni deꞌ mutiꞌ Topaꞌ moꞌ sina:‘Okuꞌ pasti yaꞌ tulung ingan, umat Kuꞌkodaꞌ janyi Kuꞌ tuduꞌ laja Daud.’
pairs.target: “Concerning that he raised him up from the dead, now no more to return to corruption, he has spoken thus: ‘I will give you the holy and sure blessings of David.’

pairs.source: Wat inoh geh Yoh tanon daang ayat deꞌ bokon:‘Diꞌ ingan yaꞌ tanah Nyaꞌa deꞌ nyelah idip-e nai kiloja saꞌanIngan odaꞌ kobos moduaꞌ daang kubul.’
pairs.target: Therefore he says also in another psalm, ‘You will not allow your Holy One to see decay.’

pairs.source: Daud moꞌ kobos iyoh moꞌ obuah ngubul samah-samah duoh sumukbabai-e, takal yohmoꞌ mokuaꞌ nai oni deꞌ odaꞌ Topaꞌ yoh nai-e  TodangDaud moꞌ obuaꞌ asul moduaꞌ
pairs.target: For David, after he had in his own generation served the counsel of God, fell asleep, and was laid with his fathers, and saw decay.

pairs.source: Pak-e Yesus deꞌ odaꞌ Topaꞌ paliꞌ idip diꞌ-easul moduaꞌ
pairs.target: But he whom God raised up saw no decay.
Be it known to you therefore, brothers, that through this man is proclaimed to you remission of sins,

pairs.source: Madih ayua, saꞌ ingan puꞌan-e soꞌ Yesus itih leh gahpingapun dosa nog tuduꞌ ingan  Ingan halus puꞌan suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌtuduꞌ-E, yohmoꞌ lopas soꞌ suaꞌ dosa-e deꞌ diꞌ-e tapod obuah ngisuꞌ pakaiAtulan-atulan Topaꞌ deꞌ nulis Musa
pairs.target: and by him everyone who believes is justified from all things, from which you could not be justified by the law of Moses.

pairs.source: Yoh leh ngan nyeꞌ bonal-bonal tiluti-emaꞌ sape yaꞌ jadi tuduꞌ ingan oni deꞌ tanon nabi-nabi,
pairs.target: Beware therefore, lest that come on you which is spoken in the prophets:

pairs.source: ‘Tiluti bonal-bonal-e, oi ingan deꞌ suka ngibibial Pingunang Kuꞌ!Ingan yaꞌ ilan-e, mokuaꞌ inoh ingan kobos!Dop-e joman deꞌ adin Okuꞌ aluaꞌ nai oniꞌ,nai oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ ingan bisayaꞌ daꞌ-e,bial ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nelang tuduꞌ ingan.’ ”
pairs.target: ‘Behold, you scoffers, and wonder, and perish; for I work a work in your days, a work which you will in no way believe, if one declares it to you.’”

pairs.source: Takal Paulus duoh Barnabas moꞌ luah soꞌ boli topat simayang inoh,nyaꞌa deꞌ daang boli topat simayang inoh moꞌ odaꞌ yoh nog lagiꞌ daangOnu Simayang ulang Yahudi deꞌ yaꞌ nog, odaꞌ yoh samung lagi silita inoh.
pairs.target: So when the Jews went out of the synagogue, the Gentiles begged that these words might be preached to them the next Sabbath.

pairs.source: Takal suaꞌ nyaꞌa moꞌ luah soꞌ boli topat simayang inoh, bogoꞌ ulangYahudi duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon deꞌ moꞌ molot agama Yahudi, moꞌ nunaꞌPaulus duoh Barnabas  Odop-e deꞌ duwoh moꞌ ngijaꞌ odaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌodaꞌ bialap tuduꞌ pilasiꞌ Topaꞌ, deꞌ ogiꞌ daang Topaꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: Now when the synagogue broke up, many of the Jews and of the devout proselytes followed Paul and Barnabas; who, speaking to them, urged them to continue in the grace of God.

pairs.source: Daang Onu Simayang ulang Yahudi deꞌ nog, yaꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa daang kotanoh nog ngojit Pingunang Topaꞌ
pairs.target: The next Sabbath, almost the whole city was gathered together to hear the word of God.

pairs.source: Takal ulang-ulang Yahudi moꞌ ningaꞌnyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ inoh, otin-e moꞌ sukup siniaꞌ yohmoꞌ nguyat Paulus daang-enetang suaꞌ oni deꞌ tanon-e
pairs.target: But when the Jews saw the multitudes, they were filled with jealousy, and contradicted the things which were spoken by Paul, and blasphemed.

pairs.source: Pak Paulus duoh Barnabas lobih bilani laginang sina, “Tuduꞌ ingan leh Pingunang Topaꞌ koꞌih tanon lobih dioꞌ, pak-eingan doliaꞌ ingan tilimaꞌ-e, ingan nang odop ingan diꞌ-e patut tilimaꞌ idipsibonal-e duoh idip nah-nah  Iyoh leh ngan koꞌih odi tuduꞌ nyaꞌa bangsadeꞌ bokon
pairs.target: Paul and Barnabas spoke out boldly, and said, “It was necessary that God’s word should be spoken to you first. Since indeed you thrust it from you, and judge yourselves unworthy of eternal life, behold, we turn to the Gentiles.

pairs.source: Itih leh deꞌ pilitah Topaꞌ tuduꞌ koꞌih:‘Okuꞌ moꞌ notap ingan daꞌ jadin oni deꞌ jawaꞌ saꞌan basa-basadeꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ,saꞌ ingan leh deꞌ toban silamat saꞌan suaꞌ nyaꞌa nog tubon longit.’ ”
pairs.target: For so has the Lord commanded us, saying, ‘I have set you as a light for the Gentiles, that you should bring salvation to the uttermost parts of the earth.’”

pairs.source: Takal basa deꞌ diꞌ-e puꞌan Topaꞌ ngojit sina inoh kila-e sukup doon,yohmoꞌ mudi Sina Topaꞌ  Nyaꞌa deꞌ notap Topaꞌ odaꞌ soꞌon idip nah-nah,moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: As the Gentiles heard this, they were glad, and glorified the word of God. As many as were appointed to eternal life believed.

pairs.source: Sina Topaꞌ moꞌ popah katiꞌ kanih daang pulou inoh
pairs.target: The Lord’s word was spread abroad throughout all the region.

pairs.source: Ulang-ulangYahudi moꞌ ngasang bala dayung deꞌ timogah deꞌ moꞌ molot agama Yahudi,duoh piayuh-piayuh daang kota inoh odaꞌ nyaꞌa buꞌui tuduꞌ Paulus duohBarnabas duoh kasig odaꞌ buꞌu soꞌ topat-e
pairs.target: But the Jews stirred up the devout and prominent women and the chief men of the city, and stirred up a persecution against Paul and Barnabas, and threw them out of their borders.

pairs.source: Rasul-rasul deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌnupap lopu soꞌ poꞌon-e deꞌ sulung jowin odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ saꞌ-e jadi tanda,saꞌ-e nyaꞌa natong Topaꞌ moꞌ nulak odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ duoh yaꞌ ngukum-e.Mokuaꞌ inoh yoh moꞌ odi keꞌ Ikonium
pairs.target: But they shook off the dust of their feet against them, and came to Iconium.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ deꞌ Antiokhiasukup doon-e, duoh obuah nguasa Iyang Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: The disciples were filled with joy and with the Holy Spirit.

pairs.source: Deꞌ Ikonium Paulus duoh Barnabas tuang watnoh geh, odop-e deꞌduwoh odi keꞌ boli topat simayang agama Yahudi, yoh ngajal samahkodaꞌ deꞌ silalu iyoh nai-e  Iyoh tanon loti pingunang-e inoh bonal-bonal,yohleh ngan-e bogoꞌ ulang Yahudi duoh ulang deꞌ diꞌ-e ulang Yahudi bisayaꞌtuduꞌ Yesus
pairs.target: In Iconium, they entered together into the synagogue of the Jews, and so spoke that a great multitude both of Jews and of Greeks believed.

pairs.source: Pak-e ulang Yahudi deꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus moꞌ ngasangkila ulang deꞌ diꞌ-e Yahudi saꞌ yoh buꞌui tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌYesus
pairs.target: But the disbelieving Jews stirred up and embittered the souls of the Gentiles against the brothers.

pairs.source: Inoh leh sobab-e Paulus duoh Barnabas tuui loꞌo danoꞌ  Odop-e deꞌmunoꞌ sukup bilani-e ngajal tentang pilasiꞌ Topaꞌ Yesus  Topaꞌ moꞌ nginkuasa odaꞌ yoh ponai nai oniꞌ deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa saꞌ-a nyaꞌa puꞌan nang oniꞌ deꞌngajal-e tok-tok soꞌ Topaꞌ
pairs.target: Therefore they stayed there a long time, speaking boldly in the Lord, who testified to the word of his grace, granting signs and wonders to be done by their hands.

pairs.source: Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ kota inoh moꞌ botah duwoh,ogiꞌ deꞌ nunaꞌ ulang Yahudi, ogiꞌ geh deꞌ nunaꞌ rasul-rasul inoh.
pairs.target: But the multitude of the city was divided. Part sided with the Jews, and part with the apostles.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh ulang Yahudi duoh pimipin-pimipin-e bisamah-samahduoh deꞌ diꞌ-e ulang Yahudi moꞌ bipokat yaꞌ nyiksa duoh nyokad rasul-rasulpakai batuh
pairs.target: When some of both the Gentiles and the Jews, with their rulers, made a violent attempt to mistreat and stone them,

pairs.source: Takal rasul-rasul inoh moꞌ puꞌan-e, yoh moꞌ buꞌu keꞌ kota-kotadeꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ propinsi Likaonia kodaꞌ Listra, Derbe duoh pulou-pulou deꞌsinok inoh
pairs.target: they became aware of it, and fled to the cities of Lycaonia, Lystra, Derbe, and the surrounding region.

pairs.source: Deꞌ topat deꞌ munoꞌ leh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ tanon Gah deꞌPaguh.
pairs.target: There they preached the Good News.

pairs.source: Deꞌ Listra ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan dali deꞌ kobos poꞌon-e, iyoh diꞌ-e taan ponu soꞌtakal sinoꞌ-o milaꞌ-a
pairs.target: At Lystra a certain man sat, impotent in his feet, a cripple from his mother’s womb, who never had walked.

pairs.source: Iyoh guluꞌ ngojit oni deꞌ nang Paulus  Paulus moꞌngibotoh iyoh, iyoh moꞌ piluh nang nyaꞌa inoh bisayaꞌ nang Yesus tapododaꞌ yoh mokuaꞌ
pairs.target: He was listening to Paul speaking, who, fastening eyes on him, and seeing that he had faith to be made whole,

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Paulus moꞌ sina dolas-dolas-e, “Mokatleh!” Iyoh moꞌ lasuꞌ mokat mujuag daang-e lasuꞌ ponu katiꞌ kanih
pairs.target: said with a loud voice, “Stand upright on your feet!” He leaped up and walked.

pairs.source: Takalnyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ oni deꞌ nai Paulus, nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nangliyuak-aab-e daang sina ulang Likaonia, “Dewa-dewa moꞌ muun kaangdunia samah kodaꞌ polong otoꞌ manusia.”
pairs.target: When the multitude saw what Paul had done, they lifted up their voice, saying in the language of Lycaonia, “The gods have come down to us in the likeness of men!”

pairs.source: Yohmoꞌ biladon Barnabas nangZeus, Paulus yoh biladon nang Hermes dop-e iyoh leh deꞌ paling bogoꞌ sina.
pairs.target: They called Barnabas “Jupiter”, and Paul “Mercury”, because he was the chief speaker.

pairs.source: Pimipin nyaꞌa deꞌ nyomah Dewa Zeus moꞌ nog soꞌ boli topat simayang-edeꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ sinok kota  Yoh moꞌ toban sapi deꞌ dali duoh bokos-bokosbunga keꞌ tiban kota  Iyoh moꞌ suwaꞌ duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ yaꞌ simoliahsapi-e ngan-e yaꞌ nyomah rasul-rasul inoh.
pairs.target: The priest of Jupiter, whose temple was in front of their city, brought oxen and garlands to the gates, and would have made a sacrifice along with the multitudes.

pairs.source: Takal Barnabas duoh Paulus moꞌ ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nai odop-e deꞌmunoꞌ yoh moꞌ notak-notak bojuh-e daang-e bikoduh keꞌ uun nyaꞌa deꞌbogoꞌ inoh, daang-e bisingak,
pairs.target: But when the apostles, Barnabas and Paul, heard of it, they tore their clothes, and sprang into the multitude, crying out,

pairs.source: “Oni nai ingan nai oniꞌ deꞌ watih? Koꞌih itihmanusia biasa samah kodaꞌ ingan! Koꞌih ogiꞌ datiꞌ yaꞌ tanon Gah deꞌ Paguhtuduꞌ ingan saꞌ ingan togan oniꞌ deꞌ doiꞌ guna-e nyeꞌ moꞌ nog tuduꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌidip, deꞌ nai longit duoh tana', laut duoh suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ daang-e
pairs.target: “Men, why are you doing these things? We also are men of like passions with you, and bring you good news, that you should turn from these vain things to the living God, who made the sky, the earth, the sea, and all that is in them;

pairs.source: Jomandeꞌ noꞌuh-e Topaꞌ tanah odaꞌ suaꞌ basa deꞌ ogiꞌ idip nunaꞌ olan idip odop-emasim-masim
pairs.target: who in the generations gone by allowed all the nations to walk in their own ways.

pairs.source: Pak-e Iyoh tanon nang Odop-e tok ogiꞌ pakai pingunai-edeꞌ paguh tuduꞌ nyaꞌa  Iyoh pimuun tuduꞌ ingan ijan soꞌ longit duoh asiltana' takal musim-e  Iyoh ngin pinguman tuduꞌ ingan duoh nyonang otiningan.”
pairs.target: Yet he didn’t leave himself without witness, in that he did good and gave you rains from the sky and fruitful seasons, filling our hearts with food and gladness.”

pairs.source: Sukup lolah nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ nunaꞌ oni deꞌ tanon Paulus duohBarnabas, pak-e nyuang-e odop-e deꞌ duwoh inoh tapod jaman odop-e deꞌmunoꞌ simoliah binatang ngan-e yaꞌ nyomah odop-e.
pairs.target: Even saying these things, they hardly stopped the multitudes from making a sacrifice to them.

pairs.source: Kudu-kudu naꞌan ulang Yahudi deꞌ nog keꞌ Listra soꞌ kota Antiokhiadeꞌ propinsi Pisidia, duoh soꞌ Ikonium moꞌ ngaluh nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ saꞌ nyaꞌadeꞌ bogoꞌ nuaꞌ odop-e  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyokad Paulus pakai batuh,mokuaꞌ inoh yoh moꞌ matak toban luah soꞌ kota  Baꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌnang yoh moꞌ kobos
pairs.target: But some Jews from Antioch and Iconium came there, and having persuaded the multitudes, they stoned Paul, and dragged him out of the city, supposing that he was dead.

pairs.source: Pak-e takal ulang-ulang deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesusdanoꞌ mujuag kilulung-e, iyoh moꞌ mokat, yohmoꞌ paliꞌ molot kaang kota.Tiaꞌ pagi-e yoh moꞌ bilakat odi keꞌ Derbe duoh Barnabas.
pairs.target: But as the disciples stood around him, he rose up, and entered into the city. On the next day he went out with Barnabas to Derbe.

pairs.source: Takal yoh moꞌ mokuaꞌ tanon Gah deꞌ Paguh deꞌ Derbe, bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌbisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ Yesus, mokuaꞌ inoh yoh moꞌ paliꞌ keꞌ Listra, keꞌ Ikonium,keꞌ Antiokhia deꞌ propinsi Pisidia
pairs.target: When they had preached the Good News to that city, and had made many disciples, they returned to Lystra, Iconium, and Antioch,

pairs.source: Deꞌ kota-kota deꞌ munoꞌ Paulus duohBarnabas pilasang odaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e bilubah otin-e, pakai nasehatsaꞌ-a totap bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ Yesus  Iyoh moꞌ in-e, “Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌtotap yaꞌ kiꞌan idip deꞌ jolaꞌ daang pingidip-e, mokuaꞌ inoh ke yoh tapodsoꞌon idip deꞌ Dunia Baꞌuh soꞌ Topaꞌ.” In inoh leh nasehat deꞌ tanon-e tuduꞌnyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ deꞌ kota-kota deꞌ munoꞌ
pairs.target: confirming the souls of the disciples, exhorting them to continue in the faith, and that through many afflictions we must enter into God’s Kingdom.

pairs.source: Paulus duoh Barnabas moꞌpilih kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa odaꞌ jadin pimipin-pimipin deꞌ suaꞌ uluk nyaꞌadeꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus  Yohmoꞌ bidoa daang-e diꞌ-e man-nuak, odop-e deꞌmunoꞌ mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ bisayaꞌ-e daꞌ-A saꞌ Topaꞌ jaga nyaꞌa deꞌ pilih-e.
pairs.target: When they had appointed elders for them in every assembly, and had prayed with fasting, they commended them to the Lord, on whom they had believed.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Paulus duoh Barnabas lanyut pimonu-e ngilusuꞌ propinsiPisidia, mokuaꞌ inoh yoh moꞌ nog keꞌ Pamfilia
pairs.target: They passed through Pisidia, and came to Pamphylia.

pairs.source: Takal-e mokuaꞌ tanonPingunang Topaꞌ deꞌ Perga, odop-e deꞌ duwoh moꞌ odi ke Atalia
pairs.target: When they had spoken the word in Perga, they went down to Attalia.

pairs.source: Soꞌ nohleh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ muat deꞌ kapal yohmoꞌ bilayal paliꞌ ke Antiokhia deꞌpropinsi Siria, dop-e yoh moꞌ mokuaꞌ nai kiloja deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa yoh nai-e.Danoꞌ leh soꞌ sibungas-e takal uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus moꞌ pilihodop-e deꞌ duwoh yohmoꞌ bidoa mitiaꞌ odaꞌ Topaꞌ tulung saꞌ-a ponai naikiloja deꞌ moꞌ tanon-e.
pairs.target: From there they sailed to Antioch, from where they had been committed to the grace of God for the work which they had fulfilled.

pairs.source: Takal-e moꞌ nog deꞌ Antiokhia, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nguluk nyaꞌasoꞌ uluk ulang bisayaꞌ inoh, yohmoꞌ silita suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nai Topaꞌ pakaiodop-e deꞌ munoꞌ  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ silita geh watki wat Topaꞌ moꞌ bukaꞌolan saꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e ulang Yahudi bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus
pairs.target: When they had arrived, and had gathered the assembly together, they reported all the things that God had done with them, and that he had opened a door of faith to the nations.

pairs.source: Paulus duohBarnabas loꞌo tuui duoh uluk ulang Kristen deꞌ kota inoh.
pairs.target: They stayed there with the disciples for a long time.

pairs.source: Kudu-kudu naꞌan ulang Yahudi soꞌ Yudea odi keꞌ Antiokhia yohmoꞌngajal uluk ulang Kristen deꞌ diꞌ-e soꞌ basa Yahudi, in-e, “Simoꞌ-oingan diꞌ-e bisunat nunaꞌ adat deꞌ moꞌ tanon nabi Musa, ingan diꞌ-e tapodsilamat.”
pairs.target: Some men came down from Judea and taught the brothers, “Unless you are circumcised after the custom of Moses, you can’t be saved.”

pairs.source: Pak-e Paulus duoh Barnabas moꞌ ulih-ulih netang pingunangnyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ  Nyuang-nyuang-e uluk ulang Kristen deꞌ Antiokhia moꞌodaꞌ Paulus, Barnabas duoh kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon odi keꞌYerusalem ngan-e yaꞌ biloneng sina deꞌ bikalah-a, tuduꞌ rasul-rasul duohpimipin-pimipin uluk ulang Kristen deꞌ danih.
pairs.target: Therefore when Paul and Barnabas had no small discord and discussion with them, they appointed Paul and Barnabas, and some others of them, to go up to Jerusalem to the apostles and elders about this question.

pairs.source: Uluk ulang Kristen deꞌ soꞌ Antiokhia moꞌ katod nog sopaꞌ kota, odop-edeꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ponu ngilusuꞌ propinsi Fenisia duoh Samaria  Takal-e danoꞌ,odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ silita watki wat nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e ulang Yahudi toganolan deꞌ jaꞌat yohmoꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus  Nyaꞌa danoꞌ sukup doon-e ngojitgah inoh
pairs.target: They, being sent on their way by the assembly, passed through both Phoenicia and Samaria, declaring the conversion of the Gentiles. They caused great joy to all the brothers.

pairs.source: Takal ayua Paulus duoh Barnabas nog Yerusalem, rasul-rasulduoh uluk ulang Kristen danoꞌ baya pimipin-pimipin-e nyamut odop-e deꞌmunoꞌ  Yohmoꞌ Paulus duoh Barnabas silita suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nai Topaꞌ takalTopaꞌ moꞌ pakai odop-e
pairs.target: When they had come to Jerusalem, they were received by the assembly and the apostles and the elders, and they reported all things that God had done with them.

pairs.source: Pak-e kudu-kudu naꞌan ulang Yahudi soꞌ golonganFarisi deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus, mokat mujuag daang-e sina, “Ulang-ulangdeꞌ diꞌ-e basa Yahudi deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus halus bisunat nunaꞌ adat deꞌmoꞌ tanon nabi Musa.”
pairs.target: But some of the sect of the Pharisees who believed rose up, saying, “It is necessary to circumcise them, and to command them to keep the law of Moses.”

pairs.source: Inoh leh ngan rasul-rasul duoh pimipin-pimipin moꞌ tikuluk ngan-eyaꞌ biloneng masalah inoh
pairs.target: The apostles and the elders were gathered together to see about this matter.

pairs.source: Tian oni odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ biloneng masalahinoh  Petrus moꞌ mokat mujuag, yoh moꞌ in-e, “Madih ayua! Suaꞌ inganmoꞌ puꞌan nang deꞌ dioꞌ Topaꞌ moꞌ pilih okuꞌ soꞌ uluk otoꞌ, Yoh odaꞌ okuꞌtanon Gah deꞌ Paguh tuduꞌ basa deꞌ bokon deꞌ diꞌ-e ulang Yahudi, saꞌ nyaꞌadeꞌ munoꞌ puꞌan Gah deꞌ Paguh, yohmoꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus
pairs.target: When there had been much discussion, Peter rose up and said to them, “Brothers, you know that a good while ago God made a choice among you, that by my mouth the nations should hear the word of the Good News, and believe.

pairs.source: Topaꞌ deꞌpuꞌan suaꞌ isiꞌ otin manusia, Yoh moꞌ tanon nang Odop-E tilimaꞌ basa deꞌdiꞌ-e ulang Yahudi takal-e pait Iyang Topaꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ samahgeh kodaꞌ takal-e pait tuduꞌ otoꞌ
pairs.target: God, who knows the heart, testified about them, giving them the Holy Spirit, just like he did to us.

pairs.source: Topaꞌ diꞌ-e pilih basa nyaꞌa, bait basaYahudi, bait basa deꞌ bokon asal-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus, yoh obuah ngapundosa-e
pairs.target: He made no distinction between us and them, cleansing their hearts by faith.

pairs.source: Oni nai ingan yaꞌ lawan Topaꞌ? Oni nai ingan odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌdiꞌ-e ulang Yahudi deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus odaꞌ nunaꞌ atulan-atulan ingandeꞌ baat, daang-e sumuk babai otoꞌ duoh otoꞌ tuang idoh geh diꞌ-e taannunaꞌ-e?
pairs.target: Now therefore why do you tempt God, that you should put a yoke on the neck of the disciples which neither our fathers nor we were able to bear?

pairs.source: Idoh diꞌ-e watnoh neh! Otoꞌ soꞌ ulang Yahudi samah-samahduoh ulang deꞌ diꞌ-e Yahudi jok-e dapod silamat dop-e Topaꞌ Yesus masiꞌtuduꞌ otoꞌ.”
pairs.target: But we believe that we are saved through the grace of the Lord Jesus,  just as they are.”

pairs.source: Suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ tikuluk danoꞌ bidongo, yoh moꞌ ngojit Barnabas duohPaulus paliꞌ silita suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa duoh oniꞌ deꞌ nai Topaꞌ pakaiodop-e deꞌ munoꞌ daang uluk basa deꞌ bokon deꞌ diꞌ-e Yahudi
pairs.target: All the multitude kept silence, and they listened to Barnabas and Paul reporting what signs and wonders God had done among the nations through them.

pairs.source: TakalPaulus duoh Barnabas mokuaꞌ sina, Yakobus moꞌ in-e, “Madih ayua ngojitdioꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nang kuꞌ:
pairs.target: After they were silent, James answered, “Brothers, listen to me.

pairs.source: Tuang Simon mokuaꞌ silita tuduꞌ ingan oni watsibungas-e Topaꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ paguh tuduꞌ ulang-ulang deꞌ diꞌ-e Yahudiyohmoꞌ pilih soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ odaꞌ jadin tung Odop-E
pairs.target: Simeon has reported how God first visited the nations, to take out of them a people for his name.

pairs.source: Oniꞌ deꞌ tanonSimon inoh samah kodaꞌ deꞌ nutaꞌ nabi-nabi daang Kitab  Dop-e ogiꞌ deꞌnulis nang in-e,
pairs.target: This agrees with the words of the prophets. As it is written,

pairs.source: in Topaꞌ, ‘Mokuaꞌ inoh Okuꞌ yaꞌ nog lagiꞌyaꞌ pakat niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ onak sukun Daud paliꞌ jadin laja samaꞌkodaꞌ boli deꞌ patuab lubuh paliꞌ mujuag baꞌuh,
pairs.target: ‘After these things I will return. I will again build the tabernacle of David, which has fallen. I will again build its ruins. I will set it up,

pairs.source: saꞌ-e suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e basa Yahudi kalik Okuꞌ.Okuꞌ moꞌ pilih soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ odaꞌ jadin tung Odop Kuꞌ.’In inoh in Topaꞌ,
pairs.target: That the rest of men may seek after the Lord; all the Gentiles who are called by my name, says the Lord, who does all these things.

pairs.source: Deꞌ moꞌ tanon-E noꞌuh-e.”
pairs.target: All of God’s works are known to him from eternity.’

pairs.source: “Nunaꞌ deꞌ pikil okuꞌ,” in Yakobus, “Otoꞌ diꞌ soꞌon pibaat nyaꞌa deꞌdiꞌ-e basa Yahudi deꞌ moꞌ nyelah odop-e tuduꞌ Topaꞌ
pairs.target: “Therefore my judgment is that we don’t trouble those from among the Gentiles who turn to God,

pairs.source: Pak-e otoꞌ halusnulis sulat tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ saꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e man pingumandeꞌ polih deꞌ moꞌ ngin-e tuduꞌ tipaduaꞌ deꞌ nai manusia, saꞌ-e diꞌ-e mandagin binatang deꞌ kobos obuah nyikak duoh man doyaꞌ, duoh diꞌ-e soꞌonngaso nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e lawang odop nyeꞌ
pairs.target: but that we write to them that they abstain from the pollution of idols, from sexual immorality, from what is strangled, and from blood.

pairs.source: Dop-e buk deꞌ nulis nabi Musasoꞌ noꞌuh-e nyaꞌa basa-e, bilang onu simayang ulang Yahudi deꞌ boli topatsimayang deꞌ suaꞌ kota.”
pairs.target: For Moses from generations of old has in every city those who preach him, being read in the synagogues every Sabbath.”

pairs.source: Rasul-rasul duoh pimipin-pimipin, samah-samah duoh uluk ulangKristen moꞌ bipokat pilih kudu-kudu naꞌan soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ yaꞌpait-e keꞌ Antiokhia, samah-samah Paulus duoh Barnabas  Odop-e deꞌmunoꞌ pilih Silas duoh Yudas deꞌ nang-e Barsabas  Soꞌ duwoh odop-e itihnyaꞌa deꞌ muaꞌ dooꞌ soꞌ ulang Kristen deꞌ bokon deꞌ Yerusalem
pairs.target: Then it seemed good to the apostles and the elders, with the whole assembly, to choose men out of their company, and send them to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas: Judas called Barsabbas, and Silas, chief men among the brothers.

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ sulatdeꞌ toban Silas duoh Yudas, deꞌ in tih in-e, “Sulat itih soꞌ koꞌih rasul-rasulduoh pimipin-pimipin uluk ulang Kristen deꞌ Yerusalem, saꞌan ingan ulangKristen soꞌ basa deꞌ diꞌ-e ulang Yahudi deꞌ loꞌo deꞌ Antiokhia, Siria duohKilikia.
pairs.target: They wrote these things by their hand: “The apostles, the elders, and the brothers, to the brothers who are of the Gentiles in Antioch, Syria, and Cilicia: greetings.

pairs.source: Koꞌih moꞌ ngojit ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan deꞌ soꞌ koꞌih deꞌ moꞌ odi tuduꞌingan, yohmoꞌ ngaso pakai oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal-e odaꞌ ingan yaꞌ bisayaꞌ yaꞌidoh, pak-e doiꞌ koꞌih nak odaꞌ-e
pairs.target: Because we have heard that some who went out from us have troubled you with words, unsettling your souls, saying, ‘You must be circumcised and keep the law,’ to whom we gave no commandment;

pairs.source: Koꞌih moꞌ bipokat pilih kudu-kudunaꞌan odaꞌ odi nunaꞌ Barnabas duoh Paulus deꞌ sukup koꞌih suka daꞌ-a.
pairs.target: it seemed good to us, having come to one accord, to choose out men and send them to you with our beloved Barnabas and Paul,

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ duwoh itih moꞌ bitaluh asong-e ngan-e magah adon YesusKristus
pairs.target: men who have risked their lives for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.

pairs.source: Yoh ngan koꞌih pait Yudas duoh Silas tuduꞌ ingan, saꞌ-e sina lasuꞌtanon isiꞌ sulat itih tuduꞌ ingan
pairs.target: We have sent therefore Judas and Silas, who themselves will also tell you the same things by word of mouth.

pairs.source: Oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ notu Iyang Topaꞌ, koꞌih moꞌnunaꞌ-a, maꞌ tiyaꞌ yaꞌ pibaat ingan lobih-lobih, jok-e deꞌ mutiꞌ sijaꞌ-e deꞌpatut ingan nunaꞌ-e
pairs.target: For it seemed good to the Holy Spirit, and to us, to lay no greater burden on you than these necessary things:

pairs.source: Maꞌ tiyaꞌ yaꞌ suwaꞌ man pinguman deꞌ nyelah nyaꞌatuduꞌ tipaduaꞌ, maꞌ man doyaꞌ, maꞌ man binatang deꞌ kobos obuah nyikakduoh maꞌ tiyaꞌ ngaso nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e lawang odop nyeꞌ, moꞌ ingan diꞌ-e tiyaꞌnai oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ, ingan moꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ paguh, in tih sijaꞌ-e sulat itih.”
pairs.target: that you abstain from things sacrificed to idols, from blood, from things strangled, and from sexual immorality, from which if you keep yourselves, it will be well with you. Farewell.”

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ pait-e itih moꞌ bilakat ponu keꞌ Antiokhia  Danih yohmoꞌ mogan suaꞌ uluk ulang Kristen odaꞌ tikuluk, yoh moꞌ ngin sulat deꞌtoban-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ
pairs.target: So, when they were sent off, they came to Antioch. Having gathered the multitude together, they delivered the letter.

pairs.source: Takal ulang Kristen inoh basa sulatinoh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ sonang otin-e dop-e sina daang sulat inoh ngilibulotin odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ
pairs.target: When they had read it, they rejoiced over the encouragement.

pairs.source: Yudas duoh Silas tuang nabi geh, muaꞌ tian-eodop-e duwoh sina duoh uluk ulang Kristen deꞌ Antiokhia, ngan-e odaꞌnyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ tamah bisayaꞌ
pairs.target: Judas and Silas, also being prophets themselves, encouraged the brothers with many words, and strengthened them.

pairs.source: Yudas duoh Silas loꞌo muaꞌ tian-e deꞌAntiokhia  Uluk ulang Kristen deꞌ danoꞌ moꞌ pait odop-e deꞌ duwoh paliꞌkeꞌ Yerusalem tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ pait odop-e
pairs.target: After they had spent some time there, they were sent back with greetings from the brothers to the apostles.

pairs.source: Paulus duoh Barnabas loꞌo muaꞌ tian-e deꞌ Antiokhia, danih odop-edeꞌ duwoh ngajal nyaꞌa duoh magah Pingunang Topaꞌ, samah-samah duohnyaꞌa deꞌ bokon.
pairs.target: But Paul and Barnabas stayed in Antioch, teaching and preaching the word of the Lord, with many others also.

pairs.source: Diꞌ-e tuui mokuaꞌ Paulus sina tuduꞌ Barnabas, “Jaꞌ otoꞌ paliꞌ nomimadih ayua deꞌ moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus deꞌ kota-kota deꞌ moꞌ ogiꞌ onu otoꞌmagah pingunang Topaꞌ daꞌ-e, saꞌ otoꞌ puꞌan oni wat odop-e deꞌ munoꞌadin.”
pairs.target: After some days Paul said to Barnabas, “Let’s return now and visit our brothers in every city in which we proclaimed the word of the Lord, to see how they are doing.”

pairs.source: Barnabas yaꞌ odaꞌ toban baya Yohanes Markus
pairs.target: Barnabas planned to take John, who was called Mark, with them also.

pairs.source: Pak-e Paulusnang in-e, “Diꞌ-e paguh toban nyaꞌa deꞌ doliaꞌ-e kiloja samah  Takal otoꞌdeꞌ Pamfilia, yoh togan otoꞌ.”
pairs.target: But Paul didn’t think that it was a good idea to take with them someone who had withdrawn from them in Pamphylia, and didn’t go with them to do the work.

pairs.source: Paulus duoh Barnabas moꞌ bikalah ayuhodaꞌ-e, luban-e yoh moꞌ bitogan  Barnabas moꞌ mit Markus toban bilayalodi ke Siprus
pairs.target: Then the contention grew so sharp that they separated from each other. Barnabas took Mark with him, and sailed away to Cyprus,

pairs.source: Pak-e Paulus pilih Silas odaꞌ nunaꞌ odop-e  Takal-e moꞌyaꞌ bilakat ponu, uluk ulang Kristen deꞌ Antiokhia bidoa ngan-e mitiaꞌ odaꞌTopaꞌ jaga-e
pairs.target: but Paul chose Silas, and went out, being commended by the brothers to the grace of God.

pairs.source: Paulus duoh Silas bilakat ponu kililing Siria duoh Kilikiadaang-e pilasang kila nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ deꞌ Yesus' saꞌ-e bitamah bisayaꞌ.
pairs.target: He went through Syria and Cilicia, strengthening the assemblies.

pairs.source: Paulus moꞌ lanyut pimonu-e keꞌ Derbe, mokuaꞌ inoh keꞌ Listra.Danoꞌ ogiꞌ pinunaꞌ Yesus deꞌ adon Timotius  Sinoꞌ-e ulang Yahudideꞌ moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus; pak-e samaꞌ-e ulang Yunani
pairs.target: He came to Derbe and Lystra: and behold, a certain disciple was there, named Timothy, the son of a Jewess who believed; but his father was a Greek.

pairs.source: Deꞌ Listra duohIkonium suaꞌ ulang Kristen puꞌan nang Timotius ulang deꞌ paguh
pairs.target: The brothers who were at Lystra and Iconium gave a good testimony about him.

pairs.source: Paulusyaꞌ toban Timotius nunaꞌ odop-e, yoh ngan-e odaꞌ Timotius bisunat, dop-esuaꞌ ulang Yahudi deꞌ Listra duoh Ikonium puꞌan nang samaꞌ Timotiusulang Yunani
pairs.target: Paul wanted to have him go out with him, and he took and circumcised him because of the Jews who were in those parts; for they all knew that his father was a Greek.

pairs.source: Daang pimonu-e Paulus duoh Silas nosaꞌ deꞌ kota-kota deꞌngilusuꞌ-e, yoh tanon tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ basa deꞌ bokon deꞌ moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌYesus, oni wat atulan deꞌ moꞌ notu rasul-rasul duoh pimipin deꞌ Yerusalem,Paulus duoh Silas tanon odaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nunaꞌ-e
pairs.target: As they went on their way through the cities, they delivered the decrees to them to keep which had been ordained by the apostles and elders who were at Jerusalem.

pairs.source: Ulang Kristenbitamah bisayaꞌ, bilang konu nyaꞌa deꞌ molot Kristen bitamah bogoꞌ.
pairs.target: So the assemblies were strengthened in the faith, and increased in number daily.

pairs.source: Iyang Topaꞌ jaman Paulus duoh silas magah pingunang Topaꞌ deꞌpropinsi Asia  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ponu baꞌat pulou Frigia duoh Galatia.
pairs.target: When they had gone through the region of Phrygia and Galatia, they were forbidden by the Holy Spirit to speak the word in Asia.

pairs.source: Takal-e moꞌ nog deꞌ baꞌat propinsi Misia odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ subamolot keꞌ propinsi Bitinia, pak-e idoh geh diꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ odaꞌ-e
pairs.target: When they had come opposite Mysia, they tried to go into Bithynia, but the Spirit didn’t allow them.

pairs.source: Odop-edeꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ lasuꞌ odi keꞌ Troas ngilusuꞌ propinsi Misia
pairs.target: Passing by Mysia, they came down to Troas.

pairs.source: Ngalom inohtakal Paulus aluaꞌ deꞌ Troas, iyoh ningaꞌ kodaꞌ daang pimoh  Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌannyaꞌa soꞌ Makedonia mujuag sinok Paulus yohmoꞌ mujok in-e, “Odi keꞌMakedonia tulung koꞌih!”
pairs.target: A vision appeared to Paul in the night. There was a man of Macedonia standing, begging him, and saying, “Come over into Macedonia and help us.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh koꞌih lasuꞌ biponyap siap odikeꞌ Makedonia, dop-e koꞌih bisayaꞌ nang Topaꞌ moꞌ mogan koꞌih odaꞌ oditanon Gah deꞌ Paguh danoꞌ.
pairs.target: When he had seen the vision, immediately we sought to go out to Macedonia, concluding that the Lord had called us to preach the Good News to them.

pairs.source: Koꞌih moꞌ bilayal soꞌ Troas lasuꞌ keꞌ Samotrake, onu deꞌ nikan-e koꞌihmoꞌ lanyut bilayal, koꞌih moꞌ nog deꞌ Neapolis
pairs.target: Setting sail therefore from Troas, we made a straight course to Samothrace, and the day following to Neapolis;

pairs.source: Soꞌ noh leh koꞌih odikeꞌ Filipi, Kota keꞌ niꞌ-e deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ propinsi Makedonia, nyaꞌa deꞌ loꞌodeꞌ Filipi nunaꞌ jadin ulang Roma  Danoꞌ leh koꞌih loꞌo kudu-kudu onu-e.
pairs.target: and from there to Philippi, which is a city of Macedonia, the foremost of the district, a Roman colony. We were staying some days in this city.

pairs.source: Takal onu simayang ulang Yahudi koꞌih odi keꞌ pang sungi deꞌ sopaꞌtiban gerbang kota, dop-e koꞌih ningaꞌ ogiꞌ topat simayang agama Yahudi,koꞌih moꞌ kilakal duoh bala dayung deꞌ tikuluk deꞌ topat inoh
pairs.target: On the Sabbath day we went outside of the city by a riverside, where we supposed there was a place of prayer, and we sat down, and spoke to the women who had come together.

pairs.source: Soꞌ odop-edeꞌ munoꞌ ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan dayung deꞌ adon Lidia soꞌ kota Tiatira deꞌ nyomahTopaꞌ, iyoh tukang jua kain ungu kain deꞌ maal loga-e, Topaꞌ bukaꞌ otin-esaꞌ-e tilimaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal Paulus
pairs.target: A certain woman named Lydia, a seller of purple, of the city of Thyatira, one who worshiped God, heard us; whose heart the Lord opened to listen to the things which were spoken by Paul.

pairs.source: Paulus moꞌ baptis Lidia duoh suaꞌodop-e daang boli-e, mokuaꞌ inoh yoh moꞌ ngijaꞌ koꞌih, in-e, “Moꞌ inganpikil nang okuꞌ tok-tok bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus, jaꞌ ngilumon deꞌ boli kuꞌ.” Yohmoꞌ tok-tok mujok odaꞌ koꞌih ngilumon deꞌ boli-e, nog koꞌih nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌnang-e.
pairs.target: When she and her household were baptized, she begged us, saying, “If you have judged me to be faithful to the Lord, come into my house, and stay.” So she persuaded us.

pairs.source: Takal onu koꞌih odi keꞌ topat simayang inoh, koꞌih bitapod duoh niꞌdayung  Iyoh jadin kuli, iyoh kiloja saꞌan nyaꞌa  Dayung inoh obuah nguasamuat munua yoh moꞌ jadin tukang ningaꞌ nasip nyaꞌa  Daang kiloja tukangningaꞌ nasip nyaꞌa', yoh bogoꞌ soꞌon duit saꞌan suaꞌ toke-e
pairs.target: As we were going to prayer, a certain girl having a spirit of divination met us, who brought her masters much gain by fortune telling.

pairs.source: Dayung inohbitunaꞌ duoh dug koꞌih ngan Paulus daang-e sina in-e, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ mutiꞌ deꞌnai kiloja deꞌ odaꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ ayuh kuasa-E, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tanon olanodaꞌ nyaꞌa silamat!”
pairs.target: Following Paul and us, she cried out, “These men are servants of the Most High God, who proclaim to us a way of salvation!”

pairs.source: Iyoh bitunaꞌ duoh Paulus nog kudu-kudu onu-e,pak-e takal Paulus diꞌ-e taan ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ nang-e, Paulus kumiat yoh moꞌin-e tuduꞌ muat munua deꞌ ogiꞌ daang dayung inoh, “Daang adon YesusKristus okuꞌ odaꞌ muꞌu luah soꞌ dayung itih!” Takal inoh geh muat munuainoh lasuꞌ luah soꞌ dayung inoh
pairs.target: She was doing this for many days. But Paul, becoming greatly annoyed, turned and said to the spirit, “I command you in the name of Jesus Christ to come out of her!” It came out that very hour.

pairs.source: Takal ayua toke-e moꞌ ningaꞌ moꞌ doiꞌtiyaꞌ yoh yaꞌ soꞌon duit, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ takap Paulus duoh Silas yohmoꞌ matak toban keꞌ topat nyaꞌa bilituang ngaduap piayuh-piayuh kotainoh
pairs.target: But when her masters saw that the hope of their gain was gone, they seized Paul and Silas, and dragged them into the marketplace before the rulers.

pairs.source: Takal-e toban Paulus duoh silas tuduꞌ piayuh-piayuh kota inoh,yoh moꞌ in-e, “Odop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ ulang Yahudi, yoh pingaso daang kota itih.
pairs.target: When they had brought them to the magistrates, they said, “These men, being Jews, are agitating our city,

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ ngajal adat deꞌ diꞌ-e soꞌon otoꞌ ulang Roma tilimaꞌ-eduoh nunaꞌ-e.”
pairs.target: and advocate customs which it is not lawful for us to accept or to observe, being Romans.”

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ moꞌ mokat nyelang Paulus duoh Silas.Piayuh-piayuh daang kota inoh odaꞌ nyaꞌa ngilolak pimakai soꞌ polongodop-e deꞌ duwoh daang-e pijolaꞌ-e
pairs.target: The multitude rose up together against them, and the magistrates tore their clothes from them, and commanded them to be beaten with rods.

pairs.source: Takal-e mokuaꞌ paliꞌ-paliꞌ pijolaꞌ-eyoh moꞌ kibalot kaang jel  Piayuh-piayuh daang kota inoh moꞌ pilitahpiayuh nyaꞌa deꞌ jaga jel odaꞌ bonal-bonal jaga Paulus duoh Silas
pairs.target: When they had laid many stripes on them, they threw them into prison, charging the jailer to keep them safely,

pairs.source: Piayuhnyaꞌa deꞌ jaga jel inoh moꞌ nunaꞌ pilitah inoh yohmoꞌ kibalot Paulus duohSilas daang bilit jel deꞌ nuaꞌ aang-e, yoh moꞌ pasung pakai kibalot poꞌon-edaang lubang lagan koyuh deꞌ togap.
pairs.target: who, having received such a command, threw them into the inner prison, and secured their feet in the stocks.

pairs.source: Kila-kila tuluap ngalom Paulus duoh Silas bidoa duoh ngilagu mudiTopaꞌ, nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon deꞌ daang jel ngojit odop-e deꞌ duwoh ngilagumudi Topaꞌ
pairs.target: But about midnight Paul and Silas were praying and singing hymns to God, and the prisoners were listening to them.

pairs.source: Tang-tang tanaꞌ biguyut daang boli jel tiguyang-tikusuak,suaꞌ tiban daang jel inoh tibukaꞌ, suaꞌ pasung nyaꞌa daang jel inoh tibukaꞌsuaꞌ-e
pairs.target: Suddenly there was a great earthquake, so that the foundations of the prison were shaken; and immediately all the doors were opened, and everyone’s bonds were loosened.

pairs.source: Piayuh nyaꞌa deꞌ jaga jel inoh moꞌ gogoh, yoh moꞌ pikil nang suaꞌnyaꞌa daang jel inoh obuaꞌ buu luah, yoh moꞌ nyitak podang-e yaꞌ bitoko.
pairs.target: The jailer, being roused out of sleep and seeing the prison doors open, drew his sword and was about to kill himself, supposing that the prisoners had escaped.

pairs.source: Pak-e Paulus nang bogan-e in-e, “Maꞌ yaꞌ ngabos odop muꞌ! Suaꞌ koꞌihaluaꞌ ogiꞌ datiꞌ.”
pairs.target: But Paul cried with a loud voice, saying, “Don’t harm yourself, for we are all here!”

pairs.source: Piayuh jel inoh mitiaꞌ lapu yohmoꞌ bikoduh molot keꞌ bilit jel daang-ekimotol kimubuah, yoh moꞌ guluꞌ bikunyug sinok poꞌon Paulus duoh Silas.
pairs.target: He called for lights, sprang in, fell down trembling before Paul and Silas,

pairs.source: Yoh moꞌ toban Paulus duoh Silas luah daang-e sina, “Oni mey deꞌ patutokuꞌ yaꞌ nai-e saꞌ kuꞌ silamat?”
pairs.target: brought them out, and said, “Sirs, what must I do to be saved?”

pairs.source: Paulus duoh silas moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Bisayaꞌ leh tuduꞌ Topaꞌ Yesus saꞌmuꞌu silamat, muꞌu duoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa daang boli muꞌ!”
pairs.target: They said, “Believe in the Lord Jesus Christ, and you will be saved, you and your household.”

pairs.source: Paulus duoh Silasmoꞌ tanon Pingunang Topaꞌ tuduꞌ piayuh nyaꞌa deꞌ jaga jel inoh duoh suaꞌnyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ daang boli-e
pairs.target: They spoke the word of the Lord to him, and to all who were in his house.

pairs.source: Tuluap ngalom noh geh piayuh nyaꞌa deꞌjaga jel inoh toban Paulus duoh Silas mamiaꞌ kinaman-e  Takal inoh gehPaulus duoh Silas lasuꞌ baptis iyoh duoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ daang boli-e.
pairs.target: He took them the same hour of the night, and washed their stripes, and was immediately baptized, he and all his household.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh yoh moꞌ toban Paulus duoh Silas ke boli-e, yohmoꞌ nguliaꞌpinguman odaꞌ man, nyaꞌa deꞌ jaga jel inoh duoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa daang boliinoh moꞌ doon, dop-e yoh moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: He brought them up into his house, and set food before them, and rejoiced greatly, with all his household, having believed in God.

pairs.source: Takal onu moꞌ jawaꞌ piayuh-piayuh kota odaꞌ onak buah-e odi tuduꞌpiayuh nyaꞌa deꞌ jaga jel tanon odaꞌ piluah Paulus duoh Silas soꞌ jel.
pairs.target: But when it was day, the magistrates sent the sergeants, saying, “Let those men go.”

pairs.source: Piayuh nyaꞌa deꞌ jel moꞌ tanon tuduꞌ Paulus in-e, “Piayuh-piayuh kotamoꞌ odaꞌ okuꞌ piluah ingan, adin ingan soꞌon buu daang silamat.”
pairs.target: The jailer reported these words to Paul, saying, “The magistrates have sent to let you go; now therefore come out, and go in peace.”

pairs.source: Pak-e Paulus in-e duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Koꞌih ulang Roma, doiꞌ-enak bilituang duoh koꞌih tapo nak mosut koꞌih deꞌ jowin nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ,yohmoꞌ kibalot koꞌih daang jel  Adin yoh odaꞌ koꞌih luah, masaꞌ nak oloꞌ-oloꞌdeꞌ wat noh! Odaꞌ odop-e odi katiꞌ saꞌ-e odop-e deꞌ piluah koꞌih.”
pairs.target: But Paul said to them, “They have beaten us publicly, without a trial, men who are Romans, and have cast us into prison! Do they now release us secretly? No, most certainly, but let them come themselves and bring us out!”

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ tanon pilitah piayuh kota inoh moꞌ paliꞌ lepot tuduꞌpiayuh-piayuh kota Roma  Takal-e moꞌ puꞌan nang Paulus duoh Silas ulangRoma yoh moꞌ tolu
pairs.target: The sergeants reported these words to the magistrates, and they were afraid when they heard that they were Romans,

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ odi keꞌ jel mitiaꞌ maꞌap tuduꞌPaulus duoh Silas, yoh moꞌ toban luah yoh moꞌ mitiaꞌ odaꞌ odop-e deꞌduwoh buu soꞌ kota inoh
pairs.target: and they came and begged them. When they had brought them out, they asked them to depart from the city.

pairs.source: Paulus duoh Silas moꞌ buu soꞌ jel, yoh moꞌ odikeꞌ boli Lidia  Takal-e moꞌ bitapod duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ danoꞌ yoh moꞌpilasang otin nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ odaꞌ bitamah bisayaꞌ mokuaꞌ inoh yoh moꞌbilakat ponu.
pairs.target: They went out of the prison, and entered into Lydia’s house. When they had seen the brothers, they encouraged them, and departed.

pairs.source: Paulus duoh Silas lanyut pimonu-e ngilusuꞌ Ampipolis duohApolonia yoh moꞌ nog keꞌ Tesalonika, danoꞌ ogiꞌ boli topat simayangulang Yahudi
pairs.target: Now when they had passed through Amphipolis and Apollonia, they came to Thessalonica, where there was a Jewish synagogue.

pairs.source: Paulus moꞌ odi keꞌ boli topat simayang inoh kodaꞌ deꞌbiasa yoh nai-e  Taluh sidoh onu simayang ulang Yahudi bijuut-juut yohkilakal duoh nyaꞌa danoꞌ, isiꞌ pingunang Topaꞌ daang Kitab deꞌ basa-e.
pairs.target: Paul, as was his custom, went in to them, and for three Sabbath days reasoned with them from the Scriptures,

pairs.source: Pakai pingunang daang Kitab, Paulus nelang duoh tanon bukti nang LajaPinyilamat deꞌ tanon Topaꞌ daang janyi-E, Iyoh pasti jolaꞌ yoh moꞌ paliꞌidip soꞌ kobos-e  Yoh moꞌ in-e, “Yesus deꞌ tanon kuꞌ itih leh odop-E, LajaPinyilamat deꞌ tanon-e daang Kitab.”
pairs.target: explaining and demonstrating that the Christ had to suffer and rise again from the dead, and saying, “This Jesus, whom I proclaim to you, is the Christ.”
