pairs.source: Kudu-kudu naꞌan ulang Yahudimoꞌ suwaꞌ bisayaꞌ nunaꞌ Paulus duoh Silas, watnoh geh ulang Yunani deꞌpimodo tuduꞌ agama Yahudi, duoh dayung-dayung timogah daang kotainoh.
pairs.target: Some of them were persuaded, and joined Paul and Silas, of the devout Greeks a great multitude, and not a few of the chief women.

pairs.source: Pak-e ulang-ulang Yahudi moꞌ siniaꞌ, yoh moꞌ ngijaꞌ ulang malas duohulang deꞌ jaꞌat deꞌ loꞌo deꞌ pasal nai uluk pingaso, yoh moꞌ ngaso odaꞌnyaꞌa biliuak daang kota inoh  Yoh moꞌ odi keꞌ boli nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌYesus deꞌ adon Yason yoh moꞌ tulak tiban-e ngan-e kalik Paulus duoh Silas,dop-e yoh yaꞌ toban bilituang duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ
pairs.target: But the unpersuaded Jews took along some wicked men from the marketplace, and gathering a crowd, set the city in an uproar. Assaulting the house of Jason, they sought to bring them out to the people.

pairs.source: Takal-e diꞌ-e tapododop-e deꞌ duwoh, yoh moꞌ matak Yason duoh kudu-kudu ulang Kristenodi ngaduap piayuh-piayuh deꞌ kota inoh, daang-e nang bogan-e, “Nyaꞌadeꞌ katiꞌ kanih pingaso adin moꞌ nog kota otoꞌ!
pairs.target: When they didn’t find them, they dragged Jason and certain brothers  before the rulers of the city, crying, “These who have turned the world upside down have come here also,

pairs.source: Yason tilimaꞌ odop-e deꞌduwoh odaꞌ ngilumon deꞌ boli-e  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ lawan oniꞌ deꞌmoꞌ notap Laja Roma, dop-e yoh moꞌ nang ogiꞌ lagiꞌ laja deꞌ bokon deꞌadon Yesus.”
pairs.target: whom Jason has received. These all act contrary to the decrees of Caesar, saying that there is another king, Jesus!”

pairs.source: Takal nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ duoh piayuh-piayuh kota ngojit suaꞌoniꞌ deꞌ nang-e, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bigaduh
pairs.target: The multitude and the rulers of the city were troubled when they heard these things.

pairs.source: Piayuh deꞌ kota inoh moꞌodaꞌ Yason duoh ulang Kristen jamen pakai duit saꞌ diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ nai hal lagiꞌ,mokuaꞌ inoh yoh moꞌ pilopas odop-e deꞌ duwoh.
pairs.target: When they had taken security from Jason and the rest, they let them go.

pairs.source: Ngalom inoh geh uluk ulang Kristen odaꞌ Paulus duoh Silas odi keꞌkota Berea  Takal-e nog, Paulus duoh Silas odi keꞌ boli topat simayangulang Yahudi
pairs.target: The brothers immediately sent Paul and Silas away by night to Beroea. When they arrived, they went into the Jewish synagogue.

pairs.source: Ulang-ulang Yahudi deꞌ Berea botang tibukaꞌ otin-e soꞌulang Yahudi deꞌ Tesalonika, yoh ngan odop-e danoꞌ tilimaꞌ gah tentangYesus yohmoꞌ bilang konu yoh bilajal Kitab saꞌ-e puꞌan tok kedoh keh oniꞌdeꞌ ngajal Paulus
pairs.target: Now these were more noble than those in Thessalonica, in that they received the word with all readiness of mind, examining the Scriptures daily to see whether these things were so.

pairs.source: Bogoꞌ soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus, bogoꞌgeh ulang Yunani deꞌ timogah deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus bait deꞌ dali baitdeꞌ dayung
pairs.target: Many of them therefore believed; also of the prominent Greek women, and not a few men.

pairs.source: Pak-e takal ulang Yahudi soꞌ Tesalonika puꞌan nang Paulusmagah pingunang Topaꞌ deꞌ Berea yoh moꞌ nog uyak kila nyaꞌa danoꞌ odaꞌbigaduh saꞌ lawan oniꞌ deꞌ tanon Paulus
pairs.target: But when the Jews of Thessalonica had knowledge that the word of God was proclaimed by Paul at Beroea also, they came there likewise, agitating the multitudes.

pairs.source: Uluk ulang Kristen deꞌ Berealikas-likas odi katod Paulus keꞌ pang laut, pak-e Silas duoh Timotius aluaꞌloꞌo deꞌ danoꞌ
pairs.target: Then the brothers immediately sent out Paul to go as far as to the sea, and Silas and Timothy still stayed there.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ katod Paulus suwaꞌ nog Atena, takal-e paliꞌyoh toban sibaya soꞌ Paulus odaꞌ Silas duoh Timotius likas-likas odi tuduꞌodop-e.
pairs.target: But those who escorted Paul brought him as far as Athens. Receiving a commandment to Silas and Timothy that they should come to him very quickly, they departed.

pairs.source: Takal Paulus aluaꞌ kajon Silas duoh Timotius deꞌ Atena, otin-e ngilobuꞌningaꞌ Kota inoh bogoꞌ tipaduaꞌ-tipaduaꞌ dewa deꞌ nyomah-e
pairs.target: Now while Paul waited for them at Athens, his spirit was provoked within him as he saw the city full of idols.

pairs.source: Noh lehngan-e yoh odi keꞌ boli topat simayang ulang Yahudi yoh moꞌ kilakal duohulang Yahudi baya nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e ulang Yahudi deꞌ nyomah Topaꞌ danoꞌ.Wat inoh geh duoh bilang nyaꞌa deꞌ tapod-e deꞌ pasal yoh kilakal duoh-e.
pairs.target: So he reasoned in the synagogue with the Jews and the devout persons, and in the marketplace every day with those who met him.

pairs.source: Wat inoh geh duoh ulang-ulang deꞌ bijak soꞌ golongan Epikuros duohgolongan Stoa  Kudu-kudu naꞌan soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nang, “Yoh itih onideꞌ puꞌan-e, sina-e jaꞌ-e deꞌ bogoꞌ, pak-e otok-e osan!” Nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon sinanang, “Iyoh magah dewa deꞌ nyomah basa deꞌ bokon”  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌin inoh dop-e Paulus magah tentang Yesus deꞌ moꞌ paliꞌ idip soꞌ kobos-E.
pairs.target: Some of the Epicurean and Stoic philosophers also were conversing with him. Some said, “What does this babbler want to say?” Others said, “He seems to be advocating foreign deities,” because he preached Jesus and the resurrection.

pairs.source: Yoh moꞌ ngijaꞌ Paulus odi keꞌ udung adat deꞌ Punguꞌ Areopagus, danihyoh moꞌ sina duoh Paulus, “Soꞌon yeh koꞌih puꞌan oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal muꞌ deꞌbaꞌuh?
pairs.target: They took hold of him, and brought him to the Areopagus, saying, “May we know what this new teaching is, which is spoken by you?

pairs.source: Dop-e muꞌu tanon odaꞌ koꞌih ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ-e molot akal, nohleh ngan koꞌih yaꞌ puꞌan oni loti oniꞌ deꞌ nang muꞌ inoh.”
pairs.target: For you bring certain strange things to our ears. We want to know therefore what these things mean.”

pairs.source: (Dop-e nyaꞌadeꞌ loꞌo deꞌ kota Atena duoh ulang nog deꞌ loꞌo danoꞌ sukup suka kabuaꞌonu-e ngojit duoh silita tentang oniꞌ deꞌ baꞌuh.)
pairs.target: Now all the Athenians and the strangers living there spent their time in nothing else, but either to tell or to hear some new thing.

pairs.source: Paulus moꞌ odi mujuag keꞌ udung adat deꞌ Punguꞌ Aeropagus yohmoꞌsina, “Oi ulang-ulang Atena! Deꞌ ningaꞌ kuꞌ, daang suaꞌ hal ingan ulang deꞌtaat agama ingan
pairs.target: Paul stood in the middle of the Areopagus, and said, “You men of Athens, I perceive that you are very religious in all things.

pairs.source: Takal kuꞌ ponu-ponu daang kota ingan, okuꞌ ningaꞌtopat-topat soꞌ ingan nyomah dewa-dewa  Ogiꞌ geh topat soꞌ ingan simoliahbinatang ngan ingan nyomah-e, danoꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ nulis ingan deꞌ in-e: ‘SaꞌanTopaꞌ deꞌ diꞌ koꞌih puꞌan-e.’ Topaꞌ deꞌ diꞌ ingan puꞌan-e inoh leh deꞌ yaꞌtanon kuꞌ tuduꞌ ingan
pairs.target: For as I passed along, and observed the objects of your worship, I found also an altar with this inscription: ‘TO AN UNKNOWN GOD.’ What therefore you worship in ignorance, this I announce to you.

pairs.source: Topaꞌ deꞌ nai tanaꞌ duoh suaꞌ isiꞌ-e, Topaꞌ deꞌogiꞌ kuasa-e deꞌ tun longit duoh tanaꞌ, Iyoh diꞌ-e loꞌo deꞌ topat-topat deꞌnai nyaꞌa saꞌan dewa deꞌ nai odop manusia
pairs.target: The God who made the world and all things in it, he, being Lord of heaven and earth, doesn’t dwell in temples made with hands,

pairs.source: Iyoh diꞌ-e pilelu odaꞌ nyaꞌatulung Odop-e, dop-e Iyoh leh deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa idip, duoh ngin asong, bayangin suaꞌ oniꞌ tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa
pairs.target: neither is he served by men’s hands, as though he needed anything, seeing he himself gives to all life and breath, and all things.

pairs.source: Soꞌ niꞌ naꞌan manusia, Yoh moꞌ nai odaꞌnyaꞌa bogoꞌ basa-e duoh odaꞌ yoh loꞌo niꞌ pulou-pulou  Iyoh geh deꞌ moꞌnotu soꞌ sibungas-e siniaꞌ duoh daki soꞌ-e loꞌo,
pairs.target: He made from one blood every nation of men to dwell on all the surface of the earth, having determined appointed seasons, and the boundaries of their dwellings,

pairs.source: saꞌ yoh puꞌan odop-e kalikTopaꞌ podo-podo-e bitapod duoh-E takal yoh kalik-E, sibonal-e Topaꞌ diꞌ-ejuuaꞌ soꞌ otoꞌ masim-masim
pairs.target: that they should seek the Lord, if perhaps they might reach out for him and find him, though he is not far from each one of us.

pairs.source: Kodaꞌ deꞌ nang tukang gumang ingan, ‘Iyohleh deꞌ odaꞌ otoꞌ idip, odaꞌ otoꞌ bigolak duoh odaꞌ otoꞌ ogiꞌ’, samah kodaꞌdeꞌ tanon kudu-kudu tukang gumang ingan, deꞌ in-e ‘Sibonal-e otoꞌ deꞌmutiꞌ ogiꞌ leh onak-onak-E.’
pairs.target: ‘For in him we live, and move, and have our being.’ As some of your own poets have said, ‘For we are also his offspring.’

pairs.source: Dop-e otoꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ onak-onak-E, maꞌ nangTopaꞌ samah kodaꞌ tipaduaꞌ deꞌ nai soꞌ mas, soꞌ pilak, soꞌ batuh deꞌ nainunaꞌ kimane manusia
pairs.target: Being then the offspring of God, we ought not to think that the Divine Nature is like gold, or silver, or stone, engraved by art and design of man.

pairs.source: Noꞌuh-e Topaꞌ moꞌ ngapun suaꞌ salah manusiatakal-e aluaꞌ diꞌ-e puꞌan oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ, pak-e adin Topaꞌ moꞌ odaꞌsuaꞌ nyaꞌa paliꞌ keꞌ olan Topaꞌ deꞌ bonal, togan olan deꞌ jaꞌat
pairs.target: The times of ignorance therefore God overlooked. But now he commands that all people everywhere should repent,

pairs.source: Dop-e Iyohmoꞌ notap onu-e takal-e yaꞌ bilituang duoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa daang dunia nunaꞌduoh oniꞌ deꞌ nai-e  Tukang ngituang inoh nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ pilih Topaꞌ saꞌnyaꞌa bisayaꞌ nang Yoh deꞌ moꞌ obuah pilih Topaꞌ, Topaꞌ moꞌ odaꞌ paliꞌidip soꞌ kobos-E.”
pairs.target: because he has appointed a day in which he will judge the world in righteousness by the man whom he has ordained; of which he has given assurance to all men, in that he has raised him from the dead.”

pairs.source: Takal nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngojit gah nyaꞌa deꞌ paliꞌ idip soꞌ pingobos-e,nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ towoh Paulus, ogiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ sina in-e, “Lopas tihnegeh koꞌih ngojit pingunang muꞌ inoh.”
pairs.target: Now when they heard of the resurrection of the dead, some mocked; but others said, “We want to hear you again concerning this.”

pairs.source: Paulus moꞌ buu togan odop-edeꞌ munoꞌ
pairs.target: Thus Paul went out from among them.

pairs.source: Pak-e ogiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ nuaꞌ Paulus, yoh moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌYesus, kodaꞌ Dionisius, deꞌ soꞌ uluk Areopagus odop-e deꞌ ngulus adat, duohniꞌ naꞌan dayung deꞌ adon Damaris, duoh kudu-kudu nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon.
pairs.target: But certain men joined with him, and believed, among whom also was Dionysius the Areopagite, and a woman named Damaris, and others with them.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Paulus buu soꞌ Atena, yohmoꞌ odi keꞌ Korintus
pairs.target: After these things Paul departed from Athens, and came to Corinth.

pairs.source: DeꞌKorintus yoh bitapod duoh ulang Yahudi deꞌ adon Akwila soꞌpropinsi Pontus, iyoh tuang-e nog soꞌ Italia duoh Priskila sowon-e  Yohodi keꞌ Korintus dop-e laja Klaudius odaꞌ suaꞌ ulang Yahudi buu soꞌ Roma.Paulus nosaꞌ tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ duwoh
pairs.target: He found a certain Jew named Aquila, a man of Pontus by race, who had recently come from Italy, with his wife Priscilla, because Claudius had commanded all the Jews to depart from Rome. He came to them,

pairs.source: Paulus moꞌ loꞌo duoh-e, yohmoꞌkiloja samah dop-e kiloja deꞌ nai-e samah duoh Paulus, tukang nai ilowsoꞌ kulit deꞌ silalu iyoh jua-e
pairs.target: and because he practiced the same trade, he lived with them and worked, for by trade they were tent makers.

pairs.source: Pak-e bilang onu simayang ulang Yahudi,Paulus odi keꞌ boli topat simayang, yoh kilakal odaꞌ ulang Yahudi duohulang Yunani bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: He reasoned in the synagogue every Sabbath, and persuaded Jews and Greeks.

pairs.source: Takal Silas duoh Timotius moꞌ nog soꞌ Makedonia, Paulus moꞌ tapodpakai suaꞌ onu ngan-e magah pingunang Topaꞌ tuduꞌ ulang Yahudi, yoh moꞌtanon Yesus itih leh Laja Pinyilamat deꞌ tanon Topaꞌ daang janyi-E
pairs.target: But when Silas and Timothy came down from Macedonia, Paul was compelled by the Spirit, testifying to the Jews that Jesus was the Christ.

pairs.source: Pak-eulang Yahudi danoꞌ telus netang duoh pijaꞌat-e  Paulus moꞌ nguguah loputanaꞌ soꞌ pimakai-e, tanda yoh moꞌ mokuaꞌ tanon salah-e deꞌ nai odop-e deꞌmunoꞌ, yoh moꞌ in-e, “Moꞌ Topaꞌ ngukum ingan, inoh salah odop ingan,okuꞌ doiꞌ salah kuꞌ  Mulai soꞌ adin okuꞌ odi tuduꞌ basa deꞌ diꞌ-e Yahudi.”
pairs.target: When they opposed him and blasphemed, he shook out his clothing and said to them, “Your blood be on your own heads! I am clean. From now on, I will go to the Gentiles!”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Paulus moꞌ buu togan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, yohmoꞌ odi keꞌboli nyaꞌa deꞌ adon Titius Yustus, ulang deꞌ diꞌ-e Yahudi, deꞌ nyomah tuduꞌTopaꞌ, boli-e sinok boli topat simayang
pairs.target: He departed there, and went into the house of a certain man named Justus, one who worshiped God, whose house was next door to the synagogue.

pairs.source: Pak-e Krispus deꞌ jadin pimipinboli topat simayang inoh duoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa daang boli-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus,bogoꞌ geh ulang-ulang Korintus deꞌ bokon ngojit gah deꞌ tanon Paulus,odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus yohmoꞌ obuah baptis.
pairs.target: Crispus, the ruler of the synagogue, believed in the Lord with all his house. Many of the Corinthians, when they heard, believed and were baptized.

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ ngalom takal inoh Topaꞌ bitanga Odop-E kodaꞌ daang pimoh tuduꞌPaulus, yohmoꞌ in-e tuduꞌ-e, “Maꞌ yaꞌ tolu! Telus negeh magah pingunangTopaꞌ! Maꞌ yaꞌ loꞌo!
pairs.target: The Lord said to Paul in the night by a vision, “Don’t be afraid, but speak and don’t be silent;

pairs.source: Doiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tapod naꞌ tongan-e kanam muꞌusobab Okuꞌ ogiꞌ duoh muꞌu; Dop-e bogoꞌ nyaꞌa daang kota itih nuwaꞌOkuꞌ, in Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: for I am with you, and no one will attack you to harm you, for I have many people in this city.”

pairs.source: Paulus moꞌ loꞌo danoꞌ niꞌ sowaꞌ nuam bulan, iyoh ngajalpingunang Topaꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa danoꞌ.
pairs.target: He lived there a year and six months, teaching the word of God among them.

pairs.source: Takal Galio jadin Gubelnul deꞌ propinsi Akhaya, ulang Yahudi moꞌbipokat netang Paulus yohmoꞌ toban Paulus keꞌ topat bilituang
pairs.target: But when Gallio was proconsul of Achaia, the Jews with one accord rose up against Paul and brought him before the judgment seat,

pairs.source: Nyaꞌadeꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e, “Nyaꞌa itih ngaluh nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ odaꞌ nyomah Topaꞌpak-e diꞌ-e nunaꞌ atulan-atulan Topaꞌ deꞌ nulis nabi Musa.”
pairs.target: saying, “This man persuades men to worship God contrary to the law.”

pairs.source: Takal Paulus yaꞌ sina, Galio dioꞌ sina in-e tuduꞌ ulang Yahudi, “Oiulang-ulang Yahudi, moꞌ-e oniꞌ deꞌ lapol ingan itih oniꞌ deꞌ salah, deꞌ jaꞌattapod okuꞌ ngojit-e.
pairs.target: But when Paul was about to open his mouth, Gallio said to the Jews, “If indeed it were a matter of wrong or of wicked crime, you Jews, it would be reasonable that I should bear with you;

pairs.source: Pak-e oniꞌ deꞌ bikalah ingan itih madas agama odop ingan, kodaꞌ bangsina, adon nyaꞌa, duoh atulan-atulan! Ngatul negeh siodop ingan, okuꞌdoliaꞌ kuꞌ ngulus oniꞌ deꞌ in inoh.”
pairs.target: but if they are questions about words and names and your own law, look to it yourselves. For I don’t want to be a judge of these matters.”

pairs.source: Galio moꞌ kasig odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ odaꞌluah
pairs.target: So he drove them from the judgment seat.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ takap Sostenes pimipin boli topat simayang,yohmoꞌ bipupuꞌ duoh-e deꞌ sulung jowin mija topat bilituang, pak-e Galiodiꞌ-e piduli-e.
pairs.target: Then all the Greeks laid hold on Sosthenes, the ruler of the synagogue, and beat him before the judgment seat. Gallio didn’t care about any of these things.

pairs.source: Paulus loꞌo muaꞌ tian-e deꞌ Korintus  Mokuaꞌ inoh, yoh tanon tuduꞌnyaꞌa danoꞌ nang odop-e yaꞌ bilayal keꞌ Siria  Deꞌ pelabuhan Kengkrea yohmoꞌ bigumol bak-e dop-e yoh moꞌ mokuaꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ janyi-e duoh Topaꞌ.Priskila duoh Akwila suwaꞌ bilayal nunaꞌ Paulus
pairs.target: Paul, having stayed after this many more days, took his leave of the brothers,  and sailed from there for Syria, together with Priscilla and Aquila. He shaved his head in Cenchreae, for he had a vow.

pairs.source: Takal-e nog deꞌ Efesus,Paulus togan Priskila duoh Akwila  Yoh moꞌ odi keꞌ boli topat simayang,yohmoꞌ kilakal duoh ulang-ulang Yahudi deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ
pairs.target: He came to Ephesus, and he left them there; but he himself entered into the synagogue, and reasoned with the Jews.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌmitiaꞌ odaꞌ loꞌo botang tuui danoꞌ, pak-e Paulus doliaꞌ-e
pairs.target: When they asked him to stay with them a longer time, he declined;

pairs.source: Takal yoh yaꞌponu yoh moꞌ sina in-e, “Simoꞌ Topaꞌ aluaꞌ odaꞌ okuꞌ paliꞌ katiꞌ, okuꞌ paliꞌlagi tuduꞌ ingan.” Mokuaꞌ inoh yoh moꞌ buu soꞌ Efesus muat deꞌ kapal layal.
pairs.target: but taking his leave of them, he said, “I must by all means keep this coming feast in Jerusalem, but I will return again to you if God wills.” Then he set sail from Ephesus.

pairs.source: Takal-e nog deꞌ Kaisarea, yoh moꞌ odi tuduꞌ uluk ulang Kristen, bisikiankabal nyaꞌa danoꞌ, mokuaꞌ inoh yoh lasuꞌ odi keꞌ Antiokhia
pairs.target: When he had landed at Caesarea, he went up and greeted the assembly, and went down to Antioch.

pairs.source: Muaꞌ tian-eyoh loꞌo danoꞌ, mokuaꞌ inoh yoh moꞌ buu nosaꞌ deꞌ topat-topat deꞌ Galatiaduoh Frigia, ngan-e odaꞌ nyaꞌa danoꞌ makin bisayaꞌ.
pairs.target: Having spent some time there, he departed, and went through the region of Galatia, and Phrygia, in order, establishing all the disciples.

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ ulang Yahudi deꞌ adon Apolos nog keꞌ Efesus, Apolos itih asal-esoꞌ kota Aleksandria, iyoh itih bijak sina-e duoh ngiloti tuluap tentang isiꞌKitab
pairs.target: Now a certain Jew named Apollos, an Alexandrian by race, an eloquent man, came to Ephesus. He was mighty in the Scriptures.

pairs.source: Yoh moꞌ mokuaꞌ obuah ngajal tentang Yesus  Iyoh tiluti daang-edoon asong-e ngajal tentang Yesus, pak-e jok-e puꞌan baptisan deꞌ tanonYohanes Pembaptis
pairs.target: This man had been instructed in the way of the Lord; and being fervent in spirit, he spoke and taught accurately the things concerning Jesus, although he knew only the baptism of John.

pairs.source: Apolos diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ tolu ngajal deꞌ boli topat simayang.Takal Priskila duoh Akwila ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal-e, iyoh moꞌ toban odikeꞌ boli-e  Priskila duoh Akwila moꞌ nelang tuduꞌ-e wat olan Topaꞌ ngan-eyaꞌ nyilamat manusia pakai Yesus
pairs.target: He began to speak boldly in the synagogue. But when Priscilla and Aquila heard him, they took him aside, and explained to him the way of God more accurately.

pairs.source: Takal Apolos ogiꞌ kila-e yaꞌ odi keꞌAkhaya, uluk ulang Kristen moꞌ situju  Noh leh ngan nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ paitsulat tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ deꞌ Akhaya saꞌ nyaꞌa danoꞌ tilimaꞌ Apolos.Takal Apolos moꞌ nog keꞌ Akhaya, iyoh bogoꞌ tulung ulang Kristen danoꞌ.Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus dop-e Topaꞌ paguh duoh odop-e deꞌmunoꞌ
pairs.target: When he had determined to pass over into Achaia, the brothers encouraged him, and wrote to the disciples to receive him. When he had come, he greatly helped those who had believed through grace;

pairs.source: Doiꞌ tiyaꞌ wat ulang Yahudi yaꞌ nyakal sina deꞌ nang Apolos, dop-e suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ tanon-e ogiꞌ bukti-e daang Kitab deꞌ nang Yesus leh LajaPinyilamat deꞌ tanon Topaꞌ daang janyi-E.
pairs.target: for he powerfully refuted the Jews, publicly showing by the Scriptures that Jesus was the Christ.

pairs.source: Takal Apolos aluaꞌ deꞌ Korintus, Paulus moꞌ dioꞌ ponu kodakkupuaꞌ-kupuaꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ propinsi Asia, nog yoh tomus keꞌ Efesus.Yoh moꞌ tapod kudu-kudu naꞌan ulang Kristen
pairs.target: While Apollos was at Corinth, Paul, having passed through the upper country, came to Ephesus, and found certain disciples.

pairs.source: Yoh moꞌ sikian odop-e deꞌmunoꞌ, “Moꞌ tilimaꞌ ingan yeh Iyang Topaꞌ takal ingan bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesusneh?” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-e, “Aluaꞌ, doiꞌ koꞌih nak puꞌan nangogiꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: He said to them, “Did you receive the Holy Spirit when you believed?” They said to him, “No, we haven’t even heard that there is a Holy Spirit.”

pairs.source: Paulus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Moꞌ-e wat noh ingan obuahbaptis nunaꞌ deꞌ ngajal osi?” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot, “Baptisankodaꞌ deꞌ ngajal Yohanes pembaptis.”
pairs.target: He said, “Into what then were you baptized?” They said, “Into John’s baptism.”

pairs.source: Paulus moꞌ sina, “Baptisan Yohanes tanda nyaꞌa moꞌ togan olan deꞌjaꞌat  Pak-e Yohanes tuang tanon-e geh tuduꞌ ulang-ulang Israel, nang nyaꞌahalus bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Iyoh deꞌ yaꞌ nog mokuaꞌ odop-e, odop-e inoh iyoh lehYesus.”
pairs.target: Paul said, “John indeed baptized with the baptism of repentance, saying to the people that they should believe in the one who would come after him, that is, in Jesus.”

pairs.source: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ tanon Paulus, odop-e deꞌmunoꞌ moꞌ mitiaꞌ baptis daang adon Yesus
pairs.target: When they heard this, they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.

pairs.source: Takal Paulus posan tongan-etun bak odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, Iyang Topaꞌ moꞌ nguasa odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ,odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ponai nang sina deꞌ aluaꞌ doiꞌ onu-e bilajal-e, yohmoꞌ mulai bitutaꞌ tanon oniꞌ deꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ
pairs.target: When Paul had laid his hands on them, the Holy Spirit came on them, and they spoke with other languages and prophesied.

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ogiꞌ simoongduwoh naꞌan.
pairs.target: They were about twelve men in all.

pairs.source: Silamaꞌ taluh bulan deꞌ Efesus, Paulus bijuut-juut odi ngunang bolitopat simayang ulang Yahudi daang-e ngajal, simadi-e bikalah ngan-e odaꞌnyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ bisayaꞌ watki wat Topaꞌ yaꞌ militah jadin Laja
pairs.target: He entered into the synagogue, and spoke boldly for a period of three months, reasoning and persuading about the things concerning God’s Kingdom.

pairs.source: Pak-e ogiꞌkudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ ngolas otin-e, doliaꞌ-e yaꞌ bisayaꞌ oni deꞌ tanonPaulus  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ pijaꞌat pingidip nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesusdeꞌ jowin nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ  Inoh leh ngan Paulus moꞌ buu togan boli topatsimayang inoh samah-samah duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus  Odop-edeꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bilang konu odi keꞌ topat nyaꞌa bilajal deꞌ kakuꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌadon Tiranus  Bilang konu yoh jawap oniꞌ deꞌ sikian nyaꞌa
pairs.target: But when some were hardened and disobedient, speaking evil of the Way before the multitude, he departed from them, and separated the disciples, reasoning daily in the school of Tyrannus.

pairs.source: Nog duwohsowaꞌ yoh wat inoh-inoh ngajal sape nog suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ loꞌo deꞌ propinsiAsia moꞌ ogiꞌ ngojit gah tentang Yesus, bait ulang Yahudi, bait ulang deꞌdiꞌ-e ulang Yahudi.
pairs.target: This continued for two years, so that all those who lived in Asia heard the word of the Lord Jesus, both Jews and Greeks.

pairs.source: Topaꞌ pakai Paulus nai oniꞌ deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa
pairs.target: God worked special miracles by the hands of Paul,

pairs.source: Nog oniꞌ deꞌ bokasPaulus pakai-e kodaꞌ saputongan, pimakai-e takal nyaꞌa posan deꞌ tunnyaꞌa deꞌ monam yoh lasuꞌ mokuaꞌ, muat munua tuang buu luah geh odaꞌsaputongan-e
pairs.target: so that even handkerchiefs or aprons were carried away from his body to the sick, and the diseases departed from them, and the evil spirits went out.

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan dukun soꞌ ulang Yahudi' deꞌ tukangponu kasig muat munua soꞌ nyaꞌa, yohmoꞌ yaꞌ suba geh kasig muat munuapakai adon Topaꞌ Yesus  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ muat munua deꞌmunoꞌ, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan, daang adon Yesus deꞌ magah Paulus, luahsoꞌ nyaꞌa itih!.”
pairs.target: But some of the itinerant Jews, exorcists, took on themselves to invoke over those who had the evil spirits the name of the Lord Jesus, saying, “We adjure you by Jesus whom Paul preaches.”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ ogiꞌ leh juꞌ naꞌan onak dalisoꞌ pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh deꞌ adon Skewa.
pairs.target: There were seven sons of one Sceva, a Jewish chief priest, who did this.

pairs.source: Pak-e muat munua inoh moꞌ nyawot-e, “Yesus okuꞌ puꞌan-e, Paulustuang puꞌan kuꞌ geh, pak-e ingan osi?.”
pairs.target: The evil spirit answered, “Jesus I know, and Paul I know, but who are you?”

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah nguasa muat munua inoh moꞌ ngomab duoh muꞌuabdeꞌ tun-e, yoh moꞌ pijolaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, yohmoꞌ bikoduh buu soꞌ boli-e,gonan-e obuaꞌ kinaman daang-e sitagual dop-e pimakai-e obuaꞌ totak-lolak.
pairs.target: The man in whom the evil spirit was leaped on them, overpowered them, and prevailed against them, so that they fled out of that house naked and wounded.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ ulang Yahudi duoh deꞌ diꞌ-e ulang Yahudi deꞌ loꞌo deꞌ Efesus moꞌtolu ngojit gah inoh, yohmoꞌ adon Topaꞌ Yesus moꞌ timogah danoꞌ
pairs.target: This became known to all, both Jews and Greeks, who lived at Ephesus. Fear fell on them all, and the name of the Lord Jesus was magnified.

pairs.source: Bogoꞌnyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ jadin bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus, nog ngakuꞌ deꞌ jowin nyaꞌa deꞌbogoꞌ nang deꞌ dioꞌ yoh tuang suwaꞌ bidukun geh
pairs.target: Many also of those who had believed came, confessing, and declaring their deeds.

pairs.source: Bogoꞌ soꞌ odop-edeꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ onu-e bidukun, moꞌ nguluk buk soꞌ-o bilajal bidukun,yohmoꞌ nyouh-e deꞌ jowin nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ  Loga suaꞌ buk inoh sukup maal,kila-kila limoh puluꞌ libu kiping duit pilak
pairs.target: Many of those who practiced magical arts brought their books together and burned them in the sight of all. They counted their price, and found it to be fifty thousand pieces of silver.

pairs.source: Takal nyaꞌa moꞌ ningaꞌ suaꞌoniꞌ deꞌ nai-e, pingunang Topaꞌ moꞌ popah katiꞌ-kanih, yohmoꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌadeꞌ togan idip-e deꞌ jaꞌat.
pairs.target: So the word of the Lord was growing and becoming mighty.

pairs.source: Takal-e suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ mokuaꞌ, Iyang Topaꞌ moꞌ pilasang kilaPaulus odaꞌ odi keꞌ Yerusalem ngilusuꞌ Makedonia duoh Akhaya  Yohmoꞌin-e, “Mokuaꞌ soꞌ Yerusalem, okuꞌ halus odi keꞌ Roma geh.”
pairs.target: Now after these things had ended, Paul determined in the spirit, when he had passed through Macedonia and Achaia, to go to Jerusalem, saying, “After I have been there, I must also see Rome.”

pairs.source: Iyoh moꞌpait duwoh naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ tukang tulung odop-e, Timotius duoh Erastus,yohmoꞌ odaꞌ dioꞌ odi keꞌ Makedonia, pak-e odop-e aluaꞌ muaꞌ tian-e loꞌodeꞌ propinsi Asia.
pairs.target: Having sent into Macedonia two of those who served him, Timothy and Erastus, he himself stayed in Asia for a while.

pairs.source: Kila-kila takal inoh leh moꞌ timul liuak daluag nyaꞌa deꞌ Efesus deꞌnetang Olan Topaꞌ deꞌ ngajal Paulus
pairs.target: About that time there arose no small stir concerning the Way.

pairs.source: Dop-e daang kota Efesus inoh ogiꞌnyaꞌa deꞌ adon Demetrius tukang pilak deꞌ nai tipaduaꞌ boli saꞌan dewiArtemis, kiloja deꞌ nai-e inoh bogoꞌ utung-e saꞌan odop-e deꞌ tukang nai.
pairs.target: For a certain man named Demetrius, a silversmith, who made silver shrines of Artemis, brought no little business to the craftsmen,

pairs.source: Yoh leh ngan-e ngijaꞌ suaꞌ tukang pilak deꞌ tukang nai tipaduaꞌ boli saꞌandewi Artemis deꞌ kiloja duoh odop-e duoh tukang pilak deꞌ bokon, yoh moꞌin-e, “Madih ayua, otoꞌ bogoꞌ soꞌon utung soꞌ kiloja itih!
pairs.target: whom he gathered together, with the workmen of like occupation, and said, “Sirs, you know that by this business we have our wealth.

pairs.source: Adin ingan moꞌningaꞌ duoh ngojit, oniꞌ deꞌ nai Paulus idoh diꞌ-e jok-e deꞌ Efesus pak-e suaꞌtopat deꞌ propinsi Asia, iyoh moꞌ biasil odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌoniꞌ deꞌ ngajal-e  Yoh moꞌ nang tipaduaꞌ deꞌ nai tongan manusia doh diꞌ-etok dewa
pairs.target: You see and hear, that not at Ephesus alone, but almost throughout all Asia, this Paul has persuaded and turned away many people, saying that they are no gods, that are made with hands.

pairs.source: Simoꞌ-e wat itih idoh diꞌ-e jok-e kiloja otoꞌ deꞌ obuah pijaꞌat,pak-e boli simayang dewi Artemis tuang diꞌ nyaꞌa tiyaꞌ bisayaꞌ daꞌ-e  Deꞌdioꞌ soꞌ kanoꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ Asia duoh suaꞌ pulou deꞌ dunia, nyaꞌa nyomahdewi inoh.”
pairs.target: Not only is there danger that this our trade come into disrepute, but also that the temple of the great goddess Artemis will be counted as nothing, and her majesty destroyed, whom all Asia and the world worships.”

pairs.source: Takal nyaꞌa moꞌ ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ nang Demetrius, nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌmoꞌ malah, yoh moꞌ nang bogan-e, “Idip Artemis, dewi ulang Efesus, iyohleh deꞌ ayuh kuasa-e,” in odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ
pairs.target: When they heard this they were filled with anger, and cried out, saying, “Great is Artemis of the Ephesians!”

pairs.source: Makin tuui makin bogoꞌnyaꞌa deꞌ bikuluk daang kota daang-e nang bogan-e, kota inoh moꞌ jadinkasang-kasua  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ odi keꞌ boli topat nyaꞌa tikuluk,yohmoꞌ matak Gayus duoh Aristarkhus, odop-e deꞌ duwoh inoh ulangMakedonia deꞌ bitunaꞌ duoh Paulus daang pimonu-e
pairs.target: The whole city was filled with confusion, and they rushed with one accord into the theater, having seized Gaius and Aristarchus, men of Macedonia, Paul’s companions in travel.

pairs.source: Paulus moꞌ yaꞌsuwaꞌ odi kaang uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ, pak-e ulang-ulang Kristen danoꞌjaman-e
pairs.target: When Paul wanted to enter in to the people, the disciples didn’t allow him.

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan piayuh deꞌ soꞌ propinsi Asia deꞌ jadindingan Paulus, moꞌ pait sibaya duoh nyaꞌa odaꞌ tanon deꞌ Paulus, jamanmolot sina ke' uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ
pairs.target: Certain also of the Asiarchs, being his friends, sent to him and begged him not to venture into the theater.

pairs.source: Takal inoh nyaꞌa deꞌ tikuluk daangboli topat nyaꞌa tikuluk inoh moꞌ masim-masim nang daluag-e  Bogoꞌ soꞌodop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e puꞌan oni tujuan-e tikuluk
pairs.target: Some therefore cried one thing, and some another, for the assembly was in confusion. Most of them didn’t know why they had come together.

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌanulang Yahudi moꞌ nyulung Aleksander keꞌ sulung jowin nyaꞌa, yoh sakaꞌnang iyoh leh deꞌ moꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa bidaluag  Aleksander moꞌ pakat togan-e,mitiaꞌ odop-e sina ngan-e yaꞌ tanon nang odop-e diꞌ-e salah
pairs.target: They brought Alexander out of the multitude, the Jews putting him forward. Alexander beckoned with his hand, and would have made a defense to the people.

pairs.source: Pak-e takalodop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ puꞌan nang Aleksander ulang Yahudi, odop-e deꞌmunoꞌ moꞌ samah-samah nang liuak aab-e kulang lobih duwoh jam, deꞌin-e, “Idip Artemis, dewi deꞌ nyomah ulang Efesus!”.
pairs.target: But when they perceived that he was a Jew, all with one voice for a time of about two hours cried out, “Great is Artemis of the Ephesians!”

pairs.source: Sekretaris kota moꞌ dapod odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ bidaluag,iyoh moꞌ sina, “Oi nyaꞌa deꞌ loꞌo deꞌ kota Efesus! Suaꞌ nyaꞌa puꞌan nang kotaEfesus leh deꞌ piala bait boli topat dewi Artemis duoh tipaduaꞌ-e deꞌ labuꞌsoꞌ longit deꞌ sukup timogah
pairs.target: When the town clerk had quieted the multitude, he said, “You men of Ephesus, what man is there who doesn’t know that the city of the Ephesians is temple keeper of the great goddess Artemis, and of the image which fell down from Zeus?

pairs.source: Oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ doiꞌ nyaꞌa tapod yaꞌ nyakal-e,notod negeh kila ingan, pikil dioꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nai ingan, maꞌ yaꞌ gupuah.
pairs.target: Seeing then that these things can’t be denied, you ought to be quiet, and to do nothing rash.

pairs.source: Ingan toban odop-e deꞌ duwoh katiꞌ, tiap odop-e deꞌ duwoh doiꞌ-e nakmilapok boli topat nyomah dewi duoh pijaꞌat adon dewi
pairs.target: For you have brought these men here, who are neither robbers of temples nor blasphemers of your goddess.

pairs.source: Jadin simoꞌDemetrius duoh tukang-tukang pilak-e inoh ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ lepot-e, iyohtapod toban masalah-e keꞌ topat bilituang  Saꞌ-e tiatul soꞌ duwoh kawaodop-e tapod tanon oni salah-e deꞌ jowin nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ ngituang
pairs.target: If therefore Demetrius and the craftsmen who are with him have a matter against anyone, the courts are open, and there are proconsuls. Let them press charges against one another.

pairs.source: Pak-esimoꞌ-e aluaꞌ ogiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ mitiaꞌ ingan deꞌ bokon, ingan tapod tobandaang uluk deꞌ moꞌ ngibonal kerajaan
pairs.target: But if you seek anything about other matters, it will be settled in the regular assembly.

pairs.source: Dop-e oni deꞌ nai ingan onu itih,yaꞌ nyusah otoꞌ  Nyaꞌa tapod nyalah otoꞌ nang yaꞌ lawan pilitah, moꞌ doiꞌwat otoꞌ yaꞌ ngibonal odop toꞌ.”
pairs.target: For indeed we are in danger of being accused concerning today’s riot, there being no cause. Concerning it, we wouldn’t be able to give an account of this commotion.”

pairs.source: Takal sekretaris kota Efesus mokuaꞌnang sina deꞌ in inoh, yoh moꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ buu paliꞌ.
pairs.target: When he had thus spoken, he dismissed the assembly.

pairs.source: Takal-e deꞌ Efesus doiꞌ tiyaꞌ nyaꞌa nang liuak daluag-e, Paulusmogan uluk ulang Kristen odaꞌ tikuluk, yohmoꞌ nasehat odop-edeꞌ munoꞌ odaꞌ diꞌ-e mulah buwon  Mokuaꞌ inoh yoh moꞌ tanon odop-eyaꞌ ponu, Paulus moꞌ odi keꞌ Makedonia
pairs.target: After the uproar had ceased, Paul sent for the disciples, took leave of them, and departed to go into Macedonia.

pairs.source: Deꞌ Makedonia Paulus odi katiꞌkanih nasehat uluk ulang Kristen danoꞌ saꞌ-a simakin bisayaꞌ, mokuaꞌ inohyoh moꞌ odi keꞌ propinsi Akhaya, deꞌ sobot nyaꞌa geh nang Yunani
pairs.target: When he had gone through those parts, and had encouraged them with many words, he came into Greece.

pairs.source: Taluhbulan iyoh loꞌo danoꞌ  Takal yaꞌ siap bilayal keꞌ Siria iyoh ngojit nang ogiꞌulang-ulang Yahudi moꞌ bipokat yaꞌ ngabos odop-e, noh leh ngan-e iyohmoꞌ bilakat ponu olan doyoh soꞌ Makedonia.
pairs.target: When he had spent three months there, and a plot was made against him by Jews as he was about to set sail for Syria, he determined to return through Macedonia.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ suwaꞌ ponu nunaꞌ iyoh keꞌ propinsi Asia iyohleh Timotius,Sopater onak Pirus soꞌ kota Berea, Aristarkhus duoh Sekundus soꞌ duwohodop-e soꞌ kota Tesalonika, Gayus soꞌ Derbe, baya Tikhikus duoh Trofimussoꞌ duwoh odop-e soꞌ propinsi Asia
pairs.target: These accompanied him as far as Asia: Sopater of Beroea; Aristarchus and Secundus of the Thessalonians; Gaius of Derbe; Timothy; and Tychicus and Trophimus of Asia.

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ dioꞌ ponu yohmoꞌkajon Paulus duoh okuꞌ (Lukas) deꞌ kota Troas
pairs.target: But these had gone ahead, and were waiting for us at Troas.

pairs.source: Takal mokuaꞌ onu ayuhPaskah, koꞌih duwoh bilayal soꞌ Filipi  Limoh onu bilayal koꞌih moꞌ nogTroas  Koꞌih moꞌ bitapod duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, koꞌih moꞌ loꞌo danoꞌ niꞌmingu.
pairs.target: We sailed away from Philippi after the days of Unleavened Bread, and came to them at Troas in five days, where we stayed seven days.

pairs.source: Takal ngalom mingu koꞌih tikuluk man Perjamuan Topaꞌ, Paulus sinaduoh ulang Kristen danoꞌ nog tuluap ngalom dop-e ogiꞌ daang pikil-e onutiaꞌ pagi yoh yaꞌ buu
pairs.target: On the first day of the week, when the disciples were gathered together to break bread, Paul talked with them, intending to depart on the next day, and continued his speech until midnight.

pairs.source: Daang bilit deꞌ somu topat koꞌih bikuluk ogiꞌ bogoꞌlapu deꞌ tung-e
pairs.target: There were many lights in the upper room where we were gathered together.

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan onak mudaꞌ deꞌ adon Eutikhus guluꞌ deꞌtiban pijaan  Dop-e Paulus sikiya tuui sina, onak mudaꞌ inoh moꞌ nunuꞌluban-e yoh moꞌ labuꞌ keꞌ douꞌ soꞌ tikat taluh  Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌtunuk-e yoh moꞌ ningaꞌ onak mudaꞌ noh moꞌ kobos
pairs.target: A certain young man named Eutychus sat in the window, weighed down with deep sleep. As Paul spoke still longer, being weighed down by his sleep, he fell down from the third floor, and was taken up dead.

pairs.source: Pak-e Paulus muunkeꞌ douꞌ yohmoꞌ muꞌuab daang-e pakuaꞌ-a, Paulus moꞌ sina, “Maꞌ bigaduhiyoh aluaꞌ idip.”
pairs.target: Paul went down, and fell upon him, and embracing him said, “Don’t be troubled, for his life is in him.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh Paulus paliꞌ maꞌad keꞌ somu, yohmoꞌbikutung kueh yohmoꞌ man samah-samah daang Perjamuan Topaꞌ  Takal-emokuaꞌ man, Paulus aluaꞌ tuui sina duoh nyaꞌa nog onu jawaꞌ, mokuaꞌinoh iyoh moꞌ buu
pairs.target: When he had gone up, and had broken bread, and eaten, and had talked with them a long while, even until break of day, he departed.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa moꞌ toban onak mudaꞌ inoh aluaꞌ idip, paliꞌkeꞌ boli-e  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ sonang otin-e.
pairs.target: They brought the boy in alive, and were greatly comforted.

pairs.source: Koꞌih dioꞌ ponu pakai kapal odi keꞌ kota Asos, takal koꞌih nog, koꞌihmoꞌ odi mit Paulus toban keꞌ kapal, dop-e Paulus ponu olan doyoh, iyoh deꞌmoꞌ ngatul odaꞌ wat inoh
pairs.target: But we, going ahead to the ship, set sail for Assos, intending to take Paul aboard there; for he had so arranged, intending himself to go by land.

pairs.source: Takal bitapod duoh koꞌih deꞌ Asos koꞌih moꞌtoban Paulus keꞌ kapal, koꞌih moꞌ bilayal odi keꞌ kota Metilene
pairs.target: When he met us at Assos, we took him aboard, and came to Mitylene.

pairs.source: Soꞌ kanoꞌkoꞌih bilayal lagiꞌ, tiaꞌ pagi-e koꞌih moꞌ sinok duoh pulou Khios  Onu deꞌnikan koꞌih nog deꞌ pulou Samos, mokuaꞌ inoh niꞌ onu lagiꞌ koꞌih nog deꞌMiletus
pairs.target: Sailing from there, we came the following day opposite Chios. The next day we touched at Samos and stayed at Trogyllium, and the day after we came to Miletus.

pairs.source: Paulus moꞌ dioꞌ motod nang odop-e diꞌ-e nosaꞌ deꞌ kota Efesus,iyoh doliaꞌ-a kabuaꞌ onu-e deꞌ Asia iyoh bigaut yaꞌ nog deꞌ Yerusalem, takalaluaꞌ diꞌ-e onu ayuh Pentakosta.
pairs.target: For Paul had determined to sail past Ephesus, that he might not have to spend time in Asia; for he was hastening, if it were possible for him, to be in Jerusalem on the day of Pentecost.

pairs.source: Soꞌ Miletus Paulus moꞌ pait nyaꞌa odaꞌ odi tanon tuduꞌ pimipin-pimipinuluk ulang Kristen deꞌ Efesus saꞌ-e nog bitapod duoh odop-e deꞌ Miletus.
pairs.target: From Miletus he sent to Ephesus, and called to himself the elders of the assembly.

pairs.source: Takal nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ nog, Paulus moꞌ in-e, “Ingan puꞌan oni wat idipokuꞌ daang uluk ingan, mulai soꞌ sibungas okuꞌ nog Asia
pairs.target: When they had come to him, he said to them, “You yourselves know, from the first day that I set foot in Asia, how I was with you all the time,

pairs.source: Okuꞌ pidouꞌodop kuꞌ ngan kuꞌ nai kiloja saꞌan Topaꞌ, ogiꞌ onu-e obuaꞌ luah piꞌin botonkuꞌ duoh bogoꞌ ulang Yahudi deꞌ lika kanam okuꞌ
pairs.target: serving the Lord with all humility, with many tears, and with trials which happened to me by the plots of the Jews;

pairs.source: Bial-e wat noh duohokuꞌ, okuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ naan-naan sina deꞌ biguna saꞌan ingan, okuꞌ ngajal deꞌtopat-topat nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ duoh deꞌ uluk nyaꞌa daang boli
pairs.target: how I didn’t shrink from declaring to you anything that was profitable, teaching you publicly and from house to house,

pairs.source: Okuꞌ silalutanon tuduꞌ ulang Yahudi duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e Yahudi saꞌ-a togan olan deꞌjaꞌat, yohmoꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: testifying both to Jews and to Greeks repentance toward God, and faith toward our Lord Jesus.

pairs.source: Pak-e adin okuꞌ nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ tanon Iyang Topaꞌ, okuꞌ odi keꞌYerusalem, okuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ puꞌan oni-oni wat nyaꞌa yaꞌ duoh okuꞌ
pairs.target: Now, behold, I go bound by the Spirit to Jerusalem, not knowing what will happen to me there;

pairs.source: Okuꞌ jokkuꞌ puꞌan deꞌ tibilang kota, Iyang Topaꞌ moꞌ tanon nang idip susah duohjel sijaꞌ-e deꞌ moꞌ kajon okuꞌ
pairs.target: except that the Holy Spirit testifies in every city, saying that bonds and afflictions wait for me.

pairs.source: Pak-e idoh diꞌ kuꞌ nyayang asong kuꞌ, asalsijaꞌ-e okuꞌ tapod kabuaꞌ kiloja deꞌ odaꞌ Topaꞌ Yesus okuꞌ nai-e  Kiloja inohmagah Gah deꞌ Paguh tentang pilasiꞌ Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: But these things don’t count; nor do I hold my life dear to myself, so that I may finish my race with joy, and the ministry which I received from the Lord Jesus, to fully testify to the Good News of the grace of God.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ moꞌ tanon watki wat Topaꞌ yaꞌ nog militah jadin Laja takal okuꞌnomi susuaꞌ ingan  Adin okuꞌ ngoon nang diꞌ kuꞌ tiyaꞌ yaꞌ bitapod duohingan
pairs.target: “Now, behold, I know that you all, among whom I went about preaching God’s Kingdom, will see my face no more.

pairs.source: Noh leh ngan adin okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan, moꞌ-e ogiꞌ ingan deꞌbinasa, inoh idoh diꞌ-e salah okuꞌ
pairs.target: Therefore I testify to you today that I am clean from the blood of all men,

pairs.source: Dop-e okuꞌ moꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan suaꞌoniꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ Topaꞌ ingan puꞌan-e.
pairs.target: for I didn’t shrink from declaring to you the whole counsel of God.

pairs.source: Jaga odop ingan, jaga geh suaꞌ ulang Kristen, dop-e ingan leh deꞌ moꞌnotap Iyang Topaꞌ odaꞌ jaga nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ soꞌon-E deꞌ moꞌ nubuas-E pakaidoyaꞌ Onak odop-E
pairs.target: Take heed, therefore, to yourselves, and to all the flock, in which the Holy Spirit has made you overseers, to shepherd the assembly of the Lord and  God which he purchased with his own blood.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ moꞌ puꞌan takal kuꞌ moꞌ buu, nyaꞌa deꞌ samahkodaꞌ binatang deꞌ gaus nog deꞌ uluk domba yohmoꞌ nyelang ingan deꞌbisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e ngag yaꞌ katuab ingan
pairs.target: For I know that after my departure, vicious wolves will enter in among you, not sparing the flock.

pairs.source: Watnoh geh ogiꞌ soꞌ odop ingan, ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ mokat tanon pingajal deꞌ diꞌ-ebonal, ngan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ wat noh saꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ bisayaꞌtuduꞌ Yesus suaꞌ-e moyap nunaꞌ odop-e
pairs.target: Men will arise from among your own selves, speaking perverse things, to draw away the disciples after them.

pairs.source: Noh leh ngan nyeꞌ silalu awas!Maꞌ komut taluh sowaꞌ diꞌ-e mosah-mosah singonu singalom okuꞌ nasehatingan obuaꞌ luah piꞌin boton kuꞌ ngan kuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan masim-masim.
pairs.target: Therefore watch, remembering that for a period of three years I didn’t cease to admonish everyone night and day with tears.

pairs.source: Adin okuꞌ nyelah ingan tuduꞌ Topaꞌ saꞌ Iyoh piala ingan, saꞌ ingantotap bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Pingunang-E tentang pilasiꞌ-E tuduꞌ otoꞌ  Pilasiꞌ-E inohleh deꞌ odaꞌ ingan bitamah togap bisayaꞌ, deꞌ tapod ngin tuduꞌ ingan oniꞌdeꞌ moꞌ jadin bigian ingan deꞌ moꞌ notu saꞌan suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ pilih Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: Now, brothers, I entrust you to God, and to the word of his grace, which is able to build up, and to give you the inheritance among all those who are sanctified.

pairs.source: Aluaꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ ngilipuang duit duoh pimakai soꞌ osi sijaꞌ-a.
pairs.target: I coveted no one’s silver, or gold, or clothing.

pairs.source: Ingan tuang puꞌan ingan geh man pakai odop kuꞌ duoh man pakaidingan-dingan deꞌ bitunaꞌ duoh okuꞌ, tongan odop kuꞌ deꞌ kalik neh.
pairs.target: You yourselves know that these hands served my necessities, and those who were with me.

pairs.source: Daang oni sijaꞌ-e okuꞌ moꞌ jadin soto saꞌan ingan, dop-e otoꞌ patut kilojasaꞌ otoꞌ tapod tulung nyaꞌa deꞌ doiꞌ oni-oni-e, otoꞌ mesti natong PingunangTopaꞌ Yesus deꞌ in-e, ‘Lobih obuah bilokat nyaꞌa deꞌ ngin soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌtilimaꞌ.’”
pairs.target: In all things I gave you an example, that so laboring you ought to help the weak, and to remember the words of the Lord Jesus, that he himself said, ‘It is more blessed to give than to receive.’”

pairs.source: Takal Paulus mokuaꞌ nang sina deꞌ in inoh, yoh moꞌ bikunyug daang-ebidoa duoh suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ
pairs.target: When he had spoken these things, he knelt down and prayed with them all.

pairs.source: Takal-e mokuaꞌ bidoa suaꞌ odop-ebipakuaꞌ simadi-e sium Paulus daang-e siꞌian
pairs.target: They all wept a lot, and fell on Paul’s neck and kissed him,

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ susahotin-e natong sina Paulus deꞌ dioꞌ deꞌ in-e, “Ingan diꞌ ingan tiyaꞌ yaꞌ ningaꞌjowin kuꞌ lagiꞌ.” Mokuaꞌ inoh yoh moꞌ katod Paulus keꞌ kapal.
pairs.target: sorrowing most of all because of the word which he had spoken, that they should see his face no more. And they accompanied him to the ship.

pairs.source: Daang kila deꞌ baat koꞌih moꞌ togan pimipin-pimipin ulang Kristendeꞌ Efesus, koꞌih moꞌ bilayal nuju pulou Kos  Tiaꞌ pagi-e nyam-ekoꞌih moꞌ nog keꞌ pulou Rodos, soꞌ kanoꞌ koꞌih moꞌ keꞌ pelabuhan Patara.
pairs.target: When we had departed from them and had set sail, we came with a straight course to Cos, and the next day to Rhodes, and from there to Patara.

pairs.source: Deꞌ Patara koꞌih tapod kapal deꞌ yaꞌ bilayal keꞌ Fenisia  Koꞌih moꞌbilakat nunaꞌ kapal inoh
pairs.target: Having found a ship crossing over to Phoenicia, we went aboard, and set sail.

pairs.source: Koꞌih moꞌ ningaꞌ pulou Siprus deꞌ nuaꞌ boitkoꞌih, pak-e koꞌih lasuꞌ bilayal nuju Siria  Koꞌih moꞌ bilabuh deꞌ kota Tirus,dop-e nyaꞌa yaꞌ pimuun balang daang kapal-e
pairs.target: When we had come in sight of Cyprus, leaving it on the left hand, we sailed to Syria, and landed at Tyre, for there the ship was to unload her cargo.

pairs.source: Deꞌ Tirus koꞌih moꞌ odinomi ulang-ulang deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus, koꞌih moꞌ loꞌo duoh-e niꞌ mingu.Iyang Topaꞌ moꞌ tanon tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ saꞌ-e jaman Paulus odikeꞌ Yerusalem
pairs.target: Having found disciples, we stayed there seven days. These said to Paul through the Spirit, that he should not go up to Jerusalem.

pairs.source: Takal-e moꞌ sukup onu-e koꞌih yaꞌ buu, koꞌih moꞌ lanyutpimonu koꞌih  Ulang-ulang deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus danoꞌ moꞌ polog manak-ekatod koꞌih nog sopaꞌ kota  Nog bingon laut koꞌih moꞌ guluꞌ bikunyugbidoa
pairs.target: When those days were over, we departed and went on our journey. They all, with wives and children, brought us on our way until we were out of the city. Kneeling down on the beach, we prayed.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh koꞌih moꞌ bisejut duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, koꞌih moꞌmuat deꞌ kapal  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ buu paliꞌ keꞌ boli-e.
pairs.target: After saying goodbye to each other, we went on board the ship, and they returned home again.

pairs.source: Soꞌ Tirus koꞌih bilayal nog keꞌ kota Ptolemais, koꞌih bilayal nog inohgeh  Koꞌih moꞌ odi bitapod duoh ulang Kristen, koꞌih moꞌ loꞌo niꞌ onu duohodop-e deꞌ munoꞌ
pairs.target: When we had finished the voyage from Tyre, we arrived at Ptolemais. We greeted the brothers, and stayed with them one day.

pairs.source: Onu tiaꞌ pagi-e koꞌih moꞌ bilayal soꞌ kanoꞌ koꞌih moꞌnog kota Kaisarea  Danoꞌ koꞌih moꞌ loꞌo deꞌ boli Filipus nyaꞌa deꞌ tukangmagah Gah deꞌ Paguh  Iyoh Niꞌ soꞌ ayua deꞌ juꞌ naꞌan deꞌ obuah pilih takal-edeꞌ Yerusalem dioꞌ soꞌ kanoꞌ odaꞌ tulung ayua rasul tukang bikutung bigiansaꞌan ulang janda
pairs.target: On the next day, we, who were Paul’s companions, departed, and came to Caesarea. We entered into the house of Philip the evangelist, who was one of the seven, and stayed with him.

pairs.source: Filipus ogiꞌ pat naꞌan onak dayung-e deꞌ ngin Topaꞌkuasa daꞌ-e, odaꞌ ponai bitutaꞌ
pairs.target: Now this man had four virgin daughters who prophesied.

pairs.source: Kudu-kudu onu-e takal koꞌih loꞌo danoꞌ,nabi deꞌ adon Agabus deꞌ soꞌ Yudea deꞌ ponai geh bitutaꞌ moꞌ nog tuduꞌkoꞌih
pairs.target: As we stayed there some days, a certain prophet named Agabus came down from Judea.

pairs.source: Yoh moꞌ odi tuduꞌ koꞌih, yoh moꞌ mit soot kupuang Paulus, yohmoꞌ mokos tongan poꞌon odop-e, yoh moꞌ sina, “In itih in Iyang Topaꞌ:‘Nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ soot kupuang itih yaꞌ obuah mokos wat itih geh odaꞌulang-ulang Yahudi deꞌ Yerusalem, yoh moꞌ nyelah tuduꞌ ulang-ulang deꞌdiꞌ-e Yahudi.’ ”
pairs.target: Coming to us, and taking Paul’s belt, he bound his own feet and hands, and said, “Thus says the Holy Spirit: ‘So will the Jews at Jerusalem bind the man who owns this belt, and will deliver him into the hands of the Gentiles.’”

pairs.source: Takal koꞌih moꞌ ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ tanon-e inoh, suaꞌ koꞌih ulang Kristendanoꞌ moꞌ jaman Paulus odi keꞌ Yerusalem
pairs.target: When we heard these things, both we and they of that place begged him not to go up to Jerusalem.

pairs.source: Pak-e Paulus moꞌ nyawot-e,“Oni nai ingan siꞌian nusah otin kuꞌ? Simoꞌ-e ngan kuꞌ magah adon TopaꞌYesus, idoh diꞌ-e jok kuꞌ obuah jel, pak-e kobos tuang doh geh diꞌ kuꞌ tolu.”
pairs.target: Then Paul answered, “What are you doing, weeping and breaking my heart? For I am ready not only to be bound, but also to die at Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus.”

pairs.source: Paulus doliaꞌ-e nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nang koꞌih, koꞌih moꞌ tanah-e, “Mana-manawat Topaꞌ duoh-e.” In koꞌih.
pairs.target: When he would not be persuaded, we ceased, saying, “The Lord’s will be done.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ kudu-kudu onu-e loꞌo deꞌ Kaisarea koꞌih moꞌ biponyap, koꞌihmoꞌ bilakat keꞌ Yerusalem
pairs.target: After these days we took up our baggage and went up to Jerusalem.

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan ulang Kristen soꞌKaisarea suwaꞌ nunaꞌ koꞌih  Yoh moꞌ toban koꞌih keꞌ boli Manason, topatsoꞌ koꞌih yaꞌ ngilumon  Iyoh soꞌ Siprus deꞌ moꞌ tuui jadin pinunaꞌ Yesus.
pairs.target: Some of the disciples from Caesarea also went with us, bringing one Mnason of Cyprus, an early disciple, with whom we would stay.

pairs.source: Takal koꞌih nog keꞌ Yerusalem ulang Kristen danoꞌ sukup sonang-enyamut koꞌih
pairs.target: When we had come to Jerusalem, the brothers received us gladly.

pairs.source: Onu deꞌ nikan-e koꞌih duoh Paulus moꞌ odi bitapodduoh Yakobus, suaꞌ pimipin uluk ulang Kristen deꞌ Yerusalem ogiꞌ danoꞌ.
pairs.target: The day following, Paul went in with us to James; and all the elders were present.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ sikian kabal nyaꞌa danoꞌ, Paulus moꞌ silita tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌnang Topaꞌ tulung basa deꞌ diꞌ-e Yahudi pakai odop-e.
pairs.target: When he had greeted them, he reported one by one the things which God had worked among the Gentiles through his ministry.

pairs.source: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ silita Paulus, odop-e deꞌmunoꞌ moꞌ mudi Topaꞌ, yoh moꞌ in-e duoh Paulus, “Madih ayua, ingan moꞌningaꞌ ogiꞌ bilibu-libu ulang Yahudi deꞌ moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus  Odop-e deꞌmunoꞌ aluaꞌ lajin nunaꞌ Atulan-atulan Topaꞌ deꞌ nulis nabi Musa
pairs.target: They, when they heard it, glorified God. They said to him, “You see, brother, how many thousands there are among the Jews of those who have believed, and they are all zealous for the law.

pairs.source: Pak-eogiꞌ nyaꞌa moꞌ tanon tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nang ingan ngajal ulang-ulangYahudi deꞌ loꞌo deꞌ topat nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e Yahudi, odaꞌ posan Atulan-atulandeꞌ nulis Musa, ingan moꞌ ngajal ulang Yahudi saꞌ-a diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ bisunatonak-onak-e duoh diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ nunaꞌ adat otoꞌ ulang Yahudi
pairs.target: They have been informed about you, that you teach all the Jews who are among the Gentiles to forsake Moses, telling them not to circumcise their children neither to walk after the customs.

pairs.source: Ulang-ulangYahudi deꞌ bisayaꞌ, pasti puꞌan nang ingan ogiꞌ datiꞌ  Wat ki tiyaꞌ?
pairs.target: What then? The assembly must certainly meet, for they will hear that you have come.

pairs.source: Watihsijaꞌ-e nunaꞌ negeh nasehat koꞌih, ogiꞌ pat naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ bijanyi tuduꞌTopaꞌ
pairs.target: Therefore do what we tell you. We have four men who have taken a vow.

pairs.source: Odi duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ pat inoh keꞌ Boli Topaꞌ deꞌ jok-e ogiꞌ deꞌYerusalem, nyeꞌ moꞌ samah-samah nai adat pilopas polih duoh kibisig odopingan, nyeꞌ moꞌ tangung biaya adat inoh, saꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bigumolbak-e  Ingan nai wat itih saꞌ nyaꞌa puꞌan nang suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ngojit nyaꞌatentang ingan diꞌ-e bonal, dop-e ingan tuang aluaꞌ nunaꞌ Atulan-atulanTopaꞌ deꞌ nulis nabi Musa geh
pairs.target: Take them, and purify yourself with them, and pay their expenses for them, that they may shave their heads. Then all will know that there is no truth in the things that they have been informed about you, but that you yourself also walk keeping the law.

pairs.source: Saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e ulang Yahudi deꞌ moꞌmolot Kristen, moꞌ ogiꞌ koꞌih pait sulat tuduꞌ-e, tanon tuduꞌ-e jaman manpinguman deꞌ moꞌ nyelah nyaꞌa tuduꞌ tipaduaꞌ, jaman man doyaꞌ binatang,jaman man dagin binatang deꞌ kobos nyikak, duoh diꞌ-e soꞌon ngaso nyaꞌadeꞌ diꞌ-e lawang odop nyeꞌ.”
pairs.target: But concerning the Gentiles who believe, we have written our decision that they should observe no such thing, except that they should keep themselves from food offered to idols, from blood, from strangled things, and from sexual immorality.”

pairs.source: Onu deꞌ nikan-e, Paulus moꞌ odi duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ pat na'an inoh, ngan-esamah-samah nai adat kibisig odop-e, mokuaꞌ inoh Paulus moꞌ molot keꞌBoli Topaꞌ tanon tuduꞌ pimipin agama Yahudi siniaꞌ onu pilopas polih yaꞌobuaꞌ, onu ngan nyaꞌa yaꞌ simoliah binatang deꞌ ngin nyaꞌa deꞌ pat inoh.
pairs.target: Then Paul took the men, and the next day, purified himself and went with them into the temple, declaring the fulfillment of the days of purification, until the offering was offered for every one of them.

pairs.source: Takal-e moꞌ yaꞌ sukup juꞌ onu, ulang-ulang Yahudi deꞌ nog soꞌ propinsiAsia, moꞌ ningaꞌ Paulus daang Boli Topaꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngaluhnyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ odaꞌ takap Paulus
pairs.target: When the seven days were almost completed, the Jews from Asia, when they saw him in the temple, stirred up all the multitude and laid hands on him,

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nang bogan-e, “Oiulang Israel yoh itih leh ulang deꞌ ponu katiꞌ-kanih ngajal nyaꞌa odaꞌ lawanbasa otoꞌ, yoh moꞌ jaman nyaꞌa nunaꞌ Atulan-atulan Topaꞌ deꞌ nulis nabiMusa duoh adin iyoh kaꞌis Boli Topaꞌ pakai toban nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e Yahudidaang Boli Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: crying out, “Men of Israel, help! This is the man who teaches all men everywhere against the people, and the law, and this place. Moreover, he also brought Greeks into the temple, and has defiled this holy place!”

pairs.source: Dop-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ogiꞌ ningaꞌ Trofimusulang deꞌ soꞌ Efesus ogiꞌ samah-samah duoh Paulus deꞌ kota Yerusalem,odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sakaꞌ nang Paulus toban keꞌ Boli Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: For they had seen Trophimus, the Ephesian, with him in the city, and they supposed that Paul had brought him into the temple.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ kota Yerusalem inoh moꞌ manas, yoh moꞌodi tikuluk deꞌ Boli Topaꞌ  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ takap Paulus, yoh moꞌmatak toban keꞌ sopaꞌ, mokuaꞌ inoh nyaꞌa moꞌ kuab tiban ijuam BoliTopaꞌ
pairs.target: All the city was moved, and the people ran together. They seized Paul and dragged him out of the temple. Immediately the doors were shut.

pairs.source: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ogiꞌ kila-e yaꞌ ngabos Paulus, gahinoh moꞌ tomus tuduꞌ komandan sidadu Roma, nang kota Yerusalem moꞌkalang-kabut
pairs.target: As they were trying to kill him, news came up to the commanding officer of the regiment that all Jerusalem was in an uproar.

pairs.source: Komandan sidadu inoh moꞌ likas-likas mogan onak buah-e,duoh komandan legu-e, yoh moꞌ bikoduh odi keꞌ uun nyaꞌa deꞌ kalang-kabutinoh  Takal nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ komandan sidadu duoh onak buah-enog, nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ kangan odop-e pijolaꞌ Paulus
pairs.target: Immediately he took soldiers and centurions, and ran down to them. They, when they saw the chief captain and the soldiers, stopped beating Paul.

pairs.source: Komandansidadu inoh moꞌ odi sinok Paulus, yoh moꞌ takap-e, yoh moꞌ odaꞌ pasungpakai duwoh late, yoh moꞌ bisikian tuduꞌ nyaꞌa danoꞌ, “Osi iyoh, oni deꞌmoꞌ nai-e?”
pairs.target: Then the commanding officer came near, arrested him, commanded him to be bound with two chains, and inquired who he was and what he had done.

pairs.source: Kudu-kudu naꞌan soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ, ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nang intih ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nang in inoh, sawot odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ obuaꞌ okon-okon.Dop-e liyuak daluag nyaꞌa sikiya dolas, komandan sidadu inoh moꞌ diꞌ-epuꞌan oni-oni deꞌ nang-e, yoh moꞌ odaꞌ onak buah-e toban Paulus keꞌ posayuh-e
pairs.target: Some shouted one thing, and some another, among the crowd. When he couldn’t find out the truth because of the noise, he commanded him to be brought into the barracks.

pairs.source: Takal nyaꞌa toban Paulus nog tunguah pos, nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ moꞌmongas, noh leh ngan sidadu-sidadu deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ tawiak Paulus
pairs.target: When he came to the stairs, he was carried by the soldiers because of the violence of the crowd;

pairs.source: Nyaꞌadeꞌ bogoꞌ deꞌ bitunaꞌ duoh-e moꞌ nang bogan-e, “Ngabos nyeꞌ iyoh neh!”
pairs.target: for the multitude of the people followed after, crying out, “Away with him!”

pairs.source: Takal-e yaꞌ toban Paulus molot keꞌ pos, Paulus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ komandansidadu Roma inoh pakai sina Yunani, “Tapod yeh kuꞌ sina duoh ingan nehkomandan?”Komandan sidadu inoh moꞌ gogoh ngojit-e, “Ponai keh muꞌ sina Yunani?
pairs.target: As Paul was about to be brought into the barracks, he asked the commanding officer, “May I speak to you?” He said, “Do you know Greek?

pairs.source: Moꞌ-e wat noh, idoh diꞌ-e muꞌu ulang Mesir deꞌ toban nyaꞌa mokatlawan pilitah deꞌ sodiꞌ-e, deꞌ toban nyaꞌa deꞌ lika ngabos nyaꞌa buu keꞌpadang pasil, pat libu naꞌan odop-e.”
pairs.target: Aren’t you then the Egyptian, who before these days stirred up to sedition and led out into the wilderness the four thousand men of the Assassins?”

pairs.source: Paulus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Okuꞌ ulang Yahudi, okuꞌ obuah milaꞌ deꞌ Tarsuskota deꞌ timogah deꞌ propinsi Kilikia, tulung odaꞌ okuꞌ sina duoh nyaꞌa deꞌbogoꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ.”
pairs.target: But Paul said, “I am a Jew, from Tarsus in Cilicia, a citizen of no insignificant city. I beg you, allow me to speak to the people.”

pairs.source: Komandan sidadu inoh moꞌ odaꞌ-e, Paulus moꞌ mujuag deꞌ bangtunguah, yoh moꞌ pakat tongan-e jaman nyaꞌa bidaluag, takal nyaꞌa moꞌloꞌo' Paulus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ pakai sina ulang Yahudi.
pairs.target: When he had given him permission, Paul, standing on the stairs, beckoned with his hand to the people. When there was a great silence, he spoke to them in the Hebrew language, saying,

pairs.source: Paulus moꞌ in-e, “Madih ayua duoh bala samaꞌ ngojit dioꞌ sina kuꞌ,kuꞌ tanon nang odop kuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ salah.”
pairs.target: “Brothers and fathers, listen to the defense which I now make to you.”

pairs.source: Takal nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ inohngojit Paulus sina pakai sina Ibrani sina odop nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ, yohmoꞌ loꞌongojit-e
pairs.target: When they heard that he spoke to them in the Hebrew language, they were even more quiet. He said,

pairs.source: Paulus moꞌ in-e, “Okuꞌ itih ulang Yahudi, obuah milaꞌ deꞌ kotaTarsus deꞌ propinsi Kilikia, pak-e okuꞌ ayuh datiꞌ  Okuꞌ bilajal datiꞌ duohgulu Gamaliel  Iyoh ngajal okuꞌ odaꞌ bonal-bonal taat nunaꞌ suaꞌ atulan deꞌtanon nabi Musa tuduꞌ sumuk babai otoꞌ  Okuꞌ sukup taat tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, suaꞌoniꞌ deꞌ nai kuꞌ samah kodaꞌ deꞌ nai ingan deꞌ mutiꞌ geh
pairs.target: “I am indeed a Jew, born in Tarsus of Cilicia, but brought up in this city at the feet of Gamaliel, instructed according to the strict tradition of the law of our fathers, being zealous for God, even as you all are today.

pairs.source: Deꞌ dioꞌ okuꞌ deꞌtukang pijolaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nunaꞌ olan Topaꞌ sape ogiꞌ deꞌ kobos; bait dali baitdayung okuꞌ takap biyon kaang jel
pairs.target: I persecuted this Way to the death, binding and delivering into prisons both men and women.

pairs.source: Pimipin Agama Yahudi deꞌ PalingAyuh duoh suaꞌ pimipin ulang Yahudi dapod tanon tuduꞌ ingan nang okuꞌdiꞌ kuꞌ mogo  Soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ okuꞌ soꞌon sulat saꞌan ulang Yahudi deꞌDamsyik  Pakai sulat inoh, okuꞌ soꞌon takap nyaꞌa danoꞌ deꞌ bisayaꞌ daangolan Topaꞌ toban paliꞌ keꞌ Yerusalem saꞌ-e obuah ukum.”
pairs.target: As also the high priest and all the council of the elders testify, from whom also I received letters to the brothers, and traveled to Damascus to bring them also who were there to Jerusalem in bonds to be punished.

pairs.source: Paulus moꞌ sina lagiꞌ in-e, “Pak-e daang olan takal kuꞌ sinok yaꞌ nogDamsyik, uun onu tang-tang jawaꞌ deꞌ soꞌ longit deꞌ sukup telang-e nyokuabokuꞌ
pairs.target: As I made my journey, and came close to Damascus, about noon, suddenly a great light shone around me from the sky.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ moꞌ labuꞌ keꞌ tanaꞌ, okuꞌ moꞌ ngojit sina in-e, ‘Saulus, Saulus!  Oni nai muꞌu pijolaꞌ Okuꞌ?’
pairs.target: I fell to the ground, and heard a voice saying to me, ‘Saul, Saul, why are you persecuting me?’

pairs.source: Okuꞌ moꞌ nyawot-e, ‘Osi Ingan?’ Yoh moꞌ in-e,‘Okuꞌ leh Yesus deꞌ soꞌ Nazaret deꞌ pijolaꞌ muꞌ.’
pairs.target: I answered, ‘Who are you, Lord?’ He said to me, ‘I am Jesus of Nazareth, whom you persecute.’

pairs.source: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ suwaꞌ duohokuꞌ suwaꞌ kilin jawaꞌ inoh, pak-e sina-E jok-e okuꞌ deꞌ klingah
pairs.target: “Those who were with me indeed saw the light and were afraid, but they didn’t understand the voice of him who spoke to me.

pairs.source: Okuꞌmoꞌ sikian in kuꞌ, ‘Oni mey deꞌ odaꞌ Ingan okuꞌ nai-e Topaꞌ?’ Topaꞌ moꞌin-e duoh okuꞌ, ‘Mokat nyeꞌ moꞌ odi keꞌ Damsyik, danoꞌ tiaꞌ ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌtanon tuduꞌ muꞌu suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ Okuꞌ muꞌu yaꞌ nai-e, in Topaꞌ.’
pairs.target: I said, ‘What shall I do, Lord?’ The Lord said to me, ‘Arise, and go into Damascus. There you will be told about all things which are appointed for you to do.’

pairs.source: Botonkuꞌ moꞌ butaꞌ odaꞌ jawaꞌ deꞌ sape mun silua-e inoh, yohmoꞌ dingan kuꞌ moꞌkayak okuꞌ toban keꞌ Damsyik.
pairs.target: When I couldn’t see for the glory of that light, being led by the hand of those who were with me, I came into Damascus.

pairs.source: Deꞌ Damsyik ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ adon Ananias, yoh itih ulang deꞌ taat nunaꞌAtulan-atulan deꞌ nulis nabi Musa, suaꞌ ulang Yahudi deꞌ loꞌo danoꞌ sukuppimodo tuduꞌ-e
pairs.target: One Ananias, a devout man according to the law, well reported of by all the Jews who lived in Damascus,

pairs.source: Iyoh nog mujuag sinok okuꞌ yoh moꞌ sina, ‘Madih kuꞌSaulus, bukaꞌ boton muꞌ ningaꞌ mey!’ Takal inoh geh okuꞌ lasuꞌ ponai kilinbaꞌuh, okuꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ iyoh
pairs.target: came to me, and standing by me said to me, ‘Brother Saul, receive your sight!’ In that very hour I looked up at him.

pairs.source: Iyoh moꞌ in-e, ‘Topaꞌ sumuk babai otoꞌ moꞌpilih muꞌu, odaꞌ muꞌu puꞌan oniꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ Iyoh muꞌu nai-e  Yoh moꞌ odaꞌmuꞌu ningaꞌ duoh ngojit sina Yesus deꞌ moꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ bonal soꞌ Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: He said, ‘The God of our fathers has appointed you to know his will, and to see the Righteous One, and to hear a voice from his mouth.

pairs.source: Dop-e muꞌu leh deꞌ jadin nyaꞌa deꞌ tukang tanon tuduꞌ nyaꞌa oni deꞌ moꞌkilin muꞌ duoh oniꞌ deꞌ ngojit muꞌ
pairs.target: For you will be a witness for him to all men of what you have seen and heard.

pairs.source: Adin oni tiyaꞌ deꞌ kajon muꞌ? Mokatmey, tanon odaꞌ nyaꞌa baptis odop muꞌ, nyeꞌ moꞌ mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ saꞌ-engapun dosa muꞌ.’ ”
pairs.target: Now why do you wait? Arise, be baptized, and wash away your sins, calling on the name of the Lord.’

pairs.source: Takal kuꞌ paliꞌ keꞌ Yerusalem okuꞌ bidoa deꞌ Boli Topaꞌ deꞌ jok-e deꞌogiꞌ deꞌ Yerusalem, tang-tang Iyang Topaꞌ moꞌ nguasa okuꞌ
pairs.target: “When I had returned to Jerusalem, and while I prayed in the temple, I fell into a trance,

pairs.source: Okuꞌ ningaꞌTopaꞌ Yesus, Yoh moꞌ sina duoh okuꞌ in-e, “Buu likas-e soꞌ Yerusalemdop-e nyaꞌa datiꞌ idoh diꞌ-e tilimaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nang muꞌu tentang Okuꞌ.”
pairs.target: and saw him saying to me, ‘Hurry and get out of Jerusalem quickly, because they will not receive testimony concerning me from you.’

pairs.source: Okuꞌ moꞌ nyawot, “Topaꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ puꞌan nang okuꞌ deꞌ odi keꞌboli-boli simayang, okuꞌ takap nyaꞌa, okuꞌ bipupuꞌ duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌtuduꞌ Ingan
pairs.target: I said, ‘Lord, they themselves know that I imprisoned and beat in every synagogue those who believed in you.

pairs.source: Watnoh geh takal nyaꞌa ngabos Stefanus deꞌ tukang magahtentang Ingan, okuꞌ ogiꞌ geh danoꞌ suwaꞌ situju sape okuꞌ deꞌ jaga pimakainyaꞌa deꞌ nyokad Stefanus.”
pairs.target: When the blood of Stephen, your witness, was shed, I also was standing by, and consenting to his death, and guarding the cloaks of those who killed him.’

pairs.source: Pak-e Topaꞌ in-e tuduꞌ okuꞌ, “Buu negehdop-e Okuꞌ yaꞌ pait muꞌu juuaꞌ tuduꞌ basa deꞌ diꞌ-e Yahudi.”
pairs.target: “He said to me, ‘Depart, for I will send you out far from here to the Gentiles.’”

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ danoꞌ aluaꞌ ngojit Paulus sina, pak-e takal-e sina nangodop-e halus buu tuduꞌ basa deꞌ diꞌ-e Yahudi, nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ tiwasnang bogan-e, “Ngabos negeh nyaꞌa deꞌ kodaꞌ itih neh' yoh diꞌ-e patut idip!”
pairs.target: They listened to him until he said that; then they lifted up their voice, and said, “Rid the earth of this fellow, for he isn’t fit to live!”

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nang bogan-e yoh moꞌ paan jubah-e deꞌ tanaꞌyoh moꞌ odaꞌ lopu tanaꞌ mokat tigamul
pairs.target: As they cried out, and threw off their cloaks, and threw dust into the air,

pairs.source: Komandan sidadu Roma tanonodaꞌ sidadu-e toban Paulus keꞌ pos-e ngan-e yaꞌ pilisa-e, danoꞌ yoh odaꞌsidadu mosut-e saꞌ-e tanon oni nai ulang-ulang Yahudi nang bogan-e deꞌ ininoh tuduꞌ iyoh
pairs.target: the commanding officer commanded him to be brought into the barracks, ordering him to be examined by scourging, that he might know for what crime they shouted against him like that.

pairs.source: Pak-e takal sidadu deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ pasung Paulus ngan-eyaꞌ mosut-e, Paulus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ sidadu deꞌ mujuag danoꞌ, “Soꞌon kehnyeꞌ tauꞌ-tauꞌ mosut nyaꞌa deꞌ jadin layat Roma deꞌ aluaꞌ diꞌ nyeꞌ bilituangduoh-e?”
pairs.target: When they had tied him up with thongs, Paul asked the centurion who stood by, “Is it lawful for you to scourge a man who is a Roman, and not found guilty?”

pairs.source: Takal-e ngojit Paulus sina in inoh sidadu inoh odi tuduꞌ komandan-eyoh moꞌ sina in-e, “Tadoꞌ koꞌih yaꞌ ngilangal hukum! Nyaꞌa itih layatRoma.”
pairs.target: When the centurion heard it, he went to the commanding officer and told him, “Watch what you are about to do, for this man is a Roman!”

pairs.source: Komandan sidadu inoh moꞌ odi tuduꞌ Paulus yoh moꞌ in-e, “Tok yehmuꞌu layat Roma neh?” Paulus moꞌ nyawot, “Tok okuꞌ itih layat Roma.”
pairs.target: The commanding officer came and asked him, “Tell me, are you a Roman?” He said, “Yes.”

pairs.source: Komandan sidadu inoh moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ Paulus, “Okuꞌ bayal pakai duitsukup maal-e ngan kuꞌ jadin layat Roma.” Pak-e Paulus in-e, “Pingoma kuꞌkan-e layat Roma, Yoh ngan Okuꞌ tuang layat Roma geh.”
pairs.target: The commanding officer answered, “I bought my citizenship for a great price.” Paul said, “But I was born a Roman.”

pairs.source: Ngojit nang Paulus layat Roma, sidadu deꞌ julah-e yaꞌ mosut moꞌdiꞌ-e jadi mosut-e, komandan sidadu inoh moꞌ jadin tolu takal-e moꞌ puꞌanPaulus inoh layat Roma, dop-e yoh moꞌ pasung Paulus.
pairs.target: Immediately those who were about to examine him departed from him, and the commanding officer also was afraid when he realized that he was a Roman, because he had bound him.

pairs.source: Komandan sidadu inoh moꞌ kalik oni sibonal-e deꞌ nai Paulus nganulang Yahudi nuduh iyoh  Noh leh ngan onu deꞌ nikan-e yoh moganpimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh duoh pimipin ulang Yahudi deꞌbokon odaꞌ tikuluk, yohmoꞌ toban ngaduap odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ saꞌ-e pilisa-e.
pairs.target: But on the next day, desiring to know the truth about why he was accused by the Jews, he freed him from the bonds, and commanded the chief priests and all the council to come together, and brought Paul down and set him before them.

pairs.source: Paulus moꞌ ngiduang nyaꞌa deꞌ bilituang duoh odop-e, yoh moꞌin-e, “Madih ayua, sape nog onu itih doiꞌ nyam kuꞌ nang odopkuꞌ salah tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, okuꞌ moꞌ idip nunaꞌ otin osuap kuꞌ deꞌ paguh deꞌjowin Topaꞌ.”
pairs.target: Paul, looking steadfastly at the council, said, “Brothers, I have lived before God in all good conscience until today.”

pairs.source: Takal Paulus sina in inoh, Ananias, pimipin Agama Yahudideꞌ Paling Ayuh, odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ mujuag sinok odop Paulus napalbobaꞌ-e
pairs.target: The high priest, Ananias, commanded those who stood by him to strike him on the mouth.

pairs.source: Paulus moꞌ in-e duoh Ananias, “Topaꞌ yaꞌ napal ingan, ingankodaꞌ sinung deꞌ koꞌis, deꞌ ngisat nyaꞌa odaꞌ mopuꞌ, ingan pulaꞌ-pulaꞌ sijaꞌ-e!Guluꞌ ngituang okuꞌ nunaꞌ Atulan-atulan Topaꞌ deꞌ nulis nabi Musa, pak-eodop ingan lawan atulan inoh odaꞌ nyaꞌa tauꞌ-tauꞌ napal okuꞌ.”
pairs.target: Then Paul said to him, “God will strike you, you whitewashed wall! Do you sit to judge me according to the law, and command me to be struck contrary to the law?”

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ mujuag nuaꞌ umiah Paulus in-e, “Muꞌu doiꞌ pimodomuꞌ tuduꞌ Pimipin Agama Yahudi deꞌ Paling Ayuh deꞌ tukang layan Topaꞌ?”
pairs.target: Those who stood by said, “Do you malign God’s high priest?”

pairs.source: Paulus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Oi madih ayua, okuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ puꞌan nang iyohPimipin Agama Yahudi deꞌ Paling Ayuh  Tok ogiꞌ deꞌ nulis daang ayat Kitabdeꞌ in-e: ‘Maꞌ muꞌu yaꞌ sina pijaꞌat nyaꞌa deꞌ jadin pimipin muꞌu!’ ”
pairs.target: Paul said, “I didn’t know, brothers, that he was high priest. For it is written, ‘You shall not speak evil of a ruler of your people.’”

pairs.source: Paulus puꞌan nang nyaꞌa deꞌ tikuluk deꞌ yaꞌ ngituang odop-e inohogiꞌ deꞌ soꞌ uluk ulang soꞌ golongan Saduki, ogiꞌ geh deꞌ soꞌ uluk ulangsoꞌ golongan Farisi, Paulus moꞌ in-e dolas-dolas-e, “Madih ayua, okuꞌ itihulang soꞌ golongan Farisi, pingoma kuꞌ ulang soꞌ golongan Farisi geh  Okuꞌobuah ngituang wat itih luban kuꞌ bisayaꞌ nang Topaꞌ yaꞌ pakat nyaꞌa deꞌmoꞌ kobos odaꞌ paliꞌ idip lagiꞌ.”
pairs.target: But when Paul perceived that the one part were Sadducees and the other Pharisees, he cried out in the council, “Men and brothers, I am a Pharisee, a son of Pharisees. Concerning the hope and resurrection of the dead I am being judged!”

pairs.source: Takal-e moꞌ ngojit sina deꞌ tanon Paulus,odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ mulai bikalah, odop-e deꞌ bilituang inoh moꞌ botahjadin duwoh uluk, uluk soꞌ golongan Farisi duoh uluk soꞌ golongan Saduki.
pairs.target: When he had said this, an argument arose between the Pharisees and Sadducees, and the crowd was divided.

pairs.source: Uluk ulang soꞌ golongan Saduki diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ nang nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos yaꞌpaliꞌ idip baꞌuh, diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ nang ogiꞌ malaikat, ogiꞌ iyang, pak-e ulang soꞌgolongan Farisi bisayaꞌ nang oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ ogiꞌ
pairs.target: For the Sadducees say that there is no resurrection, nor angel, nor spirit; but the Pharisees confess all of these.

pairs.source: Ulang soꞌ golongan Farisideꞌ jadin gulu agama Yahudi duoh ulang soꞌ golongan Saduki moꞌ bikalahpakai bisingak, makin tuui makin dolas  Yohmoꞌ in ulang soꞌ golonganFarisi, “Doiꞌ koꞌih tapod oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat deꞌ nai nyaꞌa itih, podo ogiꞌ iyangkeh, malaikat keh deꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e.”
pairs.target: A great clamor arose, and some of the scribes of the Pharisees’ part stood up, and contended, saying, “We find no evil in this man. But if a spirit or angel has spoken to him, let’s not fight against God!”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ isin-isin bikalah, komandan sidadu inoh moꞌtolu jak odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ pijolaꞌ Paulus odaꞌ kobos  Pimipin sidadu inohmoꞌ odaꞌ onak buah-e odi mit Paulus soꞌ uun odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ odaꞌ tobankeꞌ pos-e.
pairs.target: When a great argument arose, the commanding officer, fearing that Paul would be torn in pieces by them, commanded the soldiers to go down and take him by force from among them, and bring him into the barracks.

pairs.source: Takal ngalom deꞌ nikan-e, Topaꞌ nog mujuag sinok Paulus, Yoh moꞌsina, “Maꞌ yaꞌ tolu  Oni wat muꞌu bilani magah Okuꞌ deꞌ Yerusalem, watnohgeh muꞌu halus magah Okuꞌ deꞌ Roma.”
pairs.target: The following night, the Lord stood by him, and said, “Cheer up, Paul, for as you have testified about me at Jerusalem, so you must testify also at Rome.”

pairs.source: Onu tiaꞌ pagi-e kudu-kudu naꞌan ulang Yahudi moꞌ nai pokat jaꞌat-e.Yohmoꞌ bisupah simoꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ aluaꞌ diꞌ-e ngabos Paulus, odop-edeꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e man diꞌ-e nuak
pairs.target: When it was day, some of the Jews banded together, and bound themselves under a curse, saying that they would neither eat nor drink until they had killed Paul.

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ bipokat inoh ogiꞌ lobih soꞌ patpuluꞌ naꞌan
pairs.target: There were more than forty people who had made this conspiracy.

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ odi ngaduap pimipin-pimipin agamaYahudi deꞌ ayuh duoh pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi deꞌ bokon daang-enang sina, “Koꞌih moꞌ bisupah diꞌ koꞌih yaꞌ man duoh yaꞌ nuak simoꞌ Paulusaluaꞌ diꞌ koꞌih ngabos-e
pairs.target: They came to the chief priests and the elders, and said, “We have bound ourselves under a great curse, to taste nothing until we have killed Paul.

pairs.source: Adin, madih ayua duoh ulang soꞌ PengadilanAgama Yahudi, ingan pait sulat tuduꞌ komandan sidadu Roma inoh, odaꞌiyoh toban Paulus paliꞌ ngaduap ingan pulaꞌ-pulaꞌ yaꞌ pilisa-e bonal-bonalsalah deꞌ nai-e  Koꞌih moꞌ siap yaꞌ ngabos yoh takal-e aluaꞌ diꞌ-e nog katiꞌ.”
pairs.target: Now therefore, you with the council inform the commanding officer that he should bring him down to you tomorrow, as though you were going to judge his case more exactly. We are ready to kill him before he comes near.”

pairs.source: Pak-e pokat nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ tomus deꞌ kojit pinanak Paulus,yoh moꞌ odi keꞌ pos tanon tuduꞌ Paulus
pairs.target: But Paul’s sister’s son heard they were lying in wait, and he came and entered into the barracks and told Paul.

pairs.source: Paulus moꞌ mogan niꞌ naꞌansoꞌ sidadu deꞌ munoꞌ yoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, “Toban onak mudaꞌ itih tuduꞌkomandan ingan dop-e ogiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ tanon-e.”
pairs.target: Paul summoned one of the centurions, and said, “Bring this young man to the commanding officer, for he has something to tell him.”

pairs.source: Sidadu inoh moꞌ tobanpinanak Paulus inoh tuduꞌ komandan-e, yoh moꞌ sina, “Paulus deꞌ daangjel inoh mogan okuꞌ, mitiaꞌ saꞌ okuꞌ toban pinanak-e itih tuduꞌ ingan, ogiꞌoniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ tanon-e tuduꞌ ingan.”
pairs.target: So he took him, and brought him to the commanding officer, and said, “Paul, the prisoner, summoned me and asked me to bring this young man to you, who has something to tell you.”

pairs.source: Komandan sidadu inoh moꞌ kagian tongan-e yoh moꞌ toban keꞌ tuakpos-e daang-e sikian tuduꞌ-e, “Oni deꞌ yaꞌ tanon muꞌ tuduꞌ okuꞌ?”
pairs.target: The commanding officer took him by the hand, and going aside, asked him privately, “What is it that you have to tell me?”

pairs.source: Yoh moꞌ nyawot-e, “Ulang-ulang Yahudi moꞌ bipokat yaꞌ mitiaꞌ tuduꞌingan odaꞌ toban Paulus ngaduap Pengadilan Agama Yahudi deꞌ palingayuh Tiaꞌ pagi  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ pulaꞌ-pulaꞌ yaꞌ pilisa Paulus bonal-bonal.
pairs.target: He said, “The Jews have agreed to ask you to bring Paul down to the council tomorrow, as though intending to inquire somewhat more accurately concerning him.

pairs.source: Pak-e maꞌ ingan yaꞌ ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ nang odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, dop-e ogiꞌlobih soꞌ pat puluꞌ naꞌan deꞌ bisukan tuman deꞌ olan, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌbisupah diꞌ-e man diꞌ-e nuak moꞌ-e aluaꞌ diꞌ-e ngabos Paulus  Adin odop-edeꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ siap, duam-e kajon ingan nang ‘yoh’ sijaꞌ-e.”
pairs.target: Therefore don’t yield to them, for more than forty men lie in wait for him, who have bound themselves under a curse neither to eat nor to drink until they have killed him. Now they are ready, looking for the promise from you.”

pairs.source: Komandansidadu inoh moꞌ odaꞌ pinanak Paulus inoh paliꞌ, yoh moꞌ in-e, “Maꞌ tanontuduꞌ osi sijaꞌ-a nang odop muꞌ moꞌ tanon hal inoh tuduꞌ okuꞌ.”
pairs.target: So the commanding officer let the young man go, charging him, “Tell no one that you have revealed these things to me.”

pairs.source: Komandan sidadu inoh moꞌ mogan duwoh naꞌan komandan kompiyoh moꞌ tanon daꞌ-e, “Sidia sidadu pat latus juꞌ puluꞌ naꞌan odaꞌ bilakatpukul pliꞌi ngalom keꞌ Kaisarea: Duwoh latus naꞌan deꞌ pakai podang, juꞌpuluꞌ naꞌan pakai kuda, duwoh latus naꞌan lagiꞌ pakai asual
pairs.target: He called to himself two of the centurions, and said, “Prepare two hundred soldiers to go as far as Caesarea, with seventy horsemen, and two hundred men armed with spears, at the third hour of the night.”

pairs.source: Nyeꞌ moꞌsidia geh kuda saꞌan Paulus, toban iyoh odaꞌ odi tuduꞌ gubelnul Feliks.”
pairs.target: He asked them to provide animals, that they might set Paul on one, and bring him safely to Felix the governor.

pairs.source: Komandan sidadu inoh moꞌ nulis sulat tuduꞌ gubelnul Feliks  Deꞌ in-e,
pairs.target: He wrote a letter like this:

pairs.source: “Tuduꞌ ingan gubernur Feliks ulang deꞌ pimodo nyaꞌa daꞌ-a, Salamsoꞌ okuꞌ Klaudius Lisias!
pairs.target: “Claudius Lysias to the most excellent governor Felix: Greetings.

pairs.source: Samah-samah duoh sulat itih okuꞌ pait niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah takapodaꞌ ulang Yahudi   Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ kagaꞌ yaꞌ ngabos-e, pak-e okuꞌ nogtoban onak buah kuꞌ odi nyilamat iyoh  Dop-e koꞌih moꞌ ngojit yoh tuanglayat Roma geh
pairs.target: “This man was seized by the Jews, and was about to be killed by them, when I came with the soldiers and rescued him, having learned that he was a Roman.

pairs.source: Dop-e okuꞌ yaꞌ puꞌan oni salah deꞌ nuduh nyaꞌa tuduꞌ-e,okuꞌ moꞌ toban keꞌ Pengadilan Agama Yahudi
pairs.target: Desiring to know the cause why they accused him, I brought him down to their council.

pairs.source: Lupa-e Paulus doiꞌ naisalah deꞌ bitotok duoh ukum ngabos duoh obuah jel  Oniꞌ deꞌ nuduh-e tuduꞌPaulus jok-e soal agama odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, pak-e moꞌ-e nunaꞌ atulan Romayoh diꞌ-e salah
pairs.target: I found him to be accused about questions of their law, but not to be charged with anything worthy of death or of imprisonment.

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tanon nang ogiꞌ pokat jaꞌat ulang-ulangYahudi tuduꞌ yoh  Okuꞌ moꞌ lasuꞌ pait iyoh tuduꞌ ingan, okuꞌ moꞌ odaꞌ ayuadeꞌ nuduh Paulus odi saꞌ-a tanon oni salah Paulus deꞌ jowin ingan.”
pairs.target: When I was told that the Jews lay in wait for the man, I sent him to you immediately, charging his accusers also to bring their accusations against him before you. Farewell.”

pairs.source: Sidadu-sidadu deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nai kodaꞌ deꞌ sibaya-e, yoh moꞌ tobanPaulus takal onu ngalom nog keꞌ kota Antipatris
pairs.target: So the soldiers, carrying out their orders, took Paul and brought him by night to Antipatris.

pairs.source: Tiaꞌ pagi ayua sidadudeꞌ ponu poꞌon paliꞌ keꞌ pos-e, ayua sidadu deꞌ pakai kuda lanyut pimonu-esamah-samah duoh Paulus
pairs.target: But on the next day they left the horsemen to go with him, and returned to the barracks.

pairs.source: Takal-e moꞌ nog Kaisarea, sidadu deꞌ pakaikuda inoh moꞌ ngin sulat deꞌ soꞌ komandan-e tuduꞌ gubelnul Feliks simadi-enyelah baya Paulus
pairs.target: When they came to Caesarea and delivered the letter to the governor, they also presented Paul to him.

pairs.source: Takal gubelnul moꞌ basa sulat inoh yoh moꞌ sikiantuduꞌ Paulus in-e, “Muꞌu soꞌ propinsi ki?” Paulus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Okuꞌ soꞌpropinsi Kilikia.”
pairs.target: When the governor had read it, he asked what province he was from. When he understood that he was from Cilicia, he said,

pairs.source: Yoh moꞌ sina, “Okuꞌ ngituang oniꞌ deꞌ nuduh nyaꞌatuduꞌ muꞌu, takal nyaꞌa deꞌ nuduh muꞌu moꞌ nog katiꞌ.” Yoh moꞌ odaꞌ naanPaulus deꞌ istana Herodes.
pairs.target: “I will hear you fully when your accusers also arrive.” He commanded that he be kept in Herod’s palace.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ limoh onu Pimipin Agama Yahudi deꞌ Paling Ayuh Ananiasduoh kudu-kudu pimipin ulang Yahudi deꞌ bokon nog toban tukangbela, deꞌ adon-e Tertulus  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ngaduap gubelnul Feliks, ngan-eyaꞌ ngadu salah Paulus tuduꞌ-e
pairs.target: After five days, the high priest, Ananias, came down with certain elders and an orator, one Tertullus. They informed the governor against Paul.
