pairs.source: Gubelnul moꞌ mogan Paulus odaꞌ ngaduapodop-e, Tertulus mulai nuduh Paulus in-e,“Gubelnul Feliks, moꞌ tuui takal-e ingan deꞌ mipin, koꞌih moꞌ mulai kiꞌansonang, dop-e bogoꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ maju daang basa koꞌih odaꞌ bijak ingan.
pairs.target: When he was called, Tertullus began to accuse him, saying, “Seeing that by you we enjoy much peace, and that prosperity is coming to this nation by your foresight,

pairs.source: Daki sijaꞌ-e koꞌih silalu tilimaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai ingan, koꞌih bisukul tuduꞌingan
pairs.target: we accept it in all ways and in all places, most excellent Felix, with all thankfulness.

pairs.source: Pak-e saꞌ-e diꞌ-e tuui saꞌat masa ingan, sabal dioꞌ niꞌ tiliaꞌ ngojitdioꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ ngadu koꞌih tuduꞌ ingan
pairs.target: But, that I don’t delay you, I entreat you to bear with us and hear a few words.

pairs.source: Koꞌih moꞌ ningaꞌ nyaꞌa itih ulangpingaso deꞌ bahaya  Daki-daki sijaꞌ-e yoh odaꞌ ulang Yahudi bikaꞌi si odop-e.Iyoh leh deꞌ jadin pimipin soꞌ uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal Yesussoꞌ Nazaret
pairs.target: For we have found this man to be a plague, an instigator of insurrections among all the Jews throughout the world, and a ringleader of the sect of the Nazarenes.

pairs.source: Yoh lika suba kaꞌis Boli Topaꞌ, pak-e koꞌih moꞌ takap-e  Koꞌihyaꞌ bilituang duoh-e nunaꞌ atulan agama odop-e koꞌih
pairs.target: He even tried to profane the temple, and we arrested him.

pairs.source: Pak-e komandanLisias nog tuduꞌ koꞌih, yoh moꞌ nalik yoh soꞌ koꞌih
pairs.target: but Lysias the commander came, and with great force took him out of our hands,

pairs.source: Lisias moꞌ odaꞌ koꞌihodi tuduꞌ ingan, moꞌ odop ingan deꞌ sikian totap ingan puꞌan nang onideꞌ ngadu koꞌih itih tok.”
pairs.target: By examining him yourself you may ascertain all these things of which we accuse him.”

pairs.source: Ulang-ulang Yahudi deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ tuang suwaꞌnyalah Paulus, yoh nang suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ sobot Tertulus inoh akan-e tok.
pairs.target: The Jews also joined in the attack, affirming that these things were so.

pairs.source: Gubelnul Feliks moꞌ tanon odaꞌ Paulus sina, Paulus moꞌ in-e, “Moꞌpuꞌan kuꞌ nang ingan moꞌ bisowaꞌ-sowaꞌ moꞌ jadin hakim basa koꞌih, nohleh ngan kuꞌ sonang tapod sina tanon nang odop kuꞌ diꞌ-e salah deꞌ jowiningan
pairs.target: When the governor had beckoned to him to speak, Paul answered, “Because I know that you have been a judge of this nation for many years, I cheerfully make my defense,

pairs.source: Ingan soꞌon kalik nyaꞌa soꞌ ingan sikian-e dop-e simoong duwohonu deꞌ dioꞌ okuꞌ odi keꞌ Yerusalem nyomah Topaꞌ
pairs.target: seeing that you can verify that it is not more than twelve days since I went up to worship at Jerusalem.

pairs.source: Aluaꞌ doiꞌ sidoh nyaꞌadeꞌ mutiꞌ tapod okuꞌ bikalah duoh osi-osi-e, aluaꞌ doiꞌ nyaꞌa tapod okuꞌnguluk nyaꞌa odaꞌ bikaꞌi bait deꞌ Boli Topaꞌ bait deꞌ boli topat simayangduoh topat-topat deꞌ bokon daang kota
pairs.target: In the temple they didn’t find me disputing with anyone or stirring up a crowd, either in the synagogues, or in the city.

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e tapodtanon bukti oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ ngadu-e inoh tuduꞌ ingan
pairs.target: Nor can they prove to you the things of which they now accuse me.

pairs.source: Pak-e okuꞌ ngadutuduꞌ ingan nang okuꞌ nyomah Topaꞌ sumuk babai koꞌih nunaꞌ Olan deꞌtanon Topaꞌ Yesus  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nang okuꞌ salah, pak-e okuꞌ bisayaꞌsuaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ obuah nulis daang buk deꞌ nulis nabi Musa, duoh buk deꞌ nulisnabi-nabi deꞌ bokon
pairs.target: But this I confess to you, that after the Way, which they call a sect, so I serve the God of our fathers, believing all things which are according to the law, and which are written in the prophets;

pairs.source: Okuꞌ samah kodaꞌ yoh deꞌ mutiꞌ geh, okuꞌ bisayaꞌnang Topaꞌ yaꞌ paliꞌ pakat nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ kobos odaꞌ paliꞌ idip, bait nyaꞌa deꞌpaguh bait nyaꞌa deꞌ jaꞌat!
pairs.target: having hope toward God, which these also themselves look for, that there will be a resurrection of the dead, both of the just and unjust.

pairs.source: Noh leh ngan kuꞌ silalu nai oniꞌ bonal-bonalnunaꞌ otin osuap kuꞌ, saꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat tuduꞌ Topaꞌ baya manusia.
pairs.target: Herein I also practice always having a conscience void of offense toward God and men.

pairs.source: Kudu-kudu sowaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ dioꞌ okuꞌ moꞌ buꞌu togan Yerusalem, okuꞌmoꞌ paliꞌ toban duit deꞌ moꞌ masia koꞌih saꞌan basa odop koꞌih, duohsimoliah binatang saꞌan Topaꞌ
pairs.target: Now after some years, I came to bring gifts for the needy to my nation, and offerings;

pairs.source: Takal okuꞌ mokuaꞌ nai adat kibisig odopkuꞌ, okuꞌ aluaꞌ simoliah binatang saꞌan Topaꞌ deꞌ Boli Topaꞌ  Kudu-kudunaꞌan ulang Yahudi soꞌ Asia kilin okuꞌ danoꞌ, doiꞌ-e nak ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌdeꞌ bikaꞌi
pairs.target: amid which certain Jews from Asia found me purified in the temple, not with a mob, nor with turmoil.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ leh deꞌ patut nog ngadu okuꞌ tuduꞌ ingan,moꞌ nyam-e tok ogiꞌ salah kuꞌ
pairs.target: They ought to have been here before you, and to make accusation, if they had anything against me.

pairs.source: – 21 Suba ingan odaꞌ odop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ deꞌtanon oni salah okuꞌ deꞌ tapod-e takal-e toban okuꞌ ngaduap PengadilanAgama  Takal inoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e tapod oni salah kuꞌ, podo odop-edeꞌ munoꞌ buꞌui ngojit sina kuꞌ deꞌ in-e deꞌ sulung jowin odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ,‘Okuꞌ obuah ngadel onu itih dop-e okuꞌ bisayaꞌ nang nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos yaꞌpaliꞌ idip.’ ”
pairs.target: -21 Or else let these men themselves say what injustice they found in me when I stood before the council,    unless it is for this one thing that I cried standing among them, ‘Concerning the resurrection of the dead I am being judged before you today!’”

pairs.source: Pak-e Feliks moꞌ bogoꞌ puꞌan oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ ngajal Topaꞌ Yesus, moꞌkangan odop-e bilituang yoh moꞌ in-e, “Kajon Lisias komandan sidadu inohnog katiꞌ, ke okuꞌ motod ituang-e itih.”
pairs.target: But Felix, having more exact knowledge concerning the Way, deferred them, saying, “When Lysias, the commanding officer, comes down, I will decide your case.”

pairs.source: Feliks moꞌ odaꞌ komandan pasukan sidadu inoh totap naan Paulus,pak-e diꞌ-e jolaꞌ ngilate-e, simoꞌ-e ogiꞌ dingan-dingan-e nog ngin oniꞌ deꞌpilelu-e diꞌ-e jaman-e.
pairs.target: He ordered the centurion that Paul should be kept in custody, and should have some privileges, and not to forbid any of his friends to serve him or to visit him.

pairs.source: Kudu-kudu onu mokuaꞌ inoh Feliks duoh sowon-e deꞌ adon Drusila,ulang Yahudi, odi keꞌ topat Paulus obuah naan, yoh moꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa tobanPaulus tuduꞌ odop-e, yoh moꞌ ngojit Paulus tanon loti bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ YesusKristus
pairs.target: But after some days, Felix came with Drusilla, his wife, who was a Jewess, and sent for Paul, and heard him concerning the faith in Christ Jesus.

pairs.source: Pak-e takal Paulus sina oniꞌ deꞌ bonal deꞌ boton Topaꞌ, nijonasong, duoh onu takal Topaꞌ bilituang duoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa, Feliks moꞌ tolu.Yoh moꞌ in-e, “Moh dioꞌ! Buu negeh adin, lopas tih okuꞌ mogan muꞌulagiꞌ.”
pairs.target: As he reasoned about righteousness, self-control, and the judgment to come, Felix was terrified, and answered, “Go your way for this time, and when it is convenient for me, I will summon you.”

pairs.source: Yoh alap-alap nang Paulus ngin duit deꞌ odop-e, noh leh ngan-epaliꞌ-paliꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa mogan Paulus, odaꞌ odi sina duoh odop-e.
pairs.target: Meanwhile, he also hoped that money would be given to him by Paul, that he might release him. Therefore also he sent for him more often, and talked with him.

pairs.source: Pak-e takal sukup duwoh sowaꞌ, Perkius Festus moꞌ gati Feliks jadingubelnul  Saꞌ ulang Yahudi diꞌ-e buꞌui deꞌ odop-e, yoh moꞌ tanah Paulusodaꞌ totap daang jel.
pairs.target: But when two years were fulfilled, Felix was succeeded by Porcius Festus, and desiring to gain favor with the Jews, Felix left Paul in bonds.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ taluh onu takal Festus moꞌ nog keꞌ Kaisarea, yoh moꞌ bilakatsoꞌ kanoꞌ odi keꞌ Yerusalem
pairs.target: Festus therefore, having come into the province, after three days went up to Jerusalem from Caesarea.

pairs.source: Deꞌ Yerusalem pimipin-pimipin agamadeꞌ ayuh duoh ulang-ulang Yahudi deꞌ timogah nog ngaduap Festus, yohmoꞌ tanon oni deꞌ nuduh-e tuduꞌ Paulus
pairs.target: Then the high priest and the principal men of the Jews informed him against Paul, and they begged him,

pairs.source: Yoh moꞌ mitiaꞌ soꞌ Festus odaꞌtulung pait Paulus keꞌ Yerusalem  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ odaꞌ wat inoh, dop-eodop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bipokat yaꞌ ngabos Paulus deꞌ lopot olan.
pairs.target: asking a favor against him, that he would summon him to Jerusalem; plotting to kill him on the way.

pairs.source: Pak-e Festus moꞌ in-e, “Paulus totap obuah naan deꞌ Kaisarea, diꞌ-e tuilagiꞌ okuꞌ tuang yaꞌ paliꞌ kanih geh
pairs.target: However Festus answered that Paul should be kept in custody at Caesarea, and that he himself was about to depart shortly.

pairs.source: Moꞌ-e wat inoh, odaꞌ leh kudu-kudunaꞌan pimipin ingan suwaꞌ odi samah-samah duoh okuꞌ keꞌ Kaisarea, ingansoꞌon nutut iyoh danih kan-e ogiꞌ salah-e.”
pairs.target: “Let them therefore”, said he, “that are in power among you go down with me, and if there is anything wrong in the man, let them accuse him.”

pairs.source: Festus loꞌo deꞌ Yerusalem kulang lobih moih nog simoong onu  Mokuaꞌinoh yoh paliꞌ keꞌ Kaisarea  Onu tiaꞌ pagi-e yoh moꞌ odaꞌ onak buah-etoban Paulus, odi ngaduap odop-e
pairs.target: When he had stayed among them more than ten days, he went down to Caesarea, and on the next day he sat on the judgment seat, and commanded Paul to be brought.

pairs.source: Takal Paulus moꞌ nog, suaꞌ ulang-ulangYahudi deꞌ nog soꞌ Yerusalem moꞌ mujuag kulung Paulus  Yoh moꞌ nuduhPaulus nai bogoꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ tok-tok jaꞌat  Pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e tapodtanon bukti oni deꞌ nuduh-e tuduꞌ Paulus
pairs.target: When he had come, the Jews who had come down from Jerusalem stood around him, bringing against him many and grievous charges which they could not prove,

pairs.source: Paulus moꞌ bela odop-e, in-e,“Sit tuang doiꞌ geh kuꞌ salah, bait tuduꞌ Atulan-atulan Topaꞌ deꞌ nulis nabiMusa, tuduꞌ boli Topaꞌ, bait tuduꞌ laja Roma deꞌ paling ayuh.”
pairs.target: while he said in his defense, “Neither against the law of the Jews, nor against the temple, nor against Caesar, have I sinned at all.”

pairs.source: Pak-e Festus yaꞌ odaꞌ otin ulang Yahudi sonang, yohmoꞌ sikian tuduꞌPaulus, in-e, “Laꞌan muꞌ yeh odi keꞌ Yerusalem, saꞌ kuꞌ ngituang oniꞌ deꞌnuduh nyaꞌa tuduꞌ muꞌu danih?”
pairs.target: But Festus, desiring to gain favor with the Jews, answered Paul and said, “Are you willing to go up to Jerusalem, and be judged by me there concerning these things?”

pairs.source: Pak-e Paulus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Adin okuꞌ ogiꞌ mujuag deꞌ jowinpengadilan Laja Roma deꞌ paling ayuh, datiꞌ leh topat ingan ngituangokuꞌ  Ingan tuang puꞌan nang okuꞌ doiꞌ salah kuꞌ tuduꞌ ulang Yahudi.
pairs.target: But Paul said, “I am standing before Caesar’s judgment seat, where I ought to be tried. I have done no wrong to the Jews, as you also know very well.

pairs.source: Simoꞌ-e tok ogiꞌ okuꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat deꞌ bitotok duoh ukum ngabos,okuꞌ siap tilimaꞌ-e, pak-e simoꞌ-e oniꞌ deꞌ napo-e tuduꞌ okuꞌ diꞌ-e bonal,osi sijaꞌ-e doiꞌ hak-e yaꞌ nyelah okuꞌ tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ  Okuꞌ mitiaꞌbilituang deꞌ jowin laja Roma deꞌ paling ayuh.”
pairs.target: For if I have done wrong, and have committed anything worthy of death, I don’t refuse to die; but if none of those things is true that they accuse me of, no one can give me up to them. I appeal to Caesar!”

pairs.source: Festus moꞌ biloneng duoh penasehat-e, mokuaꞌ inoh Festus moꞌ sina,“Muꞌu halus odi ngaduap Laja Roma deꞌ paling ayuh, muꞌu mitiaꞌ bilituangdeꞌ jowin Laja inoh.”
pairs.target: Then Festus, when he had conferred with the council, answered, “You have appealed to Caesar. To Caesar you shall go.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ kudu-kudu onu-e, Laja Agripa duoh sudiꞌ-e deꞌ dayung deꞌadon Bernike nog keꞌ Kaisarea, ngan-e odi nomi Festus
pairs.target: Now when some days had passed, King Agrippa and Bernice arrived at Caesarea, and greeted Festus.

pairs.source: Kudu-kudu onu-eLaja Agripa duoh Bernike loꞌo danoꞌ, Festus moꞌ tanon suaꞌ masalah Paulustuduꞌ laja Agripa  Festus moꞌ sina,“Datiꞌ ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah naan, takal Feliks aluaꞌ jadin gubelnul.
pairs.target: As he stayed there many days, Festus laid Paul’s case before the king, saying, “There is a certain man left a prisoner by Felix;

pairs.source: Takal okuꞌ aluaꞌ deꞌ Yerusalem pimipin-pimipin agama deꞌ ayuh duohulang-ulang Yahudi deꞌ timogah moꞌ tanon oniꞌ deꞌ nuduh-e tuduꞌ Paulusduoh odaꞌ ngukum iyoh
pairs.target: about whom, when I was at Jerusalem, the chief priests and the elders of the Jews informed me, asking for a sentence against him.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ moꞌ nyawot odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, ‘Idoh diꞌ-etapod moꞌ-e nunaꞌ adat Roma, nyeꞌ nyelah nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah napo odaꞌ obuahukum, simoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nang-e salah inoh aluaꞌ diꞌ-e odaꞌ ngaduap nyaꞌadeꞌ napo iyoh, duoh odaꞌ bela odop-e
pairs.target: To whom I answered that it is not the custom of the Romans to give up any man to destruction, before the accused has met the accusers face to face, and has had opportunity to make his defense concerning the matter laid against him.

pairs.source: Jadin takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌsamah-samah duoh okuꞌ nog katiꞌ, tiaꞌ pagi-e okuꞌ moꞌ lasuꞌ guluꞌ bilituang,kuꞌ moꞌ odaꞌ Paulus molot ngaduap okuꞌ.’
pairs.target: When therefore they had come together here, I didn’t delay, but on the next day sat on the judgment seat, and commanded the man to be brought.

pairs.source: Ayua deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ mokatmujuag tanon oniꞌ deꞌ napo-e tuduꞌ Paulus, pak-e niꞌ tuang doiꞌ geh oniꞌ deꞌjaꞌat deꞌ nai-e kodaꞌ deꞌ sakaꞌ kuꞌ
pairs.target: Concerning whom, when the accusers stood up, they brought no charge of such things as I supposed;

pairs.source: Pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bikalah duohPaulus jok-e hal agama odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ adon Yesus deꞌmoꞌ kobos, pak-e Paulus tanon nang Iyoh moꞌ tok-tok mokat idip baꞌuh.
pairs.target: but had certain questions against him about their own religion, and about one Jesus, who was dead, whom Paul affirmed to be alive.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ tuang moꞌ idoh geh diꞌ kuꞌ puꞌan oni wat kuꞌ yaꞌ ngiloti oniꞌ deꞌbikalah odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, okuꞌ moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Paulus, ‘Oni keh muꞌu laꞌanodi keꞌ Yerusalem, otoꞌ ngituang oniꞌ deꞌ napo-e tuduꞌ muꞌu itih danih?’
pairs.target: Being perplexed how to inquire concerning these things, I asked whether he was willing to go to Jerusalem and there be judged concerning these matters.

pairs.source: Pak-e Paulus doliaꞌ-a, yoh mitiaꞌ odaꞌ odop-e totap obuah naan, okuꞌmoꞌ naan-e, nog okuꞌ tapod pait iyoh tuduꞌ Laja Roma deꞌ paling ayuh, saꞌyoh bilituang deꞌ jowin Laja Roma,” in Festus.
pairs.target: But when Paul had appealed to be kept for the decision of the emperor, I commanded him to be kept until I could send him to Caesar.”

pairs.source: Yohmoꞌ in Agripa tuduꞌ Festus, “Okuꞌ yaꞌ lasuꞌ ngojit soꞌ odop-e.”Festus moꞌ in-e, “Tiaꞌ pagi ingan bitapod lasuꞌ ngojit soꞌ odop-e.”
pairs.target: Agrippa said to Festus, “I also would like to hear the man myself.” “Tomorrow,” he said, “you shall hear him.”

pairs.source: Onu tiaꞌ pagi-e Agripa duoh Bernike moꞌ nog keꞌ topat bilituang, nyaꞌamoꞌ lami nyamut-e  Yoh moꞌ molot kaang topat bilituang samah-samahduoh ayua komandan sidadu, baya ulang-ulang timogah soꞌ kota inoh.Festus moꞌ pilitah odaꞌ sidadu-e toban Paulus molot
pairs.target: So on the next day, when Agrippa and Bernice had come with great pomp, and they had entered into the place of hearing with the commanding officers and the principal men of the city, at the command of Festus, Paul was brought in.

pairs.source: Festus moꞌ sina,“Laja Agripa duoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ datiꞌ! Nyaꞌa itih, moꞌ ogiꞌ ulangYahudi lepot tuduꞌ okuꞌ, bait takal kuꞌ deꞌ Yerusalem, watnoh geh takalkuꞌ deꞌ Kaisarea  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nutut Paulus pakai nang bogan-e,yoh diꞌ soꞌon otoꞌ tanah odaꞌ idip tuui
pairs.target: Festus said, “King Agrippa, and all men who are here present with us, you see this man, about whom all the multitude of the Jews petitioned me, both at Jerusalem and here, crying that he ought not to live any longer.

pairs.source: Pak-e deꞌ puꞌan okuꞌ, doiꞌ salahdeꞌ nai-e deꞌ bitotok duoh ukum ngabos  Takal yoh mitiaꞌ odaꞌ Laja Romadeꞌ paling ayuh ngituang odop-e, okuꞌ moꞌ motod yaꞌ pait iyoh tuduꞌ LajaRoma
pairs.target: But when I found that he had committed nothing worthy of death, and as he himself appealed to the emperor I determined to send him,

pairs.source: Pak-e doiꞌ deꞌ pasti deꞌ yaꞌ nulis kuꞌ tuduꞌ Laja Roma deꞌ palingayuh masalah yoh itih  Iyoh leh ngan kuꞌ toban yoh odaꞌ ngaduap suaꞌingan, lobih lagiꞌ tuduꞌ ingan Laja Agripa, saꞌ-e mokuaꞌ ingan pilisa-e, ogiꞌoniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nulis kuꞌ
pairs.target: of whom I have no certain thing to write to my lord. Therefore I have brought him out before you, and especially before you, King Agrippa, that, after examination, I may have something to write.

pairs.source: Dop-e moꞌ-e nunaꞌ kila kuꞌ, diꞌ-e patut nyeꞌ paitnyaꞌa deꞌ obuah naan, pak-e doiꞌ nyeꞌ tanon oni deꞌ napo nyaꞌa tuduꞌ-e.”
pairs.target: For it seems to me unreasonable, in sending a prisoner, not to also specify the charges against him.”

pairs.source: Laja Agripa moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ Paulus, “Muꞌu soꞌon sina tanon nangodop muꞌ diꞌ muꞌ salah.” Paulus moꞌ pakat tongan-e yoh moꞌ silitanang odop-e diꞌ-e salah, yoh moꞌ in-e,
pairs.target: Agrippa said to Paul, “You may speak for yourself.” Then Paul stretched out his hand, and made his defense.

pairs.source: “Laja Agripa, onu itih okuꞌ nang odop kuꞌ tok bituah dop-e okuꞌ tapodsina tuduꞌ ingan nang odop kuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ salah kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nuduh ulangYahudi tuduꞌ okuꞌ
pairs.target: “I think myself happy, King Agrippa, that I am to make my defense before you today concerning all the things that I am accused by the Jews,

pairs.source: Amot-e ingan deꞌ tok puꞌan adat duoh suaꞌ oniꞌ daangbangsa koꞌih Yahudi, okuꞌ mitiaꞌ ingan sabal ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ tanon kuꞌ.
pairs.target: especially because you are expert in all customs and questions which are among the Jews. Therefore I beg you to hear me patiently.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ ulang Yahudi puꞌan oni wat idip kuꞌ soꞌ takal okuꞌ aluaꞌ mudaꞌ,okuꞌ idip samah-samah duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ Yerusalem
pairs.target: “Indeed, all the Jews know my way of life from my youth up, which was from the beginning among my own nation and at Jerusalem;

pairs.source: Simoꞌodop-e deꞌ munoꞌ laꞌan tanon-e, moꞌ tuui odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ puꞌan nangokuꞌ soꞌ uluk ulang Farisi  Ulang deꞌ paling tutug nunaꞌ atulan deꞌ ogiꞌdaang agama Yahudi
pairs.target: having known me from the first, if they are willing to testify, that after the strictest sect of our religion I lived a Pharisee.

pairs.source: Adin okuꞌ mujuag datiꞌ obuah ngituang deꞌ jowiningan luban okuꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ janyi deꞌ nai Topaꞌ tuduꞌ sumuk babai koꞌih.
pairs.target: Now I stand here to be judged for the hope of the promise made by God to our fathers,

pairs.source: Suaꞌ ulang Yahudi tuang suwaꞌ geh kajon janyi inoh, noh leh ngan odop-edeꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ buwon-buwon singonu-singalom nyomah Topaꞌ  Luban okuꞌbisayaꞌ deꞌ janyi inoh leh okuꞌ obuah nuduh odaꞌ ulang Yahudi
pairs.target: which our twelve tribes, earnestly serving night and day, hope to attain. Concerning this hope I am accused by the Jews, King Agrippa!

pairs.source: Oni naidiꞌ ingan bisayaꞌ nang Topaꞌ tapod pakat nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos odaꞌ mokat idipbaꞌuh?
pairs.target: Why is it judged incredible with you, if God does raise the dead?

pairs.source: Sibonal-e dioꞌ soꞌ kanoꞌ okuꞌ tuang suwaꞌ geh nai oni sijaꞌ-e ngan kuꞌlawan pinunaꞌ Yesus, nyaꞌa soꞌ Nazaret inoh
pairs.target: “I myself most certainly thought that I ought to do many things contrary to the name of Jesus of Nazareth.

pairs.source: Wat inoh leh oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌnai okuꞌ deꞌ Yerusalem takal okuꞌ moꞌ soꞌon sulat kuasa soꞌ pimipin-pimipinagama Yahudi, okuꞌ moꞌ takap ulang deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus biyon daangjel  Okuꞌ tuang suwaꞌ situju geh ulang Kristen obuah ngabos
pairs.target: This I also did in Jerusalem. I both shut up many of the saints in prisons, having received authority from the chief priests, and when they were put to death I gave my vote against them.

pairs.source: Bogoꞌ sidohokuꞌ pijolaꞌ ulang deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ Yesus deꞌ boli topat simayang,duoh paksa saꞌ-e diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus  Nyam oniꞌ deꞌ nyouh kila kuꞌ,okuꞌ ngajah kalik ulang Kristen sape nog kota deꞌ bokon.”
pairs.target: Punishing them often in all the synagogues, I tried to make them blaspheme. Being exceedingly enraged against them, I persecuted them even to foreign cities.

pairs.source: Paulus lanyut silita-e in-e, “Wat inoh geh okuꞌ odi keꞌ Damsyik tobansulat kuasa deꞌ soꞌ pimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh.”
pairs.target: “Whereupon as I traveled to Damascus with the authority and commission from the chief priests,

pairs.source: Oi lajaAgripa, takal inoh okuꞌ deꞌ lopot olan aluaꞌ uun onu, tang-tang jawaꞌ soꞌlongit lobih soꞌ jawaꞌ boton onu nyokuab okuꞌ duoh dingan-dingan kuꞌ.
pairs.target: at noon, O king, I saw on the way a light from the sky, brighter than the sun, shining around me and those who traveled with me.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ odop koꞌih labuꞌ keꞌ tanaꞌ, okuꞌ moꞌ ngojit sina deꞌ pakai sina Ibrani,‘Saulus, Saulus! Oni nai muꞌu pijolaꞌ Okuꞌ? Doiꞌ guna muꞌ lawan niat Topaꞌ,madas kanam odop muꞌ sijaꞌ-e.’
pairs.target: When we had all fallen to the earth, I heard a voice saying to me in the Hebrew language, ‘Saul, Saul, why are you persecuting me? It is hard for you to kick against the goads.’

pairs.source: Okuꞌ moꞌ nyawot, ‘Osi Ingan?’Yoh moꞌ in-e nyawot okuꞌ, ‘Okuꞌ leh Yesus deꞌ bigaꞌan muꞌu pijolaꞌ-e.
pairs.target: “I said, ‘Who are you, Lord?’ “He said, ‘I am Jesus, whom you are persecuting.

pairs.source: Mokat mujuag! Okuꞌ bitanga odop Kuꞌ tuduꞌ muꞌu, saꞌ muꞌu kiloja saꞌanOkuꞌ  Okuꞌ odaꞌ muꞌu magah suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ kilin muꞌ onu itih tuduꞌ suaꞌnyaꞌa, duoh tanon suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ bitanga Kuꞌ tuduꞌ muꞌu sunih onu-e.
pairs.target: But arise, and stand on your feet, for I have appeared to you for this purpose: to appoint you a servant and a witness both of the things which you have seen, and of the things which I will reveal to you;

pairs.source: Okuꞌ odaꞌ muꞌu odi tuduꞌ basa Yahudi duoh basa deꞌ diꞌ-e Yahudi  Nyaꞌadeꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ lawan muꞌu pak-e Okuꞌ yaꞌ nyilamat muꞌu
pairs.target: delivering you from the people, and from the Gentiles, to whom I send you,

pairs.source: Okuꞌ odaꞌ muꞌubukaꞌ boton nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ, saꞌ-e kos soꞌ mopung odi keꞌ jawaꞌ, saꞌ-e lopassoꞌ kuasa Laja muat munua yoh moꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, saꞌ-e takal-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌOkuꞌ, Topaꞌ ngapun dosa-e, Topaꞌ odaꞌ yoh soꞌon topat deꞌ moꞌ jok-e saꞌannyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ pilih-e,’ inoh in Yesus.
pairs.target: to open their eyes, that they may turn from darkness to light and from the power of Satan to God, that they may receive remission of sins and an inheritance among those who are sanctified by faith in me.’

pairs.source: “Oi laja Agripa, noh leh ngan okuꞌ silalu nai oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ tanon-Etakal-E sina soꞌ siluga
pairs.target: “Therefore, King Agrippa, I was not disobedient to the heavenly vision,

pairs.source: Sibungas-e okuꞌ odi tuduꞌ ulang Yahudi deꞌDamsyik, deꞌ kota Yerusalem duoh suaꞌ propinsi Yudea, mokuaꞌ inoh tuduꞌbasa deꞌ diꞌ-e Yahudi okuꞌ tanon odaꞌ suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ togan olandeꞌ jaꞌat, paliꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ nyeꞌ moꞌ nai kiloja deꞌ paguh saꞌ-e puꞌan nangodop-e moꞌ togan olan deꞌ jaꞌat
pairs.target: but declared first to them of Damascus, at Jerusalem, and throughout all the country of Judea, and also to the Gentiles, that they should repent and turn to God, doing works worthy of repentance.

pairs.source: Noh leh oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ tanon okuꞌ lubanulang Yahudi takap okuꞌ deꞌ Boli Topaꞌ, iyoh moꞌ yaꞌ ngabos okuꞌ
pairs.target: For this reason the Jews seized me in the temple, and tried to kill me.

pairs.source: Pak-enog adin Topaꞌ aluaꞌ tulung okuꞌ, adin okuꞌ tapod mujuag datiꞌ tanon tuduꞌsuaꞌ nyaꞌa, bait ulang deꞌ sotok, bait ulang deꞌ kaya  Oniꞌ deꞌ tanon kuꞌ itihdoiꞌ deꞌ bokon, oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nutaꞌ nabi Musa duoh nabi-nabi deꞌ bokon.
pairs.target: Having therefore obtained the help that is from God, I stand to this day testifying both to small and great, saying nothing but what the prophets and Moses said would happen,

pairs.source: Yoh nang Laja pinyilamat totap jolaꞌ, Iyoh yaꞌ kobos  Iyoh inoh leh deꞌpidioꞌ-o mokat idip soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ kobos  Iyoh leh deꞌ yaꞌ tanon olandeꞌ jawaꞌ tuduꞌ ulang Yahudi duoh ulang deꞌ diꞌ-e Yahudi saꞌ-a silamat.”
pairs.target: how the Christ must suffer, and how, by the resurrection of the dead, he would be first to proclaim light both to these people and to the Gentiles.”

pairs.source: Takal Paulus aluaꞌ sina tanon oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nai-e, tang-tang gubelnulFestus mokat nyingak Paulus, “Gila muꞌu neh! Muꞌu sikiya bogoꞌ bilajal,muꞌu moꞌ gila odaꞌ-e.”
pairs.target: As he thus made his defense, Festus said with a loud voice, “Paul, you are crazy! Your great learning is driving you insane!”

pairs.source: Paulus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Idoh diꞌ kuꞌ gila nehgubelnul Festus deꞌ pimodo okuꞌ daꞌ-e, sina deꞌ nang kuꞌ itih akan-e tokbonal duoh molot akal!
pairs.target: But he said, “I am not crazy, most excellent Festus, but boldly declare words of truth and reasonableness.

pairs.source: Laja Agripa tuang puꞌan-e geh suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌmutiꞌ  Yoh ngan kuꞌ bilani sina deꞌ sulung jowin-e  Okuꞌ bisayaꞌ nang iyohpuꞌan-e, dop-e suaꞌ nyaꞌa tuang puꞌan-e geh dop-e oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ jadi deꞌjowin nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ
pairs.target: For the king knows of these things, to whom also I speak freely. For I am persuaded that none of these things is hidden from him, for this has not been done in a corner.

pairs.source: Bisayaꞌ kedoh keh ingan laja Agripa oniꞌ deꞌ tanonnabi? Okuꞌ puꞌan nang ingan bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ nabi.”
pairs.target: King Agrippa, do you believe the prophets? I know that you believe.”

pairs.source: Laja Agripa moꞌ nyawot-e, “Likas manah muꞌu odaꞌ okuꞌ jadin ulangKristen!”
pairs.target: Agrippa said to Paul, “With a little persuasion are you trying to make me a Christian?”

pairs.source: Paulus moꞌ in-e, “Likas bait tuui bait, okuꞌ yaꞌ bidoa mitiaꞌtuduꞌ Topaꞌ saꞌ ingan duoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit pingunang kuꞌ datiꞌ samahkodaꞌ okuꞌ  Jok-e ingan diꞌ-e obuah pasung kodaꞌ okuꞌ.”
pairs.target: Paul said, “I pray to God, that whether with little or with much, not only you, but also all that hear me today, might become such as I am, except for these bonds.”

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh laja Agripa, Gubelnul Festus, Bernike, duoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌguluꞌ samah-samah duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ mokat mujuag
pairs.target: The king rose up with the governor, and Bernice, and those who sat with them.

pairs.source: Daang-eluah odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e si odop-e, “Nyaꞌa itih doiꞌ nyam salah-ediꞌ-e patut nyeꞌ yaꞌ ngabos-e duoh ngejel-e.”
pairs.target: When they had withdrawn, they spoke to one another, saying, “This man does nothing worthy of death or of bonds.”

pairs.source: Laja Agripa moꞌ in-e duoh Gubelnul Festus, “Simoꞌ yoh diꞌ-e mitiaꞌbilituang tuduꞌ Laja Roma deꞌ paling ayuh yoh itih moꞌ tapod nyeꞌ pilopas-e.”
pairs.target: Agrippa said to Festus, “This man might have been set free if he had not appealed to Caesar.”

pairs.source: Takal-e moꞌ nog onu deꞌ notap-e, koꞌih yaꞌ bilayal keꞌ kota Romadeꞌ negeli Italia, Paulus duoh kudu-kudu naꞌan ulang deꞌ obuahnaan, yohmoꞌ nyelah tuduꞌ piayuh pasukan sidadu Roma deꞌ adon Yulius.Pasukan inoh deꞌ kakuꞌ odop Laja Roma deꞌ paling ayuh
pairs.target: When it was determined that we should sail for Italy, they delivered Paul and certain other prisoners to a centurion named Julius, of the Augustan band.

pairs.source: Koꞌih muat deꞌkapal deꞌ nog soꞌ kota Adramitium, deꞌ yaꞌ bilakat keꞌ pelabuhan-pelabuhandeꞌ propinsi Asia  Aristarkhus, ulang Makedonia deꞌ nog soꞌ Tesalonika,samah-samah suwaꞌ bilayal duoh koꞌih
pairs.target: Embarking in a ship of Adramyttium, which was about to sail to places on the coast of Asia, we put to sea; Aristarchus, a Macedonian of Thessalonica, being with us.

pairs.source: Onu tiaꞌ pagi-e koꞌih moꞌ nogkeꞌ Sidon  Yulius sukup paguh duoh Paulus, iyoh diꞌ-e jaman Paulus odibitapod duoh dingan-dingan-e, saꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ngin oniꞌ deꞌ pileluPaulus
pairs.target: The next day, we touched at Sidon. Julius treated Paul kindly, and gave him permission to go to his friends and refresh himself.

pairs.source: Takal koꞌih moꞌ bilayal soꞌ Sidon, sobak dolas moꞌ nog soꞌ jowinkapal, koꞌih moꞌ bilayal nunaꞌ bingon laut pulou Siprus ngan koꞌih nonansobak inoh
pairs.target: Putting to sea from there, we sailed under the lee of Cyprus, because the winds were contrary.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inoh kapal koꞌih moꞌ motas laut deꞌ biladuap duohKilikia duoh Pamfilia, koꞌih moꞌ nog keꞌ kota Mira deꞌ propinsi Likia.
pairs.target: When we had sailed across the sea which is off Cilicia and Pamphylia, we came to Myra, a city of Lycia.

pairs.source: Danoꞌ piayuh pasukan sidadu inoh moꞌ tapod niꞌ kapal deꞌ nog soꞌ kotaAleksandria deꞌ yaꞌ bilayal keꞌ Italia  Yoh moꞌ odaꞌ koꞌih pinah deꞌ kapalinoh.
pairs.target: There the centurion found a ship of Alexandria sailing for Italy, and he put us on board.

pairs.source: Kapal koꞌih bilayal lamat posah, kudu-kudu onu-e ke koꞌih nog kotaKnidus  Dop-e sobak dolas aluaꞌ nog soꞌ jowin kapal, koꞌih moꞌ diꞌ tapodlanyut bilayal  Saꞌ diꞌ koꞌih obuah sobak deꞌ dolas, koꞌih moꞌ ponu nuaꞌtoꞌuh boton onu tumuꞌ, ngilusuꞌ nyuang pulou Kreta, deꞌ adon tonyungSalmone
pairs.target: When we had sailed slowly many days, and had come with difficulty opposite Cnidus, the wind not allowing us further, we sailed under the lee of Crete, opposite Salmone.

pairs.source: Daang susah payah koꞌih motas tonyung inoh, koꞌih moꞌ nogtopat deꞌ adon Pelabuhan Sangon, sinok kota Lasea.
pairs.target: With difficulty sailing along it we came to a certain place called Fair Havens, near the city of Lasea.

pairs.source: Bogoꞌ onu deꞌ moꞌ tibuang, onu ayuh puasa ulang Yahudi moꞌ mokuaꞌ,moꞌ diꞌ-e aman otoꞌ yaꞌ lanyut bilayal dop-e moꞌ musim ijan  Noh leh nganPaulus in-e,
pairs.target: When much time had passed and the voyage was now dangerous, because the Fast had now already gone by, Paul admonished them,

pairs.source: “Madih ayua, moꞌ-e nunaꞌ kila okuꞌ, sikiya bahaya simoꞌotoꞌ totap bilayal  Doh diꞌ-e jok-e kapal duoh balang-balang deꞌ tobantoꞌ, pak-e asong otoꞌ tuang idoh geh diꞌ-e yaꞌ silamat.”
pairs.target: and said to them, “Sirs, I perceive that the voyage will be with injury and much loss, not only of the cargo and the ship, but also of our lives.”

pairs.source: Piayuh pasukansidadu diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ deꞌ pingunang Paulus, pak-e yoh lobih bisayaꞌ tuduꞌdileba kapal, duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ mipin kapal
pairs.target: But the centurion gave more heed to the master and to the owner of the ship than to those things which were spoken by Paul.

pairs.source: Pelabuhan inoh diꞌ-e paguhtopat kapal-kapal loꞌo daang musim modud, yoh ngan-e nyaꞌa deꞌ kilojadeꞌ kapal bogoꞌ deꞌ situju lasuꞌ bilayal nog kota Feniks duoh loꞌo danoꞌsilamaꞌ musim modud  Feniks iyoh leh kota pelabuhan deꞌ pulou Kreta deꞌngaduap nuaꞌ boit boton onu timutuam.
pairs.target: Because the haven was not suitable to winter in, the majority advised going to sea from there, if by any means they could reach Phoenix, and winter there, which is a port of Crete, looking northeast and southeast.

pairs.source: Takal inoh sobak goyuang-goyuang-e nog soꞌ nuaꞌ toꞌuh boton onutumuꞌ, nyaꞌa deꞌ kiloja deꞌ kapal moꞌ sakaꞌ nang tapod lanyut bilayal  Odop-edeꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ paꞌad ganung kapal yoh moꞌ bilayal nunaꞌ bingon laut pulouKreta
pairs.target: When the south wind blew softly, supposing that they had obtained their purpose, they weighed anchor and sailed along Crete, close to shore.

pairs.source: Pak-e diꞌ-e tian ki-ki-e, sobak libut deꞌ nang nyaꞌa, ‘Sobak Nuaꞌ BoitJowin Boton Onu Tumuꞌ,’ moꞌ nog
pairs.target: But before long, a stormy wind beat down from shore, which is called Euroclydon.

pairs.source: Yohmoꞌ guyang-gusuak kapal koꞌih.Kapal moꞌ diꞌ-e taan yaꞌ lawan sobak, koꞌih moꞌ tanah odaꞌ kapal koꞌihpaman nunaꞌ sobak
pairs.target: When the ship was caught, and couldn’t face the wind, we gave way to it, and were driven along.

pairs.source: Kapal koꞌih paman nog pulou isit deꞌ adon Kauda,danoꞌ daang lolah posah koꞌih moꞌ tapod paꞌad onak olud keꞌ tun kapal.
pairs.target: Running under the lee of a small island called Clauda, we were able, with difficulty, to secure the boat.

pairs.source: Takal onak olud moꞌ maꞌad tun kapal, nyaꞌa deꞌ kiloja deꞌ kapal moꞌngilaling kapal pakai tolin  Dop-e yoh tolu jak kapal nyangag deꞌ pasil deꞌogiꞌ deꞌ lasan laut, deꞌ adon beting Sirtis  Yohmoꞌ pimuun layal kapal, yohmoꞌ tanah odaꞌ kapal paman nunaꞌ kaki sobak toban-e
pairs.target: After they had hoisted it up, they used cables to help reinforce the ship. Fearing that they would run aground on the Syrtis sand bars, they lowered the sea anchor, and so were driven along.

pairs.source: Sobak libut sukupdolas-e guyang-gusuak kapal, yohmoꞌ onu tiaꞌ pagi-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌmoꞌ mulai tolan balang-balang daang kapal keꞌ laut
pairs.target: As we labored exceedingly with the storm, the next day they began to throw things overboard.

pairs.source: Onu deꞌ nikan-e,nyaꞌa deꞌ kiloja deꞌ kapal mulai bitolan duoh alat-alat kapal pakai tonganodop-e sadiꞌ-e
pairs.target: On the third day, they threw out the ship’s tackle with their own hands.

pairs.source: Silamaꞌ kudu-kudu onu-e, boton onu duoh bitang-bitangdiꞌ-e tiyaꞌ tonga, sobak libut tuang diꞌ-e mokuaꞌ-mokuaꞌ  Koꞌih moꞌ diꞌ koꞌihalap nang odop koꞌih tapod yaꞌ silamat.
pairs.target: When neither sun nor stars shone on us for many days, and no small storm pressed on us, all hope that we would be saved was now taken away.

pairs.source: Moꞌ kudu-kudu onu odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e man  Paulus moꞌ mokatmujuag deꞌ uun odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, yoh moꞌ sina, “Madih ayua, simoꞌ inganngojit oniꞌ deꞌ nang okuꞌ, saꞌ diꞌ otoꞌ bilayal soꞌ Kreta, doiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ lusakduoh diꞌ otoꞌ lugi kodaꞌ itih
pairs.target: When they had been long without food, Paul stood up in the middle of them, and said, “Sirs, you should have listened to me, and not have set sail from Crete, and have gotten this injury and loss.

pairs.source: Pak-e okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ suaꞌ ingan, bialotoꞌ susah pak-e notod negeh kila ingan, dop-e niꞌ tuang doiꞌ geh deꞌ soꞌotoꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ kobos, jok-e kapal itih yaꞌ asul
pairs.target: Now I exhort you to cheer up, for there will be no loss of life among you, but only of the ship.

pairs.source: Dop-e singalom-e ogiꞌ niꞌnaꞌan malaikat soꞌ Topaꞌ, Topaꞌ deꞌ nyomah kuꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ idip kuꞌ, nogtuduꞌ okuꞌ
pairs.target: For there stood by me this night an angel, belonging to the God whose I am and whom I serve,

pairs.source: Yoh moꞌ sina in-E, ‘Maꞌ tolu Paulus! Muꞌu halus odi ngaduapLaja Roma deꞌ paling ayuh  Dop-e Topaꞌ paguh tuduꞌ muꞌu, yoh ngan-eyaꞌ nyilamat suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bilayal pakai kapal itih deꞌ samah-samah duohmuꞌu.’
pairs.target: saying, ‘Don’t be afraid, Paul. You must stand before Caesar. Behold, God has granted you all those who sail with you.’

pairs.source: Yohleh ngan otoꞌ totap notod kila toꞌ, dop-e okuꞌ bisayaꞌ Topaꞌpasti yaꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ tanon-E tuduꞌ okuꞌ
pairs.target: Therefore, sirs, cheer up! For I believe God, that it will be just as it has been spoken to me.

pairs.source: Pak-e sobak yaꞌ toban kapalotoꞌ itih, ogiꞌ pulou soꞌ-o yaꞌ supiah.”
pairs.target: But we must run aground on a certain island.”

pairs.source: Nog ngalom keꞌ simoong pat-e, koꞌih aluaꞌ tiguyang-tigusuak odaꞌgilumang deꞌ laut Adria, pak-e takal tuluap ngalom nyaꞌa deꞌ kiloja deꞌkapal moꞌ sakaꞌ nang odop-e moꞌ sinok doyoh
pairs.target: But when the fourteenth night had come, as we were driven back and forth in the Adriatic Sea, about midnight the sailors surmised that they were drawing near to some land.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ kiloja deꞌ kapalmoꞌ pimuun tolin ngan-e nojok lasan laut, kila-kila tuluap-e duwoh puluꞌdopoh  Mokuaꞌ inoh yoh nojok lagiꞌ, kila-kila tuluap-e simoong limohdopoh
pairs.target: They took soundings, and found twenty fathoms. After a little while, they took soundings again, and found fifteen fathoms.

pairs.source: Tolu jak kapal nyangag tun batuh kalang, nyaꞌa deꞌ kiloja deꞌkapal moꞌ pimuun ganung kapal nuaꞌ lubat kapal saꞌ kapal diꞌ-e tiligian,koꞌih moꞌ ngatiꞌ-ngatiꞌ onu jawaꞌ
pairs.target: Fearing that we would run aground on rocky ground, they let go four anchors from the stern, and wished for daylight.

pairs.source: Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ kiloja deꞌ kapal yaꞌ subabuu soꞌ kapal inoh  Yoh moꞌ pimuun onak olud, pulaꞌ-pulaꞌ yaꞌ pimuunganung kapal nuaꞌ jowin kapal
pairs.target: As the sailors were trying to flee out of the ship, and had lowered the boat into the sea, pretending that they would lay out anchors from the bow,

pairs.source: Pak-e Paulus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ piayuhpasukan sidadu duoh onak buah-e, “Simoꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e loꞌodaang kapal, ingan diꞌ dapod silamat.”
pairs.target: Paul said to the centurion and to the soldiers, “Unless these stay in the ship, you can’t be saved.”

pairs.source: Sidadu deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ kopog tolinonak olud deꞌ munoꞌ, yoh moꞌ tanah odaꞌ paman.
pairs.target: Then the soldiers cut away the ropes of the boat, and let it fall off.

pairs.source: Takal onu moꞌ yaꞌ jawaꞌ, Paulus moꞌ ngijaꞌ suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ ogiꞌ daangkapal odaꞌ man, Paulus moꞌ sina, “Moꞌ simoong pat onu jok ingan loꞌosijaꞌ-a, naan pilai duoh diꞌ ingan man
pairs.target: While the day was coming on, Paul begged them all to take some food, saying, “Today is the fourteenth day that you wait and continue fasting, having taken nothing.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan, man lehkadu-e soꞌ, saꞌ toꞌ bitaan idip, dop-e suaꞌ ingan pasti yaꞌ silamat.”
pairs.target: Therefore I beg you to take some food, for this is for your safety; for not a hair will perish from any of your heads.”

pairs.source: Takal-e mokuaꞌ sina, Paulus moꞌ mit kuweh, yohmoꞌ bisukul tuduꞌTopaꞌ deꞌ jowin odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, yohmoꞌ piliaꞌ-piliaꞌ-a bikutung odaꞌodop-e deꞌ munoꞌ man-e
pairs.target: When he had said this, and had taken bread, he gave thanks to God in the presence of all, and he broke it, and began to eat.

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ paliꞌ simangat, yoh moꞌsuwaꞌ man
pairs.target: Then they all cheered up, and they also took food.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ ogiꞌ daang kapal inoh ogiꞌ duwoh latus juꞌpuluꞌ nuam naꞌan
pairs.target: In all, we were two hundred seventy-six souls on the ship.

pairs.source: Takal-e mokuaꞌ man nog busuah-e, nyaꞌa deꞌ kilojadeꞌ kapal moꞌ tolan ganum kaang laut saꞌ kapal-e jangan.
pairs.target: When they had eaten enough, they lightened the ship, throwing out the wheat into the sea.

pairs.source: Takal onu moꞌ jawaꞌ, nyaꞌa deꞌ kiloja deꞌ kapal moꞌ ningaꞌ ogiꞌ doyoh,pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e puꞌan pulou oni inoh  Pak-e takal-e ningaꞌbonal-bonal, danoꞌ ogiꞌ laut deꞌ ngasuak keꞌ doyoh deꞌ lata tobing-e  Odop-edeꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ mutus sijaꞌ-a, suba bikayuh kapal keꞌ bingon laut saꞌ kapal-enyatuak tun pasil deꞌ bingon laut inoh
pairs.target: When it was day, they didn’t recognize the land, but they noticed a certain bay with a beach, and they decided to try to drive the ship onto it.

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ kopogtolin-tolin ganung kapal yoh moꞌ supiah-e deꞌ lasan laut  Yoh moꞌ bukaꞌtolin-tolin bokos kimudi-e duoh paꞌad layal-e odaꞌ nutuan jowin kapal inohnuju keꞌ bingon laut
pairs.target: Casting off the anchors, they left them in the sea, at the same time untying the rudder ropes. Hoisting up the foresail to the wind, they made for the beach.

pairs.source: Pak-e kapal koꞌih moꞌ ngilangal pasil deꞌ lasanlaut, yoh supiah diꞌ-e ponai bigolak, lubat-e obuaꞌ asul obuah ngilangalgilumang deꞌ dolas.
pairs.target: But coming to a place where two seas met, they ran the vessel aground. The bow struck and remained immovable, but the stern began to break up by the violence of the waves.

pairs.source: Sidadu-sidadu daang kapal inoh moꞌ yaꞌ ngabos suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ obuahnaan deꞌ ogiꞌ daang kapal inoh, tolu jak odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bilonang bikoduhbuu
pairs.target: The soldiers’ counsel was to kill the prisoners, so that none of them would swim out and escape.

pairs.source: Pak-e piayuh pasukan sidadu inoh yaꞌ nyilamat Paulus  Yoh ngan-ejaman onak buah-e ngabos ayua deꞌ obuah naan, yoh moꞌ pilitah, saꞌ nyaꞌadeꞌ ponai bilonang dioꞌ bitabum keꞌ laut bilonang nuju doyoh
pairs.target: But the centurion, desiring to save Paul, stopped them from their purpose, and commanded that those who could swim should throw themselves overboard first to go toward the land;

pairs.source: Yoh moꞌodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon nunaꞌ-e muat tun opog papan duoh oniꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ tunkapal.Wat inoh leh ngan-e suaꞌ koꞌih silamat.
pairs.target: and the rest should follow, some on planks, and some on other things from the ship. So they all escaped safely to the land.

pairs.source: Takal koꞌih silamat nog doyoh ke koꞌih puꞌan inoh pulou Malta.
pairs.target: When we had escaped, then they learned that the island was called Malta.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ loꞌo deꞌ pulou inoh sukup paguh duoh koꞌih, yoh naiopui tabun saꞌan koꞌih soꞌ koꞌih ngunuh, dop-e onu ijan daang-e modudputuah.
pairs.target: The natives showed us uncommon kindness; for they kindled a fire, and received us all, because of the present rain, and because of the cold.

pairs.source: Takal Paulus nguluk langas koyuh naꞌ daang opui, tang-tang dipohdeꞌ bisa luah noman bongoh opui yoh moꞌ nukuk tongan Paulus
pairs.target: But when Paul had gathered a bundle of sticks and laid them on the fire, a viper came out because of the heat, and fastened on his hand.

pairs.source: Takalnyaꞌa deꞌ loꞌo deꞌ pulou inoh ningaꞌ dipoh bitaliang deꞌ tongan-e yoh moꞌin-e tipan odop-e, “Nyaꞌa itih pasti ogiꞌ ngabos nyaꞌa dop-e takal-e yohdiꞌ-e longod deꞌ laut, pak-e dewi deꞌ adon-e Tukang Ngadel diꞌ-e tanahodaꞌ idip.”
pairs.target: When the natives saw the creature hanging from his hand, they said to one another, “No doubt this man is a murderer, whom, though he has escaped from the sea, yet Justice has not allowed to live.”

pairs.source: Pak-e Paulus tapi dipoh inoh daang opui, doiꞌ-e nak nomanoni-oni-e
pairs.target: However he shook off the creature into the fire, and wasn’t harmed.

pairs.source: Daang pikil odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ duam niꞌ tiliaꞌ lagiꞌ tongan-ebokak yoh moꞌ polong wat-e kobos  Pak-e tuui-tuui doiꞌ geh wat-e, nyaꞌadeꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bilubah pikil-e yoh moꞌ nang Paulus itih pasti dewa.
pairs.target: But they expected that he would have swollen or fallen down dead suddenly, but when they watched for a long time and saw nothing bad happen to him, they changed their minds, and said that he was a god.

pairs.source: Diꞌ-e juuaꞌ soꞌ topat koꞌih maꞌad, ogiꞌ tanaꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ Publius deꞌ jadingubelnul deꞌ pulou inoh  Yoh sukup paguh, yoh nyamut, maꞌan koꞌihodaꞌ loꞌo deꞌ boli-e taluh onu
pairs.target: Now in the neighborhood of that place were lands belonging to the chief man of the island, named Publius, who received us, and courteously entertained us for three days.

pairs.source: Takal inoh samaꞌ Publius polong-polongmonam modud duoh mokiꞌ ngibawos, Paulus molot keꞌ bilit-e yoh moꞌbidoa daang-e posan tongan-e tun bak-e, yoh moꞌ mokuaꞌ
pairs.target: The father of Publius lay sick of fever and dysentery. Paul entered in to him, prayed, and laying his hands on him, healed him.

pairs.source: Mokuaꞌ inohsuaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ monam deꞌ pulou inoh moꞌ odi tuduꞌ Paulus, suaꞌ odop-e deꞌmunoꞌ tuang mokuaꞌ geh
pairs.target: Then when this was done, the rest also who had diseases in the island came, and were cured.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngin buaꞌ tongan tuduꞌkoꞌih, takal-e moꞌ nog onu koꞌih yaꞌ bilayal, nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nginonyad saꞌan pimonu koꞌih.
pairs.target: They also honored us with many honors, and when we sailed, they put on board the things that we needed.

pairs.source: Taluh bulan koꞌih tigalon deꞌ pulou Malta, mokuaꞌ inoh koꞌih bilayalpakai kapal deꞌ soꞌ Aleksandria, kapal inoh bilabuh kajon musim modudmokuaꞌ  Kapal itih ogiꞌ tipaduaꞌ Dewa deꞌ Bilopid daꞌ-a, deꞌ adon Kastorduoh Poluks
pairs.target: After three months, we set sail in a ship of Alexandria which had wintered in the island, whose sign was “The Twin Brothers.”

pairs.source: Koꞌih moꞌ nog deꞌ Sirakusa, koꞌih moꞌ loꞌo danoꞌ taluh onu.
pairs.target: Touching at Syracuse, we stayed there three days.

pairs.source: Soꞌ Sirakusa koꞌih bilayal lagiꞌ nunaꞌ bingon laut, koꞌih moꞌ nog kotaRegium  Tiaꞌ pagi-e sobak moꞌ mulai goyuang-goyuang soꞌ nuaꞌ boit botononu nusak yup kapal koꞌih  Yoh ngan-e onu deꞌ nikan-e koꞌih moꞌ nog deꞌkota Putioli
pairs.target: From there we circled around and arrived at Rhegium. After one day, a south wind sprang up, and on the second day we came to Puteoli,

pairs.source: Danoꞌ koꞌih bitapod duoh ulang Kristen  Yoh moꞌ ngunangkoꞌih, koꞌih moꞌ loꞌo juꞌ onu duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, mokuaꞌ inoh koꞌihmoꞌ odi keꞌ Roma
pairs.target: where we found brothers, and were entreated to stay with them for seven days. So we came to Rome.

pairs.source: Ulang-ulang bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus deꞌ kota Roma moꞌngojit gah tentang koꞌih, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nog bitapod duoh koꞌih keꞌPasal Apius  Ogiꞌ geh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ kajon deꞌ topat deꞌ adon-e TaluhBoli Topat Nosaꞌ  Takal Paulus bitapod duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, yoh moꞌbisukul tuduꞌ Topaꞌ otin-e moꞌ paliꞌ doon.
pairs.target: From there the brothers, when they heard of us, came to meet us as far as The Market of Appius and The Three Taverns. When Paul saw them, he thanked God, and took courage.

pairs.source: Takal koꞌih nog deꞌ Roma, pilitah Roma ngibonal Paulus odaꞌ loꞌosadiꞌ-e, yoh moꞌ odaꞌ niꞌ naꞌan sidadu deꞌ jaga.
pairs.target: When we entered into Rome, the centurion delivered the prisoners to the captain of the guard, but Paul was allowed to stay by himself with the soldier who guarded him.

pairs.source: Takal-e moꞌ taluh onu daang Roma, Paulus moꞌ mogan piayuh-piayuhulang Yahudi deꞌ loꞌo deꞌ Roma odaꞌ tikuluk, Paulus moꞌ in-e, “Madihayua, doiꞌ kuꞌ nai salah oni-oni-e tuduꞌ bangsa otoꞌ  Doiꞌ kuꞌ nak lawanadat sumuk babai otoꞌ, pak-e ulang Yahudi takap okuꞌ deꞌ Yerusalem yohmoꞌ nyelah okuꞌ tuduꞌ pilitah Roma
pairs.target: After three days Paul called together those who were the leaders of the Jews. When they had come together, he said to them, “I, brothers, though I had done nothing against the people, or the customs of our fathers, still was delivered prisoner from Jerusalem into the hands of the Romans,

pairs.source: Takal pilitah Roma moꞌ pilisa salahkuꞌ, yoh moꞌ yaꞌ pilopas okuꞌ dop-e doiꞌ-e nak ogiꞌ salah kuꞌ deꞌ bitotokduoh ukum ngabos
pairs.target: who, when they had examined me, desired to set me free, because there was no cause of death in me.

pairs.source: Pak-e ulang-ulang Yahudi deꞌ Yerusalem diꞌ-e situju,yoh ngan okuꞌ tipaksa mitiaꞌ bilituang baꞌuh tuduꞌ Laja Roma deꞌ palingayuh, okuꞌ nai deꞌ wat noh idoh diꞌ ngan kuꞌ yaꞌ ngadu basa odop toꞌ.
pairs.target: But when the Jews spoke against it, I was constrained to appeal to Caesar, not that I had anything about which to accuse my nation.

pairs.source: Yoh ngan kuꞌ mogan ingan katiꞌ neh, ngan kuꞌ yaꞌ sina duoh ingan nangodop kuꞌ obuah pasung deꞌ watih, luban kuꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Pinyilamat deꞌkajon-kajon basa Yahudi.”
pairs.target: For this cause therefore I asked to see you and to speak with you. For because of the hope of Israel I am bound with this chain.”

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-e, “Aluaꞌ doiꞌ koꞌih tilimaꞌ sulat soꞌYudea tentang ingan, niꞌ naꞌan aluaꞌ doiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ nog tanon oniꞌ deꞌjaꞌat deꞌ moꞌ nai ingan
pairs.target: They said to him, “We neither received letters from Judea concerning you, nor did any of the brothers come here and report or speak any evil of you.

pairs.source: Pak-e koꞌih laꞌan yaꞌ ngojit soꞌ odop muꞌ, onideꞌ bisayaꞌ muꞌ daꞌ-a, dop-e koꞌih ngojit katiꞌ kanih nyaꞌa netang oniꞌ deꞌbisayaꞌ muꞌu daꞌ-e.”
pairs.target: But we desire to hear from you what you think. For, as concerning this sect, it is known to us that everywhere it is spoken against.”

pairs.source: Ayua deꞌ munoꞌ duoh Paulus moꞌ notap onu-e yaꞌ bitapod baꞌuh.Yohmoꞌ daang onu deꞌ notap-e, bogoꞌ ulang Yahudi deꞌ nog keꞌ boli soꞌPaulus loꞌo  Soꞌ sipagi sape nog onu ngumi, Paulus tanon gah Topaꞌ deꞌnog militah jadin Laja  Pakai sina deꞌ moꞌ nulis Musa duoh nabi-nabi deꞌbokon daang buk, yoh tanon loti-e ngan-e suba nolik otin ayua deꞌ munoꞌodaꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus
pairs.target: When they had appointed him a day, many people came to him at his lodging. He explained to them, testifying about God’s Kingdom, and persuading them concerning Jesus, both from the law of Moses and from the prophets, from morning until evening.

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ odop-e deꞌ bisayaꞌ, ogiꞌ geh deꞌ idoh tuduꞌoniꞌ deꞌ nang Paulus
pairs.target: Some believed the things which were spoken, and some disbelieved.

pairs.source: Ayua deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ buu masim-masim nunaꞌ pikilodop-e sadiꞌ-e, pak-e Paulus in-e tuduꞌ ayua deꞌ munoꞌ, “Bonal oniꞌ deꞌnang Iyang Topaꞌ pakai bobaꞌ nabi Yesaya tuduꞌ sumuk-babai otoꞌ deꞌ in-e,
pairs.target: When they didn’t agree among themselves, they departed after Paul had spoken one word, “The Holy Spirit spoke rightly through Isaiah, the prophet, to our fathers,

pairs.source: ‘Odileh tuduꞌ bangsa itih, in nyeꞌ tuduꞌ-e:Ingan yaꞌ ngojit paliꞌ-paliꞌ, pak-e diꞌ ingan ngiloti-e;Ingan yaꞌ ningaꞌ paliꞌ-paliꞌ, pak-e diꞌ ingan puꞌan-e.
pairs.target: saying, ‘Go to this people, and say, in hearing, you will hear, but will in no way understand. In seeing, you will see, but will in no way perceive.

pairs.source: Dop-e bangsa itih otin-e madod.Kojit-e yoh maput-e,duoh boton-e moꞌ kuab-eYoh ngan-e diꞌ-e ponai kilin,kojit-e diꞌ-e ponai ngojit,otin-e diꞌ-e ponai ngiloti,simoꞌ yoh ponai ngiloti, totu diꞌ yoh paliꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.Wat noh leh Okuꞌ paliꞌ odaꞌ yoh paguh.’ ”
pairs.target: For this people’s heart has grown callous. Their ears are dull of hearing. Their eyes they have closed. Lest they should see with their eyes, hear with their ears, understand with their heart, and would turn again, and I would heal them.’

pairs.source: Nyuang sina-e, Paulus moꞌ in-e, “Noh leh ngan kuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan saꞌingan puꞌan nang gah deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa silamat nog soꞌ Topaꞌ, adin moꞌ obuahmagah tuduꞌ basa deꞌ diꞌ-e Yahudi, nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ tilimaꞌ-e.”
pairs.target: “Be it known therefore to you, that the salvation of God is sent to the nations, and they will listen.”

pairs.source: TakalPaulus mokuaꞌ sina deꞌ in inoh ulang-ulang Yahudi moꞌ buꞌu daang-ebikalah si odop-e.
pairs.target: When he had said these words, the Jews departed, having a great dispute among themselves.

pairs.source: Paulus moꞌ loꞌo duwoh sowaꞌ deꞌ boli deꞌ nyewa-e, yoh tilimaꞌ suaꞌnyaꞌa deꞌ nog tuduꞌ-e
pairs.target: Paul stayed two whole years in his own rented house, and received all who were coming to him,

pairs.source: Diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ tolu-tolu dop-e doiꞌ tiyaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌkaso Paulus magah gah Topaꞌ yaꞌ nog militah jadin Laja, yoh moꞌ ngajalnyaꞌa tentang Yesus Kristus, dop-e doiꞌ tiyaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kaso.    EFESUS
pairs.target: preaching God’s Kingdom, and teaching the things concerning the Lord Jesus Christ with all boldness, without hindrance.    Ephesians

pairs.source: Sulat soꞌ okuꞌ, Paulus, deꞌ odaꞌ Topaꞌ jadin rasul Kristus Yesus kodaꞌ deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ.   Okuꞌ pait sulat itih tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ jok-e Topaꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ deꞌ Efesus, nyaꞌa deꞌ totap bisayaꞌ daang Kristus Yesus.
pairs.target: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus through the will of God, to the saints who are at Ephesus, and the faithful in Christ Jesus:

pairs.source: Okuꞌ bidoa saꞌ Topaꞌ Samaꞌ otoꞌ duoh Topaꞌ Yesus Kristus ngin bilokat duoh idip bidanah tuduꞌ ingan.
pairs.target: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

pairs.source: Obuah mudileh Topaꞌ! Samaꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ otoꞌ Yesus Kristus! Iyoh moꞌ ngin suaꞌ bilokat soꞌ siluga tuduꞌ otoꞌ, dop-e otoꞌ moꞌ idip niꞌ duoh Kristus.
pairs.target: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who has blessed us with every spiritual blessing in the heavenly places in Christ;

pairs.source: Dop-e Topaꞌ moꞌ pilih otoꞌ takal dunia aluaꞌ diꞌ Topaꞌ nai-e, saꞌ otoꞌ jadin nyaꞌa deꞌ jok-e Topaꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ duoh diꞌ-e salah deꞌ sulung jowin-E, dop-e otoꞌ moꞌ idip niꞌ duoh Kristus.
pairs.target: even as he chose us in him before the foundation of the world, that we would be holy and without defect before him in love;

pairs.source: Dop-e Topaꞌ ngibalaꞌ otoꞌ, noh leh ngan Iyoh moꞌ dioꞌ notap otoꞌ ngan-e pakat otoꞌ odaꞌ jadin onak-onak-E, suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ jadi odaꞌ oni deꞌ moꞌ nai Yesus Kristus.   Inoh leh deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ, deꞌ munuas-E daꞌ-a.
pairs.target: having predestined us for adoption as children through Jesus Christ to himself, according to the good pleasure of his desire,

pairs.source: Obuah mudileh Topaꞌ dop-e Iyoh moꞌ bitanga otin-E deꞌ sukup-sukup paguh-e tuduꞌ otoꞌ pakai Onak-E deꞌ ngibalaꞌ-E.
pairs.target: to the praise of the glory of his grace, by which he freely gave us favor in the Beloved,

pairs.source: Topaꞌ moꞌ nubuas otoꞌ soꞌ dosa pakai doyaꞌ Kristus deꞌ moꞌ kobos saꞌan otoꞌ.   Loti-e, Topaꞌ moꞌ ngapun dosa-dosa otoꞌ nunaꞌ otin-E deꞌ paguh deꞌ diꞌ-e obuaꞌ-obuaꞌ.
pairs.target: in whom we have our redemption through his blood, the forgiveness of our trespasses, according to the riches of his grace,

pairs.source: Dop-e otin Topaꞌ deꞌ paguh deꞌ diꞌ-e obuaꞌ-obuaꞌ deꞌ ngin-E tuduꞌ otoꞌ inoh geh deꞌ odaꞌ otoꞌ ponai bijak duoh ngiloti suaꞌ oniꞌ.
pairs.target: which he made to abound toward us in all wisdom and prudence,

pairs.source: Nunaꞌ deꞌ laꞌan odop-E, Topaꞌ moꞌ tanon tuduꞌ otoꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nai-E deꞌ aluaꞌ diꞌ otoꞌ puꞌan-e.   Iyoh moꞌ notap Kristus Yesus ngan-e pijadi oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nai-E inoh.
pairs.target: making known to us the mystery of his will, according to his good pleasure which he purposed in him

pairs.source: Itih leh oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nai-E moꞌ-e moꞌ nog onu-e: Yesus yaꞌ jadin pimipin duoh odaꞌ jadin niꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ siluga duoh deꞌ dunia.
pairs.target: to an administration of the fullness of the times, to sum up all things in Christ, the things in the heavens, and the things on the earth, in him;

pairs.source: Topaꞌ nai suaꞌ oniꞌ nunaꞌ deꞌ laꞌan-E duoh deꞌ moꞌ notap-E sadiꞌ-E.   Soꞌ sibungas-e Iyoh moꞌ pilih otoꞌ ngan-e odaꞌ otoꞌ jadin umat-E, dop-e otoꞌ moꞌ idip niꞌ duoh Kristus.
pairs.target: in whom also we were assigned an inheritance, having been foreordained according to the purpose of him who does all things after the counsel of his will;

pairs.source: Ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh koꞌih deꞌ dioꞌ bialap tuduꞌ Kristus, koꞌih dapod mudi Topaꞌ deꞌ ayuh kuasa-E.
pairs.target: to the end that we should be to the praise of his glory, we who had before hoped in Christ.

pairs.source: Ingan tuang moꞌ jadin umat Topaꞌ takal ingan moꞌ ngojit sibaya Topaꞌ.   Sibaya inoh Gah deꞌ Paguh deꞌ odaꞌ ingan silamat.   Ingan moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus Kristus, noh leh ngan Topaꞌ moꞌ ngin tanda tuduꞌ ingan jadin nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ kakuꞌ-E.   Tanda inoh yohleh Iyang-E deꞌ tanon-E daang janyi-E.
pairs.target: In him you also, having heard the word of the truth, the Good News of your salvation—in whom, having also believed, you were sealed with the promised Holy Spirit,

pairs.source: Iyang Topaꞌ inoh leh deꞌ jamen nang otoꞌ yaꞌ tilimaꞌ oni deꞌ moꞌ janyi Topaꞌ tuduꞌ umat-E.   Itih leh deꞌ odaꞌ otoꞌ puꞌan nang Iyoh moꞌ nubuas otoꞌ duoh odaꞌ otoꞌ jadin umat-E.   Obuah mudileh Topaꞌ dop-e ayuh kuasa-E.
pairs.target: who is a pledge of our inheritance, to the redemption of God’s own possession, to the praise of his glory.

pairs.source: Noh leh ngan takal okuꞌ ngojit nang ingan bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ Yesus duoh ingan ngibalaꞌ suaꞌ umat Topaꞌ,
pairs.target: For this cause I also, having heard of the faith in the Lord Jesus which is among you, and the love which you have toward all the saints,

pairs.source: okuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ mokuaꞌ-mokuaꞌ bisukul tuduꞌ Topaꞌ tentang ingan.   Okuꞌ silalu sobot adon ingan takal kuꞌ bidoa.
pairs.target: don’t cease to give thanks for you, making mention of you in my prayers,

pairs.source: Okuꞌ mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, Topaꞌ-E Yesus Kristus, Samaꞌ otoꞌ deꞌ ayuh kuasa-E, saꞌ Iyoh ngin Iyang-E tuduꞌ ingan.   Iyang inoh leh deꞌ odaꞌ ingan bijak ponai duoh bitanga Topaꞌ tuduꞌ ingan saꞌ ingan piluh Iyoh.
pairs.target: that the God of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of glory, may give to you a spirit of wisdom and revelation in the knowledge of him;

pairs.source: Okuꞌ mitiaꞌ saꞌ Topaꞌ bukaꞌ pikil ingan odaꞌ telang saꞌ-e ngiloti oni deꞌ dapod ingan alap soꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ mogan ingan.   Watnoh geh saꞌ ingan puꞌan nang sukup-sukup bogoꞌ bilokat deꞌ konaꞌ deꞌ sidia Topaꞌ saꞌan umat-E,
pairs.target: having the eyes of your hearts enlightened, that you may know what is the hope of his calling, and what are the riches of the glory of his inheritance in the saints,

pairs.source: duoh puꞌan nang doiꞌ tiyaꞌ kuasa deꞌ lobih ayuh soꞌ kuasa Topaꞌ deꞌ kiloja daang otoꞌ deꞌ bisayaꞌ, kuasa inoh sukup-sukup ayuh-e.
pairs.target: and what is the exceeding greatness of his power toward us who believe, according to that working of the strength of his might

pairs.source: Inoh leh kuasa deꞌ pakai Topaꞌ takal-E paliꞌ kidip Kristus soꞌ kobos-E duoh odaꞌ guluꞌ nuaꞌ toꞌuh-E deꞌ topat deꞌ punuaꞌ kuasa deꞌ siluga.
pairs.target: which he worked in Christ, when he raised him from the dead, and made him to sit at his right hand in the heavenly places,

pairs.source: Kristus juuaꞌ lobih ayuh kuasa-E soꞌ suaꞌ iyang deꞌ ogiꞌ kuasa-e, soꞌ suaꞌ iyang deꞌ militah duoh mipin dunia, duoh soꞌ suaꞌ adon oniꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ kuasa-e, bait deꞌ joman deꞌ adin, bait deꞌ joman deꞌ yaꞌ nog.
pairs.target: far above all rule, and authority, and power, and dominion, and every name that is named, not only in this age, but also in that which is to come.

pairs.source: Topaꞌ naꞌ suaꞌ kuasa deꞌ libuaꞌ kuasa Kristus duoh ngin Kristus tuduꞌ uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ, saꞌ Iyoh jadin bak saꞌan suaꞌ oniꞌ.
pairs.target: He put all things in subjection under his feet, and gave him to be head over all things for the assembly,

pairs.source: Uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ inoh polong Kristus.   Kristus deꞌ jadin bak-E duoh odaꞌ polong inoh sukup.   Iyoh geh deꞌ moꞌ nyukup suaꞌ oniꞌ.
pairs.target: which is his body, the fullness of him who fills all in all.    Ephesians

pairs.source: Deꞌ dioꞌ soꞌ kanoꞌ ingan moꞌ kobos luban ingan lawan pilitah-pilitah Topaꞌ duoh nai dosa-dosa.
pairs.target: You were made alive when you were dead in transgressions and sins,

pairs.source: Takal inoh ingan idip nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ mala nyaꞌa daang dunia nai-e; loti-e ingan tunuak tuduꞌ Laja Muat Munua deꞌ militah deꞌ tun longit, deꞌ adin nguasa otin nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e tunuak tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: in which you once walked according to the course of this world, according to the prince of the power of the air, the spirit who now works in the children of disobedience;

pairs.source: Dioꞌ soꞌ kanoꞌ suaꞌ otoꞌ idip samah kodaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ; otoꞌ idip nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ mala manusia nai-e deꞌ nyonang polong baya pikil otoꞌ.   Takal inoh otoꞌ yohleh nyaꞌa deꞌ suwaꞌ obuah ukum Topaꞌ geh, samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon.
pairs.target: among whom we also all once lived in the lusts of our flesh, doing the desires of the flesh and of the mind, and were by nature children of wrath, even as the rest.

pairs.source: Pak-e pilasiꞌ Topaꞌ sukup ayuh-e, yoh ngan-E ngibalaꞌ otoꞌ.
pairs.target: But God, being rich in mercy, for his great love with which he loved us,

pairs.source: Bial-e deꞌ dioꞌ otoꞌ moꞌ kobos luban otoꞌ lawan pilitah-E, Topaꞌ moꞌ ngin idip tuduꞌ otoꞌ samah-samah duoh Kristus.   Topaꞌ odaꞌ otoꞌ silamat, dop-e Iyoh sukup paguh.
pairs.target: even when we were dead through our trespasses, made us alive together with Christ (by grace you have been saved),

pairs.source: Dop-e otoꞌ moꞌ idip niꞌ duoh Kristus Yesus, Topaꞌ paliꞌ kidip otoꞌ samah-samah duoh Iyoh, saꞌ otoꞌ suwaꞌ militah samah-samah duoh-E daang siluga.
pairs.target: and raised us up with him, and made us to sit with him in the heavenly places in Christ Jesus,

pairs.source: Topaꞌ nai deꞌ wat inoh saꞌ takal joman deꞌ yaꞌ nog, manusia ningaꞌ nang Topaꞌ sukup-sukup-e ngibalaꞌ otoꞌ.   Iyoh moꞌ bitanga otin-E deꞌ sukup-sukup paguh-e tuduꞌ otoꞌ pakai Onak-E.
pairs.target: that in the ages to come he might show the exceeding riches of his grace in kindness toward us in Christ Jesus;

pairs.source: Dop-e Topaꞌ sukup paguh, Iyoh odaꞌ ingan silamat dop-e ingan bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Kristus Yesus, inoh idoh diꞌ-e asil oniꞌ deꞌ nai odop ingan, pak-e inoh oniꞌ deꞌ ngin Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: for by grace you have been saved through faith, and that not of yourselves; it is the gift of God,

pairs.source: Inoh idoh diꞌ-e asil kiloja deꞌ nai ingan.   Maꞌ ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ bilagah tentang oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: not of works, that no one would boast.

pairs.source: Dop-e otoꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ nai.   Iyoh moꞌ nai otoꞌ odaꞌ baꞌuh daang Yesus Kristus saꞌ otoꞌ nai suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ paguh deꞌ moꞌ nyidia-E saꞌan otoꞌ.
pairs.target: For we are his workmanship, created in Christ Jesus for good works, which God prepared before that we would walk in them.

pairs.source: Ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh, madih ayua natong nyeꞌ oni wat odop ingan deꞌ dioꞌ, ingan deꞌ diꞌ-e ulang Yahudi, ingan deꞌ nang-e “Ulang deꞌ diꞌ-e bisunat” in ulang Yahudi deꞌ ngakuꞌ nang odop-e bisunat.   Sunat inoh tanda deꞌ nai manusia deꞌ gonan nyaꞌa.
pairs.target: Therefore remember that once you, the Gentiles in the flesh, who are called “uncircumcision” by that which is called “circumcision”, (in the flesh, made by hands);

pairs.source: Takal inoh ingan aluaꞌ diꞌ-e idip niꞌ duoh Kristus, ingan deꞌ diꞌ-e ulang Israel, ingan diꞌ-e molot daang janyi deꞌ mokos Topaꞌ duoh umat-E.   Ingan idip daang dunia itih doiꞌ oni-oni deꞌ dapod ingan alap-e duoh diꞌ ingan piluh Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: that you were at that time separate from Christ, alienated from the commonwealth of Israel, and strangers from the covenants of the promise, having no hope and without God in the world.

pairs.source: Pak-e adin ingan moꞌ idip niꞌ duoh Kristus Yesus.   Noꞌuh-e ingan juuaꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ, pak-e adin ingan moꞌ obuah toban sinok duoh Topaꞌ odaꞌ doyaꞌ Kristus.
pairs.target: But now in Christ Jesus you who once were far off are made near in the blood of Christ.

pairs.source: Dop-e Kristus leh deꞌ odaꞌ otoꞌ bidamai, Iyoh moꞌ nguluk otoꞌ ulang-ulang Yahudi duoh ulang-ulang deꞌ diꞌ-e Yahudi jadin niꞌ, yohmoꞌ pilubuh sinung deꞌ odaꞌ otoꞌ bilosah.   Sinung inoh deꞌ odaꞌ otoꞌ bitomi.
pairs.target: For he is our peace, who made both one, and broke down the middle wall of partition,

pairs.source: Dop-e ukum ulang Yahudi duoh suaꞌ pilitah-pilitah-e baya atulan-atulan-e moꞌ obuah ngisuꞌ odaꞌ Kristus takal Iyoh kobos, saꞌ-e duwoh bangsa jadin niꞌ bangsa manusia baꞌuh, deꞌ idip niꞌ duoh odop-E.   Wat inoh leh wat Kristus odaꞌ ogiꞌ idip bidanah.
pairs.target: having abolished in his flesh the hostility, the law of commandments contained in ordinances, that he might create in himself one new man of the two, making peace;

pairs.source: Ngan-E kobos deꞌ salip, Kristus nguluk duwoh bangsa inoh odaꞌ niꞌ, odaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bidamai duoh Topaꞌ, yohmoꞌ duwoh bangsa inoh diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ bitomi.
pairs.target: and might reconcile them both in one body to God through the cross, having killed the hostility thereby.

pairs.source: Noh leh ngan Kristus nog ngan-e magah Gah deꞌ Paguh tentang damai inoh tuduꞌ ingan, bait ulang deꞌ juuaꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ, bait ulang Yahudi deꞌ sinok tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: He came and preached peace to you who were far off and to those who were near.

pairs.source: Luban Kristus, suaꞌ otoꞌ, bait ulang Yahudi, bait ulang deꞌ diꞌ-e Yahudi moꞌ dapod sinok duoh Samaꞌ odaꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: For through him we both have our access in one Spirit to the Father.

pairs.source: Noh leh ngan ingan idoh diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ saluh-saluh duoh ulang nog.   Pak-e adin ingan jadin umat Topaꞌ duoh molot daang lawang Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: So then you are no longer strangers and foreigners, but you are fellow citizens with the saints, and of the household of God,

pairs.source: Ingan kodaꞌ boli deꞌ kajuag nyaꞌa, ingan mujuag soꞌ oni deꞌ ngajal bala rasul duoh bala nabi, yohmoꞌ Yesus deꞌ jadin batuh pinogap-e.
pairs.target: being built on the foundation of the apostles and prophets, Christ Jesus himself being the chief cornerstone;

pairs.source: Ngan ingan moꞌ idip niꞌ duoh Kristus, suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ngan nyaꞌa nai boli inoh bisusun bijamit jadin Boli Topaꞌ deꞌ jok-e Iyoh deꞌ kakuꞌ soꞌ-E loꞌo.
pairs.target: in whom the whole building, fitted together, grows into a holy temple in the Lord;

pairs.source: Ngan ingan moꞌ idip niꞌ duoh Kristus, ingan obuah kajuag geh samah-samah duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon odaꞌ jadin Boli Topaꞌ, deꞌ danoꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ loꞌo.
pairs.target: in whom you also are built together for a habitation of God in the Spirit.    Ephesians

pairs.source: Noh leh ngan okuꞌ, Paulus, obuah jel, luban kuꞌ nai kiloja saꞌan Kristus Yesus ngan kuꞌ tulung ingan deꞌ diꞌ-e ulang Yahudi.
pairs.target: For this cause I, Paul, am the prisoner of Christ Jesus on behalf of you Gentiles,

pairs.source: Totu ingan moꞌ ngojit tentang Otin Topaꞌ deꞌ paguh, Iyoh ngin tuduꞌ okuꞌ kiloja itih ngan kuꞌ tulung ingan.
pairs.target: if it is so that you have heard of the administration of that grace of God which was given me toward you;

pairs.source: Topaꞌ moꞌ tanon tuduꞌ okuꞌ, oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nai-E, oniꞌ deꞌ aluaꞌ diꞌ nyaꞌa puꞌan-e.   (Tentang hal inoh moꞌ ogiꞌ kuꞌ nulis-e kodoꞌ-e geh deꞌ puꞌun sulat itih,
pairs.target: how that by revelation the mystery was made known to me, as I wrote before in few words,

pairs.source: moꞌ ingan basa-e, ingan yaꞌ ngiloti samah kodaꞌ okuꞌ tuang ngiloti kuꞌ geh oniꞌ deꞌ aluaꞌ diꞌ nyaꞌa puꞌan-e, deꞌ yaꞌ nai Kristus.)
pairs.target: by which, when you read, you can perceive my understanding in the mystery of Christ;

pairs.source: Noꞌuh-e oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ aluaꞌ diꞌ Topaꞌ tanon-e tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa, pak-e adin Iyang Topaꞌ moꞌ tanon-e tuduꞌ rasul-rasul duoh nabi-nabi-E.
pairs.target: which in other generations was not made known to the children of men, as it has now been revealed to his holy apostles and prophets in the Spirit;

pairs.source: Oniꞌ deꞌ aluaꞌ diꞌ nyaꞌa puꞌan-e inoh yohleh takal nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e ulang Yahudi tilimaꞌ Gah deꞌ Paguh soꞌ Topaꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ suwaꞌ kiꞌan bilokat-bilokat Topaꞌ, deꞌ noꞌuh-e jok-e saꞌan ulang Yahudi.   Wat inoh geh ulang-ulang deꞌ diꞌ-e Yahudi inoh moꞌ suwaꞌ samah-samah duoh ulang Yahudi jadin niꞌ gonan.   Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ samah-samah suwaꞌ tilimaꞌ oni deꞌ janyi-E daang Kristus Yesus.
pairs.target: that the Gentiles are fellow heirs, and fellow members of the body, and fellow partakers of his promise in Christ Jesus through the Good News,

pairs.source: Okuꞌ jadin kuli Topaꞌ ngan kuꞌ magah Gah deꞌ Paguh, takal Topaꞌ pakai otin-E deꞌ paguh ngan-e ngin kuasa-E tuduꞌ okuꞌ.
pairs.target: of which I was made a servant, according to the gift of that grace of God which was given me according to the working of his power.

pairs.source: Soꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ Topaꞌ, okuꞌ deꞌ paling diꞌ-e biguna.   Bial-e wat inoh, Topaꞌ ngin otin-E deꞌ paguh tuduꞌ okuꞌ, odaꞌ magah Gah deꞌ Paguh tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e ulang Yahudi tentang bilokat-bilokat deꞌ soꞌ Kristus deꞌ diꞌ-e obuaꞌ-obuaꞌ.
pairs.target: To me, the very least of all saints, was this grace given, to preach to the Gentiles the unsearchable riches of Christ,

pairs.source: Okuꞌ magah geh Gah deꞌ paguh inoh saꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa puꞌan bonal-bonal tentang oniꞌ deꞌ dioꞌ soꞌ kanoꞌ diꞌ nyaꞌa puꞌan-e, deꞌ yaꞌ nai Topaꞌ deꞌ nai suaꞌ oniꞌ.   Oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nai Topaꞌ moꞌ ogiꞌ daang otin-E soꞌ sibungas-e.
pairs.target: and to make all men see what is the administration of the mystery which for ages has been hidden in God, who created all things through Jesus Christ;

pairs.source: Oniꞌ deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ yohleh saꞌa adin iyang-iyang deꞌ militah duoh deꞌ nguasa deꞌ siluga ningaꞌ uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ, yohmoꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ dapod puꞌan bijak ponai Topaꞌ deꞌ sukup ayuh-e.
pairs.target: to the intent that now through the assembly the manifold wisdom of God might be made known to the principalities and the powers in the heavenly places,

pairs.source: Topaꞌ nai suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ samah kodaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nai-E deꞌ moꞌ dioꞌ-E notap-e soꞌ takal dunia aluaꞌ diꞌ-e obuah nai.   Topaꞌ pakai Kristus Yesus ngan-e odaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ jadi.
pairs.target: according to the eternal purpose which he purposed in Christ Jesus our Lord;

pairs.source: Idip niꞌ duoh Kristus odaꞌ otoꞌ bilani duoh ponai nog deꞌ sulung jowin Topaꞌ daang kila deꞌ diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ tolu dop-e otoꞌ bisayaꞌ sipunuaꞌ-e tuduꞌ-E.
pairs.target: in whom we have boldness and access in confidence through our faith in him.

pairs.source: Yoh ngan okuꞌ mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ ingan maꞌ yaꞌ bigaduh takal ingan ngojit susah jolaꞌ deꞌ obuah okuꞌ luban ingan.   Dop-e susah jolaꞌ deꞌ ngoon kuꞌ inoh saꞌ ingan obuah pimodo.
pairs.target: Therefore I ask that you may not lose heart at my troubles for you, which are your glory.

pairs.source: Noh leh ngan kuꞌ bikunyug bidoa deꞌ sulung jowin Samaꞌ.
pairs.target: For this cause, I bow my knees to the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ,

pairs.source: Iyoh leh deꞌ odaꞌ ogiꞌ tibilang lawang deꞌ siluga duoh deꞌ bumi itih.
pairs.target: from whom every family in heaven and on earth is named,

pairs.source: Okuꞌ bidoa saꞌ kuasa Topaꞌ deꞌ sukup ayuh-e duoh deꞌ diꞌ-e obuaꞌ-obuaꞌ deꞌ ngin-E ngan-E nogap otin ingan, pakai kuasa Iyang-E deꞌ ogiꞌ daang otin ingan.
pairs.target: that he would grant you, according to the riches of his glory, that you may be strengthened with power through his Spirit in the inward man;

pairs.source: Ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh ingan deꞌ bisayaꞌ sipunuaꞌ-e tuduꞌ Kristus, Kristus loꞌo daang otin ingan yohmoꞌ ingan biꞌaat duoh ogiꞌ puꞌun-e daang ngibalaꞌ.
pairs.target: that Christ may dwell in your hearts through faith; to the end that you, being rooted and grounded in love,

pairs.source: Okuꞌ bidoa saꞌ-e samah-samah duoh suaꞌ umat Topaꞌ, ingan dapod ngiloti nang sukup-sukup ayuh-E, sukup-sukup omu-E, duoh sukup-sukup bigatung-E, baya sukup-sukup tuluap-E Kristus ngibala ingan,
pairs.target: may be strengthened to comprehend with all the saints what is the width and length and height and depth,

pairs.source: yohmoꞌ ingan dapod ngoon nang Kristus sukup-sukup ngibalaꞌ ingan bial oniꞌ deꞌ wat inoh diꞌ ingan tapod yaꞌ ngiloti pakai pikil ingan, saꞌ idip Topaꞌ deꞌ paguh daang suaꞌ oniꞌ, bonal-bonal ogiꞌ daang idip ingan.
pairs.target: and to know Christ’s love which surpasses knowledge, that you may be filled with all the fullness of God.

pairs.source: Topaꞌ dapod nai lobih bogoꞌ soꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ mitiaꞌ toꞌ duoh deꞌ pikil toꞌ, pakai kuasa-E deꞌ silalu kiloja deꞌ daang odop otoꞌ.
pairs.target: Now to him who is able to do exceedingly abundantly above all that we ask or think, according to the power that works in us,

pairs.source: Jaꞌ otoꞌ, uluk ulang deꞌ bisayaꞌ deꞌ idip niꞌ duoh Kristus Yesus, mudi Topaꞌ daang suaꞌ tolap joman.   Mudileh Topaꞌ nah-nah! Amin.
pairs.target: to him be the glory in the assembly and in Christ Jesus to all generations forever and ever. Amen.    Ephesians

pairs.source: Topaꞌ moꞌ mogan ingan odaꞌ jadin umat-E.   Inoh leh ngan okuꞌ, Paulus, deꞌ obuah naan dop-e okuꞌ nai kiloja saꞌan Topaꞌ, okuꞌ bonal-bonal mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ ingan saꞌ ingan idip nunaꞌ bogan-E.
pairs.target: I therefore, the prisoner in the Lord, beg you to walk worthily of the calling with which you were called,

pairs.source: Daang suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai ingan, maꞌ yaꞌ samuh, pak-e ingan halus binulut, duoh sabal.   Bitanga leh nang ingan ngibalaꞌ siodop ingan, ngan ingan tulung siodop ingan.
pairs.target: with all lowliness and humility, with patience, bearing with one another in love;

pairs.source: Ingan kagaꞌ ulih-ulih-e idip bidamai duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon, saꞌ idip niꞌ deꞌ moꞌ ngin Iyang Topaꞌ totap obuah jaga.
pairs.target: being eager to keep the unity of the Spirit in the bond of peace.

pairs.source: Jok-e ogiꞌ niꞌ gonan, duoh niꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ.   Wat inoh geh ingan obuah mogan saꞌ ingan bialap deꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ samah.
pairs.target: There is one body, and one Spirit, even as you also were called in one hope of your calling;

pairs.source: Jok-e ogiꞌ niꞌ Topaꞌ, jok-e niꞌ Gah deꞌ Paguh soꞌ nyeꞌ bisayaꞌ, niꞌ baptisan,
pairs.target: one Lord, one faith, one baptism,

pairs.source: niꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ jadin Samaꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa.   Iyoh leh Topaꞌ deꞌ nguasa longit duoh bumi, Iyoh nai kiloja-E pakai suaꞌ otoꞌ duoh daang suaꞌ odop toꞌ.
pairs.target: one God and Father of all, who is over all, and through all, and in us all.

pairs.source: Pak-e otoꞌ masim-masim tilimaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ngin-E nunaꞌ deꞌ laꞌan Kristus.
pairs.target: But to each one of us was the grace given according to the measure of the gift of Christ.

pairs.source: Daang buk Kitab ogiꞌ deꞌ obuah nulis in-e, “Takal Iyoh maꞌad keꞌ topat deꞌ bigatung, Iyoh toban bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah naan, Iyoh moꞌ ngin oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ ngin-E tuduꞌ manusia.”
pairs.target: Therefore he says, “When he ascended on high, he led captivity captive, and gave gifts to men.”

pairs.source: Asal daang buk Kitab moꞌ obuah nulis nang, “Takal Iyoh maꞌad,” inoh loti-e Iyoh moꞌ mokuaꞌ muun ke topat deꞌ paling douꞌ-e daang bumi itih.
pairs.target: Now this, “He ascended”, what is it but that he also first descended into the lower parts of the earth?

pairs.source: Iyoh deꞌ mokuaꞌ muun inoh, Iyoh geh deꞌ moꞌ maꞌad juuaꞌ lobih bigatung soꞌ suaꞌ longit ngan-e kanuaꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ.
pairs.target: He who descended is the one who also ascended far above all the heavens, that he might fill all things.

pairs.source: “Iyoh moꞌ ngin oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ ngin-E tuduꞌ manusia,” kodaꞌ-e ogiꞌ deꞌ kakat-E jadin rasul-rasul, nabi-nabi, ogiꞌ deꞌ jadin tukang magah Gah deꞌ Paguh, ogiꞌ geh deꞌ kakat-E jadin gulu-gulu duoh gembala-gembala uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ.
pairs.target: He gave some to be apostles; and some, prophets; and some, evangelists; and some, shepherds and teachers;

pairs.source: Iyoh nai deꞌ wat itih saꞌ umat Topaꞌ taan nai kiloja ngan-e layan Topaꞌ duoh nogap uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ jadin gonan Kristus.
pairs.target: for the perfecting of the saints, to the work of serving, to the building up of the body of Christ;

pairs.source: Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ jadi nah-nah nog otoꞌ samah-samah bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ niꞌ, otoꞌ moꞌ samah-samah ngiloti pikil toꞌ tentang Onak Topaꞌ.   Yohmoꞌ otoꞌ jadin nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ tuꞌuh daang bisayaꞌ, makin tuui otoꞌ makin punuaꞌ samah kodaꞌ Kristus.
pairs.target: until we all attain to the unity of the faith, and of the knowledge of the Son of God, to a full grown man, to the measure of the stature of the fullness of Christ;

pairs.source: Ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh, otoꞌ diꞌ toꞌ tiyaꞌ jadin onak opot deꞌ tipuang katiꞌ kanih odaꞌ masam-masam pingajal soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ pingunang-e tok in oniꞌ deꞌ bonal deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa pogo.   Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ mogo nyaꞌa iniꞌ iniꞌ in sina-e ngan-e odaꞌ nyaꞌa moyap soꞌ olan deꞌ bonal.
pairs.target: that we may no longer be children, tossed back and forth and carried about with every wind of doctrine, by the trickery of men, in craftiness, after the wiles of error;

pairs.source: Pak-e, ngibalik-e otoꞌ halus tanon oniꞌ deꞌ bonal ngan otin otoꞌ deꞌ sape nyam-e ngibalaꞌ, saꞌ-e makin tuui otoꞌ makin punuaꞌ samah kodaꞌ Kristus deꞌ jadin bak saꞌan uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ, deꞌ moꞌ jadin gonan-E.
pairs.target: but speaking truth in love, we may grow up in all things into him, who is the head, Christ;

pairs.source: Soꞌ Iyoh leh suaꞌ bigian gonan-E obuah nyusun bijamit duoh obuah nyamung odaꞌ bukun-bukun tulang-e masim-masim.   Takal suaꞌ bigian gonan inoh kiloja nunaꞌ tugas-e masim-masim, ke suaꞌ gonan inoh yaꞌ ponai jadin polong deꞌ ayuh yohmoꞌ dolas daang ngibalaꞌ tipan si odop-e.
pairs.target: from whom all the body, being fitted and knit together through that which every joint supplies, according to the working in measure of each individual part, makes the body increase to the building up of itself in love.

pairs.source: Inoh leh ngan daang adon Topaꞌ, isin-isin okuꞌ sibaya deꞌ ingan: maꞌ tiyaꞌ idip kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e piluh Topaꞌ duoh pikil oniꞌ deꞌ doiꞌ guna-e.
pairs.target: This I say therefore, and testify in the Lord, that you no longer walk as the rest of the Gentiles also walk, in the futility of their mind,

pairs.source: Pikil-e tikukuab diꞌ-e ponai ngiloti.   Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ juuaꞌ soꞌ idip deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ diꞌ-e puꞌan idip deꞌ ngin Topaꞌ, dop-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ pikil-e madod duoh otin-e kolas.
pairs.target: being darkened in their understanding, alienated from the life of God, because of the ignorance that is in them, because of the hardening of their hearts;

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ doiꞌ dasaꞌ-a, pikil kila-e moꞌ madod, yoh moꞌ idip suka nai suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ-e sinunuh ngan-e kanuas kila odop-e.
pairs.target: who having become callous gave themselves up to lust, to work all uncleanness with greediness.

pairs.source: Pak-e ingan idoh diꞌ-e wat inoh! Ingan moꞌ bilajal piluh Kristus.
pairs.target: But you did not learn Christ that way;

pairs.source: Ingan moꞌ ngojit tentang Iyoh! Duoh ingan moꞌ bilajal oniꞌ deꞌ bonal daang Yesus!
pairs.target: if indeed you heard him, and were taught in him, even as truth is in Jesus:

pairs.source: Inoh leh ngan nyeꞌ pilopas tiyaꞌ gaya idip ingan deꞌ oma, deꞌ obuah pilusak odaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ laꞌan odop ingan ngan ingan nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat, deꞌ kayap ingan,
pairs.target: that you put away, as concerning your former way of life, the old man, that grows corrupt after the lusts of deceit;

pairs.source: saꞌ otin duoh pikil ingan suaꞌ-e obuah nai odaꞌ jadin baꞌuh.
pairs.target: and that you be renewed in the spirit of your mind,

pairs.source: Ingan mesti pakai gaya idip deꞌ baꞌuh, jadin nyaꞌa deꞌ baꞌuh deꞌ nai Topaꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ-a niꞌ mun duoh odop-E, daang oniꞌ deꞌ bonal, deꞌ tongon, duoh deꞌ bisig.
pairs.target: and put on the new man, who in the likeness of God has been created in righteousness and holiness of truth.

pairs.source: Ngan-e wat inoh, maꞌ tiyaꞌ pibulaꞌ, pak-e samah-samah nyeꞌ sina jujul, dop-e otoꞌ suaꞌ-e bigian gonan Kristus.
pairs.target: Therefore putting away falsehood, speak truth each one with his neighbor. For we are members of one another.

pairs.source: Simoꞌ ingan malah, maꞌ ingan yaꞌ tanah malah ingan odaꞌ ingan nai dosa.   Maꞌ yaꞌ malah sape niꞌ onu-onu,
pairs.target: “Be angry, and don’t sin.” Don’t let the sun go down on your wrath,

pairs.source: saꞌ Laja Muat Munua diꞌ-e soꞌon piluang odaꞌ ingan nai dosa.
pairs.target: and don’t give place to the devil.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ pinoku, maꞌ tiyaꞌ noku.   Pak-e paguh yoh ulih-ulih kiloja nai kiloja deꞌ paguh pakai tongan odop-e, saꞌ iyoh tapod kutung oniꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ sotok.
pairs.target: Let him who stole steal no more; but rather let him labor, producing with his hands something that is good, that he may have something to give to him who has need.

pairs.source: Moꞌ ingan sina, maꞌ nang sina deꞌ diꞌ-e paguh.   Pak-e nang negeh sina-sina deꞌ paguh ngan nyeꞌ kakat nyaꞌa deꞌ pilelu, saꞌ-a jadin bilokat saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit.
pairs.target: Let no corrupt speech proceed out of your mouth, but only what is good for building others up as the need may be, that it may give grace to those who hear.

pairs.source: Maꞌ yaꞌ odaꞌ otin Iyang Topaꞌ ngilobuꞌ, dop-e Iyang inoh leh deꞌ jadin tanda nang ingan moꞌ jadin nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ Topaꞌ, nog onu Topaꞌ nubuas ingan.
pairs.target: Don’t grieve the Holy Spirit of God, in whom you were sealed for the day of redemption.

pairs.source: Kadi tiyaꞌ soꞌ kila ingan otin deꞌ monam, deꞌ kilangas, deꞌ tiwas.   Maꞌ tiyaꞌ yaꞌ bisingak bikalah, maꞌ tiyaꞌ yaꞌ nang sina deꞌ pijaꞌat nyaꞌa, duoh maꞌ tiyaꞌ nai suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat.
