pairs.target: You therefore, my child, be strengthened in the grace that is in Christ Jesus.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ pingajal deꞌ moꞌ ngojit muꞌ soꞌ okuꞌ deꞌ sulung jowin nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ, tanon leh tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon deꞌ tapod muꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ-e duoh deꞌ ponai ngajal nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon geh.
pairs.target: The things which you have heard from me among many witnesses, commit the same to faithful men, who will be able to teach others also.

pairs.source: Muꞌu halus nunaꞌ suaꞌ susah jolaꞌ dop-e Kristus Yesus samah kodaꞌ sidadu deꞌ taan naan idip susah jolaꞌ.
pairs.target: You therefore must endure hardship, as a good soldier of Christ Jesus.

pairs.source: Sidadu deꞌ bitugas, doiꞌ yoh nai kiloja deꞌ bokon, yoh jok-e nai kiloja deꞌ nyonang otin komandan-e.
pairs.target: No soldier on duty entangles himself in the affairs of life, that he may please him who enrolled him as a soldier.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ bilomaꞌ diꞌ-e soꞌon juala simoꞌ-e diꞌ-e nunaꞌ atulan bilomaꞌ.
pairs.target: Also, if anyone competes in athletics, he isn’t crowned unless he has competed by the rules.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ dolas kiloja daang umoh, iyoh leh deꞌ dioꞌ man oniꞌ deꞌ soꞌon-e soꞌ kiloja deꞌ nai-e.
pairs.target: The farmer who labors must be the first to get a share of the crops.

pairs.source: Timotius, pikil tuluap-tuluap-e suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nang kuꞌ itih, Topaꞌ yaꞌ ngin odaꞌ muꞌu ngiloti suaꞌ oniꞌ.
pairs.target: Consider what I say, and may the Lord give you understanding in all things.

pairs.source: Natong nyeꞌ: Gah deꞌ Paguh deꞌ magah kuꞌ inoh iyoh leh Gah tentang Yesus Kristus onak sukun Laja Daud.   Iyoh leh Kristus deꞌ moꞌ paliꞌ idip soꞌ kobos-E.
pairs.target: Remember Jesus Christ, risen from the dead, of the offspring of David, according to my Good News,

pairs.source: Dop-e luban kuꞌ magah Gah deꞌ paguh okuꞌ obuah susah jolaꞌ, obuah pasung kodaꞌ ulang deꞌ jaꞌat.   Pak-e doiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ponai naan Pingunang Topaꞌ yaꞌ obuah magah.
pairs.target: in which I suffer hardship to the point of chains as a criminal. But God’s word isn’t chained.

pairs.source: Inoh leh ngan okuꞌ taan naan suaꞌ oni deꞌ munoꞌ, saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ obuah pilih Topaꞌ, saꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ suwaꞌ geh silamat deꞌ soꞌon-e soꞌ Kristus Yesus, yohmoꞌ idip duoh Topaꞌ deꞌ nah-nah.
pairs.target: Therefore I endure all things for the chosen ones’ sake, that they also may obtain the salvation which is in Christ Jesus with eternal glory.

pairs.source: Sina itih tok bonal, “Simoꞌ otoꞌ kobos duoh Kristus, otoꞌ tuang idip geh duoh Iyoh.
pairs.target: This saying is trustworthy: “For if we died with him, we will also live with him.

pairs.source: Simoꞌ otoꞌ sabal taan naan susah jolaꞌ, otoꞌ tuang suwaꞌ geh militah duoh Iyoh.   Simoꞌ otoꞌ diꞌ toꞌ ngakuꞌ nang puꞌan Iyoh, Iyoh tuang idoh geh diꞌ-e ngakuꞌ nang puꞌan otoꞌ.
pairs.target: If we endure, we will also reign with him. If we deny him, he also will deny us.

pairs.source: Bial otoꞌ diꞌ toꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ nang-E, pak-e Iyoh totap nai oniꞌ deꞌ nang-E, dop-e Iyoh diꞌ-e bilubah.”
pairs.target: If we are faithless, he remains faithful. For he can’t deny himself.”

pairs.source: Paliꞌ-paliꞌ nyeꞌ tanon-e tuduꞌ nyaꞌa bonal-bonal-e deꞌ sulung jowin Topaꞌ, sibaya maꞌ yaꞌ odaꞌ bikalah tentang loti bang sina.   Dop-e oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ doiꞌ guna-e, minaꞌ pilusak kila nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit.
pairs.target: Remind them of these things, charging them in the sight of the Lord, that they don’t argue about words, to no profit, to the subverting of those who hear.

pairs.source: Nai kiloja muꞌ bonal-bonal-e saꞌ Topaꞌ ngakuꞌ nang muꞌu bitotok nai kiloja saꞌan odop-E.   Maꞌ yaꞌ dasaꞌ, pak-e ngajal leh isin-isin pingajal deꞌ bonal soꞌ Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: Give diligence to present yourself approved by God, a workman who doesn’t need to be ashamed, properly handling the Word of Truth.

pairs.source: Sina deꞌ doiꞌ guna-e duoh sina deꞌ pijaꞌat Topaꞌ tolan juuaꞌ-juuaꞌ-e.   Sina-sina kodaꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ minaꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa makin jaꞌat.
pairs.target: But shun empty chatter, for it will go further in ungodliness,

pairs.source: Oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ samah kodaꞌ onam deꞌ odaꞌ gonan nyaꞌa moduaꞌ.   Soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ogiꞌ Himeneus duoh Filetus.
pairs.target: and those words will consume like gangrene, of whom is Hymenaeus and Philetus;

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ moyap soꞌ pingajal deꞌ bonal, duoh ngaso kudu-kudu nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ.   Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tanon nang Topaꞌ moꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ kobos paliꞌ idip.
pairs.target: men who have erred concerning the truth, saying that the resurrection is already past, and overthrowing the faith of some.

pairs.source: Pak-e puꞌun deꞌ moꞌ kajuag Topaꞌ diꞌ nyaꞌa taan guyang-e.   Deꞌ tun-e ogiꞌ deꞌ obuah nulis deꞌ in-e, “Topaꞌ piluh osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ jadin umat-E”, duoh “Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngakuꞌ nang odop-e umat Topaꞌ, halus diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat.”
pairs.target: However God’s firm foundation stands, having this seal, “The Lord knows those who are his,” and, “Let every one who names the name of the Lord depart from unrighteousness.”

pairs.source: Daang boli deꞌ ayuh ogiꞌ bipasia-pasia pingian-makup.   Ogiꞌ deꞌ nai nyaꞌa soꞌ mas, soꞌ pilak, soꞌ koyuh, ogiꞌ geh soꞌ tanaꞌ.   Deꞌ soꞌ mas duoh pilak yoh pakai takal-e biluman ayuh, deꞌ soꞌ koyuh duoh tanaꞌ pakai-e soꞌ-e man bilang konu.
pairs.target: Now in a large house there are not only vessels of gold and of silver, but also of wood and of clay. Some are for honor, and some for dishonor.

pairs.source: Wat inoh geh otoꞌ simoꞌ otin toꞌ bisig, samah geh kodaꞌ mas duoh pilak deꞌ pakai nyaꞌa daang onu-onu ayuh.   Iyoh moꞌ jadin balang deꞌ biguna deꞌ kakuꞌ Topaꞌ, deꞌ odaꞌ-E nai kiloja deꞌ paguh saꞌan Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: If anyone therefore purges himself from these, he will be a vessel for honor, sanctified, and suitable for the master’s use, prepared for every good work.

pairs.source: Timotius, maꞌ yaꞌ nunaꞌ kila muꞌ deꞌ mudaꞌ.   Soꞌot negeh idip nunaꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ, taat tuduꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal-e duoh ngibalaꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa, idip bidanah samah-samah duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ mogan adon Topaꞌ daang otin deꞌ bisig.
pairs.target: Flee from youthful lusts; but pursue righteousness, faith, love, and peace with those who call on the Lord out of a pure heart.

pairs.source: Maꞌ yaꞌ suwaꞌ bikalah duoh uluk ulang-ulang budua, deꞌ diꞌ-e puꞌan oni-oni-e.   Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ minaꞌ-e nimul kaꞌi-kalah jaꞌ-e.
pairs.target: But refuse foolish and ignorant questionings, knowing that they generate strife.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ nai kiloja saꞌan Topaꞌ diꞌ-e soꞌon bikalah, pak-e iyoh halus paguh tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa, ponai ngajal nyaꞌa, taan kila-e.
pairs.target: The Lord’s servant must not quarrel, but be gentle towards all, able to teach, patient,

pairs.source: Yoh mesti sabal ngajal nyaꞌa deꞌ suka bilawan; mudah-mudah Topaꞌ ngin masa tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ odaꞌ paliꞌ keꞌ olan deꞌ bonal, duoh puꞌan ajal deꞌ bonal.
pairs.target: in gentleness correcting those who oppose him: perhaps God may give them repentance leading to a full knowledge of the truth,

pairs.source: Moꞌ-e moꞌ wat inoh, nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ paliꞌ bingoon, duoh lopas soꞌ jolat Laja Muat Munua, deꞌ moꞌ pasung duoh paksa odaꞌ nunaꞌ kila odop Laja Muat Munua.
pairs.target: and they may recover themselves out of the devil’s snare, having been taken captive by him to his will.

pairs.source: Natong nyeꞌ: Daang onu-onu piobuaꞌ-e otoꞌ ulang deꞌ bisayaꞌ yaꞌ kiꞌan bogoꞌ susah jolaꞌ,
pairs.target: But know this, that in the last days, grievous times will come.

pairs.source: dop-e manusia jok-e piduli odop-e jaꞌ-e, bakoꞌ duit, samuh duoh suka bilagah odop-e.   Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ suka pijaꞌat nyaꞌa, lawan pingoma-e, diꞌ-e puꞌan bisukul, diꞌ-e pimodo tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: For men will be lovers of self, lovers of money, boastful, arrogant, blasphemers, disobedient to parents, unthankful, unholy,

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e ngibalaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon, doliaꞌ-e yaꞌ bidamai, suka pijaꞌat adon nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon, mulah manas, gaus duoh diꞌ-e suka oniꞌ deꞌ paguh.
pairs.target: without natural affection, unforgiving, slanderers, without self-control, fierce, not lovers of good,

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ suka nyelah dingan-e tuduꞌ musuh-e, samuh duoh diꞌ-e bipikil omu.   Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ jok-e suka nunaꞌ kila odop-e, diꞌ-e nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: traitors, headstrong, conceited, lovers of pleasure rather than lovers of God;

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nunaꞌ atulan agama-e madas saꞌ nyaꞌa ningaꞌ-e, pak-e sibonal-e yoh diꞌ-e bonal-bonal kalik Topaꞌ.   Maꞌ yaꞌ sinok nyaꞌa deꞌ wat inoh neh.
pairs.target: holding a form of godliness, but having denied its power. Turn away from these, also.

pairs.source: Ogiꞌ soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ molot keꞌ boli-boli nyaꞌa, yohmoꞌ nipu dayung-dayung deꞌ budua, deꞌ bogoꞌ nai dosa duoh obuah nguasa odaꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ laꞌan-e deꞌ jaꞌat.
pairs.target: For some of these are people who creep into houses, and take captive gullible women loaded down with sins, led away by various lusts,

pairs.source: Dayung-dayung deꞌ munoꞌ silalu yaꞌ bilajal, pak-e nyaꞌa ngajal pingajal deꞌ salah tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.   Ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ doiꞌ sidoh-e ponai yaꞌ puꞌan oniꞌ deꞌ bonal soꞌ Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: always learning, and never able to come to the knowledge of the truth.

pairs.source: Gulu-gulu agama deꞌ palsu deꞌ munoꞌ samah kodaꞌ Yanes duoh Yambres deꞌ lawan Musa.   Pikil odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ bonal duoh suka lawan ajal deꞌ bonal deꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ, yohmoꞌ diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ bisayaꞌ.
pairs.target: Even as Jannes and Jambres opposed Moses, so do these also oppose the truth; men corrupted in mind, who concerning the faith are rejected.

pairs.source: Pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e yaꞌ soꞌon oni-oni-e, dop-e suaꞌ nyaꞌa telang-telang yaꞌ puꞌan nang odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ budua kodaꞌ Yanes duoh Yambres.
pairs.target: But they will proceed no further. For their folly will be evident to all men, as theirs also came to be.

pairs.source: Pak-e muꞌu moꞌ nunaꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal kuꞌ, muꞌu puꞌan oni wat gaya idip kuꞌ, muꞌu puꞌan oni niat kuꞌ daang idip kuꞌ.   Muꞌu ningaꞌ oni wat okuꞌ bisayaꞌ bonal-bonal tuduꞌ Kristus Yesus, taan kila kuꞌ duoh okuꞌ ngibalaꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa.   Muꞌu moꞌ ningaꞌ oniꞌ wat kuꞌ taan idip takal kuꞌ susah jolaꞌ.
pairs.target: But you did follow my teaching, conduct, purpose, faith, patience, love, steadfastness,

pairs.source: Muꞌu moꞌ ningaꞌ oni wat okuꞌ obuah pijolaꞌ duoh ngoon suaꞌ susah jolaꞌ takal kuꞌ deꞌ kota Antiokhia, deꞌ kota Ikonium, duoh deꞌ kota Listra.   Muꞌu puꞌan suaꞌ susah jolaꞌ deꞌ obuah kuꞌ, pak-e Topaꞌ nyilamat okuꞌ soꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ.
pairs.target: persecutions, and sufferings: those things that happened to me at Antioch, Iconium, and Lystra. I endured those persecutions. The Lord delivered me out of them all.

pairs.source: Sibonal-e, suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus Kristus duoh idip nunaꞌ deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ, yaꞌ obuah susah jolaꞌ.
pairs.target: Yes, and all who desire to live godly in Christ Jesus will suffer persecution.

pairs.source: Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ jaꞌat duoh pinipu bitamah jaꞌat.   Yoh nipu nyaꞌa, yoh tuang obuah nipu geh.
pairs.target: But evil men and impostors will grow worse and worse, deceiving and being deceived.

pairs.source: Pak-e muꞌu Timotius, kagian bonal-bonal-e suaꞌ pingajal deꞌ bonal deꞌ ngajal kuꞌ tuduꞌ muꞌu, duoh deꞌ bisayaꞌ muꞌu tuduꞌ-e, dop-e muꞌu tuang puꞌan osi deꞌ ngajal.
pairs.target: But you remain in the things which you have learned and have been assured of, knowing from whom you have learned them.

pairs.source: Soꞌ isoꞌ muꞌ geh muꞌu moꞌ puꞌan pingunang daang buk Kitab.   Buk Kitab deꞌ odaꞌ muꞌu bijak, deꞌ odaꞌ muꞌu puꞌan nang Topaꞌ nyilamat asal nyaꞌa bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Kristus Yesus.
pairs.target: From infancy, you have known the holy Scriptures which are able to make you wise for salvation through faith, which is in Christ Jesus.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ pingunang daang buk Kitab nog soꞌ Topaꞌ.   Buk inoh sukup biguna ngan nyeꞌ ngajal oniꞌ deꞌ bonal, ngan nyeꞌ tanon salah nyaꞌa, ngan nyeꞌ tulung nyaꞌa deꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ salah odaꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ bonal, duoh ngan nyeꞌ ngajal oni wat idip deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: Every Scripture is God-breathed and profitable for teaching, for reproof, for correction, and for instruction in righteousness,

pairs.source: Ngan-e moꞌ ogiꞌ buk Kitab inoh, suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ jadin umat Topaꞌ jadin siap ngan-e nai kiloja deꞌ paguh.
pairs.target: that the man of God may be complete, thoroughly equipped for every good work.

pairs.source: Kristus Yesus yaꞌ nog lagiꞌ kaang dunia itih ngan-e bilituang duoh manusia deꞌ idip baya manusia deꞌ kobos, Iyoh yaꞌ nog militah jadin Laja, inohleh ngan kuꞌ ulih-ulih tanon deꞌ sulung jowin Topaꞌ Samaꞌ duoh Yesus Kristus.
pairs.target: I command you therefore before God and the Lord Jesus Christ, who will judge the living and the dead at his appearing and his Kingdom:

pairs.source: Magah leh pingunang Topaꞌ siniaꞌ sijaꞌ-e, laꞌan bait idoh bait nyaꞌa ngojit-e, magah negeh.   Tanon salah deꞌ nai-e, ngalah nyaꞌa deꞌ nai salah-e, ngin nasehat tuduꞌ-e daang punuaꞌ sabal, duoh pakai pingajal deꞌ bonal.
pairs.target: preach the word; be urgent in season and out of season; reprove, rebuke, and exhort, with all patience and teaching.

pairs.source: Dop-e ogiꞌ onu-e takal nyaꞌa diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ laꞌan ngojit pingajal deꞌ bonal.   Pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ nunaꞌ kila odop-e sadiꞌ-e, yoh moꞌ nguluk gulu-gulu deꞌ odaꞌ ngajal oniꞌ deꞌ madas paguh in-e ngojit-e.
pairs.target: For the time will come when they will not listen to the sound doctrine, but, having itching ears, will heap up for themselves teachers after their own lusts;

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ maput kojit-e doliaꞌ ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ bonal, pak-e yoh jok-e laꞌan ngojit silita-silita donan.
pairs.target: and will turn away their ears from the truth, and turn away to fables.

pairs.source: Bial-e wat inoh, muꞌu halus taan nijon odop muꞌ daang suaꞌ oniꞌ, taan naan idip susah jolaꞌ, nai negeh kiloja muꞌ tukang magah Gah deꞌ Paguh duoh nai bonal-bonal-e kiloja jadin kuli Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: But you be sober in all things, suffer hardship, do the work of an evangelist, and fulfill your ministry.

pairs.source: Adin okuꞌ moꞌ sinok nyuang idip kuꞌ, okuꞌ yaꞌ kobos jadin kulban saꞌan Topaꞌ, niꞌ tiliaꞌ lagiꞌ okuꞌ yaꞌ buu soꞌ dunia itih.
pairs.target: For I am already being offered, and the time of my departure has come.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ moꞌ bilomaꞌ nunaꞌ atulan, okuꞌ moꞌ nog galis piobuaꞌ-e.   Okuꞌ taat tuduꞌ Gah deꞌ Paguh nog piobuaꞌ idip kuꞌ.
pairs.target: I have fought the good fight. I have finished the course. I have kept the faith.

pairs.source: Adin geh moꞌ ogiꞌ hadiah deꞌ saꞌan okuꞌ, deꞌ taat tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, daang onu deꞌ moꞌ notap odop Topaꞌ hakim deꞌ adil.   Idoh diꞌ-e jok-e okuꞌ sadiꞌ kuꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ tilimaꞌ hadiah inoh, pak-e suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kajon Topaꞌ nog, tuang tilimaꞌ-e geh.
pairs.target: From now on, there is stored up for me the crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous judge, will give to me on that day; and not to me only, but also to all those who have loved his appearing.

pairs.source: Laju nyeꞌ nog tuduꞌ okuꞌ,
pairs.target: Be diligent to come to me soon,

pairs.source: dop-e Demas moꞌ buu togan okuꞌ, yoh lobih ngibalaꞌ dunia itih, yoh moꞌ odi keꞌ Tesalonika.   Kreskes tuang moꞌ buu geh odi keꞌ Galatia, Titus keꞌ Dalmatia.
pairs.target: for Demas left me, having loved this present world, and went to Thessalonica; Crescens to Galatia, and Titus to Dalmatia.

pairs.source: Jok-e Lukas sijaꞌ-e deꞌ aluaꞌ loꞌo duoh okuꞌ.   Odi ngijaꞌ Markus, nyeꞌ moꞌ toban samah-samah duoh muꞌu dop-e yoh tapod tulung kiloja kuꞌ.
pairs.target: Only Luke is with me. Take Mark, and bring him with you, for he is useful to me for service.

pairs.source: Tikhikus moꞌ pait kuꞌ keꞌ Efesus.
pairs.target: But I sent Tychicus to Ephesus.

pairs.source: Simoꞌ muꞌu odi katiꞌ toban geh jubah kuꞌ deꞌ supiah kuꞌ deꞌ boli Karpus deꞌ Troas.   Toban nyeꞌ geh suaꞌ buk kuꞌ, amot-e buk kuꞌ deꞌ nai nyaꞌa soꞌ kulit binatang.
pairs.target: Bring the cloak that I left at Troas with Carpus when you come, and the books, especially the parchments.

pairs.source: Aleksander, tukang boba inoh, bogoꞌ nai jaꞌat-e tuduꞌ okuꞌ.   Bogoꞌ kaso kiloja deꞌ nai kuꞌ, pak-e tanah negeh saꞌ Topaꞌ ngukum samah kodaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai-e.
pairs.target: Alexander, the coppersmith, did much evil to me. The Lord will repay him according to his deeds,

pairs.source: Maꞌ tauꞌ-tauꞌ tuduꞌ iyoh, dop-e yoh sukup kolas netang kiloja otoꞌ.
pairs.target: of whom you also must beware; for he greatly opposed our words.

pairs.source: Takal keꞌ niꞌ sidoh okuꞌ bela odop kuꞌ, niꞌ naꞌan tuang doiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ bela okuꞌ, suaꞌ-e buu togan okuꞌ.   Mudah-mudah Topaꞌ diꞌ-e nyalah oniꞌ deꞌ nai nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ wat inoh.
pairs.target: At my first defense, no one came to help me, but all left me. May it not be held against them.

pairs.source: Pak-e Topaꞌ moꞌ tulung okuꞌ odaꞌ okuꞌ bilani magah Gah deꞌ Paguh, saꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e bangsa Yahudi tapod ngojit-e.   Topaꞌ tuang moꞌ odaꞌ okuꞌ lopas geh soꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ponai odaꞌ okuꞌ yaꞌ kobos, kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ lopas soꞌ bobaꞌ singa.
pairs.target: But the Lord stood by me, and strengthened me, that through me the message might be fully proclaimed, and that all the Gentiles might hear; and I was delivered out of the mouth of the lion.

pairs.source: Topaꞌ yaꞌ pilopas okuꞌ soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ lika kagaꞌ yaꞌ jaꞌat duoh okuꞌ.   Iyoh yaꞌ toban okuꞌ molot keꞌ topat soꞌ Iyoh militah jadin Laja deꞌ siluga.   Tanah saꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa mudi Iyoh nah-nah! Amin.
pairs.target: And the Lord will deliver me from every evil work, and will preserve me for his heavenly Kingdom; to whom be the glory forever and ever. Amen.

pairs.source: Salam tuduꞌ Priskila, Akwila, duoh tuduꞌ lawang Onesiforus.
pairs.target: Greet Prisca and Aquila, and the house of Onesiphorus.

pairs.source: Erastus aluaꞌ loꞌo deꞌ Korintus, Trofimus deꞌ supiah kuꞌ deꞌ Miletus dop-e yoh aluaꞌ monam.
pairs.target: Erastus remained at Corinth, but I left Trophimus at Miletus sick.

pairs.source: Kagaꞌ leh odop muꞌ odi katiꞌ takal aluaꞌ diꞌ-e musim modud.   Salam soꞌ Ebulus, soꞌ Pudes, soꞌ Linus, soꞌ Klaudia, duoh soꞌ suaꞌ madih ayua deꞌ moꞌ bisayaꞌ.
pairs.target: Be diligent to come before winter. Eubulus salutes you, as do Pudens, Linus, Claudia, and all the brothers.

pairs.source: Saꞌ Topaꞌ tulung muꞌu, Sa Topaꞌ bilokat suaꞌ madih ayua deꞌ moꞌ bisayaꞌ! Salam soꞌ okuꞌ Paulus.       TITUS
pairs.target: The Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Grace be with you. Amen.

pairs.source: Sulat itih soꞌ okuꞌ, Paulus, nyaꞌa deꞌ jadin kuli Topaꞌ duoh rasul Yesus Kristus.   Okuꞌ obuah pilih duoh obuah pait odaꞌ tulung nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ pilih Topaꞌ sa'-a bitamah bisayaꞌ duoh puꞌan pingajal deꞌ bonal deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa idip nunaꞌ oni deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: Paul, a servant of God, and an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to the faith of God’s chosen ones, and the knowledge of the truth which is according to godliness,

pairs.source: Pingajal inoh moꞌ bitotok duoh oniꞌ deꞌ alap otoꞌ, nang otoꞌ yaꞌ tilimaꞌ idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah.   Idip inoh moꞌ obuah janyi odaꞌ Topaꞌ, takal dunia aluaꞌ diꞌ-e obuah nai.   Topaꞌ diꞌ-e pibulaꞌ.
pairs.target: in hope of eternal life, which God, who can’t lie, promised before time began;

pairs.source: Takal onu deꞌ moꞌ notu-E, Topaꞌ Pinyilamat otoꞌ moꞌ tanon janyi-E inoh pakai Gah deꞌ Paguh.   Iyoh moꞌ pilih okuꞌ odaꞌ magah Gah deꞌ Paguh inoh, nunaꞌ pilitah Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: but in his own time revealed his word in the message with which I was entrusted according to the commandment of God our Savior;

pairs.source: Okuꞌ nulis sulat itih tuduꞌ muꞌu Titus deꞌ ngakuꞌ kuꞌ nyam onak odop kuꞌ, dop-e muꞌu duoh Okuꞌ samah-samah moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Kristus.   Okuꞌ bidoa Topaꞌ Samaꞌ duoh Kristus Yesus, Tukang Pinyilamat otoꞌ, ngin bilokat duoh idip bidanah tuduꞌ muꞌu.
pairs.target: to Titus, my true child according to a common faith: Grace, mercy, and peace from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ our Savior.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ moꞌ supiah muꞌu deꞌ pulou Kreta saꞌ muꞌu tapod ngulus oniꞌ deꞌ aluaꞌ pilelu nyaꞌa yaꞌ odaꞌ tiatul, duoh deꞌ tibilang kota, muꞌu pakat pimipin-pimipin uluk ulang bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ tanon kuꞌ itih tuduꞌ muꞌu:
pairs.target: I left you in Crete for this reason, that you would set in order the things that were lacking, and appoint elders in every city, as I directed you;

pairs.source: Pimipin uluk ulang deꞌ bisayaꞌ halus leh nyaꞌa deꞌ tongon idip-e, sowon-e jok-e niꞌ, onak opot-e halus moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Kristus, idoh diꞌ-e onak deꞌ sobot nyaꞌa nang onak deꞌ bilawan duoh diꞌ-e bonal.
pairs.target: if anyone is blameless, the husband of one wife, having children who believe, who are not accused of loose or unruly behavior.

pairs.source: Pimipin uluk ulang deꞌ bisayaꞌ iyohleh nyaꞌa deꞌ ngulus pingunai kiloja Topaꞌ.   Inoh leh ngan-e iyoh halus nyaꞌa deꞌ tongon idip-e, diꞌ-e samuh, diꞌ-e pimalah, diꞌ-e pimabuk, diꞌ-e suka bikaꞌi, diꞌ-e pinganguak.
pairs.target: For the overseer must be blameless, as God’s steward; not self-pleasing, not easily angered, not given to wine, not violent, not greedy for dishonest gain;

pairs.source: Iyoh suka tilimaꞌ nyaꞌa ngilumon deꞌ boli-e, suka nai oniꞌ deꞌ paguh, bijak daang idip-e, diꞌ-e ngilipiꞌ, bisig otin-e, duoh taan nijon odop-e.
pairs.target: but given to hospitality, a lover of good, sober minded, fair, holy, self-controlled;

pairs.source: Iyoh halus bikagong togap tuduꞌ pingajal deꞌ bonal, kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ mokuaꞌ iyoh bilajal-e soꞌ koꞌih, saꞌ iyoh ponai ngin nasehat pakai pingajal deꞌ bonal duoh dapod tanon salah nyaꞌa deꞌ lawan pingajal deꞌ bonal.
pairs.target: holding to the faithful word which is according to the teaching, that he may be able to exhort in the sound doctrine, and to convict those who contradict him.

pairs.source: Dop-e moꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ idip-e diꞌ-e tiatul, amot-e ulang Yahudi deꞌ bikagong deꞌ atulan bisunat, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ mogo nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon pakai pingunang-e deꞌ adoh-adoh deꞌ doiꞌ guna-e.
pairs.target: For there are also many unruly men, vain talkers and deceivers, especially those of the circumcision,

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ kodaꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ halus nyeꞌ odaꞌ loꞌo diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ sina, dop-e pingajal deꞌ nang-e bogoꞌ kaso idip lomin boli nyaꞌa.   Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ ngajal oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ-e bonal deꞌ wat inoh, madas ngan-e yaꞌ soꞌon duit deꞌ diꞌ-e patut.
pairs.target: whose mouths must be stopped; men who overthrow whole houses, teaching things which they ought not, for dishonest gain’s sake.

pairs.source: Nabi odop ulang Kreta ogiꞌ sidoh-e nang in-e, “Nyaꞌa soꞌ pulou Kreta suka pibulaꞌ, samah kodaꞌ binatang deꞌ suka man dingan-e, lakaꞌ jolua, malas-masal.   ”
pairs.target: One of them, a prophet of their own, said, “Cretans are always liars, evil beasts, and idle gluttons.”

pairs.source: Oniꞌ deꞌ tanon-e inoh bonal.   Noh leh ngan muꞌu halus ulih-ulih ngalah-e, saꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bisayaꞌ deꞌ pingajal deꞌ bonal.
pairs.target: This testimony is true. For this cause, reprove them sharply, that they may be sound in the faith,

pairs.source: Ngan-e wat inoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ bisayaꞌ deꞌ silita donan ulang Yahudi duoh atulan-atulan deꞌ nai manusia deꞌ doliaꞌ-e tilimaꞌ ajal deꞌ bonal.
pairs.target: not paying attention to Jewish fables and commandments of men who turn away from the truth.

pairs.source: Saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ bisig otin-e, suaꞌ oniꞌ bisig.   Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ koꞌis otin-e deꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ, doiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ bisig, dop-e bait akal-e, otin osuap-e, suaꞌ-e moꞌ koꞌis geh.
pairs.target: To the pure, all things are pure; but to those who are defiled and unbelieving, nothing is pure; but both their mind and their conscience are defiled.

pairs.source: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ngakuꞌ nang odop-e puꞌan Topaꞌ, pak-e pingunai kiloja-e bonal-bonal samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e puꞌan Topaꞌ.   Topaꞌ sisiꞌ ningaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.   Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ doliaꞌ-e nunaꞌ pingunang Topaꞌ duoh diꞌ-e taan nai oniꞌ deꞌ paguh.
pairs.target: They profess that they know God, but by their deeds they deny him, being abominable, disobedient, and unfit for any good work.

pairs.source: Pak-e muꞌu, Titus, ngajal negeh oniꞌ deꞌ bonal.
pairs.target: But say the things which fit sound doctrine,

pairs.source: Tanon tuduꞌ dali-dali deꞌ nyoma, saꞌ-e: taan nijon odop-e, pimodo nyaꞌa daꞌ-a, idip-e bijak, totap bisayaꞌ deꞌ ajal deꞌ bonal, ngibalaꞌ susuaꞌ nyaꞌa, tungang naꞌan idip deꞌ susah jolaꞌ.
pairs.target: that older men should be temperate, sensible, sober minded, sound in faith, in love, and in perseverance:

pairs.source: Wat noh geh tuduꞌ dayung-dayung deꞌ nyoma, muꞌu tanon tuduꞌ-e, saꞌ-e: idip nunaꞌ wat deꞌ moꞌ tanon Topaꞌ.   Diꞌ-e soꞌon ngituang sobot nyaꞌa, diꞌ soꞌon nuak nog-e mabuk, pak-e yoh halus ngajal oniꞌ deꞌ paguh.
pairs.target: and that older women likewise be reverent in behavior, not slanderers nor enslaved to much wine, teachers of that which is good;

pairs.source: Moꞌ-e watnoh, yoh dapod ngajal dayung-dayung deꞌ mudaꞌ, saꞌ-e ngibalaꞌ bonon-e duoh onak opot-e.
pairs.target: that they may train the young wives to love their husbands, to love their children,

pairs.source: Idip dayung-dayung deꞌ mudaꞌ halus: bijak idip-e, bisig otin-e, lajin ngatul lomin boli-e, paguh akal-e, duoh tunuak tuduꞌ bonon-e, saꞌ-e doiꞌ tiyaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nguyat pingunang deꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: to be sober minded, chaste, workers at home, kind, being in subjection to their own husbands, that God’s word may not be blasphemed.

pairs.source: Watnoh geh duoh dali deꞌ mudaꞌ nyeꞌ ngajal tuduꞌ-e saꞌ-e bijak idip-e.
pairs.target: Likewise, exhort the younger men to be sober minded;

pairs.source: Daang suaꞌ oniꞌ, muꞌu, Titus, halus jadin soto nai oniꞌ deꞌ paguh.   Moꞌ muꞌu ngajal, muꞌu halus pakai otin deꞌ paguh duoh bonal-bonal.
pairs.target: in all things showing yourself an example of good works; in your teaching showing integrity, seriousness, incorruptibility,

pairs.source: Moꞌ muꞌu ngajal pakai leh sina deꞌ bonal duoh sina deꞌ diꞌ nyaꞌa ponai nyalah-e, saꞌ musuh-musuh muꞌ dasaꞌ, dop-e moꞌ diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ ponai pijaꞌat otoꞌ.
pairs.target: and soundness of speech that can’t be condemned; that he who opposes you may be ashamed, having no evil thing to say about us.

pairs.source: Kuli-kuli halus tunuak tuduꞌ toke-e, daang suaꞌ oniꞌ yoh nyonang otin toke-e.   Iyoh diꞌ soꞌon bisawot duoh sina deꞌ nang toke-e,
pairs.target: Exhort servants to be in subjection to their own masters, and to be well-pleasing in all things; not contradicting;

pairs.source: maꞌ noku, pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ halus bitanga nang odop-e nai oniꞌ deꞌ paguh duoh dapod toke-e bisayaꞌ daꞌ-a, saꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon ningaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, yohmoꞌ mudi nang tok paguh pingajal Topaꞌ, Pinyilamat otoꞌ.
pairs.target: not stealing, but showing all good fidelity; that they may adorn the doctrine of God, our Savior, in all things.

pairs.source: Moꞌ telang-telang tonga otin Topaꞌ deꞌ paguh deꞌ nyilamat suaꞌ manusia.
pairs.target: For the grace of God has appeared, bringing salvation to all men,

pairs.source: Otin Topaꞌ deꞌ paguh tulung saꞌ otoꞌ posan pingunai deꞌ jaꞌat duoh diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ idip nunaꞌ asong odop toꞌ deꞌ lawan oni deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ.   Daang dunia deꞌ adin, Topaꞌ ngajal saꞌ otoꞌ taan nijon odop toꞌ, idip bonal duoh idip deꞌ nyonang otin Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: instructing us to the intent that, denying ungodliness and worldly lusts, we would live soberly, righteously, and godly in this present age;

pairs.source: Otoꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ simadi otoꞌ kajon onu deꞌ sukup doon-e deꞌ alap-alap otoꞌ inoh: Takal onu inoh nog, suaꞌ nyaꞌa yaꞌ ningaꞌ jawaꞌ telang Yesus Kristus, Iyoh leh Topaꞌ deꞌ sukup ayuh kuasa-E duoh Pinyilamat otoꞌ.
pairs.target: looking for the blessed hope and appearing of the glory of our great God and Savior, Jesus Christ;

pairs.source: Yesus Kristus inoh deꞌ moꞌ nyelah odop-E ngan-e odaꞌ otoꞌ lopas soꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat.   Iyoh odaꞌ otoꞌ jadin nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ bisig soꞌ dosa duoh lajin nai oniꞌ deꞌ paguh.
pairs.target: who gave himself for us, that he might redeem us from all iniquity, and purify for himself a people for his own possession, zealous for good works.

pairs.source: Titus, suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ halus muꞌu ngajal tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit pingunang muꞌ.   Ngin nasehat duoh ngalah leh nyaꞌa pakai kuasa deꞌ ngin Topaꞌ tuduꞌ muꞌu deꞌ jadin pimipin.   Maꞌ tanah nyaꞌa yaꞌ adoh-adoh in-e duoh muꞌu.
pairs.target: Say these things and exhort and reprove with all authority. Let no man despise you.

pairs.source: Titus, muꞌu halus tanon tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ saꞌ-e diꞌ-e komut tunuak tuduꞌ pilitah duoh pimipin-pimipin deꞌ ogiꞌ kuasa-e, silalu nunaꞌ atulan pilitah duoh siap nai oniꞌ deꞌ paguh.
pairs.target: Remind them to be in subjection to rulers and to authorities, to be obedient, to be ready for every good work,

pairs.source: Tanon tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ maꞌ pijaꞌat nyaꞌa, maꞌ bikaꞌi, pak-e iyoh silalu paguh duoh pimodo tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa.
pairs.target: to speak evil of no one, not to be contentious, to be gentle, showing all humility toward all men.

pairs.source: Dop-e noꞌuh-e idip otoꞌ tuang budua, diꞌ-e taat tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, moyap soꞌ olan deꞌ bonal, nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ laꞌan odop-e, idip deꞌ punuaꞌ odaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat, siniaꞌ, suka buꞌui tipan odop-e.
pairs.target: For we were also once foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving various lusts and pleasures, living in malice and envy, hateful, and hating one another.

pairs.source: Pak-e Topaꞌ Pinyilamat otoꞌ moꞌ ngibalaꞌ duoh bitanga paguh-E tuduꞌ otoꞌ.
pairs.target: But when the kindness of God our Savior and his love toward mankind appeared,

pairs.source: Iyoh nyilamat otoꞌ, idoh diꞌ-e luban otoꞌ moꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ bonal, pak-e luban Iyoh masiꞌ tuduꞌ otoꞌ.   Iyoh nyilamat otoꞌ pakai Iyang Topaꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ otoꞌ bisig soꞌ dosa duoh odaꞌ idip otoꞌ jadin baꞌuh, samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tuang-e obuah milaꞌ.
pairs.target: not by works of righteousness which we did ourselves, but according to his mercy, he saved us through the washing of regeneration and renewing by the Holy Spirit,

pairs.source: Topaꞌ pimuun Iyang-E sipunuaꞌ-e saꞌan otoꞌ, pakai Yesus Kristus, Pinyilamat otoꞌ,
pairs.target: whom he poured out on us richly, through Jesus Christ our Savior;

pairs.source: Topaꞌ paguh otin-e duoh otoꞌ, inohleh ngan Iyoh moꞌ tanon nang otoꞌ bonal.   Otoꞌ ponai soꞌon idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah kodaꞌ deꞌ alap otoꞌ.
pairs.target: that being justified by his grace, we might be made heirs according to the hope of eternal life.

pairs.source: Pingunang itih tok-tok bonal.   Okuꞌ alap odaꞌ muꞌu paliꞌ-paliꞌ tanon hal itih saꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ bonal-bonal nai kiloja deꞌ paguh dop-e inoh leh deꞌ paguh duoh deꞌ biguna saꞌan suaꞌ nyaꞌa.
pairs.target: This saying is faithful, and concerning these things I desire that you affirm confidently, so that those who have believed God may be careful to maintain good works. These things are good and profitable to men;

pairs.source: Pak-e maꞌ suka nunaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bidu bikalah oniꞌ deꞌ doiꞌ guna-e, silita asal usul onak sukun-e, bikaꞌi bikalah soal atulan agama.   Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ doiꞌ guna-e duoh doiꞌ utung-e.
pairs.target: but shun foolish questionings, genealogies, strife, and disputes about the law; for they are unprofitable and vain.

pairs.source: Simoꞌ-e ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ odaꞌ uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ bipisah-pisah, muꞌu halus ngalah-e.   Asal muꞌu moꞌ ngalah nog duwoh sidoh-e, pak-e yoh doliaꞌ-e ngojit muꞌu, maꞌ tiyaꞌ bidingan duoh-e.
pairs.target: Avoid a factious man after a first and second warning,

pairs.source: Muꞌu moꞌ puꞌan nang nyaꞌa deꞌ kodaꞌ inoh moꞌ moyap soꞌ olan deꞌ bonal duoh moꞌ bidosa.   Dosa-dosa deꞌ nai-e yaꞌ ngukum odop-e.
pairs.target: knowing that such a one is perverted and sins, being self-condemned.

pairs.source: Okuꞌ yaꞌ odaꞌ Artemas keh Tikhikus keh odi tuduꞌ muꞌu, asal yoh moꞌ nog tuduꞌ muꞌu, likas-likas nyeꞌ nog tuduꞌ okuꞌ deꞌ Nikopolis dop-e okuꞌ ogiꞌ niat kuꞌ yaꞌ loꞌo danoꞌ silamaꞌ musim modud.
pairs.target: When I send Artemas to you, or Tychicus, be diligent to come to me to Nicopolis, for I have determined to winter there.

pairs.source: Muꞌu halus bonal-bonal tulung Zenas, nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ puꞌan tentang ukum, duoh tulung geh Apolos.   Sidia suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ pilelu-e daang pimonu-e.
pairs.target: Send Zenas, the lawyer, and Apollos on their journey speedily, that nothing may be lacking for them.

pairs.source: Tanah saꞌ otoꞌ ulang-ulang deꞌ bisayaꞌ bilajal geh nai kiloja deꞌ paguh, saꞌ-e tapod nyukup oniꞌ deꞌ pilelu nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon daang idip-e, saꞌ idip otoꞌ biguna.
pairs.target: Let our people also learn to maintain good works for necessary uses, that they may not be unfruitful.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ samah-samah duoh okuꞌ pait salam tuduꞌ muꞌu.   Tanon geh salam soꞌ koꞌih tuduꞌ dingan-dingan otoꞌ deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus.   Okuꞌ bidoa saꞌ Topaꞌ bilokat suaꞌ ingan.   Soꞌ okuꞌ, Paulus.     SULAT YAKOBUS
pairs.target: All who are with me greet you. Greet those who love us in faith. Grace be with you all. Amen.

pairs.source: Salam soꞌ okuꞌ Yakobus, kuli Topaꞌ duoh kuli Topaꞌ Yesus Kristus, tuduꞌ suaꞌ ulang Kristen deꞌ loꞌo jadin nyaꞌa deꞌ saluh-saluh deꞌ pulou-pulou deꞌ ogiꞌ daang dunia itih.
pairs.target: James, a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ, to the twelve tribes which are in the Dispersion: Greetings.

pairs.source: Madih ayua kuꞌ, ingan halus ngoon doon jaꞌ-e takal ingan obuah masam-masam pingisuba,
pairs.target: Count it all joy, my brothers, when you fall into various temptations,

pairs.source: dop-e ingan moꞌ ngoon takal bisayaꞌ ingan obuah suba, ingan jadin nyaꞌa deꞌ taan naan susah jolaꞌ deꞌ obuah ingan.
pairs.target: knowing that the testing of your faith produces endurance.

pairs.source: Ingan yaꞌ jadin nyaꞌa deꞌ makin taan naan susah jolaꞌ, saꞌ idip ingan jadin samah kodaꞌ deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ duoh diꞌ ingan kulang oni-oni-e deꞌ sulung jowin Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: Let endurance have its perfect work, that you may be perfect and complete, lacking in nothing.

pairs.source: Simoꞌ-e ogiꞌ deꞌ soꞌ ingan deꞌ diꞌ-e sikiya bijak ponai, mitiaꞌ negeh tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, dop-e Topaꞌ laꞌan-e ngin bijak ponai.   Iyoh diꞌ-e tukud ngan-e yaꞌ ngin-e duoh doiꞌ sidoh-e malah deꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ-E.
pairs.target: But if any of you lacks wisdom, let him ask of God, who gives to all liberally and without reproach; and it will be given to him.

pairs.source: Takal ingan mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, ingan halus bonal-bonal bisayaꞌ, maꞌ muta-muta.   Dop-e nyaꞌa deꞌ muta-muta, iyoh samah kodaꞌ gilumang laut deꞌ kusuak sobak katiꞌ-kanih.
pairs.target: But let him ask in faith, without any doubting, for he who doubts is like a wave of the sea, driven by the wind and tossed.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ kodaꞌ inoh, maꞌ alap yoh yaꞌ tilimaꞌ oni-oni soꞌ Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: For that man shouldn’t think that he will receive anything from the Lord.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ bisokap otin-e diꞌ-e bidanah idip-e.
pairs.target: He is a double-minded man, unstable in all his ways.

pairs.source: Ulang Kristen deꞌ botak halus ngoon munuas, dop-e Topaꞌ moꞌ pakat iyoh odaꞌ bigatung.
pairs.target: But let the brother in humble circumstances glory in his high position;

pairs.source: Wat noh geh ulang Kristen deꞌ kaya halus ngoon doon, simoꞌ Topaꞌ pidouꞌ iyoh, dop-e ulang kaya yaꞌ musuap kodaꞌ suwat duh.
pairs.target: and the rich, in that he is made humble, because like the flower in the grass, he will pass away.

pairs.source: Takal boton onu moꞌ tumuꞌ, onu moꞌ putiak, duh inoh moꞌ kolong, suwat-e moꞌ luluh, sangon-e moꞌ doiꞌ.   Wat inoh geh duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ kaya; iyoh yaꞌ kobos takal-e nai kiloja-e ngan-e odaꞌ odop-e kaya.
pairs.target: For the sun arises with the scorching wind, and withers the grass, and the flower in it falls, and the beauty of its appearance perishes. So also will the rich man fade away in his pursuits.

pairs.source: Topaꞌ yaꞌ bilokat nyaꞌa deꞌ taan nijon odop-e takal-e obuah pingisuba.   Dop-e moꞌ yoh monang lawan pingisuba inoh, iyoh yaꞌ tilimaꞌ upah-e idip deꞌ moꞌ janyi Topaꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngibalaꞌ Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: Blessed is the man who endures temptation, for when he has been approved, he will receive the crown of life, which the Lord promised to those who love him.

pairs.source: Takal nyaꞌa obuah mujok odaꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat, maꞌ yaꞌ nang Topaꞌ deꞌ mujok iyoh.   Dop-e odop Topaꞌ diꞌ-e tapod obuah mujok odaꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat, duoh Iyoh doiꞌ onu-e mujok nyaꞌa odaꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat.
pairs.target: Let no man say when he is tempted, “I am tempted by God,” for God can’t be tempted by evil, and he himself tempts no one.

pairs.source: Pak-e niat deꞌ jaꞌat deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa obuah mujok odaꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat, dop-e niat-e deꞌ jaꞌat inoh nalik duoh nguasa odop-e.
pairs.target: But each one is tempted when he is drawn away by his own lust, and enticed.

pairs.source: Simoꞌ nyaꞌa nunaꞌ niat-e deꞌ jaꞌat, iyoh moꞌ yaꞌ nai dosa.   Takal dosa inoh moꞌ nguasa idip-e, iyoh yaꞌ kobos duoh lopas soꞌ Topaꞌ nah-nah.
pairs.target: Then the lust, when it has conceived, bears sin; and the sin, when it is full grown, produces death.

pairs.source: Madih ayua deꞌ ngibalaꞌ kuꞌ, maꞌ yaꞌ obuah nipu.
pairs.target: Don’t be deceived, my beloved brothers.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ngin Topaꞌ inoh paguh duoh doiꞌ deꞌ kulang.   Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ paguh inoh otoꞌ soꞌon soꞌ Topaꞌ Samaꞌ deꞌ siluga, deꞌ moꞌ nai suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ jawaꞌ deꞌ longit.   Iyoh doiꞌ sidoh-e bilubah, idoh diꞌ-e kodaꞌ sibamia deꞌ telus jaꞌ-e bilubah.
pairs.target: Every good gift and every perfect gift is from above, coming down from the Father of lights, with whom can be no variation, nor turning shadow.

pairs.source: Nunaꞌ deꞌ laꞌan odop Topaꞌ, Iyoh moꞌ odaꞌ otoꞌ jadin onak-onak-E pakai gah deꞌ bonal, saꞌ otoꞌ jadin deꞌ paling penting-e soꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: Of his own will he gave birth to us by the word of truth, that we should be a kind of first fruits of his creatures.

pairs.source: Madih ayua deꞌ ngibalaꞌ kuꞌ, ogiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ halus ingan puꞌan-e, osi sijaꞌ-a halus ngojit bonal-bonal.   Maꞌ dioꞌ sina takal aluaꞌ diꞌ nyeꞌ bipikil.   Maꞌ yaꞌ likas malah,
pairs.target: So, then, my beloved brothers, let every man be swift to hear, slow to speak, and slow to anger;

pairs.source: dop-e nyaꞌa deꞌ malah, diꞌ-e tapod nai oniꞌ deꞌ nyonang otin Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: for the anger of man doesn’t produce the righteousness of God.

pairs.source: Ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh, tolan negeh suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat duoh suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ salah daang idip ingan.   Nyeꞌ moꞌ pidouꞌ otin nyeꞌ duoh tilimaꞌ pingajal deꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ puluah-e daang otin ingan.   Ajal inoh tapod nyilamat ingan.
pairs.target: Therefore, putting away all filthiness and overflowing of wickedness, receive with humility the implanted word, which is able to save your souls.

pairs.source: Nai leh oni deꞌ moꞌ tanon Topaꞌ, maꞌ jok nyeꞌ ngojit-e, dop-e moꞌ nyam jok ingan ngojit-e, ingan mogo odop ingan.
pairs.target: But be doers of the word, and not only hearers, deluding your own selves.

pairs.source: Nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit Pingunang Topaꞌ pak-e diꞌ-e nunaꞌ-a, iyoh samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ningaꞌ jowin-e deꞌ silomin.
pairs.target: For if anyone is a hearer of the word and not a doer, he is like a man looking at his natural face in a mirror;

pairs.source: Takal-e mokuaꞌ ningaꞌ jowin-e deꞌ silomin, yoh moꞌ buu, yoh moꞌ lasuꞌ komut mun jowin-e.
pairs.target: for he sees himself, and goes away, and immediately forgets what kind of man he was.

pairs.source: Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ bilajal duoh bonal-bonal nunaꞌ oni deꞌ tanon Ukum Topaꞌ, idoh diꞌ-e jok-e ngojit-e yohmoꞌ komut-e, Topaꞌ yaꞌ bilokat iyoh dop-e iyoh moꞌ nai suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ.   Ukum Topaꞌ inoh doiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ kulang daꞌ-e duoh ogiꞌ kuasa-e deꞌ odaꞌ manusia lopas soꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat.
pairs.target: But he who looks into the perfect law of freedom, and continues, not being a hearer who forgets, but a doer of the work, this man will be blessed in what he does.

pairs.source: Simoꞌ-e ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nang odop-e taat simayang, pak-e diꞌ-e jaga oniꞌ deꞌ nang-e, iyoh mogo odop-e.   Simayang-e doiꞌ guna-e.
pairs.target: If anyone among you thinks himself to be religious while he doesn’t bridle his tongue, but deceives his heart, this man’s religion is worthless.

pairs.source: Simayang deꞌ sibonal-e duoh deꞌ doiꞌ salah-e deꞌ sulung jowin Topaꞌ iyoh leh kodaꞌ: Tulung onak tumang patu duoh janda-janda deꞌ susah, duoh jaga odop-e saꞌ-e diꞌ-e nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat deꞌ laꞌan dunia.
pairs.target: Pure religion and undefiled before our God and Father is this: to visit the fatherless and widows in their affliction, and to keep oneself unstained by the world.

pairs.source: Madih ayua kuꞌ, ngan ingan jadin nyaꞌa bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus Kristus, Topaꞌ otoꞌ deꞌ sukup ayuh kuasa-E, idoh diꞌ jok nyeꞌ paguh duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ kaya jaꞌ-a.
pairs.target: My brothers, don’t hold the faith of our Lord Jesus Christ of glory with partiality.

pairs.source: Nyam basa ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kaya pakai sisin mas duoh pimakai deꞌ sangon, nog takal ingan tikuluk simayang.   Yohmoꞌ takal inoh geh ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ botak nog, pakai pimakai deꞌ totak lolak,
pairs.target: For if a man with a gold ring, in fine clothing, comes into your synagogue, and a poor man in filthy clothing also comes in;

pairs.source: ingan moꞌ lobih pimodo tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ paguh pimakai-e inoh, ingan moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e “Guluꞌ deꞌ klosi deꞌ paguh itih.   ” Pak-e duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ botak inoh, ingan sina tuduꞌ-e, “Mujuag negeh danih” atou “Guluꞌ sinok tubon poꞌon kuꞌ.   ”
pairs.target: and you pay special attention to him who wears the fine clothing, and say, “Sit here in a good place”; and you tell the poor man, “Stand there,” or “Sit by my footstool”;

pairs.source: Oniꞌ deꞌ nai ingan inoh moꞌ pilih-pilih nyaꞌa.   Ingan moꞌ nilai nyaꞌa nunaꞌ pikil ingan deꞌ jaꞌat.
pairs.target: haven’t you shown partiality among yourselves, and become judges with evil thoughts?

pairs.source: Madih ayua deꞌ ngibalaꞌ kuꞌ! Topaꞌ pilih nyaꞌa deꞌ nang nyaꞌa botak daang dunia itih odaꞌ jadin ulang deꞌ kaya daang bisayaꞌ-e.   Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ jadin umat Topaꞌ deꞌ tilimaꞌ bilokat-bilokat soꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ janyi-E tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngibalaꞌ-E.
pairs.target: Listen, my beloved brothers. Didn’t God choose those who are poor in this world to be rich in faith, and heirs of the Kingdom which he promised to those who love him?

pairs.source: Pak-e ingan moꞌ pidasaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ botak, tiap deꞌ sibonal-e nyaꞌa deꞌ kaya deꞌ adoh-adoh wat-e duoh ingan yohmoꞌ odaꞌ ingan obuah toban keꞌ sulung jowin pingadel ngan-e yaꞌ ngadel ingan.
pairs.target: But you have dishonored the poor man. Don’t the rich oppress you, and personally drag you before the courts?

pairs.source: Ulang kaya deꞌ mutiꞌ leh deꞌ suka nguyat adon Yesus Kristus deꞌ mudi toꞌ.   Yesus Kristus inoh leh deꞌ odaꞌ ingan jadin nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: Don’t they blaspheme the honorable name by which you are called?

pairs.source: Ingan moꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ bonal simoꞌ ingan moꞌ nai nunaꞌ atulan deꞌ paling penting-e deꞌ ogiꞌ daang buk Kitab deꞌ in-e, “Ngibalaꞌ leh siodop muꞌ manusia, samah kodaꞌ muꞌu ngibalaꞌ odop muꞌ.   ”
pairs.target: However, if you fulfill the royal law, according to the Scripture, “You shall love your neighbor as yourself,” you do well.

pairs.source: Pak-e simoꞌ ingan jok ingan paguh duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ kaya, ingan moꞌ nai dosa.   Atulan Topaꞌ moꞌ tanon nang ingan moꞌ lawan hukum.
pairs.target: But if you show partiality, you commit sin, being convicted by the law as transgressors.

pairs.source: Dop-e simoꞌ nyaꞌa moꞌ nunaꞌ atulan Topaꞌ, pak-e yoh ngilangal niꞌ atulan Topaꞌ, inoh loti-e samah geh duoh yoh ngilangal suaꞌ atulan Topaꞌ.
pairs.target: For whoever keeps the whole law, and yet stumbles in one point, he has become guilty of all.

pairs.source: Dop-e Topaꞌ deꞌ sina nang, “Maꞌ yaꞌ biamai,” Iyoh geh deꞌ nang, “Maꞌ yaꞌ ngabos nyaꞌa.   ” Ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh, moꞌ nyam diꞌ ingan biamai, pak-e ingan ngabos nyaꞌa, ingan tuang moꞌ ngilangal atulan geh.
pairs.target: For he who said, “Do not commit adultery,” also said, “Do not commit murder.” Now if you do not commit adultery, but murder, you have become a transgressor of the law.

pairs.source: Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nang ingan duoh oniꞌ deꞌ nai ingan halus nunaꞌ atulan Topaꞌ, dop-e otoꞌ yaꞌ obuah nguji odaꞌ Topaꞌ pakai atulan inoh.   Atulan inoh leh deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa lopas soꞌ dosa.
pairs.target: So speak, and so do, as men who are to be judged by a law of freedom.

pairs.source: Dop-e Topaꞌ diꞌ-e yaꞌ ngin pilasiꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e ngin pilasiꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon.   Nyaꞌa deꞌ ngin pilasiꞌ-e diꞌ-e tolu nang odop-e yaꞌ obuah ngukum.
pairs.target: For judgment is without mercy to him who has shown no mercy. Mercy triumphs over judgment.

pairs.source: Madih ayua! Doiꞌ guna-e moꞌ nyam-e ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngakuꞌ nang odop-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Kristus, pak-e diꞌ-e nai pingunai deꞌ paguh.   Bisayaꞌ deꞌ wat inoh, diꞌ-e ponai odaꞌ yoh silamat.
pairs.target: What good is it, my brothers, if a man says he has faith, but has no works? Can faith save him?

pairs.source: Simoꞌ-e ogiꞌ madih nyeꞌ deꞌ samah-samah bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, bait deꞌ dali, bait deꞌ dayung, deꞌ pilelu pimakai duoh doiꞌ pinguman-e tibilang konu,
pairs.target: And if a brother or sister is naked and in lack of daily food,

pairs.source: yohmoꞌ ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ sina nang, “Buu negeh toban kila deꞌ sonang, Topaꞌ ngin bilokat tuduꞌ muꞌu, saꞌ muꞌ dapod man nog muꞌ busuah duoh dapod pakai pimakai deꞌ odaꞌ gonan muꞌ diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ modud.   ” Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ sina in inoh tiꞌ-e diꞌ-e ngin oni-oni-e tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ pilelu man pakai inoh.   Suaꞌ sina deꞌ nang-e inoh doiꞌ guna-e.
pairs.target: and one of you tells them, “Go in peace, be warmed and filled”; and yet you didn’t give them the things the body needs, what good is it?

pairs.source: Wat inoh geh moꞌ nyam nyaꞌa nang odop-e bisayaꞌ, pak-e pingunai-e diꞌ-e kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ, bisayaꞌ deꞌ wat inoh doiꞌ guna-e.
pairs.target: Even so faith, if it has no works, is dead in itself.

pairs.source: Pak-e ogiꞌ konik-e nyaꞌa deꞌ nang: “Bisayaꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ muꞌu, pingunai deꞌ paguh ogiꞌ deꞌ okuꞌ.   ” Yoh ngan kuꞌ yaꞌ nyawot in tih: “Bitanga tuduꞌ okuꞌ kodaꞌ oni bisayaꞌ muꞌ deꞌ diꞌ-e pakai pingunai deꞌ paguh deꞌ nai muꞌ, okuꞌ yaꞌ bitanga bisayaꞌ kuꞌ deꞌ tonga soꞌ pingunai deꞌ paguh deꞌ nai kuꞌ.   ”
pairs.target: Yes, a man will say, “You have faith, and I have works.” Show me your faith without works, and I by my works will show you my faith.

pairs.source: Ingan bisayaꞌ nang Topaꞌ jok-e niꞌ, paguh leh! Pak-e gamut-gamut tuang bisayaꞌ geh duoh kimotol tolu.
pairs.target: You believe that God is one. You do well. The demons also believe, and shudder.

pairs.source: Ingan manusia deꞌ budua-pilayua, aluaꞌ keh diꞌ ingan ngiloti-e? Bisayaꞌ pak-e diꞌ nyeꞌ nai pingunai deꞌ paguh, doiꞌ loti-e bisayaꞌ deꞌ wat inoh!
pairs.target: But do you want to know, vain man, that faith apart from works is dead?
